1.content:
*****This story takes place about 100 years after the adventures in "Princes of Fatlantis" have occurred.*****

Thousands upon thousands of Mountanians had packed into the grand throne room located inside of the huge palace to witness this historic moment. It was a once-in-a-lifetime event in the history of this country, and something that only occurred when one ruler had died or had decided to pass on the crown to a younger generation. That was the case today.

King Hercules had ruled the country for over twenty years and he had decided to step down in favor of his eldest son, Leviathan. The Crown Prince, who had grown up in the palace and was known as Levi, had become a strong, young man. He was an expert swordsman and he had grown into a tall, muscular soldier who had made his father proud. Therefore, the decision to step down was relatively easy for Hercules, who had himself ascended the throne at a young age when his father had become too ill to govern.

Merlin, the youngest great-grandson of Draxon, the son of Osric the Wizard who lived in the White Castle, had come over personally to attend the Coronation. After the convocation and the opening ceremony, Merlin had taken the crown and carefully placed it on Leviathan's head. The trumpets were blown and shots were fired from guns and cannons outside, announcing the peaceful transfer of power. Mountania had a new King!

Three youngsters looked on, smiling at their mother, Queen Athena, for they were now the Princes of Mountania who would have to rise up and be the next in line in case something were to happen to their father. And there was always something going on in Mountania: You had the Vladians lurking over the horizon, the dragons coming over the mountains and attacking the fields and the villages, robbers and thieves attacking and stealing items from transports between Mountania and Fatlantis, and more. There was the food festival, the Mountanian Summer Games in the Colosseum, the trade fair, the weapons fair, the music fair, the food festival, and more! Mountanians loved to party, they loved to compete, and they loved to have guests over from other countries!

Princes Cassius, Gladius and Triton were the three princes growing up in the royal household. Cassius was 15 years old, and he was the oldest. Gladius was 13, and Triton was the youngest at 10.
1.title: Welcome to Mountania! It's a dawn of a new era...

13.content:
Cassius stared at himself in front of a large mirror. He looked every inch an heir to the Mountain Throne.

He was perhaps not very tall for his age. Only six feet, but he still looked like a prince of the mountain. Powerfully-built, with tanned skin, ripped guns, wavy blond hair and blue eyes. A chick-magnet of the highest degree. He worked out regularly and fancied himself a scholar, athlete, warrior and ladykiller. The ultimate prize-catch prince.

Cassius dipped a rag in a mix of sand, vinegar and piss. The substance was vile and smelt like a cesspit, but it sure as hell made his armour look shiny. He was already dressed in most his armour, except his helmet. He polished it furiously and breathed on it and spat on it and kept rubbing and scraping. Slowly, he lowered it onto his head.

He raised the visor, peeked out and then slammed it shut. It fit perfectly. He took it off and headed out of his room, his servant-boy, who was an eager young peasant-boy named Aeros, jogging behind. He had dreams of becoming a knight, just like his master would be, and he followed him everywhere.

The prince went to the stables to check on his horse.

"C'mere Nightfire", Cassius said. The horse, jet black with white streak down its face, trotted out. Cassius mounted the beast and kicked his heels. "C'mon! Eeyup!"

Nightfire snorted...stamped the ground...whinnyed...

And then Cassius heard the droning, dribbling sounds of powerful urination.

"Oh come on! Piss in your own time! Yaah!"

The horse neighed and clopped out into the fields behind the stables. Aeros followed with a large, wooden shaft with a metal grip-guard at one end. Cassius picked up the hefty wooden lance and started doing laps, hoping to get used to the weight of the thing before the jousting tournament tomorrow...

Cassius had been training for months for this moment. He watched as at the other end of the jousting run was another teenager, the same age. They were competing in the Middle-Teens Jousting Tournament at the yearly Mountanian Games.

Cassius slammed his visor down and grabbed his lance. This was the last of ten rounds. If he won this one, he would've won the Middle-Teens jousting tournament!

"His Royal Highness, the Crown Prince Cassius! And his challenger, Lord Vortex Garathon!"

Lord Vortex was a boy of Cassius's age. He was slimmer and smaller than Cassius and had long brown hair. They were good friends in real life, but today, it was death or glory!

"Ready?" the umpire shouted. The two boys lined up their horses on opposite ends of the run. They stared down the run and waited.

The umpire dropped his flag.

"Go!"

Cassius sped down the track! He twisted his lance over to one side! He watched as...

CRASH!!!

The lance struck Vortex in the chest! The tip shattered on impact! Cassius watched everything happen in a split-second as Vortex was hurled off his horse! He hit the soft, sandy ground of the jousting-track with a heavy thud! Cassius stopped his horse at the end of the run and climbed off.

"His Royal Highness emerges victorious!" the umpire shouted. Everyone watching from the stands cheered! Cassius panted and jogged over to where Vortex was being helped up.

"B-b-Bitch!!" Vortex grunted, hopping over to Cassius, "I think I did my ankle!...F-Fuck it hurts!" he winced!

"Go sit down and let the doctor check it", said Cassius.

The prince removed his gauntlets and shook his friend's hand.

"No hard feelings, right?"

"Sure Cas...But if this doesn't heal I'mma challenge you to a duel!"

Cassius laughed, "Yeah I look forward to winning...again!"

Cassius waved goodbye to his friend and headed away from the crowds to where everyone was eating and drinking in the huge marquees, tables and benches set up away from the main tournament-grounds. He helped himself to some beer, bread, meat and cheese and then he spotted something...

She was young and beautiful, buxom and cute, with dark blond hair that was wavy and long. She was wearing a revealing dress of silk and cotton. Cassius strolled up to her, carrying his helmet under his arm.

"Well hello there", he said. "Have we met before?"

The girl got up as Cassius approached and curtsied.

"Your Royal Highness", she said.

"And what's your name?

"I am the Lady Minerva, my lord".

"Minerva, huh? That's cute...I'm Cassius".

"I know, my lord. I have seen you at jousting".

"Yeah?' said Cassius, standing up a little bit straighter. "And uh...whatcha think?"

"I thought your Royal Highness most gallant, my lord".

Cassius smirked. Of course he was gallant! He was a prince!

"Well thanks", said Cassius. He touched her hand and she raised it up for him to kiss.

"My lady".

Woooosh!! WHAM!!

It all happened so fast, Cassius wasn't even sure WHAT happened! When he opened his eyes, he realiesd he was lying on his back on the table! Pinning him down easily were three colossal Mountain men! He stared up at them from his position on the table, where his head was hanging off the end!

"Whatta you think you're doin', huh boy?" one of the superhunks asked. From his position upside down, Cassius could see that they were tall, insanely bulky and buffed up, tanned with varying shades of brown hair. They looked incredibly dangerous and they probably outstripped him by three feet! They all had to be in their later teens or even their early twenties! They looked mean!

Cassius watched the girl hurry over! Her tiny hands wrapped around a gigantic forearm and she tried feebly to pull it away!

"Jupiter!..." she began, but the monster-hunk ignored her!

"I said...Whatta yah think you're DOIN' BOY?" he roared!

"W-w-what the fuck!?" Cassius spluttered, "Let me go NOW! Do you know who I am!?"

"You're a little pipsqueak tryin' to feel up our sister is who you are right now!" said the monster-hunk named 'Jupiter'. "And if you don't start talkin' you'se gonna be the DEAD pipsqueak!"

"My name is Cassius! And I'm your fucking prince! Now let me go!"

"You touchin' our sister, boy!?" one of the other interrogaters snarled!

"Cannius! Stop it!" Minerva cried out, "Stop you're hurting him!"

"We don't like it when folks start touchin' our girl without our sayso", said the third monster-hunk. "If youse hurt her again, we gonna do REAL nasty stuff to yah..."

"Fortis I LET him touch me!" Minerva shouted.

The three giants stopped.

"You LET him touch you?" the one named Jupiter asked.

"Well...yeah. H-he's cute..."

Jupiter hauled Cassius upright and stood him on the ground.

"Alright then", he said. "But if you make her cry. If you HURT her in ANY way, my bros and I are gonna be rippin' you a new royal asshole. You got that, your Royal Shortness?"

"Alright, alright! Sheesh!"

Cassius watched as the three giant teens rumbled off to find some food.

"I-i-I'm s-sorry about that", said Minerva. "T-those were m-my three brothers. That's Jupiter, Cannius and Fortis.They...um...Love me too much".

"I can see that!" said Cassius, "Damn!"

"I...was um...approached...once and uh...ever since they kinda...follow me around to see I'm okay".

"Uh-huh. What happened to the other guy?"

"I don't know", said Minerva, "Fortis said something about needing to be moved around in a wheelchair and eating food through a hose...I don't know exactly what that meant though..."

"...Right", said Cassius. "Well um...I...hmm. Yeah...Nice meeting you..."

Minerva sat in her bedroom. Behind her, her ladies' maid, Penelope, a young teenager like herself, was busy brushing her mistress's beautiful, long blond hair.

"What's the matter, Miss?" she asked, watching Minerva stare grumpily into the mirror. "You don't look too happy, if you'll pardon me for sayin' it, miss..."

"Wha's wrong with it?"

"Wh...WHAT'S WRONG WITH IT!? Penny! If they're guarding me day and night everywhere I go, how on EARTH am I gonna meet the right boy!? Every single one I meet, he's not good enough for them! He looks cheeky, crafty, dangerous, devious...I...I can't take it! Soon I'm gonna be that cute girl that nobody can touch and nobody's gonna come for me and I'll die alone like a spinster!"

"Oh you must've think that, missie! A time will come! It surely must..."

"Huh! Yeah! WHEN?"

"Mayhap you have to make that time y'self..."

"Maybe you're right...Thanks, Penny".

"Yessum. Ah! That's all brushed and all the kinks taken out. Will you be goin' to bed now, miss?"

"I think so, yes".

"I'll be gettin' you y'bedwarmer, then..."

Minerva's bedroom in her father's ancestral castle was not enormous, but not small, either. It had a dressing-room, a bathroom with a privy, a main bedchamber with a fireplace, a huge canopy bed, and a bookcase, table, chairs and other assorted feminine necessities. Minerva sighed and climbed into bed. Penny slipped the charcoal-filled bedwarming pan out from between the sheets and went to empty the burning coals back into the fireplace. She looked out of the windows and closed the curtains.

"Sleep well, miss. The storm outside's gettin' worse!"

"Yes I know...Goodnight, Penny".

"G'night, miss".

Minerva sighed. She lay in bed. She was so...frustrated! Those stupid brothers of hers!

Perhaps she should speak to them...Yeah she should!

Minerva shivered. It was surprisingly cold. She heard the thunder rumbling heavily outside and the steady drone of the pouring rain. She got out of bed and lit a candle. She shuffled to the windows and pulled back the curtains. It was a real monster storm outside! And the glass on the window was freezing!

When she was younger, Minerva used to run to her brothers' bedrooms and ask to sleep there with them on stormy nights like this. She hadn't done it in years...but right now was the perfect time to take up an old habit.

She left her room, carrying the candle with her...

"Fortis..."

"Mmmm..."

"Fortis!"

"Hmmmmmmuuurrrrggghhhmmmm..."

"Foooortis!!"

"Huh!?"

Minerva held up her candle and stared at her largest and oldest brother slumbering in bed, his broad-shouldered, towering frame taking up almost all of the massive bed.

"Huuurrrghhh...w-what do you want, Min...It's...one o'clock..."

"Forty, can I sleep with you?"

"Huh?"

"The storm's scary..."

"Eeeuuuggghhh...Hain't you grown outta that, yet?"

"Fortis! It's scary and I can't sleep...Please?...I love you!"

Fortis sighed.

"A'right, a'right...put down that candle and get in".

Minerva put down the candle on the bedside table and Fortis pulled back the sheets to give her admittance.

"FORTIS!"

"What?"

"You-y-y-you're not w-wearing any...any smalls!"

"Huh? Hey, nothin' small 'bout it, sis..."

"I...COVER YOURSELF!"

Fortis pulled the sheets back.

"Night Sis..."

"YOU KNOW WHAT I MEAN!"

Fortis chuckled. "A'right, a'right. To protect your delicate, ladylike senses, I will cover that which nature has...abundantly...endowed me with..."

Minerva pulled a face!

Gross!

Fortis laughed. He tugged on a pair of white undershorts...that still left nothing to the imagination, crawled back into bed and reinvited his sister into it.

She crawled in and Fortis blew out the candle.

Minerva shivered and snuggled down. She felt her brother's huge chest and bulky arms wrap posessively around her, like a cage of alpha-masculine protection. She sighed.

"What's wrong, sis?"

"I'm cold!"

"Funny...no girl's ever said that to me before..."

"FORTIS!"

Fortis silenced her by hugging her and kissing her on the cheek.

"What's up, sis?"

"Fortis, I want to speak to you about something..."

"What?"

"...boys".

"I don't swing that way".

"I mean ME!"

"Why? You're not a boy..."

"FORTIS! Today you...you and...Cannius and Jupiter...and...and what you did with the prince!"

"That was a PRINCE?...Fuck he's tiny..."

"Fortis! I...we...the prince was sweet! And he was nice! I want to be...to make friends with him! And we were just getting acquainted and you had to scare him off like that!"

"So?"

"So you do that with EVERYONE! I'm tired of it! How am I supposed to find a boyfriend if you keep beating them up!?"

"So?"

"S...Are you even LISTENING to me? Will you lay off with the whole tough-guy routine!? Everytime I find a new boy, you chase him off! Please can this stop? At least for the prince? Crown Prince Cassius is really sweet, and I want to be friends with him..."

"...No".

"FORTIS!"

"Minnie, you need to be..."

"I know, I know...but...it's so BORING otherwise! Please Fortis? Just lighten up in the whole 'hands off my sister' routine?"

"Alright...You know, papa's going to the royal fortress at Ferramount in a week's time..."

"I know. I want to go with him. I already told him. And I told him the reason why".

"The prince?"

"Well...yeah...How do you know?"

"Because we're going too?"

"Wh...NO!"

"Oh yeah".

"No! No you'll ruin everything!"

"Hey, Minnie, you're a cute, gorgeous, young, wonderful little girl..."

Fortis kissed her again.

"...You should be admired from a distance. There's LOTS of cads and rakes out there who'd LOVE to sink their claws into you...among other things. And we PROMISED momma on her deathbed, that we would LOOK AFTER YOU".

"Not again with the promise on momma's deathbed..." Minerva groaned.

Their mother had died a few years ago, her dream of leaving her husband with a bubbly, cheerful baby girl finally fulfilled, after the agonising birthing of three big Mountain boys! Minerva had been her treasure, and she had made her three sons SWEAR to protect her honour and her...intactness...until marriage.

"Please, Fortis...?"

"Alright, I'll speak to Canny and Jupiter and papa..."

"Thanks..."

"But you WILL have a chaperone!"

"FOR-"

"NO BUTS! You will have a chaperone!"

"Oh cocksausages...I...Just one!"

"We'll see what papa says..."

"ONE! I don't want all of you swarming around me like a pack of wolves! If I have to have one of you lumbering around behind me all the time, then I just want ONE brother, not the whole family tree!"

"We'll see what papa says", Fortis said. "Now shaddup will yah? I wanna sleep..."

"Dead. We're hiking alright", said Jupiter.

Seeing that he was outvoted, Fortis sighed. "Alright, we'll continue. We have some food...weapons...clothing...camping-supplies...We'll go to Ferramount. Minerva, you will come with us. You will obey EVERY command that I give you. This is NO place for a young noblewoman to travel unescorted, through the wilds of the Mountanian countryside. You will NOT wander from us at ALL under ANY circumstances. I don't care if you have to go behind a tree to piss, one of us will follow you".

Minerva nodded.

"Come on".

Fortis picked up two trunks, strapped them together and then hauled them onto his huge, broad back. Cannius picked up the last trunk and strapped it onto his back.

Jupiter easily lifted Minerva off the ground and threw her over his shoulders, so that she was sitting on top of him!

"Woah!" she gasped.

"I'm not doin' this for fun, sister", Jupiter said. "But you never could keep up with us when we go out hunting. I'll carry you instead".

After walking for several hours, they made camp in a clearing near the road. Here, they found an old log cabin or cottage. It didn't look like it had been used in a while. Inside was some old furniture and a fireplace with an inbuilt stove. It wasn't big, but at least it was dry.

"We'll camp here tonight", said Fortis. "It'll be too dark soon, to keep moving any further..."

He examined the cabin. There was one bed, four chairs, a table, a couple of simple wooden armchairs, a bench and a couple of cabinets or cupboards...but precious little else.

The bed wasn't even a proper bed. It was just the frame. Any mattress that had existed there previously, was long gone.

They spent the rest of the day gathering soft grass for the bed, and wood and kindling for the stove and fireplace. By the time the sun went down, everyone was exhausted.

They stood around the bed.

"So how do we do this?" Cannius asked.

"I'll sleep on the inside. You and Jupiter on the outside, furthest from the wall", Fortis said.

"What about the girl?" Jupiter asked.

Fortis placed a powerful hand on his sister's shoulder.

"Minnie's gonna sleep with me".

"Why can't I sleep on the bench in front of the fireplace?" Minnie asked. She wasn't sure if she wanted to share a bed with her older brothers!...Jupiter snored...

"We don't want nothin' happenin' to yah", said Fortis. He bent down, opened a trunk and pulled out three pillows and three blankets.

"We weren't expecting a stowaway on our trip, so there ain't much here for you", he said.

Fortis climbed onto the bed and laid down. It was barely big enough to contain his broad, heavy, ten-foot frame. Minerva, only just past half her brother's height, crawled into his arms. He threw a blanket over them, locked his arms around her and rolled over. Minerva felt the bed creak as her two other brothers climbed in...it was going to be a long night...
1311122222.title: Her brother Cannius. The carriage is on fire an...

choices: They bathe in the stream nearby.
They go hunting for food.
13111222222.content:
Minerva yawned and opened her eyes. She felt herself being hemmed in by Fortis's massive arms and chest, pinned down by his bulk, his body-heat keeping her warm. She shivered and snuggled closer, but found that she just couldn't get back to sleep...

Wriggling out of her brother's grasp, she climbed over him...and Jupiter...and Cannius...to get off the bed.

"Huurrrrk..." Cannius grunted in his sleep when Minerva accidentally trod on a prize portion of his anatomy. She froze, and delicately lifted her foot away, before springing lightly to the floor.

The fire in the fireplace was still burning. She loaded on some tinder, kindling and wood and started fanning the embers with her fan. It took a while, but soon, the wood began to smoke...and smoulder...and burn.

She checked the trunks. There was a small skillet, some plates, some knives and forks, some tankards...and the food! She examined it. There wasn't much there. Some salted pork, some bacon, and a couple of loaves of bread...that was about it.

She would have to make some crude sandwiches.

She put the frying pan on the hotplate of the stove and started laying the meat on top of it to fry. None of the knives were sharp enough to cut the bread. She tiptoed over to the bed. Hanging off the bedposts were her brothers' leather belts. She unsheathed Fortis's dagger, a formidable blade of nearly two feet in length!

Holding the razor-sharp blade carefully, she began slicing the bread and toasting it using an old toasting-fork that she found. Her brothers had collected water from a nearby well and placed it in buckets. She poured the water into a small copper kettle and hung it over the fireplace to boil.

Minerva didn't hear anything. The sound of the fizzling, crackling meat and the flames and the bread being toasted absorbed her completely.

On the bed, Fortis began to stir. He yawned and groaned, brushing his dark blond hair away from his face and rolling over...

He sat up with a start! Where was the girl!? Where the...Oh....!! Thank goodness...

Fortis climbed out of bed and ducked to stop himself hitting his forehead on the rafters. He strode across the cabin towards the fireplace. He reached out and grabbed his sister roughly by the shoulder!

Minerva jumped! She whirled around and stared up at her brother!

"Don't you EVER do that again".

"...Make breakfast?"

"LEAVE without my say-so!"

"Oh come on, Fortis. I'm in the same room, for goodness sake!"

"GIRL I MEAN IT!" Fortis rumbled dangerously. "With papa at his rest it is my job to see that you're looked after and I'll be damned if you screw it up over your own stupidity! You understand me, girl?"

Minerva nodded.

"Yes brother".

"A'right...What the hell is this?"

"Just some simple toasted sandwiches...it's not much..."

"We'll find somethin' more tasty sooner or later...Thanks for the food...HEY WAKE UP YOU LAZY POTATO SACKS! YOUR LOVING AND ADORING SISTER MADE YOU BREAKFAST AND YOU DON'T EVEN HAVE THE DECENCY TO GET OFF YOUR LAZY ASSES AND COME EAT IT TO THANK HER!"

Minerva giggled! She slapped Fortis on the arm, "Oh stop it!" she squealed, her eyes watering with laughter. Fortis gave her a rough kiss. "Thanks, Min", he said.

Everyone sat around the table and started eating.

"What shall we do?" Minerva asked.

"Go to Ferramount and gain an audience with the king in his private hall", said Fortis.

"And you can gain an audience with the Crown Prince in his bedchamber..." Jupiter teased Minerva.

"Don't plant such stuff in her", said Fortis, "She ain't old enough".

"I ain't plantin' nothin'...that's the prince's job..."

"JUPITER!"

"A'right...I was jokin', cheese doodles..."

"How will we get to Ferramount?" Minerva asked.

"What stupid question is that? Walk!"

"But it's so far! It's three days by horse and carriage alone! Goodness knows how far by foot!"

"We don't have an alternative right now", said Fortis. "And we must get there".

"What for?"

"To tell the king about those outlaws".

"But they're dead!"

"He'll still want to know about them!"

"Ah...Yes, I...I suppose he would".

After breakfast...

Someone attacks their camp during the night!
131112222222.content:
"C'mon guys, we gotta get moving and we gotta have food. Let's shoot and scoot", said Fortis. "Girl, you better stay back behind us. We don't wantcha gettin' hit while we go hunting".

"Oh sure, the big, brave boys go hunting..." said Minerva, sarcastically.

"Hey, you want meat, don'tcha?" said Jupiter, "It don't fall outta the sky on its own, y'know. It's gotta be forced!"

Packing everything, they started off down the road. Every now and then, the boys stopped and ventured into the woods. Proficient hunters, before long, they'd captured a few birds and four fat, furry rabbits.

"Awww...they're cute..."

"They're also delicious..."

"FORTIS!"

"What? They are..."

Minerva sighed. She liked rabbits...

After walking until sundown, they found themselves too tired to try and walk through the night. They found a clearing, pitched tents, lit a fire and prepared to eat and sleep.

Minerva couldn't watch her brothers prepare the meat. She reckoned they had far too much fun gutting the rabbits and boning them, than it was natural for a boy to have.

But when the meat had been washed, she did agree to cook it for them. The meal was crude - not at all like what they were used to, with plates and cutlery and a table and candles and cordial and beer...but it would have to do.

Once again, Minerva resigned herself to sleeping in a cage of muscles, swamped by her older brothers. She sighed.

Perhaps she should've stayed home.
131112222222.title: They go hunting for food.

Eldonia tries to seduce the bigger, older Lord Fortis...
1311122222221.content:
Minerva groaned. Her feet were killing her! But she was glad at least, that they'd reached their destination.

She sat with her three brothers in the foyer of the palace. A guard approached them.

"Lord Fortis, King Leviathan will see you now".

"Thanks".

Fortis got up and followed the guard into the throne-room beyond.

"The guard has told me your story", said King Leviathan.

The king sat on a large, marble throne draped with red and gold fabric and cushions. Curled up at his feet was a large, golden-haired lion...which was asleep.

"I am very sorry for the loss of your father and you have my gratitude for dealing with the highway robbers that you mentioned, who had taken his life. Your father was a noble and kind man. You will, of course, as his firstborn son, inherit his title, his lands, his house, the estate and his fortune".

Fortis bowed.

"Yes sir".

"I imagine that your brothers and your sister have had a long journey".

"We are very tired, sir. We've been walking since..."

Fortis checked his pocketwatch.

"...Eight o'clock this morning".

"And it is now eight o'clock at night", said the king, glancing at a clock. "You must all be very tired. Unfortunately, I expected you here several days earlier, but with the loss of your horses, I suppose that cannot be helped. But many of the guestrooms are full. But I'm sure I can arrange something. You might have to use the private guestrooms".

"Private?" Fortis asked.

"The ones next to my sons bedrooms. They're usually used by their friends when they come to visit, but I suppose they'll have to be occupied by you, your brothers and your sister in the time-being".

Fortis nodded. "Thank you, sir".

A tall, slim servant-boy approached Fortis and led him from the room. He would show him where he and his siblings could sleep.

"I'm afraid that the princes' guestrooms do have bathrooms, but they might not be big enough for a...person of your...stature", said the servant-boy. He stared up at the young Mountanian's ten-foot, broad, muscular body.

"'Sokay, dude", said Fortis, "Just show me a room which has a bath I can use".

"Yes, my lord. Follow me".

The young servant-boy showed the four brothers and sisters to their rooms. Perhaps unknowingly, he showed Minerva into Prince Cassius's private guestroom!

Minerva left her bedroom and headed down the corridor. She saw another girl leaning against a doorframe.

"Hey!"

Minerva hurried over. The girl looked a year older, and was slightly taller. She had beautiful dark brown hair that she was brushing with a hairbrush.

"I haven't seen you here before".

"I'm Lady Minerva".

"Yeah? I'm Lady Eldonia. My father's here to speak to the king about some deal he has. I'm so bored! This place is a complete sausage-fest!"

"I wouldn't think that's a problem..."

"Heh! Yeah, but there's no girls around here to talk to! I'm fifteen, for goodness sake!"

"I'm fourteen..."

"That's close enough. So are you here with your father too, Minerva?"

"He...died. I'm here with...other relatives".

"Ooh...I'm sorry. Hey, you want to come to my room? We can chat".

"Okay".

The two girls headed down the corridor and into Eldonia's bedroom. She sighed. "This place is so dull...Are you staying here long?"

"Probably a few days, I'm not sure yet", said Minerva.

"Well you can keep ME company, at least", Eldonia said.

She froze.

"What's wrong?" Minerva asked.

"There's a light in my bathroom. I thought I blew out all the candles..."

She headed to the door of her bathroom. That was when they heard splashing. Eldonia peeked in.

"There's a MAN in my bathroom!"

She was about to open the door and confront her intruder, when the sound of rushing water told both girls that the 'man', whoever he was, was now standing up in the bathtub.

Eldonia peeked in.

"...and WHAT a man...Rrrraaawrr..."

Minerva tiptoed over and peeked in. She gasped!

"What?"

"That's...Fortis!"

"You know him?"

"He's my oldest brother..."

"Oh you poor, poor thing..."

"What do you mean?"

"Having such a fun TOY and not being allowed to play with it..."

Minerva giggled!

"Eldonia! You can't say things like that!"

Eldonia opened the bathroom door. Fortis yelped and whirled around! Eldonia and Minerva gasped, covering their mouths! Fortis fumbled hopelessly with a towel that was far too small to accomplish the act of decency he was hoping to achieve. He held it over his waist, trying to cover that which made the towel look like a pocket handkerchief in comparison to!

"Wow..." said Eldonia slowly. "...Minerva your brother is HAWT!"

Minerva giggled.

13111222222211.content:
"Hey! What's going o--LORD FORTIS COVER YOURSELF AT ONCE!"

Minerva whirled around! At once, her vision was full of a tall, teenage presence. A presence with lightly-tanned skin, longish blond hair, blue eyes and a cute, friendly-looking face. The boy looked old for his age. He was perhaps, not solidly built, with the bulk and heft of her older brothers, but he was slim, muscular, fit and athletic - the body of a universal sportsman.

"Lady Minerva!"

Minerva gasped! She curtsied.

"Your Royal Highness!" she whispered.

Crown Prince Cassius stepped forwards. "It's nice to see you. I..I heard about your um...yeah..."

Minerva nodded.

"Thank you", she whispered.

"You're welcome. Your father was a wonderful person. Funny, friendly, cheerful..."

"Excuse me!" said a voice. "But I WOULD like to have a bath now..."

Everyone turned to face Lady Eldonia.

"Oh! Yes of course!" said Cassius. "Sorry Eldonia...Come, my lady, my lord", he added, gesturing to Fortis. "Anyway, there's someone who would want to meet you".

"Meet us?" Minerva asked. "My father was coming to Ferramount to see the king! Nobody else possibly knew we were coming!"

"Oh there was one other person..." said Cassius. He led them down the corridor, knocking on doors, bringing Jupiter and Cannius along with him. "And she's in here!"

He opened a door to one of the guestrooms.

131112222222111.content:
Prince Cassius opened the doors to one of the guestrooms. "Lady Athena..." he called.

Minerva ran into the room into the arms of a tall, elderly lady with whiting grey hair. She gasped and wrapped her bony arms around her!

"Minerva my darling!" she said, kissing her. "Oh you are SO beautiful!"

"Gramma!" Minerva cried out, "What are you DOING here!?"

"I hadn't seen you in so many weeks! I happened to be in Ferramount visiting friends. You know that Old King Hercules and I have been friends for many years. He dropped me a letter to say that your father was coming! I was going to surprise him...but...well..."

"It was horrible, granny...!"

"Ooooh. Such is life, my darling! But you're safe! And that is what is important! And here I see is the reason for your safety...Come along! Come along! Give me a hug! What? You grew out of giving granny hugs once you became teenagers?"

Fortis lumbered forwards. Old Lady Athena was not short, but her grandson towered over her! For a second, he didn't do anything, but then...

"Whoooooooooooo!!!" the old woman shrieked! Fortis grabbed her roughly, squeezed her until Minerva felt her spine would snap, and then hoisted her into the air!

"Awww..." she said, rubbing Fortis's huge, muscular shoulders, "My poor little baby!"

Fortis sniffed.

"Awww...you cryin' big fellah?" Jupiter teased.

"SHUT UP YOU TWERP!"

"Fortis! Not in front of grandma!" Minerva cried out. "And put her down!"

"Huh...Oh! Yeah...sorry nanna..."

With a substantial 'thud!', Fortis lowered his grandmother to the ground.

"And the twins!" she said, smiling. She hugged them both and kissed them. "Poor boys! Well you'll all be alright now!"

"Lady Athena, with your permission, I'd like to ask Lady Minerva to join me for dinner", Cassius suggested.

"Oh no you don't!" said Fortis, "Taking advantage of..."

"Fortis!" said Lady Athena, waving her walking-stick in her grandson's face. "The Prince is a young man of honour and decorum. I am assured he will treat our Minerva with nothing but love and respect!"

"Respect maybe, love...Huurgh!...You so much as undo ONE BUTTON on her..."

"Foooortis..."

"Sorry grandma..."

"Away with you two!" she said, waving off the prince and Minerva, "You boys let your sister have some fun!"

Not waiting for Fortis, Jupiter and Cannius to open their mouths, Cassius and Minerva rushed off!
131112222222111.title: Their grandmother, Lady Athena!

1311122222221111.content:
Minerva found herself sitting in Cassius's bedroom at his private dining-table. In front of them was an array of meat, cheese, bread, wine, smoked fish, mashed potatoes, gravy and other heavy, stodgy food. The kind of heavy, stodgy food that made Mountanian boys enormous. As if to prove that, Cassius was chowing down with amazing eagerness!

Minerva smiled. She liked the prince. He was...cute...But he was also so different from every other boy she'd ever met. Her brothers...mostly. And it was her brothers who generally kept her from meeting other boys. She loved them all...especially Fortis...but they were all so overprotective!

As a result, Minerva had rather lost the taste for the giant muscle-hulks that most girls lusted after. She'd had enough of that to last her a lifetime!

Instead, she was more interested in the handsome, slim, athletic boys. Fighters, sculptors, artists...not the grotesque lumbering giant bodybuilders that her brothers were...nooot that there was aaaanything wrong with that...

"I'm sorry to hear about your father", said the Crown Prince. "he was a...he was a...a nice man".

Minerva nodded.

"Don't look so glum", said Cassius. "You know, the day after tomorrow is my mother's birthday. Everyone's invited".

"I'd rather not", said Minerva. She wasn't quite in the mood for parties.

"Aw", he said. "Hey, I don't want my companion for the evening to look all dowsy and glum".

"Compa...ME!?" Minerva said, choking on her wine and coughing!

"Well yes you...I...I...I mean...if you...wanna..." Cassius said, blushing.

"Why ME?"

"Well...I always...I mean...You're different...and...different is good. And...Well, I'm so sick of all those other girls".

"What others?"

"You know...snooty society-girls..."

"With their swaggering..."

"And their clothes..."

"...and their eyes..."

"Eyes?" Cassius asked.

"Always so sneering and glinting and superior, staring down at you..." Minerva said.

Minerva's family was not especially rich. Her father's family held a humble position in the royal court...that was about it. She was well-off, but they weren't rolling in gold!

"You're...different...better...from those others", Cassius said. "And I...I wanna get to know you better, so..."

"Are you asking me on a date?" Minerva asked.

"I...I guess I am", Cassius said, blushing. "I...I mean I can see that you're used to um...the...finer things in life..."

He glanced down at himself.

"...Like me".

Both of them laughed! Minerva giggled. He was making horrible, cheap pickup lines. He must be really desperate! She smiled.

"Well alright", she said. "I'd love to come!"

"Good! Should be fun...So long as your brothers don't pound me into the earth..."

"You should be able to tell them to stop that", Minerva said.

"Father says that I don't tell. I show. I gotta have the strength to prove royal authority or whatever it is. But what authority?" He asked. He stood up.

Cassius was not hulking and massive. He was slim and muscular, with a sportsman's build.

"I still think you're cute", Minerva said.
1311122222221111.title: Cassius has dinner with Minerva.

choices: The party begins with an enormous roast hog, a gift from Fatlantis.
Minerva tries to mingle with the rest of the children and teenagers...
13111222222211111.content:
"...and then we pull it TIGHT!..."

"OUCH!"

"Oooh I'm SO sorry my buttercup...and we smooth it...and we put on your beautiful tiara..."

"I don't own a tiara!"

"You do now. It was mine. I barely wear these silly old things anymore. And it'll look much nicer on you".

"I dunno granny, I feel so...dressy!"

"Good! You want to look good, don't you?"

"Well..."

"There are going to be some very nice boys at the party, and there's going to be a lot of girls, too. You're going to fade into the wall if you don't look absolutely stunning!"

Minerva stood up. Her dark blond hair was combed and dressed and on her head was a glittering silver and diamond tiara. Around her body was a dazzling light blue silk gown with accents of white satin. Her shoes were the same hint of sky blue with handsome silver buckles. Minerva's grandmother smiled and kissed her granddaughter.

"You look stunning, my darling! Come along!"

Minerva exited her bedroom and headed into the corridor. Outside, she could see her older brothers all dressed in various bits and pieces.

"Damn it!" Fortis grumbled.

"What's the matter, Fortis?" old Lady Athena asked. She reached up with her thin, bony hands and grasped her grandson's massive left forearm.

"These stupid...fucking...buckles..."

*CRACK!!*

*PING!*

A rivet snapped off and ricochet'd off the wall as the buckle that held his armour together at the side broke from the strain of fighting against his massive chest!

"BITCH!" he swore.

"FORTIS!"

"...sorry nan...But this damn thing doesn't fit! I can't go to the Queen's birthday party without my dress-armour!"

Behind him, Cannius and Jupiter were busy buffing up their own armour with a gritty polish made of sand and vinegar.

"Hey Minnie, can you do my shoulders?" Jupiter asked, indicating his shoulder-plates.

"You should've tried doing that before you put them on..." Minerva said.

"Oh no!" said Lady Athena, "You're NOT getting your sister's beautiful evening-dress smeared with polishing-compound! Away with you, girl!"

Fortis reached out and touched his sister.

"You look...you look...um...you look..."

"You can say it..."

"I mean...I think..."

"...C'mon big fellah..."

"...You're...real purdy..." Fortis said.

"Awww...Thanks Fortis...Are you BLUSHING?"

"NO!...Okay a bit...okay a LOT!...But...I never seen you like that..."

"Well if you let me go to more parties, maybe you WOULD!" she retorted, and she spun around on her shoes, letting her skirts swirl up and out in a beautiful swish!

"Real cute, Minnie", said Cannius. "So Fortis, what else are you gonna wear?"

"I dunno..."

"How about those robes?"

"No way! I brought them as sleeping-clothes! They barely fit me anymore!"

"I didn't think you WORE anything to sleep..." Minerva said.

"Minnie!"

"Oh just wear your hose and sandals and for goodness sake, tell me you've got a codpiece that fits, even if your armour don't!"

"Don't make a codpiece BIG enough to fit, you mean..."

Minerva groaned! Stupid, sick, gross, oversexed, overmuscled brothers...She was going to the ball!

Minerva headed along a corridor into the main foyer of the enormous old castle. Here, hundreds of people were gathered. Noblemen, their wives, their sons and daughters. Famous soldiers and warriors, and their families, the heads of famous crafting-families, and a smattering of courtiers and government officials.

"Minerva!"

Minerva turned around. Climbing down a staircase was Prince Cassius. He wore a white and gold tunic and hose, with sandals, and a dazzling silver breastplate. Across his front was a bright blue sash, with various pins and medals attached to it, most of them honorary military ranks bestowed on him by his father or grandfather. His blond hair was brushed neatly back and he wore a handsome gold medallion around his neck. He looked every inch the handsome Mountain prince of her dreams!

Minerva curtsied as the prince approached and kissed his hand respectfully.

"Good evening, my lord Cassius", she said.

Cassius raised her own hand and kissed it in reply.

"Madam", he said.

"I did not know I was invited to the Queen's birthday celebrations".

"Well your grandmother knows my grandfather, and let's just say that between the two of them, they pulled a few strings..."

Minerva giggled.

"You WILL be my companion for this evening, won't you?" he asked.

"Yes!" said Minerva. She was so honoured!

"Good! Come on, I'll introduce to my brothers..."

The prince led her across the foyer to a boy with darker, brown-blond hair who was chatting to some girls. Cassius introduced him as his younger brother Gladius. Gladius smiled at Minerva as if he half-expected her to offer him certain...favours...which she would not have, of course. She felt quite revolted by the idea!

Next, Cassius introduced her to a younger boy. He had not the muscles or dashing physique of his older brothers, but he was cute as an angel and very good-looking. He was about ten or eleven, and was much shorter than Cassius.

"Minnie, this is my brother Triton. Triton, this is Lady Minerva".

"Hi!" said Triton, smiling.

"Hello!" said Minerva. "Oooh, what a cute little kitty!" she gasped, stroking a pure white kitten that was wrapped around Triton's shoulders! It purred loudly.

"This here's Quicksilver!" said Triton, stroking it. "Say hello!"

Miaow!

"Triton, you're not supposed to bring pets into the dining-hall!"

"Mother and father said it was alright!" Triton said, looking hurt!

"Triton! We don't want him running around under the tables!"

"He won't! He won't! Really he won't Cassius! He's a GOOD kitten!"

Triton squeezed Quicksilver almost to death, determined not to let him go!

"He BETTER be a good kitten, or else his tail's gonna become the lining of my scabbard!"

"MOMMA!" Triton yelped, and jogged away. "Momma! Cassius wanna eat Quicksilver! And you said I could take him to the party with me!..."

"My lord, that was not very nice!" said Minerva.

"Perhaps", said Cassius. "But Triton is far too attached to his pets. You know apart from the cat, he also has a goldfish named Bubbles, a Canary named Tweets and a Mountanian timber-wolf named Cerberus!"

"Timber wolf!? Aren't those dangerous?"

"It was an orphan cub, and Triton took it in. It's quite tame and a bit of a baby, really..."

Long ceremonial bugles were raised and sounded.

"Oh! Time to head in!" said Cassius, "Come on".
13111222222211111.title: Minerva's grandmother prepares her for the ...

choices: To the royal table where she sits with the king, queen and Prince Cassius!
out into the corridor. A group of rowdy, drunk boys spot her.
131112222222111112.content:
The massive dining-hall was separated into three sections. At the very back of the room was the royal dais. Here sat old King Hercules, his son, King Leviathan, and Queen Athena, with their closest friends.

Nearby were tables for great nobles and courtiers, famous warriors and soldiers.

A little further down was the next section, with tables for the younger set. And at the very end were tables for the real children of the court. Prince Triton sat here with his friends...who were all trying to feed Quicksilver the kitten, some prime smoked river salmon.

Between the three collections of tables were large, communal areas, punctuated by huge buffet-tables. Servants and guests wandered and mingled, feeding off the tables and then chatting in groups around the vast dining-hall.

Minerva watched as Prince Cassius chatted to some of his friends. She got up and headed over to a bunch of girls who all looked roughly her age.

"...And then papa gave me THIS..." said an older girl of about eighteen, showing off an expensive-looking pendant that was nestled snugly between her generous breasts. It was shaped like a heart, with a diamond in it, and was made of gold.

"Oooh that's beautiful! Claire you're soooo lucky..."

"Hello..." said Minerva, nervously. She entered the group.

"Who are you?" one of the girls asked. Minerva sensed at once that these were the 'cool' girls. They had those arrogant, annoying, lofty, stuck-up, smug voices that came from having everything that they could ever want, and giving nothing in return.

"I-I'm Lady Minerva", she said.

"Yeah? Lady of WHAT?" another girl asked, sniggering.

"Hey shut up, Jasmine! Hi Minnie!"

Minerva smiled, grateful to see a familiar face!

"Eldonia!"

She smiled back. "Wow that's a pretty dress", she said. "Did you make it?"

Minerva was right!

A girl as wonderful as her deserved a prince! A REAL prince. A proper prince. Someone strong...handsome...powerful...confident!

Cassius got off his bed and stared at himself in the mirror. He was all of those things! And more! Cassius was relatively tall for his age, about six feet three inches, and he had a slim, strong, athletic build. He stared at himself, still wearing his ceremonial armor. Now he would need some mental armor...

He stood up straight, took a deep breath, and left his room. He headed down the corridor and around to the guest-wing. He found the appropriate room and knocked on the doors.

"Come in!" a voice called out.

Cassius opened the doors and stepped inside.

The room was large and dark. There were candles burning either side of a huge canopy-bed, and a fire in the grate. And candles burning on a large dressing-table. Standing in front of the dressing-table wearing only his smalls was a giant of a man. His face was white with shaving-soap, and in one hand he held a massive straight-razor the size of a meat-cleaver. He was busy scraping his stubble off his face before going to bed. His musculature was clearly visible in the candlelight.

Cassius cleared his throat. The giant finished shaving, washed his face, and turned around.

"Oh...it's you...What do you want?"

"First..." said Cassius, stepping forward, "It's not 'You'. You are my father's subject, Lord Fortis. And that makes you my subject. And that means you will address me as such. It will be Your Royal Highness, and nothing else..."

"Uh-huh..."

Fortis picked up his strop and began skimming his razor back and forth at lightning speed.

"STOP THAT!" Cassius barked. Fortis flinched, his shoulders rippling. He put down the razor.

"And stand up straight! Now...I wish to do the respectful thing here, and I expect you to give me respect in return!"

"Uh-huh...What's that?"

"I wish to write and accompany your sister, the Lady Minerva".

"Huh..."

Fortis stepped forwards. Soon, he was in front of Cassius. He was so close that Cassius could almost lick him. Fortis was five years older and four feet taller than Cassius. And he outweighed him by more than double.

"You?"

"Me".

Fortis smirked. "Oh I get it. You save the cute girl from being ravaged by drunken hooligans. So you think her older brother's going to give you the permission you want to have your own way with her...huh..."

Cassius glared at Fortis. Fortis laughed.

"Okay, okay...I see. Well...You got balls, boy. I like that. I see that you value my sister's company. Very well. You will have her, then".

Cassius nodded.

"BUT...If you hit her. If you touch her without her permission. If you make her cry. If you do ANYTHING that compromises her reputation, I WILL rip you a new asshole. You will treat her respect and you will treat her with love and affection, which I expect you as a prince, know how to do".

Cassius nodded.

"If things don't work out, then you will tell me. And I will tell her. I don't want you screwing up a break-up and leaving her in tears. She would understand it better if I told her personally. Understand?"

Cassius nodded.

"Very well. Then, you have my permission".

"Thank you".

"Goodnight. Your Royal Highness".

Fortis gave a stiff, unnatural-looking bow from the chest. Cassius nodded in recognition, and left.

"We're going home tomorrow", Minerva said to Cassius the next morning. "Granny's leaving today after luncheon". She stared at her tall, stately-looking grandmother who was helping herself to an array of fresh, wafting pastries on the sideboard of the royal dining-hall. As old King Hercules's friend, she always got special treatment...and she made damn sure that her grandchildren got special treatment as well...such as her darling granddaughter Minerva being allowed to eat with the Crown Prince!

Cassius nodded. "I know", he said. "I would like to write to you, if it's alright".

"Yes of course!" Minerva said. She opened her purse and pulled out a neat little calling-card. She handed it to Cassius. "There you are. My name and address", she said.

"Say um..."

Cassius gulped, "Uh, it's still early and uh,...the court isn't as crowded now that mother's birthday is over. Um...Per-perhaps you'd like to uh...um...To see the palace? Wh...no you don't, um...uh, h-how about um..."

"Y-you would...YOU WOULD!?"

"Like to see the palace", Minerva said.

"Uh...g-g-great! Um...Yeah! F-fantastic! Um...wait there!"

Cassius got up and went to speak to his parents. The Queen smiled and King Leviathan nodded and seemed to be lecturing the prince on something, to which the prince nodded dutifully in reply. Minerva suspected it was something about gentlemanly conduct.

"Come along!" Cassius said cheerfully, taking her hand. Minerva smiled and got up.

"...and WHERE do you think you're going with THAT?"

"Oh give it a REST, Fortis!" Minerva sighed. "He's just giving me a tour of the palace! We're not doing ANYTHING!" she said. "I'll give you a massage later if you let us go now..." she said in a sing-song voice.

Fortis groaned. He DID like his sister's massages. She used all those fancy scented oils that felt so wonderful and warm and...

"Oh what the hell...Okay. But you be careful, alright!"

"Yes Fortis!"

"I wasn't talking to you, girl!"

Minerva giggled, grabbed Cassius's hand and ran off down the corridor with him.

"Sheesh! Is he ALWAYS like that!?" Cassius asked.
"Most of the time!" Minerva giggled. "Never mind! Fortis is harmelss!"

"Not with those arms he's not! He looks like a gorilla!"

Minerva laughed.

"Come on, I'll show you the armoury!"

Room by room, Cassius showed Minerva through the palace. The armoury, the chart-room, full of maps and globes and all other documents regarding navigation and geography, the stone-room, full of display cases loaded with precious stones and jewels...

"Oooh that one is so beautiful!" Minerva said, pointing to a large, round diamond set in gold with rubies and sapphires around the edge.

"It's beautiful isn't it? That was my grandmother's. Mother occasionally comes in here to take jewels out and wear them". He pointed to a fat, velvet cushion with a card on it which read: "CURRENTLY IN USE by..." and underneath was handwritten the Queen's name.

"Oh she must feel so lucky to have a whole HALL dedicated to such amazing treasures!" Minerva gasped. "How ever do you keep it safe!?"

"Are YOU planning to steal them!?" Cassius asked, rounding on her and pretending to pin her to the wall. She giggled, "No! I was just wondering! It seems too easy!"

"Ah you'd think that", said Cassius. He pointed upwards to what looked like long spikes in the ceilings. "Those gates drop down and lock if anyone breaks the glass or anything. They're on a very delicate hair-trigger mechanism. Anything more than a moderate jolt and...WHAM!!"

Minerva continued to wander around the palace. She could see the library, the nursery, the conservatory, the gymnasium, the royal bathhouse, and the forge...

"Oh it's amazing!" she said, staring at all the beautiful pieces of ironwork on the walls. She picked up a large, four-armed, five-socket candelabrum made of coiled wrought iron.

"It's so beautiful!" she said, examining the neat, delicate twists and curls in the metal. "To think such big arms and hands made something so intricate and delicate!"

"Oh it's not that delicate!" said Cassius, picking it up and striking it on an anvil. The metal let out a loud 'CLANG!!' Minerva laughed!

"Here's something I made", Cassius said. He pointed to a set of wrought iron frames. One low one and several higher, smaller ones.

"What are these?" she asked. "They look like...um..."

"They're tables!" Cassius said. "These spaces here is where the tabletops go. I'm hoping to make them out of glass!"

"Oh how beautiful! And...and then you can see the metalwork underneath! That's ingenious! You're so talented!"

Cassius BLUSHED!!

"You MUST make me a set of tables like this! Oh they would look so beautiful in our living-room!"

"They're not cheap!" Cassius warned, "I make them all by hand!"

"Oh I can SEE!" she said, rubbing his arms. Cassius flexed and she giggled. "I can pay", she said.

"Well write me a letter", Cassius said, "And sketch out what you'd like your thing to look like, and I'll try and make it!"

"Oh yes! Yes indeed! Thank you!"

"Excuse me, m'lady..."

A young teenager of Minerva's age entered the forge, "But thy brother is asking for you, m'lady".

"Now, Penny?" Minerva asked her lady's maid.

"Now, Miss Minerva. Somethin' about packin' for tomorrow...?"

"Oh goodness!" Minerva gasped, "But...I thought that was YOUR job?"

"It's DONE, m'lady! But Master Fortis wanted to see you anyway, just in case..."

"Can't you SEE who I'm with, Penelope!?" Minerva gasped, frustratedly . Penelope gulped and curtised at once!

"I do beg your pardon, your roy..."

WHAM!!

The trunks crashed to the ground and Fortis stood up, cracking his back and groaning. "Lazy bastards..."

"Fortis! Don't say that in front of Granny!" Minerva piped up.

"Granny ain't here! I'll say whatever the hell I want! YOU TWO! MOVE IT!...Useless lumps of meat..."

"Fortis! You will NOT speak to your brothers like that!"

Fortis jumped and whirled around!

"Shit!...G-ggranny!" he stammered. At once, all the bravado and machismo vanished!

"H-h-hhi-hi g-g-ggranny..."

"That's better!" she said. "Now, give me a hug".

Fortis stared at his grandmother. She wasn't exactly SMALL, but to someone like Fortis, she looked like a tiny, little old lady who had to be handled like some delicate antique teapot.

"Oh come on!" she snapped. Fortis lifted her up and hugged her. He gave her a rough kiss.

"Love you, Nannah", he said, and lowered her down. "So, how long are you staying?"

"Who said I was leaving?" she asked.

"Granny's moving in with us, Fortis!" Minerva said.

"That's great...wonderful...WHAT!?"

"Don't you dare take that tone with ME young man!" Lady Athena barked with surprising ferocity! "You should thank me for moving in with you! It's obvious this place requires a woman's touch!"

"It DOES!"

Fortis grabbed Minerva. "THIS woman!"

Minerva blushed.

"The rest of it is BoyCountry, the rest of it is..."

"A complete mess!"

"It wouldn't be if the housemaids spent more time sweeping the fortress instead of sleeping with Fortis..." Jupiter said, entering the foyer. He bowed slightly and kissed his grandmother, "Hi Nanna".

"Jupiter my sweet one...Fortis, I think it's very unkind of you to be taking advantage of the serving girls!"

"What advanta...Oh yeah, gettin' it on with me's gotta be pretty advantageous, huh..."

The three brutish boys laughed, but they froze to ice under the stare their grandmother leveled at them, even though she was half their size!

"Now go and clean up!" she said, "We're having dinner early tonight!"

choices: After dinner, the "children" ask Lady Athena to tell them a story.
After dinner, Lady Athena tells her grandchildren that there is a coffin waiting
131112222222111112222121111.content:
Fortis sat down at the dinner-table. Set out before them was a huge array of sausages, bacon, bread, eggs, fresh garden salad, beer, wine and various roast meats. His grandmother sat opposite him. Minerva sat in the middle on one side, and her two other brothers sat together on the other side. Minerva stared at the beautiful array of food. She reached out tentatively for a dinner-roll. Fortis nodded, and she started eating, dipping the roll in olive oil and vinegar before nibbling on it.

Fortis stood up. He picked up the large carafe of wine and lumbered over to his sister. He held the carafe over her head. Minerva pushed her dainty silver goblet aside. Fortis filled it up and handed it back. He moved to his grandmother.

"Thank you, darling", she said. She handed him her goblet and he filled it up. She reached up to touch his huge arm while he handed the goblet back. She smiled at him. Fortis merely grunted and sat down.

"Hey!" said Jupiter, "How's come we don't get no wine?"

"You ain't girls", Fortis said gruffly.

"Hey! Grandma's not a girl, you gave her wine!"

"You suggestin' grandma's a man?"

Minerva and grandma burst out laughing!

"Oh enough, everyone!" Lady Athena said. "Let us eat! Girl, I want some of those sausages, with the tomato ketchup and the mustard-sauce, please".

"Yes granny!" said Minerva, passing the tray across.

"Oooh these look very nice. What are they, Fortis?"

Fortis stared at the sausages. "Pork", he said. "Salted pork. Imported from Fatlantis. We've got beef too if you want it..."

"No no no, pork will be fine...Oooh! This mustard is very strong!"

"Hahaha...yeah...I was about to warn you about that.."

"Oh tush! I was spreading condiments more powerful than THIS on my food when I was your age, young Fortis..."

At once, this sparked a debate of culinary toughness! Fortis called one of the serving-girls over and ordered her to bring forth from the kitchen, the household array of spices and chilies. Soon, they were adding everything to their food, from black pepper all the way up to Mountanian Fire Bells, powerful, bulb-shaped chili-peppers which were bright red and which packed an almost heart-stopping kick! Minerva chomped on one experimentally.

"Girl, I wouldn't suggest..." Fortis began.

"WHAAAAAAAARRGGGHHHHHH!!!"

"...eating that...Girl!" Fortis called. The housemaid on table-duty stepped forward. "Find Lady Minerva some milk to wash that fire down with will yah?"

"Yes my lord!" she said. She hurried away to the kitchens and came back with several jugs of milk and glasses for everyone.

"Oooh...ooooh...oooooooh..." Minerva wheezed, gulping down the milk and sweating like a pig. Everyone laughed.

"I tell yah..." she gasped, "...those...f-fire bells...r-really c-clear out the nasal passages...AAAHCHOOO!!"

"Boys!" Fortis said, "Toast your sister. She's survived her Trial of Fire!"

The three brothers raised their goblets and clanked them together and cheered. Lady Athena giggled at her grandsons.
131112222222111112222121111.title: The first family dinner in a long time.

choices: The next morning, and Fortis is still not used to having granny around the house
Fortis goes to his room. The head housemaid is waiting there to 'comfort' him
1311122222221111122221211112.content:
BURRRRRRP!!

"Fortis!"

"Sorry granna...Oooh man...that was...that was good..."

"Children, go and get ready", Lady Athena said.

"Get ready for what, granny?" Minerva asked.

"There is something special I want you to see. Now go and wash up and make yourselves presentable!" she said.

Once the children were cleaned up, they returned to the foyer. Lying on a large, metal trolley was a heavy stone casket, sealed with lead. Minerva gasped!

"Grandma!"

"I had your father's body located in the forest and brought back here", she said.

"He's been dead a week! I don't wanna know what that thing looks like..." Fortis said. "Oooh boy..."

"Regardless, we are here to pay our last respects", Lady Athena said. "Come children".

Fortis pushed the gurney holding the coffin while the other four walked alongside. Once they reached out the back, they headed towards the family cemetery. Jupiter opened the doors to the family crypt and Fortis lifted the coffin and carried it inside, laying it on an altar.

One by one, everyone entered, their heads bowed. Lady Athena took a deep breath.

"Great Ancestors, Warriors of Night. Defenders of the Dear and Departed. We ask that you accept this casket, contained within, the remains of thy child, recently gone from our world of light, thence to the world of evermore. We ask that you watch over him until time comes his spirit shall join you in the ancestral realm".

One by one, they filed out, each person leaving a small pebble on top of the heavy stone casket before they left, as was the tradition for anyone buried whole.
1311122222221111122221211112.title: After dinner, Lady Athena tells her grandchildr...

choices: That afternoon, the boys find their grandmother and sister knitting...
Fortis goes to the stables to check on his giant stallion, Vortex.
13111222222211111222212111121.content:
"Good morning master".

Fortis groaned. He opened his eyes to stare at a slim, short boy with dark blond hair and dark blue eyes.

"Good morning, Koviac..."

Young Lord Koviac lived in the Earl's household. He was a page, a knight-in-training, to his master, the Earl. Fortis clambered out of bed, towering over his puny servant/student.

"Will you dress, my lord?"

Fortis shook his head. "Exercise first...Then breakfast...then a bath...Then I'll change...No point otherwise..."

"Yes master. Breakfast will be ready when you are".

"Good".

Fortis lumbered out of his bedroom. It was still dark outside and he tried to be as quiet as possible, stepping as gently as he could past his brothers doors, and past the doors belonging to his sister and grandmother. He paused and opened one of them and peeked in. He could just see Minerva's hair on her pillows. He smiled and closed the door before sneaking off into the garden.

The next two hours were filled with push-ups, sit-ups, weights and fast walking.

Minerva woke up. She shuffled to her windows and drew back the curtains. She stared out at the rising sun to see her brother doing cartwheels across the lawn under her bedroom windows. She giggled. The idea of someone as enormous and heavy as Fortis doing something as dainty and ladylike as cartwheels! She opened her windows and stepped onto her balcony and walked over to the edge. She giggled again, covering her mouth. Fortis flopped down and stood up. He spotted his sister on her balcony.

"What're you laughin' about?" he barked.

"The idea of YOU doing cartwheels!" Minerva squealed.

"Anything that builds the body isn't stupid!" Fortis retorted, and went back to splitting firewood...

An hour later and Fortis came back into the castle. He was stripped to his waist, wearing only his undershorts. His broad-chested body drenched with sweat from chopping and splitting untold cords of firewood. He lumbered heavily into the dining-room to examine the food on the buffet-table for breakfast...The sun was only just coming in through the windows and the candles were only half-lit. The young nobleman started shovelling out eggs, bacon, toast, sausages, beans, fried tomatoes and...

"Why Fortis! I do believe all that axe-swinging is doing quite the bit of good for your arms!"

CLANG!!!

Fortis jumped, knocking over silver milk-jug! He whirled around to see his grandmother sitting at the table, buttering her toast. Had she been there ALL that time...perving on him!?

"GRANDMA!!"

Lady Athena cackled. "Go and CHANGE, boy!" she chuckled, "I'll not have you eating breakfast half-naked!"

"I'll eat breakfast how I choose, then I'll have my bath, then I'll change!" he said haughtily. He sat down gruffly. Lady Athena walked up to her muscular grandson and patted him on the shoulders. "You are a good boy, Fortis..." she said, and kissed him.

"Ooooooh..."
"SHUT UP, GIRL!"

Minerva giggled and jogged in and gave her sweating brother a kiss. "Morning, Sleepy!" she teased. Fortis groaned. Could he have just a few MINUTES alone to eat, instead of having his grandmother and sister fussing over him?

He bolted down his breakfast and jogged out of the room and upstairs.

"Master!" Koviac called out.

"Later!" Fortis growled. He had to get a grip and find somewhere quiet to relax! And have a BATH...Yes that was it! He needed a bath! A nice bath...

"Master!" Koviac shouted, jogging after the young earl, "I..."

"Is my bath drawn?"

"Yes! But..."

"Good! Leave me alone! I don't want to be disturbed for the next hour!"

"But..."

The door to Fortis's bathroom slammed shut. A few minutes later, all that could be heard was the splashing of hot water. Koviac groaned. He knocked on the door.

"Master! I need to..."

"LATER!"

"But..."

Sighing, the boy opened the door into the bathroom. Stretched out in a massive, twenty-foot long marble bathtub, the earl stared at his servant. "WHAT!?" he bellowed so loud that Koviac was bowled over!

"This!" Koviac hissed, waving a piece of paper at his master.

"Well why didn't you SAY SO! Stupid boy...Give it!"

Fortis snatched the piece of paper from his servant. He froze.

Sealing the letter shut were three large, red wax seals. He recognised the one in the middle. It had adorned many important documents that his father used to receive.

The seal in the middle, of a dragon, meant that the KING himself had personally written, signed and sealed the communication that he held in his hands. Fortis froze in the water. He broke the three seals and started reading.

"Is it bad?" Koviac asked.

Before he could even move, Fortis jumped out of the bath and ran! Water was flying everywhere! He sprinted downstairs to where his grandmother and sister were leisurely taking their breakfast.

"Uh, Fortis..." Minerva said.

"Listen to this..." Fortis said, waving the piece of paper.

"Uh...yes, brother," said Minerva, "But..."

"...By order of His Majesty, King Leviathan, Lord High Protector of the Realms..."

"Fooooorrrrtis..."

"...owing to an unprovoked attack on communities along our northern borders, all members of the military class are to mobilise at once..."

"...FORTIS!..."

"...and assemble at Ferramount in a week's time, to be given their assignments..."

Fortis lowered the letter, "What do you think? It means we're going to war! The Vladians again!"

"That's wonderful, Fortis", Lady Athena said flatly, "And I'm sure you're raring to go...but DO put something on before you appear before your sister. Her sensitivities can't handle such things, you know..."

"Huh...WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRGGGGHHHHH!!!!"

"...I tooooold you there was something important..." Minerva said, sighing.

Fortis rushed upstairs to start dressing. Minerva stared at her grandmother in alarm!

"Don't worry, honey!" she cooed. "All the men are like this. Especially when they're young..."

Several minutes later, and Fortis appeared, dressed in armour.

Not dress-armour. Fancy, decorated ceremonial stuff for parties, dinners and state events at the great royal palace, parades or anything like that, but full battle-gear! A tremendous sword, six feet long, two shorter swords strapped to his back, daggers, knives...it was a terrifying display of weaponry. Lady Athena blushed and smiled.

"My goodness! Fortis you look so handsome!"

"Not supposed to be HANDSOME, grandma! It's supposed to kick ass!" Fortis growled. He turned around and then said in a lighter tone, "Um...so...whatcha think?"

Lady Athena chuckled. "Very very...um...impressive, my dear".

"Thanks gran".

Fortis drew out the heavy, steel sword and handed it to Minerva. "Here girl, hold this for me, huh..."

Minerva grabbed the huge, double-handed sword by the handle, but the weight of the steel was incredible! Fortis laughed and snatched it up easily with one hand. He smirked and then whirled it over his head! He started showing off his swordfighting maneuvers, swinging, thrusting, balancing, slicing...Minerva clapped!

"You damn right it's good!" Fortis shouted.

131112222222111112222121111212.content:
Fortis clunked out of the castle and into the grounds. He was heading for the stables. Inside, he could see the stableboys and groom.

"Ajax!" Fortis bellowed.

A tall teenager jogged forwards and bowed.

"My lord!" he said.

"Prepare my horse!".

"Yes my lord!"

Fortis walked slowly along the line of the stables. There were all kinds of horses in here. Carriage-horses, farm-horses, and riding-horses. He stopped in front of one stall which showed an elegant, white mare, which belonged to his sister. She called her 'Snowflake'. Nearby were his brother's horses, Sulphur, which was a sort of tan colour, and Charcoal, which was jet black.

The stall at the end opened and a large horse, much larger than the others, clopped out. The horse had to be large and strong, to support Fortis's immense weight, and to be able to carry someone of his height!

Ajax held the stallion by the reins while he strapped on the saddle. Fortis climbed up and onto the horse and rode out of the stables...

Return to the house, exhausted and filthy. They see Minerva and granny knitting
1311122222221111122221211112121.content:
"MOVE YOUR ASS, BOY!!"

Koviac rushed to set up the quintain for his master!

The quintain was a mock-up of a knight. It had a wooden frame which supported a suit of armour and a helmet, with two arms that stuck out. One arm held a shield, the other, a wooden dummy-sword. The entire apparatus was mounted on a swiveling wooden stand. The idea was to hit the shield and then move out of the way of the avenging blade as the dummy swung around to counterattack. It was hard enough dressed in armour on foot, on horseback...well...

Fortis brandished his heavy sword and charged the quintain. He struck the shield and pulled on the reins! Vortex snorted and wheeled off around in a sharp 180-degree turn, swinging out of the way of the dummy sword that whipped around as the shield swung off and away. Fortis kept attacking the quintain with various weapons. Swords, lances, javelins, spears, axes, each time moving faster and faster with greater and greater determination.

Young Lord Koviac, the earl's page, replaced broken armour, removed rivets, hammered pieces straight and generally kept the quintain from falling apart under his master's vicious attacks. Koviac was used to Fortis's rough treatment. He'd been the young nobleman's page, his servant and student, since the age of seven. He had to learn such things as how to identify every single piece of armour, how they linked together, how they were put on, taken off, how they were cleaned, how to keep them shiny to prevent rusting, and how to use the various weapons which Fortis had in his possession.

Being of noble birth himself did not protect Koviac from his master's brutal treatment. It was deemed necessary to toughen him up for battle in the future.

"COME ON, BOY! THE LANCE! MOVE IT! NOW NOW NOW!" Fortis bellowed. "I SAID MOVE IT! IN TWO WEEKS YOU'RE DOING THIS SHIT FOR REAL ON THE LINE, BOY! MOVE YOUR ASS! HUP HUP HUP! FASTER! MOVE IT! MY GRANDMA CAN DO THIS FASTER THAN YOU! I KNOW, I'VE SEEN HER TRY!...ENOUGH DAYDREAMING!"

The lance was surprisingly heavy for just being a long shaft of wood! Fortis lifted it easily into his arms and galloped off! He wheeled around and came back, throwing it aside. Koviac passed up the sword.

"Grow those arms, boy!" Fortis called out as he galloped off, "None of that half-assed bullshit on the battlefield!"

Fortis swung the sword! There was a sickening "CRACK!!" as the shield and half the arm was smashed off of the quintain!

"ANOTHER ONE!" Fortis yelled. Koviac was already running towards the quintain. He broke it up, threw it onto a pile of other, decimated dummy soldiers, and started setting up another one. Fortis was wheeling around again for the attack, when he heard clapping. He stopped and stared to where his sister was standing under a tree. He galloped over and dismounted.

"Girl! What're you doin' here?" Fortis growled. "Don't want you gettin' hurt...this is man's stuff..."

"Oh Fortis!" said Minerva, "I wanted to see you practicing! It's so exciting!"

"Ain't excitin', girl! It's training!...YOU TWO! MOVE IT!" Fortis yelled at his two younger brothers who jogged past, carrying enormous sacks on their backs, loaded with stones. "That's only lap five! You got another fifteen! Now get your asses up!"

Minerva giggled. Giving orders seemed to come naturally to a big man like Fortis. She reached up and touched his armour. Fortis grabbed her under the arms and kissed her.

"You'n'gramma keep the fortress safe, huh?" he said. Minerva smiled and nodded.

"Atta girl..." said Fortis, almost dropping her to the ground. Minerva moved to a safer distance. She watched Cannius and Jupiter round the side of the house again, sweating and gasping for breath! They crashed to the ground, panting and heaving for air!

"GET YOUR ASSES UP AND MOVE! THIS AIN'T SOME STUPID BATHHOUSE!" Fortis yelled at them. Minerva laughed as both boys reached for large buckets of water and started gulping them down. She was glad that she was raised to be a nobleman's daughter, and not a warrior bride! A life of quiet and genteel living was the life for her!

Fortis, Cannius and Jupiter...

Minerva has dinner alone with Penelope, her maid.
13111222222211111222212111121212.content:
"That's very nice, Penny", said Lady Athena as she kept knitting. Penelope smiled as she kept playing her violin, a special gift from the late lord, Minerva's father.

"It's nice to have music while we knit", said Minerva, smiling approvingly. Athena nodded. The house was so peaceful and quiet...

BANG!!

"The boys are back, I see..." Athena said, not even bothering to look up from what she was doing. The doors to the parlour swung open and Minerva looked up to see the three, filthy, sweat-drenched hunks that stood in the doorway. They reeked of perspiration, their great Mountanian forms glistening in moisture! Fortis towered over his two younger brothers, his broad shoulders and arms dribbling sweat. All three of them were dressed only in their undershorts, drenched in sweat and clinging tightly to their bodies. Minerva tried NOT to pay any attention to the more-than-impressive bulges that she noticed...

"He-hey gr-gramma..." Cannius gasped, "W-w-whe-when's d-di-dinner...?"

"Not until you all go and wash!" Lady Athena gasped, holding her hand to her nose! "Wooof! You all smell like...I don't even know WHAT! Now leave at once!"

"You heard your grandma!" Fortis barked. "You're offendin' her delicate, ladylike senses with your presence! Now upstairs!"

"Yeah Fortis, you know all about delicate, ladylike senses..." Jupiter teased. Cannius and Minerva burst out laughing. Fortis just scowled. Upstairs, boiling hot baths were waiting for all three of them.

Nearly two hours later, and the three brothers returned to the parlour, freshly dressed and cleaned. They stared at their sister and grandmother, knitting dutifully away for king and country.

"What the hell is that?" said Fortis. He indicated a long, sausage-like appendage hanging off of Minerva's knees.

"It's um...uh...it's a...When it's finished, it'll look like..."

"It's a cock-sock!" said Jupiter. Lady Athena laughed!

"It is NOT!" said Fortis. "...It's too small...huh girl?" he smirked. Minerva blushed.

"They ARE socks", said Lady Athena.

"SEE?" said Jupiter, "it's for..."

"FEET!" Lady Athena interrupted.

"...Oh..." said Jupiter. Minerva smirked.

A gong sounded in the hall.

"Dinner is served!" one of the housemaids called.

"Come along, children!" said Lady Athena, rising to her feet. "Dinner!"

"CHILDREN!?" Fortis blurted out.

"You ARE to me," Lady Athena said, resting a hand on her grandson's immense forearm.
