choices: A week later, the boys prepare to leave. Minerva sees her brothers ride off.
Lady Eldonia, Minerva's friend, comes to stay with her to keep her company.
131112222222111112222121111212121.content:
The young lord of the estate entered the dining-room. An enormous fire burnt at one end at the fireplace. Oil lamps and candles burned along the walls and on the table. Laid out in front of them was the glittering silverware, boneware, crystalware and pewterware, all filled with food. While it was generally true that Mountanians didn't eat nearly as much as their southern counterparts, someone of Fortis's size ate like a whale at the table. His immense body and the furious physical work that he did screamed for monstrous amounts of food. He helped himself to bread, oil, vinegar, cold cuts, roast meats, cold meats, salted meats, tomatoes, cucumbers, sandwiches, eggs...Minerva sighed. There was something faintly unattractive about seeing her oldest brother gorging himself at dinner, even though she knew he needed such vast amounts of food to keep him going.

"Do slow down, Fortis!" Minerva pleaded, "Such speed can't be good for you!"

But all three of her brothers seemed to ignore her! She sighed and sat there, nibbling on her chicken cutlets.

"You gonna eat that?" Fortis asked. He reached over for his sister's untouched lamb cutlets.

"Fortis! You leave your sister to her dinner!" Lady Athena squawked from the far end of the table. Fortis shrugged and reached for a tankard of ale. He was thirsty as hell after all that horseback riding, jousting, swordplay, archery and everything else...

"What happens now?" Minerva asked.

Fortis glugged down the last of his ale and belched loudly.

"FORTIS!" Lady Athena yelped.

"Whussat, girl?" Fortis asked. He was now slicing into the sausages on his plate.

"The war or whatever it is", Minerva said.

"The Vladians are comin' down south. They're trying to get their filthy little hands on our mining-areas. Granite, coal, iron, tin, gold, silver, quartz...all that stuff. We gotta stop them before they reach that far. Then we gotta drive them back, or outflank them and cut them off and destroy the bastards..."

"Fortis", Lady Athena said, "Your language".

"They ARE bastards!" said Cannius, slamming his fist into the table. "Every few years they get the balls to come charging down south and we send back their heads in buckets!"

"Cannius!" Minerva gasped.

"What? It's true!" said Cannius, hotly.

Minerva sighed. She wished she hadn't brought up this topic, now...
131112222222111112222121111212121.title: Minerva asks her brothers what will happen.

choices: Eldonia talks to Minerva about her brothers, Fortis, Cannius and Jupiter.
Eldonia has brought a special present for Minerva.
1311122222221111122221211112121212.content:
Minerva found herself surprisingly hungry. She ate away, eating sausages, bread, mustard, tomatoes, lettuce, carrots and peas. Her three brothers were sawing into monstrous steaks as big as their own chests!

"You want some, girl?" Fortis asked, noticing her staring at his plate. Minerva nodded slightly. Fortis sawed off what he judged to be a 'small' piece and dumped it into his sister's plate. The steak was enormous! But she didn't want to say anything...Fortis might take it that she was full, and then commandeer her entire plate!...It had happened in the past...

The doors to the dining-room opened and one of the maids entered. She carried a tray with a card on it. Fortis stopped in his feasting and waved the girl over. He took the card and frowned. He handed it to Minerva.

"The Lady Eldonia is here, apparently", he said. Minerva smiled.

"Teresa, show her in!" Minerva said excitedly. The maid curtsied, and a few minutes later, a glamorous teenage girl with chestnut hair wafted into the room. She curtsied to the table.

"My dear!"

Lady Athena rose and Lady Eldonia curtsied again.

"You must have travelled far to see us!"

"Father wished that I spend recent times down south, my lady. He feared for my safety. The king has ordered our estate be used for the recuperation of injured soldiers. Father thought it not the best place for me. He said I should come here. I apologise for not sending a letter, we were rather presumptuous..."

"You were indeed!" said Lady Athena. "But you are most welcome to stay...Isn't she, Fortis?" Lady Athena asked, forcefully, hardly giving Fortis a chance to say anything!

"Uh...um...uh...uh...uh...yeah!" said Fortis. He got up from the table and lumbered forwards. Eldonia curtsied. "My lord", she said. Fortis waved a hand and some of the maidservants hurried forwards.

"Take Lady Eldonia's luggage upstairs to the main guestroom".

He looked down at her. Eldonia was a bit taller than Minerva, but still looked tiny to a giant like Fortis.

"You'll sit for dinner", he said, gruffly. "Teresa. Cutlery and such, for the lady..."

"Yes my lord!" said the maidservant. She opened the doors of a cabinet and pulled out extra plates, cups and cutlery. She set them out and moved to the side of the room.

Eldonia sat down. There wasn't much left.

"I could get something for you..." Fortis offered.

"Oh no! I've already had a small meal already. These leftovers will do fine!" Eldonia said, reaching out for the food. She smiled at Minerva, who smiled back. It was wonderful to have her best...and really...only...friend, staying with her!

After dinner...since there wasn't much food left, it didn't last very long, the girls left to retire to the front parlour.
1311122222221111122221211112121212.title: Lady Eldonia, Minerva's friend, comes to st...

choices: Fortis bursts in. They're leaving for war. He's come to say goodbye.
"Bedtime, girls!" Lady Athena says. In her room, Eldonia fantasizes about Fortis
13111222222211111222212111121212121.content:
"Thanks Penny", said Minerva. Penelope bowed to her mistress and left the room. The two young teenagers sat in front of the fireplace in the parlour, with a selection of sweet cakes and hot chocolate in a handsome silver chocolate-pot.

"So..." said Eldonia, "Big brothers going off to war and you and me and little old granny holding down the fort, huh?"

Minerva giggled. "Yes", she said. "Oh they're so excited! Ellie you should hear them TALK! They sound like they're off to play a game of football!"

"To them, it is a game", said Eldonia, "Trying to impress us ladyfolks, huh?"

Minerva laughed. "They don't have to do that for us!"

"Doesn't mean they shouldn't..." Eldonia whispered, winking. Both girls giggled.

"I hear that you and the Crown Prince are hitting it off, huh? The cute young heir to the throne, huh? Kissing and cuddling, huh? Lettin' him have some fun, huh? Gonna become a princess and pop him out some boys, huh? Huh? Huh? Huh???"

Minerva blushed!

"He's...he's...cute!" she said.

"Oh I know..." said Eldonia. "And you're luckier than most girls".

They got dressed and headed downstairs. Fortis sat down at the table as one of the housemaids brought out the food. The family dined in their own private dining-room. Fortis's twenty men dined in another room in the castle.

"Morning, Susanna..." Fortis grumbled.

The kitchen-maid curtsied. "My lord", she said. She laid a butter dish on the table and took off the lid. Fortis grunted his thanks and she skimped back to the kitchens.

"How long are you staying with us, Fortis?" Lady Athena asked, reaching for eggs.

"Not so long, grandma. I'm leaving on the weekend. But I guess while I'm here, I can do stuff for you, if you like..."

"Just firewood..." said Lady Athena.

Fortis nodded. "Sure gramma", he said.

"Uh, I could help!" said Eldonia. "I could um...carry in the split wood!"

"Gentlewomen do NOT concern themselves with the labours of men, my dear!" said Lady Athena. "You are a LADY and you will conduct yourself accordingly! That means not interrupting them when they are at work!"

"Oh it's no trouble..."

"My girl..."

"I think what Eldonia's saying, granny", said Minerva, "Is that she wants to be there to make sure Fortis doesn't get hurt..."

"Yeah!" said Eldonia quickly, jumping on her friend's excuse. "Minerva's right! Absolutely! It could be dangerous for him to do it all alone with nobody around. What if the axe broke in half and injured him!?"

"I'm sure that wouldn't happen, darling!" said Lady Athena.

"With those arms of his, I don't know..." Eldonia said. Fortis let out a grunt and flexed his powerful biceps when his grandmother was occupied with her toast. Eldonia and Minerva giggled.

"I'll join her, granny!" said Minerva, "We could eat luncheon outside in the garden!"

"Oh that's a wonderful idea!" said Lady Athena, "I could join you!"

Eldonia gave her friend quick 'No! NO!" motions, waving her hands back and forth and shaking her head.

"Uh!...g-granny, Eldonia and I wanted to be alone in the garden. We'll be talking about...well...boys and clothes and..."

"And the war", Fortis interrupted. "You don't wanna hear about all that, gran'ma", he added.

"R-right!" said Eldonia, "You shouldn't hear about that, Lady Athena!"

"Alright, I can tell when you want some privacy..." the old woman said. "I'll cloister myself upstairs in the library for the day, then. Run along, children!"

"Chil-" Fortis began. He was NOT a child! He was a MAN! He was LORD of the estate!

Minerva kicked her brother under the table to silence him, in case his outburst caused their grandmother to change her mind.

"I'll go get the axe and the sledgehammer and spikes..." Fortis mumbled, getting up from the table.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Eldonia! What ARE you doing!?"

"What? The weather's nice outside. We could have a picnic!"

Eldonia stood in the kitchens, dicing up cucumbers for sandwiches. Minerva peeked into a fat, bulging wicker picnic hamper. She whistled.

"Oysters, sandwiches, bread rolls, butter, sausages, cold cuts, smoked meats, fish, cookies, two cakes, bottles of mineral water and homemade lemonade, Lucian chocolates...How many people are coming!?"

"Just us two! This is my first time to your house, Minnie! I wanted to enjoy myself outside with some nice food and my best friend!"

Eldonia wrapped up the last of the sandwiches in paper. "Done!" she said, closing the lid on the hamper.

"But this thing weighs at least fifty pounds!" Minerva said, "How are we going to carry it all the way outside without dropping it!?"

"Just watch..." Eldonia said. She grabbed the basket and hefted it up the few short steps to the dining-room. She seemed to be making a big effort out of it. Not that she didn't find it really heavy, but because...

The bottles and plates jangled as Eldonia let the hamper fall onto the rug around the dining-table with a soft 'clunk!'. Just then, Fortis entered, wearing only boots and shorts. Splitting logs was going to be sweaty work. The giant Mountain lord lumbered over. He watched as Eldonia put on a rather convincing show of not being able to lift up a picnic-hamper!

"My lord!" Eldonia gasped, "Oh you couldn't help us, could you? We need to carry this around the side of the house, only it's SO heavy and FULL! And you're so STRONG and POWERFUL and TALL!"

She smiled up at him. Minerva watched from the kitchen door as Eldonia buttered up her older brother. She was practically wrapping herself around him like a snake! If Fortis tried to take a single step, he'd fall over the dining-table!

Fortis chuckled and played along.

"Well, such a cute, baby-girl like you shouldn't be carrying such a big, heavy hamper! You leave that stuff to the boys!" he said. "Huh...?"

He bent down and lifted the hamper. Eldonia watched the display as his arms bulged as he hefted the basket into them and carried it outside. Minerva watched as her best friend practically skipped outside with him!

"Minerva!"

Minerva turned around. Her grandmother strode up to her. "Where's your friend Ellie?"

"She's outside, granny, with Fortis!"

"Oh! It is nice to see her getting on well with Fortis..."

"Oh, she's getting *on* him, alright...you have nooo idea..."

"What was that?"

"Nothing gramma!"

Minerva flitted out of the dining-room and into the gardens.

The two girls sat in the gardens on a rug on a smooth patch of grass. Nearby, Fortis was busy splitting logs. Eldonia watched as the mountain lord's arms and back rippled and flexed as he swung a huge sledgehammer through the air, smashing heavy iron spikes into a tree-trunk. The wood cracked and split open under the vicious assault.

"Is he a monster or WHAT!?" Eldonia said, as Fortis slammed the sledgehammer down, clefting a section of trunk in one blow.

"How DARE you talk about my brother like that!" Minerva fumed, "I'll have you know that Fortis is a LOVING and CARING and COMPASSIONATE man! He might show it in a sort of rough and tumble way..."

"Oh Minnie you have NO idea...Hehehehehe..."

"Eldonia!"

"He's such a catch! I don't know why you don't chase after a boy like him..."

"Please! I'm chasing after something a lot more important than rippling muscles and huge arms and chest..."

"Like what?"

"...The Crown Prince of our fair kingdom..."

"No way could you do that!"

"Yes I could! My grandmother's a friend with old King Hercules...and it's important for granny to take her baby granddaughter to court with her, so that she can see how things work..."

"...in the Crown Prince's bedroom...?"

"NO!...Well...not yet..."

Both girls laughed.

"Wow, would you watch that axe and hammer fly!"

"I suppose it's good exercise for the war..."

"The what? Oh right! Yeah...and keeping his butt toned..."

"ELDONIA!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Eldonia fanned herself as she sat on the balcony. She was feeling rather hot and bothered...

...because in the garden below, was the lord of the manor splitting firewood without a shirt on.

Of course, Fortis could have gotten one of the servants to do it, such as one of the stableboys, but he insisted on keeping in shape. Which was fine by Eldonia. She got to enjoy the show...

Fortis rolled the last massive tree-trunk segment into place. He started hammering the wedges into the log and then picked up the huge sledgehammer to drive them through. He raised the hefty, 1,000-pound lump of iron over his head and was about to bring it down when the sound of galloping distracted him! He turned around to see a rider bearing royal colours charging towards him! The man dismounted and jogged up to the young nobleman, waving a sealed envelope in his hands.

"My lord Fortis!" the man gasped. "Important news from the king's palace!" he said. "You are wanted at once, my lord! Your orders are contained within!" he added, waving the sealed envelope in Fortis's face. Fortis tossed the 1,500-pound sledgehammer aside like a teaspoon and broke the seal on the envelope and quickly flashed over the contents. He reached into the pocket of his shorts and handed the man a gold sovereign.

"Thank you, my lord!"

"Go on! Scat!" Fortis grunted. "Tell the king I'll be coming as soon as I can".

"Yes sir!...Yah!"

The rider kicked his horse and it took off at a sharp gallop out of the gates. Fortis read over the orders again in greater detail and then jogged inside.

The doors into the second dining-room burst open and Fortis stood there, panting.

"Alright men!" he shouted, to the gaggle of teenagers who were busy playing cards and chess. "Pack up your stuff! We're moving out!"

"We're here a week!" said one of the squires.

"We're needed at the Front as soon as possible!" Fortis said. "It can't wait until tomorrow, we're leaving today! Pack everything! We're going in an hour!"

Fortis rushed out of the room and sprang up the stairs, almost running over his own squire! Young Lord Koviac jumped as his master came barreling towards him!

"Pack your shit! Get downstairs and then tell the stable-boys to saddle up the horses!" Fortis shouted, crashing off towards his room. "We're leaving! Now!"

Soon, everything was ready. Wagons were loaded, horses saddled, chests, cases and bags were packed and everyone was ready for the off. Fortis burst out of his bedroom, ready for travel. He nearly bowled over his sister and Eldonia who were standing in the hallway with his grandmother!

"Darling, you'll be careful, won't you!?" said Lady Athena. She hugged her oldest and biggest grandson. Fortis hugged her back. "Sure grandma", he said. "I'll be safe, don't worry...I love you..."

"Forty I'm'ma miss you..." Minerva said, hugging her brother. He hugged her back and hoisted her into his huge arms, and gave her a kiss.

"Heh, miss you too, girl", he said, as always, addressing his sister not by her name, but her gender. "Hey, I'll write you whenever I get, okay?"

Minerva nodded. She pulled something off her body and draped it around her brother's broad, hard chest.

"Take this for luck", she said. Fortis stared at the chain and the delicate, ladylike pendant at the end. He fumbled with it in his big hands, and popped the locket open at the bottom. Inside were little portraits of himself and his sister. He smiled and snapped the exquisite gold locket shut.

"Sure sweetcakes", he said. He dropped her to the floor with a 'bump!'.

Eldonia hugged her lover and kissed him.

"You be safe, my handsome lord..." she said. "And don't forget to write to us all!" she added as Fortis broke away and then headed downstairs. He stopped at the bottom and waved. Lined up in the foyer were all the house-servants. Fortis hugged and kissed each of the maids as he headed towards the doors. At the threshold, he turned back and waved to the servants, and then to his family standing at the head of the stairs.

"I'll be back", he said.

He turned and his squire, Koviac, opened the doors.

"The men are waiting, my lord..." he whispered, "We must leave now!"

Fortis nodded. He mounted his horse and watched as the servants closed the front doors. He stared up at the ancient and grand house before him, and sighed.

"Yah!" he barked, "Come on, Vortex! Move it!"

He kicked his horse's sides and started off out of the estate. His men followed on horseback, or by wagons bringing up the rear. From the windows on the first floor, the members of the Vanderstorm household watched as the posse of men disappeared out the gates and down the road...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Fortis!"

Fortis clopped through a maze of tents, wooden huts and fires. He tugged on the reins and Vortex clopped to a halt, snorting loudly and urinating powerfully.

A tall, young man with brown hair walked up. He had broad shoulders and a heavy tan.

"Damascus!".

"So..."

The young knight leaned against a massive shield. "You FINALLY got here..."

"Oh shut up! I had boys to train..."

"So did I, but I got here a week ago..."

"So the king thought I did a better job. He let me have a week off. Maybe you would've too, if you put more effort into it..."

Damascus snorted! "Huh! Yeah...whatever...Come on, I'll show you around the camp".

Fortis dismounted from his horse and led him by the reins.

"Alright..." said Damascus. "Over here's the stables...you wanna put Violet there..."

"Vortex".

"Whatever..."

The two knights headed over to the stables and Fortis let his horse relax.

"Over here's the officers' tents...this here's the mess-area...fires...over here's where we are...knights and such...over there is the regular men...and over there are the latrines".

Fortis surveyed the rows of tents, simple wooden huts, fires, worn-down paths and a small valley which served as the latrines. He hoped he wouldn't have to go there anytime soon...

"C'mon!" said .Damascus. "You're hungry. You been riding all day. I'll show you where chow is..."

The two young knights headed towards a huge series of fires where meat roasted on the flames. Here and there, shorter, fatter men dressed in white moved around, with large knives and forks for carving off the roasts.

"Fatlantean cooks. Best in the world. And of course, the King insisted that we're all well-fed. Who better to pick?" Damascus asked. Fortis laughed.

"My lord!" said a fat, blond-haired man with a neat moustache and a goatee beard, "What'll it be?"

"Beef, bread, butter, some of that salad, the potatoes, sausages..." Damascus said. "And the same for my buddy here".

"And to drink, gentlemen?"

"Four pints of your best Mountanian lager".

"Very good!"

The fat chef waved his knife through the air, and gestured to several yards away. Crude wooden benches were set around a number of stone rings, where fires burned.

Fortis stared around. He now noticed that there were other fat men, and teenagers and boys, milling around the camp. He stared at Damascus for an explanation.

"What's with all the fatties all over the place?" he snorted. "I thought this was OUR war!"

"Well it is!" said Damascus. "The Fatlanteans are part of the Mountanian Military Catering Corps. They provide us with all our food and service! Here, sit down!"

The two Mountain warriors sat down on a long bench in front of a fire. A chubby boy with dark blond hair waddled up, carrying two large plates of food. Another boy approached carrying huge flagons of beer. The boys handed over the food and bowed before backing away.

Fortis took a long, hard pull of his beer, and groaned. He needed that like he needed a hot bath and a clean shirt. He hadn't had either in a week! Combined with the riding and camping, he was beginning to feel rather manky...

As more and more knights gathered around the fires to eat, drink and make merry, food vanished and beer evaporated at an alarming pace! After several hours, things began to quiet down. They would need to sleep and rest-up for the day ahead. As they sat around the fire, chatting, Fortis leaned forwards, resting on his powerful thighs. Something fell out of his shirt and dangled around his neck, catching in the firelight and sparkling...

"Hey what's that?" one of the knights asked.

Fortis glanced down. He picked up the dangling gold locket that his sister had given to him.

"A...keepsake...from...someone..." Fortis said.

"Heh...cute...Yeah..." said the other knight. It slowly transpired that every knight with a woman or a girl in his life had also brought something along: A ring, a bracelet, a necklace, a box, a knife. One even managed to show up with a pillow! The objects were passed around the fire and examined, and then returned. One of the knights popped open the locket that Fortis had handed into the circle of "show-and-tell", and smirked at the pictures inside.

"Heh...yeah...cute..." he said. "She's sweet, who's that?" he asked.

Fortis was busy talking to Damascus and didn't hear. "Huh?" he asked, turning away and looking up, "Wha?"

"This!" the other knight said, waving the locket around, "The girl's cute! She available? Huh? She looks like she wants it..."

"Uh...Excalibur..."

"Such purdy eyes and a cute widdul mouth..."

"...stop it..." Damascus whispered. Fortis fixed Excalibur with an icy stare.

"So like, she takes it good, huh!?"

Before anyone could stop him, Fortis was on top of Excalibur in a flash! The two fully-grown Mountain warriors were brawling on the ground! Fortis held Excalibur firmly on the ground, punching him, over, and over, and over again!

"Fortis quit it!" Damascus shouted! He tried to pull Fortis away but only succeeded in being thrown back! He finally caught Fortis's right fist and getting him into a powerful arm-lock!

"Enough!" Damascus shouted, "You can do all that tomorrow, Forty! Stop it! He's just a stupid, drunk schlubb who ain't worth it!"

Damascus picked up the locket from the ground and helped Fortis to his feet. Excalibur lay on the ground with a fat lip and a bloody nose! Many of the assembled knights stared at him in disgust. Not even able to stand up for himself! What a loser...

"What would Minerva think of you!?" Damascus said, wiping blood off of Fortis's knuckles and wrist. "Her big, protective older brother, Fortis, beating up some other guy just because he got too drunk and stupid to guard his own mouth..."

Fortis looked about ready to rip Damascus's head off, but Damascus was too smart for his friend. He grabbed his arms.

"Alright big fellah", he said, "Just relax. Here's the locket. Now you better get to bed. We got a big day of kicking ass tomorrow..."

Fortis just snorted. "Yes, granny", he sneered. Damascus sighed. "Come on man," he said. "You can let it all out tomorrow..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis tossed and turned on his pallet. While he was used to sleeping on the hard ground with minimal padding underneath him, he wasn't used to sharing his sleeping quarters with other men--men who snored loudly!

After getting Minerva's locket back from Excalibur, Damascus had led Fortis to a decent-sized tent near the front of the grouping of knights' tents. All the beer he had drunk had unfortunately gone through him, and Fortis scowled his way down to the latrine, breathing through his teeth as he relieved himself. When he had gotten back to his tent, he stripped himself down to his skin. Fortis then realized that Damascus himself was getting ready for bed. Soon, four other men stumbled into the tent, laughing and cackling drunkenly. Fortis scowled at their loud behavior. However, Fortis soon laid down on his pallet, dragged a light blanket over his hot, heavy body, and closed his eyes, trying to block out the sounds around him and the light from the still burning fires casting shadows on the tent walls.

He grasped the locket lying on his sternum, and his thoughts turned to his sister. He grimaced as he remembered the leering comments Excalibur had made about his young, innocent sister. No one treated his precious Minnie like a piece of meat! Thank goodness Grandma Athena and Eldonia were staying with his sister. He hated having Minnie out of his sight. He didn't trust any young man any further than he could throw them! He snorted and rolled over when he thought of the Crown Prince. He didn't entirely trust the young man, either, but at least he was going about courting Minerva the right way.

Fortis growled as his eyes slowly drooped. Prince Cassius had better KEEP courting her the right way....

Fortis was weary. His entire body ached. His armor had fresh new dents littering its formerly shiny surface. He had numerous vicious chips in his swords and daggers. He'd have to hit the smithy hard to make sure he was prepared for the next time the Crown called him up into service again. Vortex snorted and whinnied as they clopped up the road that led to his home.

The war had gone on for several years. Fortis hadn't had a chance for a furlough since those few precious days after training his recruits. He had religiously sent letters home to Minerva, but he had scant few from her in return. He hoped that she was alright. She had been constantly on his mind during the long weary encampments and battles that littered and scarred his memory.

Mountania was victorious, but the Vladians had been just as stubborn and clever as his own people had been, making the small border skirmish erupt into a full-out war. Fortis breathed in the fresh air. Three years he had been at war. Minerva would be nearly seventeen now. He left her a girl, and now she would be a woman.

As Fortis neared his family home, he urged Vortex into a quicker pace. He was anxious to finally be done with his travelling.

He leaped off his horse and gave the reins to a waiting servant boy, who bowed and looked overjoyed to see the young earl once more.

Fortis barrelled through the front door and yelled at the top of his lungs, "MINNIE! GRANDMA! I'M HO-OME!!!"

"Forty?!" came a delighted squeal from the library.

Minerva hurried towards her brother, and Fortis caught her up in a crushing hug.

"Oh, girl! You have no idea how much I've missed you!"

"Oh, Forty! I'm so glad you're safe and sound! I've heard stories...."

"I promised I'd come back to you! Besides, it takes a lot more than a Vladian blade to bring me down!"

She looked up into his face, and she gasped before running a soft hand along the right side of his face. A long, jagged, pink scar ran the entire length of his face from his temple down to his stern chin.

"Oh, Forty!" she sighed, tears gathering in her eyes.

"Hush, girl," he said gruffly. "I'm alive. That's all you need to know."

Minerva sighed and snuggled back down into her brother's arms.

Fortis frowned when he finally registered his sister's soft flesh beneath his hands. She felt curvier and softer and rounder than when he had left. She had definitely put on weight. He let go of her gently and put her at arms' length to examine all her changes more closely. However, he immediately saw what his hands had felt, and his face flushed red in fury.

"WHO DID THIS TO YOU?!" he yelled, pointing at her rounded belly. "I KNEW I SHOULDN'T HAVE LEFT YOU WITHOUT A PROTECTOR! WHO DARED TO PUT THEIR HANDS ON YOU?! WHO TOOK YOU AGAINST YOUR WILL?! I'LL CUT HIS COCK OFF AND RAM IT DOWN HIS THROAT! I'LL KILL HIM! I'LL KILL HIM!!!"

"Forty! Fortis! Please, calm down!" Minerva clung to her brother's muscular arm, her face pleading. "No one took advantage of me! There are...things I haven't told you!"

Fortis didn't listen. He shook his sister off and began stalking through the house. "WHERE ARE YOU, YOU FILTHY, STINKING PILE OF HORSE MANURE?! WHEN I FIND YOU, YOU'LL WISH YOU'D NEVER LAID EYES ON MY SISTER!"

"What in the world is all this racket?" came a young man's voice.

Fortis saw red when he saw an older Crown Prince Cassius walk into the room, a wide-eyed toddler on his hip.

"YOU!" Fortis roared. "I SHOULD HAVE KNOWN TO NEVER TRUST YOU WITH MY SISTER!"

Fortis charged at Cassius, who leapt to the side just in time, Minerva screaming and crying the entire time.

"My lord, you don't understand!" Cassius pleaded, quickly handing off the toddler to Minerva and facing Fortis squarely. "I have never treated your sister with anything but the utmost respect and dignity!"

"THEN WHY IS SHE PREGNANT? IS THAT BABY HERS, TOO? HOW DARE YOU!"

Fortis charged at Cassius once more, but Cassius growled and met the earl head on. The two fell to the floor, grappling each other, punching, kicking, swearing, and trying to beat the stuffing out of the other.

"Both of you: stop it!" Minerva cried, tears streaming down her cheeks. The baby in her arms was crying and screaming, too, in response to the tense activity in the room.

"Fortis, if you would just listen: Cassius is my HUSBAND! He never touched me until our wedding night!"

Fortis paused, his arms around Cassius in a Nelson hold around the prince's neck. "What?"

Minerva knelt down, a steadying hand on her pregnant belly. "Cassius courted me properly after you left for war. When everything began escalating, and I heard next to no news from you, I was scared! Cassius promised to always take care of me, and he offered me his hand in marriage to protect me, since you couldn't. I...I'm sorry, Forty! I had no way of knowing if you were dead or alive! So, I...I married him. We've been married for two and a half years now."

Fortis swallowed hard. "You married him only six months after I had left? I don't understand! I sent you a letter every week since I left! Didn't you get them?"

Minerva slowly shook her head.

Fortis sighed and hung his head in shame. How could he have let down his sister so that she felt she had to get married in order to protect herself?

"Can you let me go now, my lord?" asked Cassius hoarsely.

Fortis released the prince's neck and closed his eyes. This was not at all what he expected to find when he got home.

Cassius rubbed his abused neck, then crawled over to Minerva and their still sobbing baby. Cassius took the toddler into his arms and kissed the chubby cheeks. "It's alright, Valerius. Daddy's fine. Are you alright, Min?"

Minerva nodded her head, and Cassius gave her a small kiss on the lips.

"Why didn't you tell me?" Fortis asked wearily.

"I...I didn't know how," Minerva answered shyly. "Besides, my last several letters to you were returned to me. No one knew where your company was. I...I thought you might be dead. When I learned you might still be alive, I was already married to Cassius and expecting Valerius." Her cheeks turned pink, and she smoothed a hand over her belly.

Cassius grinned at her and placed his own hand on her belly. "We're hoping this one will be a girl."

Fortis looked at the two of them smiling happily at each other. His little sister had grown up on him. She was now a wife and mother. She had Cassius now. She didn't need him anymore.

"What are you two doing here? If you were married, I would think you'd be living in the palace."

"Oh, we do most of the year," answered Cassius, "but we always come back here around this time of year on holiday."

Minerva looked at her brother sadly. "I always come back here on the anniversary of your departure...just in case you might come back home. This year...I was lucky. I'm so glad you're back, Forty."

"Me, too, girl. I...er, missed you a lot."

"I missed you, too, but not near as much as Eldonia." Minerva's sad countenance turned into a smile that became more of a smirk, making Fortis feel taken aback. He didn't recall ever seeing such a look on her face before. Minerva giggled. "Wait till Eldonia hears that you've returned."

Fortis sucked in a breath. His thoughts had dwelt on the lovely girl much in the past three years. He admitted she starred in most of his wanking fantasies. She'd be about nineteen now. He wondered what she looked like...if she had married...if she would welcome him back in her bed as she had once upon a time.

"Is she...well?" Fortis asked.

"Well,...."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Eldonia," Fortis said hoarsely, "is she well?"

"Well, she's had a rough go of it since you've been gone," Minerva said. "Didn't she ever write to you?"

"If she did, I never received her letters. Why? Is there something wrong with her?"

Minerva shared a look with Cassius. "No, not wrong per se," said Minerva, "but I have no doubt she'll be delighted to see you again."

"As well as her father," Cassius said under his breath.

"What?"

"Nothing," said the prince with a shake of his head.

"Where is she? Isn't Eldonia here?"

Minerva shook her head. "She's been staying with her parents for the past couple of years, since not too long after your furlough."

Fortis frowned. "I don't understand. I thought she was going to stay with you. Why is she back with her parents?"

Minerva sighed. "It's a long story, Forty--one that I'm not at liberty to tell you. Besides, did you honestly expect her to just stay here and keep me company when you've been gone for three years? She missed her family after a while, and she needed them, so she returned home. However, I can tell you that she's been worried as much as I have about you and would greatly appreciate a visit."

Fortis sighed and got to his feet. He felt inordinately tired, but it looked like resting after the war was going to have to wait.

Fortis helped Minerva to her feet, then embraced her gently (well, for what Fortis thought was gently, particularly since she was in the family way). "I'll go see Eldonia at her father's estate; then, I'll return back home here. Wait for me?"

Minerva giggled and gave him a kiss on his unscarred cheek. "Always."

Fortis looked sternly at Cassius. "I expect you to watch over her while I'm gone."

Cassius raised an eyebrow. "I wouldn't do any less than I have since you left, my lord."

"Good!"

Fortis then left his family home. He had the stable boy saddle up another of his prized stallions, since Vortex needed a much-deserved rest, and kicked the horse into a fast gallop towards Castle VonGewalt, the seat of Eldonia's father's earldom.

As events often go in dreams, Fortis hadn't travelled long--merely over two hills--before he reached the VonGewalts' home.

As Fortis rode up the dirt road, he saw a woman chasing two small children around the large grassy lawn. Well, the woman was chasing a little girl with long sandy blond pigtails, while a strapping little boy was chasing the woman. They were all laughing and smiling. Fortis pulled on the reins to halt his mount and sat to watch, smiling at the cute youngsters, who couldn't have been more than two or three years old. The woman suddenly turned at the sound of his laughter, and the look on her face instantly changed from gaiety to shock.

Fortis sucked in a quick breath. "Eldonia?"

Fortis dismounted, threw his reins around a conveniently placed tree limb, and slowly walked over to Eldonia. Eldonia quickly got to her feet and held the two little children close to her, one arm around each child.

Her body had certainly rounded out nicely. Her cleavage was larger than he remembered. Her hips were more ample. Her waist had thickened a bit, too, but overall she was curvier and shapelier. Just the sight of her had his cock hardening and twitching in his pants.

Further, the generals knew that such visitations helped alleviate the stress of war and helped the men keep their focus on the battlefield.

"Momma?" asked the little boy. "Who that?"

Fortis then looked at the boy, who was pointing a finger at him. Momma? Eldonia was a mother?! Fortis thought the children were her younger siblings or cousins or something. How could they be her children?

Fortis then took a better look at the little boy. His eyes widened. The boy had large, brown eyes...the exact color of his own! It couldn't be!...Could it? Fortis was in shock! It was as if he were looking in the mirror at himself twenty years ago!

Fortis's eyes then flew to Eldonia's bright blue eyes. Eldonia was giving him a sly smile.

"This, Atlas," Eldonia said to the boy, "is your papa."

"Daddy Forty?" asked the little girl, popping her thumb out of her mouth long enough to ask the question.

"Elly," Fortis croaked out. "How...Why...When...? I...."

Eldonia laughed at Fortis's speechlessness. "Well, we weren't exactly taking any precautions, were we? These two were born nearly eight months after you left. This is Atlas and Artemis."

Fortis just stood there, taking it all in. He had expected to be a father some day; after all, he had to have a son to pass down the earldom to. However, he hadn't expected to come back from war to realize he had gotten Eldonia pregnant before he had left! No wonder her figure was more mature--she had given birth to twins!

Fortis slowly knelt down to the ground. He gave a small smile, first to the boy, then to the girl.

"Hi, Atlas, Artemis," he said softly. "I'm...I'm your papa."

The little girl walked slowly over to him and looked him closely in the eyes. Fortis gulped.

"You gots my eyes," she said softly.

Fortis smiled. "I do."

"Hey, I got Papa's eyes, too!" said Atlas, hurrying over to his sister's side.

Fortis chuckled. "You both do."

"Momma say you gone a long time 'cuz you were keeping bad people from hurting us," said Artemis.

Fortis looked up at Eldonia, who just smiled and nodded her head. "That's right, Artemis. I was fighting the Vladians."

"You look strong," said Atlas in wonder, running a small hand over Fortis's armor.

"Of course I am! And someday, you'll be just as strong!"

Atlas straightened up to his full height and threw out his little chest. "I already strong! I help keep Momma and Artie safe!"

Fortis ruffled his boy's hair. "I'm sure you did."

"Eldonia? Altas? Artemis? Where are you?" came a deep voice.

"Uh oh," Eldonia said softly.

"There you are! What are you--?"

Fortis slowly stood. He saw a middle-aged man pause in coming down from the house. The man's demeanor instantly changed upon spying Fortis. The man snarled and drew the dagger from his waist.

"YOU!"

Fortis sighed. How ironic that Eldonia's father should come at him the same way he just went at Prince Cassius. Only Fortis deserved it.

Earl VonGewalt was charging at Fortis, and Fortis barely made out the whites of the man's eyes before...

"GAAAAAAHHHHH!"

The five other men in his tent snorted and cursed. "Yeah, right. Whatever," one of them said.

Fortis laid back down. What in the world would have possessed his mind to imagine the scenarios he had just seen? Minerva marrying the Crown Prince for her own protection? Pregnant with her second child? All grown-up and not needing him anymore? And then there was Eldonia. Why would he have dreamed that she had bore him twins out of wedlock?

Fortis ran a tired hand over his face. Yeah, they hadn't been as careful as they should have been, and he'd taken her more than once. But he doubted she'd get pregnant from the few times they'd had sex. No other girl he'd been with had gotten pregnant before.

First the shoulder-pads, the arms, then the backplate, the breastplate, the abdominal plates, side-plates...all done up with buckles and leather straps so that they hung off of each other. Then the shins, thighs, kneecaps, and the metal coverings over Fortis's boots. The young teenager struggled to lift the immense dead weight of Fortis's sword! Impatiently, Fortis snatched the sword up, taking Koviac with it! He shook the boy off like he was a dead fly, and strapped the scabbard roughly around his armour.

"I'm going out!" Fortis grunted, "You stay here and you find a spot where you can see me, okay?" he said.

"Yes sir!"

Damascus jogged over with their horses. Fortis climbed up onto Vortex and held his shield. The two knights trotted off to join the others of their class, lined up. They would be in the reserve. Once the battle was well underway, they would charge in as the scale-tippers. From their vantage point up on the escarpment, they would be able to see everything, and judge when was best to enter the fray. They could judge the movement of the troops by the banners and colours flying in the wind. A battle could last a few minutes, or it could last a few days. Or even longer. Weeks. Months. Fortis leaned on his horse, stroking Vortex gently. The horse snorted and stamped its feet...just like its master, it was bored...

Fortis watched the colours move back and forth, side to side. Vladians were a stupid people. Living so far north and cut off from the other kingdoms chilled their brains and dulled their senses. They were a mess of warring lords, tribes, villages and communities. Every few years they tried to do a little sabre-rattling. In recent years they'd been growing stronger, and this kept the Mountanian Army on the alert at all times. Fortis watched as the banners moved again. He saw Vladian knights entering the battlefield. They had no real discipline. Fortis watched as ordinary Mountanian foot-soldiers speared them off of their horses and butchered them on the ground. Fortis sighed...this was gonna be a long battle...or not...

He sniffed the air. He could smell...smoke and...blood and...something not nice...and...smoke and...something REALLY nice...He turned back to see the Fatlantean army-caterers. They were carrying paper bags and trays filled with what looked like rolls or buns or sandwiches or something...something to eat before the big event. How typical of them to always think of food first...at least their hearts were in the right place...

Suddenly, their impromptu brunch was interrupted by the sound of a bugle!

"Shit!" Fortis swore. "Come on guys! Move it! Vortex! Yah!"

Fortis charged down the slope into the fray. He held a heavy wooden lance under his arm. He harpooned three Vladian soldiers in one swift lurch! Dropping the lance, he drew out his sword, slicing and slashing through the sea of enemy soldiers!

It was a knightly tradition that knights only fought with other knights, but King Leviathan had said to call the Vladian knights 'knights' was an insult to the knights that served his own kingdom. As a result, Fortis fought indiscriminately. His sword sailed through the air, slashing and slicing, smashing his way through like an explorer hacking his way through the wildest jungles. Fortis dismounted his horse and landed on the ground. The Vladians who were nearby suddenly realised that this horrific being was just as tall on his feet as he was on horseback!

Fortis's size meant that he needed stronger and thicker armour, that his body was well-capable of carrying. It also meant that the Vladian swords couldn't pierce it. Fortis's heavy sword thrummed through the air, cracking and smashing into the enemy like a can-opener. And Fortis wasn't alone. Dozens of other knights, elite warriors and professional killing-machines with the strength of mountains, bore down upon the enemy, slicing them up like mincemeat. They avoided killing each other purely by virtue of their size and the heraldry on their shields. Fortis's shield, like all the others, had the coat of arms of his family. A helmet, a quartered shield, with a slab of stone, a lightning-bolt, crossed swords and a length of chain. It reflected his family background of the warrior elite, as builders, as being born of bad weather, of protection, and togetherness.

After hours away, Fortis and his fellow knights returned. Fortis was filthy. He was covered in blood and sweat, and he reeked to high heaven when Koviac unwisely removed his armour, to be hit with the full pong of battle! He regretted it even more when he asked Fortis to raise his arms so that he could remove his chainmail!

Koviac had seen the bruises on her arms. But he knew that Fortis had never actually hurt her. He was not known for being gentle, but he was known for being loving, caring, compassionate and attentive. He simply didn't know his own strength, was all...

Koviac knew that Fortis was one of the best knights in the king's army. He excelled in his training which was why he was already so established at such a young age. Koviac knew that if he ever hoped to be a full knight himself, as was his family's wish for him, he would do well not to cross his master, and obey his every command. For only then would he hope himself, one day, to have his own armour, his own sword, his own shield, coat of arms, horse, and have all the cute girls fawning over him...

Koviac didn't mind all the hard work...He just hoped that Fortis had a BATH before he saw him again!...Although that was pretty unlikely!

Minerva was sitting in front of her vanity as her maid Penelope was brushing through her long, dark blond hair. Minerva looked forlornly out of her bedroom window. The trees were beginning to lose their leaves, and the weather was turning colder. She moved her eyes to her calendar posted on the wall next to the window. Just last night she had crossed off another day--another day that her brothers had been at war with the Vladians. The days her brothers had been gone now totalled 165. Over four months of loneliness and blandness as she puttered around her family home.

Granted, she wasn't completely alone, with her servants, her grandmother, and her friend Eldonia staying here. However, Minerva was tired of the endless worrying. Her days were mostly filled sitting beside Grandma Athena and Eldonia as all three knitted blankets and clothing for the war effort. Everything they made was sent off to make-shift hospitals and orphanages to help those that had been wounded or otherwise negatively affected by the loss of loved ones in the war.

When Minerva wasn't knitting, she was writing letters. She wrote to all three of her brothers nearly every day, but she had gotten scant few in return. She understood that they were busy, but every single missive she got reassured her that her family was still alive. She had lost her father not quite six months ago. She couldn't stand it to lose one of her brothers right now, especially Fortis. She knew she shouldn't have favorites among her brothers, but she couldn't help it. Fortis had always been stronger and bigger and more protective of her than Jupiter or Cannius. He had always spent more time with her, too. She looked at a small oil painting of her brother that sat on her vanity. She smiled sadly. She hoped the war would end soon so Fortis could come back home to her.

"All set, my lady," said Penelope with one final primp of her mistress's hair.

"Thank you, Penelope."

With that, Minerva stood and left to go downstairs for breakfast. Both Eldonia and her grandmother were already sitting at the dining room table having breakfast. Despite being just the three of them, a large spread was laid out for them. Lady Athena was sipping at her cup of tea and demurely eating a scone. Eldonia, however, was eating at a rapid pace. Minerva laughed at the sight of her friend stuffing food into her face as if there wouldn't be enough.

"Hungry this morning?"

Eldonia merely nodded her head and put together the most disgusting sandwich Minerva had ever seen. Eldonia took a piece of buttered toast, placed fried tomatoes, pickles, and slices of apple on top, before drizzling honey and spreading cranberry preserves on top.

Minerva looked practically ill as she watched Eldonia take a large bite, close her eyes, and hum happily as chewed her rather gross-looking concoction.

"Elly, are you...feeling alright?"

"Mmm, never better, Min!"

"Are you sure? That sandwich you're eating looks rather...er...."

"Now, Minerva, dear, let Eldonia eat what she wants," said Lady Athena. "After her lack of appetite the past several weeks, it's only natural that she'd make up for lost time."

Minerva just shrugged her shoulders. "Yes, Grandma." She supposed if Eldonia wanted to eat that weird combination of foods, it was her choice. Minerva, too, was glad that her friend had recovered her appetite. Eldonia hadn't been quite herself since the boys left for war. She had been rather tired and irritable and had barely touched her food. Minerva just thought her friend was depressed. After all, Eldonia and Fortis had struck up quite a...'friendship'...before he left. Minerva thought of Prince Cassius and sighed. Pining for a boy was enough to still her appetite, too.

"Oooohhh," Eldonia moaned as she scooted her chair back from the table. "I think I ate too much." She placed her hand over her mouth and gave a delicate burp. "Excuse me. I think I'm going to go lie down and digest a bit."

"Take as much rest as you need, dear," said Lady Athena.

Eldonia rose to her feet, one hand on her belly. Minerva looked at her friend in surprise. Eldonia seemed to have put on quite a bit of weight recently! Her normally flat stomach was now quite rounded and distended from her body. Was she eating so much now to take her mind off of Fortis?

As Eldonia waddled a bit from the room, Minerva's brows drew together. Eldonia's weight gain was rather low in the belly--much lower than where her stomach would be. Why would....

Minerva gasped and put a hand to her mouth. A horrible thought occurred to her. Her mind ran frantically through all the changes she'd seen in her friend over the past several months, and she groaned. Why hadn't she seen it before? Eldonia was pregnant!

Minerva shook her head and sighed. Eldonia had told her she and Fortis had been careful when they were together. Minerva snorted. Yeah, right!

Minerva looked to her grandmother. Lady Athena nodded her head. "I see you've finally figured it out, my dear," Lady Athena said. "I wondered when you would put all the pieces together."

"You know? About Eldonia?"

Athena snorted. "Of course I know! I've been around plenty of women in her condition, including myself. I recognized the signs right away!"

"Aren't you...mad?"

"Mad? Why would I be mad at Eldonia? The foolish chit got herself with child. She's going to have to deal with the consequences of bearing an illegitimate child, and I do not envy her that, nor the conversation she will have with her father once she's told him. But she's not my granddaughter. I know that YOU know better than to get in her condition."

Minerva blushed. "Yes, Ma'am. But...even though she's not your granddaughter, I thought you'd be upset, since she carries your great-grandchild."

Lady Athena went absolutely still. "What?" she said quietly.

"Um...Eldonia. She's carrying your great-grandchild."

Minerva cringed as her grandmother went livid. "I can't believe one of my grandsons would be so careless!" the older woman seethed. "Which one was it? I bet it was Jupiter! He never could keep it in his pants!" At Minerva's head shake, Athena said, "Cannius never was the most intelligent when he was around a girl."

When Minerva shook her head again, Athena rose to her feet. "Not Fortis! Fortis knows better!"

Minerva cowered in her chair, but she bit her lip and gave a tiny nod of her head.

Athena fumed. "I cannot believe my oldest grandson would take advantage of a girl her age! What was he thinking?! Well, it was obvious he wasn't thinking, or rather it was obvious what he was thinking WITH!"

Minerva blushed, but her grandmother continued on. "When he gets back home, he will have to sort all this out! He will own up to his actions, and I will make sure he does right by the girl! She is, after all, the daughter of an earl and of respectable lineage, despite her irresponsible behavior."

Lady Athena took several deep breaths. "She could be carrying his heir. I will NOT see the earldom fall to an illegitimate son because Fortis couldn't take appropriate precautions!"

Athena walked down the table to Minerva and gave her a strained smile. "I'm sorry, my dear. I did not mean to frighten you. However, I have some letters to write."

As Lady Athena swept out of the room, Minerva sighed and took a shaky sip of tea. She had rarely seen her grandmother so upset, but rightfully so. Anger was starting to bleed through Minerva's shock, as well. Had Eldonia planned this? Did she intentionally become pregnant to trap Fortis in marriage? Was her so-called friend so desperate for a good match that she would sleep with a newly titled earl so that she could guarantee she'd become a countess?

Minerva got angrily to her feet and left the dining room. She would seek out Eldonia and have a good talk with her 'friend.'

Then it dawned.

Father wasn't here. Fortis was lord of the manor now. Minerva supposed that being at the top of the food chain now, Fortis felt he didn't have to worry so much and explain himself to anyone. And he wouldn't, if grandma wasn't here. Oooh boy.

Eldonia groaned. "It was all...well it was kinda my fault. I...I got the hots for him when I met you at the castle during the Queen's Birthday...He was so different from all the other idiots there...They're all cocky, jocky, penis-hockey...seeing how many girls they can pass around between them. I hate those guys, they're so boring! Fortis is so different!"

"Is he?" Minerva asked. She was at a loss to see WHAT was so different about her brother...Okay, if she thought about it, maybe she'd come up with something...but...

"Well I could see it!" Eldonia said. "H-how he acts around you. He...he treats you so...so nice...It was sweet and...and well...how he makes sure you're always comfy and safe and happy and how he teases you and makes fun of you and how you let him do that..."

"Well he's not gonna change, so..." Minerva said. "...I have to make SOME concessions to him...and he's not so bad..."

"Well that's it!" Eldonia said. "He's sweet and he's sexy and strong all in one. Do you know how many of those there are out there? Not many! And you have no idea, Minerva. You're the youngest of four! I'm my father's only child! There's a lot of pressure for me to marry good! I could see that Fortis was something special and well...I suppose I took advantage and...and I was a bit...well...opportunistic...?" she finished, not sure of the word.

Minerva listened in silence.

"YOU TOOK ADVANTAGE OF...!!!"

"Minnie PLEASE don't be angry! I don't even know what my FATHER'S going to say! It all happened so fast! He was sweet and loving and playful, I was looking for someone who might be a cool boyfriend. Things kinda got out of control! I led him on and opened myself up to him, I admit it..."

"You opened your LEGS!" Minerva said hotly.

"...and even then, not far enough..." Eldonia said. Minerva glared at her 'friend'! Eldonia gulped. Normally their dirty little teenage-girl jokes were met with giggles, but apparently Minerva wasn't in the mood!

"Look I'm sorry alright!? But Fortis is really sweet! I'm sure we can work something out!"

"We better!"

"And when we get married, then you and I can be more than just friends!"

Minerva stopped...that WAS true...Eldonia would be around all the time...they could hang out whenever they wanted, play with the babies...eat, drink, be merry...maybe it wouldn't be so bad?

"It's all too far ahead!" Minerva finished with a huff, "The baby isn't even BORN yet! You STILL need to get married. And then you have to PRAY that Fortis legitimises the baby! If he doesn't recognise it as his, you're in deep trouble!"

"Of course he will! He wants an heir to his estate, doesn't he!?"

"I hope you realise he won't do it if it's a girl! A girl's no use to him! Who heard of a Girl Earl? He needs a BOY to take over the estate when he dies!"

"Minnie don't TALK like that!" Eldonia sobbed, "It's hard enough! Now just...just leave me alone!" and she burst into tears!

Minerva gulped and left the room! She headed upstairs and burst into her grandmother's bedroom! Lady Athena was busy crocheting a blanket. The needle poked through the fabric and the thread left neat little patterns everywhere...

"Grandma!" said Minerva, in much less of her usual, soft, timid tones. She closed the doors, "What's gonna happen?"

Lady Athena put down her embroidery and dropped her shoulders. She removed a pair of handsome, gold spectacles from her face.

"Darling?" she asked. She gestured to a seat nearby. Minerva spread out her dress and sat down.

"Grandma what's gonna happen!?" Minerva asked. "About Fortis, I mean! And Eldonia!?"

Athena sighed.

"I would never have believed this of your brother, Fortis..." she said slowly. "He was always the hot-headed type. Fast-acting, rough, tough, rumble, tumble, macho, prove-it tough-guy sort of boy...But...he had his principles and he NEVER broke them. But then, your friend Eldonia is a fine young woman...from a good family. A wealthy family of significant age. Perhaps not as old as ours...but still. I think they both had a moment of weakness..."

Minerva glared at her grandmother.

"...or...three...and this...event...was the result".

"So what happens, granny!?" Minerva pressed.

"When Fortis returns...there will be a marriage. There WILL be a marriage. He must take care of the girl, and attend to any children that she might bear. I shall write to Lord Von Gewalt and tell him what has happened. And I shall send a letter to your brother...if I can...and tell HIM what has happened. At the nearest possible convenience, he is to come home and attend to his responsibilities!"

Minerva sighed.

"Oh I'm sure it will not be so bad!" Athena said. "You know Fortis. He cares for you very much. He's always been sweet inside. He will take good care of Eldonia and the baby!"

"I hope so, granny..." said Minerva, getting up and leaving the room. "Oh I hope so..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Over the coming weeks and months, Eldonia's appetite steadily increased. As did her desire for...strange food combinations. Minerva wasn't sure at WHAT stage in her life she would ever desire fresh Lucian oysters dipped in chocolate...but...to each her own, she guessed.

As Eldonia grew more and more pregnant and her weight made it harder for her to move around, Lady Athena became more and more determined to find some way to contact Fortis! Meanwhile, Minerva and the housemaids decorated and prepared one of the empty guestrooms. It would now become the nursery for the new baby. Minerva climbed up into the attic and came downstairs with a heavy, wrought iron cradle! The cradle was jet black and very dusty! It had a solid iron frame and bars around it, and a pretty, protective metal mesh between the baby and the bars, to prevent it from getting its arms...legs...or even its head!...stuck between the bars. The cradle was simply decorated, with snails and flowers and birds, all hammered and bent out of iron, and welded to the outside bars of the crib as a form of decoration. The canopy over the crib had dusty old lace curtains. Minerva removed the curtains and shook and cleaned them thoroughly before putting them back around the crib.

"It's so beautiful!" said Eldonia, examining the rough elegance of the cradle. "Who made it?"

"One of our ancestors", said Minerva. "It's pretty, isn't it?" she said. She hung a mobile above the bars of the cradle where the baby could watch it spin around when the little clockwork motor was wound up.

"It's very pretty", said Eldonia, smiling. She stared around the nursery at the changing-table, the couch, chairs, and toy-chest. She gasped and then sat down heavily on the couch!

"Are you alright!?" Minerva asked.

"I'm...I'm fine! I...the baby!" Eldonia gasped. "He's getting so BIG now! Ooh!" she groaned. "It is kinda...hard to...hard to move!"

"You're carrying the baby of a big, strong Mountain lord within you!" Minerva said. "I think you should expect it to be of larger than average size!"

"I think it passed THAT point three months ago!" Eldonia gasped!

Their conversation was interrupted by Lady Athena entering the new nursery with a letter!

"Finally, a WORD from your brother!" she said. "He writes..."

"...My dearest Nanna,

It is a great joy to hear from you. I have had so little news from anything outside of the fields of battle. Our efforts against the Vladians amount to steady victory. I know not when I will be home again. Perhaps in a few months.

The Lady Eldonia is a fine and virtuous young woman. Spirited, strong and determined. She is very different and is most attractive. I foresee us being very contented. Your news of her expectation was a surprise. But I am sure the child will be a healthy young lad who I shall love and tend to for ever and always. Give her my love. Oh, and tell the girl I will return to her soon. Young Minerva must miss her big brother's attentions, hmm?..."

"There's a winking face, there..." said Lady Athena. The girls laughed. She continued.

"I don't care what you tell Lord Von Gewalt. In our union, his daughter will marry a man of substance, standing and strength. He should be happy..."

"'Happy' is underlined", Athena interrupted...

"...and joyful that she will marry into one of the finest and oldest families in all of our great and noble kingdom. My love to you all.

Fortis Maximus Vanderstorm...Lord Vanderstorm".

The two girls stared at each other and smiled.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Eldonia headed upstairs. It had been nearly a YEAR now, since Fortis had gone! Eldonia groaned! This baby-weight was getting to her! It was getting harder and harder to move up and down stairs! She shuffled heavily towards her bedroom. She gasped! She could feel a twitching sensation! She kept moving. Then she felt it! A distinct clenching feel in her abdomen! These must be the 'contractions' that Lady Athena had mentioned! She gasped! Was the baby COMING already!?

She headed down the corridor and opened her bedroom door! She nearly stumbled when she felt something painful jolt through her body! She gasped and staggered in! These contractions were SHARP! And painful! They were like the worst-ever muscle-cramps and windings that she'd ever had! She was having trouble breathing! Another painful jolt! She staggered to her bed but fell short, hitting the floor instead! She started breathing hard and heavy! The contractions were getting tighter and tighter! She let out a groan of agony! She tried to get up but the pain in her abdomen was excruciating!

"Muh...muh..muh...m-MINNIE!" Eldonia squealed, barely able to breathe! "M-minnie! th-th-th-the b-b-b-b-baaa...AAAGH! B-BABY!" she screamed! "MINNIE!"

Minerva was knitting in her bedroom. She stopped when she thought she heard muffled voices. She frowned. Then it came again! Then she realised what it was! She tossed her knitting onto her bed and got up to her feet! She left her room and went into her friend's bedroom! She screamed!

"Eldonia are you alri..."

"NO I'M NOT ALRIGHT! THE BABY'S COMING!" she shrieked, in near hysteria, now!

"Well you can't lie there!" Minerva said. "We have to get you to the bed! Can you stand up!?"

"I...I..." Eldonia gasped. Minerva grabbed her arm and tried to help her up. But another powerful contraction caused Eldonia to collapse back onto the floor!

"W-w-where's f-f-FORTIS!?"

"He's not HERE of course! He's away!"

Eldonia SWORE! What was the point of marrying a super-strong Mountain hunk when his strength wasn't around when you needed it!?

"Girls?" Lady Athena called out, "Is every...Oh my!"

The old woman rushed into the room. "You take her other arm, darling! We'll carry her into the bed together! Come along now! That's right, strong grip! Up! One...two...UP! That's right! Easy now...easy...down...down! Legs up and over and onto the bed...good!"

Eldonia gritted her teeth! The pain was making her see stars!

"Grandma what do I do!?" Minnie gasped. "I DON'T KNOW NOTHIN' 'BOUT BIRTHIN' NO BABIES!!"

"Oh hush, child!" Athena snapped back. "I I need to...uh..."

Eldonia screamed again! This brought the house-girls running! They thundered up the stairs to see what was going on!

"You girls!" Lady Athena said, "I...I need towels! I need a knife! A bowl! Water! Hot water! And...and...and...uh...and string! And...and...and...Ooooh what else!? Oh, and my smelling-salts! Minerva, they're on my dressing-table! Well HURRY!"

The womenfolk all dispersed to find the necessary equipment! Two huge buckets of boiling water, a bowl, a sharp knife, some string, plenty of towels, a bottle of smelling-salts and all other manner of things! Lady Athena positioned Eldonia's body, sitting her on top of a pile of pillows so that she would be slightly sloped downwards.

"Legs up, darling! No! UP! NO! Like THIS!...Skirts up! That's good! Now...towels!...Put them there...Now push darling! Come along! Puff-puff-puff-puff! That's it! Let it out! LET IT OUT! SCREAM!"

Eldonia screamed alright! The windows vibrated as she shrieked in pain! She felt like she was giving birth to a COW, not a baby! She gasped and felt a release! Something wet flopped out! It landed with a 'whump!' in the bundle of towels and Lady Athena reached for the knife to cut the umbilical cord and to pull out the rest of the cord and afterbirth. She bundled up all the soiled and used and otherwise unwanted products and equipment of the birth and stuffed it into an old basket.

"Here girls!" she said. "Take it away! Burn it!"

"Burn it!?" one of the girls asked.

"The WHOLE THING! We don't want any of it near the baby where it might get sick! Go away now!"

The girls carried out all the towels and the afterbirth and other bits and pieces, and left the room. Athena staunched the bleeding from the birth with a towel.

"Now...keep your legs shut! That'll hold the towel in place. Of course, if you'd done that to begin with, we wouldn't be where we are now..." she mumbled. "Now, let's have a...My goodness!"

"I got the smelling-salts granny! I...Woah!" Minerva gasped!

Lying on the bed was the new baby. It had dark blond, brown-mixed hair, a cross between his mother and father. Minerva stared at the baby!

"He's so BIG! No wonder you were in so much pain Ellie! Here's the salts..."

Eldonia sniffed them and coughed! She was sweating heavily! Athena handed her a towel and wiped her down while Eldonia caught her breath. She finally fainted against the pillows, spent and exhausted! It was now that they heard the crying...

Athena picked up her great-grandson and dumped him into the buckets of water to clean him off! She toweled him down and turned him every whichway, to see how the next generation of her family had measured up! She smiled. He was a PERFECT baby! She smiled.

"Hello little darling!" she cooed softly, "Hello! Do you know who I am? I'm your Granny Atheny! Yes I am! And you, you are...are...eh...are...um...Huh..."

She turned to Eldonia, who was drinking down an ocean of water!

"...What do we call this young master?' she asked.

Eldonia stared at Minerva!

"You know...I never talked about it with Fortis!..." Eldonia said.

"Well lucky for you, I wrote down a list of names the moment I knew you were expecting", said Athena. She pulled them out of her pocket in her dress and shook the piece of paper open.

"Let's see now..."

"Virgil?"

"I think Fortis would make some horrible sex-joke out of that..."

"Zeus?"

"Nah, that's boring..."

"Maximus?"

"Too common!"

"Atlas?"

Eldonia frowned and ran the word over her tongue. "No...I don't think he's an 'Atlas' anyway..."

"Erectus?"

"Oh don't name him that!" Minerva cried out, "He'll get bullied!"

"Or it could be the best name in the world for him, if he's inherited anything from his father..." Eldonia whispered. The two girls giggled.

"Hercules?"

"Again, too common".

"Bacchus?"

"Oh sure, name him after a drunk!"

"How about Augustus?"

"Booooring...I want something COOL! Something GRAND! Something POWERFUL! I bet that's what Fortis would want!"

"I bet he would!" said Lady Athena. She glanced down her list of names.

"How about...Daemon?"

"Maybe if the hair was brown...I don't think he's a Daemon", Minerva said.

"What about...Jasper?"

"He's a BOY, not a cat!"

"Uh...What about...Leonarrrrrrrdo...?"

Minerva smiled. "Ooooh!"

Eldonia ran the name through her lips. "Leonardo?"

"Classic, powerful, upstanding, alluring. And his brown-blond hair could grow out long like a lion's mane", Lady Athena suggested.

Eldonia stared at Minerva and the two girls frowned.

"Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm..." Eldonia whispered. She grinned, "Oooh, I think I like that!...Hey we can call him 'Leafy' for short, because his hair looks like autumn!"

The three women burst out laughing!

"I think we have a name!" said Athena, smiling and kissing the baby, "Don't we little Leafy?" she teased. "Ooooh!" she said, squeezing the baby tightly.

Eldonia had recovered from the exhaustion of the birth now, and she took hold of her baby and snuggled it.

"Hello Leo!" she cooed, "Welcome to the world, my darling..." she whispered, kissing him on the forehead. "Mother loves you!" she added.

Armed riders galloped into camp, escorting a bright red mail coach. The carriage rumbled into the center of the main front-line camp and the doors opened. The mail-carriers got out and a man blew a whistle several times, long and loud, to get everyone's attention!

"MAIL CALL!" another man shouted out. People lined up and huddled around as packages and parcels, letters and envelopes were handed out to the gathering crowd.

"For you, my lord", said the mailman, handing Fortis a large, folded sheet of paper.

Fortis examined the letter. There was a large seal stamped onto the fold in the paper. He broke the seal and opened the document.

"My darling Fortis...awwwwww...Much love and great affection and concerns for your safety...yadda yadda yadda...writing to you about Lady Eldonia...again??...say that she has...WHAT!?"

Everyone within hearing-distance turned around to stare at Fortis! Fortis ignored them and kept reading! His expression kept changing, from one of joy, to worry, to anger, to panic! He jogged away and entered a large tent where King Leviathan was busy with his most senior officers.

"...Then you will go...ahem...another time, gentlemen", said Leviathan. The generals saluted and left the tent.

"My lord", said Leviathan.

Fortis saluted.

"Your Majesty I...I received a letter from home".

"Yes. Was that the mail-coach that just came?"

"Yes sir".

"Oh good!...Achilles! Send these off at once, will you?" the king asked his manservant. He shoved a number of sealed documents into the younger man's hands. He bowed and left the tent at once.

"Well, what is it?" the king asked.

"Well...ahem. I...um..." Fortis wasn't sure how to say this. He handed over the letter instead. The king started to read.

"Oh...Oooh...Ooooooooooh..."

He put the letter down and smiled. "So I see..." he said. "Been expanding the kingdom, have we?"

"Eh...so it seems!" said Fortis, brightly.

The king chuckled. "You are here to ask for time off to attend your new son...and your FIRST son, I believe?"

"Yes sir!"

"Hmm!..."

"Come here".

Fortis advanced to the table. The king pointed to the map in front of him. "We're here...our men are here...here...here...and over here. The Vladians are here...and here...We can trap them easily like this...if we send our forces in on both sides, and these two companies over these hills. It's a long way out of that gully, and those idiot Vladians have just about dug their own graves. Well, it's our job to bury them there. We have more than enough men and the Vladians are running out of weapons and supplies. I daresay I could spare you. But no longer than a week, just in case the tide turns".

"It won't!"

"I very much doubt that it will, but you never know", said the king.

"Yes sir".

"Well go on and pack, then!" the king said. "But no more than a week, mind!"

"Yes sir! And...and thank you, sir".

The king smiled. "You should count yourself fortunate, Lord Fortis. You are now fighting for the life of your new child! A noble cause".

Fortis thought about this as he left the tent. The king was right! He was fighting for his child...But what kind of child was it? The only information in the letter was that it was a boy, and that they'd named it Leonardo Fortis. Leonardo was a classical and powerful name, suggestive of strength, intelligence, good looks, a creative streak, and a penchant for being a free spirit...What would the baby be like? Would it live up to its names?

Fortis packed up all his stuff, said goodbye to his friends, mounted his horse, Vortex, and took off down the road...He was going home again...

The journey was long, but Fortis was young, strong and determined. He rode his horse hard and stopping for only the briefest of respites. When he finally reached Castle Vanderstorm, it was extremely late at night and both he and his horse were exhausted! Fortis stabled Vortex, and tiptoed into the house. Somewhere in here, there was a new baby boy...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis sneaked into the castle via the servants' entrance near the kitchen. He tiptoed past the kitchen table, the servants' hall, the servants bedrooms and upstairs. These stairs seemed SO much smaller than when he was 15...when he used to sneak downstairs to...'play'...with Rosemary the chambermaid...aaah, good times...

Fortis entered the front parlour. A fire was still burning in the grate. He added some logs and stoked the fire until it was burning properly. The light filled the room and the warmth washed over him! He NEEDED that! He stood up and stared at the fire. He then picked up a candlestick and lit the candle in it, before heading upstairs.

If there was a baby in the house, where would it be? He kept moving until he saw a door with a beautiful floral wreath on it. A baby-ring. He smiled and opened the doors to the nursery. He tiptoed inside and moved around, lighting the candles on the tables and wall-brackets. Then he recognised the old, wrought-iron crib in the middle of the room. He walked up to it and lit the four candles in the sockets on the sides of the crib. The candles were far above the crib, with wax-pans underneath to catch the dripping wax, so there was no danger to the baby. With the four candles lit, Fortis could bend over the crib.

Being tall was a sign of strength, virility, power, security and protection in Mountania. Mothers liked their sons to be big and strong, fathers wanted them to be healthy and carry on the family line. Girls saw big strong, towering husbands and boyfriends as being strong providers, good producers and incredible bedroom performers.

Fortis wasn't about to deny that he was all those things...but being tall DID lead to a few issues...He hated having to bend down this far to look into the damn crib!

He knelt down and peeked into the crib. Wrapped up tightly in a blanket was a baby boy, with only its head visible, sleeping on a bright blue pillow. It had wheat-coloured hair of browny-blond. Fortis chuckled. So this was his baby boy...

"Hey little fellah..." he said in his deep, rumbling bass. "You awake, huh?"

He poked the blanket.

wriggle!

He chuckled and kept poking. The blanket kept wriggling. Then, the baby's eyes opened! Fortis smiled. He had bright blue eyes! So big and beautiful...

"Hey little buddy!" said Fortis, softly. "Huh? You awake, huh? Fortis slowly unwrapped the blanket to reveal a sky-blue fleechy romper-suit. Free from the blanket, the baby kicked and wriggled around! It giggled up at Fortis. Fortis lowered a hand down and the baby grabbed his finger!

"Hehehe! You ain't scared of anything, aren'tcha?" said Fortis. He easily lifted the wriggling mass of baby out of the crib and stood slowly up, holding the baby tightly in his huge arms!

Baby Leonardo didn't KNOW who this strange man was! It was okay when he was just staring at him and whispering to him and giggling, but now he was being carried up and away from the safety of his home! He wriggled and kicked! The man held him tightly in his powerful arms!

"Heeey! Shhhh...It's okay..."

Fortis tried to get a closer look at Leonardo's face, but the baby kept turning his head away! Fortis sighed and sat down in a rocking-chair. It creaked loudly, but held, and Fortis began rocking back and forth, stroking and squeezing the baby.

When Leo decided that the big scary man wasn't a danger to him, he opened his eyes and stared at him with wonderment. The man smiled back and chuckled. His voice was deep and soothing...the baby liked this voice! He yawned and snuggled up.

Fortis chuckled. He hugged the baby, got up and started walking around the room, rocking it gently in his arms...

"Shhhh..." Fortis whispered, and started walking gently around the room with the baby in his arms...

"Hush little baby, don't say a word...
Papa's gonna forge you a gleaming sword...
If that gleaming sword turns rust,
Papa's gonna cast you a plaster bust.

If that plaster bust should chip,
Papa's gonna build you a model ship.

Papa's gonna give you a pen and ink.

If that pen and ink should spill,

She armed herself with a candle and a large knife that Fortis had given her, and slipped out of her bedroom. She tiptoed along the hall to where she saw the nursery doors slightly open! She hurried towards them, her nightdress fluttering! She pushed the doors open to see all the candles lit! She stared around the room and then she saw a HUGE figure standing by the windows, his massive arms held up, obviously holding something!

Fortis saw the reflection of his sister in the window and turned slowly around.

"Hey girl!"
