"Hey don't do that! I spent a long time making that for you!"

Minerva picked up the knife, and put it on a cabinet, out of reach of the baby.

"You're home!" Minerva said.

"Not for long. Only a week", Fortis said. "I thought I'd come and see this baby that everyone's been talkin' about..."

"Isn't he darling?" Minerva whispered.

"Yeah. Just like his Aunty Minnies, huh?"

Minerva blushed!

"Forty..."

"Hey he is...And youse gonna be a big, strong, strappin' Mountain lord one day, young man...Hugh!" Fortis grunted, flexing his massive arms. Leonardo Fortis giggled and kicked excitedly! Fortis chuckled!

"Awww, look at him! He knows his papa!"

Fortis kissed the baby tenderly and stroked it.

"Fortis, it's late!" said Minerva. "You better go to sleep!"

"Yeah good idea. I been ridin' all day..." said Fortis. "G'night girl. I'll see you tomorrow for breakfast".

"Alright..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Alright, there, my little man," Fortis said softly, kissing Leonardo on the forehead, "time for you to go back to sleep."

Leonardo yawned cutely, closing his bright blue eyes and opening his cupid's bow mouth.

"Aww," Fortis chuckled, running a finger down his son's soft, chubby cheek. He gently laid the baby back down in his crib, and Minerva came up to cover Leo with a soft afghan that their grandmother had crocheted.

"I'm surprised he didn't need to be fed or changed," Minerva said softly as Fortis laid his large hand over his son's belly, amazed at feeling it rise and fall as his son's breathing became deep and even. "He usually needs both of those before going back to sleep after waking up in the middle of the night."

"Well, he didn't wake up on his own. I admit to having woken him up to see what color his eyes were...and to play with him a bit."

"Fortis!" she hissed.

Fortis just chuckled and began to snuff out most of the candles around the nursery. "What? No harm done!"

Minerva just sighed and shook her head. She couldn't really fault her brother for wanting to spend some time with his son when he first got home. Too bad he was only going to be home for a week.

"How is the war going?" she asked as they left only two candles burning near the crib and quietly left the nursery.

"Come on, little guy, burp for Momma," Eldonia said quietly.

"I'll wash Mortimer after breakfast!" said Lady Athena, putting the soft toy aside and returning to her breakfast.

"Be careful with his eyes, grandma", said Fortis, "You will be careful, right?"

"I might be OLD, Fortis, but I know how to clean glass eyes!"

Athena laughed at her oldest grandson. Sometimes he acted just as if he was four years old again...

The maids entered with pancakes and whipped cream, honey, strawberries, blueberries, blackberries and a whole host of other berries, picked fresh from the lord's orchards the day before.

"Fortis my darling..." Athena began. She was about to ask how the king was faring under the war, when she was interrupted by a distant "WHAM!!"

Everyone jumped! Fortis got to his feet and reached for a nearby sword...this being a Mountanian house, there were naturally swords in every room. Mostly for display-purposes, but they were kept razor sharp at all times...just in case.

They heard heavy footsteps coming down the corridor from the foyer and then two figures appeared at the doorway. Twin brothers Jupiter and Cannius!

"What're YOU doin' here!?" Fortis growled. "You supposed to be out fighting!"

"What are YOU doing here?" Cannius snapped back.

"I'm on leave!" Fortis retorted.

"Well so are we! Hey granny!"

Athena got up and hugged her two younger grandsons.

"My darlings!" she said, kissing them. "Oooh! You're both a bit ripe, aren't you?"

"Hey, we been riding since dawn, give us a break!" said Jupiter.

"And some breakfast!" said Cannius. "We haven't eaten since yesterday afternoon!"

Fortis called the maids and they set up two new places at the table for the lord's brothers. They sat down and attacked the food.

"Whoogah!"

"What's that, sweetheart?" Eldonia whispered. She was feeding Leo a sort of milky porridge slurry. It was sweet and hot and semi-liquid, easy for a baby to digest.

Leo pointed at the two newcomers! He didn't know who these two were!

"Oh hey, a baby!" said Cannius, "Hello little baby!"

"Oooogah!"

"Son, you don't pay no attention to your ugly Uncle Cannius and you get back to your porridge!" Fortis rumbled.

"SON!?" the two brothers blurted out!

They'd been away from home for so long that they'd quite lost touch with the rest of the family!

"Forty...a tiger in the sack..." said Jupiter. "So, who's the mother?"

"I am!" said Eldonia.

"...Oh...Sorry Lady Eldonia...So...Is Forty good?"

"Jupiter!...Yes..." she said, blushing.

Fortis smirked. "I'm always good..."

"Oh please!" said Minerva, "Can we talk about something a BIT more pleasant?"

"Yeah!" said Cannius, "What's your name, little fellah?"

"He's called Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm!" said Minerva proudly, "Leo, this is your Uncle Cannius...and this is your Uncle Jupiter!"

"Hah!" said Jupiter, "Get that, Canny? UNCLES! Hah! Cool! Hey, we should make him stuff, I know, I could make him his first sword..."

"Sword!? You couldn't make a SPATULA!" Fortis roared, "And I've seen you TRY!"

The table erupted with laughter!

"That heat-weld on the handle was useless! I remember Mrs Tibbs trying to use it to fry eggs! I don't know how you made that thing, but it snapped in half from the heat! Don'tcha know how to quench your stuff so it doesn't go brittle?"

Jupiter blushed. Metalwork was never his strong suite.

"Uh...Well...I could make him toys!" said Jupiter, "I can make stuff outta wood!"

"Like what, a walking-stick?" Cannius teased.

"I can SO make more stuff than that!"

"Yeah, blocks can't be THAT hard to build..."

Fortis and Cannius laughed. Minerva sighed...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Relax!" said Eldonia, "We'll make it fun! We'll have fire-breathers and jugglers and all kinds of things! We'll have a great big feast with everyone!"

Fortis smiled. "Yeah...maybe it could be fun".

Eldonia opened her mouth to say something else when they heard a shrill shriek, followed by the clashing of copper pots and pans!

"What the..." Fortis jumped to his feet! He was only half-dressed in a pair of leggings and sandals, but that wasn't going to stop him! He reached up for one of two swords hanging on a rack above the fireplace in the dining-room, and charged into the kitchen!

The kitchen at Castle Vanderstorm was behind the dining-room and down a short corridor. It had three entrances: Two into the dining-rooms and living-rooms, and one into the back yard and kitchen garden. Fortis burst into the kitchen to see the housemaids, housekeeper and cook terrified at the sight of four Vladian mercenaries! The back door was busted off its hinges! The men looked to be in terrible condition! Fortis had no doubts that they were Vladian deserters who were on the run, and searching for food! They probably figured that the menfolk in this household were away at war!

"WHAT THE HELL ARE YOU DOING IN MY HOUSE!?" Fortis roared, so loudly that in the background, he could hear Leonardo burst into tears!

The terrified girls hurried behind their gigantic master! Fortis shoved them roughly away and through the doors into the servants' passage, and held his sword out front. The four men were all heavily-built, beefy soldiers, all about six or seven feet tall, but the sight of Fortis struck an unnamed terror into their hearts! They tried to run out the back door! With one hand, Fortis grabbed the heavy kitchen table and shoved it across the floor! It slammed against the back wall with a CRASH!, cutting off their retreat! Fortis swung his sword down and the four men drew out their own swords! The clash of steel on steel radiated out from the kitchen! The swing-doors leading into it slowly opened as pairs of eyes peeked in to watch the show.

Fortis didn't have a dagger with him, like he usually did, so he was a bit limited, but as he passed a knife-block, he pulled out the largest of the blades he could find! Swing! Thrust! Parry! Block!

Soft gasps and squeals emanated from behind Fortis as his sword plunged into flesh! A crunchy, squishy, squelchy sound! The sword...all eight feet of it, was drawn out again, drenched in blood! The remaining three Vladians stared in horror and scarpered! Fortis grabbed the last, impaled man and hurled him out the door with the rest! Not caring about his horrendous injury, the man sprinted off with the rest of his cronies!

The kitchen door opened and the maids and servants hurried back in! They swarmed around Fortis! Their lord and master! Their big, hunky protector! Fortis chuckled. He wrapped a thick arm around the shoulders of Mrs. Tibbs, the housekeeper.

"This isn't gonna delay lunch is it, Tibby?" he asked, his old baby-name for the aging servant. She laughed.

"Oooh you!" she said, chuckling, "Not at all, my lord! And we thank you for coming so swiftly to our aid!"

"We could'a held them off!" said one of the feistier maids! "This is a KITCHEN! We got knives everywhere!"

"Don't be so, Eliza!" Mrs. Tibbs scowled, "You should be thankful his lordship is here to serve those who serve him!"

"Oh we are!" said another girl, wrapping herself around Fortis's waist. She looked up at him with big, wet, puppy-eyes. Fortis chuckled. He stood proudly in the middle of the kitchen with the sword-point resting on the ground...blood still dripping off the edge!

Slowly, the girls began righting the kitchen, stacking up all the pots and pans that had fallen over earlier. With even greater ease than earlier, Fortis pulled the heavy kitchen table away from the doorframe and set it back to rights in the middle of the room.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Our savior!"

The servant-girls crowded around Fortis to admire him and hug him and kiss him in gratitude. Fortis smiled.

"Ooooh! Thank you my lord!" said Mrs Tibbs, the housekeeper. She was an old, short, stout woman, even older than Granny Athena. She had served the Vanderstorm household since she was a child, and had watched Fortis grow up.

...and up...

...and up...

...and up!!

She hugged him and Fortis hugged her gently back...or as gently as he thought he was, at least. He then returned to the dining-room.

"Man all that stuff got me beat!" Fortis groaned, "I'mma go upstairs and do some reading or something..."

"Us girls are going into town!" said Lady Athena sharply.

"Sure gran'ma", said Fortis.

Eldonia handed baby Leonardo to his father.

"You take good care of him now, won't you? See that he doesn't get into any mischief and that he plays nice, hmm? Like a good boy?"

"Sure sweetheart", said Fortis.

"I was TALKING to Leonardo!"

Minerva laughed! "Oh Eldonia! Don't TEASE him so! Come on! Or the shops will be closed!"

Fortis smiled. He scooped up his son in his huge arms and carried him upstairs. He spotted Mortimer his plush-cat pinned to a clothes-horse in the front hall. Leonardo reached out hungrily for the toy!

"Ah-ah-ah!" said Fortis, "He's all wet still, son! Gotta wait, huh?"

Leo sighed.

"Patience son..." Fortis crooned. He remembered when HE was a child and HE wanted to play with Mortimer! Mother had said he wasn't ready to play with. Forty would find a way! He would warm up kitty so he would dry faster and so he could play with him!...Unfortunately, Fortis's idea of warming kitty was holding him over a candle...ever since, Mortimer had been a cat without a tail. Athena had refused to sew a new one back on, to teach her grandson the virtue of patience.

Fortis carried Leo into the library and searched the books. He pulled down a battered old tome of children's stories and sat down in front of the fireplace with his son in his lap. Fortis opened the book and flipped through the pages.

"Okay...How's about poppy reads to you, huh son? You like that? How about...Sir Vladamir and the Lava Spewer?...No? Or...The Little Shoemaker?...No? What about the Blacksmith and the Talking Anvil?...Hey careful!...Oooh you want this one, huh?"

Leo wasn't particularly interested in the stories! He was slapping the paper because he liked the pretty printing on the pages!

"The Story of the Luck Dragon", Fortis read. He flipped to the page and propped Leo up in his lap.

"Here we are...Once upon a time, there was a very poor Mountain family. A mommy...a pappy...a granny...and their little baby! See? There's baby, just like you!...And they were very scared because the mean landlord was gonna throw them off his land because they had no food to pay taxes! But the weather was very bad and the harvests had been poor! And the little Mountain Family only had enough food for themselves and couldn't pay taxes! Very scared, they packed everything up and ran away to the big city!...see? Here they are...and here's the big city far, far, far away!..."

Leo leaned close to look at the pretty pictures! He slapped the paper excitedly. Fortis smiled and hugged his son.

"...As they went, the snow got very bad and they were so cold! So they built a fire using ten big stones to make a fire-ring, and then they burnt some wood to keep them warm in a cave. They fell asleep around the fire and when they woke up, the baby was gone!"

Leo burst into tears!

Fortis laughed. "Oooooh! And then...and then the granny saw that there were only nine stones around the fire! One of them was gone! She saw that the stone had broken apart into little pieces! The family followed scruffy scratchy marks on the cave floor and out into the snow. They found baby sleeping in the snow. And wrapped around it was a shiny red and gold baby dragon that was blowing fire on the baby to keep him warm and snuggly! Without the dragon, the baby would've frozen to death! So the family kept the dragon to bring them good luck! And that is why they're called Luck Dragons!"

Fortis hugged his son. "And Luck Dragons are VERY very rare! Their eggs are stored in big scary volcanoes that are very hard to get to! It's very dangerous! Papa wishes he could give you a luck dragon as a present but they're very hard to find!"

Leo looked sad! He wanted the cuddly baby dragon!

Fortis laughed. He wrapped his son back in his baby blankie and left the room, returning the baby its crib. By the time he'd come back, Fortis realised that the library was not empty!

Kneeling in front of the fireplace was a girl dressed in a maid's outfit. Just from her size, Fortis could see that she was quite young...and cute... Fortis approached the girl and then sat down in his chair, putting his feet up and relaxing.

"Good morning".

The girl shrieked! She dropped the tinder and flint and whirled around!

"Oh! I...I...I...I beg your...your pardon my...my...my..."

Fortis rose slowly to his feet and approached the girl.

"That is my LORD...girl..."

"My lord..." she said.

"Hmmm. You are new here".

"Yes, my lord!"

"Your name?"

"Emma, my lord..."

Emma curtsied. She had beautiful light brown hair and blue eyes. She looked scarcely ten years old! A mite of a girl! Fortis frowned. Emma's feet shifted.

"Is something wrong?" Fortis asked. He moved closer. He TOWERED over her! Sitting down, Fortis hadn't realised QUITE how short she was!

"I...I...no-n-no!" she said quickly! She couldn't help but stare at this attractive, adonesque figure before her... A tall, strapping, young, handsome member of the military elite...Oh her parents would be SO happy if one day, she could marry someone like this!

"Then what are you staring at!?"

"N-no-nothing!" she said quickly! She averted her eyes from his...family-package deal...and raised them just a few inches to ogle at something else...

"You been here long?"

"N-no sir! O-only a...n-nearly t-two weeks, sir!"

Fortis nodded. "Enjoying your work? How has your time been, hmm?"

"Uh...l-long!...Hard!...GOOD!" she stammered! Trying to get the proper words out!

"Long, hard and good, eh? I could do that..."

"MY LORD!" Emma gasped! She'd HEARD stories of...well...lecherous young noblemen...but...wow!

Fortis roared with laughter!

"Reeeelax, girl!" he said, chuckling. "You're a kid! I ain't interested in that! Youse just a couple o' years younger than mah girl Minnie...And I don't touch a hair on her head...'ceptin' when I wanna look after her, 'tis...Why, what's you heard, huh?"

"I...I...well...the girls...t-told me...s-stories...about..."

"Yeah?"

"Y-you...and..."

"Nothin' bad, I hope..."

"Oh no! Oh no my lord! Only that...well...um...you were...um...are...um...'experienced'..."

"I've racked up a few hours..."

"My lord, I am only a child! I am whole and unbroken...I know nothing of..."

Fortis smirked. "Relax! Why're you so TENSE!? I'm not gonna do ANYTHING! Don't forget girl that you are working in the household of a VERY old knightly family...and a knight is sworn to protect innocents and womenfolk...like you..."

Emma blushed! She guessed that WAS true...and she HAD seen how Fortis fought off those intruders earlier! She guessed she was wrong to jump to such assumptions about her new master! He seemed genuinely charming and heroic!

"I don't hold back on the girls of the house", Fortis said. "They'll do what they'll do. But NEVER would I force them to do a thing against their will...for one thing, my sister would never look me straight ever again. I was only joking! You don't have to worry. Now continue with your work".

Emma knelt and resumed building and lighting the fire.

"So why is it you're HERE, anyway?"

"Father is dead. Mother said I should find work. She said the house here was good. With Lady Athena living here, there was a low-level vacancy for a housemaid..."

"Oh I see...The old 'she-gets-promoted, so-let's-all-move-up-a-broom' thing..."

"Uh...yes!"

"Hmm".

Fortis got up just as Emma finished. She turned to leave. Fortis blocked her, pressing a hand against the mantle.

"I want the girls in this house to feel safe and protected", Fortis said in a surprisingly soft voice! "So if you ever got any problems...You come tell Lord Fortis, you understand?"

Emma nodded!

"Good..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Minerva arrived home from her journey into town. She'd gone out to buy cloth for making dresses and clothes with, and some food to eat. She headed upstairs, deposited her purchases in her bedroom and headed down the corridor to find her grandmother and ask about sewing supplies. She was passing the library when something out of the corner of her eye caught her attention! She spun around, caught the doorframe and whipped her head around!

"Fortis!"

Fortis smiled and turned casually around.

"Hah! Hey girl! Just uh, getting better acquainted with the latest addition to our household servantry...and a VERY fine addition too..."

"Fortis Vanderstorm you should be ashamed of yourself!" said Minerva, "You've only just met! This is Emma. Ever since grandmother moved in, we've needed extra help, and Mrs. Tibbs agreed to be nursemaid if she got an extra pair of hands around the house".

"Mrs Tibbs is the Housekeeper. It's her job to keep the house!"

"I know that!"

"It's NOT her job to keep the baby!"

"Well..."

"Are you suggesting that I can't take care of my own kid!?" Fortis rounded on his sister. He TOWERED over her, but Minerva had known her brother long enough not to be intimidated by a show of force!

"You're hardly here! And I bet you wouldn't be, even if there was a war to fight!"

"YOU!..."

"DON'T YOU DARE!" Minerva barked back! "At any rate, Eldonia can't be looking after the child on her own! She has other details to handle at present, or did you forget that, too?"

Fortis seethed! He let out what sounded like a harsh, grudging rumble of resignation. His massive shoulders lowered slightly. Minerva could see that Emma was alarmed by Fortis's sudden temper and show of force!

"Oh away with you!" said Minerva, staring at her brother. "Go and polish your pocketknives or something!..."

Fortis rumbled off. He'd go and split firewood...that was always therapeutic...

"I was so scared, m'lady..." said Emma, shuddering a bit.

"Oh that's just Fortis!" said Minerva, "You mustn't mind him! Really you mustn't! He's no harm really. He's just...well...a man! And they are SO difficult...Especially when they're like him".

"Eh?"

"Well they always think they're right! Showin' off...Now you mustn't be scared or intimidated! Fortis is nothin' but a big kitty! He'll not harm a hair on your head, that I can promise you. And if he does, which isn't likely, you come and tell me and I'll set it right!"

Emma nodded! She was a bit scared, working for a giant like Fortis! But his lordship's younger sister seemed ever so sweet!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
A young man, who was not built, but who looked capable, entered a large tent.

"Your Majesty".

The man bowed.

"Ah, Achilles. What news?"

"Lord Vanderstorm has returned, your Majesty".

"Ah. The capable Lord Vanderstorm...Very good. Send him in".

"Your Majesty".

The man bowed and left the tent. King Leviathan sat in his folding chair. The war had moved swiftly. His armies had trapped the Vladians in a number of passes and canyons and had driven them back and surrounded them. Their retreat had been cut off behind them by merging Mountanian forces, and soon, the armies of strength would crush them utterly, closing in on four sides to grind them into dust!

"Sir".

Leviathan stood up and smiled at the young, powerfully-built warlord.

"My lord. I trust you have enjoyed your short sabbatical?"

"Yes sir".

"Your son, is he a fine young man?"

"He is eager and spirited, my lord. When I return, I will make him a family".

Leviathan frowned. He knew what *that* meant!

"He doesn't yet have a family?"

"Not in the legal sense, your Majesty".

The king smirked. "The eagerness of youth, eh? Remember that you fight for your son and your family, my lord. And remember that a wife is faithful to a husband of whom faith is worth".

"I...uh...what?" Fortis mumbled.

"If you show her love and protection, respect, adoration, security and warmth, if you are an able performer of the necessities of marriage..."

"Uh-huuuuuuh..."

The king chuckled. "...She will desire your touch above all others and will remain close. Remember that men and women together have needs and that if they are jointly satisfied, a marriage will remain".

"Oh, I can satisfy her, don't worry about that..." said Fortis smugly. The king laughed! "Good! Then she's bound to provide you many healthy children! What is the boy's name?"

"Leonardo, my liege".

"Ah, a healthy name. Strong, determined, powerful! A fine name for the son of a Mountanian lord".

"Yes sir. Thank you, sir".

"Now, to business...Tomorrow begins the final push. The Vladians are trapped here...they are as stubborn as they are stupid. If they had any brains at all, they would've retreated long ago, instead of getting themselves jammed and bottle-necked in here..."

The king gestured on his map, to a number of valleys and gullies with high ridges on either side.

"The main force is located here...We are located here in the north, here in the south, and here on either side. I will be leading the main charge up from the south tomorrow. What forces of theirs don't turn to engage us will flee north, as their routes are cut off on the East and West. I want you and your officers and men to see to it that this passage here...is cut off. Ambush them, confront them, attack them, do whatever you have to do. But this is where it ENDS and they will NOT pass out!"

"Sure they'll pass out. Once they see ME!"

The king smirked. "I'm sure they will. But remember. You must not go until I have made my move. We are to hit them, one after the other in close succession for the fullest effect! Once we have laid in on them, the two sides will come down here and here...they will be completely trapped with no escape!"

"Yes sir".

"Very well. To your tent, my lord".

Fortis saluted and left the tent...what a battle this would be...

"How do we KNOW when we need to move in?"

"We'll be up here on this ridge. When we see the King's banner move towards us, we get ready. When the Vladians prepare to turn tail and run, fifers and drummers will alert the ranks. They'll head in and block off the Vladian retreat. We go in to provide back-up and stop the bastards from slipping through the cracks".

"No fucking Vladian's gettin' anywhere near MY crack..."

"Not THAT kind of...Oh forget it...Just remember! Don't move in until they start moving towards us! The moment they start, we charge in! If we go in before then, we'll spoil the element of surprise. It has to be when they think they're home-free, otherwise they'll be expecting something".

"I still don't want some Vladian slipping through my crack..."

"Pontius, they're NOT gonna slip through ANYONE'S crack! But if you don't shut up, my sword's gonna be crammed up yours! Not SHUT UP! Now everyone get into position!"

Fortis groaned. Why was he stuck with the IDIOTS!?

"Sir! Look!"

Fortis shook open his spyglass and jammed it to his eye. The standard-bearer was moving!

"Right! Everyone ready! Get into your positions! You! Over there! You! There! Lancers on the flanks! If any of those cock-jockey Vladians get past I want you to harpoon them like fucking whales! You! Over there, and here! Archers at the back! Volley high as we go in, then move forwards! Let's go!"

"They're moving forwards, sir!" another scout shouted. "Look! I thought you said they'd turn?"

"Oh they'll turn alright! That's the main force there! Just keep watching them! Look! There's the king's archers and lancers! They're opening up with the trebuchets and the catapaults! They're coming! They're coming! Get ready!...Alright MOVE!"

The ground thundered and rumbled and dust rose as hundreds of thousands of men charged down the valley to clash with the Vladians! At the same time, the two flanking armies charged down from the ridges, surrounding the Vladians on all sides!

"Alright!" said Fortis, drawing out his sword and dismounting from his horse. His friend Damascus was nearby. "Let's have some fun, man!"

The two towering knights lumbered into battle. Their heavy, solid armour being too strong for the Vladians to pierce, the two Mountanian warriors harvested their way through a sea of the enemy, slashing and slicing, smashing and carving! Cheap Vladian armour split open like aluminium cans, blood ran everywhere! Fortis harpooned every Vladian he came across, and then hacked them to pieces with his dagger! The ground was soon soggy with sweat, blood and tears! Fortis could feel his blood pumping, his heart pounding, his body sweating! He could even feel and uncomfortable tightness in his groin!...Yeah, warfare tended to do that to him...Suddenly, he felt something hit him in the back! Something cold and sharp! Something warm! He gasped and staggered to his knees! He could feel something in his back! He could feel warmth and heat!

A roar! Fortis gasped as he felt something lift him into the air! The idea that such an action was even possible was beyond Fortis! But it wasn't like it was an easy lift; Fortis could tell that the person was struggling! He gasped and then blacked out...

--- --- --- ---

"Is he alright?"
"I dunno! He conked out once I dragged him off..."
"Did you get it out?"
"Yeah it's out! But that wound's gonna take some time to heal. I cleaned it best I could...but it might take a while..."

Fortis groaned and slowly opened his eyes.

"He's awake!"

"Uugh! Of course I'm fucking awake you pansy bastards..." Fortis groaned.

"Warfare hath mellowed our lordship's temperment..." someone said. Voices laughed!

Fortis gasped and groaned. With frustrating lethargy, faces swam into view before him.

Around him were most of his men. And his friend Damascus, and nearby, the surgeon.

"W-what happened?" Fortis groaned.

"You were speared in the back by a Vladian lance", the surgeon explained. "Fortunately the lance broke before it could be driven in far enough to cause serious damage. I have removed it, staunched the bleeding, cleaned and dressed the wound and stitched it up. There shouldn't be any lasting damage. A young man such as yourself should make a full recovery. But there may be a scar there".

"Scar?"

"About three or four inches long, below your left shoulder...ah! Don't move! I don't want those stitches popping out!"

"A scar..." Fortis said.

"Yes. There's no telling if it'll go away. It may, it may not".

"Cool. I can show it off to the kid when I get home..."

Suddenly, everyone spread apart as a figure entered the treatment tent. King Leviathan stood over the bed.

"My lord", he said. "You have fought valiantly against the enemy to protect your kingdom and its subjects. It is my honour to present you with this reward".

The king handed Fortis something in a smart wooden box. Fortis opened it. Inside was a red and yellow silk ribbon. At the top was a handsome gold mounting with two crossed, gold swords and a strong clasp-pin. Hanging off the bottom of the medal was another gold mounting, set with a huge red ruby and smaller diamonds around the outside.

"I present you with the King's Order of Valor, for services rendered in battle despite personal injury..."

The king indicated the blood-red ruby in the middle, and the pure, sparkling diamonds around the outside. Fortis seemed a bit overwhelmed!

"YEAH!" someone shouted at the back of the crowd. Everyone laughed and clapped loudly!

"Th-thank you your majesty..." said Fortis.

"You have been rather out of it", said the King.

"Huh?"

"You've been unconscious for six hours!" said Damascus. "I don't think you remember much. You were groaning so much when the surgeon was digging that spear-point out of your shoulder, he gave you a sleeping draft to knock you out!"

"S-spear-point?" Fortis slurred. The surgeon held up a steel spear-point. The point had been cleaned, polished, and there was a chain threaded through the holes in the shaft which were supposed to attach to the spear-shaft.

"A little souvenier", said the surgeon, draping it over Fortis's mighty shoulders. Fortis picked up the spear-point with his right hand. "Heh...cool!" he said.

"Now everyone out!" said the surgeon, "He needs to rest!...Here, my lord, drink this..."

Fortis gulped down another sleeping draft and was soon in a land of clouds and blue skies...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Emily blushed as the really hot mountain lord left his private ward for the last time. The young army nurse was going to miss the hot and hunky young aristocrat...his wicked smiles, his cheeky grins, his "come hither" eyes, and the out-and-out lies that Emily and all the other young nurses had told his lordship, that it was hospital "policy" that as an Incapable invalid, they had to give him private sponge-baths every day...they didn't,of course,but how else were they to grope and grab at his fantastic body? Fortis had guessed their ruse after the third bath...in a day!...but he played along, pretending to protest and complain, when really, it was a lot of fun!...Clean fun, though...switch a wife and child at home, Fortis wasn't about to get another girl pregnant! He probably didn't look like it, but he did have...some principles!

Fortis packed his bags and mounted his horse. When he was assured that his faithful squire, Koviac wuild be following him, he started off away from the base hospital and on his journey home.

"The baby must look a lot like you my lord!" Koviac said.

Fortis nodded. "Of course he does. And I want to try and bring him home something special from the war," Fortis said.

"A sword would make an excellent gift, my lord!"

"That'll be for when he's older, not now," Fortis said.

The two riders, master and student, had been on horseback for serval hours now, and truth be told, Koviac had only started talking to his mast out of sheer boredom. Although fortis was chatty and jovial enough with family and close friends, Koviac always trod a fine line with Fortis between being considered his friend and just being his squire.

Koviac was just about to suggest another potential gift for the newborn mountain lord when Fortis's attention was captured by huge amounts of smoke pouring from a distant mountain-range...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"His young lordship would love anything that his father brought home for him, I'm sure, my lord", Koviac said. "His lordship would make a fine father!"

"And how do you arrive at that conclusion?" Fortis asked.

"Well, his lordship is naturally of the protective sort. He defends the weak and enfeebled, he is generous and kind, he is friendly, he has a loving disposition, he knows a great deal about..."

But Koviac never got a chance to expound on Fortis's vast stores of knowledge! Because at that precise moment, Fortis had disappeared! The young squire stared around and saw his master's broad shoulders vanishing off across a field. In the far distance, Koviac could see a large mountain range. Smoke curled and wafted up from between some of the peaks.

It was the intense volcanic activity around Mountania that gave it the precious metals, stones, and vast mountain-ranges for which the northern kingdom was famous for. And right now, Fortis was charging off towards one of these massive volcanoes as fast as his horse could take him! Koviac knew better than to try and stop his master, and instead, charged off after him to see if he could help!

The mountain looked just like Fortis. Towering, hulking, dangerous, alluring, mysterious, attractive and begging for someone to climb into its embrace. And Fortis was too much of a daredevil to resist. He'd heard stories about Mountanian volcanoes and the treasures that were supposed to lie within their fiery cores, treasures that only the bravest and most daring of Mountain men, and sometimes, spunky Mountain women, would be able to retrieve.

Once they'd reached the top of the volcano, Fortis had stripped to his undershorts! The heat was intense! Steam and smoke wafted up in thick, heavy clouds, and far below, a semi-solid crust of cooled magma opened crevices where lava bubbled out.

"I always wanted to see one of these!" Fortis shouted over the sound of the volcano. "Father never allowed me to come! Man is this COOL or WHAT?"

Koviac didn't care! He was too scared! Fortis scanned the volcano, shaking his head in awe and grinning like a schoolboy. This was AWESOME!

As Fortis kept staring, he spotted something in the mouth of the volcano, perched on a ledge near the bottom of the crater. From this distance, it looked quite small, but was in fact about the size of a large watermelon, and roughly the same shape. It was also a bright, glittery golden colour. Fortis recognised it at once for what it was.

Koviac saw his master's body tense. Something had obviously caught his attention.

"Boy gimme the rope!" Fortis said. Koviac shrugged several yards of rope from his shoulders and handed it to Fortis, who tied it to several more yards of rope coiled around his own upper body. Creating a noose-knot at one end, Fortis looped the rope around a suitable wedge of rock at the mouth of the volcano and tied the other end of the rope around his waist.

"My lord!" said Koviac, when he realised the object of Fortis's mission, "Are you entirely sure this is safe?"

"You stay here!" Fortis yelled back, "You keep an eye on that rope!" he ordered. Fortis pulled something out of his pocket and handed it to Koviac. It was his whistle that he carried on him, just in case of emergencies.

"If anything happens, you blow this to get my attention, okay?" he shouted. Fortis had to shout because of the constant rumbling noises. Koviac nodded. He wasn't happy about this, but he knew he would not possibly be able to stop a giant like his master!

The rope gripped in his powerful hands, Fortis began to abseil from ledge to ledge, down and down into the volcano, wearing only his shorts, his sandals and a large leather satchel-bag, slung around his shoulders. Koviac watched from above as Fortis leapt from rock to rock, pausing every now and then to prepare for the next jump, or to gather stuff from the inside of the volcano.

It was a long way down. By the time Fortis had reached the large golden thing, it had been nearly half an hour! Fortis wrapped the thing in a blanket taken from his bag and stuffed it inside. Then, he began the painstaking task of hauling himself out of the volcano. Steam rushed up, covering Fortis's body! When it had disappeared, Fortis appeared hot, wet and shiny, as if he'd just left a sauna! Repeated blasts of steam covered his body as he headed back up. By the time he'd reached the top again, Fortis was soaking wet from all the moisture! He looked like he'd just stepped out of a bathtub!

"I think I forgot my soap!" he shouted. Koviac laughed, and helped his master back onto the safety of the ledge. Fortis unwrapped the rope from around his waist and Koviac gathered it up.

--- --- --- ---

"What is it that you have there, my lord?" Koviac asked as they headed back down the mountain a few minutes later. Fortis opened the bag and peeled back the blanket.

"It's a...DON'T TOUCH IT! It's extremely hot!...This, young Kovi, is a very rare object, the egg of Draconis Felix".

"Egg of what?"

"The Mountanian Luck Dragon. Whoever so finds an egg and rears the dragon from young will be granted good luck", Fortis explained.

"Ooooh...How?"

"I...dunno, actually!" said Fortis, laughing, "These eggs are VERY hard to find! As you can probably see".

Koviac nodded. If they were housed in active volcanoes, no wonder they were rare!

"Granny used to tell me about these when I was a kid. She'll know what it is. We'll show her when we get home!" Fortis said.

Minerva yawned and crawled into bed. She snuggled against her hot water bottle and blew out the candles on her bedside table. She curled up and snuggled her bolster, wriggling around until she could get into a comfortable position.

Creak!

Minerva ignored the sound and closed her eyes.

Crreeaak!!

Minerva opened her eyes. It was of course, pitch black inside her room. She listened.

Crrrrreeeaaaakkk!!

"H-h-hello!?" she hissed, nervously.

CRUNK!!

Minerva shrieked as her whole bed vibrated! Suddenly, she felt something wrap itself around her in a CRUSHING embrace! She felt a hand press over her face to stop her screaming! She struggled and fought, but her captor was FAR too strong!

"Shhhh! Shhh-shhh-shhh..." a voice whispered. Minerva let out a muffled "MMMMM!!!"

Her eyes widened! A hand was touching her in somevery special places! Then she felt hot breath on her face and a rough kiss on her cheek and an even tighter, bone-crushing embrace! And then, a deep, heavy bass chuckle.

"Hey girl".

WHACK!

Huurrrkk!!

Minerva felt her captor let out a very unmanly whimper as she attacked HIS special area!

"THAT is for SCARING me!" she hissed. Then, she rolled over and hugged him and gave him a kiss on the cheek.

"And that's for coming home..." she whispered.

Fortis chuckled. "H-h-Hey girl..." he gasped. "Wow...You got strong huh..."

Minerva blushed. "You want me to kiss the boo-boo better?"

"Ye-...NO!! No! It's fine, it...it don't hurt so bad..."

"Liar..." Minerva muttered. Fortis laughed and hugged his baby sister and gave her a kiss. Minerva rolled away and lit some candles. She smiled at him in the firelight. He was so charming. Then, Minerva noticed something around her brother's chest. It looked like a...

"Fortis what IS that!?"

"Huh? Oh this? Just a Vladian spearpoint. The surgeon dug it out of my back about a month ago. Little war souvenier".

"YOUR BACK??"

Fortis rolled over and Minerva noticed the scar below her brother's left shoulder-blade!

"Oh dear!"

"I'm alright! Relax...Besides, I reckon Eldonia'd get a kick out of it".

"Oh? What kind of kick?"

"You know, her big brave defender, her hunky hubby and his fantatsic war-wound..."

"Oh Fortis STOP!...Actually, she MIGHT like that..."

Fortis was about to say what else Eldonia might like, when Minerva's bedroom door opened!

"Minnie! Can I borrow your...FORTY!"

Eldonia raced into the room and jumped onto Minerva's bed and hugged him. Fortis chuckled and squeezed her back.

"Hey girl!" he said. "Muah! Love yah! I got presents back for all of you!"

"Presents!?" said Minerva. "Eldonia did you HEAR that!? He's back all this time and he doesn't give us presents!"

Eldonia pretended to look EXTREMELY offended! She slapped him on the back in mock-scolding!

"Naughty Forty!" she teased, and the two girls giggled. Fortis chuckled. He opened his sack and reached inside.

"These are for you both", said Fortis. he handed the girls something wrapped in cloth pouches.

Eldonia looked at them and frowned.

"...Pebbles?" she asked.

"Pe...PEBBLES!? These are PUMICE, GIRL!" Fortis barked. "I thought you'd like them!"

"W-what're they for?"

"You use them in the bath!" said Minerva, giggling, "They're for exfoliating your skin and keeping it soft and smooth! I use them all the time!" she said.

"Ooooh!"

"Yeah, NOW she likes them..." Fortis grumbled. Eldonia blushed.

"And this is something special for granny", Fortis said. He picked up the wooden box with the handsome ruby and diamond gold medal of valour inside. The two girls squealed!

"Oh she'll be so PROUD of you!" said Minerva. "Ooooh!" she added, hugging her brother. She snatched the medal out of the box and held it over the candlelight. "Oh it's so sparkly!" she cooed, "Eldonia isn't it pretty?"

"Oh it is!" said Eldonia,"Forty, you should pin it to your tunic...at-our-wedding..." she added, punching out the last three words.

"Oh! Uh...I...I will..." said Fortis, blushing...

"Minerva, is everything alright?"

Minerva gasped! They'd woken grandma!

"Uh, everything's fine, granny!" she called back. Eldonia giggled!

"What was that? Is there someone in there with you?" the old woman asked. Before Minerva could reply, her bedroom door swung open!

"Hey Grammy," Fortis said, with a cocky grin on his face. Lady Athena's eyes widened, but then she let out a knowing smile.

"Hello, Fortis", she said.

Fortis frowned.

"Is that it? I thought you'd be surprised to see me?"

"I have walked in on my darling oldest grandson surrounded by a pair of darling, beautiful women! " Lady Athena paused, "and about that I should be surprised?"

"Well..." Fortis began.

Lady Athena smiled.

"Of course I'm happy to see you!" she added, feeling bad for hurting his feelings, "now give granny a hug!"

A HUG!? Fortis groaned, rose from the bed and lumbered over to give her a kiss.

"Awww, granny's little darling!"

Fortis looked mortified to be called as such! Minerva and Eldonia giggled and rolled around on the bed laughing!

"Grandma," Fortis said, "can you help me with something?"

Lady Athena frowned. "Help, darling? Help with what?"

Fortis heaved up his leather satchel...and took his time about it when, out of the corner of his eye, he saw Eldonia drooling over his huge biceps...and carried it over to his grandmother. He lowered it down and opened it. He reached in and lifted something large and heavy out of it.

"I found this on my way home and...OUCH!"

The object had been wrapped up in a blanket, but it was so hot that Fortis dropped it out of pain! A large, round, golden object hit the floor with a metallic 'clang!' and rolled towards the chair where Lady Athena was sitting! The loud noise made by the object hitting the stone floor made everyone jump! The girls got out of bed to examine the round, egg-shaped golden orb that sat on the floor between them!

"Oh my!" said Lady Athena.

"It's very pretty!" said Minerva, kneeling down to get a closer look. "um...what is it?"

"I dunno for sure," said Fortis. He turned to their grandmother. "Grandma?" he asked. But Lady Athena seemed to have gone stock still, as if paralyzed by shock!

"Granny?" Minerva asked, "What's the matter?"

"Where did you find this?" the old woman asked, in barely a whisper. Fortis related the bare bones of his adventure to the family matriarch, who said not a word, but merely nodded occasionally.

"So, what do you think, grandma?" Fortis asked.

"Felix draconis," she whispered.

"Who's Felix, granny?" Minerva asked, naively.

"THAT is Felix!" Lady Athena said, with solid conviction, and pointing to the egg, "the Mountanian Luck Dragon!"

Eldonia gasped! She stared at Fortis with a look that Minerva had never seen before!

"Oh darling! Oh my big, brave, wonderful darling! Such a beautiful present for the baby!"

Fortis blushed!!

Baby Leo kicked and fidgeted in his cot. He was having a dream that he was playing with Big Papa. Papa was throwing him in the air, and Leo was kicking around trying to stay uppy-up! But he kept falling, and papa was catching him and tickling him everywhere so he was wriggling around trying to escape!

"Awwww..."

Eldonia watched as Leo fidgeted and wriggled around in bed. "Such an active little darling!" she said. She reached down and stroked her baby, gently trying to lift his writhing body out of the crib. Leo jerked awake when he felt someone touching him! Who was touching him!? No! No! Go away! He wanted to go back to playing with dream-papa! He burst into tears!

But then he saw REAL papa!

"Hahaha! Hey little fellah!"

Leo wriggled in momma's arms! He wanted papa! He wanted Papa! HE WANTED PAPA!!!!

"Oh Ellie! Give him to me!" said Minerva, "there now! Aunty Minnie's here...Ooh! Leo STOP wriggling around! And STOP crying!"

But Leo would NOT stop wriggling! He wanted PAPA!! Why didn't these silly people understand!? He cried louder, trying to get them to realise what he wanted!

"Silly GIRL!!" said Lady Athena, "Come to grannydarlings, my little fighter!"

NO! NO! NO! Leo didn't WANT granny! Leo wanted POPPY! He wanted POPPY! By now, he was SCREAMING! His forehead was firing up from the fever he was giving himself!

"Oh jeez!" said Fortis, "Granny give him to ME!...C'mere fellah! Now you STOP crying!"

Leo hiccupped...and fell silent. He snuffled, snuggled and curled up in papa's arms...

"Yeah...now...when he's quiet..." said Eldonia.

"No! I meant Fortis holding the baby!"

The girls laughed. Fortis smiled and bounced the baby in his arms. He dumped him into his crib and Leo crawled to the bars. He peeked through and saw a large, golden ball on the ground. His mouth opened in shock as he saw this fantastical object! He rattled the bars excitedly!

"What is it, sonny?" Fortis asked. Leo pointed at the big ball! He wanted to play with it!

"Oooh no! That's not for you to touch, buddy!" said Fortis, "This is a very SPECIAL toy..."

Fortis carried a brazier over and popped it next to the cot. He loaded the brazier with wood, paper and charcoal and lit the mixture with a candle. Once it was burning and hot, he lowered the egg on top. The fire would incubate the egg until it was ready to hatch. Leo sat there intently watching this strange display. Why was papa burning the golden bouncy-ball? Leo wanted to play with it!

"We'll leave this here to heat up", Fortis said. "Better let this fellah get back to bed..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis lay in bed. By rights, as the new Earl, he was supposed to sleep in the master's bedroom at the end of the corridor. It was much larger, better furnished, and was more comfortable, but Fortis didn't want to move in there...just yet. Sooner or later, Leonardo would take his father's current room, though, and Eldonia would move into the master bedroom with Fortis...after the wedding...

The wedding...Fortis wondered what it would be like. There were some very old Mountanian wedding traditions, and he'd been to a few weddings in the past, mostly friends of his father's, or grandmother's. But his own wedding was rather daunting! He was just imagining what it would be like, when a muffled wailing wafted in on the air...

Fortis groaned. The baby...He rolled out of bed, stood up, cracked his back, and shuffled sleepily out of the bedroom and down the corridor.

"Alright, alright, I'm COMING!" he groaned. As he shuffled along, his sister, grandmother, and girlfriend all exited their bedrooms. They filed into the nursery, just as Leo stopped crying.

Leo's face was flushed and warm, slightly pink in colour, and his eyes were big and wet. He was leaning against his crib, and staring at something. Fortis turned. The baby was staring at the large brazier holding the golden dragon's egg.

"Somethin' wrong son?" Fortis asked.

Suddenly, there was a rustling sound! Ashes and partially burnt charcoal fell from the brazier into the ash-tray underneath, and the egg rocked and jostled around in the steel fire-basket! Leo wailed and cried!

"He's scared of the egg!" said Eldonia, "Oh Leo, honey-baby! There's nothing to be alarmed about! Oh here, look!" she said. She picked up the baby and carried it over to the basket. Leo leaned over to stare at the brazier and its strange contents. The egg kept rocking and vibrating in the coals! Leo cried and covered his eyes! Suddenly, the egg cracked open!

"Forty! Forty it's hatching!" Minerva cried out, "Oooh Forty look!"

Lady Athena bent over the egg and watched. "Remarkable!" she mused.

All at once, the cracks on the golden eggshell all met up, and the whole thing split open, lengthwise, from top to bottom! They flopped open and something small, red and golden flopped out, sizzling slightly on the coals...

"It's a baby dragon!" said Minerva, "Oh granny it's all reddy and goldeny! Awww it's cute!"

The baby dragon sneezed! A small fireball shot out of its nostrils!

Leo was fascinated by the latest addition to his tiny domain! It was a baby lizard!...He wanted to play with the baby lizard!!

The luck dragon unfurled itself and stared around, its big eyes flitting from side to side as it took in its surroundings. It flapped tiny, underdeveloped wings and scittered across the flaming hot coals...

"It's rather..small..." said Eldonia. The dragon was about the size of the baby she held in her arms! Perhaps even smaller!

"It'll grow!" said Athena. "It'll grow a lot! Aah! Look to the baby, child! Before it burns itself!"

Eldonia tightened her grip on Leo! He seemed ready to fall out of his mother's arms to examine this new creature! The dragon, too, seemed to be examining Leo. The dragon scittered up onto the rim of the brazier...then with a weak spring, it bounded onto Eldonia's arms! Eldonia screamed!

"Shhhh!!" Lady Athena said, "Not so loud, my dear! And you needn't be scared! He's not interested in YOU!...watch!"

As if she was cradling an incredibly poisonous spider, Eldonia barely dared to breathe! Instead, everyone watched what would happen...

The dragon crawled up Eldonia's arm and then wrapped itself around Leo's body! Leo giggled and snuggled the dragon. The dragon breathed fire on him! Eldonia reacted in shock!

"It's alright!" said Lady Athena, "They do that.They breathe fire on the baby to keep it warm and safe from the cold. Here, let me!"

Lady Athena scooped up her great-grandson and smiled.

"Hello Leo! Granny Athena's going to put you to bed now...In you go!...And in goes your new petty-pet!"

Everyone watched. Granny tucked Leo in, Leo curled up and laid down on his pillow. The dragon curled up on the blanket and shut its eyes.

"They'll be inseparable!" Lady Athena declared.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"My lord".
"Madam".

Lord vonGevalt was a tall, pale, muscular figure. He had not the impressive, bulky build of some Mountanians, but his demeanor was solid and strict. He had a mane of silver hair and a neatly trimmed beard and mustache. His face was fixed in a permanent frown. He was once tall, but age had withered his growth, and he was now only about 7'3". He was in his fifties, but he looked much older. The product of a rough life. A long scar ran down one side of his face.

"I know how very much this must be an inconvenience for you..."

"Never mind..."

"Your wife is not here?"

"Lady vonGevalt found herself unable to attend".

"Of course...I quite understand".

"You will explain to me, please, what I am doing here".

"W-well it's quite simple, really. My grandson and your daughter are to begin their wedding-arrangements".

Lord vonGevalt grunted.

"And where are they?"

"Oh, upstairs!"

"Show me".

Lady Athena led the aging nobleman upstairs. She stopped outside a door and opened it a crack. Inside, the lord could see clearly the person who had enjoyed the most intimate attentions of his young and inexperienced daughter. He grunted.

"He at least seems a capable young man", the old lord rumbled. "He's how old?"

"Nearly twenty-one".

The lord raised his eyebrow.

"He's um...He's...developed...for twenty one..."

"So everyone tells me. Of exceptional strength, size, intelligence..."

"And virility, it would seem".

"Uh...yes!"

"And where is this cause of their union?"

"Eh..."

"The child!"

"Oh! Yes of course!"

Fortis and Eldonia had been so busy with their own problems that they barely heard their parents. Lady Athena led Lord vonGevalt down the corridor to the nursery. Inside, Leo was playing with his luck-dragon, giggling at the pretty fireballs that kept spurting from his pet lizard's mouth!

"Hmm!" said Lord vonGevalt, for the first time, registering something more than a modicum of approval, "A luck dragon for the baby...Very hard to find..."

"Oh yes!"

"...A capable lad, your grandson...Very capable...Very difficult to find..."

Lord vonGevalt rounded on the baby, who now realised that there was a stranger in his chamber! He sniffled and fidgeted, and seemed to hide behind his reptilian protector!

"Now my lad..." said Lord vonGevalt, "What is your name, hmm?"

"His name is Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm", Athena said, proudly. Lord vonGevalt nodded. "A nice and solid sounding name", he said approvingly. "And you know who I am, my lad? Hmm?"

Leo turned away! He didn't like this new person! He wanted granny! Why wasn't granny stopping this horrible man!?

Leo felt himself hoisted into the air! He wasn't having ANY of this! He made a face, fidgeted and...

"Shhhhh!!" the old lord mumbled, "Shhh...It's alright..." he cooed, stroking the sobbing, wailing baby! "Grandpappy's here...It's alright..."

No it wasn't! Leo's sobbing and sniffling escalated into outright crying! The nursery doors swung open as Leo's concerned parents burst in!

"Hey gran'ma, what's going...on..." Fortis said, stopping short when he saw Lord vonGevalt. He paused, stood tall, and then bowed.

"My lord", he said.

"So this is the fruit of YOUR loins, is it?" Lord vonGevalt asked. The sight of pappy and Mammy had calmed Leo down now, and he nestled securely in this new stranger's arms, staring at everyone with wide, wet, blue eyes...and sucking his thumb.

"Um...Yeah!" said Fortis, a bit uncertainly.

"And WHAT loins..." Eldonia teased. She moved up to her father who held onto the baby with one arm and hugged her with the other. "Papa! Papa please don't be angry!...You always said I should marry someone well-hung..."

"I said well-OFF!"

"...Oh!...Well he's that too!...And just as much as the first...Oh papa don't be angry please! Forty's a lovely boy! He's ever so sweet and thoughtful. Look! He brought home a live dragon for the baby! And he's big and he's strong and he's SOOOO cute!...and that's just the dragon! I haven't started to talk to you about my Forty yet..."

Fortis watched as Eldonia steadily buttered up her aging father. Boy she knew how to work him! She was practically wrapping her ass around him, doing the big, butterfly-eyes, the sweet smile, the gentle, daughterly hugs...

Lord vonGevalt cleared his throat loudly!

"Harrehmmm!..ahem...Be there as it may...um...darling...This is a SERIOUS issue!"

"Oh of COURSE papa!" said Eldonia, sweetly, "And Forty and I ARE gonna get married! And we ARE gonna be wed! And we ARE gonna be a good momma and poppa to baby Leo!...and maybe a few other babies..."

Eldonia gave her future husband a hungry look that her father wasn't able to see...

"I am in no position to grant you my permission for this union", Lord vonGevalt said gruffly. "But...I give you both my blessing. For a happy, prosperous, loving and affectionate marriage, strong, healthy and plentiful children, and a bright future together".

"THANK YOU PAPA!!!"

Lord vonGevalt felt the wind knocked out of him as his daughter locked her arms...and legs!...around him, squeezing him like a snake!

"My lady!" Lord vonGevalt, gasped, "I...I think we h-have a w-wedding to plan! Eldonia NOT so tight, my dear! I'm not as young as I was..."
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: With the war over, Fortis and Eldonia must face...

choices: The next evening, Fortis & Eldonia have their separate pre-wedding celebrations
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Dude! Dude, dude, dude...We could have them fighting in strawberry gelatin!"

"Cannius!"

The two teenage knights jumped! They'd just returned from finishing their advanced training and were in Cannius's bedroom talking about the fact that their oldest brother got laid...and paid...when their grandmother walked in!

"You two are SUPPOSED to be helping Fortis with the wedding!"

"We are!" Jupiter said, "We're thinking about ideas for the Bucks Party!"

"In MY day, we didn't ask young men about to be married, to wrestle around in coagulated pig's fat..."

"We were talking about the girls and the Hen's Night, actually..."

"In MY day, young ladies about to be married did NOT roll around on the floor covered in a cold desserts!"

"...Oh".

"...We used honey instead..."

"HONEY! Ooooooh man...Jupiter!! Write that down...honey...honey..."

Lady Athena tried to look cross and serious, but she let out a slow smile. She well-remembered her own wedding, all those years ago, to a man who sadly was no longer alive, who had made her life a whirling sensation...Aaah youth...

"And we gotta have a fire-breather!"
"Ooooh yeah! Fire-breather..."

"Girls are NOT going to appreciate THAT at a Hen's Night!" Athena called as she left the room.

"What GIRLS? We're talking about the Buck's Party, gran'ma! Get with it!" Jupiter called after her. He sighed.

Cannius wrote "Fire...Breather..." on a pair of growing lists on the table next to his bed. One for the Buck's Party, the other for the Hen's Night. Not ever having hosted one before, Minerva wasn't quite sure what to do! She had suggested something a little naughty and had considered hiring a stripper...Until Eldonia reminded her that Fortis was all the stripping she was ever gonna need!...and more!

In his bedroom, Fortis was more worried about the ceremony rather than fire-breathers or unclad maidens drenched in honey... He stood in front of the mirror, mumbling over his vows. He would of course be guided through them on the day, but still...

"With my sword I will protect, with my hands I will hold, with my body I will love, and with all mine worldly goods I thee endow...and then I...um...um...I...do the ring-thing...and uh...the aisle...uuh..."

"Forty?"

Fortis JUMPED!

You wouldn't think a 10ft Mountain giant like Fortis was easily startled or surprised by anything, but he jumped!

"Hammers and anvils! What the...Oh!...Oh sheeeeesh! Don't you DO THAT!"

Minerva tiptoed into her oldest brother's bedroom and smiled up at him. She whirled around on the spot.

"What do you think?"

Minerva was decked out in a dazzling white silk gown splashed with sky blue ribbons and trailers, and a beautiful pair of white shoes with silver buckles, polished so intensely that they nearly blinded Fortis when he looked at them!

"Harrumph...um...You look...um...cute!"

"CUTE????"

"Um...purdy?"

Minerva frowned!

"...Sweet?"

"Elegant!"

"Oh yeah!...Um...that too!"

Minerva tittered forwards, hopped up on tiptoe and gave her brother a kiss...which he had to bend down to receive. As she peered behind him, she saw something.

"Is THIS what you're wearing?" the little sister asked. Fortis turned to see. She was staring at his gleaming ceremonial body-armour and sword. Fortis nodded.

"You like?"

"Where's your medal of valor, my lord?" Minerva teased, "Best put that around your chest!" she said, caressing the well-developed body-area with a teasing hand. Fortis turned RED.

"Um...y-y'think I should?"

"Of course! Eldonia will LOVE it!"

Fortis sighed and lifted the acolade out of its box and slung it over his head...it WAS pretty dashing...

choices: The next morning, a very hung-over bride & groom prepare for the big day....
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
In the end, most of Cannius and Jupiter's ideas were shelved...by their grandmother! Lady Athena wasn't going to have any more shame brought upon the noble and ancient House of Vanderstorm. She wafted between room to room. The girls were to stay inside, and the boys were to stay outside. She surveyed the scene of the Bucks Party from the balcony of the Master Bedroom. Flaming torches lit the yard, and a huge fire-pit served as a roasting-center for sausages, steaks, and huge, bloated hog-carcasses, a gift supplied by some far-off Fatlantean friends.

No doubt, the boys were all drinking and telling lewd, rude, crude jokes, and probably eating just as much as they were drinking, but at least the gathering looked civilised. Or as civilised as a gathering of young, horny mountain men could be...

Downstairs, Eldonia and her friends drank and ate, and chatted and gossiped about the boys. Who was still available, what was good about him, why he was worth even considering, and what did everyone think of her prize catch?

Minerva wandered between the two parties, making appearances among the men and women, usually assisting guests or serving food or drinks, as their mutual host. She headed out into the garden, where the scents of beer, sweat, smoke and roasting meat hit her heavily in the face.

"Hey GIRL!" Fortis bellowed, "C'mere!"

Minerva trotted over. She smiled meekly and curtsied.

"Wow, you trained her good, Forty..." said one of the other boys.

Fortis whirled around!

"You said WHAT?" he snarled. "This is my SISTER! I ain't trainin' her to do squat! You be talkin' 'bout her like she some sorta clod-hopping pot-scraper again I'll break your NECK!"

Fortis's friend, Damascus, got shakily to his feet.

"Hey...hey guys...We's all a bit pissed...Um...Tyson...I...think you oughta perhaps STOP altogether before you fall into that rose bush again..."

The air was punctuated by loud bouts of laughter!

"...So...so let's not try and um...say stuff or whatever that's gonna like...screw up...stuff..." he finished, flopping back down into his chair, missing his aim and falling ass over heels on the grass with his folding chair collapsing on top of him!

"Th...th...this...this here's...Girl..." Fortis said drunkenly, to a new group of friends, "Sh...she...She's m...m-my sis...sister and um...yeah she...um...she so sweeeeeheheheheheeeeeet!"

Fortis lifted his sister into the air and gave her a drunken kiss! Minerva was REPULSED! She loved all three of her brothers...but not when they were in drink!

"G'awn!" Fortis slurred. He dropped her roughly to the ground and slapped her on the behind! "Go hang with the girls, girl..." he said.

Minerva sighed. She couldn't wait for the wedding...
