1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Does this look right?"

"It's beautiful!"

"I think it's crooked..."

"It's fine! Don't worry! It's beautiful, isn't it granny?"

"Like a virgin!...kinda..."

Eldonia blushed. She was trying to get her veil on correctly. The stupid thing kept shifting. Eventually, she held it in place with a couple of decorative hat-pins and smiled at the results. She had a thin, white, silk wedding-gown, and her hair was brushed up into a bun, and braided at the back.

"Very pretty, my dear!" said Lady Athena. She helped her future granddaughter-in-law adjust her gown while Minerva left the room and tiptoed down the corridor. She peeked in on her two brothers, who were busy getting into their dress-armour for the occasion. She slipped open a bedroom door and snaked inside.

Standing in front of a mirror in all of his military glory, the Earl of Castle Vanderstorm was busy checking himself out. His gleaming steel and brass ceremonial armour sparkled and gleamed in the sunlight from his window. He had his ceremonial sword strapped to his waist, his medal around his chest, and his helmet under one arm.

"Do I look good?" he asked.

Minerva sidled up to her brother and smiled. "Wonderful!"

"Do I look um...nice?"

"Very gallant and noble!"

"I meant SEXY!"

Minerva burst out laughing! "Fortis, DO stop thinking about your little sword! At least until AFTER the wedding!"

"Ain't nothin' little about it, girl! So, do I look good?"

"Like a knight should!"

"Damn right!"

Fortis whipped back his long dark blond hair and smirked at the mirror. He exited the room. Minerva rushed downstairs to see the guests.

In the dining-hall of the castle, were the assembled guests. Standing outside, was Lord vonGevalt. The old, lion-looking nobleman eyed his future daughter-in-law. She was a flighty young thing. She would make a man very happy one day...

Assembled in the dining-hall were friends, family, and visiting nobles.

"Minerva!"

Minerva jumped and spun around.

Before her stood a vision of royal wonderment. The Crown Prince had answered her invitation!

Crown Prince Cassius, first son of King Leviathan, stood in his own dress-armour, in a corner of the room. He was a vision of royal good looks. Minerva stared at him! Had he gotten even...TALLER?? And...wider?? and...Did he put on weight? He was certainly looking considerably more solid and...hunky...than the last time she saw him! She curtsied.

"My lord", she said.

The prince gave a courtly bow and extended a steel-sheathed arm. Minerva curtsied and he kissed her hand.

He was CERTAINLY getting bigger! Those hands weren't that size the last time she touched them! And judging from the size of the codpiece, other things were growing, as well!!

WHAM! WHAM! WHAM!!!

Everyone jumped as the M.C., Fortis's friend, Damascus, slammed his rod against the floor.

"His Lordship, Fortis, Earl Vanderstorm. Lady Eldonia vonGevalt and her father, Lord vonGevalt..."

Everyone stood up. Up in the minstrel's gallery, music started playing...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The next morning, a very hung-over bride & groo...

choices: Time to cut the cake! Fortis unsheaths his huge, ceremonial sword...
Uh-Oh! Baby Leo got to the cake first and is eating it already!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
An extremely old wizard stood at the dais at the end of the dining-hall. Old Draxon was over a hundred years old, with white hair streaked with grey.

"My lords, ladies and gentlemen", he said, with a voice with surprising clarity for one of his age, "We are gathered here today to witness the union of these two people, who have agreed to live together, in the covenant of marriage, which is an honourable and noble institution".

People clapped.

"The groom..."

Fortis strolled down the aisle, his armour clanking softly. He stood by the altar.

"And the bride".

A flourish! The doors opened and Eldonia glided in, accompanied by her father, Lord vonGevalt. Everyone rose to their feet. Lord vonGevalt stopped at the front row of chairs, and Eldonia finished the last few steps to the dais herself.

"Very good", Draxon said. "My Lord Fortis. Fortis Vanderstorm. Do you take this woman to be your lawfully wedded wife?"

"I do".

"Will you forever guard and protect her? Her body, her spirit, and her worldly honour?"

"I will".

"Will you forever love her, defend her, and provide for her needs?"

"I will".

"And will you swear before these assembled peoples, that she shall, forever be, the sole recipient of your favours and affections?"

"Uhhhh..."

Giggles and laughter rippled throughout the hall. Lord vonGevalt silenced them with a frozen glare.

"Aaahrehm...yeah!" said Fortis.

Draxon turned to Eldonia.

"Lady Eldonia Elizabeth vonGevalt. Do you take this man to be your lawfully wedded husband?"

"I do".

"Will you forever love and cherish him? Share with only him, your favours, affections and deepest desires?"

"Oooooh yeah...I...I mean yes!...I mean I will!"

The crowd laughed.

"Will you honour and obey him as your husband, for as long as you both shall live?"

Eldonia nodded. "I will".

"And do you swear to do your womanly duty, and sire him healthy children, to the best of your ability?"

"I do".

Draxon cleared his throat. He stepped aside. People could now see that he was actually standing in front of a cradle that was sitting on the table behind him. Curled up inside it, was baby Leonardo!

"And do you both accept this child as being natural and the fruit of your loins? Will you hold him in legitimacy and honour this child, and forever raise and care for it as your own?"

Fortis gulped and Eldonia went a bit red...

"We do..."

"You may kiss the bride!"

Eldonia screamed and people cheered as Fortis literally swept her off her feet into his arms!

"Well hello there Lady Vanderstorm..." he teased. Eldonia burst out laughing and the two of them embraced.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The ceremony begins...

choices: Fortis and Eldonia enjoy their first night together in the marriage bed...
After the party, baby Leonardo has gone missing! Eldonia starts to panic!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
People threw flowers and coins at the bride and groom as they headed down the aisle. Flowers to symbolise delicacy, beauty and life, coins to represent industry, strength, wealth and prosperity. The pennies clattered onto the floor and everyone cheered! Fortis led his new bride away from the dining-hall into the huge gardens outside. Here, benches, tables, chairs and huge marquees had been set up.

"Guard of Honour for the new Lord...and Lady...Vanderstorm!" Damascus shouted out. All of Fortis's friends withdrew their swords and held them over their heads, forming a tunnel of steel that the young earl and his bride walked under.

"Three cheers!"

"Hip-hip!...Huzzah!...Huzzah!!...Huzzah!!!"

The bride and groom entered the central marquee and people filed in after them. Sitting on a low table was a towering, five-tier wedding cake! It was encased in white frosting and on the top, were two little models. A knight in shining armour, his sword between his legs, and a bride dressed in her glimmering white wedding-dress.

Once everyone had gathered, old Draxon smiled.

"Let us gather, friends and family, to witness the cutting of the cake!"

Everyone clapped and gathered around.

Fortis stared at the table where the cake was standing in presentation. He frowned.

"Uh...there's um...there's no knife..." he said.

"Silly boy!" Eldonia scolded! "Of course there's no KNIFE!" she said, "THIS is all the knife WE need!"

She wrapped her arms delicately around her husband's waist, and tugged playfully at the ceremonial sword strapped to his side.

"Oh!" said Fortis, blushing. "Right! Okay...um..."

Everyone gasped and a few people stepped back as Fortis drew out his enormous ceremonial sword. It was a fearsome blade, nearly five feet long and razor sharp! Fortis whirled it impressively over his head and the crowd "Ooohed!" and "Aaaahed" at the display. Fortis brought the sword whistling down, stopping an inch from the cake. He looked at his bride and Eldonia grabbed the handle of the sword.

Fortis gave the briefest of nods and together, they thrust the blade in, and down, making the first cut! The crowd cheered!

Fortis then withdrew the sword and, holding the blade to Eldonia's mouth, he waited as she nibbled off some of the cake-residue. Fortis then inserted the blade down his throat, closed his mouth, and slowly drew the sword out again, licking the whole thing clean!

"He sure is a show-off, huh?"
"My lord!"

Minerva stared at Cassius. "Well...Yes...!" she said, blushing. She snuggled up against her Prince Charming, watching as the rest of the cake was sliced and then slowly dished out. It was a traditional Mountanian fruitcake. Heavy, stodgy food, that was drenched in pints of brandy for a week before the wedding. It was incredibly sweet and was floating in alcohol.

"Oh my!" said Lady Athena, as Fortis handed his grandmother a quite considerable chunk of cake!

"Fortis! I can't possibly take the whole thing!!"

"That's what she said..."

"FORTIS!"

"Sorry! Sorry...alright, I'll cut it in half..."

Minerva watched as her two other brothers, Cannius and Jupiter, chatted up the bridesmaids. Knowing her brothers, later on in the party, at least two bridesmaids might mysteriously disappear, to re-emerge later, shaken, shivering and with silly, puppy-dog looks on their faces...

Fortis relaxed. He needed to sit down. Lady Athena handed Fortis baby Leonardo.

"Hey baby!" said Fortis, teasing his baby son. Leo sat in papa's lap, watching Fortis wave something in front of him. It was the little model knight from the wedding-cake. Leo reached up for it with his chubby hands! Fortis handed the knight to his son, who stared at it curiously. It was a mini-papa!

Leo sat on Papa's lap. Papa was hard and clankerly! Leo didn't like that! He wriggled off and went to find momma...Momma was soft and snugglesly...

Once the wedding feast had been finished, and the cake had disappeared, along with turkey, goose, venison, several bottles of wine and champagne, and just as much brandy and whiskey, the stuffed, inebriated guests swaggered and staggered indoors for the next part of the grand party.

"Laaaadies and GENTLEMEN!" Damascus shouted, "Please re-enter the dining-hall for the evening's dancing!"

Everyone headed inside. The chairs from earlier had been cleared away to the sides of the room.

"The first dance is for the men only!" Damascus shouted. "Will the groom and all the men in the audience willing to take part, proceed to the center of the hall! Everyone else, take a seat! Our first dance of the evening is the traditional Mountanian Sword Dance..."

"Ooooh!" said Athena, "Oh I remember seeing this at MY wedding! Oh I haven't seen it in YEARS!"

"What is it, granny?" Minerva asked.

"Just watch, darling! Watch and pay attention...Look!"

Somewhere up above, a violin, cello and accordion started playing. The men had paired off in two long rows. In one movement, they'd all withdrawn their swords! They raised them up and struck them together, before breaking off, stepping back, spinning around, and striking swords again, breaking off, spinning, and striking yet again. It was half dance, half choreographed stage-fight. The crowd watched and gasped.

"Oooh it's so elegant!" said Minerva, watching. She hadn't thought her rough, tough, manly brother Fortis, was capable of being so...arty!...She would have to tease him about this later!

"It's not an easy dance", said Athena, "It requires great strength and skill to wield a sword like that without injuring your partner. One wrong move..."

She drew a bony finger over her throat and made a hoarse, choking sound.

Minerva winced!

The music stopped as the men joined up into two lines again, sheathing their swords and bowing to each other. Everyone applauded.

"Next, we ask the bride and groom to dance..."

Fortis and Eldonia stepped onto the dance-floor. Fortis had removed his armour and was dressed just in hose, codpiece, shoes and...no shirt...

Eldonia still wore her glamorous wedding-dress.

Despite their height difference, the bride and groom joined hands. Fortis pulled something out of his trousers and held it in front of Eldonia. A gleaming dagger. He held it in his teeth and the music started. It was a tango. It started off slowly, as they moved around the dance floor, as the music sped up, Fortis became more aggressive. He spun, dipped and whirled Eldonia around with some quite vicious movements! The crowd gasped and sat, riveted to the scene before them.It was so raw and powerful and...quite sexy! As the dance reached its climax, Fortis pulled the knife from his teeth! He threw it at the floor where it hit the floorboards, sticking straight up in the wood! The duo danced the last few bars around it, before ending in a tight embrace, the knife between their feet. Everyone laughed and cheered!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Time to cut the cake! Fortis unsheaths his huge...

choices: Minerva returns to bed. To her surprise, Prince Cassius is waiting for her...
Baby Leo wakes up the next morning and explores the master bedroom!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Whooo!!"

Eldonia screamed as Fortis threw her through the air! She landed with a loud "FWUMPH!!" on the marriage-bed in the master's bedroom! Fortis chuckled, a deep, heavy bass laugh.

He slowly removed his clothes and slumped down in bed next to his beloved. It was late at night now...very late...well past midnight. The guests had all headed to their rooms, or to the village inn, to sleep off the effects of the party.

"So tell me..." said Fortis, holding his bride in his arms, "How does it feel to be married?"

Eldonia started stroking her husband's arms and chest.

"Oh it feels GOOD..." she said, teasing, "It feels hot and heavy and...mmmmmm..."

Fortis smiled and hugged her, pulling playfully on her hair.

There would be no love-making this evening. Perhaps a lot of fondling and stroking, hugging, kissing and touching, but no deeper affections...they needed to rest!

Tap-tap-tap-tap-tap!!!!!

"Huh?" Fortis groaned. "Who...oh come in..."

Minerva entered, carrying baby Leonardo.

"Well!" she said, "The married couple!"

Fortis blushed and Eldonia turned red!

"The young master here wouldn't sleep!" said Minerva.

"Awww..." said Eldonia, reaching out for Leo, "Come here sweetums! Mommy'll make you sleepy..."

Leo snuggled up against momma's chest, his arms wrapped around his fat, squishy plush-cat.

"Hey you be careful with Mortimer, okay son?" Fortis rumbled. "Thanks Min", he said to his sister. Minerva smiled and left the room.

Eldonia snuggled Leo. Leo snuggled his toy. And...

"Whoo!!" Eldonia gasped as she felt Fortis's huge arms wrap tightly around her!

"Hey there..." he said huskily. And kissed her, pulling the covers over all three of them at once.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Fortis and Eldonia enjoy their first night toge...

choices: Fortis takes out his huge battle-sword! Leo is fascinated by it!
Leo crawls into the case and looks at Fortis's suit of armour!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
With Vanderstorm blood pumping through his body, it was unsurprising that little Leo Vanderstorm grew up fast. Even though he was not yet a year old, he was now able to crawl, a feat that pleased his father, thrilled his mother, and which worried his great-grandmother! ("Crawling! Oh gosh he's going to be walking soon, and then I'll never catch him!")

Leo loved this new skill, and used it all the time. Snuggled up in mama's arms, he wriggled out of her grasp...and then tried to wriggle out of the much more formidable grasp of his father! Leo crawled across the bed and off the end, onto the linen chest. Then with a soft 'fwump!' onto the carpeted floor below. Sunlight peeked in through the curtains and filled the room with a soft half-light.

Leo crawled around the room. He sat in front of the wash-stand, the dressing-table, the closets...but then he saw something that really fascinated him! He crawled over to it excitedly! He sat in front of the object and ogled up at it. It was so big and shiny and pretty! Leo wanted to touch it and play with it! He reached out and slapped the object!

His tiny hand hit an invisible forcefield! He stared at it in shock! He kept slapping the strange, invisible barrier! Why couldn't he touch the big shiny thing?!? He sniffled and wrinkled his nose! Then, he started to cry! He wanted to play with the shiny thing and he couldn't! What started off as a sniffle moved onto lip-trembling, and then a soft, high-pitched wailing!

"Huh!?"

Fortis groaned. He was used to being woken up by strange noises. A leftover trait from the battlefield. He groaned, yawned, stretched out his gigantic body and rolled over.

"Whuuuurrgghhh...wh-what...huurgh...ugh..."

Fortis stretched, and felt his bones cracking!

"Ooh..."

He rolled out of bed and stopped!

Sitting in front of a tall, glass display-case was his baby son! Leo turned when he heard movement! Papa was up! Leo crawled to the case and started slapping on the glass panels again! He wanted to touch it! He wanted to touch it!

"Hey, hey, hey!" said Fortis softly, "What're you doin', son? Whatcha lookin' at, huh?" he asked. Fortis tiptoed out of bed and carefully pulled back one of the curtains. Sunlight sparkled into the room and Fortis smiled.

"Ooooh...You like it, huh?" Fortis asked. Leo sat on the floor, pointing at the object in the case!

"You wanna see it?" Fortis asked. He walked over to the case and opened the doors.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Baby Leo wakes up the next morning and explores...

choices: Uncle Jupiter is playing with his baby nephew!
A strange boy with blond hair! Merlin the Boy Wizard!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis pulled out a massive battle-sword! He waved it through the air and Leo giggled and clapped! Fortis lowered the blade to the ground and Leo crawled up to it.

"Ah! No touchy!" said Fortis, "Big knives aren't for little babies...But you can look at it".

Leo did look at it! He started making faces at the swordblade, giggling when he saw his reflection in the steel. Fortis got down on the floor and showed his son the handle. Leo tried to grasp the massive handle with his tiny hands. Fortis let the sword drop to the floor and watched as Leo tried to push it, or lift it, or move it! He couldn't, of course, but it was a great source of amusement to his father that he tried.

Fortis picked up his son and the sword and put the sword back in its case. Leo curled up in his father's arms and sucked on his thumb. Fortis chuckled and stroked the baby. He was so fucking CUTE! He kissed him and carried him out of the room.

Fortis carried the baby back to the nursery and sat him in his crib. The New and Improved, Extra-Cuddly, Super-soft Mortimer the Plush Cat was waiting for the baby in the crib! The baby immediately snatched up the toy and hugged it adorably. Fortis chuckled. Granny had made it for him and it was so cute!

The young nobleman left his son there and headed downstairs. He was so bored! He left the house and headed into the garden.

Fortis had no real interest in gardening, but he liked playing with wood. Chopping wood, slicing wood, carving wood, hammering out stuff and building things...that was what he liked.

Fortis stared at some huge logs of firewood in the back yard. They needed splitting, and Fortis needed a workout. He headed into a storage-shed and came back with a sledgehammer, spikes, and a huge splitting-maul. The sledgehammer and the maul were huge, solid chunks of iron, each one with a weight of 500 pounds. They felt like nothing in the young beast's huge arms, but he was one of the few in the family who were able to wield such gigantic tools. Jupiter came close, but he soon tired out after just a few swings.

WHAM!!

The huge splitting-axe smashed into a particularly large log!

"HUURGGHH!" Fortis growled, ripping the axe out, heaving it over his head and slamming it down again!

Fortis groaned as he lay in bed. It was damn cold and stormy outside and he was having no luck trying to sleep. He got out of bed and lumbered over to his fireplace and threw some wood onto the burning logs and coals already in the grate. The room was already baking hot, and Fortis wanted to be sure that it stayed that way. He shuffled over to the windows and stared outside. He pressed a hand against the glass and winced! It was freezing! As he stood there, wondering and dreaming, he fancied he heard a noise somewhere...He frowned. What on earth...Nobody else was likely to be awake at this time of the night...Nobody except...

The baby!

Fortis picked up a candelabrum from his bedside table, opened his bedroom doors and headed down the corridor to the nursery. He could hear the crying distinctly, now, together with a high-pitched wail of "Papa!!!"

Fortis opened the nursery door and saw his son standing up in his crib, crying and screaming! He kicked the door shut behind him and lumbered over, and knelt down.

"Hey, hey, hey!" he said, "Quitcher wailin',willyah? Grandma's next door tryin' to sleep!"

But Leo just kept crying! Fortis put down the candles and lifted his son into his arms.

"Alright...alright...shhhh...papa's here now...it's okay..."

"Papa..."

"Hehehe, hey, you learnt a new word!"

Fortis cleaned his son up, wiping away the tears and mucus and gave him a kiss on the cheek. "There! All clean!" he said. He put the baby back in the crib and piled on more wood. Then he bent down to pick up his candelabrum again.

Leo burst into tears! Why was papa going away again!? He didn't want papa to GO! He wanted papa to STAY!

Fortis sighed. He lifted the baby into his arm. "Alright, I guess you can sleep with me tonight", he said. "C'mon son".

Fortis carried the fidgeting baby out of the nursery and into his own room. Leo liked papa's room! It was big and homey and had a lot of light from the fire! Leo reached out towards the fireplace as he entered his father's bedroom. Fortis smiled. "You like the fire, huh son?"

Leo sat on his father's bed, gazing at the fire, just going "oooooooooh!"

Fortis laughed. He got into bed and pulled his son in with him, wrapping him up and then encasing him in his huge arms. "Alright son, now you sleep with pops and you promise to be quiet, okay?" he said. Leo let out a soft googling noise and squeaked: "Papa!"

Fortis gave his son a kiss and rolled over in bed. Leo snuggled down and dozed off...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Little Leo curled up against his father's chest. Papa's room was warm and snuggly. And he felt safe next to papa. He dozed off, sleepy and exhausted from crying and screaming. He shut his eyes and was soon asleep...

...and all too soon, awake again! Fortis jerked upwards, knocking his son over and waking him up when he heard a CRASH! of glass! This was followed soon after by a loud scream!

"You sit there!" said Fortis to the baby, even though he was sure the baby didn't understand such an order! He snatched up the candelabrum by the bed, lit it from the flames in the fireplace, and grabbed a sword that hung above the mantelpiece! Fortis threw his bedroom doors open and ran down the corridor! A door opened and Eldonia stuck her head out!

"Forty!?" she cried out, "Forty what's going on!?" she cried out.

"Shut up!" Fortis shouted. He skidded to a halt in front of Minerva's bedroom door and kicked it open!

Minerva was sitting up in bed, shivering and terrified! Fortis and Eldonia hurried inside!

"What's the matter..." Fortis began, but then he saw the smashed window. Outside, the storm wailed and howled!

"One of the shutters broke off!" said Penelope, Minerva's lady's maid, "It swung around and smashed the window, my lord! It scared us out of our wits!"

Fortis put down the sword and candles and Eldonia stepped forward, but quickly retreated when she saw the glass on the floor!

"Don't nobody move!" said Fortis. "Minnie, c'mere girl!..."

Minerva crawled off her bed and Fortis carried her over the glass. Her screams had woken up the whole top floor and her grandmother and two other brothers soon appeared at her doorway.

"What on earth!?" Lady Athena cried out, dressed in a nightgown.

"Just an accident with the storm, grandma, go back to bed!" Fortis said, "Minnie just had a scare, that's all..."

"My dear!" said Athena, hugging her granddaughter, "Oh you poor thing! Fortis! There's glass everywhere! She can't sleep here tonight! And not with that broken window!"

"She could sleep in my room!" said Penelope.

"Absolutely not!" said Athena. She wouldn't hear of her granddaughter sleeping with a SERVANT!

"She can sleep in my bed tonight, and I'll have a look at the window in the morning", said Fortis. He brushed up the glass using a small broom and then drew the curtains across the broken window to try and keep out the rain. Fortis slung the sword and its scabbard over his back and lifted his sister in one arm and bent down to pick up the candelabrum in the other. That was when he noticed a sealed letter on the table with a familiar coat of arms on it. He picked it up and frowned. He turned it over. It read: "To the Family Vanderstorm" on the other side.

"Why didn't you tell me about this?" Fortis asked as he carried Minerva out of the room.

"Huh?" Minerva said, she was still in shock! She stared at the letter, "Oh! I...I forgot!" she said.

Fortis kicked his bedroom doors shut and laid his sister on his bed. He broke open the seal and sat down to read it. Baby Leo crawled over to his Aunt Minnie, who took him in her arms and stroked him gently.

"Huh!" said Fortis. "Min you should've opened this the moment you got it!" he said.

"What for?" she asked.

"It's from Wolfgang..."

"Wolfgang!?"

"You remember Cousin Wolfgang..."

"The last time I remember him, he broke my arm!"

"Oh come on, he was just playin'...He says...uh...Him and his missus are...being sent by the king's court to fulfill the post of...Ambassador...to the royal court of Fatlantis...in Regis City. He'll be dropping by to visit us along the way...and will arrive...Tomorrow! Oh jeez! The house ain't ready yet!"

"We'll figure it out, a delay of a day isn't so much..." Minerva yawned. Fortis grunted. "Oh, and he says he's bringin' his kid along. I forgot his name..."

"Champion", said Minerva. "A rather pretentious name, if you ask me".

"Now Minnie..."

"Well it is! I never understood this fascination with naming sons such...such...aspirational names! What if he doesn't live up to it?"

"Hey, pops named me Fortis! I live up to it, don't I?" He asked, he laid down next to his sister and smirked.

"Do you know what Fortis MEANS?" she asked.

"Sure I do. It's Latin for...somethin'..."

"It's Latin for "Strong"", Minerva informed him.

"And I aaaam..." said Fortis, flexing a massive bicep. Minerva sighed. She loved her brother, but he really COULD be up himself sometimes...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
CLANG CLANG CLANG CLANG CLANG!!!!!

"Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!! Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!!!"

"Oh no! Oh Penny, look after the baby!" said Minerva to her maid, "Someone answer the door!"

Minerva hurried downstairs as her family gathered in the foyer. Mrs. Tibbs the housekeeper opened the doors.

"Hey! Forty!"

An enormous figure, tanned, heavily-built, with bulging arms and a huge chest, lumbered inside, his hair long, brown and windswept.

"You grew up, little cuz!" the giant boomed.

"Hey Woofy", said Fortis, smiling. The two giant lords hugged and Wolfgang smiled. He hugged his two other cousins Cannius and Jupiter, and then smiled down at...

"MINNIE!"

Minerva blushed. "H-h-hi, Wolfgang..." she said sheepishly. Wolfgang hoisted her up in his huge arms and gave her a bone-crushing hug!

"Muah! How's mah favourite little cuzzy!? You're so precious!"

"Wolfgang! You'll strangle her!" said Fortis. "And I want you to meet..."

But before Fortis could finish his sentence...

"Gran'ma!"

Wolfgang enveloped his grandmother in a crushing hug! She hugged him back, rubbing his broad, rippling back and smiled.

"Oooh Wolfgang! Muah!"

"Woofy, this is Eldonia, she's the um...she's the new Lady Vanderstorm..." said Fortis.

"Oh yeah?" said Wolfgang, he stared down at her. He whistled loudly.

"Wolfgang!" Lady Athena snapped, "Your manners!"

"Awww..." said Wolfgang, and everyone laughed. Eldonia curtsied and Wolfgang kissed her hand.

"It's nice to meet you", said Wolfgang, with surprising civility. "And this is Vesta".

A fiery-looking maiden with flowing red hair entered the hall and curtsied. Fortis smiled.

"It's nice to meet you", he said. She kissed his hand. "My lord", she said.

"Hi Uncle Forty!"

WHUNK!!

"Ooooooow..."

"Now Champ! What'd I tell you about stuff like that, okay? Not until your arms build up!"

"I was only playin'..."

A short, blond-haired boy appeared between everyone. Young Lord Champion was Wolfgang's son. Only eight years old. He massaged his knuckles where he had unwisely made contact with his uncle's six-pack.

Fortis chuckled and got his knees, hugging the little fellah.

"Hey there, Champy!" he said, "How's stuff?"

"Momma and Papa won't take me to the palace!"

"Palace? But you go all the time!"

"Not THAT palace! I mean when they go to Fatlantis! They won't take me to see the King and Queen and meet the princes!"

Fortis chuckled, "Now why would you do that?"

"Well they's so different! I wanna meet them!"

"Son I already told you", said Wolfgang, "I'll be WORKING when I go to the palace, and I can't have you running around and getting lost!"

"But..."

"No buts!"

"I wanna see the princes!"

Fortis chuckled, "Champy, the Fatlantean princes are ENORMOUS boys! Over a thousand pounds each! All fat! You don't want to get too near to them!"

"Yeah, they might eatcha!" Jupiter teased.

"...They might squash yah flat!" said Cannius, laughing.

"They're very VERY big boys and you would need a lot of strength to handle them", said Fortis, "And you haven't reached the age where you can start building up your body to do that yet".

"Exactly!" said Wolfgang, "So that's why I was hopin' that perhaps he could live with you for a while".

Fortis got to his feet, "With me!?" he spluttered.

"Well just until me and Vesta are settled in".

"How long?"

"About a month".

"A M...I...I guess...that's...alright..."

"Good! Then you could also help us look after..."

Vesta revealed a little pink bundle. Inside was a baby girl.

"Astrid".

"Astrid, this is your Uncle Fortis!" said Vesta, softly.

"Uckle Tortoise!" she burbled. Everyone laughed.

"...And this is your Uncle Cannius".

"Uckle...C...c...Candywuss..."

"...and this is your Uncle Jupiter!"

"Uckle Juniper..."

"This is your great-grandma!"

"Gamma! Gamma!!"

"Awww such a sweet baby!" said Athena, giving her a kiss.

"And THIS is your Aunty Minerva..."

"Anna Minera..."

"And your Aunty Eldonia!"

"Anna Abalonea..."

"Momma, momma I wanna hold Astrid", said Champion.

"Oooh no", said Vesta. "Listen, Fortis, we'll be staying here a couple of days. Just for the weekend, then we must get going. The children can stay here for the time-being. Once we've settled in at Regis City, we'll send a letter to you saying that they can come and move in with us".

"That sounds fine", said Fortis.

Upstairs, they could hear muffled crying.

"Oooh, the baby's up..." said Cannius.

Like a moth towards a flame, Champion's eyes lit up!

"Swords!? You got SWORDS Uncle Forty!?"

"Sure I do! You wanna look?"

"Like...SWORD-SWORDS?"

"And they're made of steel and super-duper-mega-ultra-sharp!?"

I wanna dagger but papa won't let me play with one. He says not until I'm ten! But I wanna dagger now! Momma carries around a dagger everywhere and I want one! Can I touch your swords Uncle Forty? --- --- --- ---

"Am SO strong! I'm gonna be the strongest in this family! You wait Uncle Forty! I'm gonna be SO HUGE! Wow! Hey can I hold this one!? It's all glittery and stuff!"

Fortis removed a long, glittering sword from a weapons-case.

"This is my ceremonial dress-sword", Fortis said. Champion held onto it with significant effort, and examined the gilded, bejewelled hilt. He whistled.

"Awwww sweeeeeet!" he said.

Set up on a table were two identical dueling foils. They were thrusting swords, not slashing swords, with long, bendy blades. In the warm, evening sunset, two figures, wearing white dueling outfits with face-masks, approached the table. Sitting on garden benches, the extended Vanderstorm family and some of the housemaids and stable-boys, who had come to watch.

"I never liked these things..." Lady Athena mumbled.

"You liked the sword-dance at the wedding, granny", Minerva reminded her.

"THAT was an act of poetry and grace!...None of that here!"

"Oh relax, granny! It won't be so bad!" said Jupiter. "Hey Canny! Hurry up, will yah? We wanna see this thing happen before the sun sets!"

"We wanna see it before the sun RISES!" Lady Vesta called out. The girls burst out laughing.

"Oh boy!" said Champion. He sat next to his youthful Aunt Minnie and hugged her.

The two opponents bowed and selected their swords. They lowered them, stepped back, and then raised them in salute.

Cannius blew on a whistle and the duel began! Steel clashed and slashed against steel! Everyone watched as the two enormous Mountain lords pushed back and forth, the long, shiny blades whacking and clashing against each other! Block! Parry! Thrust! Swipe! Duck! Deflect! Slide! Engage! Swing!

Eldonia and Vesta watched as their husbands fought back and forth! Such strength and gallantry! Such power! Such...

Minerva sighed. Those girls could KEEP their gigantic, titanic, musclebound super-jock husbands. She only had eyes for a certain, golden-haired prince...

"YAH!!"

Fortis's sword hit his cousin in the throat! Wolfgang, distracted, fell over! Fortis pointed the sword-tip at his heart.

"Do you surrender!?"

Fortis pressed the point in a little harder.

"I surrender!" Wolfgang cried out. Everyone laughed and clapped.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Hey Gramma..."

Lady Athena was in her bedroom. She jumped, scattering ink everywhere!

"Oh Fortis! Do KNOCK before you enter a person's room! Oh now I have to start all over again!"

Fortis lumbered over and knelt down to hug his grandmother. He gave her a playful kiss.

"Whatcha writin'?"

"That young wizard, Merlin. I'm writing to his grandmother, Ursula. I want to see if she's available to perform a Future Viewing for us".

Fortis frowned. "A what?"

Athena sighed. "Oh of course you wouldn't know..." she said. She turned in her seat to face her grandson.

"A future-viewing is where a magical being examines a newborn child to give its parents a glimpse into what its future might possibly be..."

"Oh granny, predicting the future is such bupkiss!"

"Young man! Future-viewings are VERY accurate! They can show the parents what their child will most likely grow up to be, and how he or she will act at various ages. And they will prepare the parents for any BAD personality traits that the child might develop, so that they can raise the child differently to avoid them!"

"I suppose mother and father had one when I was born, huh?"

"Oh yes they did!"

"And I suppose it showed me as a tall, dark, handsome hunk bedding girls and winning wars and..."

"It showed you as a young man. Caring, well-built, loving, attentive, sweet-natured, show-offy..."

"I am NOT show-offy!" said Fortis defensively!

Lady Athena rolled her eyes. Right now, Fortis was standing in front of her without a shirt on!...So much for that denial!

"They can be VERY interesting! So I'm writing to her to ask if she can come and perform one for us".

"Oh alright..." said Fortis.

Lady Athena sighed and turned back to her desk. She dipped her pen and began writing...

My Dearest Ursula.

My grandson, the new Lord Vanderstorm, and his unwed bride, have birthed a child between them. A healthy young man whom we have named Leonardo.We are most eager for you to visit us, so that you might perform a traditional future-viewing. We hope that you will have the time for this, and we will prepare the nursery for the event when you arrive.

Your friend,
Lady Athena Vanderstorm. Dowager Countess.

Athena smiled, folded the letter, sealed and stamped it, and then took it outside to the waiting post-rider to deliver...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Oh Fortis, DO tidy up your HAIR!"

"I will, if you can reach it!"

"Don't talk to granny like that!"

"I LIKE my hair like this! I think it looks cool...all wavy and messy and wild...Eldonia LOVES it...!"

"I!...I...I don't...LOVE...it! I just said that it...it suited you..."

"Noooo, you said it made me look like a..."

"Ah!! Not another word, young master!"

"Awww peanuts..."

CRACK!!

Green smoke exploded everywhere! When it wafted away, an aged practitioner of the magical arts stood...or rather...stooped...before them.

Ursula looked almost exactly like those cackling old hags that Fortis read about in fairy-tales as a child. She was a TINY woman! She would struggle to be five feet tall standing on tip-toe! She had great masses of wavy white and grey hair, wrinkled, aged skin, beady green eyes, and wore battered old black robes and a tall, pointed wizarding hat, which looked in desperate need of starching! She held onto an old, carved walking-stick with surprising firmness, and carried a carpet-bag in one hand. She stared around her, as if wondering where she was...

"Aaaah!"

Her voice sounded like a squeaking door! She smiled at the tall, stately, elder woman.

"My darling!"

She hobbled over to Athena and the two women shook hands, and hugged.

"You look well, my dear!"

"Thank you, Ursula. How is your grandson?"

"He suffers most grievously from inattention, idleness and incompetence. He should spend less time trying to build that replicating chest of his, and more time building up his mind studying spells!"

"...So he's normal, then..."

"Yes!...Regrettably..."

The old crone turned her attention to the younger set. She whipped out an eyeglass on a long, gold chain and peered through it interrogatively.

"Hmmm...You must be Marianna..."

"That's MINERVA, Ursula! Your eyesight really is going!" Athena said, with a sigh.

"Well if perhaps you invited me to luncheon more often, I would recall their likenesses with greater detail!" she snapped back.

She moved onto the next person in the line.

"And you must be Esmeralda..."

"Eldonia, Ursula!" Athena sighed. "Didn't you read ANYTHING I mentioned in my second letter?"

"It was rather poorly written, my dear..."

"Yes well I was babysitting at the time, and the baby was rather more interested in the quill than the rubber ball I gave him to play with..."

The old witch let out a 'tch-tch-tch...' sound of disapproval.

"This must be the new master, then..." she said. She stared up at the imposing giant before her.

"Hey".

"Good evening, young man".

"Oh...yeah...um...uh...uhm...I um...yeah".

"And THIS little one must be..."

Before anyone could stop him, Leo snatched Ursula's eyeglass away from her and started waving it around!

"...the baby..." she sighed. "Naughty baby! You give Aunty Ursula back her glass!"

Leo refused! He tugged on the chain, gathered it in his hands and started waving the glass around. He caught it and peered mischeviously through the lens, back at its owner!...Then he burst into tears, cried and buried his face in his father's arms!

Fortis chuckled, "Cheeky little bugger...I'm sorry, Ursula, but he's always been rather curious...Son, you give back her eyeglass right now!"

"Gnah!" the baby pouted.

"Leo! You don't give it back, and papa won't play with you..."

Leo handed the glass back at once!

"Good boy!"

Ursula hobbled upstairs into the nursery where a table was set up. She sat down and everyone sat down as well. The table was circular, with a red cloth on it, and chairs all around. She stooped down, and opened her bag, pulling out a handsome wrought iron stand, and a crystal ball that would sit on top of it. She sat it on the table and then opened up a small pouch. She sprinkled the contents of the pouch all over the ball and all around the base. She reached out, and as if under a spell, Leo crawled out of his father's arms and over to the ball. He sat down obediently and stared at the ball as if it was the most fascinating thing in the world! He rubbed the white powder and started putting some of it into his mouth...

"Leo no!" said Eldonia.

"It's alright!" the witch said, "It's not going to do him any harm at all..."

"What is it? Powdered bones? Ashes? Ground-up arrowroot?"

"...Actually it's sugar", the witch said.

"Sugar!?"

"Something sweet to keep the baby's attention so he won't want to wander away. Now let us begin. I want you all to lean forwards. Rest your elbows on the table, and place at least one hand on the ball. Close your eyes and let your bodies relax. Now young Master Leonardo. Let's see your future, hmm?"

The baby was now constantly touching the crystal ball, trying to get more and more of the sweet powdery stuff off it. The more he touched it, the more powerful the vision became, until it enveloped them all. At first, all they could see around them was a swirling blue mist...and then...the mist cleared in their minds' eyes...and a vision appeared before them...

It played out like some sort of theatrical production. The door opened and into what was once the nursery, strolled in a tall, well-built young man. He was tanned and impressively muscular. He had longish brown hair and, as he turned around, they could all see, a handsome, solid-looking face, with bright eyes. He had what looked like a small smirk on his face.

The young hunk looked around the room and then lumbered out.

"HEY GIRL! WHERE ARE YOU!?" he shouted. The voice was strong, deep and powerful.

No answer.

"GIRL! It's lunchtime!"

The stud left the bedroom and jogged downstairs. He headed outside and strong sunlight flashed across his hair, revealing streaks of blond in the brown. The bulk and heft of his body created shadows on his muscles.

"GIRL!" the hunk roared, "WHERE ARE YOU!?"

Distant giggling floated along with the breeze, along with "Rommie! Rommie stop!"

The titanic teenager broke into a jog and ran around the estate. He burst around the corner and spotted two youngsters playing with wooden swords!

"Yah! Gotcha! En Garde!"

"No no no! No fair! I wasn't ready!"

"GIRL! LUNCH TIME! NOW! ROMIE!! YOU TOO!"

"But we're playin'..."

"Granny says LUNCH! I been lookin' all over the house for you little pips now MOVE IT!"

The two youngsters sighed, downed their wooden playthings and trotted after him.

An elderly woman tottered out of the back door.

"There you are!" she cried out, "I have been sending your brother ALL over the house looking for you! Lunch time, dearest! You too, Romeo!"

"But grandma!" the younger boy said, "I was gonna win!..."

"A blood nose!" the girl retorted.

"Was NOT!"

"Was TOO! You can't block! All you do is step back and back and back! One day you'll hit a wall and then you'll be sorry! You should play more with Leo! He can show you how to do it! Huh Leo?"

The giant hunk grinned, "Hey yeah..." he said. "C'mon girl, lunch...ROMEO ARE YOU COMING OR NOT!?"

"I'm comin' I'm comin'! Jeez! Will you stop beltin' like that for once!?"

The scene changed to the dining room downstairs. Sitting around the table was a rough-looking giant with long, dark blond hair and nearby, a society beauty with her hair done up in long, soft silky braids.

"Found them!" the old woman creaked. "Now Julie you sit down! Romeo you too!"

"Found 'em pops!" said Leonardo, "They was outside doin' swordplay".

"Did you win, son?" the older man asked.

"Yeah!"

"Liar!" the girl pouted. The woman laughed and hugged her baby girl. "Oh you're so smart, sweetums!"

The girl leaned over and hugged her mother. "Love you momma..."

Leo sat down and started eating lunch.

"Leo yelled at us!" Romeo grumbled.

"Son..." said the older man.

"I was CALLING them!" Leo defended himself. "And Reo, don't chop up your meat like that!...Oh give it to me before you massacre it! The damn steak already died once, you don't have to kill it again!...Like THIS!...You're old enough to know how to cut your own meat..."

The girl stuck out her tongue.

"Ju'let, you keep that in your mouth or later I ain't playin' with you..." Leo warned.

Juliet closed her mouth at once! The hunk smiled and hugged his baby sister, "Sure I will sweetcakes", he said, kissed her.

--- --- --- ---

"Awwwww!" said Lady Athena as the ball turned clear and the vision before them faded away.

"Oooh he's gonna be handsome!" said Eldonia, squealing and scooping up her baby son, "Yes you are my little fighter! You gonna be SOOOO cute! And you already ARE! So you gonna be adorable adorable adorable!"

"Oh jeez! Stop doin' that!" said Fortis.

"And you gonna have a little bruddah and sister!"

"Oh he might not", said old Ursula the witch, carefully packing up her crystal ball. "That vision only shows what MIGHT happen. He may not have any siblings at all!"

"You questionin' mah skills in bed, Ursie?" Fortis asked.

"Oh tush!" said the old witch, "Thou vile Mountanians think of nothing else!"

Eldonia laughed and hugged her big bad hubby. Minerva smiled and tickled her nephew's little tummy. He was so cute!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Minerva peered eagerly into the swirling mist inside her aunt Ursula's crystal ball, anxious to see her future...

"WOMAN!! WHERE ARE YOU?!"

The loud, gruff voice echoed through the stone corridors, making Minerva jump and shiver. The dark-haired toddler in her arms burst into tears, and Minerva tried to soothe the child with hushes and soft words. However, the voice kept yelling for her, and Minerva made her way out of the bright, cheery nursery into the dank, cold hallway.

She was several years older, probably in her late teens or early twenties. She was several inches taller and appeared fully mature, though weariness and fear marred her lovely face instead of happiness and joy.

"There you are! Where have you been?! I've been hollerin' for you fer five minutes!"

The tall, imposing man with dark hair and a neat goatee stomped up to her. He was at least ten feet tall and as ruggedly and hugely built as Minerva's brother Fortis. However, this man was obviously much older, as gray decorated his sideburns and the hair at his temples. Frown lines were cut deeply into his cheeks around his mouth. His dark eyes were intense and scary as they glared at her. He grabbed her upper arm roughly.

"Aurelius!" she hissed, struggling to keep hold of the still-screaming child in her arms. "Quiet down! Please! You're upsetting Nero!"

Aurelius gave a hoarse laugh and grabbed the child from her. "Ah, the child just needs to learn to not be frightened by loud noises!"

He held the toddler up to his face and gave him a mocking, tooth-filled grimace. The child just screamed harder, making Aurelius laugh again. "That's right, boy! EVERYONE should be scared of your old man! NO ONE crosses Lord Aurelius Vergallen!"

Minerva beat her small fist on his bulging bicep. "Aurelius! Stop it!"

Aurelius snarled at her and pushed her away, making her fall to the floor in a heap. Minerva moaned as the fall aggravated the bruises she still had on her hands, arms, and thighs.

"You still haven't learned yer lesson, have ya, wife?" Aurelius sneered, dumping the child on the frightened and cowering nursery maid and closing the door behind his still-sobbing son. "I woulda thought after four years, you'd have learned to still your tongue and watch yer manners! Seems I still need to beat the fire outta ya!"

Minerva's eyes widened and she scuttled back a bit on the floor. "N-no, my lord! Please! I'll...I'll do anything! Please, not again!"

Aurelius laughed harshly and hauled her up into his arms. He crushed her tightly to him, his arms like unyielding bands of steel around her that made her attempts at squirming essentially nonexistent. He walked quickly and firmly down the hallway to the master bedroom, Minerva pleading all the way.

Aurelius locked the door to his suite of rooms and plopped her on his enormous bed. She tried to move away to the other side of the bed, but Aurelius merely grasped her ankle and hauled her back.

"Ah, ah, ah!" he said mockingly, waving a forefinger in front of her face. "You need to learn to take your punishment, my dear."

He settled his long, hard body on top of her to keep her from moving and grasped both of her wrists easily over her head with one of his large, calloused hands. He then reached for the scarves he had tied to the bedposts and quickly tied her wrists to the bed.

"N-n-not the scarves! Please, Aurelius!"

He slapped her cheek with a snarl! "WHAT DID YOU CALL ME?!"

Minerva gasped at the stinging she felt on her face. She even tasted a bit of blood in her mouth. "I...I mean...m-my lord!" she whispered.

"That's right! I'm your lord! Your master! You will learn to show me RESPECT! ESPECIALLY IN FRONT OF MY SON!"

Minerva bit her lip to keep from saying anything more, knowing that whatever she said would probably just rile up her husband that much more.

Aurelius stood up from the bed and quickly removed his clothing, leering at his young wife all the while. Minerva merely turned her head away, silent tears running down her cheeks. When Aurelius was completely disrobed, he moved back onto the bed. He took a bejeweled dagger from underneath one of his pillows and expertly sliced the expensive gown and undergarments from his wife's body....

"Oh my!" said Ursula, quickly ending the spell and pulling her startled fingers away from the crystal ball.

"What...what was that?" Minerva gasped, putting one hand over her heart and the other hand over her mouth. "Is that...really going to be my future? Who WAS that man?"

Ursula shook her head and pulled a black square of cloth from her pocket, laid it on top of the crystal ball, and then snatched the ball up and put it back in its felt-lined box. "As I told you before, my dear," Ursula said shakily, "this is only a possible future for you. It won't necessarily come true."

"...But it could!"

Ursula locked the box and turned back to her niece, sighing. "Yes. It could."

Ursula took pity on the poor girl and led her over to a comfortable seat. She held Minerva's hands gently in her own. "I can tell you what I do know, though, if that will help, Minnie. The man you saw was Lord Aurelius Vergallen. He lives in a large, but lonely castle in the northern-most part of Mountania and on the Vladian border. Lord Vergallen has always had a reputation for being ruthless and unforgiving. But I imagine he'd have to be to survive in such a rugged, harsh environment and having to deal with those murdering, nasty Vladians day in and day out. He is currently in his late thirties, but he's never shown an interest in marrying before. I suppose he'll eventually decide he needs an heir and therefore look for an appropriate bride. A young, lovely girl like yourself he would probably consider biddable enough for what he would be looking for in a bride."

Ursula grimaced at her own reasoning and explanation. She disliked the vision intensely and had no intention of letting Minerva be married off to such a mean, nasty Lord as Aurelius Vergallen, despite his vast wealth and resources!

Minerva sat silently for a few minutes, processing everything she had just seen and heard. She swallowed hard before looking into her aunt's kind, concerned face. "How could Fortis allow me to be married to someone like that? And besides, what about Prince Cas.... Er..."

Minerva blushed at nearly revealing her crush on the Crown Prince. She thought for certain the crystal ball would reveal a happy future as Prince Cassius's wife...not the wife of some awful, old Lord who would beat her and practically rape her!

Ursula chuckled and patted her niece's hand. "Have a wee bit of a crush on the Crown Prince, do we? Well, I must say that Prince Cassius is a fine, upstanding young man. Handsome, too!"

Minerva giggled. "Auntie Ursula!"

Sobering a bit and putting a hand on Minerva's cheek, Ursula gazed into Minerva's eyes. "Don't let what you saw in the ball frighten you, my dear! The future is not set! And if I have anything to say about it, I will make sure you are not married off to that awful Lord Vergallen! The only thing I can figure for how that could even BE a possible future for you is if something happened to Fortis or your brothers, such that the Vanderstorm earldom became destitute and in need of coin. I could easily see Lord Vergallen paying handsomely for a comely bride like yourself--enough to pull any struggling nobleman from dire straits into coffers overflowing with gold."

Minerva shook her head. "I still can't see how Fortis, Cannius, or Jupiter would ever SELL me for a brideprice!"

"Well, as I said, don't let it worry you anymore! I will personally speak to Fortis and inform him of what we saw. I'll make sure that future never happens!"

Minerva threw her arms around her aunt's neck and gave her a tight hug. "Thanks, Auntie," she murmured.

Ursula hugged her back. "My pleasure, my dear. Now, dry your tears and go write a letter to your prince. I'm sure that will make you feel better!"

Minerva drew back with a blush, but smiled at her aunt and nodded before leaving the room.

Ursula sighed and looked up at the ceiling in exhaustion. "Of course, the stupid ball would show her the WORST possible future she might slightly possibly have! Silly, contrary thing!"

"Fortis?"

Fortis was busy doing push-ups in his bedroom.

"Fortis!"

"Huh? Oh...Hey Aunt Ursie..."

The tall young Mountain lord made to get up, but she waved her hand, and he went back to his push-ups.

"I need to speak to you about your sister".

Fortis stopped. "Why?" he asked.

"It's about her future".

"Uh-huh..."

"It may be a possibility that should fortunes for the Vanderstorm family turn sour, she may end up marrying a person of um...questionable reputation".

"Uh-huh..."

"Do you know someone named Aurelius..."

"Vergallen!?" Fortis grunted, standing up.

"Um...yes!"

Fortis frowned. "I think I saw him once at one of those royal gatherings in Ferramount. Father took us there once..."

"Yes...well in a vision I held with your sister Minerva, it may come to pass that Lord Vergallen might um...desire her as a partner...for a price".

Fortis frowned. "Wh...OH NO!" he said roughly. He'd heard of stories like this before! "I don't damn think so!"

"I know!" said Ursula. "Now I KNOW you share a VERY special bond with your sister..."

"I promised mother on her deathbed I'd take care of her..."

"Your mother died in childbirth, I know, Fortis. But after three boys the size of you and your brothers..."

Fortis smirked.

"...It was probably to be expected".

Fortis nodded.

"I know you love your sister very much", said Ursula. "And you want make sure that she marries someone kind, sweet and loving, who can take care of her".

Fortis nodded.

Ursula reached into a pouch and pulled out two gold lockets. She handed them to Fortis.

"These are Attachment Lockets..."

Fortis examined them. "Oh yeah...mother had one of these..."

"Yes. They're to be shared between loved ones. They glow red hot whenever one of them is in trouble. You might hold onto one, and give one to your sister".

"Can't you do that?"

"It has to be an exchange between the two parties. I can't interfere", said Ursula. "But also, if you want to safeguard Minerva's future, I see another person in her life who would make her extremely happy".

"Who?" Fortis asked, suspiciously.

"Well he's young, handsome, attractive, athletic..."

"You mean my friend Damascus?"

"NO! Crown Prince Cassius!"

Fortis frowned.

"If your sister saw more of the prince, they might fall in love. And if they marry, she would be forever bound to someone who would treasure her, and protect her!...to say nothing of giving your own family a big social boost..."

Fortis smirked. He liked the sound of that!

"I know you're very protective of your sister", said Ursula. "But don't deny her when she has found someone who can make her truly happy. Especially when preventing happiness could lead to such an uncertain and dangerous future".

Fortis nodded at this advice. "Alright, she can write to the prince and stuff..." he said.

Ursula smiled and left the room.

That evening after dinner...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Alright, girls..." said Fortis, "Relax, I'm here now. I'll go see what's outside", he said. Taking his sword, Fortis headed out into the yard.

Outside of the kitchen door was a large garden. This was where the house-servants could relax on their time off, but it was also the estate's vegetable garden. There were neat rows of carrots, bushes of cucumbers, onion, garlic, and long, green vines with fat, round tomatoes on them. There were bushes of mint, rosemary, basil and and all other manner of herbs.

At the other end of the garden was a neat patch of lawn, and hedges and bushes. Fortis approached the bushes and stared around. Then, he suddenly bent down...

"YEEEK!!"

Fortis straightened up! He held some sort of shrieking, wriggling creature in his hands! It took him a couple of minutes to realise that it was a girl! She shrieked and wriggled around! Kicking and flailing her legs! Suddenly, the bushes parted and a filthy-looking boy stuck his head out! He waved something at Fortis! Fortis grabbed the boy's arm and twisted it violently! A small knife fell to the ground!

"Let go of my sister!" the boy squeaked! Fortis stared at the two children! They couldn't be any older than about eight or nine years old! Fortis let go of the girl, who landed on the grass with a 'fwump!'. He drew out his sword and swung it around to face them! The two kids gulped!

"What're you doing on my land!?" Fortis barked. "This is private property!"

"Please sir!" the boy said, grabbing his sister and pushing her back, so that he stood in front of her, "We didn't mean anything! We got lost and!...and...It was those men! They captured us!"

Fortis could tell by the boy's accent that he was a native. He grunted dismissively.

"What do you mean?" Fortis asked. "And you're Mountanians aren't you?"

"Yes sir!" said the girl.

"Then it's MY LORD", Fortis corrected them. Their hands flew to their mouths! They'd never met a REAL Mountain Lord before! They'd heard stories, of course...but...

The boy dropped to his knees and the girl curtsied. Behind him, Fortis didn't notice the house-servants all crowding at the windows to see what was going on.

"I beg your pardon, my lord!" the boy said, "My sister and I were kidnapped by the Vladians when they ran away. They made us look after them! We didn't want to come here and we don't know how to go home! We meant thee no harm, my lord!"

Fortis sighed.

"You got any family?" he asked.

The boy stared at the girl.

"She's my sister...that's it", the boy said.

"What's your name, boy?"

"Perseus, my lord! And, and this is my sister Katie..."

Fortis nodded.

"I suppose you don't have anywhere to go, huh?" he asked.

The two children shook their heads. Little Katie looked close to tears!

"So what are you, orphans?"

Perseus nodded.

"You know, there's an almshouse in the village".

"We didn't want to come here!" Perseus said. "Those mean men made us! Please don't tell us to go away! We don't have anywhere to live!"

Fortis sighed. He turned around and stared across the yard at the castle.

"Mrs. Tibbs!" he called. "Come here!"

Mrs. Tibbs shuffled across the garden, her heart melted when she saw the two waifs.

"This is Percy and this is Katie. They'll be staying with us for a while".

Mrs. Tibbs frowned. "Percy doesn't sound very Mountanian", she said.

"It's Perseus!" the boy said.

"Awww!"

"Can you sort out some food and a bed or something? And uh...probably a BATH as well..."

"Of course, Lord Vanderstorm!...Come along now, children!"

Fortis turned and headed back inside. Katie and Percy watched him go. He was so BIG! Percy was sure the gigantic Mountain lord could rip his arms off and shove them down his throat if he wanted to!...But he seemed so nice, too! Percy made a mental note that he and his sister would be as good as gold!...It wouldn't do to get on the wrong side of THIS man!

Fortis passed through the kitchen and returned to the dining-room, briefly explaining to his sister, his grandmother and his wife what was going on. Minerva and Eldonia shared looks with each other. Despite his rough exterior, Fortis really was a soft little puppy...Awwwww!!

Perseus stood boldly in front of his sister! He wasn't going to let someone push him around!...

...unless he was a super-huge, giant, musclebound Mountain lord...The youth felt his courage whither away like a melting ice-cube.

"Mrs. Tibbs!"

Perseus looked and saw a plump woman who was past middle-aged, waddle into the garden.

"My lord!" she said.

"Find some food and clothes for these kids and uh...perhaps give them a bath, too..."

"Of course, my lord!"

Perseus watched as the monster-hunk lumbered back inside, his eyes fixed upon him in awe. He was HUGE!

"Where are we?" Katie asked. The fat old woman looked pleasant and kind!

"My name's Mrs. Tibbs!" she said softly, "This..." she gestured, "Is Castle Vanderstorm, ancestral home of the Vanderstorm Family. The Vanderstorms have been warrior nobility in Mountania for a long, long, long time!" she said.

"I'm Perseus!" the boy said. He regained some of his courage now that he could speak to someone who didn't TOWER over him! "I'm eight!" he said. "And this is Katie. She's my sister. She's five".

"It's very nice to meet you, Master Perseus!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "You children must be hungry! Come along inside and we'll see what we can whip up for you..."

The kindly old housekeeper led the children inside and out of the garden.

"How on earth did you end up here?" she asked.

"We ran away from our village when the Vladians came", Katie said. "Momma and papa went missing and we didn't know where they were. And then those big scary men found us! And they kidnapped us so that we would be their slaves!" she said dramatically.

"They wanted to hold us forever!" Perseus added. "And then they came here and they told us to wait outside. We were too scared to run away. And then when the giant man came, we hid in the bushes!"

Mrs. Tibbs chuckled and invited the children to sit down. She laid out plates and filled them with leftover sausages, bread, butter, bacon and other breakfast leftovers. The children didn't wait for cutlery, they started eating it all with their hands!

"My goodness!" she said. "You two must be hungry!" she said.

"We haven't eaten in nearly three days..." Perseus said, blushing.

"Oh you poor things!" said the old housekeeper, sitting down. "Well you've nothing to fear about! You'll get plenty to eat around here!" she said proudly.

"Mrs. Tibbs", Katie said, "Who's the big scary man?"

"The big scary man?...Oh you mean his lordship! Why that's Fortis Vanderstorm! He's landlord of the county around here".

"I thought lords were older!" Katie said.

"Old Lord Vanderstorm died last year", Mrs. Tibbs said. "Master Fortis is his firstborn son! So he inherits the title and the estate!"

"He's scary!" Katie whispered. Mrs. Tibbs smiled.

"He's not so terrible!" she said. "He's a very sweet young man! He's a bit...a bit rough...but he's got a heart of gold!"

"And a body of rock!" Eliza said, entering the kitchen.

"Eliza! Don't you be thinking such things of his lordship!" Mrs. Tibbs chastised. "And back to your cleaning, my girl!"

"I bet he's really mean!" Katie whispered.

"Oh no he's not!" said Mrs. Tibbs, "He's very sweet! You'll like him a lot once you get to know him better".

"He's got BIG arms!" said Perseus. Like a lot of Mountanian boys, he dreamed of one day becoming a knight and a great warrior!...Unlikely...but it was a dream, nonetheless. Most Mountanian boys grew impressive musculature of their own from farming, mining, logging and other, labour-intensive industries for which the Mountanians were famous.

"Oh he's very very strong!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "He's ten feet tall, you know. He has to be very strong!"

"Ten feet!" Perseus squeaked, "Oh wow! Oh boy I wanna be THAT BIG!!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Perseus and Katie were playing with the baby when the kitchen doors swung open. The two children recoiled in horror!

Lord Vanderstorm was so tall that he had to bend over to enter the kitchen. Fortunately, its high ceilings were sufficient enough for him to stand up straight. He lumbered over to the kitchen table. The two children watched in awe.

Baby Leo sat on the table, suckling his bottle. Then he heard a deep rumbling noise behind him. He turned around and squealed! He dropped the bottle with a 'clunk!' and crawled eagerly towards the giant!

Fortis let out a heavy, rumbling laugh. He scooped up the miniscule baby and hugged it roughly. Leo squeaked! Fortis laughed, patted it heavily on the head and gave it a powerful, loving kiss on the cheek. He chuckled.

"Hehehehe...Hey there little fellah! We was wonderin' where you'd gotten to...Huh? You had papa all worried! Don't you crawl away from the parlour like that again! You might get lost! Now come on, time for your nap..."

"You see?" said Mrs. Tibbs, smiling. "You've nothing to be scared of!"

"Aww shucks, Tibby, Leo ain't scared of nothing!" said Fortis, bouncing his son on his massive arms, "Are yah, boy?"

Leo giggled happily. Mrs. Tibbs smiled.

"Not that, my lord! I meant our two young guests! They thought you a horrible, terrifying monster who would eat them up as soon as look at them!"

Fortis turned and let out a fearsome roar! Katie gasped and held her hands to her mouth!

Mrs. Tibbs giggled and Fortis guffawed with laughter!

"Hahahahahaha!! Hain't gonna hurtcha! Relax! So you got no place to go...You can stay here until we figure out what we can do with you", said Fortis. "Mrs. Tibbs, perhaps you could find them some old clothes? Burn those disgusting rags they're wearing and then give them a bath. They'd probably like a nice, long, lazy soak after crawling around in those bushes..."

"Of course, my lord!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "And I'll sound the gong when luncheon is ready!"

"Right..." Fortis said, "And YOU my little escape-artist, are gonna have a nap..." he said, bouncing his son in his arms and carrying him out of the kitchen.

Katie sighed when Fortis left.

"Oh you mustn't be afraid of his lordship!" Mrs. Tibbs said, "He's just...well...He's a nice chap. Now, there'll be a hot bath for you soon", she said. "You're lucky that the castle has its own piped and sewer-systems. All the water's stored in big copper cisterns on the roof, and there's a boiler right here in the kitchen! The servants bathroom is through here, come along!"

The two children followed the housekeeper into the bathroom. They both took off their clothes and climbed into a hot, steaming bath, full of soap-flakes.

"Oooooh!!" Katie gasped when the hot water washed over her!

"How's that, now?" the housekeeper asked, smilng. "You just relax and get nice and clean! I'll go find you some clothes!" she said.

The bath was delightful! Hot and soapy and clean-smelling. The brother and sister scrubbed away, trying to clean their hair and their bodies all over. They hadn't had a proper wash in weeks! Ever since they'd been kidnapped from their village. They were drying themselves off with the two enormous, fluffy towels that were folded on a chair, when Mrs. Tibbs entered again.

"Here we are!" she said, "These are a bit old and they might not fit, but they'll have to do. You can't go back to wearing what you had previously!"

She held up some undershorts, pants and a tunic for Perseus, and a small, white dress for Katie. Perseus stared dubiously at the clothing.

"It's a bit...big, isn't it?" he asked.

"Well they DID belong to his lordship...when he was a child..."

"He must've been a BIG child!!"

"Oh my yes...Over six feet by the time he was ten! But these should fit you...or at least give you something to wear", she said. "I'll wait outside while you try them on".

"Now you keep those doors locked and those windows shut and those curtains drawn!"

"Aww! But Forty! We wanna see the sights!...Oooh look Minnie! The Grand Arena! Oh we should go there to watch a boxing-match!"

"Alright keep the curtains drawn, but the windows SHUT!"

Fortis sat on the driver's box of the family carriage, driving it through the streets of the Mountanian capital. It was late afternoon and time was getting on. They'd been travelling for the better part of two days, and they were glad to be near the end of their journey.

The carriage approached an enormous stone defensive wall with a huge, portcullised entrance-way. A burly-looking roya guard dressed in armour peered up.

"Yes?" he asked.

"Lord Vanderstorm and his family to see the king", Fortis said.

"Are you invited and expected?"

"No".

"What is the nature of your business?"

"We seek to consult his majesty on a matter of domestic service".

"Oooh...Alright wait here..."

The guard clanked off. He returned several minutes later.

"The king will see you, Lord Vanderstorm...Raise the portcullis!"

The huge gate creaked upwards and the carriage rumbled inside. It was parked and the horses were taken to the stables to be fed and watered. Fortis led his sister and his young wife into the palace, up the wide stone steps and into the foyer, and then into the huge throne-room further beyond.

"The Earl Vanderstorm, your Majesty", said the guard, who had led them in. The guard stared at Fortis and held out both his hands, palms upwards.

Fortis unbuckled his sword and handed it to the guard. He and the girls approached the royal dais. Fortis bowed and his wife and sister curtsied.

"Your Majesty", he said.

"Lord Vanderstorm", said King Leviathan.

The king cast his eyes over the three before him.

"And this must be your new wife", he said, gesturing to Lady Eldonia. She blushed.

"Hmmm. And your charming sister".

Minerva blushed as well!

"What brings you to my palace?"

"Your Majesty, the womenfolk of the house are of the opinion that we require more assistance in the running of Castle Vanderstorm. We have come to make a selection of the available surplus of labour".

"Aaah..." the king said. "Of course you are! Yes. Your grandmother and your new wife, and your son! Of course! Absolutely you may!...Achilles!"

The king's personal assistant snapped to attention.

"Y'maj'", he said.

"We DO have a surplus of servants seeking new placements, do we not?"

"We do".

"Excellent. You will tell them please, to assemble..."

"Oh there's no hurry!" said Fortis. "We can take our time...with your majesty's permission..."

"Very well...You must be tired from your journey. Achilles. Show Lord Vanderstorm and his family to the guest-wing. Dinner is in..."

The king checked his watch.

"One hour".

"Are we to be expected, your majesty?" Fortis asked.

"I hope that you would not object?" the king asked.

"No sir!"

"Excellent! Dinner in one hour. You will all be my guests! I insist!"

Fortis and the girls followed Achilles out of the throne-room. He called two slim, muscular footmen forward, instructing them to retrieve the luggage from the Vanderstorm coach and bring it upstairs.

"This way, my lord!" said Achilles. He led the young nobleman upstairs.

"There are a number of people at Court presently", said the king's servant. "So the selection of rooms is not as great as it might be. But we have this double-bed suite in here, which you and her ladyship might desire..."

The servant opened a huge pair of double-doors.

"...and through here..." he said, opening a pair of doors further down the corridor, "...a single room for the young lady. They all come with private bedchambers for your servants as well".

"Thank you", said Fortis.

Minerva entered her suite. Through large, leadlight windows, she could see the sun setting in the distance. Her maid, Penny, lit the candles and then, confessing to sleepiness, headed to her own small room.

"I don't think I'll need your help with anything", said Minerva, "You really didn't have to come, Penny. You could've taken the weekend off!"

"And miss the chance to come here!?" the maid snapped back, indignantly, "I should think NOT, my lady!" she said.

Minerva giggled. "Point taken!" she said. "Have a good sleep! And eat in the servants' hall downstairs if you're hungry later on".

Penny said goodnight and closed the door.

Minerva stood in front of the windows, staring at the view of the city below. Lamplighters scurried around, lighting the street-lamps, filling the city with specks of golden light...

"Good evening..."

"Aaaah!!!"

Minerva jumped! She whirled around! Something grabbed her!

"Woah!" the voice said, "Easy! You'll twist your ankle doing that!"

The handsome and charming Crown Prince Cassius held her steady and fixed her with his blue eyes. He stepped back and gave a courtly bow.

"My lady", he said.

Minerva found herself curtsying out of habit.

"I recognised the coat of arms on the carriage in the courtyard", Cassius said. "Are you here alone? I saw someone else..."

"My brother Fortis is here as well", Minerva said.

"Ah...Does he still want to kill me for thinking you're cute?"

Minerva giggled. "Yes!" she said.

"Good!"

Minerva laughed.

"Your Royal Highness, what are you doing in my room?"

"Cassius".

"Prince Cassius, what are..."

"...Cassius!"

"Just Cassius?"

"JUST Cassius".

"Alright...JUST Cassius...what are you doing here?"

"Well, a little bird told me that a very pretty young lady of my acquaintance had arrived in the palace. I hope you don't mind me barging in like this..."

"I don't mind. Just you see that Fortis doesn't catch you, or he'll rip your head off! He's very...um...protective and...um...well who are we kidding? He's obsessed with the idea that I need to be chaperoned everywhere!"

"Well he's your brother, Minerva. He loves you and he wants to protect you..."

"Giving me a knife is protecting me! Following me around like a shadow is just smothering me!"

"Are you coming to dinner?" Cassius asked. Minerva nodded.

Cassius held out his arm. "Might I walk you down?" he asked.

Minerva bobbed, and hooked her arm into his, and followed him out of the room.

The Queen laughed at something and Fortis grinned, and rapped his knuckles on Eldonia's temples. She scowled at him and wriggled away.

At the far end of the table were the other dinner-guests. Minerva pointed to an older man. He looked to be in his forties. He was tall, heavyset, brooding and dark, with dark brown hair, which was all shaggy. So dark it was almost black.

"Cassius who is that?" Minerva asked.

"Who?...Triton! Father said no kittens at the table!"

"But Sundash is thirsty!" the younger prince complained.

"Then give him his milk on the floor!"

"But..."

"Now!...Sorry who?"

Minerva pointed down the table. Cassius leaned over.
