"He's here to speak to father about...somethin'...Confidentially I don't like the man".

"Is he mean?"

"He's always grumpy about something! Every few weeks he shows up here. If he came any more frequently, you'd think he LIVED here!"

Minerva looked up to see Lord Vergallen staring at her! She sat back in her chair where he couldn't see her so well. He looked so mean!

"You want some dessert, Minerva?" Cassius asked. "We've got berry-punch...and we also have mixed-berry tarts with cream, and..."

"I...I don't think I'm very hungry", she said. "Perhaps we could dance?" she asked. She gestured towards the open floor. A small string quartet up in the musicians' gallery was playing music for the king's dinner.

"Uh...oh yeah!" said Cassius, "If you want, sure!"

He got up and helped her to her feet. He led her out and he bowed while she curtsied. The quartet up above changed their tune to a steady waltz and Cassius began to dance.

"One...two...three...one...two...three...ONE...two...three...Turn...and. ..three...one..."

"You're not nervous, are you?" Minerva asked. "At least you're easier to dance with than Fortis!"

"Is Fortis a bad dancer?"

"He's twice my height! I can never reach up high enough for the turns! I keep tripping over!"

Cassius laughed.

"I can't imagine your brother dancing!"

"Oh he's quite good, when he puts his mind to it".

"I think I'm about to find out", said Cassius. He twisted Minerva around so that she could see. She watched as the king and queen, Fortis and Eldonia, and some of the other couples, paired off and wandered into the middle of the room.

"Fortis's favourite dance is the Sword Dance", said Minerva.

"Oh I can't do that", said Cassius. "You need a lot of upper-body strength. I don't have that yet".

When the dance was over, Minerva and Cassius broke off. She backed away from the prince, and felt someone touch her!

"Can I have this next dance?"

She turned to see the lined face of Lord Vergallen.

"I...I feel rather faint", she said, "I think I need to sit down".

"I said, can I have this dance?"

Minerva felt a slight tension on her wrists and shoulders.

Whenever Fortis squeezed her like that, it was a brotherly and playful show of strength. But Minerva felt no sense of play here!

"Thank you, my lord, but I'd rather not..."

"I insist!"

"And I desist!"

"The girl says no..." came a heavy voice from behind Lord Vergallen. "Now I suggest you let go of her shoulders...NOW!"

Minerva felt a slackness and release. The older man lumbered off, grumbling. Minerva stared up at her brother.

"So, you two ladies don't need a chaperone, huh..." Fortis snorted. "You look tired, girl. Go to bed".

"I'm not tired!"

"Go...to...BED", said Fortis. "Or have you forgotten that tomorrow we're pickin' out your precious servants?"

"Oh!" said Minerva. She'd totally forgotten! "Yes I...I suppose I should sleep, shouldn't I?"

Fortis nodded. Minerva hopped up on her tip-toes and kissed her brother, and hugged Eldonia. Cassius smiled.

"I'll take you back to your room", said Cassius. "You don't want to get lost this late at night".

Prince Cassius led Minerva through the passageways and stairways.

"Do your brothers dance?"

"Gladius would like to think he can. But I don't think he's so good".

"Where is he?"

"He's in Regis City down south! He's bodyguard to the Fat Princes. I don't think he likes the idea very much!"

"Why not?"

"Well he thinks they're nothin' but pigs! I met the princes. They're different as night and day to us! But they're awful nice. Very kind boys..."

The prince and his girlfriend turned the corner. They saw Lord Vergallen standing in the hallway. He turned as they approached.

"Well hey there young thing..." he said, approaching them. He stood in their way, blocking their path. He stared at the pretty young girl. "Aren't you cute?"

Minerva tensed.

"Good night, Lord Vergallen", she said.

"Oh I don't think so..."

"I do".

She made to move. Lord Vergallen shifted his weight, blocking her path again.

"I'd take it as an insult if you didn't allow me that dance..."

"Good NIGHT, Lord Vergallen!" she said. She moved again. Lord Vergallen grabbed her hand! A scraping sound echoed down the corridor.

Cassius held his unsheathed sword in his hand.

"In the name of my father, King of Mountanian you will unhand that girl at ONCE!" Cassius snapped, suddenly sounding a lot older than he was.

Aurelius Vergallen glared at Cassius, let go of Minerva's arm and trudged off, muttering something under his breath that seemed to rhyme very well with "witch".

"Never mind him", said Cassius, "He's been bitter for years. Nobody ever knows why. Grandpa said it was some sort of family thing that happened years and years ago, but even he's not entirely sure".

Cassius escorted Minerva to her bedroom and then left to allow her to sleep.

Minerva climbed into bed and blew out the candles. The room was plunged into a peaceful darkness with only the moonlight shining through the windows. It was so quiet and relaxing.

Before she knew it, she'd dozed off. She didn't even notice her bedroom door swing open...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Minerva yawned. She hadn't noticed that the door to her suite had opened. She didn't notice the figure creeping in the darkness. She didn't know for an instant what he had on his mind.

It was the settling of the bed which awakened her. She felt something heavy and large rest on the mattress.

"Forty?" she mumbled. She was used to her brother creeping into her bed at night, when he wanted some company.

"Hey girl..."

Minerva was too sleepy to realise that the voice was not the heavy, deep, rich tone of her brother, but the rough, older voice of another man.

"...I told you I'd take it as an insult..."

Before Minerva knew what was happening, she felt herself being pinned down! With one hand, the man opened a dark lantern to give off some light! Minerva stared into the face of the man on top of her! She tried to scream, but a hand covered her mouth!

"...If you didn't!..."

Lord Vergallen pulled off his smalls and hoisted up her nightdress, reaching between her to pull away her undergarments!

"...dance!" he grunted, forcing his weight onto her! Minerva burst into tears! She screamed into his hand! She felt something thick and warm press against a spot between her legs! She kicked furiously but his weight held her legs down! She felt a powerful, violent entrance and she screamed!

"Shut up, bitch!" Aurelius shouted. He slapped her in the face and Minerva burst into tears! Aurelius covered her mouth again as he started pistoning in and out! Minerva wailed! The pain was incredible! She'd never done this before! Then she saw her chance! She opened her mouth and bit down hard on his fingers!

Lord Vergallen howled! He swung his hand back and down! Minerva screamed! She screamed and screamed! She kicked and pushed, trying to get the unfamiliar and unwelcome sensation out from between her thighs! She cried and screamed and sobbed! She pushed hard and fell out of the bed! She scrambled to her feet and ran to the doors! They'd been locked! She shook the handles in vain! Aurelius hoisted her up and slammed her against the wall, resuming his powerful thrusting! She sobbed and lashed out at his face!

"Hey!" a voice shouted from behind the door, "What's goin' on in there!? Minerva you open this door now!"

Minerva kept wailing and screaming!

WHAM!!

The door burst open!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis stared at Lord Vergallen. Lord Vergallen was about a foot taller, but Fortis was younger and stronger. He grabbed the older man furiously by the shoulders and pulled him back! Minerva screamed and fell to the ground!

"YOU GET OFF MY SISTER YOU BASTARD!"

Fortis threw Lord Vergallen to the ground! Minerva sat there in a daze, watching the two men squaring off like two lions fighting for dominance over the pride. Eldonia rushed in and pulled Minerva to her feet!

"Minnie are you alright!?" she cried out. "Oh my goodness look at your face!" she said. "Come here and sit down!" she said, pulling up a chair.

"NOBODY TOUCHES MY SISTER WITHOUT MY PERMISSION!" Fortis roared. He was punching Lord Vergallen with all of his quite considerable strength! The heavy, meaty thuds echoed through the room! "YOU DARE! YOU BASTARD!"

Lord Vergallen fought back! Fortis ducked and weaved, swinging and striking! Fortis got the older man into a powerful headlock and proceeded to rain punches on him! The noise woke up everyone else! Fortis was in an unimaginable rage! He slammed Aurelius into the wall and started beating his head against it!

"LORD VANDERSTORM STOP THIS AT ONCE!"

King Leviathan stood in the doorway. Fortis let go of Lord Vergallen, who spat at Fortis.

"THIS SLUT WAS TRASHING MY SISTER!" Fortis roared. "HE DARES TO TOUCH HER! HE DARES TO HUMILIATE HER! HE HELD HER DOWN AND RAPED HER!" Fortis was bellowing at the top of his lungs, loud enough for the whole palace to hear! "IF YOU DON'T DO SOMETHING ABOUT IT, THEN I WILL!"

"Now Lord Vanderstorm! Aurelius will receive fair trial like every-"

"DAMN YOUR FAIR TRIAL! HE HAD HER PINNED AGAINST THE WALL WITH HIS DICK IN HER CROTCH! I'LL SLICE IT OFF AND FEED IT TO THE WOLVES! HE HAS INSULTED THE HONOUR OF MY FAMILY AND DEFILED MY SISTER'S PURITY! AND FOR THAT INSULT I DEMAND SATISFACTION! Lord Vergallen will accept a duel by swords to first blood at dawn! Do you accept or are you a COWARD!? A COWARD WHO HELPS HIMSELF TO LITTLE GIRLS!?"

When Lord Vergallen didn't answer, Fortis punched him!

"Lord Vanderstorm! Control yourself!" the king snapped. "Aurelius you've acted in a manner of total disgrace! Forthwith I strip you of your title and your land!

Lord Vergallen glared at everyone. He stared at Fortis, "You bastard..."

"Guards!" the king shouted, "Take MISTER Vergallen to a cell and hold him there until dawn".

"I'll do it myself!" said Fortis, grabbing Lord Vergallen by the wrists.

"Lord Vanderstorm...I think you should let the guards handle it. Your sister will need you", said the king. Fortis released Vergallen, bowing to his king's wisdom.

"Yes, your Majesty", he said.

When the room was empty again, Fortis knelt in front of his sister. She was still sobbing while Eldonia applied salve to the bruises on her face.

"You alright, girl?" Fortis asked. Minerva sobbed. Fortis hugged her, his huge arms wrapping around her in a band of security.

"It's okay..." he said. "Ain't gonna hurtcha no more...Shhh-shh-shh...Nothin's wrong..."

"Minerva relax!" said Eldonia. "See? Aren't us girls lucky? We got a big hunk like this fellah here to look after us and defend our virtues!"

Minerva let out a choked laugh at Eldonia's constant optimism. She hugged her brother even harder!

"Awww girl!" said Fortis, stroking her hair. "You're alright now...C'mon, both of you're gonna sleep with me tonight. Ain't lettin' neither of you out of my sight!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis lay in bed.

Snuggled up on his right side, his little sister Minerva, her head resting on his huge bicep. Snuggled up against him on his left side with her head resting on his huge chest, his wife slumbered peacefully.

"Kurka-kurka-roooo!!"

Fortis yawned. That damn rooster...

He tried as delicately as a man of his size could, to slip out of bed without waking the two best girls in his life. He lowered their heads onto the pillows, drew up the blankets and got dressed. He picked up his sword and left the bedchamber.

Fortis entered the courtyard of the palace and stared around. The old man was a no-show. He snorted. He might've known.

"Lord Vanderstorm!"

The young nobleman turned around. Achilles, the king's assistant, jogged up to him. "You're looking for Lord Vergallen?"

He nodded wordlessly.

"I'm afraid you can't duel with him today, sir".

Fortis snorted. "Why?" he asked, his tone dangerously soft.

"Well um...ahmmm...see...um...he's not fit to duel".

Fortis glowered.

"Is he breathing?"

"Yes, my lord!"

"THEN GET HIS ASS OUT HERE NOW!"

"Yes, my lord! But you see..."

"NOW!"

"He's in the infirmary!"

"I DON'T CARE IF HE'S GIVING BIRTH! GET HIM OUT NOW!"

"He's got a broken nose, two missing teeth, a broken jaw, a concussion, a dislocated shoulder, broken arm, wrist, two cracked ribs, a punctured lung..."

"Now...Achilles..." Fortis said, his voice still in the danger-zone.

"...A burst ear-drum, stitches along the back of his head, a broken cheekbone...and two dislocated fingers".

"I don't care if his ass fell off! GET HIM OUT HERE!"

"My lord! He's still recovering from his injuries!"

Fortis fumed! He turned and walked smack-bang into the king, who was out for his dawn walk.

"My lord", he said. Fortis ignored him.

"Lord Vanderstorm!"

Fortis stopped.

The king approached him.

"Now listen, I know that you are EXTREMELY angry. And you have every right and justification to be so. But I MUST insist that you call off the duel".

"Absolutely NOT! And you know just as well as I do that a duel is not against the laws of our kingdom!"

"Indeed not", said Leviathan. Indeed, duelling had been legal in Mountania for as long as the kingdom ever existed! "But I seriously think that you have caused enough damage alre..."

"*I*...have caused enough damage?" Fortis asked softly. "I...caused...enough...damage?"

Fortis exploded!

"IF THAT BASTARD'S GOT MY SISTER PREGNANT I WILL PERSONALLY SLICE OFF HIS BALLS AND MAKE HIM EAT THEM! THEN I WILL SHAVE HIS DICK INTO LITTLE BACON STRIPS WHILE HE'S STILL ALIVE AND POUR SALT ON IT AND STAND THERE WHILE HE SCREAMS! I WILL MAKE HIM BEG FOR ME TO KILL HIM BEFORE THE SUN SETS! I WILL PULL OUT EVERY SINGLE ONE OF HIS TEETH WITH RED HOT PLIERS! I WILL GOUGE HIS EYES OUT WITH A MELON-BALLER! I WILL SLICE HIM OPEN AND STRANGLE HIM WITH HIS OWN GUTS! DO YOU UNDERSTAND ME!?"

"LORD VANDERSTORM! DON'T YOU DARE TALK TO ME LIKE THAT!"

Fortis groaned, and suddenly collapsed to the ground and started crying!

The king sighed and got on his knees. He reached out to touch the young nobleman, who merely batted his hands away!

"I...I know this must be extremely hard for you", said the king. "And I don't blame you at all for ANYTHING that you've done! Or said! It's good to vent! I don't even blame you for shouting like that. Goodness knows you have more than enough of a reason to! I know how much your sister means to you. How much you treasure her!"

"No you don't!" Fortis snarled.

"Yes I do, actually. Because Cassius tells me every single day whenever he walks out with Minerva, how much he worries about you".

Fortis snorted.

"Oh he does! He wouldn't want you chasing after him if some sort of harm befell your sister. That's how I know".

"Prince Cassius is...he's a good...Minerva likes him..." Fortis choked.

"Yes she does. And that's another reason why you should protect her! I think you need to calm down a bit. Relax! Go for a walk, have a nice meal! Spend some time with your wife! Make sure your sister is comfortable..."

Fortis nodded.

"Right", he said.

"Good!" said the king, helping Fortis to his feet.

"Right after the duel!"

The king sighed and shook his head. "Perhaps you should come with me", he said.

Fortis followed the king inside. He led him to the infirmary. Lying on a bed at the back was Lord Vergallen, although he was hardly recognisable! Bandages covered most of his face from the relentless beating that Fortis had dealt out the night before. One arm was in a sling and his fingers were bandaged.

"Now do you see why he can't duel with you?" the king asked.

Fortis nodded.

He sat down on the bed with Lord Vergallen and leaned inwards.

"If...you...EVER...Touch...speak...LOOK...BREATHE on my sister again..."

Fortis reached out with a hand.

Before anyone could stop him, he had opened the front of Lord Vergallen's infirmary-gown! He had an iron grip around his testicles and was crushing them in his hands with a powerful squeeze! The bandaged face contorted with pain!

"...I will PERSONALLY...FIND YOU...TAKE YOU...and kill you. Slowly, painfully and without mercy. Over the course of several days and weeks...until you will BEG me to kill you. And I still won't listen. Do I make myself CLEAR!?"

Lord Vergallen didn't answer.

"YES!?"

Fortis punched the nobleman hard in the scrotum, making him hunch up in pain! A jolting nod was extracted as an answer.

"Alright then..." said Fortis. He held out a hand. "Let's shake on it".

Lord Vergallen held out a feeble hand. Fortis grasped it.

Before the king could react, Fortis slipped out of Aurelius's grip! He grasped his hand the nurses screamed when they herad a sickening "CRUNCH!" Lord Vergallen howled in agony as Fortis twisted his whole wrist around!

"Good!" he said. "Matron, his lordship has injured himself carrying some barrels of wine. Make sure he gets all the treatment that he deserves..." he added, and left the ward.

"My lord!" said the king, "I do NOT approve of that".

"I do", said Fortis.

"Now see here!" said King Leviathan. "I will allow this. Lord Vergallen has been a thorn in my side for years and because I wish to see him receive his just desserts, I will pretend I did not see what just happened. But in return you will promise me that you will seek no further revenge upon his lordship".

Fortis glowered, but then took a deep breath. Then he bowed.

"I will do as my liege lord commands", he said softly.

The king nodded. "Now..." he said more brightly, "You and your family will join mine, for breakfast! And then we shall look into those servants which you were so anxious about..."

Fortis groaned! So much had happened in the last twenty-four hours, that he'd totally forgotten about the whole REASON for their visit!

He nodded. "Yes sir!" he said, more like his old self, "I'll go and see how the girls are".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"You'll be relieved to know that as nothing of a um...climactic nature...took place...I would say that pregnancy would be extremely unlikely".

Dr. Raspin was a tall, thin man. He was not strong, per-se, but he looked capable. Minerva was lying on the bed with her legs spread. Not something she was very happy with, but Eldonia had insisted on it.

"So doc, is she um...intact?" Eldonia whispered.

"Unfortunately not..." said the doctor. Minerva wailed! She was saving herself for her husband!...eventually.

She wanted the man who was going to make her children and make her happy, have the honour of opening her up for the first time, to give her, her first real dose of pleasure...instead...now it was all gone...

Eldonia hugged her sister-in-law and kissed her.

"Thanks doc", she said. Minerva sniffled and sobbed, trying hard not to cry, but failing miserably.

The bedroom doors swung open just as the doctor was leaving. Fortis entered. Eldonia gulped. He looked furious!

"How was it?" she asked.

"It didn't...happen..." Fortis glowered. He looked as angry as a five-year-old boy who'd been told that he couldn't go to the county fair!

"What!?" Eldonia fumed, "Why not!?" she demanded. "He RAPED her! And she's my best friend! Now you DO SOMETHING about this!" she snapped. Eldonia might've been overshadowed by her husband by nearly five feet, but she wasn't about to let him boss her around!

"Have you actually gone to the infirmary to look at him? I didn't think I did so much to him..."

"Not NEARLY as much as HE did to her!" Eldonia cried out, pointing to Minerva. "I DEMAND that you DO SOMETHING!"

"Will you be quiet!?" Fortis snapped. "You think I didn't want to!? Hell, even the king wasn't happy about it! But Lord Vergallen can't fight a duel! He can barely stand up!"

"GOOD!" Eldonia fumed. "I mean...what!?"

"Uh...what was it again...um...broken jaw, broken nose, broken ribs, broken arm, broken fingers...punctured lung..."

Eldonia listened to her husband's impressive list of injuries.

"Are we to be satisfied with that then, without formal revenge!?" she fumed.

"For the time-being. Yes".

Eldonia let out a low groan of frustration. Fortis hugged her close.

"Sweetie. You know I'd like to do more, but..."

"I'LL MURDER HIM IN HIS BED!"

"Shhh-shhh-shhh..." Fortis whispered. "Don't worry sweetkins...I've had a talk with him and..."

"TALK? What did he do? Invite you over for tea and cake!?"

"I have gained his assurances that he will leave our family alone".

"Oh he better!" said Eldonia. "Where is that rat!? We'll see how much he likes it when he's got a four-foot fireplace poker shoved up his ass!" she scowled, snatching up the instrument in question from the rack next to the mantlepiece!

"Ellie!" Fortis said. "Trust me, nothing would give me greater pleasure than to do EXACTLY what you suggest. But we can't. Not right now, alright?"

Eldonia sighed. "I'm just SO ANGRY!" she sobbed.

"I know, sweetheart. And I'm angry too...Tell you what. The king's invited us all for breakfast. Now we better hurry or we'll be late!"

Eldonia sighed again. "I suppose it would help", she grumbled.

Fortis smiled. He turned to his sister who was still crying.

"Girl!" he said, "You comin'?"

Minerva shook her head.

"Aww..."

Fortis got onto the bed and touched her. She batted his hand away!

"Girl!" Fortis said, "Listen, I wish I could help you more, but...You sure you don't want breakfast? Prince Cassius will be there. The cute prince...You like him, right? Y'know he's sweet on you...You wouldn't want him to see you all teary-eyed and crying, would you?"

"OH GO AWAY!!" Minerva shrieked! Fortis stared at his sister in shock! She'd NEVER snapped at him like this before!

Not because she never dared, or never tried...she never wanted to, before now!

"I..." Fortis began. Eldonia wrapped her hands around her husband's waist.

"Leave her alone..." she whispered. "She needs to rest! She's just had a VERY trying experience!"

Fortis sighed. "I guess you're right...come on".

--- --- --- ---

"Oh the poor darling!"

Queen Athena shook her head and turned to her husband, "You had better have done something about this!" she said.

"There's not much I CAN do", said King Leviathan. "Lord Vanderstorm here beat up Lord Vergallen so bad the man can't even walk!"

"GOOD!" the queen said forcefully! "He's such a toad! I don't even know WHY you put up with him!"

"I suppose I shouldn't", said the king.

The Queen "Hurrmph!"ed in disapproval.

"How fairs your sister, my lord?" she asked.

"She's resting", said Fortis simply. "She's...Who knows what she is. This isn't the first time it's happened. I don't know what it is about my sister! She seems to attract the people who are the worst for her!"

"Hey!" Prince Cassius called out.

Eldonia laughed.

"She's always been well...delicate and...impressionable", Fortis said. "I love her and...well...we'll just have to see", he said.

Fortis suddenly felt arms around his chest. He turned to feel Minerva's face press against his. She kissed him.

Fortis wrapped a huge arm securely around his sister. "Are you okay?" he whispered. She nodded.

"I...I thought I probably should have...something...to eat", she whispered.

"Come and sit over here, my darling!" the queen said. She shook her head at the bruises on Minerva's face and wrists. "Absolutely disgusting!" she said. "You poor thing...Cassius!"

Cassius jumped! He was so taken aback by what had happened that he'd forgotten to help Minerva into her seat!

"You'll be alright", he said. "We'll look after you".

"What if he comes back?" Minerva whispered.

"What's that?"

"What if he comes back!?"

"If he comes back I will personally torture him to death!" Fortis said, stabbing a sausage with his fork.

"...Oh..." said Minerva softly. She turned to Cassius, "Fortis loves me so very much..." she said in barely a whisper. The whole table erupted in laughter!

"That's more like it!" said King Leviathan. "Now come along everyone! Eat up! Who wants waffles?"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Cassius", said King Leviathan as the servants cleared the table, "Lord Vanderstorm and his family are here to select some new servants for their household staff. I've already told the Lord Chamberlain to assemble all the servants looking for new positions. You'll take his lordship and his family to the assembly area where they can pick out their servants".

"Yes father!" said Cassius. He got up and watched as the Vanderstorms gathered. He approached them and made to take Minerva's hand. Fortis stepped forward, blocking his path. Not wanting a confrontation with Lord Vanderstorm, Cassius dropped his hand. Fortis hoisted his sister up in his colossal arms and carried her bodily from the room.

"He sure is protective..." Cassius whispered to Eldonia. She smiled. "It's a good quality in a husband", she whispered back.

Minerva sighed. "Forty..." she whispered, "You don't have to carry me! I can walk!"

"Ain't lettin' NOBODY touch you", said Fortis firmly.

"Cassius isn't anybody! He's a prince!"

Fortis fixed his sister with a look that actually made her scared of her brother for the first time in her memory. She decided to drop the subject. He was obviously still seething inside.

The servants had gathered in the servants' hall and Cassius walked down the line, introducing each of them in turn. Fortis, Eldonia or Minerva all shook their heads as they headed past each two or three boys and girls.

Too small.
Too weak.
Too old!
Too fat.
Too skinny.
We can't have THAT thing working in our house!
Too young.

Finally, Eldonia and Minerva stopped.

Standing in front of them was a tall boy. He was slim, handsome, pale, with light blond hair and sky-blue eyes. He did not look very muscular, but he had a slim, athletic build.

"What is your name?" Minerva asked.

"Zachariah, my lady", the boy said. He looked about fifteen.

"How old are you?" Eldonia asked.

"Thirteen, ma'am", the boy said. Eldonia smiled. She waved her husband over. She smiled and pointed to Zachariah and smiled.

"What's your name, boy!?" Fortis barked.

Zachariah's jaw dropped...he stared up...and...up...and UP at the colossal, hulking, gigantic young Mountain lord...

"Z-z-z-z..."

"Ain't no time for sleepin', boy! What's your name!?"

'Zachariah!" said Eldonia, seeing that Fortis's presence was clearly terrifying the boy!

"What's your last name, boy?"

"Vv-v-va-vandersteen, m-my lord!"

"Hmm. Good name. You live up to it, boy?"

"I-i-iI I try, my lord!"

Fortis snorted. "You better. We lookin' for a hall-boy, a maid and a footman..."

Fortis cast his critical eyes up and down. "Y'ain't that big, boy!"

"F-f-five f-foot fou-four, my lord..."

Fortis snorted again. "Too small".

"But..." Eldonia began.

"I don't need a boy who can do backflips under a coffee-table!"

"But Forty! He could do other things!" said Eldonia, "I think he could work out very well!"

Fortis turned back.

"Why should I hire you as a footman?" he asked. "Can you run?"

"Yessir!"

"Can you carry stuff? Trays? Food? Dishes? Clothes?"

"Yessir!"

"Can you manage trunks? Cases? Luggage?"

"Yessir!"

"Firewood!?"

"Yessir!"

"You know much about the nobility, boy?"

"Yessir!"

"No you don't! You will speak to me as Yes My Lord, and as nothing else! Do you understand!?"

"Yess-...uh..m-my lord!"

Fortis grunted and shook his head. Cassius stepped in.

"Lord Vanderstorm, Zachariah does have other qualities", he said. "He's got a younger brother and sister!"

"And what use are they? We're running an estate here! Not a daycare-center!"

"W-well you wanted a hallboy and page, and you wanted a new undermaid...And if you select Zachariah, by law, they have to go with him!"

"But what if I don't select Zachariah?" Fortis asked. "Then they can stay put!"

"Zach, go and get your brother and sister!" Cassius whispered. He could tell that Fortis was still mighty steamed from the incident with Lord Vergallen. His fuse was short and his temper hot. Zach ran off and returned less than a minute later with his brother and sister. Fortis turned to look at them.

"C'mere sirrah!" Fortis barked. The younger boy stepped forward. He had darker blond hair than his older brother and was smaller. He was solidly built and looked like a capable youngster with a bit of spunk in him.

"You know how to light a fire, boy?"

"Yes m'lord!"

"Huh...Good! How old are you, boy?"

"Eight, sir!"

"And your sister?"

"Five, sir!"

"Hmmm".

Fortis stared at the girl. She was TINY! She could probably sleep in a stew-pot! He turned, but was blocked by his sister and his wife, diminutive as they were. He could see that their hearts had melted at the sight of the youngsters. He groaned.

"Alright!" he grumbled. "Take them! But they better work good or else I'll be back here next week!" he said.

Zachariah, his little brother Hermes, and his sister Lucy, followed the intimidating mountain lord out of the servants quarters.

"Penny!"

Penelope entered her mistress's guestroom and curtsied. "My lady", she said. "I hope you're much-recovered, my lady".

"I shall never recover!" said Minerva, firmly. "But I don't wish to dwell on the past. This is Zachariah. His brother Hermes, and his little sister Lucy. They'll be coming home with us as our new servants".

"Oh! Yes m'lady" said Penny.

"I thought you should all get to know each other before we go", Minerva said. "Fortis is eager to leave as soon as possible".

"Yes m'lady. I already started packing your things, my lady".

"Thank you!"

Minerva left the room. She needed to walk to clear her head.

Little Lucy began to cry...

"What's the matter, Luce?" said Zachariah, getting on his knees in front of his sister, "You sad?"

She whispered something into her brother's ear.

"Oh I'm sure it won't be so bad!"

"What's the matter?" Penny asked.

"She says she's scared of the big man".

"Big man?"

"Lord Vanderwhatisname..."

"Oh!!" Penny said, and giggled. "Oh come here! You've nothing to be scared of! Lord Vanderstorm is a VERY nice person! He's just...grabbity and grouchy right now because well...something bad happened, and he's very angry about it. But he'll calm down...eventually. And then you'll love him! I promise!"

"You do?" Lucy sniffled.

Penny nodded, "I do! You don't need to fear his lordship! Besides! You must be very used to the sight of big mountain lords, living in the palace!"

"Actually she isn't", said Zachariah. "Hermes and Lucy aren't allowed upstairs".

"...Oh!" said Penny.

Penny stared at the collection of people in front of her. Little Lucy was a timid, shy creature, but one of incredible softness and beauty. Hermes was short, stocky and looked well-built for a boy of only eight. Zachariah was muscled, but slim. Not overly tall, but tall enough to be noticed. He looked like a kindly and handsome boy.

WHAM!! WHAM!!

Penny squealed! Lucy ran to her and hugged her! Zachary jumped out of his skin!

"Where is she!?" Fortis called out, lumbering inside.

"L-l-l-lady M-minerva we-went f-for a walk, m-my lord!" Penny stammered. Fortis snorted.

"Pack up this crap!" he said, gesturing towards the travelling trunks and bags. "We're leaving after lunch. Take it down and see it's stored in the coach. You three! Start earnin' your keep! Go pack up all your stuff and dump it in the carriage. Penny'll show you where it is! Move it!"

Fortis left, slamming the doors behind him.

Penny smiled. "Breakfast has improved his mood, I see", she said.

"That's an improvement!?" Zachary gasped.

"Well his lordship was very upset yesterday".

"I'm afraid to ask..." Zachariah mumbled. "Come on guys, let's go pack our stuff before he comes back and rips our heads off...It's a figure of speech, Lucy!" he said, when his sister began whimpering again.

After lunch, Fortis and everyone else got into the carriage.

"Penny, Minerva, Eldonia. In. You two, young'uns, in. You, boy! Up in the box".

Zachariah climbed into the driver's box. Fortis climbed up next to him. Fortis was so tall and broad that he almost took up the entire front seat by himself! Zachariah held onto the handrails, not wanting to fall off!

"YAH!!" Fortis roared. The four horses neighed and clopped off.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Hey grandma hurry up! They're back!"

Lady Athena hurried downstairs. Her two other grandsons bounded past her. They assembled in front of the doors. Fortis led the way, with his sister and their servants behind them.

"We got your letter!" said Athena. "Oh Minerva are you alright?"

"She'll be fine, grandma", Fortis said, "It was a once off. I made sure of it".

"I hope you didn't do anything that you'll regret, young Fortis!"

"No. But that Vergallen fellah certainly did. He won't walk straight for six months. And if he's lucky, he'll be able to eat baby-food..."

Jupiter and Cannius laughed. "You're exaggerating, Forty!"

"Am not!" said Fortis, haughtily. "Anyway, these are the new kids", he said, gesturing towards the serving-children.

Lady Athena frowned. She stared at Zacharia, his younger brother Hermes, and his little sister, Lucy.

"It's very nice to meet you", she said. "The girl's rather young..."

"She'll be fine, grandma. We got that other little girl. What's her name?"

"Katie? Yes, I suppose so", said Athena. "Penny, take the new servants to their quarters and see that they're introduced properly".

"Yes m'lady!" said Penny. "Come along!...M'lords..." she added, curtsying to Cannius and Jupiter. The three newcomers followed her into the castle.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Come along!" said Penny to her new servants, "We've got stuff to do!"

In the servants' hall, the three newcomers sat down. The other servants, most of them teenagers, stared at them.

"This is Perseus", said Penny, "This is his sister Katie..."

The two little girls waved at each other.

"This is Eliza, the head housemaid. This is..."

Jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle!

Cling-cling-cling-cling-cling!

Dingle-dingle-dingle-dingle!!

"Oh bother!" Penny sighed. "I should've known this would happen! They're all back and it's back to work for us!"

"You wait here!" said Eliza, "We won't be gone long. Just you all sit tight and don't wander off anywhere. And don't touch anything!"

The three youngsters sat at the table while the others hurried off to their duties.

They watched as servant-girls and boys moved hither and thither, and thither and yon, and within and without.

"Oh damn!" said one girl, hurrying into the hall, "Where's the blacking!? And the rags!? Eliza!"

"I haven't touched them!"

"But Lord Jupiter wishes to clean his boots!"

"Ask Koviac!"

"Hey I haven't seen nothing!"

"Oh blast! Out of the way you three! Begone from here!...THERE'S the blacking!...Now where are those rags!?"

"Mattie! Did you take my button-hooks!?"

"Certainly not, Penny! What would I need with them!? I'm not a lady's maid!"

"Well then where are they!?"

"I bet you left them in the scullery!"

"I...Oh gosh you're right! Oh no! I hope they haven't gone and tarnished!"

Trying not to get run over, the three raw recruits retreated from the bustling servants' hall into the kitchen.

"EMILY! Will you hurry up with that water, girl!?" a fat, middle-aged woman cried out, "I need it for the chicken!"

"Can we help?" Zacharia asked.

"Oh out of my way!" the woman fumed, "EMILY!"

"Here we are!" said a girl, rushing in, carrying two buckets of water from the well, "The water!"

"At last! Fill up the big pot and put it on the stove! Not so much!...Careful, girl! Careful! Now go and prepare the dough! DRY YOUR HANDS FIRST YOU SILLY GIRL!"

Just then, Penny came back.

"What's going on!? I thought I told you to wait in the hall!?"

"We were going to! But Cook looked like she needed some help, and..." Hermes began.

"I certainly do not! And it's Mrs. Tibbs, if you please! Not 'cook'! This is a nobleman's household! Not a two-penny inn-house! I'll not be called by what ain't my proper title! Not around here!"

"Of course not, Mrs. T.," said Penny, "What are you making there, Missus?"

"IF it ever gets DONE, it'll be chicken dumplings with noodles for our dinner this evening!"

"Oooh yum!" said another servant-girl. "I do like your dumplings, Mrs. Tibbs!"

Mrs. Tibbs nodded appreciatively, "It's nice to know, Mattie. Now, who are these!?"

Oh!" said Penny, "Sorry...Mrs. Tibbs, this is Zacharia, and his brother Hermes, and their little sister Lucy".

"Lucy, eh? How old are you, girl?"

Lucy held up five fingers.

"Hmmm. I daresay you could make a good companion to that girl Katie. And what are you two supposed to be?"

"Zacharia's to be the new footman, Mrs. Tibbs. And his brother's to be the hallboy".

"A hallboy we have now, do we? Well it took some time, I must say! But perhaps things will get done, now! I hope you're a strong, capable young lad!"

"Yessum!" said Hermes, standing up straight.

"This is Mrs. Tibbs, everyone", said Penny, "She's the housekeeper and cook".

"I am that!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "Although these days, I spend more time as cook than housekeeper, one day Eliza will do that. If she can spend enough time away from his lordship's bedchamber...!"

Eliza blushed.

"It's nothing, Mrs. T.!"

"Nothing, is it!? I do wonder! Anyway, enough of that...what time does the Dowager want dinner served?"

"The usual time, Mrs. Tibbs", said Mattie, the second housemaid.

"Very good. Perseus!"

Perseus hurried forward. He stopped and stared at Hermes. The two boys smiled at each other.

"Perseus is the pageboy", Penny explained.

"Perseus. Tell his lordship and his family that dinner will be at the usual time. Roast beef, bread, sausages, eggs, a rack of lamb cutlets and a fresh salad with cream sauce!"

"Yessum!" said Perseus.

"Aaaah! A pageboy does NOT run!"

"No'um!" he said, and started a slow walk from the kitchen.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"You got any questions at all, you ask me", said Mrs. Tibbs.

The cook stood in front of the fire, poking a chicken inside a pot of water. "I've worked for the Vanderstorm family my entire life! I know every single member, I know the entire estate!"

Lucy and Katie, the two new scullery maids, were busy cleaning the pots and pans. Nearby, Emily the kitchen-maid was busy kneading dough. Zachariah was polishing the silverware and his brother Hermes was sweeping the floor.

"Ask whatever you like!" said Mrs. Tibbs.

"Is his Lordship really mean?" Lucy asked Katie. Katie blushed.

"Oooh his Lordship's not mean!" said Mrs. Tibbs. She put the lid back on the pot with a loud 'clang!', "Emily, how's them dumplings coming along!? Good gracious girl! I said KNEAD it! Not...Like this! In...out! Keep it moving! Up! Down! Back! Forward! Just fiddling around with it won't do it any good at all! Go and look to the soup, girl! I'll handle this!"

"Who's everyone in the house?" Hermes asked as he swept around the stove and fireplace.

"His Lordship, the earl Fortis", said Mrs. Tibbs, "His twin brothers, Cannius and Jupiter...His young sister Minerva...You'll like her. She's very sweet! His wife, Eldonia...and their grandmother, the Dowager Countess, Lady Athena Vanderstorm".

"And Leo!" said Emily.

"Who?"

"The baby!"

"Oh yes! His lordship's got a new son! His first little darling! Young Master Leonardo! He's a handful, just like his father was!"

"Can we see the baby?" Lucy asked.

"I very much doubt it", said Mrs. Tibbs, "But then, that child crawls everywhere. He may crawl in here. It's happened before, hasn't it, Katie?"

"Yes!" said Katie, smiling. "Oooh he's so cute!"

"What's he like?"

"Well he's got blond hair like his papa! And he's adorable! You'll like him, if you get to meet him".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
The carriage bumped along the dusty road. The girls had dozed off and Hermes was staring out of the windows looking at the countryside. It was so beautiful!

He was watching a rabbit hopping alongside the road when a whistling noise whipped through the air! Suddenly, something thudded into the carriage wall! Hermes yelped! An arrow stuck through the side of the carriage, just inches from where he was! The horses neighed and whinnied! Fortis hauled on the reins!

"Hey! HEY!" he roared, "Hold it!" he shouted.

Zachariah yelped as more arrows whistled past! The girls screamed when one arrow smashed through one of the carriage windows! Fortis climbed down from the carriage and stared around. He didn't see anything.

He turned, and then out of the bushes came four armed men! Two had bows and arrows and two had swords.

"You!" one of the men shouted, pointing at Fortis, "Leave your gold! Your weapons! Your valuables and the carriage will pass unheeded!"

Fortis glared at the man. He was about seven feet tall. But that was still much shorter than Fortis.

"Yeah?" Fortis asked. "How about...you fuck off...you leave your swords and bows and arrows...and I'll pretend this never happened".

The archers raised their bows and pulled back on their arrows.

"Alright!" Fortis said. He unbuckled his scabbard and held out his sword. "Here".

One of the men stepped forward to retrieve it. He grabbed the scabbard, but Fortis pulled the huge battlesword out of the end of it! He stepped back, waved the heavy blade through the air and in one fell swoop, smashed through both men, sliccing their heads off at their necks! The useless corpses dropped the ground, the heads thumping on the dirt like coconuts falling out of a tree. The girls screamed and Zachariah gasped. Fortis turned, blood splattered everywhere and dripping off the sword. He turned to the other two men.

"I have had a VERY bad weekend..." he said. "...and you are not making me any better", he said.

Dropping their bows, the men pulled out short-swords! Fortis whirled his huge battle-sword through the air! Zachariah clapped his hands to his ears! Minerva covered little Lucy's eyes! The screeching of steel on steel was deafening! Fortis swung back and forth! Clash! Clang! Smash! REEEK!! The two other men were smaller and could move faster, but the sheer force and power behind connecting with one of the Mountain lord's massive swordstrikes sent vibrations jolting through their entire bodies!

Fortis swung his huge sword down, and one of the men screamed! There was a "thud!" as his useless right arm, sword intact, fell to the ground! Fortis grabbed the man and slammed him up against a tree! He started beating him furiously! Slamming his body into the trunk with loud, hollow thudding noises! He dropped him to the ground and turned on the other man. The man let out a wail of fear, dropped his sword and ran! Fortis chased the man down and tackled him on the road, easily pinning him down under his tonnage!

"Please my lord!" the man grovelled, "I beg of your mercy! W-w-w-we d-didn't w-want an-anything b-but -t-the m-m-mmoney! Have mercy, my lord!" he sobbed.

"Go!" Fortis grunted, getting up. The man backed away and stared at Fortis. Fortis smiled and returned to the carriage. The man got up and began to stumble and limp away! Before he'd gotten very far, Fortis had kicked one of the bows into his hands and loaded it with a shaft. The girls watched from the carriage as the bow was pulled back and then the arrow was loosed.

In the distance, they fancied they heard a thudding sound of something hitting the earth...

Fortis wiped down his sword, gathered up the dropped weapons, threw them into a trunk at the back of the carriage and climbed back into the driver's seat. Zachariah stared at him in horror!

"What'cha lookin' at!?" Fortis grunted.

"N-n-no-nothing m-m-my lord!!" Zachary whimpered.

Fortis grunted.

"YAH!" he shouted, whipping the horses into motion again.

Minerva and Eldonia cleaned up the mess of broken glass inside the carriage, throwing the bits out the window and removing the two arrows fired at the carriage. Meanwhile, Hermes was staring out of one of the windows, up at Fortis who was now driving them home.

"Wooooooooooooowwww!" he said. "Lucy did you see that!? He was like...woosh! Woosh! Woosh! SMASH!! That was SO COOL!! Oh wow I wish I could do that! And then I'd be cool! Oh that was Awesome!!"

Lucy didn't see what was so incredible about it! But Hermes was rapt! He stared at Fortis like he was some sort of god!

At their first rest-stop, a small village about halfway home, they all hopped out for drinks and a break. The women used the facilities, and Zachariah helped Fortis to fit in a new pane of glass into the broken window, using one taken from the village glazier.

The horses were fed, watered and rested, and then hitched up again for another ride. Fortis had a quick strip-wash, and then got back into the driver's seat.

"Hi!"

The enormous Mountain lord stared at a tiny figure sitting in the seat next to him. Hermes had usurped his brother's position as the driver's companion, apparently!

"Hermes..." said Fortis. "COME ON GIRLS! I WANNA GET BACK BEFORE THE MIDWINTER FESTIVALS!!" he shouted. He watched as the girls skittered forwards and climbed into the carriage. Zachariah closed the doors and the carriage was on its way.

"That stuff was cool!" said Hermes, once the carriage was on the way, "All that...thrusting and...swiping and...Wooow!!"

Fortis smirked. It'd been a while since anyone had commented on his combat abilities. He leaned back in the driver's seat.

"You like that stuff, huh?" he asked, putting a huge arm around Hermes's back. The awestruck youngster nodded so hard, his head might fall off! He was acting like he'd just met his favourite movie-star!

Fortis chuckled and flexed a powerful forearm. Hermes turned when he felt the monster's huge biceps and triceps expand behind him.

"Can I see your sword!?" Hermes asked. Fortis nodded. The boy grabbed the heavy handle and tried to pull the sword out of the scabbard! It was immensely heavy! He could hardly draw it out, let alone hold it! It was so heavy! And yet he'd seen Fortis wield this monster in ONE HAND! Hermes stared at his reflection in the blade.

"Wooow!" he said. "How many people have you killed with this!?"

"I don't know..." said Fortis, casually. "I didn't really keep track the last time I went on a border-skirmish..."

"You fought the Vladians!?"

"Sure I did! What, you think King Leviathan lets me keep my family estate for nothing!?"

"N-n-no sir!" said Hermes, "I only meant..."

"Yes, I did", said Fortis.

The boy's jaw dropped.

"Wooooooooooooooow..."

"Don't you ever say anything else than that?" Fortis asked, chuckling. He could tell that young Hermes was mightily impressed!

And Hermes was! He was gonna be living with a super-huge, giant warrior lord! A bloodthirsty, merciless Mountainian monster! Someone who gave no quarter and showed no mercy! Someone who...who...who....

Hermes then admitted to himself, he didn't know what else!...But it sounded cool!!

By sunset, Fortis could see lights in the distance. Their village was finally in sight...and beyond the village...the lights of Castle Vanderstorm...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Gran'ma!"

Lady Athena jumped! Jupiter put his arms around his grandmother and squeezed her fondly from behind.

"You should be in bed!"

"I'm not going to bed until I've seen your brother and sister safely home!" the old woman said. "Are you going to bed?"

"Yeah, me and Cannius are..."

"Cannius and I, Jupiter".

"...we're pretty tired. We're goin' to bed. G'night, granny".

Athena reached up to her grandson's shoulders and pulled him down. She gave him a kiss on the cheek.

"Graaaan! I'm too old for that!"

"Nonsense!" she said, and stroked his hair. "Goodnight, darling!"

Lady Athena sat in her rocking-chair by the fire. She yawned. It was such a slow night. She could smell moisture in the air. It felt like a heavy, summer thunderstorm was on its way. She opened the windows to her bedroom, which overlooked the front drive, and sat down, with a candelabrum casting golden light over the room.

Mrs. Tibbs the housekeeper entered. She had a tray with hot chocolate and cookies on it, and she set it down on the table nearby.

"Your treat, my lady", she whispered.

"Oh thank you, Mrs. Tibbs! Do sit down and join me! I could use the company".

Mrs. Tibbs smiled and sat down, producing another cup and saucer from her apron. She filled the two cups with steaming hot chocolate and silced a large sponge-cake with a knife. In the distance, Athena heard a soft wailing noise.

"Oh dear..." she said. She got out of her rocking chair and shuffled out of the room. "Yes, yes, yes! Granny's coming! Alright, alright..."

Lady Athena returned a few minutes later with a bundle wrapped in blue cloth. Baby Leonardo suckled on a little wooden pacifier. Mortimer the plush-cat clutched in his chubby little baby-hands. Athena sat back down and rocked back and forth with the baby in her lap.

"There there my darling!" she said, stroking the baby, "Hush now...Shhh!"

Wrapped in his blankie, baby Leo soon dozed off. Lady Athena hugged him with one hand, and supped her hot chocolate and nibbled on cake with the other. Outside, the storm broke. Thunder rumbled through the air and rain scattered down! Lightning flashed! Baby Leo woke up and started crying!

"Aww!!" said Lady Athena, "It's alright sweetums!" she said. She got up and moved to the window. She leaned out to close the windows when she heard a neighing sound in the distance. Mrs. Tibbs moved to the window too, and she squealed and pointed!

Dashing down the road at top speed was a black carriage with four blazing carriage-lamps on the sides! It skidded to a halt at the front door where stable-boys came to help offload the passengers and cargo before driving the coach away. The two women upstairs headed down into the foyer. They stood there, nervously.

The doors flew open! The moist heat of the evening rushed in!

A towering figure entered the foyer, covered in a heavy, dark cloak, followed by six other people!

"Huuuaarrgghhh!!"

Fortis ripped off his travelling-cloak and threw it at a rack in the corner, exposing impressive muscles. Penny pushed the doors shut and everyone else slowly took off their cloaks and capes, caps and hoods.

"Gran'ma", said Fortis, roughly, hugging the old woman. "Boy", he said, nodding at a wide-eyed and terrified Leo! Fortis acted as if he was learning his words for the first time.

"Is everything alright?" Lady Athena asked.

"Sure, sure. We got the servants. Girl got raped. Things are fine..."

"Girl?...OH MINERVA!!"

"I'm alright, granny!" said Minerva, "Really, I am! Fortis saved me!"

"I should hope so! What happened!?"

"I'll tell you in the morning!" said Minerva. "Granny, this is Zachariah. This is his brother Hermes. And this is their sister Lucy!"

"Look Hermes! A baby!" Lucy cried out.

Fortis cleared his throat loudly.

Lucy curtsied and the two boys bowed.

"This here's gran'ma", said Fortis. thumping a huge arm on the old woman so roughly he nearly knocked her over. "Now you mind her, you hear? Granny's sweet, and she gonna remain sweet. 'Slong as you do what you's told, okay?"

The three newcomers nodded.

"And this here's Boy!" said Fortis, twiddling the infant's chin. "Leo, say 'Hi'!"

"Oooooooh..." Leo burbled.

"Now come on, it's late", said Fortis, "Miz Tibbs, you show these folks to their quarters. We'll sort all this stuff out tomorrow. It's late, I'm beat".

Slowly, everyone dispersed. After a flurry of activity, the house was silent again...

Fortis groaned as he lumbered upstairs and into the master bedroom. He stripped off down to his undershorts and crawled into bed. What a hell of a day...he needed to...needed to...huuurrghh...sleeeeeep...

Before he knew it, he'd dozed off.

Fortis didn't know how long he'd been asleep, when he heard his bedroom door open. Who was it? He sat up. He could hear by the rustling of cloth that it was a woman's night-gown. He pulled back the curtains around his bed...

"Good evening, my lord..."

Fortis opened his eyes. His youthful wife slinked into his bed and snuggled up next to him. She was wearing only a shifty, silk gown and precious little else. He smiled.

"My lady", he said.

"My lord is so handsome and brave...and strong and powerful! Such a beast...protecting us poor, innocent womenfolk from all the horrors in the world!"

Fortis wrapped his arm around his wife and squeezed her. She rolled over and crawled over his huge body, her hands cupping the solid curvatures of his muscularity, feeling for herself, the physical evidence of her lordship's raw, bestial strength!

She breathed heavily and laid down on top of him.

Suddenly, she squealed as Fortis locked his arms around her! He hugged and squeezed with a vengeance! Eldonia gasped! Fortis kissed her and squeezed her even harder! He chuckled.

"Love yah, woman..." He said. "Such smooth hair..." he said, stroking it. It was cool and soft, and truly as light and smooth as silk! He felt it run through his fingers like rivers of tingling passion. She crawled up until she was right next to him. She whispered in his ear, begging for her noble Mountain Lord to take her to the reaches of far beyond...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Lucy, Katie, Perseus, Hermes and Zachariah stared up at their imposing new master.

"Alright..." said Fortis. "...Katie, Perseus, since you don't have anywhere to call home anymore, my grandmother Lady Athena, gave you her permission to live here at Castle Vanderstorm, in return for positions as household servants. But I haven't given you MY permission to live here. This is MY castle and I decide who lives here. Are you happy to live here and work for your keep?"

Brother and sister whispered to each other. After a couple of minutes, they both nodded.

"Good!" said Fortis. "Then I'll formally accept you as servants. Now..."

Fortis started walking back and forth, in front of the cowering children before him.

"Katie, Lucy, since you're young and inexperienced, you will be scullery-maids. You'll do all the dish-washing, and you'll help with the easier parts of washing clothes. You'll keep the servants hall, kitchen and servants quarters clean. Do you understand?"

The two girls nodded.

"Good. Hermes, Perseus, since you're older and stronger, you'll be the castle's new hall-boys. You'll do general cleaning-work and help your sisters. You'll carry and chop firewood, and keep the servants quarters clean".

The two boys nodded.

"Zachariah, since you're the oldest, and since we do need one to help with more important details, you'll be the castle's footman and pageboy. You'll run messages, you'll help out around the house, you'll clean the silverware and you'll wait at the table during dinner. When the doorbell rings, it's your job to answer it and announce visitors. If Mrs. Tibbs is around, she'll do it for you. If she isn't, then it's your job. Is that all clear?"

Everyone nodded.

"Good. Those are your duties. I expect you to stick to them. Everything else in this house is handled by the housemaids, or Mrs. Tibbs. If you have any questions, ask them. Now, within this house, everyone is going to be happy, and healthy, and comfortable, and safe. If at ANY time, you are not one of these four things, you will tell me at once. Any kind of emergency or problem at all. Speak to Mrs. Tibbs first, and if that doesn't solve the problem, then you come and speak to me. You all understand?"

They all nodded.

"Good. Now, you will address me as 'My Lord', 'Your Lordship', or 'Lord Vanderstorm'. My wife is Lady Vanderstorm, 'My Lady', or 'Your Ladyship'. My sister is Lady Minerva, or 'My Lady'. My brothers are Lord Jupiter and Lord Cannius, or 'My Lord'..."

Fortis paused.

He grabbed his grandmother and gave her a rough, one-armed hug. "And granny here..."

The two youngest girls giggled.

"...is the Dowager Countess. You will address her as Lady Athena, or My Lady. Do you understand?"

Everyone nodded.

"Good. In that case, we can all go to work".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Come along now, children", said Mrs. Tibbs. She took the two girls and the two boys into the servants quarters. She showed them the scullery and washroom, the servants' hall and the kitchen. Large windows opened out onto the gardens beyond, and the rooms were delightfully bright, with high ceilings and high doorways. Mrs. Tibbs showed them where their bedrooms were and how they were expected to sleep. She explained what their daily routines would be and how they would vary throughout the week.

"You have to wash ALL the dishes", she said. "We've got soap for you to do that with. There's cold water on tap, but any hot water you need should be boiled on the stove. There are saucepans and kettles there for you to use. And there are also some oven-mitts to protect your hands. NEVER touch hot metal without them, or you'll burn yourselves VERY badly!" she said.

She showed them where all the cleaning-supplies were and let them organise how they would handle their cleaning-rosters.

"We'll start tomorrow. To save time and water, it's advisable to fill up one BIG tub with hot water and then just place all the things that need washing up, into the tub, along with shaved soap. That way, it can soak in the water all day, and then all you have to do at the end is give it a good scrub, a rinse, and let it drip-dry overnight!"

"What about the rest of the servants quarters?" Katie asked.

"That'll just be sweeping and dusting!" said Mrs. Tibbs, "You can do that easily, I'm sure! I'll show you a few handy tricks about how to do all that. The older girls will handle things like polishing the brass and firing up the stove and cleaning out the ashes and the fireplaces and lighitng fires and candles and so-forth. You don't have to worry about any of that!" she said.

"Today, we'll relax. I've made some cakes and cookies if you want!" she said. "They're in the pantry!"

The kindly old housekeeper cum cook, opened the pantry and brought out sponge-cakes and cookies. She laid them all out on a big trolley and wheeled the whole thing outside. She also had some lemonade in a huge glass jug. She brought out some glasses and let the children sit out in the yard on chairs and tables, eating away.

Upstairs, Fortis smiled. Mrs. Tibbs was a sentimental, sweet-natured old woman. She would know best how to look after the new servants. And he didn't want to spoil their fun.

"What a big house!" Lucy said.
"It's a beautiful castle!" said Katie. "And we get to live here!"

"Lord Vanderstorm is SO cool!" said Hermes to Perseus, "Y'know he killed four guys on the way home!"
"He did not!"
"He did too! I saw him! He sliced two heads off, he smashed another guy against a tree and he shot another guy with a bow and arrow! Splat!"
"Eugh!"
"No, it was not 'eugh!', it was cool! He kicks ass!"
"Hey watch it, or he'll kick our asses!"

A very fat, brown, fluffy bunny, the colour of fresh toffee, bounced away from the nursery, its fat round belly and big floppy ears bouncing around with each determined hop. Butterscotch hopped away down the corridor. He hopped in and out of rooms, and between doors. He hopped and hopped and hopped!

This room was warm and steamy. He hopped up onto a stool. Then he hopped up and stared into the big pond!

Butterscotch was thirsty... and hungry!...Maybe there was something to eat in this pond?

At the same time, Fortis relaxed in his bathroom, oblivious to the escaped woodland pet that was currently loose in his domain. He yawned, his eyes shut...Mmmmmm...

Splash!

"Huh!?" Fortis grunted, "What..."

Then he saw that his block of soap on the bathtub-edge wasn't there anymore.

"Oh..." he mumbled. He fished around, found the soap and put it back. His hand brushed against something fluffy in the water. Stupid washcloth was always floating around. Fortis yawned and closed his eyes again...The water was so hot and wonderful...

Nibble-nibble-nibble...

SIGH!

Tap...tap...tap...

SIGH!

Tap...tap...tap...

"Eldonia?" Minerva asked. "Is there something wrong?"

Eldonia turned from looking out the window of the dining room, where she had been watching her husband build a new larger hutch for Butterscotch since the rabbit had gotten so fat it was now twice the size it was since it arrived here two weeks ago!

"Hmm?" Eldonia asked absently. Her chin was on her hand, and she idly stirred the peas and carrots on her plate, tapping her fork on the fine china plate in boredom.

"Are you feeling alright?" Minerva asked in concern, her brow furrowing. "You're not feeling ill or anything, are you?"

"You have been a bit listless lately," added Lady Athena, taking a sip of tea. A smile crossed her aged face. "You're not expecting again, are you?"

Eldonia snorted and threw her fork down on her plate, slumping down in her chair and crossing her arms over her chest. "One has to have SEX in order to be expecting!" she muttered.

Minerva frowned. "Ellie, what's wrong?"

Eldonia sighed once more and shook her head. "Nothing. I just.... I'm not hungry. I'm gonna get some fresh air."

With that, the young lady of the house got huffily to her feet and hurried out of the dining room.

"What was that all about?" Minerva asked her grandmother.

"Oh, never you mind, dear," said Athena wisely. "Eldonia is just now realizing that she's not the sole focus of Fortis's time and attention. As you know, with Fortis being the Lord of the manor and the surrounding area, he has a lot of responsibilities. For a while, Fortis was able to give her all the attention she wanted, but he's been awful busy with his other duties the last couple of weeks. I think she's been missing his company."

"Oh, is that all?" Minerva laughed. "What a silly thing to be upset about!"

"I agree. However, she may appreciate someone to commiserate with." Athena looked pointedly at her granddaughter, and Minerva brightened.

"I gotcha, Granny. I'll go get Leo, and maybe the both of us can cheer her up."

"That's the spirit!"

***

Eldonia stomped through the flower gardens that Athena loved to tend. Granted, several patches of flowers were noticeably chewed on or missing, courtesy of Butterscotch's appetite, but it was still a lovely and soothing place in the backyard. Unfortunately, the gardens weren't so soothing right at the moment.

Eldonia fumed. For the past two weeks, she had hardly spent any time with her husband! If he wasn't in his study tending to accounts and books, he was out chopping wood, or making repairs to the house or stables, or out with the tenant farmers, helping them with their needs. Jupiter and Cannius were often with him, lending their considerable strength and muscle to building and repairing projects.

Eldonia understood that things had gotten into a bit of disrepair while Fortis had been gone fighting the Vladians and that now with his return there was much up-keep that needed to be done, especially since it wouldn't be long before winter would be setting in.

However, Fortis had been so wearing himself out during the day that her normally horny husband had had no desire to do more than share a bed with her and sleep! They would kiss a few times and snuggle down, but nothing more! Eldonia's young, ripe body was anxious for a bit more action. Despite her attempts at seduction--sultry smiles, wearing scraps of lace and linen that left little to the imagination, running her fingers alluringly along his strong biceps and pecs--Fortis would always yawn and push her away or turn his back to her, ignoring her!

Eldonia was so...sexually frustrated, she wanted to pull her hair out! Before Fortis left for the war and right after he got back, he could hardly keep his hands off her. Now...now it was as if he weren't interested in her anymore! Eldonia came to a halt as a horrible idea came to her. Was Fortis getting his pleasure...from someone else?? Was she not enough to satisfy his needs anymore?? Was some young, naive daughter of one their tenant farmers showing her appreciation of all his efforts...leaving him with no energy to bed his wife at night??

Eldonia walked around the side of the manor house and watched as Fortis whacked and sawed and hammered and cursed as he worked on the new rabbit hutch, Butterscotch lolling about at his feet--a big, fluffy, toffee-colored ball that was so fat it could barely hop! Her heart lurched in her chest as she saw sweat rolling down his naked back and his muscles constricting and flexing with his rough movements. She sighed wearily. How much she loved him, loved the sight of him. And yet, he had been completely ignoring her!

Eldonia straightened up to her full height, a stern look washing over her lovely face. She'd had enough! As his wife, she deserved a bit more consideration from him than a mere kiss goodnight! She wanted a full, steamy night of passion--she deserved one after the past two weeks of celibacy!--and she was gonna get it!

She squared her shoulders and marched over to Fortis, tapping him smartly on his massive deltoid.

"What?!" he grumbled.

"Is that any way to speak to your wife?!"

"I'm busy, girl! Go bother someone else!"

"No! I've had enough of your ignoring me, Fortis! I think I'm due a little more consideration from you!"

"I haven't been ignoring you! I've been extremely busy lately! No go on into the house and take care of Leo! I need to get this new hutch done before that stupid rabbit eats me out of house and home!"

"Oh! So the RABBIT deserves more attention that I DO?"

"LOOK!" he roared, turning around to face her with a hammer held high in his fist. "I DON'T HAVE TIME TO ARGUE WITH YOU! GET IN THE HOUSE AND LEAVE ME ALONE, WOMAN, BEFORE I DO SOMETHING YOU'LL REGRET!"

Eldonia gasped and backed up a few steps. She had seen Fortis angry plenty of times, but he'd never been so livid AT HER before! He looked very scary with his naked chest heaving in anger, his arm raised with the hammer as if ready to strike! His eyes were narrowed, and he glared with fury--at her!

Tears filled Eldonia's eyes. She only wanted a little time with her husband! Was that so much to ask? And Fortis was acting like she was a burden to him! A sob escaped her throat, and she ran off, stumbling a bit as she went.

Fortis realized what he had done too late. He lowered his hammer and ran his free hand over his grimy, sweaty face. He hadn't meant to yell at her like that. To be honest, he had missed his young wife's company the past couple of weeks. However, there was much to do to prepare the estate and his tenants for the winter. Turning back to the half-finished hutch, Fortis took a deep breath and went back to work. He'd finish this up, clean up a bit, have a good dinner, and then he'd see if he could make it up to his wife. His body was certainly telling him that he hadn't seen any action for a while. He was never one for big romantic overtures, but he could certainly put a little effort in showing Eldonia he still loved and cared for her. Just the thought of making love to her had a smile spreading across his handsome face. He put a little more muscle into his hammer swings, wanting to get the new hutch done as soon as possible. His wife needed him!

"Stupid rabbit," he muttered, looking down briefly at the fat ball of fluff lounging by his feet and chewing idly at some dandelions.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Swearing, grumbling and lighting a lantern, Fortis left the house. Carrying his walking-staff and the lantern, he headed off into the night. Far in the distance, on a hilltop overlooking the village of Dynamos, the bells of the Abbey of Dynamos rang out. Fortis listened and counted.

Clang-clang clang-clang-clang!!!...Clang-clang...clang-clang-clang!!!...

Dong!...Dong!...Dong!...Dong!...Dong!...Dong!...Dong!...Dong!...Ding!

The melody bells, the hour-bells, and one half-tone bell. Eight thirty at night. The monks and nuns in the abbey must be preparing for evening chores. Fortis ignored the tolling bells and kept on walking. In the valley between the surrounding hills, with a river running through it, was the sleepy village of Dynamos. It was this village, the buildings around it, and the surrounding countryside and farmland over which the Vanderstorm family had ruled for generations. Fortis strolled through the village, the cobblestone streets, the houses and buildings, built of stone and brick and wood and wattle and daub, with tiled or thatched roofs.

A couple of bridges crossed the river in the middle of town. Built along the banks of the river near one bridge, was the village watermill. Here, farmers brought their wheat and other grains to be ground into flour, their olives to be crushed into oil, or their grapes to be turned to wine. Branching off from the mill were the village bakery and wine-merchant's establishments. Some of the windows and doors were still open as villagers did last-minute trading.

"Good evening Mr. Von Pann", said Fortis.

A plump baker smiled up at the towering young nobleman who stood at the serving-window of his bakery.

"My lord! Good eventide! Could I favour you with um...some of my cheese rolls? Or the ham croissants? We have some leftover flour-loaves if you would like some...excellent with olive-oil and chili-sauce...A very suitable snack for the summertime!"

"Thank you, no", said Fortis. "Do you have any of those little cinnamon sugar-rolls that your wife makes?"

"Ooooh I'm sorry! All sold out this afternoon! Very popular they are. Never hang around very long!"

A short, slim, young, good-looking teenage boy about fourteen approached the window.

"Flavius! You should be in bed!"

"Sorry papa. I couldn't sleep. I'm going out for a walk".

"Don't you wander far now!"

"No papa".

Young Flavius Von Pann left the village bakery and walked down the main road with Fortis.

"Yes papa, no papa, three bags full, papa..."

Fortis chuckled. "He only wants to show you he loves you".

"Yeah! But he doesn't seem to realise that I have OTHER things that I want to do!"

Fortis nodded. There seemed to be a lot of that going around. But he said nothing.

At the end of the street was a large building. Four storeys high, and a cellar beneath. This was the Hammer and Tongs, the local public house. It was the haunt of everyone from farmhands to shopworkers, carpenters, blacksmiths, farriers, coopers, wheelwrights and chandlers. In a scene that might never be seen in Fatlantis, both men and women drank at the Hammer. And it wasn't unknown for men to bring their wives in for a good drink and a quick jaunt in one of the spare bedrooms upstairs.

The Hammer and Tongs' ground floor was for food and drink. Upstairs on the next two floors were bedrooms for rent. The very top floor was the living-quarters for the publican and his family. The cellar and basement stored supplies and other things that the pub needed. It was combination tavern, restaurant, boarding-house and rest-inn for travellers. Abd as usual around this time of night, business was booming.

"You want a drink, boy?" Fortis asked, looking at Flavius. Flavius shook his head. "Thank you, m'lud. No thank you!"

Fortis shrugged, "Suit yourself..." he mumbled. Fortis needed something to take his mind off the stupid fight he had with Eldonia. He headed inside.

The tavern was orange with the light of candles, lamps and the huge fire in the far end of the room. The windows were all open, letting in a soft breeze. The locals gathered around tables. In the corner, four men sang along to a drunken composition on a secondhand harpsichord which hadn't been tuned since the dawn of time.

Fortis approached the bar.

"BACCHUS!" he shouted over the drunken singing in the back.

A large, burly, older man in his forties approached from the kitchen out the back.

"Hurry up with those burgers, Martha! Those watermen are hungry bastards!"

"It'll be ready when it's ready!" a woman's voice called from the kitchen.

"M'lord!" said Bacchus, walking down the bar towards his chief customer. Bacchus was nine feet tall, solidly built. He had not the male model, chiseled physique that Fortis had, but years of splitting stone and felling trees had grown him a solid, barrel chest and abdomen, with thick, muscly arms. He had a stubbly beard and hair on his arms and chest. He was only wearing a pair of breeches, sandals and a large, leather apron tied around his waist. His hair, messy medium brown, was damp with sweat from the heat of the candles and the fires in the kitchen.

"Good evening Bacchus".

"M'lord. What'll be his lordship's pleasure this evenin'?"

"Whatever's good, whatever's cheap, whatever's strong".

"Oooh...that'll be one of everythin' exceptin' those fine bottles of Lucian brandy..."

Fortis groaned, "I'm in no mood for your jokes tonight, Bacchy...Just fill me up".

"Trouble at home, eh?"

Fortis groaned. The bartender/landlord smiled. "The estate's been a bit of a mess since your father died, hmm?"

"It's been a mess BEFORE he died! I'm trying to fix the fucking thing up! And the Missus wants stuff that I can't give her!"

"Can't?"

Bacchus had known Fortis since he was a child. For a Mountain lord to suggest a lack of..."ability"...was rare.

"Okay fine, something that I WON'T give her!" Fortis grumbled, if the man was going to be picky about phraseology.

"Too worn out from work to be worn out by the wife, huh?"

"You could say that".

"Hmmm...I'll get you some gin".

Fortis watched as the bartender prepared him a gin and tonic. Fortis gulped it down.

"Gurrghhh! What is that!? You clean sword-wounds with that stuff or something!?"

"Yeah...but it's also my strongest gin".

"Ugh! Tastes like something I use to clean my paintbrushes in!"

"Perhaps some beer would be better..." said the bartender, filling up a huge flagon. Fortis nodded and started gulping it down. He was gonna just sit here...and drink...and drink...and drink...

Hold on! He did have his dagger! He used it to split the firewood! Where was it!? Shit! He'd left it in the cabin! He hoped none of the Vladians would notice it... He peered through the crack in the bedroom door. The dagger in question was underneath a low table in front of the fireplace. They probably wouldn't see it unless they were standing in front of the fire keeping warm, with their backs to the flames.

"Dur, whoever's here, bawss, dey's long gawn by now..." said Hans.
"Yeah", said Viktor, "And they's left us a fire! Wasn't that nice?"

"Shut up you egg-heads!" Vilnius hissed, "They might still be here. You, Sven! Search the bedroom".

Sven entered the bedroom.

He never saw it coming.

Fortis stunned him! He smacked him hard on the head with his brass knuckles, knocking him out instantly, and slicing his throat with his sword! Fortis knew from his war with the Vladians not to waste time. It happened so fast that nobody noticed anything!

"Sven?" another one of the goons asked, "Sven what's up?"

Fortis cleared his throat, and spoke, in a passable Vladian accent.

"Is nothing!" he said, "I stubbed my toe on the bed! I wanna sit down for a bit, it hurts!"

"Blockhead!" Vilnius said, "Yancy! Go and see what's going on! And get his sack of gold while you're in there!"

Another goon who hadn't spoken yet, entered the room. Fortis grabbed him around the throat! Yancy let out a gurgle! Fortis plunged Sven's dagger into his chest and dropped him on the ground.

"Yancy?...Yancy!?...Stupid..."

Vilnius approached the door. He pushed it open and entered. Then he saw the bodies.

"What the..."

WHAM!!

Fortis kicked the bedroom door! It flew back, smashing Vilnius in the shoulder! The Vladian warlord growled in pain! The remaining three goons rushed forwards! With Vilnius momentarily blinded by the throbbing bruise on his shouulder, Fortis drew out his sword and whirled it menacingly over his head!

In the confined space of the cabin, there was nowhere to run! Fortis had no shield with him, but he had picked up the pistols from the two dead Vladians. He fired shots that echoed through the tiny structure! He rounded on the last goon, Yuri, and despatched him with a swift thrust through the abdomen! Fortis stood there, panting...

WHAM!!

Something heavy and metallic struck Fortis on the head! He grunted and staggered forwards! He fell on the table in front of the fireplace! The rickety old piece of furniture collapsed under the sudden impact! Fortis rolled over and saw his attacker!

Vilnius was tall, at least as tall as Fortis, and much older, probably double his age. He was old, but still powerfully-built.

Vilnius swung his sword down! Fortis rolled! He grabbed his sword and got to his feet! He swung forwards, deflecting an incoming sword-swing! Vilnius disengaged and swung again, aiming for Fortis's head! Fortis ducked and thrust his dagger upwards, aiming for Vilnius's abdomen, but the older man backed away! The fight spilled out into the road and soon, the two men were dueling out in the middle of the forest!

"WHO ARE YOU!?" Fortis roared. "COMING ON MY LAND!?"
"YOUR LAND!? WHO THE HELL DO YOU THINK YOU ARE, BOY!?"
"FORTIS VANDERSTORM! LORD OF THESE LANDS!"
"LORD!? YOU AIN'T OLD ENOUGH!"

The two men circled, swiped, stabbed and swung. Fortis usually had a lot of stamina, but his earlier drinking, and later activities had rather drained his strength and concentration. As they circled and continued to fight, neither of them noticed a figure hiding between the trees, it was...

Fortis goes looking. Eldonia has been kidnapped! There must've been another man!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis ducked and swung! He stepped back, aside and around, constantly moving! Vilnius moved, every time outsmarting the Mountain lord and getting back into his face everytime Fortis tried to move back to give himself some room. Fortis was about to try and just grab Vilnius's sword-arm and twist the blade out of his hands, when he saw something flash in the night, by the light of the moon. At first he thought they were eyes, but then...

Crack! Crack!

Vilnius gasped and grunted! He turned around!

Crack!...Crack!!

From behind a tree, Fortis saw a figure emerge. Vilnius stared down and spotted four bleeding wounds in his chest, he gasped in shock, and collapsed on the ground.

Lady Athena approached.

"Grandma!...I had him! Why'd you have to interfere!?"

"Oh it's alright darling! I know the way home, you won't be lost, and you're welcome for me giving you a hand..."

Fortis blushed.

"Sorry grandma..."

Lady Athena held up two double-barreled muff-pistols. Diminutive, shiny brass firearms with flashy pearl grips.

"They were a present from your grandfather when we were married", she said. "When you didn't emerge home after so long, I thought I should go looking for you! You know there's a gang out in the woods! I've heard stories down at the Hammer and Tongs! I went there and Bacchus and his wife said you'd left already! I figured you must've gotten lost and taken the woodland route home, instead of the one that cuts through the valley. You were always scared of this road as a boy, you never came down here, so I thought you might've gotten lost! And then I was worried about Eldonia! And...where is she, anyway?"

Fortis gulped! He was so busy, he'd completely forgotten! He whirled around!

"Donie!" he shouted, "ELLIE!...ELDONIA!...Damn it...WOMAN WHERE ARE YOU!?"
