choices: The next morning, Fortis, his brothers and others, come to remove the treasure.
Fortis hears muffled sounds from the cellar. He goes back down to have a look...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"WOMAN IF YOU'RE AROUND HERE YOU BETTER ANSWER ME!"

Eldonia peeked out from behind a tree.

"F-Forty?"

Fortis turned around.

"There you are!" he said. He strode angrily over and pulled her forwards, "Why didn't you say anything!?"

"I was scared! Is it alright?"

Fortis nodded, "It's okay, everything's fine. Grandma's here".

Eldonia hurried out to the front of the cabin where Lady Athena stood. She sighed and gasped when she saw Eldonia's body!

"My dear! Are you alright!? Oh look at what those BEASTS did to your dress!"

"Oh I'm alright, granny..." said Eldonia, "...My dress is fine!...A um...A different KIND of beast did that..." she said. She leaned suggestively against Fortis's body as he stepped up behind her, wrapping an arm around his back, just above his hips, giving him a playful squeeze.

Lady Athena shook her head, "You children these days..." she mumbled.

"Oh grandma..." Fortis said, "We're fine! Listen, you wait here, I wanna check something".

Fortis headed back into the cabin. He dragged out the corpses, pocketed everything worth taking, and then using a broken plank, dug a hole in the woods to dump the corpses into. Then, he went back into the cabin.

"Somewhere around here, those guys were hiding treasure", he said. "Where would that be?"

"Perhaps it was under the bed?" Eldonia suggested.

"Don't be silly! Why'd they do that? It would have to be...wait..."

Fortis turned. He remembered something from earlier. There was a revolting old rug on the floor in front of the fireplace. He whipped it back, rolled it up and threw it into the flames of the dying fire. Set into the floor was a trapdoor!

"Hah!" he said. He pulled up the trapdoor.

"Gimme one of the candles!" he said. Eldonia handed her husband a candle set into the neck of a bottle. Fortis stepped into the hole.

"What do you see?" Lady Athena asked.

"It looks like some sort of old root-cellar", Fortis said. "But these barrels are all loaded with gold!"

"Gold!?" said Eldonia.

"There's sacks down here...and barrels...and crates...there must be thousands in here! It's all...like...candlesticks, plates, bowls, cutlery, coinage, jewels...Half the wealth of Mountania must be down here!"

"Oh I hardly think so!" said Lady Athena, "What should we do?"

Fortis climbed out of the cellar. "We need to get it back to the castle. Once it's there under lock and key, I can send out invitations. We'll get everyone over and they can reclaim their lost property".

"But how will we get the...loot...home?"

"We can't do it tonight, of course. We'll come back, first thing in the morning. In the meantime, I wanna get home! I'm exhausted!"

Another Vladian gang of robbers! Fierce fighting ensues!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis stomped downstairs. Eldonia stared at her husband. Strapped across his chest was a harness that held two daggers and a pair of short-swords. Across his back were slung a pair of muskets, and at his waist, a brace of pistols, along with extra powder and shot. Cannius and Jupiter were also similarly armed.

"I really think this is far too much!" Eldonia said.

"Woman we're handling a LOT of gold around here, and it stands to reason that others might want to take it. So we gotta be armed!" Fortis said. "You don't want us gettin' killed, do you?"

"Of course not! But..."

"Good...C'mon boys!"

Fortis headed out into the stable yard. There, Koviac, Fortis's servant-boy, stood, with two carts, all ready to go.

"Juppy, you drive this one, I'll take the other one", Fortis said. "Canny, you go with him. Kovy, you get in here with me".

"Yes m'lord!" said Koviac. The younger Mountain male struggled to get on. He too was armed. In the bed of the carts were lengths of rope, shovels, axes and other bits and pieces for hauling out the gold. Loaded up with all the weapons and tools that they would need, the small posse headed off down the western road, into the woods and towards the cabin on the roadside.

It took them a while to haul the gold and jewels out of the cellar, using ropes and nets, but they were all strong, capable young men. After a couple of hours, the contents of the cellar were loaded into the two carts.

"Kovi, you drive", Fortis said, "I'll be in the back keeping an eye out".

Koviac nodded, "Yes m'lord!"

The now loaded carts began rumbling back home towards Castle Vanderstorm.

Along the way, however, they met someone on the road...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The next morning, Fortis, his brothers and othe...

choices: Fortis invites all the robbery-victims to reclaim their treasures at the Castle.
Minerva sees something beautiful in the piles of treasure & takes it for herself
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
The carts rumbled back towards the castle. They were going at a leisurely pace, taking their time. That was, until they heard the distant thumping of horse-hooves. Fortis looked back to see a cloaked figure riding up towards them.

"Slow down boys, and prepare yourselves..." he whispered. The young earl and his two brothers, and his servant, Koviac, unsheathed their swords. The rider galloped up and then slowed down. He pulled the hood down from his cloak, to reveal the lined, wrinkled face of a man in his fifties, with a beard and hair that was pepper-and-salt white and grey.

"My lord", said Fortis, keeping his sword raised, "What is your business here?"

The man dismounted and came closer, then Fortis recognised who it was, and lowered his blade, indicating for his brothers to do the same.

"Lord VonGewalt".

The older nobleman nodded. "Good morning, my lord Vanderstorm. I trust that my daughter is well in your care?"

"Indeed".

"I fear for her safety and security. There are robber-barons from Vladia operating in these parts".

"We know", said Fortis. "And we are handling the matter".

"I am grateful", said Lord VonGewalt, "But I have been robbed! Last night. I came down this morning to my dining-hall to find my best silverware, and my pewter tankards, the candelabras on the tables, all gone!"

Fortis pulled the covers off the crates and barrels on the wagons.

"We found these in an old cabin down the road, which was the hideout for the Vladians. Your treasure is probably in here. We are going back to the Castle to sort through it. Then we were going to send out messengers to all the houses in the surrounding area for them to claim their lost treasures. Perhaps you should come home with us?"

Lord VonGewalt nodded. "I think I would like that", he said. "Drive on!"

The older mountain lord mounted his horse and cantered along beside the wagons.

"I hope that Eldonia is satisfied?" he asked.

"Oh...um...oh she IS...satisfied, that is..." Fortis said.

Behind him, his two younger brothers laughed.

"I would like to see my grandson when I arrive at the castle".

"Of course! And you shall. How many others have been targeted?"

"Excuse me?"

Fortis pointed to the crates and barrels behind him. The older man frowned.

"Word has gotten around. I think at least a dozen households. Everyone from local merchants and tradesmen, up to great houses and noble families such as our own".

Fortis shook his head. "We should do something about it. We should try and boost security and safety in our region of the Kingdom".

Lord VonGewalt nodded. "We should. I suppose it's due to our nature, really".

"Nature?"

"You would agree, Lord Vanderstorm, that it would be a great insult to any mountanian, especially a man, to suggest that he could not hold his own and defend himself?"

"Yes".

"Well that's just it. People wouldn't be exactly open to a system of riders and watchmen in their villages and towns and along the roads. It would suggest that they couldn't look after themselves!"

Fortis nodded. he hadn't considered that! He supposed he would be insulted if someone told him he needed HELP in looking after his own safety!

"But there are the womenfolk and the children", he added.

"A Mountain man is responsible for the safety of his family, as well".

"And he's responsible for keeping them in food and drink, clothes, and a warm house", Fortis countered, "He can't do everything!"

Lord VonGewalt bowed to the younger hunk's wisdom. "That is true...We shall hold council on the subject with the other leaders of our land".

"I like that", Fortis said. "Once we have gathered everyone and their property returned, we can set a date and time".

The carts approached the castle, and they headed into the grounds. Standing at the front doors were Minerva, Eldonia and Athena. Lord VonGewalt hopped down from his horse. Lady Athena smiled, and curtsied. He kissed her hand.

"Lady Athena".

"My good lord Venatarius. How dost thou fare?"

"Better in other times, if I'm honest".

"Oh dear! I hope your wife is well?"

"She is. I'm here to reclaim stolen property which your grandson has in his possession!"

"Did somebody call me?" Eldonia asked.

Venatarius and Athena chuckled.

"My darling..." said Venatarius, his deep, heavy voice rumbling in affection. He pulled his young daughter close to him and pushed her head back so that he could get a proper look at her face. He smiled.

"You look more beautiful every day I see you".

"Papa!!"

The old man laughed and gave his daughter a kiss. "How are you, my dearest one? How is the baby?"

"He's upstairs! Do you want to see?"

"I do! But not now, I have things I need to do. Lady Minerva".

Minerva curtsied, "My lord", she said. "Your daughter is very comfortable here, my lord".

"It pleases me that she is. I'm proud that she has married into an old, respectable family of standing, wealth and good favour".

"Sure are that!" said Jupiter, shuffling past with two huge crates in his arms.

"Come on, everyone!" said Fortis, "We're taking all this stuff to the drawing-room. We'll open it there and sort through it".

In the drawing-room, Fortis and his brothers used crowbars and axes to smash, break and lever the crates and barrels open. Gold coin, plate, cutlery, candlesticks, silverware, brass ornaments and all other manner of jewels and treasures spilled onto the floor. Lady Athena gasped!

"The scoundrels! Stealing all these things from hardworking people!" she said. She bent down and picked up a handsome gold chalice with intricate engraving on the stem.

"Oh it's so elegant!"

"I think that belongs to old Dame Mortius. It was a present from her late husband. I saw it on her sideboard once", Venatarius said.

"Must be a VERY late husband. She's almost a hundred!" said Athena. She frowned, "I do wonder if she would agree to sell it to me? It is very handsome..." the old woman held it up to the sunlight streaming in from the windows, "Oh! Such a beauty!"

"You can...GURGH!...Ask her your..SELF!...gran!" Fortis grunted, levering open yet another crate, "We're...INVITING...GURGH!...everyone over to reclaim their lost property!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Lord Venatarius VonGewalt, Eldonia's father...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Isn't he adorable, papa?"

Eldonia handed baby Leonardo to her father, who held him in his arms. The baby giggled and bounced excitedly up and down! Venatarius chuckled.

"Hello little fellah...You know who I am then, hmm? HMM!? Rrrawwwrr!!"

The baby started to cry.

"Awww...aww grandpa's sorry...Awwww..."

Venatarius chuckled and hugged his grandson, "Hehehe, You're a feisty little fellah, aren'tcha? Muah! Just look at you! One day you'll be a big strong Mountain lord like your papa, huh? Like grandpa, huh? But now you're a baby, and babies should be cute and cuddly..."

Venatarius held his grandson his arms, rocking him back and forth. He walked around the castle, holding him and hugging him, with Eldonia following behind.

"Papa, why didn't you have more children?"

"I always wanted more. But your mother, bless her darling heart, she never had the capacity for it. She invested so much joy and love and beauty into one little angel, she never had enough left over for another child".

Eldonia blushed, "Papa!!"

Venatarius slapped his daughter on the cheek, "You know that's true!" he scolded lightly and Eldonia giggled. "Papa!!"

Venatarius chuckled and wrapped an arm around his daughter. "It's nice to see you happy here", he said, "And starting a family. Do you want more children with Fortis?"

"Oh I do, papa! One day. I think it'd be lovely to have two or three big strong boys! And maybe a girl or two...someone I can spoil and be sweet with..."

Venatarius nodded approvingly. "Girls are the joys that parents are given after doing their duties to provide strong, healthy lads for the betterment of king and country, my dearest".

"Whatever happened between you and mother?"

"Well apparently on that particular year, there was a surplus of boys, so we got our reward early, hmm?"

"Papa!" Eldonia blushed. Venatarius chuckled and squeezed his daughter. Then, he headed into a room nearby.

The lord's study was full of shelves and cabinets and chairs and tables. At the far end, between three massive windows, Fortis sat at his desk, writing with a beautiful, ivory-shafted pen.

"Papa!" a voice burbled.

Fortis looked up.

"Oh hey son!" he said. He put the pen down, "C'mere boy! C'mere! Let papa hold you..."

Fortis reached out and grabbed his son and pulled him in, tickling him and giving him a powerful squeeze! Venatarius picked up the sheet of paper on the desk.

"What's this?" he asked.

"Oh that's what I'm sending to everyone. I figured we could have a sort of function thing. We invite them over to reclaim their lost property. We give them a chance to socialise, we figure out a plan of action against these thugs, and then we'll cap it all off with a feast and banquet in the evening. What do you think?"

Lord VonGewalt nodded approvingly. "A very sound idea", he said. "Oh yes, you need to know who to send all this to, don't you? I better write down a list of names", he said. He reached for the pen and a sheet of paper. He flipped open the handsome brass inkwell and dipped the pen into it.

"Yes, quite a few people..." Venatarius mumbled as he wrote. "As lord of the neighbouring county I hear quite a lot of gossip of this nature. Quite unfortunate...I was surprised to hear that you hadn't also been robbed!"

"I'd never heard it was happening".

"Hmm. I suppose a household with as many people as yours, and in such condition, was not likely to draw the attention of these bandit-gangs. They're attracted to the houses with older occupants, or with fewer residents. Like mine, I suppose...Lady VonGewalt was so upset when those candlesticks were stolen from the foyer. They were a wedding-present from Eldonia's grandmother, you know, when we were married. We had planned to give them to you two one day, as an anniversary present. When they disappeared, she never thought she'd see them again. I'll be glad to bring them home".

Fortis nodded. Venatarius finished writing the list, and Fortis began writing out copies of his letter to each of the recipients. He rang a bell on his desk.

Matilda, one of the housemaids who was cleaning one of the bedchambers, entered the room and curtsied.

"My lord Venatarius..." she said. She curtsied to Fortis, "My lord Fortis, sir", she added.

"Ah, Mattie..." said Fortis, "Where is Koviac?"

"He's in the kitchen, my lord".

"Send him up here, please. Tell him I need him to deliver some letters for me".

"Yes, my lord".

She curtsied again, and headed downstairs.

Fortis began folding and sealing the letters with wax, pressing his gold signet-ring into the moulten wax to create a decorative seal. Baby Leo sat on his father's desk, watching the whole process with great interest. The baby picked up one of the finished letters and stared at the seal. It was so pretty! He crawled over to his father and tugged at his hand, wanting to look at the sparkly golden stamp that made these pretty patterns.

Fortis smiled. "You'll have one of these rings yourself one day, Leo", he said, ruffling his blond hair, "One day when you're Lord Vanderstorm", he added, and continued to fold and seal the envelopes. Venatarius smiled. "I'm sure you'll have a very big family one day, Fortis", he said. "Sadly, it was something I couldn't provide for my lady".

"What you gave her was a gem worthy of any number of children", Fortis said. Venatarius smiled.

"It's good to know that she has found a stable and secure companion in a young man such as yourself", he said. He picked up Leonardo. "Come now, Leo. Let us leave your father to his work..."
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Fortis invites all the robbery-victims to recla...

choices: Everyone agrees! Fortis ends the meeting and everyone stays for dinner.
As feared, men take offense at the idea that they can't look after their own kin
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Well come along! Come along!"

The girls carried trays of sandwiches and cold-cuts in the cellar.

"That's right. Put it all there on the shelves! Keep it cold and fresh. We'll bring them up later! Have you finished setting everything out in the ballroom?"

"Yes Mrs. Tibbs".

"And the drawing room?"

"Yes Mrs. Tibbs".

"And the..."

"Yes, Mrs. Tibbs!"

"And I suppose you forgot to get new candles the sconces in the hall?"

"Oh dear!"

Mrs. Tibbs shook her head. Addle-brained servant-girls! Got their heads between the master's thighs and their minds floating in the skies, and never on their work...

She smoothed out her housekeeper's uniform and headed upstairs. Lord Fortis stood in the foyer, dressed in ceremonial battle-armor.

"You look very fine, my lord", she said. Fortis smiled, "Thank you, Mrs. Tibbs. We're expecting quite a few people of um...status...so I wanted to look good".

"Oh his lordship could never not do that!"

"Why Tibby..."

The housekeeper and cook blushed. "Everything has been prepared, my lord. The guests will gather in the hall and you'll explain everything to them. They'll reclaim their property, and then they'll move into the ballroom where you may hold your meeting. Then they can retire to the dining-hall for a light dinner and relaxation".

Fortis nodded, "Excellent. That's just right".

"Yes, my lord".

CLANG!

A bell in the foyer rang loudly and Mrs. Tibbs went to answer the door. She opened it to a middle-aged lord and lady.

"Lord and Lady VonGewalt".

Fortis stepped forward. "My lord, ma'am".

Venatarius smiled. "Very smart, Fortis", he said. He ushered his wife forward. Lady VonGewalt was a gorgeous beauty in her late fifties, with whiting blond hair that was done up in curls and bunches. She had a beautiful diamond necklace on around her chest. Fortis bowed and kissed her hand.

"Where is my daughter?" she asked.

"Up here, mama!" Eldonia said. She glided downstairs, carrying Leo in her arms. The older woman smiled.

"Aaaah! Baby!" she said, and reached out for the toddler. "Hello darling! Granny's here! Muah!"

Lady Athena came downstairs. "Wanda, my darling!"

The two women kissed.

"Isn't our grandson a wonder?" said Wanda VonGewalt. "But then of course he would be. He comes from excellent stock".

Fortis and Eldonia blushed!

"Who else are we expecting?" Lady Athena asked.

"Quite a few", said Venatarius. "Mr. VanClayden, that fellow who runs the jewellery-shop..."

"Oh dear!" said Athena.

"Oh his shop is fine. But his wife's sapphire necklace and earrings were stolen. His son Apollo is coming along as well. For the socialising at the end, more likely, though".

"Who is that?" said Minerva, entering the room.

"Oh I think he's a bit old for you, darling!" said Wanda. "He's..." she frowned, "Eighteen? Twenty? You'll meet him. He's a very talented musician!"

"Perhaps you should have a look through the treasure-piles in the drawing-room and pick out your property before everyone else arrives?" Fortis asked, "Or else there's going to be a huge crowd".

"Oh yes!" said Lady VonGewalt, "Tarrie, let's have a look".

Venatarius blushed. He couldn't stand his wife calling him by his pet-name outside of the house...

Apparently, Lady VonGewalt found what she was after, because a few minutes later, she let out a squeal of delight!

Eldonia blushed. "Mother tends to get very excited..." she said.

"You know, the Von Eisenwald brothers are coming too", Fortis said. "Their great-grandfather's toolchest with all his antique woodworking tools was stolen".

"I hardly count that as treasure!" said Athena.

"Grandma, just because it's not gold doesn't mean it's not valuable!" Fortis said. "That chest has been in their family for generations! They use it for furniture-making. And you know how beautiful their furniture is. Who do you think made that rocking-chair in your bedroom?"

Lady Athena blushed at her rudeness. She guessed Fortis was right.

One by one, guests arrived and went to claim their stolen property. Once all the lost loot was gathered, Fortis herded everyone into the ballroom.

Usually, the ballroom was reserved for grand parties and dances, cocktails and women's events. But tonight, benches had been set up in a semicircle on the floor. Everyone sat down.

"My lord, ladies and gentlemen. Now that you have reclaimed what was taken from your homes, I call together this meeting so that we can ensure that this never happens again, and that the people responsible for these atrocities are brought to justice!" Fortis said to the packed room.

"Vladian robber-gangs, some under the command of Vladian warlords, have been helping themselves to our precious possessions. We cannot allow this continue. First they invade our homes and steal our silver. Then our gold and our pewter. Those things may be recovered as has been done tonight".

Fortis paused.

"But what happens when they've got all our gold and silver and brass? Our tools with which we work? Our ceramics off which we eat? Our clothes? What happens when they've taken everything that isn't nailed down? What would they come back for, after that?"

The crowd was silent.

"My brothers and I are well-capable of taking care of ourselves. But in our house we have servant-girls who keep house for us, in return for bed, board, money and security. We also have our young sister. There is also our grandmother, and the good Lady Vanderstorm, my wife, who has recently given birth to her first child".

Fortis let these details sink in.

"Once they have taken everything else, they will come for our women and our children!" Fortis shouted, "And we WILL NOT LET THAT HAPPEN!"

There was a murmur of agreement from the crowd.

"We Mountanians are an industrious and peace-loving people..."

A couple of people laughed.

"...but our reputations for war and savagery are well-known in our neighbouring kingdoms of Fatlantis and Lucia. Which is well. In return for their riches and produce, we protect their citizenry. Many of us employ Fatlantean servants for their excellent cooking, and buy Lucian silks and cottons, wools and glassware".

Fortis paused.

"But how can we claim to protect our allies and trading-partners if we can't handle a few smash-and-grab bandits in our own backyard!?"

More murmurs of agreement.

"It is well-known that we have our right to bear arms of sword and shot. We should use those rights to protect our lesser folk and our families who cannot protect themselves. I propose the establishment of a system of watchmen and constables, to be overseen by each main landowner in the surrounding estates and counties, for the protection of all their citizenry. Funds could be raised and salaries set. What say you?"

"Girl".

Fortis pressed his sister up against the wall. He brushed a rough hand through her soft, silky smooth brown hair, stroking its beautiful sheen. He tugged playfully at her braids which she had woven into the long falls of her hair.

Minerva blushed.

"Brother".

"Do you think me a monster?"

"Of course!"

"Good".

"The best kind of monster, my darling brother".

Fortis chuckled. He patted his sister on the cheek and flexed an arm arrogantly. Minerva sighed.

"Really Fortis...we have guests!"

"I know...come..."

Fortis held out a hand and his sister followed him into the dining-room. Lords, ladies and the wealthy merchants and their families moved around the buffet tables, helping themselves to the food, while the house-girls moved around, offering trays of sandwiches, cookies, cakes, or glasses of drinks. Eldonia glided over to her husband.

"Darling, keep the guests occupied. I want to go upstairs to check on the baby", she said.

Fortis nodded. "You got it", he said. Eldonia made to leave. Fortis grabbed her by the arm.

"Where do you think you're going?"

"Upstairs!"

"Without giving me a kiss, first?"

Eldonia laughed nervously, "Darling! Not in front of everyone!"

Fortis squeezed harder, "Why not?"

"Fortis! you're hurting me!"

"Then you better give me a kiss".

Eldonia sighed and gave him a quick peck on the cheek. Fortis laughed, "Go on upstairs. See to the baby", he said.

Eldonia stared at her sister-in-law with a "He can be SUCH a bore sometimes", sort of look, and headed out of the dining-room. Minerva sighed. She moved through the crowd, looking at everyone, shaking hands and curtsying and generally playing the gracious hostess, along with her brother. Her two other brothers were busy chatting up the daughters of a local tailor, and from the sound of it, Cannius was suggesting some rather unorthodox uses for their father's measuring-tape. Not that the girls seemed to mind.

Whump!!

"Aaah!"
"Oh no!"

Minerva stared at her dress! Fortunately, the dress was a dark red colour, and the wine didn't show. But it was still a shock! She stared to see a handsome teenage boy about 16. He had light brown hair and a cute, angelic face.

"Oh gosh I'm sorry!" he said. "Here let me help you!" he said. "I'm such a boulder sometimes. I'm REALLY sorry!'

The boy clumbsily picked up a nearby napkin and started dabbling away at Minerva's dress, trying to soak up the excess wine and began wiping down her chest. Not the wisest thing to do when...

"And just what do you think you're doing?"

The boy turned and stared right up at Lord Vanderstorm.

"M-my lord! I'm sorry, I..."

"You DARE touch her without my permission?" Fortis asked in a dangerously soft tone.

Sensing trouble, Lady Athena glided into the conversation.

"Ah Fortis! Minerva! You've met young Master Apollo, haven't you?"

"No, grandmother!" said Minerva. She gave her brother a dirty look, that said: "Go away!", and turned back to her grandmother, "Who is he, did you say?"

"This is Master Apollo VanClayden, my dear!" said Lady Athena, "His father is the jeweler!"

"Oh yes!" said Minerva. She blushed, "I'm sorry, Master Apollo..."

"Apollo, please", he said. "And you must be Lady Minerva?"

Minerva nodded.

"You're very beautiful".

"Don't say that!" Minerva said, "If my brother Fortis hears that, you'll be drinking out of a straw for the rest of your life".

"Rather um...possessive, isn't he?"

"He just...loves me...that's all. He has strange ways of showing it".

Minerva paused.

"VERY strange".

Apollo laughed. "I'm sorry about the wine. Let me get you another glass!"

"Oh no no no! It's alright!" Minerva said. She noticed a violin-case on the buffet-table. "Is that yours?" she asked, trying to create a distraction.

"Oh yeah! Sweet biscuits...if I'd lost this, pops would murder me! Thanks..."

Apollo opened the case. Inside was a beautiful violin.

"Oh it's stunning!" said Minerva.

"Thank you. It was a birthday present when I was ten. From old King Goliath..."

"My goodness!"

"Our shop had been broken into. By pure good fortune, an order for the royal court was not stolen. But the king heard about what happened. He heard how my old violin was stolen. It belonged to my great-grandfather. He had this one specially made for me. My father is hoping to secure his position as Royal Jeweler to the Mountanian Court. One day, I'll follow after him. It's such rewarding work".

Apollo held out a hand to show off a glittering gold ring.

"It belonged to my grandfather. It's one of his first creations".

"It's stunning!" said Minerva. She looked at the violin.

"But doesn't it make it hard to play?"

"It can".

"Would you play something for me?"

"Oh gosh...I'm...I'm not very good..." he said, blushing. "And perhaps somewhere not so noisy", he said.

"We could go into the parlour. It's empty now", said Minerva. Apollo nodded.

"It's very nice to meet you, Emerald", said Fortis. "Is that for me?"

"Thank you".

The maid curtsied and headed out of the room.

Fortis started eating. He was ravenously hungry! He'd only reached his second sandwich, when the doors opened...

Fortis wolfed down the sandwiches! He was starving! What was in here? Chicken salad, tuna salad, ham, cheese, egg, cold cuts, beef...

Without anyone around, the young nobleman relapsed into bestial greed, and started munching hungrily on his first sandwich. In six huge bites, the sandwich was gone! Fortis then picked up his second sandwich. He took one huge bite and chewed hungrily. He opened his mouth and took another bite!

That was when a door opened at the far end of the drawing-room.

"Triton! I found Peppers for you!...Triton? Triton are you in here!?...I said I found...Why does he keep having to..."

Fortis turned and saw a handsome teenage boy in the room. He was about seven feet tall, with handsome, medium-length blond hair and dazzling blue eyes. He had a slim, athletic build and was about fifteen. The Crown Prince.

"Good evening, your Royal Highness".

The youth jumped! He whirled around and saw the giant Mountain lord get to his feet.

"Lord Fortis!" he said.

Arf! Arf-arf-arf-arf-arf!!!

"Shhh! Quiet, Peppers!"

But the brown-spottled lap-dog jumped out of the prince's arms and scampered across the floor to inspect this new stranger!

"I'm sorry! This is Peppers. He's one of my brother's pets..."

Fortis hoisted the dog up with one hand.

"Hey Peppers".

Arf-arf-arf-arf!! LICK!

"Peppers! NO!" said Cassius. "Oh forget it! Stupid mongrel dog..."

Fortis stared at the Crown Prince. He reminded him of himself at that age. Handsome, tall, slim, and boyish. Before he started bulking up...and out. Before he got his tan, and let his hair grow out. And got his battle-scars.

"Is your sister here?" Cassius asked.

The Crown Prince knew that he was treading on thin ice. Lady Minerva was a beautiful, stunning, delicate flower of a girl. Soft, gentle, loving and affectionate. Sharp, witty and brave. She was not the kind of girl who went looking for boys. She didn't have to. Boys were more interested in looking for her!

But first they had to get past her formidable brother Fortis.

Cassius guessed he could well understand why Fortis was so extremely protective of his sister. Cassius was sure he would be too, if he had a sister like Minerva, who was constantly fighting off every horny nobleman's son that had ever laid eyes on her.

...and one or two princes, as well...

"She's at the Castle", said Fortis.

Cassius knew at once that Fortis meant Castle Vanderstorm, his ancestral estate.

"Oh...Um...I...I had a letter for her and I was hoping you might let me have it delivered to her".

Fortis frowned. "What letter?"

Cassius pulled a folded and sealed letter out of his pocket. Fortis guessed that this was no accident.

"You just carry this thing around with you?" the Mountain lord asked.

"Weeeell...um...no..."

"What do you want with her!?"

"S-she's nice! I...I mean...Well she is! And I want to spend time with her. She's pretty..."

"Uh-huh..." said Fortis, as if he hadn't noticed.

Of course, Fortis had noticed his sister's beauty since the day she was born. He had marvelled at her appearance his whole life. Now on the cusp of womanhood, she was growing more stunning every passing month. It was only that they were brother and sister that stopped Fortis from doing anything more to his sister. Sure, he hugged her, kissed her, slept with her. He even stroked her and...handled her...in a teasing, brotherly way. And she always found it adorable and sweet and cute and funny. But Fortis never dared to do anything more. He loved her far too much.

But the thought of someone else doing that to her made him extremely nervous...and jealous, to an extent.

"I wondered if I could give you the letter to send to her", Cassius said, breaking into Fortis's little daydream. The mountain lord yawned.

"Yeah sure..." he mumbled. "I guess a letter ain't so bad", he said, and held his hand out for it.

"What's down there?" Eldonia cried out.

Fortis climbed up the ladder into the cellar.

"It's all gold! It's jewels and coins and plateware and such!" he said. "Stolen, all of it!"

"Stolen!?"

Fortis reached into the sack that he had brought up with him. He pulled out a handsome pair of shiny brass candelabra. Eldonia gasped!

"Recognise these?"

Eldonia snatched them up. They had a coat of arms on the central column.

"These belong to my father!...They used to stand in the foyer over the fireplace!...Oh papa!"

Fortis handed up the sack, "You better hold onto these, woman", he said, "Give them back to your father when you see him again".

"What else is down there?" Lady Athena called, "Can we help?"

"I'll take one last look and then I'll seal the place up and we'll come back later to look it over in daylight", Fortis said. He jumped back down the ladder.

The cellar was large, but small to someone of Fortis's stature and size. Made even smaller by the barrels and crates and sacks everywhere. Fortis thumped and shook the sacks, crates and barrels that he laid his hands on. They all clanked, jangled, clattered or rattled. He finished with one barrel and turned to another. That was when he heard a thumping noise.

"What on earth..."

Fortis turned back to the barrel he had just touched. It was jolting around! There must be something moving inside!

"What's it for?"

A minute later, and the axe was passed down into the cellar.

"What is it, Forty?"

"There's something weird in one of these barrels, but I can't get it open. I'll have to smash it open..."

Fortis raised the axe and threw it down! The barrel split open and broke into two halves! He dropped the axe, which thudded on the dirt floor. He lowered his lantern.

Cowering in a fetal position, his legs drawn up around his chest, his hands over his head, was a mite of a boy. Perhaps ten or twelve years old, with dark blond hair. Long and messy, and cold blue eyes and pale skin.

"W-w-who-who are you!?" he asked. He had a slight, Vladian accent. Fortis glared at the boy. Suddenly, the Mountain lord grabbed the boy around the throat and hauled him upright!

"Well..." said Fortis, "What DO we have here..."

"P-please!" the boy choked. "I ain't here to..."

"To WHAT, BOY!? Looks like we've got another Vladian rat which we forgot to deal with..."

"No!" the boy gasped, "I didn't steal nothin'! I swear! I promise! It was them others! I didn't do nothin'!"

"Grandmother! Take Eldonia home!" Fortis called out from the cellar. "The little fellah's gonna tell me a bedtime story and I don't wanna be interrupted".

"Fortis now don't you do anything rash!"

"Grandma, take her HOME!"

Lady Athena finished loading her pistols again.

"Come darling", she said to her granddaughter-in-law, "Let us return home. The lord of the manor must dispense justice as he sees fit".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis raced around to the other side of the cabin, knowing that's where he threw Eldonia out of the bedroom window. He crouched down and found the ground near the window disturbed: evidence of where Eldonia had landed. However, there was no sign of Eldonia anywhere! He looked around wildly before racing towards the trees nearest this side of the shack.

"ELDONIA! ELLIE! WHERE ARE YOU?!?!"

Fortis raced around every tree, looking and searching and getting more and more worried. Where could she be?!

"ELDONIA!!!!!!"

***

Fifteen minutes earlier...

Eldonia grumbled to herself as she got to her feet. She couldn't believe that Fortis had actually just tossed her out the window! She pulled the old, ratty blanket tighter around her to protect her naked body from the cold, but hopped a bit on either foot as her bare feet tingled when making too much contact with the cold, hard ground. She hopped and jumped her way back over to the window to see if her husband was okay, only to gasp in alarm at seeing him take down a couple of thugs! Oh, how she hoped he would be alright!

Suddenly, a large, rough hand clamped over her mouth, while a long, muscled arm wrapped around her waist, and she found herself being hauled backwards towards the trees! She tried to scream and yell and even bite the hand covering her mouth, but the hand stayed stubbornly on her face! She kicked and squirmed and tried to wriggle her arms loose, but that arm was like a band of steel around her!

She managed to rap her heel firmly against the man's shin, and he groaned aloud in pain. His arms loosened around her, and she bit viciously into the man's palm.

He swore and cursed, letting her go to see to his injured leg and hand, and Eldonia fell to the ground. She quickly rose up to her knees, the blanket slipping from her body as she scrambled to get to her feet and find a way to flee. However, she wasn't fast enough.

"You stupid witch!" the man seethed. Despite his injuries, he quickly hauled her back up and held her firmly against his body. He hauled her over to the nearest tree and pressed her roughly against it, holding her still between the tree and his own body.

Eldonia cried out as her naked front was scratched against the tough, cold bark of the tree.

"Hmm...," the man said in a husky voice that made Eldonia shiver in fear. "Now I wonder what a woman like you was doin' in our cabin without a stitch o' clothing on." He pressed his engorged groin into her behind as he ran his hands roughly over her naked, shapely sides. One hand rose up to squeeze one of her breasts, while the other drifted down to roughly pet her most intimate place.

"St-stop it!" Eldonia whimpered. She didn't want the beloved memory of Fortis taking her against a tree earlier this night to be ruined by what this man might do! "Please! Let me go!"

"Oh, I don't think so, my little whore. It's been a long time since I've had a woman, and I can pay you well. Just got me a whole lot o' gold just this evening. I can feel you've already been taken tonight, but that doesn't bother me. Means you're already loosened up and ready for me."

Eldonia shuddered as he licked over her ear and left a long, slimy trail of spit down her neck.

"Don't you touch me!" she said as firmly as she could, rallying her courage in the face of a possible rape! "My husband will kill you if you do anything to me!"

"Husband, eh?" The man continued fondling her, making her squirm. His touch almost made her feel ill! "And just who might your husband be?"

"L-lord Fortis Vanderstorm! He's the earl of all the land in this area! He's young and strong, and he'll snap your neck like a twig!"

"Hmm...so was it this Lord Vandersteem you were cavortin' with in me and the boys' shack?"

"It's Vanderstorm! And Yes! Let me go, and you might get away with your life!"

The man chuckled and twirled her around harshly so she could see his face. The man was young and harsh, perhaps a few years older than Fortis. Eldonia might have considered him somewhat handsome if he weren't a Vladian scoundrel! "I don't think so, lovey," the man said, lowering his head slowly. Eldonia's eyes widened when she realized he intended to kiss her! "Ol' Loki has a plan up his sleeves...."

Loki held Eldonia's face still, but right before his lips met hers...

A pair of gun shots had him whipping his head up and putting his hand over Eldonia's mouth again. "Shut up, if you know what's good for ya," he sneered.

After a couple moments, another Crack! Crack! had him hauling Eldonia with him around the side of the cabin. Stealthily zig-zagging between trees, the pair reached the front of the cabin and hid behind another large tree. Loki looked aghast as Vilnius looked down at his bloody, bullet-ridden chest before collapsing to the ground.

Loki grit his teeth. "Where did those shots come from?" he whispered. "That man there holds merely a sword. And where are the others? Don't tell me that man killed them all!"

Eldonia tried to scream and yell as she caught sight of Fortis and then her grandmother, as the older woman stepped out from behind a tree, holding two smoking pistols. However, a few muffled groans were all that escaped Loki's hold on her mouth.

"I don't believe it!" Loki seethed. "Felled by a feeble old woman?! Gotten lax in your old age, brother. Lord Papa Ramius will not be happy to hear about this! But...you and the others...be at peace with the gods."

Loki bowed his head to his chest for a moment.

He stilled when he heard the sword-bearing man begin yelling. Loki figured this must be Eldonia's Lord Vanderstorm.

Loki kept himself and Eldonia clear of line-of-sight as Fortis began running around, searching wildly and yelling out a name over and over.

Loki smirked down at the woman in his arms. "Eldonia, hmm? Nice name. It fits you."

The Valleyans nodded. Valleyans knew already. Valleyans always knew.

Although often seen as nomadic gypsies, Valleyans were possessed of their own mystical magical powers, inherited from their distant Fantasmian cousins and ancestors, when they migrated north. Because of their constant travel and preference to living in the lowlands, most people called them valley-people or valleyans...and the name just stuck. They were not a people of their own land, and were not strictly speaking, Mountanian citizens and subjects. But for centuries, Mountain kings had granted them free-roam of their lands, in return for certain favours in times of war, favours which the Valleyans were more than happy to grant, in return for free roam over Mountain lowlands.

"Thou shalt ride with us!" said Constance, "Come, my dear! Into the caravan with thee. Rest on thy journey. Prithee enjoy some of our victuals to your own delight".

"Thank you!" said Eldonia. Constance smiled and led Eldonia up the back steps of the caravan and inside. Ulrich and his brother-in-law, Josiah, climbed up onto the front seat again.

Josiah frowned. "Our crafts are not suited to Mountain men of this size...you may ride on the roof, if thou wish".

Jupiter blushed. Ulrich chuckled.

"Mine brother-in-law doth jest with thee, good Lord Jupiter. Ride in front with us. 'Tis more comforting. We shall deposit thee at thy brother's estate when we arrive there".

"Thanks!" said Jupiter, and climbed up into the driver's seat.

Ulrich flicked the reins on the backs of the two horses pulling the caravan.

"Walk on!" he cried out, and the horses trotted off.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
CRASH!!

"Waaaaah! Aaah waaaaah!!! Waaaaaaah!!"

"AAAH SHUDDUP!"

Minerva hurried upstairs from the drawing-room to see her brother Fortis pacing back and forth in his bedroom. The doors were opened. In the nursery down the corridor, Leo wailed and sobbed! The scary noise woke him up and he was scared by it!

Minerva scooped up her nephew and shook him, and bounced him up and down in her arms.

"Awww there there!" she said, and kissed him, "Aunty's here...Fortis you're waking up the baby!"

"Oh shut up!" Fortis growled. Minerva entered her brother's room to see him smashing his huge fists into a solid, wooden dummy on a stand. He seemed to be taking out his fury on the mannequin that held his old suit of armour, the one which didn't fit him anymore.

"Fortis! Stop it!...Granny why is he so angry!?" Minerva said, as her grandmother came up behind her to take the baby.

"Oooh come darling!" said Lady Athena, "He's just...questioning things, that's all".

"It SOUNDS like he's trying to beat that mannequin into toothpicks!"

"Let's say he's trying to reaffirm his masculinity, darling".

Minerva blushed. She never thought her oldest brother ever had to do that!

"What do you mean?" she said.

"Well his favourite girl and his wife was just kidnapped and snatched up away from right under his nose! He feels like he's failed Eldonia as a husband and a protector! He's feeling very depressed right about now".

Minerva nodded. She supposed that she could understand that.

"He could do with some company, dear", said Lady Athena, "Go to him! You always make him feel better. I'll look after the baby...Come along, Leonardo! Let's go play with the bunnies!"

Leo perked up. The bunnies! Ooooh...

Minerva cautiously entered her brother's bedchamber. She knew that her brother, despite his phenomenal strength, would never dare lay a finger upon her, but in his highly agitated state, she didn't want to take any chances.

"Forty?"

"WHAT!?...Oh...uh...w-what is it, girl?"

"Forty, please! I'm sure Jupiter will bring Eldonia back safe! You know he's very good with stuff like that. Snooping and poking around. Remember how much trouble he got into with papa that time on granny's birthday, when I was ten?"

Fortis snorted. "He wasn't so good then", he said. He let out a weak smile, and sat down on the bed. His sister sat on his lap.

"See? He'll be fine, and Donnie'll be okay! They'll both come back safe!"

Fortis groaned, "Whatever...I dunno, girl! I'm just worried! I want to have a big happy family with Donnie. She could give us lots of kids and we could have boys and girls to bring us all happiness and joy...and...and...well she's sweet!"

"Of course she is! She wouldn't be my best friend if she wasn't! Oh Forty, do stop worrying!"

Minerva snuggled up against her brother. Fortis wrapped a gigantic arm around her and squeezed her close to his solid, bare chest. She rubbed her cheek against him and gave him a sisterly kiss.

Fortis sighed. "Alright..." he said. "Tell you what, how about..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"How's about I make us somethin' to eat, huh?" Fortis asked. "Would that make you feel better?" he asked. Minerva nodded. Maybe a snack might take her mind off of how uncertain things were. Fortis smiled. He got up and headed downstairs. Minerva followed.

The house-girls were out. They either had their days off, or were in the gardens. There was no real problem with this. Fortis never really relied on them. He kept them on mostly because of tradition. And he could afford to pay their wages, so he didn't see why he shouldn't continue to do so.

The mountain lord entered the kitchen of his castle. The kitchen was not huge, but not tiny, either. After all, it had to produce food for the lord, his friends, his family, and the household staff. Fortis reached for a frying-pan, a spatula, some bowls, plates, and other things.

"I'll make us up some steak sandwiches, huh girl?" Fortis asked. He started sawing at a loaf of bread, producing thick, fluffy slices of bread.

"Aaaaah!"

Minerva squealed!

"Oh Forty! Granny left Leo in the kitchen!" she said. The year-old toddler sat on the kitchen table, sucking his thumb, looking googly-eyed at Aunty and Papa.

"She did not!" said Lady Athena, "I went to get him his bottle from the larder!" she added, coming into the kitchen from a corridor nearby, "Here you are, my sweet treasure!"

"Oh I'll do it, granny", said Minerva. She hefted her nephew in her arms and sat down in a chair, slowly feeding the baby his milk-bottle. The baby suckled on the wooden teat with a steady 'smuk-smuk-smuk!!' suckling sound.

Lady Athena left the kitchen, and Minerva stroked her nephew.

"Aww he's cute...Forty when Eldonia comes back, will you have more children?"

"Probably", Fortis said. He started stoking up the range, getting the stove nice and hot, before drizzling oil onto the pan and cracking eggs onto it. The eggs sizzled in the hot olive oil. He beat them up with the spatula and stirred them around the pan. Minerva noticed that her brother's body was slick with sweat from the heat of the stove. She smiled. She bet Eldonia would be all over that. Her big, brave, bronzed beast...

Fortis tossed on a few steaks and began frying them, too. Eventually, he transferred everything to plates. He carried the food out into the dining-hall and put it onto the table. Leo crawled along the dining-table.

"C'mere, sonny!" said Fortis. He grabbed his son and sat him in his lap, "You want some steak, boy?"

Fortis tugged a small piece of meat out of his sandwich, "Say 'Aaah'!"

"Fortis! He's only a year old! He can't eat steak!"

"He's got teeth, ain't he?"

"They're MILK teeth!"

"Girl, when I was his age, I was eatin' a cow a week!"

"Oh rubbish!"

"Ain't hardly! How you think I got so big, huh? Suckin' down moo-juice?"

"Well of course you did! Milk builds bones!"

"Yeah. And eatin' what makes that milk makes them bones even bigger!" he said, and flexed an arm, "Now c'mon boy! Just a little bite..."

Minerva sighed. She watched as Leo munched on a particularly juicy bit of meat. He giggled! He liked it!

"Oh if you MUST feed him that stuff, then at least mince it up!" Minerva said.

"Good idea, girl. I think I will..."

"I WAS JOKING!"

"I'm not! I'll mince him some later...right now, I'm hungry..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
After enjoying his meal with Minerva and his son (and eventually feeding Leo numerous small bites of steak, which the baby absolutely adored), Fortis sent Leo off with his sister to play. He thought he would go to his study to get some work done, hoping that would distract him from thinking and worrying more about his missing wife and his brother.

Seated at his large desk, Fortis frowned down at the figures in his ledger, making several notations and doing some minor addition and subtraction.

"Hmmm...Tenant Weitboer has been skimping on his rations he pays for rent for the past three months! How could I have overlooked this?! And...wait a minute...he's not the only one! Gerstboer, Vanderlanden, Geitherder...."

Fortis ran an irritated hand through his hair.

"I'll have to address this issue with my tenants immediately, or they'll get even more stingy! Plus, I need to collect the amount they've shorted me, or the king will have MY hide! Blasted farmers!"

A knock on the door interrupted his thoughts.

Fortis threw his quill down on the blotter on the desk and barked out, "Yes?!"

"Pardon me, my lord," his squire Koviac said upon opening the door a ways and bowing. "However, there is a...gentleman...here bearing a letter for you."

"A letter? Well, come on in and give it to me, then!"

"Well, er, the man said he was to deliver the letter to you personally, my lord."

"Well, then, send him in!"

"Yes, Sir!"

Fortis shook his head.

A minute later, a middle-aged man entered the study and bowed before the young earl. Fortis raised an eyebrow at the man's dress, for the stranger was wearing very simple clothing in very bright colors and patterns. Fortis even caught a sparkle of light glinting off the man's ears, and Fortis was surprised to realize the man's ears were pierced!

"You have a letter for me?" Fortis said.

"If thou art Lord Fortis Vanderstorm, aye, I bear a missive for thou," said the man in a distinct accent.

Fortis rose from his desk and approached the odd man. "I am Lord Vanderstorm, Sir, but WHO might you be?"

"I be Joaquim, my lord, and I have ridden hard all day and night to deliver this letter unto thy hands, and thine alone."

Joaquim presented a folded piece of parchment to Fortis, who took the note with a small amount of skepticism...until he unfolded it and read the signature at the bottom.

"It's from Jupiter!" he exclaimed.

"Aye, the young man Jupiter and a young maedchen with him came and joined our caravan a couple days ago, my lord," Joaquim said with a nod of his head. "They be heading here with the rest of my kin."

Fortis finally placed the odd dress and manner of speech. "You're a Valleyan, aren't you?"

"Aye, my lord."

"You say my brother Jupiter met up with you a few days ago, and he had a young woman with him? Do you know the name of the woman? And where did he join you?"

Joaquim smiled at the anxious earl. "Perhaps your brother has addressed thy miriad questions in yon missive, my lord."

"Oh! Of course!"

Fortis then began quickly scanning the letter.

"My dearest older brother,

I knew you would be worried sick still for Eldonia's (and perhaps even my own) safety, so I thought it best to send you a letter before we arrive back home to Castle Vanderstorm.

You will be happy to know that I successfully made it into Vladia, infiltrated the enemy keep, found Eldonia, and killed her captor (some old man named Lord Ramius). I was then able to lead her out of the keep and into the wilds of Vladia.

A day or two after we fled her captors, we encountered a troupe of Valleyans along a Vladian road, and they were kind enough to allow us to travel with them in their caravan. Steadily more Valleyans have been joining up with us, and we are now in a rather sizeable entourage heading into Mountania. Joaquim, whom we quickly befriended, graciously agreed to carry and deliver this letter into your hands. Please, treat him well.

I know that your main concern is for Donnie, and while she is now safely out of the hands of those nasty Vladians...she unfortunately didn't escape from her kidnapping unscathed. She has been unwilling to confide in me everything the Vladians did to her, but I know they treated her abysmally, brother. She won't fall asleep unless I am there holding her (I can see your frown of jealousy, Fortis, and it was purely platonic, I swear!), and every night I am awoken by her cries as she relives her torture in her nightmares. I am hoping that when we get home, she may find some comfort or some measure of peace with either you or Minnie, because she seems rather broken. She is also anxious to see Leo again.

As I write this, the caravan is perhaps two days' journey out from Castle Vanderstorm, and assuming Joaquim makes it to you in good time, we should be seeing you in a day or so upon your receipt of this letter.

Seeing you soon,

Your brother, Jupiter"

Fortis grit his teeth and couldn't help himself from crushing the letter in his fists as he read it. How dare those Vladian scoundrels torture his beloved, sweet, spunky wife?! If it didn't mean going into Vladia, Fortis would teach those awful, foul, cretinous excuses for human beings to never kidnap or torture a Mountanian woman ever again!

"Are you alright, my lord?" Koviac asked, fidgeting nervously at the sight of the earl's obvious ire.

"DO I LOOK ALRIGHT TO YOU?!"

Fortis closed his eyes and took a deep breath. "Koviac, leave me. Joaquim, thank you for delivering this letter. If you're hungry, I'm sure Mrs. Tibbs has something to feed you in the kitchens."

"I understand thy wife has been through a most heinous experience, my lord," Joaquim said sadly. "And I appreciate thy hospitality. However, I needs must get back to my caravan."

Fortis nodded his head. "Thank you. Safe travels."

Joaquim bowed, and both he and Koviac left the room.

Fortis stomped over to the nearest window and seethed. He needed to hit something...break something...yell out his anger. Eldonia was tortured! And his mind kept filling with all different kinds of horrible scenarios of how those disgusting Vladians treated his spunky, joyous wife.

Fortis caught sight of Cannius wandering past his window, hauling his sword and shield, and a feral grin sprouted on Fortis's face. Perfect!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis took several deep breaths.

Minerva was soft. Tender. Gentle. Sweet. Loving. Trusting. Affectionate. She had an inner strength and determination, confidence and firmness. And Fortis adored all of her excellent qualities...even if she could be rather clingy at times.

Eldonia was fiery, excitable, loving, caring, darling, sweet, spunky, athletic and daring!

It was a wonderful balance between the two girls. No wonder they got along so well.

Fortis wondered how many of those qualities Eldonia would have left when she had returned after her ordeal? Fortis groaned. He slammed a fist into the stone walls of his study, letting out a loud growl of frustration! It was then that he saw Cannius swinging his sword around outside, practicing his moves. Overcome with fury, Fortis lumbered out of his study and into his bedroom. He changed his clothes and drew out his sword. He had to blow off steam, and this was probably the best way to do it...

It took a great deal of upper-body strength to wield a sword effectively. Strong arm, back and chest-muscles were essential for handling the solid length of steel in anything approaching skill. It was because of this constant training that Fortis boasted impressive pecs, a broad chest, huge shoulders and massive arms.

As a knight, he had been forced by tradition to train since the age of five. He remembered his father training him when he was younger. Old lord Vanderstorm had been a knight, and although he had long retired from active military duty, he still knew all the skills for combat, and had rigorously trained his three sons in combat.

The birth of their little sister had only given the three boys greater cause to make themselves the best that they could be.

Fortis headed downstairs and into the garden. He could see Cannius swinging, swiping, stabbing and twisting, practicing his moves against invisible enemies.

Well one of those enemies was about to become very visible indeed.

"YAAAAARRGGGHHH!!"

CRASH!!

Steel screeched and sparks flew!

In the dining-hall, housemaids cleaning up the luncheon things stopped in their work. They hurried to the windows. They unlocked them and pushed them open to watch the spectacle.

Usually, this would cause a change, and Fortis would become more of a showman. But today it was strictly business. He was there to burn off his anger and he was going to do it no matter who was watching!

Harsh scraping, clashing sounds echoed around, as the two brothers fought. Lady Athena entered the dining-room when she heard the ruckus, and hurried to the windows. She was about to ask the boys to please keep it DOWN, as the baby was sleeping upstairs, but she was too impressed by the spectacle to stop watching. One of the maids pushed up some chairs and everyone sat down to watch.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"What the heck is wrong with you?!" Cannius panted, blocking another brutal strike. "That last swing nearly took my head off!"

"You blocked it didn't you?! Quit-cher whining!"

"I didn't ASK for you to come out and spar with me!"

"Well, you didn't say I COULDN'T, either!"

"You didn't give me time to object! You just came out with your sword swinging! What else could I do but defend myself!"

"And you're gonna keep on defending yourself, you lazy cur!"

Fortis swung and stabbed, and Cannius blocked and parried. Fortis let everything he was feeling, all his pent-up emotions of anger and worry and fear, bubble up inside him, fueling his sword arm. He took out everything he'd been feeling since Eldonia had been kidnapped on his younger brother.

Cannius, meanwhile, was seething himself. He had merely wanted to practice a few sword moves, get in a little bit of training during the cool of the evening. And then Fortis comes up and attacks him! Well, two could play this game! He was tired of constantly being on the defense around his surly brother these days. Fortis seemed to have been taking out his anger on nearly every male in Castle Vanderstorm lately, with the exception of little Leo. Well, Cannius had also been worried about Eldonia, and now Jupiter. He'd show Fortis a thing or two!

"YAAAAHHH!"

With a flurry of sword strikes, Cannius went on the offensive, making Fortis stagger back in surprise. Despite his obvious advantage in height and weight and muscle, Fortis found himself now scrambling to block Cannius's sudden moves! Cannius was more nimble and agile than Fortis was and kept moving in circles around Fortis. Fortis began to pant and tire as he found himself now trying to keep from being sliced apart by Cannius's swings!

Back in the house, the gathered maids began to titter in excitement when they saw the tide turn in the sword-fight. While they all rooted for their lord and master to win, the quick turn-around with Cannius gaining momentum and the upper hand just built their excitement. They relished the thought of the earl pulling ahead in the end and throwing Cannius down into the dust.

Lady Athena, though, frowned. It was unusual for Fortis to make a mistake in a sword-fight. Athena was all too aware of how over-confidence, arrogance, or emotional upheaval could affect how one performed in battle. Her late husband had been known for his hot-headedness, and Athena remembered far too many times when she had to patch him up after he had severely lost a fight--be it with swords or fists. She didn't relish having to do the same to either of her grandsons, but she rarely had to patch up Fortis. She wondered if today might be different.

Fortis's legs began to feel shaky as his adrenaline and anger began to wear off. He grit his teeth and sliced his sword, but it merely swished through the air. However, it temporarily left him open and vulnerable. A brutal swing from Cannius at an unexpected angle made him stagger backwards in shock...and pain!

"ARRRRRGGGGGGHH!" Fortis howled.

He involuntarily dropped his sword and clenched his bloody arm with his free hand.

"That would be first blood, Forty," Cannius said haughtily, though his chest was heaving for breath. "I win! Finally!" He pumped his sword into the air, then spun on his heel and swaggered back into the house.

Fortis stood there in shock! Neither of his brothers had ever beaten in him a fight before! NEVER! Fortis glanced down at his stinging arm, not able to believe the sight of blood running down from the long cut across his bicep.

The maids as one all gasped! The earl had...LOST?! Such a thing had never occurred before!

"Well, I don't know about you girls," one of them said after a long moment, "but I think Lord Cannius deserves a little...attention...after winning his fight!" She primped her hair, pinched her cheeks, and gave the other maids a seductive waggle of her eyebrows before leaving the dining room, adding a little swing to her hips as she walked away.

Lady Athena rolled her eyes and clapped her hands to get the other maids' attention. "Lord Fortis obviously needs medical attention. Susan, go get a dish of hot water. Rachel, some thread and a needle. Cynthia, tear an old sheet into rags, and make sure it's a clean one. We don't want his wound going septic."

The girls scurried off to get the ordered items just as Fortis wandered into the dining room. He slumped down into a chair and simply stared straight ahead...as if he were still in shock. Athena tsked at her oldest grandson and went over to inspect his wound.

"Well, I've seen worse," she said, grabbing a chair and hauling it over so she could stitch it back up. "It's a nice clean slice and should heal readily. The jagged lacerations are the ones you have to worry about."

Fortis turned blank eyes to his grandmother as if not really seeing her. "I...I lost," he said in disbelief.

Athena frowned. "So you did. But you let your temper get the best of you, boy."

Fortis snorted. "Twas my temper what led me to fight Cannius in the first place."

"Aye. And look what that taught you!"

Athena just sighed as Fortis frowned and looked off into space. When the maids brought all the supplies Athena had asked for, she went about the task of cleaning, sewing up, and bandaging Fortis's wound. Fortis didn't wince or show any sign of pain even once through the whole process.

"Come now, son, go take a bath and relax for a bit," Athena said softly, laying a hand on Fortis's enormous shoulder.

Fortis sighed and ran his good hand over his face. "Yeah."

After several strong lads had dumped the hot water in his own personal brass tub, Fortis sank wearily into his bath. His arm was beginning to really sting, but he kept it up out of the water so that the bandaging wouldn't get wet.

He couldn't believe his brother had actually got first blood in a sword fight! Fortis had always won before...ALWAYS! It didn't seem right that he somehow lost this time! He was the tallest, the oldest, the strongest! He still was! But then, how did Cannius manage to get the better of him?

Fortis had worked off a mad plenty of times before in a sword fight! He'd also sparred with his brothers countless times before! What made this one fight different from all the rest?

I've never been afraid for Eldonia's life before, he admitted to himself. Or worried about her state of being when she returns to me.

Fortis sank lower in the water, slumping his shoulders. The fight hadn't made him feel any better. If anything, it only made him feel worse.

Fortis was so absorbed in his despondent thoughts, he didn't see the door to his bathing chamber slowly open or hear the soft noise of fabric moving along the wooden floor.

Clang! Clang! Clang!

Fortis suddenly shot up his bath! A giggle sounded from the floor, and Fortis leaned over the tub. Leo sat on his bottom, banging his fist merrily against the brass tub.

Clang! Clang! Clang!

Fortis couldn't help a small smile. His son never ceased to cheer him up when he was feeling down.

"Come here, you little noisemaker!"

Leo giggled as Papa lifted him high in the air and then settled him on his chest.

"Papa! Baff!"

Leo leaned over and batted his hand on the surface of the water, splashing his father's face and chest.

"That's right, you little scamp!"

Fortis splashed the water himself, and ended up dousing his fully clothed son so that the boy was completely drenched!

Fortis laughed at the surprised look on Leo's face, and then removed the sopping clothes and nappy from the boy's body.

"Yea! Baff wiff Papa!" Leo clapped his little hands, then his father's cheeks, and then the bathwater again.

Soon, the two were happily playing in the water.

Fortis reveled in spending some quality time with his son...until Leo tired out a bit and lay sleepily on his father's broad chest and asked innocently, "Papa? Where Momma, Papa?"

As the baby rubbed his fist in his eye, Fortis inwardly cursed at being reminded once more of Eldonia's absence.

Fortis cleared his throat and gently rubbed the boy's back. "Momma's been...um...travelling, Leo. She'll be back in a day or two. I'm sure she's missed you a lot."

Leo sniffed. "Want Momma."

"I know, boy. I want her, too."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
“You wanted to see me, Madam Matilda?”

“Aye, mein Kind*. Please, come in.”

Eldonia let the flap of the tent fall down behind her as she entered the bright, airy space. A large cauldron was bubbling furiously on a fire in the far corner. A round table with two chairs was set up in the middle. A crystal ball that had a white mist swirling in its midst was sitting in the middle of the table. An old woman with long white hair was sitting hunched over in the far chair. A fuchsia scarf was wrapped around her head, numerous golden necklaces hung from her neck, and bangles covered her wrists. She had a smile on her face as she raised a gnarled hand at Eldonia.

“Take a seat, meine Teure**.”

Eldonia sat in the closest chair and put her hands primly in her lap.

“I understand that thou hast had a rather trying time recently,” Madam Matilda said kindly.

“Yes,” Eldonia said simply, not really wishing to talk about what she had gone through at the hands of her Vladian captors.

“I am most sorry for all that happened to thee. Most unpleasant business those Vladians engage in. However, I have seen some things recently in mein crystal ball about thee that I felt I should share with thee.”

“Oh?”

“Hast thou been feeling poorly lately?”

“Poorly? Well, um,...I suppose I haven't felt completely healthy since I was kidnapped several weeks ago. It's only been in the past couple of days when Jupiter and I came into your caravan that I've had a decent amount of food to eat.”

Eldonia paused and swallowed hard as the old gypsy woman just stared at her...seemingly stared through her.

“...Well, I suppose despite all the food available, I...haven't had much of an appetite over the past couple of days. But I just figured that was because the first meal I had with you, I ate too much and ended up getting sick. A-and the smell of cooked rabbit still makes me queasy.”

Matilda nodded at her.

Eldonia's eyes widened in fright, and she splayed her hands on the table in front of her. “Oh, no! Am I ill with something? Did one of those Vladians...*gulp*...g-g-give me...something...? Something...horrible?”

Eldonia had heard horror stories from some of the maids in her father's house and in Castle Vanderstorm about some of the diseases uncultured men could give to women through...sexual contact. What if she had caught something from one of her captors?!

“No, no, mein Kind. Nothing like that. But hast thou been lethargic, as well?”

“I...suppose so. I feel as if I can't get enough sleep these days, but I felt that way the entire time I was in Vladia, too.”

Matilda smiled at Eldonia. “Hast thou not figured it out for thyself, yet?”

Eldonia racked her brain over her symptoms, but her mind was a bit foggy and unfocussed. She shook her head sadly at the old gypsy. “I...I don't know.”

Matilda waved her hand over the crystal ball, and the swirling mist inside began swirling faster. Soon, a picture appeared in the middle of the mist.

“Take a look at thy future, meine Teure,” Matilda murmured.

Eldonia leaned forward and watched with wonder.

Fortis was holding a slightly older Leo's hands as the little boy was taking several toddling steps forward.

“There's my big boy!” she heard herself say. She saw her own hands stretched out toward Leo and Leo's big smile as Fortis let go. Leo continued walking by himself until he fell into her arms.

“Wook, Momma! I big boy!”

Eldonia held Leo tightly, laughing all the while.

“Yes, you are, Leo,” Fortis said, sinking down on his haunches to engulf his family in his big, strong arms.

“Leo make good big bwuver?”

Fortis laughed. “I'm sure you will!”

Eldonia saw herself look down. Leo was patting her belly. But, her belly wasn't flat. It was large and round.

Fortis placed his hand on top of Leo's on her belly and smiled at Eldonia before leaning close and giving her an intense kiss. “I can't wait to meet this little one, Donnie.”

Leo giggled. “Baby kick me, Momma!”

Eldonia looked down and smiled. “That's his way of saying 'hello'!”

“Hewwo, baby!”

As the image in the glass ball faded, Eldonia sat back in shock. She put a hand to her very flat belly.

“I'm...I'm....”

She looked up at Matilda uncertainly. The old woman nodded.

“Thou art.”

Initially, Eldonia felt excitement. She was giving Fortis another baby! She remembered him saying how he wanted a large family, and she was glad she could give it to him! Maybe another son....

But then, reality intruded. For the last month before her kidnapping, she hadn't slept with Fortis at all...until that last night they were together, and then they had shagged like rabbits.

However, after that one wonderful night with Fortis....

Tears sprang to Eldonia's eyes, and she quickly removed her hand from her belly. She clenched the arms of her chair tightly. What if...it wasn't Fortis's baby? She had been r-r-...taken...countless times by that awful Loki, not to mention Lord Ramius, and who knows who did what to her when she was passed out or asleep!

“Madam Matilda,” Eldonia gasped, trying to keep from sobbing. “Can you...t-tell me if my husband, Fortis,...is the father of my baby?”

Matilda got up and placed a gentle hand on Eldonia's shoulder. “I am afraid the spirits have not revealed that to me. I am very sorry, mein Kind. The only thing I canst do for thee is give thee a potion. Thou canst give it to thy Kind upon birth, and it shalt reveal the Pater of thy Kind. However, if thy experience is too much for thee....”

The old woman went over to a trunk near the wall of the tent and rummaged through a few drawstring sacks and herbs. She eventually found what she was looking for and presented a sealed bag to Eldonia.

“This herb canst...relieve...thee of thy burden. Merely steep it as tea for three minutes and drink down the liquid. Thou willt bleed for several hours, but thy burden willt be gone. However, the herb must be used within the next four weeks; otherwise, thy Kind willt be too large to remove and cause thy own death.”

Eldonia stared at the drawstring bag with wide eyes. She had never considered the possibility of...abortion...before. She didn't want to kill Fortis's baby. But, if it were Loki's baby.... Eldonia shuddered at the thought. She didn't know if she could raise the child of her repeated rapes.

Hesitantly, she took the bag from the old woman. Matilda smiled at her kindly. The gypsy then retrieved a vial that contained an opalescent liquid.

“This potion will reveal the Pater of thy Kind...should thou choose to bear the Kind to term. The face of the Pater will briefly insinuate itself over the face of thy Kind.”

Eldonia took the vial, too, then stood.

“Thank you, Madam Matilda. I...appreciate you telling me.”

“Mein Teure,” the old woman murmured, taking the discomfited girl in her bony arms for a comforting hug. “Thou shalt be alright. May the spirits guide thee in thy decisions. Trust in thy husband...and in thyself.”

“I...I will, Madam Matilda.”

Eldonia let a few tears fall at the kind woman's words and then left the tent.

“Donnie!” Jupiter yelled as he ran up to her. “Hey, we're only a few hours away from Castle Vanderstorm! We'll be there by supper time!”

“Oh! Great!” Eldonia said with a forced smile.

As the caravan packed up to head on down the road, Eldonia's thoughts were in a whirl. While she was grateful she would soon be home, what and how could she, should she, share what she had gone through in Vladia...let alone the knowledge she had just received?

Eldonia placed one hand on her belly, while she put the other in her pocket where she stashed the abortion herb and the paternity potion. What would Fortis or Minerva or Grandma Athena think she should do?

"TELL ME!!"

Eldonia took a deep breath. "You really want to know?"

"YES!"

"I was kidnapped by Vladians about fourteen years ago. They...tortured me and did awful things to me. Your uncle Jupiter found me and brought me back home, but when I got home, I found out I was carrying you."

Odin reeled back, his eyes wide. "You mean...that I'm...."

Eldonia nodded sadly, a few tears slipping down her cheeks. "It was the hardest decision I ever made, to carry you to term and keep you. Despite who your father is, Odin, you're still MY son. And I love you very much!"

Odin shook his head in disbelief, got shakily to his feet, and ran off into the woods.

--- --- --- ---

Eldonia gasped as she awoke once more. She put a hand to her flat belly and began crying. If her child were indeed Loki's or some other Vladian's, how could she bear to raise it?
