1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"You feelin' alright, sweetheart?"

Eldonia nodded mutely. She had been having so many different dreams and thoughts lately...which one of them was even real?

The Vanderstorm family sat down to breakfast. There was a mix of sweet and savoury dishes on the sideboard, and when Minerva got to her feet, she could choose from eggs, bacon, sausages, porridge, pancakes, waffles, potatoes and a staggering array of buns and tarts. She was glad she had only a small appetite or she would soon end up as round and plump as Mrs. Tibbs!

*Jangle-jangle-jangle!!*

"Aaaahh!!" Eldonia squeaked!

"Oooh there, there!" said Athena, "Her nerves are so frayed ever since she got back!"

"Liza, the door", Fortis said flatly. The housemaid curtsied and left the dining-room. She headed down the corridor and opened the front doors.

"Is your master at home?"

Standing on the stoop was a tiny, wrinkled old woman dressed entirely in black. She held a battered old walking-stick and a sack over her shoulder.

"Yes ma'am", said the maid, bobbing in curtsy, "Who should I say has arrived?"

"I will not require an introduction", the lady said. Her voice was sort of rough and sharp. She shuffled into the foyer.

"Hi!"

Eliza turned around. Standing outside was a handsome youth with stunning white blond hair. He smiled and came in. Sunlight seemed to radiate from his smooth, pale skin.

"I am Lord Merlin", he said. he didn't look any older than twelve! "She's my grandmother", he added.

"COME ALONG, MERLIN!"

"Oh...Coming granny!"

Fortis sat up in his seat, "Uh-oh...Granny, you did tell Ursula to come AFTER breakfast, didn't you?"

"Well...um...her eyesight is not what it was..." Athena said, "She may have misread the letter. You know how old she is".

"Never mind", Fortis said, "We're nearly done, anyway".

Two figures entered the dining room.

"Merlin!"

The handsome young wizard smiled and rushed to Minerva. The two friends hugged.

"Athena", said Ursula creakiily, "You are well?"

"Thank you, yes! Here's your patient, doctor!"

"Aaah...the virtuous young maiden...Hmmmm..."

"Ursula, I DID mention that it was a pregnancy through...misadventure, shall we say. it is in no way a reflection on her character!"

The old witch nodded. "We shall see", she said.

"Can you tell me who the baby's father is? I would really want to know!" Eldonia said.

Ursula frowned, "I can try..." she said. "I will need somewhere quiet where I can work", she said.

"Let's go to the parlour", said Athena. Everyone got up and started towards the parlour.

"Now", said Ursula, taking some things out of her bag. A wand, a ball, and some bottles of potions, "You will forgive me, but I must ask some rather...um...personal...questions. Anyone offended by such things should leave now".

Nobody stood up.

"Very well...Fortis, you are this woman's lawfully and naturally wedded husband?"

"Uh...naturally...wed?"

"She means have you had sex before!?" Athena hissed. A few people giggled.

Just then, Leo toddled in.

"Mama!!"

"Um...Yeah", said Fortis, and pointed to the baby.

Everyone laughed. Eldonia put an arm around her toddling son.

"Of course...I had forgot you had another child. That is very good. I may need it later on".

"It's a boy, Ursula. It's not an 'it', it's a 'him'", Eldonia corrected. The old witch paid no attention.

"When is the last time you two um...enjoyed each other's company?"

Fortis frowned, "Um...About a month or two ago, I think? We hadn't been...getting along and well...we found ourselves in special circumstances. And one thing...led to another and...we had fun...huh?" he said, looking at Eldonia, who blushed red! Cannius and Jupiter grinned.

"Was it um...a single event?"

"Oh gosh...no um...two or three times..." said Eldonia.

"FORTIS!" Athena said.

"Hey, at least I'm healthy gran!"

Minerva laughed.

"And these other events...they happened...when?"

"About a week after I spent my time with Fortis".

"Hmmm. As many times as before?"

"Oh I don't think so...Maybe once or twice...I don't know! It was all so terrible!"

"Good!" said the witch.

"GOOD!?"

"Certainly. I must know your emotions. They are important!"

"Oh! You're welcome".

"And you were happy with your husband?"

"Indescribably so..."

"Eeeewww!" Cannius yelped! "T-M-I!"

"His big, strong arms and his powerful upper body, pressing down an innocent, weak waif, submitting to his bestial rage!!..."

"That's enough, darling..." said Athena.

Minerva giggled and Fortis smirked. Yeah. You BET that's what happened.

The witch cleared her throat. "Very well. Athena, you said something about Vladian gypsies in your letter..."

"That's VALLEYAN, granny!" Merlin said, "I don't know why you don't get yourself a new pair of glasses like grandpa does!...HERE'S the letter..."

Athena read over her own writing.

"Oh yes!" she said, "Eldonia was given some...medicines...by the Valleyans on her way home. One to tell the paternity of the child, and the other to um...rid her of her burden".

Ursula nodded. "I would like to see them", she said.

Minerva hurried upstairs to the nursery and came back a couple of minutes later. The old witch held one bottle, and then the other, in her hands, and peered at them through a gold-rimmed monocle.

"Hmmm...this one, we may not need", she put down the abortion drug.

"THIS ONE...may prove useful to my...examination. We have a similar potion in Fantasmia. It does more or less the same thing, but it is of greater strength and capability", she said. "I will ask everyone to leave the room".

"What for?" Jupiter asked.

"I must have the lady expose herself, or the next part of my experiment will not work!"

"Well I'm not leaving!" said Fortis, firmly.

"Oh very well..." said Ursula, "The husband may stay. Everybody else, OUT!"

One by one, everyone else filed out.

Ursula pointed to the sofa. "My dear, I'll ask you to remove the top part of your dress and lay down on the couch. Strip all the way down to your waist!...Don't be shy! Come along now!"

Eldonia slowly tugged off her bodice and top robes, and lay down on the couch. After her recent ordeal, she wasn't exactly happy exposing herself to anyone but immediate family at the moment!

"What's this got to do with finding out who the father is?" Fortis said.

"Valleyans have good magic, but they do not always fully realise their own powers", Ursula explained. "My people have found that this paternity potion works in more than just one way".

"How's that?"

"I bet the lady who gave you this..." the old witch waved the bottle, "...told you to feed it to the baby?"

Eldonia nodded.

"I suppose it never occurred to any of you that it would work even better if you drank it yourself?"

Eldonia let out a "Oooooh", and blushed.

"I thought not!" said Ursula. "It's very simple. She drinks the potion and I perform a simple revelation charm on her torso. It will show us the insides of her body, and reveal the baby, and the identity of the father".

Ursula measured out a spoonful of the potion.

"There...drink it!...Down! Good...Now, we must wait..."

Eldonia gulped the potion down and swallowed.

"How do you feel?"

"Fine...I...Ooooh!...I feel all...warm and tingly!"

"That's the potion taking effect!" said Ursula. "Now..."

She traced a circle on Eldonia's abdomen with her wand, Eldonia giggled! That tickled!

Slowly, the layer of skin on Eldonia's midriff vanished and as if they were looking into a window into her body, Fortis and his wife could see inside her body.

"Oh my!" said Eldonia. She spotted a tiny, humanoid form inside her womb.

"That's the baby..." said Ursula.

"Hello baby!" Eldonia said.

"Now we just need to wait", Ursula said, "While the potion takes its full effect..."

Slowly, a misty white face began to form over the image of the tiny lifeform inside her. Like a sort of smokescreen image, a face began to emerge. Fuzzy and misty at first, but slowly more and more defined...

Slowly, the fuzzy clouds took form. Eldonia spied Fortis's face reflected on her abdomen. The likeness gave a rogueish grin and a smirk, and then slowly vanished from view.

"Oh Forty!" she squeaked! She hugged her husband.

Fortis smiled, "I TOLD you it was gonna be me, woman! Who else but a Mountain lord could impregnate his wife on the first try, huh?"

Eldonia giggled.

"Intercourse borne of love will always triumph over intercourse of hate", Ursula said. "Your bondage was one of affection and caring. Not to mention the fact that Mountain males are generally more dominant than their Vladian counterparts when it comes to...matters of procreation".

"What do you mean 'dominant'?" Fortis asked.

"Um...fertile!" said Ursula.

"Awww yeah..."

"Forty!" Eldonia squealed, and giggled.

"Well thanks, Ursula, I'll go tell grandma the news!"

"Not so fast!" said the old witch, "We are not finished here!" she said.

"What? What else is there!?" Eldonia squeaked. She was a bit nervous, now!

The witch pointed to the image on Eldonia's belly. It shifted slightly and Eldonia squeaked!

"IS that...another two feet? And...and hands?"

"Are you holding TWINS, Donnie!?" Fortis cried out. He knelt down to look for himself. "Woah...Mountain power...!!"

Eldonia squealed and giggled! Twins! Oh boy!

"Are they boys or girls?" she asked.

"I wouldn't know!" said Ursula. "They are not developed enough yet for me to tell. At this stage, they could be either. When they are more developed, and you wish to know, I could come again. And then I could run another examination for you".

"Oh yes please!" said Eldonia.

The witch smiled, "We shall see", she said. She rubbed a cold salve over Eldonia's belly, and the images vanished from her skin, returning it to its ordinary state.

Fortis helped Eldonia put her clothes back on, and everyone hurried back inside to hear the news.

"Oh thank you, Ursula!" said Athena, "You've lifted a great weight off of all our minds", she said, while behind her, her two younger grandsons jibed their older brother at his virility. Eldonia and Minerva hugged each other joyfully.

"You're very welcome, Athena", she said.

A rabbit made of stardust bounded past.

"MERLIN! No tricks like that in the house!"

"Grandma! Minerva likes bunnies..."

The young wizard-boy waved his wand and the sparkly golden bunny vanished in an explosion of twinkles.

"Oh honey! We're gonna have more babies!" said Eldonia, hugging her husband.

"You sure are", said Fortis. "I'm very proud of you, sweetie. I'll send a letter to your parents so they know you're safe and that everything's good".

"Ooooohhhhh!" Eldonia moaned. She barely turned her head and wished that she hadn't! The entire room began spinning, making her stomach roil alarmingly.

She leaned her head over the side of the bed just in time!

"Donnie? Are you okay?"

Minerva knocked and stuck her head around the partly open door to Eldonia's room. She gasped and hurried to her sister-in-law's side when she heard and saw Eldonia being violently sick.

"Oh, Ellie," Minerva sighed, holding Eldonia's hair out of her face.

Eventually, the heaves stopped, and Minerva helped Eldonia lie back down on her bed.

Minerva grabbed a soft cloth, dipped it in the water basin near the bed, and helped clear Eldonia's face of her spittle and tears.

"Th-thank you, Minnie. I...feel terrible!" Eldonia whimpered.

"Sh, sh, I know."

"It wasn't near like this when I was carrying Leo!" Eldonia protested. "I was only sick a few times with him. I mostly felt queasy during the early months. But this...!"

Another knock sounded on the doorway.

"Hey, how's the expecting momma this morning?" Fortis asked cheerfully, coming into the room carrying Leo. However, his bright grin turned to a grimace as the smell of vomit hit his nose.

"Were you sick again, Donnie?"

Eldonia rolled her eyes, feeling grumpy. "No, Forty, it's someone else puking their guts out every morning because you happened to knock them up--with twins!"

Despite her sarcasm, a wide grin spread across Fortis's face, making Minerva chuckle. Fortis loved having anyone point out the proof of his virility!

"Momma?" Leo asked hesitantly, his thumb in his mouth.

"Hi, sweetie," Eldonia said, trying to come up with a smile for her son.

"Tiss, tiss!"

Eldonia grimaced as Fortis sat down on the bed next to his sister, Leo's arms reaching out toward his mother.

"I don't think you want a kiss from Momma right now, Leo," Fortis said. "Momma's not feeling too well."

Leo frowned, not quite understanding all the words.

"Momma will kiss you later, alright?" Eldonia said.

"Tiss, tiss!" Leo repeated. Apparently, the only word he really caught onto was 'kiss.'

Minerva laughed and took the little boy into her arms. "I'll give you kisses, Leo! Muah, muah, muah!"

Leo giggled as Minerva peppered kisses all over his face before lifting up his little shirt and blowing raspberries on his belly.

Eldonia watched this with sad longing, which Fortis noticed.

"Hey, Girl, why don't you take Leo down to see the bunnies?"

"Yea! Bun-buns!" Leo said, clapping his hands together in excitement.

Once Minerva and Leo were gone, Fortis stretched out on the bed and gathered Eldonia into her arms. Eldonia groaned at how queasy she still felt. She was tired and weak. She didn't even have the energy to leave her bed!

"I wish you didn't feel so sick," Fortis said softly.

"It wouldn't be quite so bad if I were only sick in the mornings, but oh no! I can't have just 'morning sickness'! I have all day, all night sickness! Except for those times in the late afternoon when I get super, super hungry and feel like I can't get enough to eat. But I hate eating, Forty! I see it all again when I sick it back up after a few hours!"

"Well, you have to eat, Ellie! How else are my babies gonna grow and become strong little Mountanian boys?"

"Boys, hmm? They could just as easily be girls, you know!"

Fortis grinned at her. "Nah! They're definitely both boys! Twin boys run in the Vanderstorm line, you know? There's usually at least one set of twins in each generation. Just look at Jupiter and Cannius."

Eldonia just rolled her eyes, but she smiled. She always loved it when Fortis tried to cheer her up.

Fortis leaned down and pressed a gentle kiss to her forehead. He let one hand slip down to rest on her tummy, and he rubbed in soft, soothing circles. He didn't quite know what he was doing, nor did he really know what to expect, since he hadn't been around at all when Eldonia was pregnant the last time.

Eldonia sighed and settled down more comfortably, but wearily, into her mattress. "That feels nice, Forty," she murmured before slipping off to sleep again.

Fortis continued to trace a delicate pattern on her belly for a while, noting that it was still as flat as ever. However, Ursula had said that Eldonia would start showing soon. Fortis couldn't wait to see his children begin to make their presence known. He wanted to place his hand on her rounded tummy and feel his babies kick him. He wanted to introduce Leo to his siblings in his mother's womb, too.

More than anything, though, he wanted his wife to feel better. She had just gotten back from her trying ordeal in Vladia to now be constantly sick from pregnancy hormones.

Snuggling closer to his wife's curvy side, Fortis hissed in a quick breath as he felt his own hormones race through his body. He'd missed her very much when she'd been gone, and they haven't truly been intimate since she'd gotten back. He hoped his babies wouldn't make her feel sick the entire pregnancy, or he wouldn't see some action for many long months to come!

"Huuurrggghhh..."

Old Lady Athena yawned and stretched. She opened her eyes to see Lucy, the pretty young kitchen-maid. She smiled.

"Yeah, we got us some Mountain boys!"

"Well, women carrying multiple babies tend to have worse morning-sickness, mood swings, cravings, the whole nine yards! However, Eldonia, yours has been worse than usual because you're not just carrying twins: you're going to have TRIPLETS!"

"WHAT?! TRIPLETS?!" Eldonia said, her eyes wide in astonishment. "But you said I was having twins when you were here before! You clearly showed us two sets of hands and feet, just TWO little bodies!"

"Well, sometimes babies hide behind one another in the womb. Besides, when I showed you the babies earlier, they were so small, it would have been easy to miss one."

"Ah, yeah! Just goes to show you how potent the ol' Vanderstorm seed is!" Fortis said proudly, puffing out his chest.

"Wow! I can't believe it!" Eldonia stroked a hand over her large belly. "THREE babies! No wonder I've gotten so much larger than when I was pregnant with Leo! That explains why I've felt so much more kicking inside of me, as well!"

"I can attest to that!" said Fortis in a huff. "She hardly sleeps at night because of all the kicking, and the babies sometimes even kick ME when her belly touches me!"

"Ursula, can you show me where each of the babies are?"

"Certainly!" said Ursula. She placed her hand at the top of Eldonia's belly. "The largest baby is lying lengthwise here at the top. The other two are on either side below him." Ursula moved her hand to the lower right and then across to the lower left to indicate where the other two babies lay.

"You said 'him.' Does that mean that one of them is a boy? What are the rest of their sexes?" Fortis asked impatiently, crossing his arms over his chest. "That's why you came, is it not?"

Ursula chuckled, straightening back up. "Yes, yes, my lord! You're having two boys and a girl. And I would wager to say the boys are even identical."

"Oh, Forty," Eldonia said, wiping a hand over her eyes as a few tears began to fall. "I can't believe it! Two more sons and a daughter!"

"Would you like to see your children, my lord?" Ursula asked.

Fortis nodded and drew closer. Ursula muttered a few words in Latin and waved her wand over Eldonia's belly to reactivate the spell, and the three babies suddenly became visible. Fortis was amazed at seeing his tiny children inside his wife. The baby at the top glowed blue, as did the baby on the lower left. The baby on the lower right glowed pink. Ursula pointed to that baby and said, "That would be your daughter, my lord."

Fortis stroked his hand over the pictures of his children and grinned when he saw and felt one of his sons kick at his hand.

"Haha! Look at my boy there! He's displaying himself for the whole world to see!" Fortis said with a laugh.

Eldonia groaned, but Ursula merely smiled. Indeed, the lower boy spread his legs to show off his goods.

After another minute, the spell ran its course, and the images of the babies inside the womb faded until all anyone could see was Eldonia's very large belly once again.

"We're going to have to come up with THREE names now, instead of just two," Eldonia said, as Fortis helped her sit up.

Fortis groaned. "Not names already! Can't we just wait until they get here?"

Ursula cleared her throat. "Well, my lord, it actually probably won't be much longer before they're born."

"What do you mean?" Fortis said with a frown. "Donnie's only been pregnant for about six months."

"True. However, multiples tend to be born earlier. There is less room for them to grow and develop. Twins tend to be born two to three weeks early, while triplets are even earlier than that. I would say that, judging from Eldonia's current size, your little ones will be here in less than two months from now."

Fortis's eyes widened. "Two months?! But...we're not ready! We have lots more furniture needed for the nursery! And more clothes, and more food, and...."

Eldonia patted his hand soothingly. "Don't worry, Forty! Between you and your brothers, Grandma Athena, Minerva, and Mrs. Tibbs, I know you'll all make everything we need for the babies!"

"That's the right attitude, my dear," said Ursula. "In fact, I think it would be best if you are on as much bed-rest as possible from now until you go into labor. Don't do anything to put undue stress on yourself. The slightest thing might trigger an early labor, and we need your babies to stay inside you and grow as long as possible. Understood?"

"Yes, ma'am."

"Take care, my dear." Ursula gathered Eldonia into a hug and kissed her on the cheek. "I'll be back to help you deliver your little ones, but feel free to contact me if you have any problems or questions, all right? This is a special amulet that I want to you always wear around your neck. If have need of me, just hold the pendant and say my name three times. I'll be right over."

Eldonia looked at the amber pendant Ursula put over her head and felt herself tearing up again. Everything seemed to make her cry these days! "Thank you, so much, Ursula!"

Ursula patted her shoulder. "You're welcome, my dear. My lord." She curtsied to Fortis, before yelling, "Merlin! Come on, now, boy! Time to go!"

"Awww, Granny! Do I have to go? I'm having fun with Leo!"

"Now, young man!"

"Oh, alright...."

"Thunder sounds like such a wonderful name. Strong and powerful!" said Eldonia. "Maximus...well I suppose it will do. We can all call him 'Maxy'. And Sapphire is a lovely name for a girl".

"Then it's agreed", said Athena, "But we should keep the other names on the list, just in case the ones we selected do not suit them".

Minerva nodded, "That's a good id--what on earth!?"

The three women got up as Fortis came by, carrying three cribs in his huge arms.

"Ladies..." he said, as he headed upstairs.

"What...Oh cribs! Oh beautiful!" said Eldonia, "Oh honey!"

Athena followed her grandson upstairs. Minerva ran ahead to open the nursery door.

"Aren't they pretty? But we'll have to move Leo's crib...Where is Leo!?"

"Hai Anta Minna!"

Leo peeked through the bars of the lowermost crib and waved.

"Leo!" said Eldonia, "Forty get him out of there!"

"He's perfectly safe!" said Fortis. He put the cribs down, and slowly unstacked them. Leo popped his head out.

"Hey mama!"

"Leo! You shouldn't hide in there!"

"Heheheh..pwaying wiff papa!"

"See? That's the spirit..." said Fortis, "Hey c'mere woman! Where you want these things?"

"Around the fireplace!" said Minerva.

"Oooh no!" said Athena, "I'll not have my great-grandchildren be roasted alive in their own beds!"

Fortis sighed. He pushed the cribs to the middle of the room and set them out in a square. There, that looked much better.

"I think the pink one should be in the middle and the other three should be around the sides", said Minerva.

"You do realise, by the time those kids pop out of her, Leo's probably gonna have his own room", Fortis said.

"Oh..." said Minerva. "Okay! Then put the pink one between the two blue ones. And we can put Leo's over there. And then when he's ready for a bed and his own room, we can put that one up in the attic!"

Fortis smiled, "Yeah that sounds good", he said, and rearranged the cribs. Eldonia hugged her husband, and wrapped her arms around his lower-back...the highest part of his body she could reach while he was standing up...and kissed him on the arm. Fortis draped a musclebound arm down her side. His hand rubbed her round, taut belly.

"Hehehe...Mountain boys growin' inside, huh...Yeah, gonna have us some big boys, huh woman?"

Eldonia blushed.

"And a girl", she reminded him.

"Hey you don't have to remind me!" said Fortis, "Forty Vanderstorm takes good care of his girls!" he said, and hugged her. "See?"

Eldonia laughed! Oh what a doofus she married!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Leo toddled into the nursery. He saw more cribs, extra changing-tables, and fluffy toys everywhere. There was a collection of paintings hung on the walls, of woodland scenes, bowls of fruit, and battles of fargone wars.

"I don't think so, darling!"

"What's wrong? They'll like it!"

"It's NOT appropriate for babies!"

Fortis entered the room, carrying something under his arm, his grandmother following after him.

"Fortis are you hearing me!?"

"It's cute, grandma!"

"It'll SCARE them!"

"No it won't!"

*tug-tug-tug*

"What's the matter, son?"

"What papa haves?"

Fortis turned around the latest painting that he was carrying into the room. It showed a dragon! Leo's mouth dropped open!

"See!? Now you take it out of here and put it back in the library where it belongs!"

"Pwitty dwaggon papa!"

"See!? I told you he'd like it..."

"Leonardo's used to dragons! The babies will be terrified!"

"Oh come on, grandma! When I was Leo's age, grandpa gave me a salamander as a pet, remember?"

"I remember! And I was against that, too!"

"Oh granny. You just never liked Barbeque because he was always playing with your knitting".

"Don't be ridiculous! How can food play with my knitting!?"

"...His NAME was Barbeque!"

"...Oh yes so it was...BUT MY POINT REMAINS!"

Fortis sighed. "Would it cheer you up if I put in a picture of flowers instead?"

"Yes, it would!"

"Fine...GIRL! Where's that painting of those fruit-orchards!?"

"In my room!" Minerva cried out from down the hall, "Why!?"

"Gran wants it for the nursery!"

"Well she can't have it! It's my favourite!"

Athena sighed.

"What about a Memento Mori picture?"

"ABSOLUTELY NOT! You want to give them nightmares!?"

"Hey they never scared me..."

"You never knew what they meant!"

"Neither will they, grandma!"

"NO!"

"Fine! I'll hang up the picture of those lowland ponies..."

Leo toddled out of the nursery and into his mother's bedroom. Eldonia was feeling very weak and sleepy. Holding three expectant and hungry babies within her had drained much of her energy. And she was having trouble moving around with all the unaccustomed weight. She reveled in being pregnant, but couldn't wait to give birth!

"Mama! Mama cuddle!"

"Come here, sweetheart..." Eldonia said, reaching out a feeble hand, "Let mommy cuddle you...Awww...Muah!"

"Babies come?"

"Oooh...Not yet, sweetie. But they'll come soon..."

"Mama, what babies names?"

"Oh we don't know yet, sweetie. Your papa's picked out lots of pretty names! We just have to see which names suit them!"

"...Oh...Babies name Leo?"

"Noooo sweetie! That's your name!"

"Oh..."

"Babies babies babies!!" Leo squeaked, and slapped his mother's belly excitedly. Eldonia laughed.

Eldonia's bedroom door opened and Fortis came in.

"Hey sweetie, which one? The sunrise, or the painting that granny did of the castle in winter?"

Fortis held up two large paintings.

"The sunrise".

"Leo wike dis wan, papa!" said Leo, pointing to the snowy castle.

"Yeah?" said Fortis, "You like the snowy castle, son?"

"Yah! Snow fun!"

"C'mon, son. Let's go hang them up. Let momma sleep".

Eldonia yawned...Yes...sleep...

Fortis and Leonardo left the room and headed back down the corridor towards the nursery.

"YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!"

"Gotcha!!"

"Hahahahahahahahahha!! Uckle Yupiter! Put down!!! Put Weo down!!! WWAAAAAAAHHH!!"

Fortis chuckled as his brother hoisted his son into his arms and tickled him!

"Aren't you cute, huh? Muah! Hey Forty, how's all that redecorating going?"

"Good. But I need to hang more stuff up", said Forty. He indicated the two paintings.

"Aww you don't want that! Put the dragon one up! Me and Canny used to love that one when we were babies!"

"That's what I tried to tell grandma, but she refused to put it up there. Leo likes it, too".

"Oh you do, huh?" said Jupiter, bouncing his nephew in his arms, "You like the dragon picture, huh?"

"Rrrawwwwwrr!!" Leo squeaked, and made a face! Fortis and Jupiter burst out laughing!

"Oh I'll go get it..." said Fortis, "AFTER I hang these up".

Jupiter gave his nephew a kiss and popped him back on the ground, "I'll give you a hand", he said.

"So", said Fortis as he hung up the final picture, "Have you found a girl yet?"

"Not really. That Ophelia girl's pretty cute..."

"She's a bit young for you, ain't she?"

"We're three years apart! Besides, you're old enough to be Eldonia's father!"

"She's not that much younger", Fortis mumbled. "Besides, she's cute..."

"Yeah...So's Ophelia..."

"You want to marry the daughter of the public house landlord?"

"Well...hey I'm not like you, Forty. I don't have the future of our house in mind. That's not my job!"

Fortis shrugged. He guessed his brother was right.

"Nooo! Nooo!! Leo no beddy!"

"Leo it's BED-TIME!"

"Nooooo!! No beddytimes!"

Athena struggled with her wrestling grandson! Ooh, he was going to be a big, strong Mountain lord one day, just like his father! She could feel it!...All too well! He was writhing and wriggling around like a drowning snake!

"Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm! Stop it at once!"

"But gwamma! Weo Big Boy now! Weo gonna have widdul bwudderz! Weo stay up late like Uckle Jupiter and Uckle Candywuss!"

"You are two and a half! I don't think so!"

"Awwww...wenn?"

"Not anytime soon! Now! To bed with you!"

Desperate to show off his advanced age, Leo threw another card on the table.

"Weo not babies! Weo a boy now! Boys not sleeps in cribs!"

"LEO!"

"NO!! Boys sleeps in beds!"

"Leo, we don't have a spare bed at the moment. When we do, then you can sleep in one and have your own room! But until then, you sleep in the nursery with the other babies, when they come!"

"Noooo!!...Gwamma, Weo sweep with papa! Papa has bed!'

"Leo, your father is exhausted! He won't want you sleeping in his bed!"

"Weo sweep good if gwamma say Weo can sweep in papa's bed!...Pwommis..."

"No!"

"Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!! W-w-waaa..."

"WHAT THE HELL IS GOING ON OUT HERE!?"

Leo coughed...sniffled...and stopped.

Standing in the doorway to his bedroom, Fortis looked like a demon from the fires of Hades. The fire in his bedroom was casting golden shadows over his broad, V-shaped silhouette, his dark blond hair glowing in the light of the flames. He towered over his grandmother, and the squirming toddler that she held in her hands!

"I'm trying to sleep! And Eldonia's got enough things to worry about as it is!"

"Forty! You nearly gave Penny and me a heart-attack!...And I nearly swallowed my bishop!" Minerva said, waving a chess-piece around, "DO try and keep it down!"

"Go back to bed, girl! I'll handle it..." Fortis said.

"I would LOVE to, if I could!" Minerva fumed, and slammed her bedroom door behind her.

"What was that?" Penny asked her mistress, as she tidied up the chess-board and shuffled a pack of cards.

"MEN!" Minerva fumed.

"Oh..." said Penny, pretending to have fully understood the situation from the hardly-complete explanation.

"Gran what's going on here?" Fortis groaned.

"Weo no sleep in cwib!" Leo pouted. "Weo gonna be big bwudda! Weo can't sweep in CWIB!! Cwibz for babies!"

Fortis chuckled. He could tell where this was going.

"How would you like to sleep in a big-boy bed with papa, huh?"

Leo's eyes lit up like coastline beacons!

"Yah! Oh pweez gwamma!?"

Athena sighed. "Alright! But you be a GOOD boy for papa!"

"C'mere baby..." said Fortis.

Leo glared at his father.

"Uuh...I mean...boy...son...Leo!...Let's go to bed".

Athena followed her two young relations into the bedroom that she had once shared with her own Mountain lord, more years ago than she cared to remember. Watching Fortis lay down on the bed made her think back to her wedding-day, when a handsome, dashing Excalibur Vanderstorm, Earl of Dynamos, had carried her upstairs, thrown her on the bed and dived on top of her!...

Oh she was a very young girl back then...and times were very different...

She smiled. Oh how she missed him. She rubbed a locket on a chain around her neck, which held a lock of the late lord's hair. She watched as Fortis laid down on the bed, his son in his arms, barely the size of a loaf of bread by comparison, and rolled over.

Athena closed the doors and headed to her own room.

--- --- --- ---

Zacharia, Hermes and Koviac sat down in the servants' hall. It was dark now, and almost everyone had gone to bed. Eliza entered the room.

"Couldn't sleep?" Zacharia asked. Eliza yawned, and nodded.

"My mattress is so lumpy! It's like sleeping on a rack of bowling-balls!"

The boys laughed.

"One day I'll have to rip that thing apart and get it all re-stuffed and sew it back together again properly! But for now, I could do with some hot chocolate".

"I'll get you some", said Koviac, and headed over to a pot on a side-table.

"You youngsters still up and about?"

The servants turned to see Mrs. Tibbs shuffling into the room, the fat, middle-aged housekeeper stared at them through her spectacles. Usually homely and sweet, she looked very stern!

"Why are you still up, Mrs. Tibbs? It's too late for old people!" Hermes squeaked!

"Why you...!" Mrs. Tibbs began, her eyes flashed behind her spectacles!

"Hermes!" Zacharia snapped at his little brother. Hermes blushed.

"Sorry..." he squeaked.

"Why are you up so late, Mrs. T?" Eliza asked.

"It's her ladyship", said Mrs. Tibbs.

"She just went to bed, I heard it", said Eliza.

"Not the Dowager! I mean Lord Fortis's wife!"

"She's been in bed all day!"

"Exactly. She's expecting!"

"Oooh...what's she expecting?" Hermes asked.

"Oh don't be silly, Hermes! Her babies!" Zacharia groaned.

"Ooooh...Are they coming for a visit?"

Zacharia groaned and Eliza giggled.

"How do I explain it to him!?" he mumbled, and stared at Koviac with an "Oh boy!" kind of expression. Koviac just smirked.

--- --- --- ---

"Who's papa's little boy, huh? Are YOU papa's little boy?"

"Aaaah!!"

"Papa...Weo happy. Gonna be BIG Bwudda! Just wike papa!"

"That's right, son!"

Leo crawled across his father's chest.

"Papa...you fink Weo be good big bwudda?"

"What do you think a big brother does, Leo?"

Leo frowned. He hadn't realised that being a big brother came with chores!

Leo suddenly threw his arms out and hugged his father around the neck!

Fortis laughed, "That's very good, son. A big brother loves his little brothers and especially his little sister!"

Leo stared at his father, "Why?"

"Why what?"

"Why Big bwudda wike widdle sisstah even moar?"

"Boys learn to look after themselves, son! One day you will!"

Fortis pointed across the room to his cabinet of swords. Leo drooled...

"One day, I'll teach you and your brothers how to use the swords! Just like how me and your uncles use them! But a lot of these swords are really heavy!"

"Really really heavy?"

"Yes son!"

"Really really really heavy?"

"Yep! And most girls can't carry those really heavy swords! And they're so heavy that they can't wave them around and use them!"

"Why, papa?"

"Because their arms aren't strong enough!"

Fortis flexed a massive bicep. Leo giggled and squeezed it.

"See these, boy? These are the kind of arms you need to haul those things around!"

Leo flexed his tiny arms...which resulted in nothing.

"Awwww..."

Fortis laughed! "Son you'll grow big arms like papa sooner or later. But because girls can't lift those big heavy swords and use them, it's your job to do that for them, and to make sure they're safe! Especially little sisters!"

Leo nodded. "Yeah papa!" he said. "I will".

Fortis smiled. He wrapped his son in his huge arms and rolled over in bed. "Of course you will...G'night kid..."
"Night-night papa..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle!!!!!!

"Huh!? What!?"

Eliza jerked awake! She'd fallen asleep in front of the servants' hall fireplace, over her half-finished cup of chocolate. A bell fixed to a panel by the wall swayed back and forth and jangled loudly. She got to her feet and stared at the panel of bells.

Jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle!!!!

Below the jangling bell was a paper label. Eliza held her candle up to it.

"BEDROOM - Lady Eldonia"

"Oh gosh!" said Eliza, and hurried upstairs! She dashed down the darkened passageways and jogged up the stairs, and rushed down the landing to the very end! She skidded to a stop, and then pushed open a pair of double-doors.

"You rang, m'lady!?"

Eldonia lay on her bed, gasping and panting! She was sweating up a storm!

"I...I....I..." she gasped, "I...Ooooooh!...L-L-Liza! G-G-Go call his lordship! A-And wake up the dowager! And Lady Minerva! The-then fetch Mrs. Ti-t-t-oooooh! Nnnnnggghh!...*pant-pant-pant!* f-fetch M-mrs Ti-Tibbs! HURRY! THEY'RE COMING!"

"They're coming?...THEY'RE COMING!? Oh gosh!"

Eliza rushed out of the room and threw open the doors to the master bedroom!

"M'lord! Wake up! Wake up!" Eliza cried out! Leo burst into tears! Fortis jerked awake!

"W-what!?"

"It's happening!"

Fortis blinked. "W-w-what's happening?"

"THE BABIES!"

"The...NOW!?"

"NOW! NOW! Her ladyship's in labour!"

"Oh Thor's sledgehammer!...I...woah!"

Fortis jumped out of bed while Eliza rushed to wake up the household!

"Are you okay, sweetheart?" Fortis asked. He was on his knees next to his wife's bed.

"It hurts!" she groaned. "I...I...huuuurrrrghhh!" Eldonia groaned as another sharp, painful, crippling, cramping contraction rippled through her body! She thrashed and writhed around, struggling to make it stop! Athena and Mrs. Tibbs hurried into the room!

"Oh out of the way!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "I need hot water, and scissors! And towels! And a ball of string!"

"Nice shallow breaths, darling!" said Lady Athena, "in, out, in, out, in, out..."

"I'M GIVING BIRTH YOU CRAZY OLD BITCH! NOT GOING FOR A ROWING TRIP DOWN THE STREAM!"

Fortis burst out laughing!

"That's right sweetheart! Let it all out! C'mon!"

"Back up! Against the bed!" Athena said.

"Like this!? You've got to be insane! I can hardly touch my feet! Let alone draw them up!" Eldonia shrieked!

"Lie down flat and lift your legs up!" Fortis said.

"I'M NOT IN THE MOOD FOR YOUR STUPID GAMES!"

"It's to make it easier for the birth!" Mrs. Tibbs said, "Oh for lord's sake!" she sighed. She picked up a low bench and put it on the bed, "Rest your feet on that...That's right1 How's that feel?"

"A...a...a-a-b-b-bi-bit b-b-beeaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaahhh!!"

"It's alright sweetie, It'll all be over soon..." said Fortis.

Eldonia kept breathing hard and fast! Then, she started a steady pushing...it was taking a lot out of her, and she was sweating like she'd run a thousand miles in a heatwave!

"Oooh! I...i-it's coming!" she gasped!

Athena knelt down and held out a towel.

"Something's coming!" she cried out, "Push! Push!"

Plop!

A wriggling newborn baby landed in the towel! Athena wrapped it up and cleaned it off with warm water! The baby wailed and screamed! Eldonia shifted uneasily in her bed as she prepared herself for the next one! Slowly, it came out, too.

"That's two boys so far!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "There's still a girl in there somewhere!"

Eldonia felt ready to faint! After this, she was sure she wouldn't be encouraging Fortis to implant his seed within her anytime soon! But then...

"Uuuuuggghhh!!"

Pop!

"Somebody get me a knife!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "I need to cut the umbilical cords...that's right...careful now..."

"You sleep, sweetheart", said Fortis. "We'll look after the babies..."

"You'll do no such thing!" said Mrs. Tibbs, "Us women will handle this! It's women's business! Begone with you!"

Fortis chuckled, and left the room with his brothers. Minerva stayed on, to comfort her friend.

Leo woke up.

He could smell something hot and warm and sweaty...

Papa had fallen asleep on top of him! He was trapped between papa's chest and his huge arms!

Leo wriggled and slipped out from under papa's grasp! He squirmed under the sheets, until he popped out the side of the bed. With a sort of ungainly backflip, he flopped off the bed onto the floor! He landed with a 'whunk!', and took a minute to collect himself.

Using the bed to steady his little legs, Leo got up and toddled across the floor, stumbling occasionally, until he reached the door. Leo tried to open the door, but the handle was too far up! Leo stared around the room. Then, he saw what he wanted! Papa's clothes valet...

Leo pushed the wooden clothing-frame across the room, from where it usually was, by the mirror and dressing-screen, towards the door. Swinging on the bars and shelves like a monkey, he pulled himself up to the top shelf where Fortis kept his rings and chains. He reached out and turned the handle on the bedroom door, and pulled!

The door swung slowly inwards. It was very heavy! Suddenly, the stand fell over! Leo squeaked and landed on his bottom on the carpet! But at least the door was open. He toddled off out...

Leo toddled down the corridor and saw that a door was open. The nursery door! Leo toddled inside...

--- --- --- ---

Fortis yawned. What on earth...?

His eyes opened...Huh!?...Where's Leo!?

Fortis ripped his bedsheets back!

No baby...

Fortis jumped to his feet!...But then his eyes took in the knocked over clothing-stand, and the opened bedroom door.

"Crafty little bastard..." Fortis said. He chuckled to himself. That boy'll be a Vanderstorm yet...

Fortis righted his clothing-stand and picked up his scattered jewellery. He opened the door into the hallway and headed down the corridor. He slowly entered the nursery. Slumbering in the three cribs were three little angels.

In the middle, a pretty little baby girl with golden hair. And on either side, like infantile bodyguards, her two older brothers, with brown hair like their Aunty Minerva.

"Hehehehe...Forty Vanderstorm strikes again, and leaves his mark..." Fortis said, and laughed. He bent down to pick up the little girl. The tiny newborn wriggled in his hand.

"Awwww...Hello babygirl...You know who I am?"

"Papa no!"

Leo popped out from behind the crib, waving a toy sword! "Papa put down baby!"

Fortis laughed, "Son! I'm not gonna hurt her! But it's nice to know you want to look after her...C'mere..."

Fortis walked over to the rocking-chair by the fireplace and sat down. Leo joined him.

"Baby small..."

"Babies are always small".

"Leo so small?"

"Yeah you were about this size when you were born".

"Ooooooh...Hewwo baby...!!"

Fortis laughed and gave the tiny infant a kiss. "Hello little Sapphire..."

The baby let out the most adorable little yawn and opened her eyes. They were bright, dazzling blue.

"Awww..." Fortis said. He hugged the tiny infant as delicately as he knew how, and gave it another kiss.

"Leo, this is your little sister Sapphire!"

"Ooooh...Wussa saffer?"

"A sapphire is a pretty blue stone".

"Awwwww...Wike waht gwamma haz on her fingah?"

Fortis frowned. Finger?

"Oh you mean grandma's ring! Yeah that's right. That's a sapphire".

"Oooh...baby purdy papa!...Weo pway!"

"Ooooh nonononoonono! Babies aren't for playing with, sonny! No, no, no! They're VERY delicate and small! You can't play with them".

"Awww..."

"You can look at them and you can talk to them".

"Hewwo Shaffer!"

Leo stared at his littlest baby sister. Awwww...

"Papa! Baby cute!"

"Yes she is..."

In the kitchen, the kitchen-maids were busy preparing ingredients for dinner. In the basements, Fortis and his brothers were busy sharpening their swords.

"You hold the damn thing on an ANGLE, you idiot! Like THIS!"

"But it keeps jumping off!"

"It WOULDN'T if you put some water on the blade!"

"But then it rusts!"

"It wouldn't if you dried it properly!"

"But then it dulls the edge!"

Fortis groaned.

"Cannius how do you even SHAVE yourself!? Every Mountanian male is expected to know how to sharpen a knife!"

Cannius blushed.

"Jupiter sharpens my razor..."

Fortis glared at his other younger brother, who blushed.

"Of all the things you could be killed by out on the battlefield, and you pick to die because your swords can't cut through snow! NOW SHARPEN THESE PIECES OF SHIT! When I get back, I expect to be shave my balls with your daggers!"

"Eeewwwwww!"

"Well GET MOVING!"

Fortis groaned. He hoisted up his own swords and daggers and headed upstairs.

In his bedroom, Fortis started polishing his armour. Polishing his armour didn't just make it look shiny and make him look even sexier than he already was...it also prevented rusting. Fortis picked up a bucket of sand and poured vinegar into it. Then, he opened the fly on his hose and his enormous phallus flopped out. He groaned as a powerful stream of urine shot into the bucket. It was revolting, no doubt, but piss, sand and vinegar was excellent at buffing up plate-armour. Although he was sure not to do this when there were any women around.

Downstairs, the doorbell rang.

"Who on earth could that be?" Eldonia said to Minerva, who shrugged.

"Are you expecting anyone else?" Minerva asked. Eldonia shook her head.

"No. Just my father. But he's not expected until this evening!"

Jupiter answered the door. There was a lot of loud shouting, followed by even more noises which the two girls couldn't identify. Just then, a blond whirl exploded into the drawing room!

"Hi Aunty Minnie!"

Young Lord Champion threw himself on his aunt's lap and gave her a kiss. Minerva giggled!

"I didn't know you were coming!" she said.

Lord Wolfgang and his wife Vesta entered. Wrapped in her arms was her little girl, Astrid.

"Wolfgang's been called up. We didn't have time to send you a letter, but we hoped we could stay here", said Vesta, blushing.

"We?" Eldonia asked.

"Well, the children and I".

"Oh sure!" said Eldonia.

"Oh boy!" said Champion, and dashed off upstairs. "HEY LEO! IT'S YOUR COUSIN CHAMPION HERE! WHERE ARE YOU!?"

"Not so loud, son!" Wolfgang shouted. "You'll wake the babies!"

Athena came downstairs, "What on earth is this...Wolfgang! Vesta how nice to see you! Hello Astrid!"

"Astrid, say hello to granny!" Vesta coaxed.

"Hawwo gwamma!"

"Awwww! Sweet pudding! Hello darling!"

Champion came running downstairs, holding his cousin in his arms.

"Look! I found him!"

"Hai Uckle Woofy!"

"Hello Leo! Wow you're growing up fast, aren't you? How old are you?"

"Uuuuuh..."

"He's nearly three", Eldonia said, "Aren't you, son?"

"Yah?" Leonardo murbled. He had no idea!

Fortis came downstairs.

"Cousin", he said. Wolfgang smiled, and the two alpha males hugged each other.

"So, I hear you added more kids to the Vanderstorm brood, huh..." said Wolfgang. "I also hear Cousin Excalibur's been called up in the regular army".

Fortis nodded. "Yes. You're up too, huh?"

Wolfgang nodded. "As father always said, we didn't earn our titles sitting on our butts".

"We're expecting Eldonia's father for dinner, you're all welcome to join us!"

"Oh that would be wonderful!" said Vesta. "I'm going upstairs to meet the babies. Come along, darling!"

"Alright..." said Wolfgang.

"I suppose that Vesta and her kids are staying here while we're off fighting, huh?" Fortis asked Eldonia. She nodded.

"How did you guess?" she asked.

Fortis pointed to the pile of trunks and cases in the front hall.

"Oh!"

"HERMES! ZACHARY! PERSEUS! KOVIAC! GET IN HERE AND EARN YOUR KEEP!"

The three servant-boys and the lord's squire hurried into the hall.

"Yes m'lord!" said Zacharia, the oldest of the three boys.

"MOVE this crap! Take it upstairs! The first and second guestrooms, and the nursery!"

"Yes sir!"

Fortis watched as Zacharia hoisted one of the massive trunks onto his back with one arm, then grabbed another trunk and hoisted that onto his back! He squatted down and then slowly got to his feet. He grunted and started slowly up the stairs. He leaned against the wall as he moved up, step by slow step, careful not to lose his balance!

Someone knocked on the door. Fortis opened it. Lord VonGewalt stood on the threshold.

"Well, good afternoon, my lad", said the older man. Fortis nodded.

"My lord".

"Come in, may I?" said Venatarius. Fortis nodded and gestured. The old man came in, carrying large bags with him. Clutched in one hand was a handsome, old-fashioned walking-stick.

"My old war-wound has been playing up. It's why I was retired. Can't stand up right on this damn leg and hold a sword at the same time..."

"Papa!"

Eldonia hurried into the foyer. She smiled at her father. Tall, battered, worn out and old, with white hair and a grizzly beard. He chuckled deeply.

"My darling. Look at you! Turn around...Just like your mother, may she rest in peace..."

Venatarius stared at all the trunks. "Expecting company?"

"My cousin and his family are here as well", Fortis said. Just then, Champion came downstairs carrying the twins, and Sapphire. Leo toddled behind.

"Look Aunty Eldonia! I can hold all three of them!"

"Oh Champion don't!" Eldonia cried out, and snatched the girl out of his arms. Venatarius chuckled.

"Who is this obliging youth, hmm?"

"This is my nephew, Champion. Champion, this is Lord VonGewalt", Fortis said.

"Oh he can call me Uncle Venatarius", said the old man. "We need not have such formalities. So! These are my grandchildren, are they?"

"Gwanpa! Gwanpa!!"

"Aaah!" Venatarius said. He scooped up his grandson and gave him a whiskery kiss. "Hello Leonardo my lad! And here we have Gabriel...and this is Thunder..."

"THIS is Gabriel, papa", said Eldonia, pointing to the opposite baby. "And this is Sapphire!"

"Ooogah!"

"Hello! Awww...She looks like her mother!"

"Papa!"

Once all the introductions were made, everyone filed into the dining-room. Fortis sat in the middle of the table, with his wife opposite him. Either side of Eldonia were Minerva and Vesta. Athena sat at one end, and Champion, Wolfgang, Cannius, Jupiter and Venatarius filled in the other gaps according to seniority.

"It's absolutely appalling!" Athena grumbled.

"What is, grandma?" Minerva asked.

"The nerve of the Vladians! To attack Lucia! Typical of them to strike at the weakest first! No courage at all! Not a fragment of backbone in the entire kingdom! If you can call that backwards wasteland a 'kingdom'!"

"Where is Vladia, grandma?" Champion asked.

"Don't you know anything about geography, boy?" Wolfgang said, "It's to our direct east!"

"Oooh...Why did they go there?"

"I have no idea!" said Athena.

"It's part of their divide and conquer thing", Venatarius said. "But it won't succeed".

"Why not, my lord?" Athena asked.

"The Lucians might be a people of candyfloss-makers and ice-cream sellers, but they're not stupid! They have rather impressive northern defenses. I went there a few times in my youth. They have capable foot soldiers. Not on a level with our own, of course, but decent chaps on a whole...But they won't last for very long if we don't go in and help them".

"But they've already invaded our northern border", said Jupiter.

"The Mountanian Border Guard will hold them", said Wolfgang, "long enough for us to report to duty. When do we leave?"

"Tomorrow night", Fortis said.

"Who stays here?" Eldonia asked.

"You, grandma...Girl...your father...Vesta...the servants...Well...the servants except for Koviac. He's coming too...the children of course..."

"I wanna go fight!" said Champion.

"Son you're TEN", said Wolfgang, "You're not old enough!"

"Aww rats!"

"You're not old enough! You're not tall enough, you're not strong enough!"

"I am SO strong!"

"Are you now?" said Fortis.

"I am! Really I am, Uncle Forty!"

"The last time he tried to lift my sword, he nearly chopped off his right leg!" Wolfgang said, conversationally. Fortis chuckled.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Forty I'll miss you!"

"Relax! I'll be back, huh? You just keep yourself fresh and those kids safe!"

"Of course, my lord! But I'm worried!"

Fortis hoisted his wife into his arms and Eldonia leaned against his powerful biceps and shoulders. She kissed him on the cheek.

"My big brave gigantic mountain lord..." she whispered. "be safe!" she said.

Fortis smirked. "Relax, woman! I'll be FINE".

Eldonia tugged a gold, heart-locket from off her chest and handed it to her husband.

"For your protection, my lord".

Fortis smiled. "Thanks, woman", he said. The locket was too small to fit around Fortis's thick neck and mighty chest, so he wore it on his wrist, instead. Eldonia hugged him, feeling his stony form and Mountanian body-heat beneath him.

How long before she would feel it again?

Minerva kissed her two other brothers goodbye, and gave them tokens of her affection, before she hugged her biggest brother around the waist. Fortis chuckled and tousled her hair.

"I'll be back soon, girl", he said. "I'll bring you a present!"

"A present?"

"Yeah! Somethin' nice..."

"Like what?"

"How about a Vladian head?"

"FORTIS!"

"Alright two, one for Donnie, too".

Eldonia glared at her husband. Fortis chuckled.

"C'mon, boys!" he said to his brothers. "We gotta go".

Nearby, Wolfgang kissed his wife and son and daughter goodbye.

"Papa you'll bring back a sword for me, won'tcha, pa!?"

"No I won't!" said Wolfgang.

"Awww...why not?"

"Because Vladian swords are made of shit! You don't want crappy weapons!"

"Wolfgang! Not in front of the children!" Vesta snapped.

"Hey he's right, you know", said Fortis. The men laughed and high-fived each other.

"C'mon cousin!" Jupiter shouted at Wolfgang, "Move your ass! Or all the good Vladians will be dead already!"

As the four Vanderstorm men rode off, the four Vanderstorm women stood in the foyer, watching them go.

"Off they go to fight and die, for victory, glory and gold. And yet they act as if 'twere naught, but jousting tournaments of old..."

"Grandmother!" Vesta snapped.

Lady Athena sighed. "It is the truth of our world, my dears", she said. "Come, let's see to the needs of the children. Eldonia my dear, where is your good father? I can't imagine he's happy being stuck on the home front while all the young bucks go off to war!"

"I...I don't know where he is!" Eldonia said. "I...hmmm..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Curious about the whereabouts of her father, Eldonia decided to go and see if she could find him. Leaving her extended family downstairs in the foyer, she headed up to where the bedrooms were located, to try and seek him out.

While Fortis as head of the household was away, Venatarius had agreed to look after the estate. He had even moved himself into the master bedroom. Eldonia smiled! That was probably where he was! She shuffled down the corridor that led to the master's chamber, a route she had often taken when she required 'comfort', expecting to find her father. But when she passed the nursery, she noticed that the door was open, and that she could hear noises coming from inside!

As she got closer to the door, she heard sounds of movement, followed by giggling and squealing! A man's laugh echoed from the chamber and Eldonia hurried forwards to see what was going on! She stuck her head around the door-frame and smiled. Lying on the floor was her father, playing with his four grandchildren! Thunder and Gabriel were crawling around and play-wrestling on the rug in the middle of the room. Nearby, Sapphire was playing with her dolly. Leo was riding on grandpa's back, playing horsey!

"Gwan'pa Vennus! Yippy-yay!" Leonardo squeaked. The old man laughed and started crawling around on the floor while his grandson sat on his shoulders, bouncing around and giggling with glee!

"Leo! Leo don't bounce around on grandpa's back like that!" Eldonia scolded. Leo just giggled.

"Is fun, mama! Gwan'pa pway horsey!"

Venatarius chuckled and reared up! Leo fell off with a squeak! Eldonia laughed.

"Oh papa! You're encouraging him to be a very bad, bad little boy!" she said. Venatarius ignored her and started giving Leo tickle-torture! The toddler squeaked and squealed, kicking furiously with his little legs, trying to get away!

Eldonia knelt down next to her father and he smiled at her. She was so young, and yet had already accomplished so much for herself! She had married exceptionally well, she had given birth to four lively, beautiful children, and had all the signs of growing into a fine, beautiful woman, just like her late mother! Venatarius smiled proudly at his pretty little daughter. She was nearly twenty, but he still saw her as his little baby darling!

"So, do you plan to have any more children, my dear?" he asked her. Eldonia blushed.

"Papa!" she said. Venatarius gave her a 'I want an answer, young lady!', sort of look. She smiled.

"I...I don't know yet, papa. It all depends. I mean, Forty never said that he didn't want more children, but then, we haven't really been trying for more. So I suppose that anything is possible".

Venatarius smiled.

"My darling", he said, "You have married an excellent young man. You should do everything you can to make him happy! It is your duty to him as his wife to make him comfortable and relaxed! To make sure that he comes home to a quiet, happy, loving home, and..."

"You make it sound like I have to do everything! What does HE do!?"

"Absolutely not!" said Venatarius, his tone rising. "I wouldn't dare say such a thing! It is YOUR duty to love him, to be loyal to him, to be faithful to him. It is your duty as his wife to obey him and to respect him as your husband! To ensure that he is happy, comfortable, relaxed and satisfied!"

"And what does HE do?"

"A husband is expected to love his wife, and to cherish her at all times. To show affection, to help her, and above all, to provide her protection!...He does provide you with protection, doesn't he?"

Eldonia blushed. "Yes!" she said. He provided her with PLENTY of protection when he invited her into his bedchamber of an evening...lots of protection!

"I expect him to treat you as nothing less than the fine young lady that you are, my dear. And I expect YOU to treat him as nothing less than the nobleman and knight that he is!"

"Yes papa!"

"However, there is one other duty, which can only be carried out by both together in a harmonious marriage".

"What's that?"

Venatarius cleared his throat, and stared around the nursery.

"PAPA!!"

"He DOES ensure that you are fully satisfied, doesn't he?"

"Well!...I...I..."

"DOES he?"

"Yes papa!"

Eldonia couldn't believe that she was discussing her most intimate encounters with her FATHER!

"No husband who cannot satisfy his lady in his own bedchamber can be called a decent one. It is the most intimate and private of enjoyments, and one of the most important duties. Your duty is to bear the child and care for it. Not an easy task, my dear. I know, because I had to do it to you after your mother died! The very least that the husband can do is to ensure that while the end might be painful...the journey will be long-remembered..."

Eldonia turned RED as wine!

"And it is memorable, isn't it?"

"Yes!" Eldonia squeaked. She wasn't going to say more. She wasn't about to reveal how Fortis would ravage her like a beast in heat...how he treated her...how he plundered her innards and drove her to hysterics of...well...

Perhaps she WOULD tell..Forty. Get him in the mood, and all...

But not papa!

Slowly, she smiled.

"Well...He's...He's very...He's a GOOD husband, papa!"

"And you are satisfied?"

"Well...we don't do it very often, papa. He's always so busy. But...Well when we get the time..."

She blushed.

Venatarius chortled. "Good girl!" he said. "You should always spend time with your husband, one-on-one".

Oh yes. They certainly did...

Leo tugged on his mother's dress.

"Yes darling?" Eldonia said, shaking herself out of her remembrances.

"Mama! You not yet Weo an' gwan'pa pway knights!"

"Knights!? Oh honey you're a BIT young!"

"Nooooooooooo!!!" Leo wailed, "Weo wanna pway knights wiff gwan'pa! Pway knights! Pway knights!" he wailed.

"One little swordplay, young man, then it's time for your nap!" said Venatarius, firmly. He went to find the wooden toy swords.

"Papa you shouldn't encourage him like that! He's going to develop bad habits!" Eldonia said.

"My dear, I AM a bad habit!" Venatarius snorted.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis, Jupiter, Cannius, their older cousin Wolfgang and Fortis's squire Koviac kept on riding. They had left early and covered many miles. Fortis felt his shield clank against the studs on his belt. The shield had a crossed sword and scythe and blue and black quartering. A knight's helmet and plumage, and white bordering. The coat of arms of the Earls of Dynamos, a position the Vanderstorm family had held for centuries. A position which they had kept, held, earned and had defended ruthlessly against all comers, pretenders and masqueraders.

Fortis awaited the day the shield would be held by his own son. He smiled to himself as he imagined Leo toddling around the castle, or playing with his Aunt Minnie, or his comely mother, Eldonia, or his great-grandmother, the dowager countess.

"Forty!" Jupiter shouted, "There's a crossroads up ahead! There's people coming!"

Fortis blinked and stared. Sure enough, two men on horseback were coming towards a crossroads. As they all converged, they drew swords, and held them until they were close enough to see each other clearly.

"Lord Vanderstorm!"

Fortis smirked.

"Lord Wolvenberg".

Lucius Wolvenberg lowered his sword. He smiled at his friend.

"Jupiter, Cannius", he said. They nodded.

"Lucius", they said.

"And..."

He frowned.

"Oh, this is my cousin Lord Wolfgang", Fortis said.

"My lord", said Lucius. "My brother, I think you know".

Fortis nodded.

Behind Lucius was a slightly shorter, younger man with blond hair, light skin and blue eyes. Atlas Wolvenberg was not nearly as solidly built as his older brother, but still an impressive catch for a lady, if she had a mind to it.

"Where are you going?" Fortis asked.

"To the main base-camp on our border with Lucia".

"So are we", said Wolfgang.

"Then we may as well ride together", said Lucius. "It's a long way and I'm getting bored talking to Apples here..."

"ATLAS!"

"Whatever!"

Fortis and his brothers burst out laughing.

As they kept riding, they continued to gather more knights of the realm. Before long, they were a dozen strong. Twelve towering, powerfully-built young men, all of noble blood. Fearsome, fearless, brutally strong and ready for the warmth of enemy blood. As they rode, they talked of family, of battle, of glory, of weapons, food, friends and sex.

Most of them had already tasted battle. Fortis and Wolfgang were veterans of the last encounter with the Vladians. Younger ones like Atlas had not yet been in combat. They chatted about trophies and prize-money and all other kinds of wondrous rewards from the field of battle.

"Halt!" one of the knights shouted.

The party came to a standstill in the road. Ahead of them was a clearing with a bridge over a stream.

"We shall camp here tonight", another one said.

"Shouldn't we go on?" Jupiter asked.

"It's several miles to the next village, and it would be too dark by then. We stay put after sundown", another knight said.

Wolfgang nodded. "He's right. We shall split into two groups! Six of us on one side, six on the other. If anything happens, then at least we have the stream and bridge between us and we won't be fully cut off either way".

Fortis, his relations and friends, stayed on one side of the bridge, while the others crossed over and made camp on the other side.

"Who's got food?" someone shouted.

"I've got cheese somewhere..." said Jupiter.

"I bet you sat on it!" said Cannius.

"What do YOU have?"

"Bread...those little rolly things...in a net-bag...oh here they are!"

Fortis unwrapped a large leg of smoked ham. A treat from Mrs. Tibbs. He drew out a dagger.

"We'll make toasted ham and cheese sandwiches for everyone", he said. "But first we need a fire".

While everyone got to gathering wood for two fires, Fortis started slicing up all the bread, cheese and meat. He watched as Wolfgang and Lucius tried to build and light a fire.

"No no no! Smaller!...Like this!" Wolfgang said. He tapped the blade of his dagger over a piece of wood, splitting it down the middle. "It doesn't burn if it's so big. And we need tinder! Who's got tinder?"

"I've got some in my saddle-pack, somewhere", Fortis said, "It's in a little wooden box!"

"You're doing it wrong!" Atlas said.

Wolfgang and Lucius looked up.

"That stuff's no good! You need drier stuff! Shriveled up stuff! Smaller twigs and whatever!"

"We've got plenty!" Lucius snapped.

"It won't work!" said Atlas in an annoying, sing-song voice.

"Go and play with Jupiter, Atlas", Wolfgang said, "We've got this".

"I'm telling you that the fire won't burn like that! It's not built right!"

"Oh fine!" said Lucius, "Come on Wolfy. Let's go see if we can find something to kill and roast! Atlas knows more about these things!"

"See? I told you I was right!"

"He knows ALL about small, dried, shriveled up things! He's had one between his legs for 18 years!"

"You bet!...HEY!"

Laughter exploded over the woods and birds flew out of nearby trees.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Birds. Woodland creatures. The crackling of flames.

Such noises filled the woods as the twelve Mountanian knights tried to sleep. Inside their tents on whatever bedding they could bring with them, they attempted to find slumber in the outdoors.

As ten men slept, on each side of the river, one man was awake, keeping watch.

Fortis stood on the bridge with one of the other knights, a slightly older man named Bastion.

"You married?" Bastion asked. Fortis nodded.

"Kids?"

"Four".

"Four!? Damn...You got biz-zey!"

Fortis shrugged. "You?"

"Mmm. Two boys. The lady wants a girl next time 'round".

"Do you want a girl?"

"I dunno..."

Bastion looked across the river to where everyone slept.

"So they're your brothers?"

"The two over there, yes. That older guy, he's our cousin".

"But YOU are the earl".

"Yes".

"How's that?"

"My father was the earl. He died...a few years ago. So I inherited the title, the estate, the fortune..."

"My father was only baron. But I managed to raise our status a bit when I was knighted. The king made me a viscount".

"Only a viscount?"

"I know, it sucks..."

Fortis laughed.

"Is it a hereditary title?"

"No".

"You're right, it does suck".

Both of them chuckled.

"I mean what's the point of being called LORD Bastion when your KIDS can't be? I mean it defeats the whole damn purpose of having a title!"

Fortis was about to say something else when they heard the rumbling of hooves.

"Shhh!" Bastion hissed. They drew their swords.

From the east came the noise. At first far away and indistinct, but every second growing slightly louder, but again not loud enough. Then, Fortis spotted two pricks of light. He frowned.

"I think it's a carriage!" he said. As the vehicle got closer, Fortis noticed two horses pulling a caravan, with another two horses behind that, pulling a second one. The light came from two lamps hanging above the driver's seat.

"Stop!" Bastion shouted. He held his sword up. "Who passes this way?"

"Who is it who asks?" one of the cloaked drivers asked.

"We are knights of the Mountanian Realm. You will answer us!"

The man lowered his hood and removed his travelling cloak. Fortis chuckled.

"Relax, Bastion", he said. "They're Valleyans!"

Sure enough, as the caravan doors opened and people came out, Fortis and Bastion saw two families of Valleyans.

Valleyan gypsies, a magical offshot of their Fantasmian cousins, were wandering nomads of no fixed address. Although they could often be found in the Mountanian lowlands, they were known to pop up all over the place!

"Isaac!" a short, round woman squawked, "What happens here!? Why are we not moving!?"

"Irma! Go back to sleep!" the man said. He turned back to the towering beasts ahead of him.

"We ask to pass in safety", he said. "We are travelling to the Fatlantean borderlands. The Vladians are acting again like the savages! We will not stay in the north!"

"Is it very bad?" Bastion asked.

"They do border-raids! Many villages very disturbed! At night you hear things! Not good things! We don't stay! We go!"

"Valleyans have powers to ward off these things!" Fortis said.

"Our powers are not so strong!" the man Isaac said. "Diversions, distractions...We cannot face them in open battle! It is a job for the Mountanian armies! And the knights of the realm!"

Fortis nodded. "You can go", he said. He sheathed his sword.

Bastion also sheathed his sword.

"I don't understand why you don't stay and fight! Your powers might not be so strong but if you all banded together.;.."

"A few hundred gypsies against a thousand-more savages!? What a fakakte idea! You meshuggah, you!" the man babbled. "We go! Now!"

The man climbed back into his caravan and shook the reins. "Heeyup! C'mon!"

Fortis watched the Valleyan caravans rumble onwards.

"Gee whiz. They don't normally high-tail it like that. It must be pretty bad..." he said.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: As the knights eat dinner, they hear noises in ...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
The next day was marked by hard riding. Pausing only to relieve themselves, or for light snacks, the twelve knights rode on for mile after mile. Their prolonged period in the saddle meant that they covered a great deal of distance, but were completely exhausted by sundown. As the sun dropped down behind them, they reached a dusky, sleepy Mountanian border-town near a babbling stream. In the village square, children, boys and girls, fought each other with wooden swords and shields. Mothers washed clothes outside and men drew water from the pumps and wells. As the knights rode into town, they made straight for the local inn.

"How might I help you, gentlemen?" said a short, rough-looking innkeeper with a muttonchop beard.

"Beds", Fortis said, "And hot meals. How much?"

"Beds are two shillings a night, a bed".

Fortis frowned. "That's pretty high, isn't it?"

"The beds boys like you are going to be sleeping in, it has to be!"

Fortis nodded. "Fine", he said.

He tossed some silver coins onto the bar-counter.

"That's for me. The two men there, and the older one by the door. And these two over here".

"Oh no, Forty!" said Lucius, "We can pay for ourselves. Take your silver back...here you are, landlord..."

"Thank you kindly, m'lord...um...hmmm..."

"What's wrong?" Fortis asked.

"I don't think we have enough rooms free. Some of you might have to share".

Fortis glared at the man. "SHARE?"

Wolfgang took a step back from Fortis. "Don't be gettin' no ideas, Cousin Forty..." he said.

Fortis snorted. "Cannius and Jupiter can share! Where can we stable our horses?"

"The inn has its own stable. You may rest them there. Zeus! Where are you, boy!?"

A handsome youngster about 13 entered the inn.

"Hi pops!"

"Stable their horses, and see that they're looked after properly!"

"Yes father".

Zeus was a tall, thin boy, about five foot ten with dark blond hair and green eyes. He bowed to his superiors and went outside to check on their horses.

Fortis yawned. The bed was surprisingly comfortable for a country tavern. He shifted around and his arms wrapped around the girl in bed with him. He smiled and hugged her. She was the daughter of the village baker.

She had a very hot oven.

Fortis had found that out for himself the night before.

He tried to remember what had happened. It was a whirl and whir of grappling, wrestling, tearing cloth, fumbling with condoms and then a series of loud, unrestrained groans and screams. He vaguely remembered breaking something...

He reached up behind him and felt the headboard, which had been cracked in half.

Oh yeah...

He rolled out of bed, as naked as the day he was born. The baker's daughter rolled out of the bed as well.

"His lordship is so handsome..." she whispered, and kissed him. Fortis grunted.

"Will I see you tonight?' she whispered. Fortis shook his head. "We leave after breakfast", he said.

"I will not see you again?"

"Probably not".

"At least I will have the memory of my lord's...abilities..." she whispered. Her hands strayed downwards...

Fortis smirked. "Every girl should try the best at least once in their lives..." he said. The girl blushed!

Fortis got dressed and shuffled out of the bedroom. He saw other doors open, followed by other knights, some with dreamy, worn-out village maidens clinging to their waists.

"C'mon guys. Drop your cocks and grab your socks. It's time we got ready to leave", he said sleepily. "We gonna have breakfast downstairs...and then we gonna clear out..." he said, and yawned. The other knights nodded. The night before had rocked the town, but with day came the responsibilities of the sword.

The average Mountanian knight could challenge any Fatlantean citizen when it came to sheer appetite. Fortis wolfed his way through six slices of bread, four eggs, a pound of bacon and sausages, hash potatoes, tomatoes, mushrooms, steaks, chops, and two pints of beer. Of course, Fortis's gigantic size made such a huge intake of food necessary, unlike the sheer gluttony of the Fatlanteans, who lived for the pleasure of food and cooking.

With their bellies full, their bags packed and their mounts saddled and bridled, the twelve knights bid farewell to the people of the village, and rode off at midday for the border-camp which they knew would not be far away...
