Flames crackled in a fireplace. Candles burned in their holders.

At a large table with several maps and scrolls upon it, King Leviathan sat, deep in thought.

Someone knocked on the doors.

"Come!" he shouted.

The doors opened.

"The Knights and Noblemen of the Realm, your Majesty", said the messenger.

Leviathan shrugged. "Hmm..."

"Shall I send them in, sir?"

"Where are they?"

"They're in the foyer, your Majesty".

"Hmmm...I think I shall come and see them. I'll be out in a minute".

"Yes sir".

The king sighed, put on his battle-crown and got to his feet. He wrapped his cloak over his shoulders and headed out onto the landing. A large gathering of men was present in the foyer below. Standing above them on the landing, the king could see them all quite clearly. He cleared his throat. Slowly, the babbling died down.

"Good evening, gentlemen. Welcome to Castle Silverblade. This is our main command-post for the time-being. You are all tired and longing for hot meals and a warm bed. I know. And I shan't detain you for very long. But I must tell you what and why you are here..."

The king stared out at the crowd.

"The Vladians have dared to attack our Lucian allies. Lucia is not a country of war. It is a country of peace. Its people are craftsmen, confectioners and farmers. They know nothing of the art of war as we have known for centuries. We pledge our allegiance to the Kingdom of Lucia in its time of need, as I hope you shall pledge yours to your sovereign lord in this time of contest".

The king paused.

"You are all knights, or else lords and masters, or sons of great wealthy, noble, aristocratic and powerful families. Families which have earned their right to rule the land which they have been granted, through loyal and faithful service in blood to the Crown. But you cannot retain your positions on past glories! To hold your lands and your titles, you are under oath to serve the kingdom and its allies. If you want your children to enjoy the lives that you have and to pass on your lands and titles and fortunes to them, then you must show me that you are deserving of them!"

There were loud murmurs of agreement.

"Now I know you are all strong, capable fighting men. I know you will do your best and that you will do our kingdom and your families the greatest of pride. I wish to see a select group of you privately. Your names shall be called out. All those who have not been called may proceed to the dining-hall for their evening meal".

The king left the room. A messenger stood with a scroll and started reading out names. Fortis was one of them. So was Wolfgang. And Lucius. And Bastion.

"Come on guys", said Wolfgang, "Let's go see what he wants".

The four of them stood outside the king's door, along with the others who had been called up. One by one, they headed inside.

"Fortis and Wolfgang Vanderstorm!" a voice called out. The two Mountain lords headed into the room. They saluted and stood at attention in front of the huge table. The king nodded.

"Both of you are heads of one of the oldest and most noble of our ancient aristocratic houses. Your services go back generations and you have often been given great rewards and honours", said the king. "Earl Vanderstorm, I have had the great honour of knowing both your father and grandfather. I pained me to hear of your father's early and untimely demise".

Fortis nodded. The king dropped his head.

"Lord Wolfgang. You have served the crown faithfully. Should your service in this conflict be as exemplary as it has been on previous occasions, then you shall be richly and generously rewarded and promoted for your services".

"His Majesty had best save his time, my liege, and grant me whatever rewards he sees fit, before I leave this room", Wolfgang said.

The king frowned.

"I THINK what my cousin is saying, is that his loyalty and effort on the Crown's behalf would never waver, your Majesty", Fortis said. The king grinned and laughed.

"Of course not, my good Lord Wolfgang. Of course not. And I would love to, but I cannot until I see definite proof. The same for you, young Lord Fortis. I know that both of you are battle-hardened and veterans. You have experience. That is why I have called you here. I wish to offer you something".

Fortis frowned, "What?"

"If you wish it, I shall be promoting both of you. Hereafter you shall both hold the ranks of Knight-Commander of the Royal Order of the Dragon".

The two warrior-lords gawped.

Very few ever received titles and ranks this high up. It would be an incredible honour...

"Could we discuss this privately?" he asked. The king nodded. "Certainly. Your raised ranks will mean that you are in a position of command. You will still be expected to fight, but you will also be expected to command and lead a squad of men each".

"How many men?" Fortis asked.

"A dozen or more", said the king, "It depends on the units available".

Fortis nodded.

"Do you HAVE what it takes to be a leader?" the king asked.

"I dunno about that, sir. But he sure has what it takes to be a breeder. He got four kids already and a fifth on the way..."

"WOLFGANG!"

The king burst out laughing and Wolfgang doubled over in grunting chortles. Fortis was so red he looked about ready to burst into flames!

"N-n-Now th-this...hahahahah!! Th-this is serious, gentlemen!" the king said.

Fortis nodded. "Yes sir. It would be a great honour, your majesty, and I accept".

The king nodded. "Lord Wolfgang?"

Wolfgang nodded, "Yes sir", he said.

"Excellent. These promotions are conditional, mind", he said.

"Sir?"

"You hold them now on a trial basis. Their confirmation and official promotion occurs only AFTER the conflict and proof of your leadership qualities. Do I make myself clear?"

"Sir, yes sir!"

"Good. Well that shall be all".

"Yes sir".

Fortis and Wolfgang headed towards the door.

"After you, Commander Vanderstorm".

"Oh no, after YOU, Commander Vanderstorm".

"No I..."

"WILL YOU TWO GET OUT!?"

The two knights burst out laughing and left the king's office, looking for the dining-hall.

Leviathan sighed. KNIGHTS!!

--- --- --- ---

"No way!"
"You lucky bastard!"
"I wanna be a commander! Me! Me! Me!"
"Well you're NOT! So suck it!"

Fortis leaned back, his friends and relatives jealous of his success. The girls were gonna be drooling over this.

Sir Fortis, Lord Vanderstorm, Earl Vanderstorm, Ninth Earl of Dynamos! Knight of the Realm, Knight-Commander of the Royal Order of the Dragon!

Damn that sounded good...

Fortis chuckled. Commander...Boy he couldn't wait to pull that one on Eldonia. She would love it! The wife of a commander...

He would have to bring her back something nice from the war. Maybe a skull...She could put flowers in the eye-sockets...Yeah that would look pretty...

As dinner wound down, everyone started going to their beds. Fortis stared at the muster-rolls that were pinned to the notice-board at the entrance of the dormitories.

"Huh. You got Cannius and Jupiter on your roll", said Fortis. Wolfgang nodded.

"They's good...I got Lucius's little brother Atlas, too..."

"I wonder who's on my roll..." said Fortis.

He glanced down the list of names.

"Uh-oh..." he said, his voice falling short.

"uh-oh what?" Wolfgang said.

Fortis pointed to a name on his list about halfway down.

"VANDERSTORM - Excalibur Dominus".

Wolfgang chortled and grinned.

"Hoo-hoo!!" he said and laughed, "Oooh boy! You got Excalibur! Little Cuzzy Excalibur!"

"He's a NIGHTMARE!" Fortis groaned. "I thought there were rules about this stuff!?"

"This is war, cousin. What rules? Boy oh boy, oh boy...you got Excalibur...I feel sorry for you..."

"Shut up, Wolfgang!"

"This is like a family reunion!" said Wolfgang. "You gotta tell me what happens. This is gonna be Fuu-uuun!"

"SHUT UP WOLFGANG!"

Wolfgang laughed. "G'night, Cousin Forty. Don't let Excalibur poke you too hard..."

Fortis groaned.

Excalibur Vanderstorm. The tearaway black sheep of the Vanderstorm family. A couple of years younger than Fortis, he was a holy terror who caused nothing but mayhem and destruction where-ever he went!

Tomorrow was going to be a hell of a day...

Girl was now a princess...and a mother...and he had six kids of his own...

"Ooooh! Go on! Go and say hi...Papa, these are your daughters!"

Fortis looked up.

"Huh? Oh...hey..."

"Awwww...C'mere girls..."

"OY!" Fortis shouted. He threw out his arms and grabbed at two, five-year-old twin boys, bringing them to a dead stop. They dropped something on the ground.

"We was only playing, papa..."

Leo snatched the objects up. "These aren't TOYS, Gabriel! They're MINE!"

Fortis stared at the objects in Leo's hands.

"Leo, why do you have a bow and a quiver?"

"Grandpa gave them to me!"

"Those are NOT toys, Leo! I hope you know that!"

"I know that! I use them all the time!"

"ALL the time?"

"WHAT!?"

"You better not!" said Fortis. "What if you'd hit someone!?"

"I don't! Here, I'll prove it..."

"AH! Not in the house! Outside".

"Alright...C'mon Sapphire, let's see if Mrs. Tibbs has any apples..."

Leo yawned and put away his bow and arrows. It had been a long day of archery practice and the youngster was tired and bored. He wanted to just relax for a bit and wander around the castle. It was so strange having his father back with him after so many years away. Now that he was back, however, Leo decided to find out more of this strange man who had helped to give him life. Leo admired his father, as any young Mountanian boy wanted to. And there was a lot to admire: 10ft of towering muscle and bulk, massive strength and dashing good looks. But as impressive as all those things were, the one thing that Leo was most impressed by was his father's achievements on the battlefield, and his impressive array of medals, decorations, titles, and of course...weapons!

While most of the Vanderstorm family sat downstairs in the drawing room enjoying a light supper of sandwiches and lemonade, Leo jogged upstairs and headed along the corridor towards the master bedroom.

This enormous, and very masculine chamber had been a forbidden area for Leo in his earlier childhood. He was only allowed in here under the strict supervision of his father, and that happened so rarely that Leo had almost no memories of this mysterious and mythical cavern of the castle. Not even grandfather let him in here when he slept in here. And now that grandpa slept in another chamber and Fortis had re-established his place as master of the house, Leo's access to this hallowed and mythical chamber was even more tightly controlled than ever.

As with most Mountanian children, Leo did not take kindly to being told what he could, or could not do. So when he found the bedroom doors were unlocked...he headed right in!

Leo took in the woven rugs, the huge fireplace, the leadlight windows, the enormous canopy bed and curtains, the drinks cabinet, the sideboard, the table and chairs, the armchairs and sofa, the coffee-table, the wardrobe, the bathroom, and on the right, two huge walls dedicated solely to the military history of the Vanderstorms.

Inherited swords, shields, maces and suits of armour decorated the entire castle, and this was but a small display of the impressive collection of weaponry that Castle Vanderstorm housed. But it was still droolingly amazing to a nine-year-old boy.

Here was Fortis's personal collection of his swords, shields, daggers, suits of armour, and all other things, like medals, letters from the king, and the scrolls bearing the details of the deeds which had earned him his numerous titles.

Leo stared at the two huge suits of armour - one was a suit of dress-armour. Not designed for combat, it was ceremonial and formal, with gold edging and pretty engraved or embossed patterns on the breastplate, helmet and backplate. The full suit of armour in the display-case next to it, was a set of complete battle-gear. Leo leaned closer, his nose pressed up against the glass...

Fortis well remembered his excitement as a child...

"Oh alright...But NO touching! This stuff is heavy and it's dangerous, okay?"

Fortis hoisted his son up in his arms. Leo sat on his father's massive triceps and biceps, one arm on his shoulder.

"So, what do you want to see?"

"Hey kid!"

Leo sat on a small bridge by the mill-stream, fishing. He saw his father walking up to him, pulling a wagon behind him, and carrying an axe, sledgehammer, saw and iron wedges, obviously off to go and fell some trees.

"Yeah papa?" Leo asked, as his father pulled the wagon over the bridge.

"C'mere..." Fortis said. Leo picked up his fishing-rod, and four fish which he'd caught already.

"Yeah papa?"

"I need you to help me chop some trees down, boy. C'mon".

Leo frowned. His father usually went tree-felling with Uncle Jupiter or Uncle Excalibur. Why was he bringing him? Leo climbed into the cart with his catch, while his father pulled it along with a yoke around his chest and shoulders.

"Don't you need a horse, papa?"

Fortis snorted, "I ain't ridin' nowhere, what do I need that for?" he asked. "It ain't heavy", he said.

Leo shrugged.

"You like your shootin', huh boy?"

"Shooting, papa?"

"Bows'n'arrows! Your archery!"

"Oh yeah! Yeah papa! It's fun!"

Fortis nodded, "That's good. Boys need hobbies", he said. "Listen, there's an archery tournament happenin' in a couple of weeks' time. If you want it, I'll put your name down for the competition".

"An archery contest!?"

"Uh-huh".

Fortis stopped the cart and Leo jumped down, "Boy that sounds like fun, papa!" he said.

Fortis hefted up a huge axe in his massive arms, feeling the weight.

"Uh-huh...You reckon it's gonna be fun, huh?"

"Oh yeah!"

"You win this round, you get to go to the national championship in Ferramount. The county prize is five hundred sovereigns. The big prize at the final is double that".

Leo's jaw dropped. Fortis started smashing the axehead into the nearest tree.

"Y'like that...son?" Fortis grunted, cutting great chips of wood out of one side of the tree. Leo nodded.

"Good. You wanna play?"

Leo's eyes opened.

"I get to go!?"

"Sure, if you wanna", said Fortis, now turning his attention to the other side of the tree.

"Oh boy! Yeah! Thanks papa!"

Fortis smiled. "You make us all proud, sonny", he said. "I know you will. You got warrior blood in them veins of yours!" he said. He squeezed his son's arm with a huge hand. Leo squeaked! Fortis laughed.

"Okay, watch it, now!" Fortis shouted. "TIMBER!!!"

Leo ducked out of the way as a huge tree came crashing down! Leo laughed. Fortis smiled.

"Boy! Go get that saw in the wagon. We can start de-limbing this thing and splitting it up for firewood. Sawnin' and wood-splitting's good for buildin' up your arm-muscles for all that bow-bending you're about to be doin'!" he said. Leo nodded and ran off to find the saw.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Smoke filled the air as a carriage parked at the edge of a field. The doors opened and Fortis's squire, Koviac, helped some of the Vanderstorms out. Athena came first, followed by Minerva, and her husband, the Crown Prince. Followed by the children.

"Gwamma Teena! Gwamma Teena! Wait up!" little Ares squeaked.

"Hey, c'mere!" said Cassius, scooping up his little prince, "Great-grandma Athena's busy! Don't go running after her! You stay with me, okay..."

"But Awez wanna cuddle Gwamma Teena!"

"Ooooh, give him here!" said Athena, holding out her arms, "Hello my darling little baby! You want to see Cousin Leonardo do some archery?"

"Yaaaaah!!"

Leo climbed out of another carriage, along with his brothers and sisters. His father rested a hand on his shoulder.

"Excited, boy?"

"Papa, I'm scared!"

Fortis snorted. "Don't be stupid! Nobody here ever met you! What do you care? You just go out there and you kick their ass! That's all that matters".

"Papa, what if I don't win?"

"Who said you was gonna win? Not everyone wins, boy. If they did, the world would be incredibly boring. You just go out there and do what you do, okay? There's the entrants' tent over there..."

The family entered a huge, fairground-type area in the field, where tents and pavilions had been set up all over the place. Excalibur pulled out his coin-purse.

"Hey cuz, I'm headin' off to the firepits!" he shouted.

Before Fortis could open his mouth, Excalibur had made a beeline for pillars of smoke in the distance - the location of the huge roasting-pits, where pork and beef sides were spit-roasting over massive bonfires.

"That looks good!" said Jupiter, "C'mon Canny! Before it's all gone..."

"Never mind about them!" said Eldonia, "Let's have a look around, granny. There's lots of stuff here. Forty, you go get Leo signed in".

"Alright sweets", said Fortis, "C'mon boy, this way..."

Fortis entered a large tent where people of all ages, most of them men and boys, were gathered. A large table at one end had a man behind it, with a long scroll. Fortis approached the table.

"Can I help you?" said the man. He was older, past sixty, cleanshaven, with muttonchops. He looked rough and more than likely, could still hold himself in a fight.

"I'm here to sign in my boy for the archery tournament", said Fortis.

"Ah-hah", said the man. "This boy?" he asked, pointing at Leo. Fortis nodded.

"Name?"

"Vanderstorm. Leonardo Fortis".

"Vanderstorm...We have a Vanderswaard...Oh here we are...Vanderstorm. Leonardo Fortis...Yes indeed. Sign here, my lad!"

The man turned the scroll around, and Leo bent over to make a tick next to his name, and to write his signature.

"Very good! I trust you brought your bow? Good. We have plenty of arrows, so you don't need to worry about that. Why don't you hang around here for a while? Meet everyone? If there's anyone else in your family here, we've got all kinds of tents and stalls and marquees set up everywhere".

"I'll buy you some lunch, boy", said Fortis, "You hang around here for a bit, huh?"

"Okay papa..." said Leo. He watched his father leave the tent.

"Okay papa!"

Leo turned. He saw a group of older teens, between fifteen and eighteen. They were all over six feet, some even over seven.

"Well hey there kid", said one of the teens. "What's your name? Been here before?"

"L-Leo Vanderstorm, sir", said Leo, a little intimidated. He didn't know WHY he was intimidated. It wasn't exactly SIZE that intimidated him. His own father would've towered over these boys, so Leo was used to size...perhaps it was the fact that they were so cocky and arrogant?

"Oh, SIR! We got a cultured one here, boys", said what appeared to be the alpha of the pack. Other boys crowded around, now. Leo stared around and started to edge towards the group of contestants who seemed to be closer to his own age.

"Hey! Where you goin', meatball!? Come back here!"

The boys surrounded Leo before he could make a proper getaway.

"What'd you say your name was?" another boy asked.

"Leo Vanderstorm! Leonardo Vanderstorm".

"Vander...Huh! Lookee here boys, we got us a spoilt rich kid! Hey Leo, how much'd your papa pay the judges to let you into this thing? Don'tcha know you actually gotta have SKILLS to win here? They don't let NOBODYS compete! This is the local level, but it goes all the way to the Grand Final in Ferramount!"

"Yeah, why don'tcha beat it on home kid before you disgrace the name of your oh-so-noble family, huh?"

Leo tried not to let this get to him. He was about to say something brave, or smart, or...do...something, when he heard his father returning.

"Here kid, I got you a bacon sandwich", said Fortis, handing his boy an enormous sandwich wrapped in paper. "You boys hangin' around waitin' for the grass to grow or somethin'?" he asked.

"No, sir", said one of the teens.

"THEN BEAT IT! I know what you're doin', and if I find you back here again I'll have you and your pa's in front of my court faster than you can shit out bricks!"

The older teens immediately backed away. Leo stared at his father in admiration. He loved how his size and power meant that he could do what he wanted, and people were compelled to obey. Fortis pushed his son towards the younger crowd.

"Go on, kid. Hang out with some boys your own age. The rest of us are gonna be wandering around the fairground, but we'll be there to see the tournament when it begins, okay?"

Leo nodded.

"Who was THAT?" said a boy, as Leo moved closer to the ten-and-unders.

"That was...that was my papa!" said Leo, brightly.

"Wooooaaah...What is he, like...a courtier or something? Or a knight?"

"He's an earl. The Lord Vanderstorm".

"Woooaah..." said the boy again. "I'm Alexei!" he said. "Who are you?"

"Leonardo Vanderstorm", said Leo. Alexei bowed. Leo blushed. "You don't have to..." he began, but Alexei ignored him.

"Is this your first time here?"

Alexei was a boy of Leo's age, with freakishly light blond hair, and pale skin. And cold blue eyes. He looked like a ghost. Leo was glad that he had inherited his father's darker, slightly heavier skin-tone and darker, brown-gold hair. Alexei must hate being out in strong sunlight!

By degrees, Alexei introduced Leo to the other boys, and a few girls. But they mostly either ignored him, or made fun of him as the older boys had done. They were convinced that he couldn't possibly have any skills as an archer and that he'd only gotten into the contest so late because of his father's position. This made Leo feel very uneasy.

"Son, I didn't do ANYTHING to get you in. I wrote a couple of letters, I paid a small fee. That's all anyone does!" Fortis said, speaking to his son outside the tent. "Whatever happens, I'm sure you'll make us proud. Now go on! The junior rounds are about to start..."
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo enters the local contest.

choices: Leo decimates the competition in his own division.
Leo loses in the moving-target component of the tournament.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"MY LORDS, LADIES AND GENTLEMEN! CHILDREN OF ALL AGES! PLEASE MAKE YOUR WAY TOWARDS THE TOURNAMENT STANDS! THE CONTESTS ARE ABOUT TO BEGIN!"


The old man from earlier, who had signed Leonardo into the contest, strolled around the fairground shouting out this message through a bullhorn. People started heading towards the stands. Sapphire scrambled onto her Uncle Excalibur's shoulders.

"You comfy up there, girl?" he asked. She giggled and pinched his ears. "Yaah!" she squeaked.

Soon, hundreds of people had gathered in the large, wooden stands either side of a huge field. Beyond the field was the large tent where all the contestants were waiting in their various age-groups.

"This tournament will feature archery from all age-levels! Children from five to ten, teenagers from ten to twenty. Adult divisions are from twenty to forty, forty to sixty, and then sixty over! There are three components to each age-group! First component is stationary target-shooting! The next component is moving targets! The final component is trick-shooting and showmanship!"

While all this was going on, Leo sat in the tent with his friend, Alexei. Behind the tent was the practice-range, where everyone had been testing their skills. Most of the younger set were ignoring, or insulting Leonardo and questioning his ability to even pull a bowstring! Most of the older set did not know Leonardo, although they did recognise the name 'Vanderstorm'.

The air filled with the twanging and flicking of bowstrings, and the steady 'thrrrrrrump!!' of arrows flying through the air, and burying themselves in various targets.

Leo watched everyone. Most of them were pretty good. They shot at playing-cards flung into the air, they hit the bullseyes from several yards away, they could shoot juggled items that were tossed into the air, one after the other...Leo had done some of this stuff, but he'd never thought about trick-shooting before!

As Leo and Alexei practiced, outside, they could hear the M.C. babbling on. And then, a younger man entered the tent.

"C'mon everyone! Out! Out! Ages Ten and Under, up to Twenty, onto the field!"

"Hey Vanderstorm! You still haven't figured out your trick-shot yet!" said one of the teenagers. "Good luck! I hope you like LOSING! You're gonna get really good at THAT!" he shouted.

But Leo had no intention of losing. True, he'd never gone up against anyone else in competition before, but he did know how to shoot! And he was going to show them that he could!

"Will our youngest contestants please take to the field!?" said the M.C. "The overall winners of these rounds will eventually go to compete against the winners of the rounds in the other divisions. The overall winner will be the county champion who will go on to compete in the national championships in Ferramount!"

The crowd gasped and applauded before anything had even happened!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo is determined to uphold the family reputati...

choices: The boys reassemble for the moving-target round.
Max and Leo start fighting.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Right! Children, ten and under, line up!"

Leo stepped up to the first line.

"Still target archery at ten yards!...Take your time..."

Leo raised his bow, loaded in an arrow, and set it on his fingers. He pulled back the string and breathed slowly. In...out...in...out...up...down...up...down...up...down...up...

TWANG!!

The thrum of arrows whished through the air! Muffled thuds told the crowd of the targets being hit.

"Bows down!" said the M.C. "Judges! Forward!"

A group of three judges moved forwards, inspecting each target, and hanging little signs on each arrow-shaft, to show the points scored.

"Still target archery at twenty five yards!...Line up!"

The children lined up again, moving fifteen yards further back.

"Bows up!...Load arrows!...In your own time!"

Twang! Zing! Thunk! Zonk! Whiiiiiiiiiiiiiist...thunk!

"Bows! Down! Judges forward! Mark the arrows! Midway scores, please! Before we move onto the hardest stage in the still target category!"

"Excellon VanDamne!...5 and 7!...Maximus Taureax!...five, and five!...Excelsior Voldern...nine and eight!...Alexei Vanderstaal...eight and eight!...Leonardo Vanderstorm...Ten and ten!"

"WHOOOOOOOOO! VANDERSTORMS RUUUUULE!"
"Excalibur!..."

The crowd clapped politely.

"Now, the next round is from FIFTY YARDS! Whoever wins this round will win the junior division of the still targets component!" the M.C. shouted. "Archers! Back! Fifty yards!"

The boys stepped back another twenty-five yards, to the fifty-yard line.

"Alright, boys! Girls! Take your time...BOWS UP!...LOAD ARROWS!...In your own time!..."

Zip! Twang! Thunk! Wooorrrrraaannnnggg...SNAP! ("Damn it!") Thunk! Zuuurrrr...thunk!...

"BOWS DOWN! CEASE FIRE! JUDGES FORWARD!"

The judges came forward to check the arrows and mark their places.

"VanDamne, 8, Maximus, 10, Voldern, 8, Vanderstaal, 9, Vanderstorm, 10!"

The crowd "Oooohed", and applauded even louder this time.

"Junior archers, take five! Next division, forward!"

The children left the archery range and headed to the refreshment tent for sandwiches and lemonade while the competition went on outside.

"Hey Vanderstorm! You think you're SO hot, don'tcha? Tryin' to show up us boys who've been doin' it so good?"

"Huh?"

"Well listen, cork-cock, I'mma beat you in the next round!" said Maximus, "Shootin' movin' targets is my specialty!"

"So that's why you eat so much pork..."

"WHAT'D YOU SAY!?"

"Hey you said moving targets was your specialty...must be since you probably can't move anyway..."

"YOU SAYIN' I'M FAT!?"

"You eat apples a lot. Don't pigs eat apples?"

"SHUT UP, VANDERSTORM!"

"Oh ignore him", said Alexei, "Max is always cranky. He's failed his page training...three times!"

"He's twelve!"

"I told you he was bad".

"That Vanderstorm kid thinks he's SO big!" said Max to the other boys. He picked up an apple and started tossing it in the air. "Well I'll show him! Moving targets are my specialty!"

*Twang!!*

*Zock!*

*Thunk!*

"MY APPLE! VANDERSTORM YOU'RE DEAD!"

"You'll have to hit me, first!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo decimates the competition in his own divisi...

choices: Leo thinks of something that will win him the competition.
Leo chickens out.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"AAAALRIGHT LADIES AND GENTLEMEN! Next round is the Kids and Teens Moving Targets! What will they be shooting at, Vesuvius?"

"Well", said the M.C.'s assistant, "We've got a slingshot here. Every boy will have to shoot three apples which the slingshot will launch into the air, one after the other. You all have three arrows in your quivers. That's all you get. The person who gets all three apples and has the highest total score, will win this round. Then, we have trick-shooting and ultimate skill!"

The archers lined up and started shooting as apples were fired into the air by assistants shooting them with slingshots.

Leo lined up his bow and arrow all ready, and prepared to shoot. He hit his first apple. As did most people. Then, he aimed again. When the next set of apples were shot into the air...

*Thunk!*

"HEY!"

"Hey nothin'! You snooze, you lose, Vandersnot!"

Leo watched as Max had fired an arrow, hitting his apple instead of his own!

"That's cheating!" Leo shouted.

"Suck it!"

Leo glared at Max. He loaded two arrows into his bow, one on top of the other. He raised his bow into the air and watched as the next round of apples, the last, were shot into the air...

*Zunk!!...Thock!...Thock!!*

"HEY NO FAIR! You had TWO arrows!...AND you hit two targets! FOUL! FOUL!"

"There ain't nothin' in the rules that says you can't have more'n'one arrow in your bow! And I hit my three apples, two of mine and one of yours! To make up for the one you stole from me!"

"Hold it! Hold it!" said the M.C., hurrying out. "Ves! The scrolls!"

The M.C.'s assistant came out, holding a large scroll.

"Let's see...regulation size arrows, bow-tensions...distances...uh-huh...uh-huh...Sorry Maxy, but young Leo here's right. There's no rule here about how many arrows you can shoot with. And since you DID hit one of his targets ON PURPOSE, I'm sorry but that disqualifies you for this round!"

"WHAT!? NO FAIR!...HE HIT ONE OF MINE, TOO!"

"You deprived him of a target and forfeited your own! We can't disqualify him for that!"

"THIS SUCKS!"

"Leo Vanderstorm, winner of the first two rounds!" the M.C. shouted. Everyone clapped.

"Wow!"
"Oh man..."
"That was COOL!"

"HEY VANDERSTORM! GET OVER HERE!"

Vanderstorm hurried over to the other boys, gulping.

"That was COOL!"

...

...

"Huh?"

"Nobody ever did that Max before!"
"Wha?"
"He bullies everyone!"
"No one's ever stood up to him like that!"
"You're the first!"
"But..."
"That was cool!"
"I thought you guys hated me!?"
"Weeeeell...no. But Max hates your guts...and the rest of your body".
"...Wow..."
"Well c'mon, we gotta practice for our trick shots! I bet you got somethin' really cool!"

"Uuuh...um..."

Leo gulped. He'd completely forgotten about the trick-shooting round! He didn't have anything! What was he going to do!?
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The boys reassemble for the moving-target round.

choices: Alexei gets to stay over at Castle Vanderstorm with Leo!
Alexei can't stay over. But the two boys do go out camping.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"...and now we come to the FINAL stage of the preliminary rounds...The Trick-Shot Segments! Each member of every age-group will be required to perform a trick-shot for the audience and judges! The shots are scored on originality, skill and showmanship! Who has the most original and creative trick, which one is the hardest to pull off, and which is the most entertaining to watch! For reasons of safety, shooting items off of people's heads or hands, will not be permitted..."

"BOOOOOOO!!"

"Excalibur!! Shhhh!"

"Let us begin with the juniors! Ages ten and under, and up to Twenty, please approach the Range!"

Everyone watched and waited. They watched juggling acts and archery, they watched multiple arrows being fired at once, they watched boys shooting flaming arrows creating gigantic fireballs! ("Wook papa! Iz burny!")

After a teenager named Amadeus X. Malikon did his stunt ("Wow, he hit a bullseye standing on a galloping horse!"), and Leo STILL didn't have some sort of act, he didn't know what to do!

"Still nothin'?" the M.C. asked, kneeling down next to Leo at the side of the range. Leo shook his head.

"Don't worry, kid. We don't do all the judging until the end. Once the teenagers are done, you'll get a shot. But you have to have thought up something by then!"

Leo nodded. He paced back and forth, watching the other acts, and struggling to think of something! What was he gonna do!? Then, he smiled.

"Ladies and gentlemen! Your attention, please! Before we conclude the last of the junior rounds, we have our final contestant...Leonardo Vanderstorm! Now, young Master Leo, what is your performance for us and our judges?"

"I need a bit of help", said Leo. "I need a few things from the audience".

"What things do you need, Leo?" said the M.C.

"I need two rings, and an assistant".

"Ladies, gentlemen, may I have two rings!" said the M.C. "You'll get them back, don't worry!"

The crowd laughed. Slowly, two gold rings were passed down through the audience and handed to the M.C.

Leo took one ring and placed it on a stick with a fork at the tip, which was half driven into the soil at the end of the archery range, fifty yards in front of a standard ring target. Leo moved all the way to the end of the range, a full hundred yards away.

"Okay, I need someone to help me with this..." he said.

The M.C.'s assistant, Vesuvius, stepped forward.

"Some trick-shots and acts need help", he said, "It's all within the rules, folks", he added. "Alright, little guy, what do you need?"

"Stand twenty-five feet away. When I say, I want you to throw it right up in the air and then step aside".

The crowd whispered.

"I'm going to shoot through one moving object, through one still object, and THEN hit the bullseye...at the other end of the range".

The crowd gasped and talked even louder!

"Ladies, gentlemen, please! A call for silence!...Thank you...Drum-roll, please!"

Drrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr...

*Ting!* *Thwink!...shoonk!...Fwhunk!!...Drrrrrr!!*

The crowd gasped. It all happened so fast, nobody was entirely sure WHAT happened!

The M.C. hurried to the target and marked the point of the arrow's entrance. A perfect bullseye! The crowd gasped. He removed the arrow from the target and approached the audience, close enough for them to see two rings dangling off the shaft.

Silence reigned supreme.

"YEAH VANDERSTORM!"

"EXCALIBUR!! Shhhh!"

Leo yelped and clapped his hands to his ears as the audience exploded!

"I...I..." he stammered.

"Young man, that is one of the most impressive feats of archery I have ever seen!" said the M.C. "To perfectly time AND aim a three-point shot like that with just one arrow and one attempt is spectacular!"

Leo blushed. He thought his whole head would turn blood red!

--- --- --- ---

"Wow!" said Champion, staring at his younger cousin's gold medal. "County champion!"

"Yeah", said Leo, "Pity you can't live up to your name!"

"I...HEY!"

"Now son, no gloating", said Fortis. "I BEAT YOU, WOLFGANG!"

Wolfgang glowered. "Stupid cousin Fortis...always gettin' better things..."

"Hey, nice work, little dude..."

"Thanks Uncle Excalidbur..."

"Awww...Cute kid...Gotcha nose!"

"Uggle Eggalibur! Aigh nogh give aggeymore!!"

"Wow! That was so cool! I've never seen anybody do that before! I saw one guy try once, but he missed! And he tried again, and he got one ring, but he missed the other! And then when he did it again, he got disqualified because he had another ring hidden in his hand when he went to load the arrow! And he LOST! But you WON! And that was SO cool! Like, the coolest thing I've ever ever ever ever seen! EVER! Oh man, I wish I could do stuff like that! I can't do stuff like that! I bet I flunked the trick-shot component all totally! A washout! A waste! A..."

"Woah, stow the gab, turbo-tongue! Hey kid, you know who this is?"

Leo blushed. "Papa...this is my new friend Alexei Vanderstaal".

"Yeah! And it is SO cool to be Leo's friend! Because Leo is...papa?"

Young Alexei stared up at the towering colossus who stood behind Leo and gawped.

"The...then...then...y-you m-must be...must be...I I mean...I...Yessir, m'lord Vanderstorm, sir..."

"Hahahahaha...twitchy little thing, ain't he, boy?"

"Yessir!" said Alexei, blushing.

"Papa! Can Alexei come home with us and stay over? His father lives near the village!"

"Really? I didn't know that there were any other nobility around here..."

"H-he's not, sir...he's a woodsman, sir".

"Aah. Your father's the firewood merchant!"

"Yessir! Raphael Vanderstaal, sir".

"Your father runs a good business. You must help him a lot, huh?"

"No sir. I have three older brothers! They do all of that stuff. I help around the house, I clean stuff...it's why I have so much time for archery".

"Hmm", said Fortis. "Well you go and speak to your parents and if it's alright with them, then you can come and stay for a week".

"Really!? Oh wow! Okay! Thanks! I'll be right back!...Hey papa!!..."

"What does that kid eat!?" Fortis whispered to Eldonia, "He's got more jump than a rabbit on coffee!"

"How do YOU know what a rabbit on coffee acts like?"

"Eeeh...um..."

"Did you feed Leo's bunny your leftover espresso?"

"...I was curious..."

"No wonder it's been jumping on my bed! My hanging canopy's got more holes than a fishing-net!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo thinks of something that will win him the c...

choices: Leo and Alexei stroll through the countryside, looking for a place to camp.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"HURGH!!"

THUNK!!

"GUUURRGGGHHH!..."

THUNK!!

"SONNOVA..."

THUNK!!!

"You giving birth over there or somethin'?"

"Shut up, Fortis!"

Fortis watched his cousin Excalibur trying to split wood.

"Use a bigger axe. Or better yet, get some irons and a sledge and beat the shit out of it! You're wasting your time with that stupid hatchet!"

Fortis stared around. He saw a boy jogging towards him. He had very white blond hair and pale skin. He bowed as he got closer.

"Ah...You're the boy's friend aren't you? Alden or...Adrian..."

"Alexei, sir".

"Oh yeah, that's it..."

"M'lord Vanderstorm, sir. Father says that I can't stay over here at the castle".

"Awww that's too bad..."

"But he said if it was alright, that Leonardo and I...well we could go camping!"

"Camping, eh?" Fortis said. "Hmm. Yes I don't see why not. There's plenty of woodland around here to go camping in".

"Thank you, sir!"

"LEO! GET YOUR SCRAWNY, ARROW-SHOOTING BUTT OUT HERE!"

"Excalibur!"

"What?...Oh yeah!...THAT WEIRD KID YOU LIKE IS HERE!"

"CAL!"

Excalibur laughed, and went back to his log-splitting. Fortis sighed.

Leo dashed outside. "Hi Uncle Cal! Hi papa! What...Heey!"

Alexei smiled.

"Your papa said we can go camping!" said Alexei.

"Really papa!? Really-really really!?"

Fortis smiled. "So long as you're careful and safe. Stay close to the main roads".

"Yes, papa!"

--- --- --- --- --- ---

"Fortis, what's this I hear about you letting Leo and his friend go camping!?"

"What now?"

"He's too young!"

"Don't be an idiot! I went camping when I was his age!"

"Yeah, and you chickened out on the first night..." said Jupiter.

"I DID NOT!"

"BUCK-BUCK-BUCK-KAW!!"

"I don't remember that!" said Cannius.

"Sure you do! The fire went out because of the rain, and chickenshit here wanted to run back to the castle! Something about how he had to get another blanket..." Jupiter said.

"Oh yeah! And he never came back..."

"I did SO come back!" Fortis retorted.

"The next DAY!"

"The next afternoon, more like it..."

Fortis's two brothers laughed.

"The boys'll be FINE", he said. He looked at Leo, who had so many things about him, he looked ready to go off to war! "You have fun, kid!"

"Thanks papa!...AND DON'T EAT BUNNY WHEN I'M GONE!"

"Gotcha...Mrs. Tibbs! We'll have jugged hare for dinner..."

"NOOOOO!"

Fortis laughed, "Relax! Bunny will remain unharmed".

"He better!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Alexei can't stay over. But the two boys do...

choices: The boys return to camp.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Your father's estate is amazing!"

"...Thanks".

"Thank you for letting me hang out with you, sir!"

"...You CAN call me Leo, you know, Alexei? We are friends, right?"

"Right! Right...Just...well...your pops..."

Leo laughed, "Yeah papa's pretty intimidating...but you don't have to worry. He's good..."

"So I suppose you're gonna be a knight like him, huh?"

"Carry on the family legacy, I guess..."

"Do you want to be a knight?"

"I guess so...I mean...Well...Why not? If I can".

The two boys wandered through the woods and forests, staring at all the trees and grass, kicking their heels along a dirt road. Eventually, they found a clearing, and set up camp. They'd promised Lord Vanderstorm to be back by Monday evening, so that meant they could have two full nights and three days in the forest alone.

The two boys gathered rocks to make a fire-pit, and then started pitching a tent between two trees.

"Hey what food did you bring?" Alexei asked.

"Cheese...bread..smoked ham..."

"You not hunting?"

"Why should I hunt?"

"You're an archer like me! Archers go hunting!"

"I suppose we could do some target-practice...You brought your bow and arrows along too, right?"

Alexei nodded. "Sure did. C'mon! Let's go look around. We can pick up kindling for the fire".

The two boys headed off and walked around the forest, swinging daggers and machetes around. All kinds of wild animals were everywhere. Birds like larks, sparrows, pheasants, and woodland creatures, ranging from squirrels to mice, and rabbits and hares.

"Mountain hares sure don't have a lot of meat on them", said Leo.

"You have a pet rabbit, don't you?"

"Yeah. It's a Fatlantean Forest-Loper".

"What the hell is that?"

"They're a Fatlantean breed. Docile, friendly, tame. They make great pets! But they'll eat your whole vegetable-garden if you give them a chance!...I guess that's why papa don't like 'em. They ate up his entire potato-patch last year!"

Alexei laughed and Leo chuckled.

"Like, those over there..." Leo pointed to a gathering of hares, "They just eat whatever falls off the fruit trees, and grass and roots and..."

Zunk!!

One of the hares flopped down dead. The others hopped away. Both boys stopped.

"What was that?"

"It's an arrow!" said Alexei. Both boys unshouldered their bows and loaded in arrows, turning around behind them. There, they saw another boy standing between trees. He also held a bow. The boy looked slightly older, maybe ten or eleven. He had brown hair and brown eyes. He strolled forwards.

"My kill", he said, simply. He stared at their bows and arrows and shrugged.

"Who are you!?" Leo shouted. He'd never met this boy before!

The boy moved towards the hare and hoisted it up, removed the arrow and pulled out a hatchet to decapitate the animal. Holding it up by the hindlegs, he turned around.

"Who are you?"

"Leo Vanderstorm. My friend Alexei Vanderstaal".

"Huh..."

The boy moved closer. "Vanderstorm, huh? Hmm". He sounded slightly impressed.

"I'm Jaxxon", he said, holding out a hand. Leo shook it. "Jaxxon DeJaeger".

"Is that your tent back there?"

He pointed to where a tent could just be seen in the distance. The two boys nodded.

"Camping?"

Nod.

"Cool. Can I join?"

"If we get in on that bunny", said Alexei. Jaxxon nodded. "Sure", he said.

"C'mon!" said Leo, "We gotta start a fire before we can eat it".
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo and Alexei stroll through the countryside, ...

choices: Something happens in the night. Jaxxon wakes up his new friends.
The three boys return to Castle Vanderstorm a few days later.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Don'tcha know how to light a fire, Alexei?" Leo asked. Alexei blushed.

"Your father's a BLACKSMITH! You can't light a fire!?"

"I've never had to!"

"I'll do it", said Jaxxon. He pulled out a firemaking kit from his haversack and started setting up the drill, tinder and fire-board on the ground. He looped his drill through the bowstring on his bow and started driving it back and forth as hard as he could. The wooden drill-bit spun back and forth over the tinder and fire-board, building up incredible friction and heat! After spinning back and forth several times, the tinder started smoking...and then burst into flames!

Jaxxon blew on the ball of tinder, before tipping it into the fire-pit, where Leo put straw and small twigs and other things on top of it. Then, he started putting larger twigs and hunks of branches on. The three boys settled down while Jaxxon gutted the hare and skinned it.

"Who knows how to cook?" Leo asked.

"I do", said Alexei. "I just need something to skewer the meat on".

"I'll find a stick", said Leo. He headed off and returned a few minutes later with a long, thin branch. he pulled out a knife and started chipping and slicing away at one end to make a point. Jaxxon forced the slices of rabbit-meat on while Alexei held it over the fire.

"Your pa's a blacksmith?" Jaxxon asked. Alexei nodded. "Mother's dead. So I do all the cooking. And my little sister helps look after the house. And I help pa in the forge".

"You like being a blacksmith?"

"It's fun".

"Who are you?" Jaxxon asked, looking at Leo.

"I'm Leo Vanderstorm. My papa's Lord Vanderstorm. This is OUR land", he said.

"Oooh...OUR land...What're you gonna do? Shoot me? You'd have to catch me, first!"

"I can shoot farther than you! AND more accurately!"

"Can't not!"

"Can too!"

"Betcha can't!"

"Bet I can!"

"Can't!"

"Can!"

"Can't!"

"Can!"

"I can out-shoot BOTH of you!"

"Yeah SURE Lexus..."

"Alexei!"

"Whatever! Alright...uh...The loser has to have first watch tonight!"

"Deal!"

--- --- --- ---

"Damn it!" Jaxxon groaned as he sat by the fire. Behind him, Leo and Alexei climbed into their tent.

"'Night Jaxx!...Shout if you see anything!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The boys return to camp.

choices: Fortis and his family travel to Ferramount for the finals of the archery tournam
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Is your father a knight?"
"Yes. Is yours?"
"Yeah..."

"You don't sound impressed".

"My saintly father wishes for me to carry on the NOBLE DeJaeger line and become SIR Jaxxon Dejaeger by my twenty-first birthday! He thinks it'll get me a bride or something...As if our family name and fortune wouldn't already do that!?"

"Hahahaha! Girls..."

"Do you have any sisters?"

"Three".

"Oh man..."

"Hahahaha! Do you?"

"One".

"Is she nice?"

"I dunno...Hey blacksmith boy, you got a sister?"

"Yes", said Alexei.

The three boys were walking slowly back to Castle Vanderstorm. Jaxxon had invited himself along to the house.

"Where do you live, Jaxxon?" Leonardo asked.

"The Oaks Estate. It's over the river, beyond the trees. Over the hills. You can walk from here to there in...half a day? Maybe? It's faster if you go by boat, or take a horse, of course..."

As the boys approached the castle, they heard galloping hooves behind them. They turned to see Lord Vanderstorm mounted on his noble steed.

"Easy boy..."

"Hi papa! Hey Vorty! Good Vorty!"

Vortex snorted and licked Leonardo's face!

"Eeeewww!!! Bad horsey!"

Alexei laughed.

"On your way back home, then?" Fortis asked.

"Yes m'lord", said Alexei, "Thank you for letting us camp in the grounds, m'lord".

"You're very welcome, Alexei. Your father is brother to Thor, the village blacksmith".

"Yes sir! Uncle Thor and Aunt Sapphire".

"Very interesting. You know I have a daughter named Sapphire".

"Leo told me!"

Fortis frowned. "'Leo told you', is it, my lad?"

Alexei blushed, "Th-that is to say, uh, Lord Leonardo told me, m'lord Vanderstorm, sir..."

"It's alright, papa..." said Leo, "I told Alexei he could call my name".

"Indeed?" said Fortis, "My lad do not forget your elders and betters. You will treat them with respect and be grateful for the services which they enable you to provide for them. Is that understood?"

"Yes m'lord!"

Leo blushed. "It's okay, Alexei", he whispered to his friend as he trailed behind his father's horse. "Papa's very...well...Don't worry about it. I'm not angry!"

Alexei nodded. "Thanks...Leo", he said, and Leo smiled.

--- --- --- ---

"Did you boys have fun camping?" Eldonia asked.

"Yes mama".

"Awww! Thunner an' Gabbywul wanna go camping!"

"You're far too young, boys!"

"Awwww...Why not Weonado too young!?"

"Because he's older than you!"

"Whyyyy mama?"

"Boys, don't pester your mother", said Fortis.

"So, you're Lord Vanderstorm, huh?" said Jaxxon.

"I am that", said Fortis. "And you are young Lord Jaxxon DeJaeger".

"Uh-huh", said the cocky, brown-haired youth.

"And your father is the Duke, Lord Bastion DeJaeger?"

"Yeah".

"I see. Lord SIR Bastion DeJaeger?"

Jaxxon groaned. "YEAH!" he snorted.

"I take it you don't enjoy your father's title?"

"I don't enjoy what it suggests!" Jaxxon grumbled.

"What's that, my lad?"

"That I have to become a knight!"

"Don't you want to become a knight?"

"He tries to teach me and he says I'm failing everything I need to do to become a proper page! I hate it! I don't wanna be a knight!"

"What do you want to be?"

"I want to be an archer! Like Leo!"

"Leo's going to be a knight too, young Jaxxon".

"Papa's teaching me how to ride a horse!" said Leo. "Papa why can't I ride Vortex?"

"Son I told you, he's too big for you! He'd throw you right off! Now Jaxxon, being a knight is a wonderful thing! Why don't you want to be a knight?"

"Papa tells me how BAD I am! He never tells me anything else! Why should I waste my time!? At least with archery I'm good!"

"You can't survive on the winnings out of archery tournaments, my lad!"

"Yeah but...I dunno!" Jaxxon brooded.

Just then, the mood in the dining-hall changed dramatically. A bell jangled loudly throughout the castle!

"What the..." Fortis began.

"Front door!" said Mrs. Tibbs, hurrying past. The rotund, homely housekeeper waddled down the corridor.

"Is his lordship in?"
"Yes sir! He's in the dining-room".
"Thank you".
"Shall I..."
"No".

"The Lord Bastion DeJaeger, m'lord!" Mrs. Tibbs panted, as a tall man, older than Fortis and more rugged-looking, entered the dining-room. Fortis stood up.

"Bastion".

"Fortis...THERE YOU ARE!"

Jaxxon let out a yelp of pain as his father almost ripped his ear off, dragging him to his side! "WHAT have I told you about running away from home!?"

"OW!!! GET OFF ME!"

"You go on home, young man!"

"NO!"

"YOU DO AS I TELL YOU!"

"What on EARTH is all this hollering about!?"

Athena entered the dining-room, tapping her walking-stick on the floor.

"Lady Vanderstorm! I apologise...I came to find my son, and to bring him HOME".

"I don't WANNA go home!" Jaxxon shouted. "You always bully me!"

"If you bothered to DO what you were TOLD, I wouldn't HAVE TO!"

"I WOULD DO IT IF YOU SHOWED ME HOW!"

"DON'T YOU TAKE THAT TONE WITH ME, BOY!"

"BASTION DEJAEGER!"

The room was deadly still. Eldonia retreated from the dining-room, taking her twin boys with her.

"WHAT is going on here!? I will NOT have you shrieking around my castle like a drowning pig!"

"Yeah, that's Forty's job..." said Excalibur, who continued to eat his lunch throughout the whole debacle.

Bastion seemed to be doing a lot of very fast thinking.

"Boy. Stay here. Play with Leonardo, go in the garden, whatever. But if you run off again I'll tan you so hard you won't sit for a month! Lord Vanderstorm, a word, if you please".

Lord DeJaeger left the room, Fortis followed.

"Bastion I DEMAND an explanation! I won't have you coming in here disrupting my household!"

Lord DeJaeger headed upstairs and into the library, Fortis following him, and closing the doors behind them.

"I'm...I'm sorry, Fortis...But that...BOY!...Has been driving me up the wall for...I don't even KNOW how long!"

"Well what's the MATTER!?"

"I want him to be a knight!"

"As would any right-thinking Mountanian father. What about it!?"

"THE BOY REFUSES!"

"Is it that bad?"

"Is...Fortis, I sent him to old Lord VonGewalt. You know who he is..."

"Of course I know! I married his damn daughter!"

"Good! You know what kind of person he is...he gave up trying to teach the boy after six months! He send him back to me! After that, I tried various members of the royal court in Ferramount, none of them would take him!"

"Word travels fast at the king's court..."

"I tried Sir Axelrod, who lives two counties away...he took the boy in and gave up after a year! I sent him to Sir Galico Vandersteen...he stopped after six weeks! I've been trying to train the boy for the past six months, and he shows NO desire to learn! OR any desire to do anything! But shoot that damn bow and arrow of his!"

"Fine!...What's that got to do with ME?"

"Your boy's in training to be a knight".

"Yes".

"Who's teaching him?"

"I am!"

"I want you to teach Jaxxon, too".

"What!?"

"Jaxxon and Leonardo are the same age. Perhaps them learning together might motivate them! And when Jaxxon finds out about your military career, he might be impressed enough to actually LEARN!"

Fortis frowned, "You know, that might not be a bad idea. But you KNOW this stuff is expensive! You're my friend, Bastion, and I'll cut prices where I can, but..."

"I'll pay all expenses!"

"Food, lodgings, lessons..."

"I'll pay his rent for you!"

"...weapons..."

"I'll give you some of my swords!"

"...mounts..."

"I'll send over one of my horses! Two, if you need them!"

"...armour..."

"I'll find something!"

"...to say nothing of..."

"I'll pay for it! Fortis you have to help me!"

"You'll cover all expenses?"

"Yes!"

"And the boy?"

"He can live here!...With your permission..."

"You do realise that both of them are enrolled in the finals of the archery tournament".

"Well his training can resume when it's over!...And he's won!"

"That won't work".

"Why not?"

"Because Leonardo's going to win".

"No he won't!"

"Oh yes he will!"

"Will not!"

"Will too!"

"Will NOT!"

"WILL TOO!"

"If you train my boy to be a knight, then perhaps I'll tell Jaxx to LET Leo win..."

"Leo wouldn't need that! He'd do it on his own merits! Because he's a winner like his own father!"

Bastion laughed.

"C'mon Bastion. Let's go downstairs...Besides, we have an archery tournament..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"M'LORDS, LADIES AND GENTLEMEN! BOYS AND GIRLS OF ALL AGES! STEP THIS WAY PLEASE! The finals of the Mountanian National Archery Tournament commence today! Yes indeed, yes indeed! Right this way! Roll up, roll up! C'mon everybody!"

"I WISH that fat sack of shit would give it a rest!" Fortis grumbled.

"FORTIS!" Athena snapped, poking her grandson in his stomach. "You will NOT use that language around me!"

"No, grandma. I'm sorry".

"Thanks for the wonderful rooms, granny!" said Eldonia, coming up behind the ancient matriarch. "How on earth did you get us guest suites at the palace!?"

"What makes you think I did anything!?" Athena asked, "Don't forget that our darling Minerva married the heir to the throne!"

Eldonia blushed. She was still getting used to the idea of her best friend being a princess!

"And here she is now..." said Fortis. He let out a loud, carrying wolf-whistle.

"FORTIS!"

"What? She's my sister! Hey girl!"

"You can't call her that! She's a princess now!"

"She was GIRL before she was ever a damn princess!"

Minerva glided towards her family and hugged and kissed them all. Trotting behind was an older woman dressed in black and white.

"Oh Forty, this is Nanny Winters. Nanny, this is my brother the Earl of Dynamos".

"Very nice to meet you!"

"Uckle Warty! Uckle Warty!"

Fortis bent down and hugged little Prince Ares.

"You little ratbag! C'mere!"

"Weee! Pway wiff Awez!"

"Not now, son. We're going to see your Cousin Leonardo win the archery tournament!"

"We all are", said Cassius, coming up. "C'mon, Ares, let's go find our seats".

"Nooo papa! Wanna sit wiff gwamma Teena!"

"Oh come here!" said Athena, "You can sit with me...Come along, now!"

Everyone hurried in. Bastion came up the rear. Holding his arm was a shapely young lady.

A loud whistle pierced the air.

"Excalibur!"

"What is THAT?"

"THAT is my daughter, Excalibur", said Bastion, "Everyone, this is Jaxxon's older half-sister, Karenina".

"Rrrrrraaawwwrrrr..."

"Excalibur!!"

"What? She is a piece of work...Hey there, fire-girl, you lookin' for somethin' hot?"

"Well that's FRESH!" said Karenina. She was tall and shapely. Over six foot, with flowing dark red hair and piercing green eyes. She had a body that sent boys bow-legged. She stared at Excalibur. Her mouth twitched slightly.

"I'm alright, papa", she said to her father. Bastion let go of her, seeming confident that she was a big girl who could take care of herself. She stared up at the cocky young Mountain lord. "Good afternoon, Lord Excalibur Vexron Vanderstorm. I've heard stories about you".

"Nothing good, I hope..."

"Absolutely repulsive..."

Athena sighed, "Things never change", she said, as she sat down.

"I'm sure grandpa was a perfect gentleman!" said Minerva.

"Good heavens what ARE you talking about, girl!?...If he was, I should never have bothered marrying him! Far too boring, otherwise!"

Eldonia and Minerva giggled.

"When are they coming on?" Bastion hissed to Fortis.

"I dunno...BOY!"

A uniformed usher hurried up to the reserved boxes and seats.

"Yes m'lord!"

"Give us a program!"

The boy flicked a folded document through the air. Fortis dug some coins out of his purse. "Hand that to the kid", he said, pushing some money into Jupiter's hands.

"Oh look, they're coming up first, the children's division. The winner, and runners up from each county..."

Leo smiled, holding up the gold medallion.

"Grraaaaandma!" Leo flinched as his great-grandmother pinched his cheeks.

"Oh we're VERY proud of you!" said Eldonia, "Aren't we, darling?"

"We sure are, boy. We sure are", said Fortis.

"Look Uncle Excalibur! I won!"

"You won your division", Excalibur said. "You still gotta win against the other divisions!"

"And he will!" said Minerva, "he's such a smart boy!"

"Gawww...Aunt Minnie..."

"You did...you did good, boy..." said Bastion. Jaxxon stood there holding the silver medal.

"Is that IT? I did good?"

"Well now you didn't win...but...well you came close! And you did...you did your best and that's still very very good. Don't forget that Leo's a real expert".

"Oh thanks, pops..."

"Now come on, boy. I know you're not happy about winning..."

"I wanted to win because I thought you'd stop complaining about my stupid knight training!"

"Jaxxon!"

"WELL YOU ALWAYS DO!"

"Have you ever thought that I might not, if you bothered to put some effort into it!?"

"Effort!? The wheezers you send me to!? It takes them more effort to get out of BED! And it's so boring! And they never SHOW me anything! And they talk about stuff I never get! And it's always JUST me and JUST them! There's never anyone else! It's so boring!"

"What are you saying?"

"I'm SAYING they're too damn old! There's nothing to do!"

"Don't you use that language with me, boy!"

"Well it's true!"

Bastion sighed. He paced back and forth in a largely empty part of the square where the finals were being held.

"So that's how you feel, huh?"

"Yes!"

"I see. Now son, I AM proud of you for doing this. For getting second place. But it's also important for you to carry out your military training! If all those things improved, you think you'd do it again?"

"I dunno..."

"Son you're already two years behind!"

"DON'T REMIND ME!" Jaxxon shouted, turned and started walking away.

"YOU COME BACK HERE RIGHT NOW! JAXXON GET BACK HERE!"

"NO!"

"Jaxxon listen to me!...Jaxxon!...Damn it!"

"Having trouble, huh?"

"Wh...oh jeez..."

Bastion stared at Fortis, "Alright! Laugh! I screwed it up again!"

"Perhaps I should talk to him?"

"Would you!? I've had enough of this crap!"

Fortis smiled, "Relax, Basty...I'll handle it...Now where's he gone?"

"Jaxxon?...JAAAAAAAAAXXON!...Jaxxon! Where are you!?"

Fortis heard a muffled sniffling and sobbing. He entered the side of the nearest spectator stand, to see Jaxxon crying while sitting on a support-beam.

"There you are", said Fortis. "You know your father's been looking everywhere for you?"

"Is it you?"

"Um...actually yes".

"A-another boy?"

"Hi papa!" said Leo, running up.

"Oh..." said Jaxxon. "Him".

Fortis chuckled. "Yes, him. Leo, Jaxx here is gonna be doing his page training with you...in fact he'll be doing ALL his training with you".

"Wow!" said Leo, "That's cool!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Now son", said Lord DeJaeger, "You remember your manners!" he said.

"Yes papa".

"You do NOT talk unless spoken to. You will address everyone by their proper names and titles unless invited not to. That is LORD Vanderstorm, Lady Vanderstorm, Lady Eldonia, Princess Minerva, and Lord Leonardo".

"W-what!? Papa! Leo and I are FRIENDS!"

"And Lord Fortis and I are friends. And I want us STILL to be friends by the time you've left! So you MIND yourself, you hear boy!?"

"Yessir".

"Alright then".

The carriage pulled up outside Castle Vanderstorm and Lord Bastion and his son climbed out. Bastion grabbed a chain by the front door and pulled, hard. A bell rang inside. The doors were opened a short time later by a short, fat, round housekeeper.

"Mornin' Mrs. Tibbs. I'm here to drop the boy off", said Bastion, indicating his son.

"Of course, m'lord!" said Mrs. Tibbs, "The Master is upstairs in his study. Perhaps you would go on upstairs?" she said.

"Thank you...C'mon boy!"

Jaxxon followed his father upstairs and into a huge, masculine chamber - The lord's study.

Fortis was busy staring at a roll of papers. Taxes, bills, rent...He swept it all aside when he saw Bastion enter.

"So, it starts today, does it?" said Fortis.

"Yes sir".

"Right. C'mere boy...Now you listen to me. Starting from today is your progression to become a proper knight. You understand? While you live here you will obey me or I will make you sorry that you didn't! You will be polite! You will be respectful! If I get any sas-mouth and backtalk from you boy, you gonna wish you were born without teeth to talk with! Your father has sent you to every reputable knight and warrior this side of the Mountanian border and if they ain't gonna take you, then you have some serious issues. And I ain't gonna give a shit what they are! You do as you're told or I will MAKE you do as you're told!"

Jaxxon gulped and nodded, wondering just what kind of deal it was that his father had brokered with Lord Vanderstorm!

"You understand, boy!?"

"Yessir!"

"Good. Good day, Lord DeJaeger. I'll send your boy back in a few years".

"Sir", said Bastion. The two men shook hands and Bastion headed downstairs.

"LADY! GET IN HERE!"

Eldonia hurried in, holding onto her twins.

"Yes my lord!"

"Young Master Jaxxon will be staying with us for the duration of his combat-training. I want you to make sure that he's familiar with the household".

"Certainly! Come along, young Jaxxon".

"Donnie!...Leave the girls..."

The twins rushed to their father who sat them playfully in his lap and stroked their hair, while Eldonia took Jaxxon away.

She showed him the bedrooms, the library, the washrooms, dining-room, ballroom, kitchens, gardens, stables, parlour, morning room, living room, dying room, basements, cellars, closets and various other chambers and rooms around the castle.

"Now unfortunately, with such a large family...EXCALIBUR PUT SOME CLOTHES ON!"

"Gotcha!...where's my cap..."

"...we won't have a spare bedroom for you. You'll have to share a room with Leonardo. I hope that's alright. We have another bed in there and we've set things up as nice as we can. Leo! Leo! C'mere! Show Jaxxon where he'll be sleeping".

"Yes mama!" said Leo, "C'mon Jaxx! You're upstairs with me!"

"That's my bed by the windows", said Leo, pointing. "Your bed's over here. We moved some of my furniture around and such. There's the fireplace over there near the door, and the chairs and tables, desk, um...yeah".

Jaxxon ignored most of that and approached a shelving unit at the foot of Leo's bed. Pride of place on the top shelf, right in the middle, was a huge gold trophy-cup. He chuckled.

"First Prize for National Archery Championship - Multidivisional Champion - Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm", he read. Leo blushed.

"Yeah", he said. Jaxxon stared at all the gold medals dangling off the handles of the cup.

"Man that's impressive..." said Jaxxon. "All I got is silver!"

Leo blushed again. Jaxxon smiled, "Nah man, you deserve it. You're a good shot".

"Thanks Jaxx".

"What's wrong?"

"Something moved on your bed!"

"What?"

Leo turned. Sure enough, a lump moved under the bedsheets.

"Oh..."

The lump moved again, working its way towards the head of the bed. Jaxxon followed it, bracing, until...

Pop!

A small, fat, sandy-coloured bunny popped out the end.

"Eww! It's a rat!"

"Don't say that! You'll hurt his feelings! It's bunny!"

"Bunny?"

"Certainly it's bunny! You leave him alone!"

"You have a pet bunny-rabbit?"

"Sure! Why not!?"

"Hahahahaha!! Leo! Future knights don't have BUNNIES for pets! They have dogs! Or horses! Or...or...dragons! Or...something cool! Bunnies are for girls!"

"Well I like him! And Bunnykins isn't going to listen to you!" said Leo, covering the bunny's ears.

Jaxxon laughed. "Man I'm sorry...it's just...weird..."

Leo hugged the defenseless little tyke.

"Awww...he's kinda cute...Hey bunny..."

Bunnywinkle!

"Hehehe! He's fuzzy...Ah-coochee-coochee-coo!!"

The bunny flopped its ears around as Jaxxon scratched it gently under the chin.

"Do you have a pet?" Leo asked. Jaxxon shook his head.

"Papa won't let me have a pet. He says I don't know how to look after one".

"Awww...Bunnykins keeps me warm at night", said Leo. "And in summer he sleeps on my bed".

"He's small".

"He's a Mountanian dwarf-bunny. They don't get much bigger than this".

"He sure is cute..."

"Coming grandpa!"

Leo rushed out into the hall. "Hi grandpa!"

"Your mother's downstairs looking for you".

"What!? Momma I already know..." Leo began.

"Aww maaan..."

Eldonia pretended that she didn't notice. "Go along, you two", she said to Leo and his friend, "Go and play out in the yard".

"No, no, no, no!" said Fortis, getting to his feet, "Boys! No! Like this! Watch me..."

Fortis pushed Jaxxon aside and picked up one of the wooden play-swords.

"Like this...watch...NEVER...stand full-on like this...You present a bigger profile...bigger target...You should stand side-on...so you're less of a target to the enemy..."

"Gee, Forty. Front-on or side-on, I'd say you're a pretty big target anyway!" said Eldonia, coming out to sit with her grandmother-in-law in the garden. The boys laughed. Fortis scowled.

"Your other hand holds a dagger, another sword, a shield, or the reins of your horse. It ain't danglin' around for you to jack off in the middle of battle!"

"Eeeww! Pops!" said Leo, "Gross!"

"Gimme that!" said Fortis, pointing to a barrel-lid modified into a play-shield. He threw Leo a practice-sword. Leo caught it.

"Alright son. Hit me".

Leo lunged forwards!

"Ah! No! NEVER lean forwards out of your center of balance! Or else, THIS happens!"

Fortis grabbed his son by the wrist and threw him to the ground!

"No fair! You're bigger!" Leo said, getting up.

"It works both ways! Don't trust me? You do it!"

Fortis made a bad swing, leaning outwards. Leo grabbed his father, wrapping both hands around his father's massive forearm. He pulled! It wasn't easy, but then Fortis staggered forwards!

"See? Now if you had a dagger or somethin'...UP! In here!" he said, gesturing to his chest. "See boys? NEVER lean forwards, or back, outside your center of gravity! It leaves you open!"

"Now", said Fortis, straightening up. "You need to learn how to compensate and take advantage of your opponents. Jaxxon...I'm gonna swing down...like this!...What do you do?"

"Uh...um...block! Up!"

"Good boy! Up! Go on, do it!"

Jaxxon picked up a practice-sword and swung upwards.

"Good! Now, that leaves all this...open. Now what?"

"Um...I take down my..."

"No, no, no!! Do NOT move your arm! Keep it there! Now what?"

"Um...Oh! THIS!"

Jaxxon grabbed his dagger and slipped inwards, thrusting!

"Good! Very good! See? You're learning!"

"That looks like fun!" said Leo. He picked up his own sword and started fighting again.

"What're you teachin' 'em, cuz? How to lose battles and be defeated in wars!?" Excalibur teased.

"You're just jealous!" said Fortis.

"Am not! Tell him, grandma! I'm the better swordsman in THIS family!"

"Oh not this again!" Athena sighed. "You know I couldn't choose!"

"Of course gran can't choose! She knows I'M the best!...right gran?" Fortis asked.

The old woman blushed. "Oh away with you two!" she chided.

Excalibur rushed inside and came back with two swords. He threw one to his cousin.

"En Garde!" he shouted. Fortis thrusted forwards! Steel scraped on steel! Sparks flew! Soon, Leo and Jaxxon forgot their own playfighting, and stared in awe at the lord of the manor and the young, hunky upstart, both sparring on the castle lawns. They beat each other, back and forth, left, right, all around! The air sung with the thrum, hum, clatter and screech of steel on steel!

"Ooooh isn't this exciting!?"

Karenina DeJaeger dismounted from her horse as she rode up, watching the two, hot, sweaty mountain men dueling it out.

"Oooh! My big ol' Calibur's gonna win!"

"No way!" said Eldonia hotly, "Fortis will win! He's the head of the family!"

"Excalibur's the cute one!"

"HEY!" Fortis shouted. "I HEARD THAT!"

Fortis threw down his sword, grabbed Excalibur by the shoulders and waist, hauled him into the air and slammed him to the ground! The girls screamed and cheered!

"Duuuuuuuuuude..." said Jaxxon. "I wish I could do that!"

Jaxxon and Leonardo lay on the grass near the stables, panting and groaning. A huge shadow stepped over them. Leo groaned.

WHUNK!!...WHUNK!!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Guards...gates...flaming torches...cold, stone walls...dribbling water...rushing rivers...bridges...

A tiny figure, rake-thin and almost naked, rushed through the pouring rain. Behind him, the steadily vanishing outline of a towering castle with twinkling lights at the windows.

It was freezing cold! He'd had to do unspeakable things to get out of there! He shuddered at the very thought of it! He ran across the soaking wet grass through the forests and slipping and sliding down riverbanks and splashing through flood-swollen creeks!

He'd been running for weeks, now. And still in the distance he could see it. The castle on the mountain. The castle that had been his only home for as long as he'd known! Perhaps he was delusional? He had no idea. He hadn't eaten in three or four days.

He shivered and coughed and sneezed. He had traveled by barge, by horse and cart, by boat...he'd snuck through the heavily-guarded Mountanian-Vladian border...and now he had no idea where he was.

He'd kept away from large population centers. He didn't want to draw attention to himself. He went from farm to farm, quarry and mine to quarry and mine, making sure at all times never to linger in one place too long.

The weather was slowly getting warmer. He must be moving south. Every day, he kept trudging, draped in whatever clothes he could steal from washing-lines, and eating whatever food he could steal from orchards. One day he got really lucky, and pinched a pie from a windowsill.

He had no idea where he was going to go, or what he was going to do when he got there, he just knew that he wanted to travel south!

Another week had passed, and he was now in the Mountanian lowlands. He made his way through the forests, searching for food, or water, or shelter, or warmth, or clothing, when he decided to stop by a stream and try to wash the grime and muck of weeks of hard travel off of his body. He climbed down some smooth rocks into a stream, pulled off his filthy tunic and hose, and stepped carefully into the sun-warmed waters below.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"In the valley of the gems,
Where the solid golden hens,
Lay eggs which are lovely azure blue..."

"...where the geese, spin the fleece,
Of the silvery sheep,
Into scarves made of shiny, glitt'ry wool..."

"...where the larks create sparks,
with the rubies in the dark,
When they haul them from the mines, for me and you..."

"Me and you! Me and you,
When they haul them from the mines, for me and you..."

Leo and Jaxxon trekked through the forests, singing loudly. The sun shone down warm and inviting, and a cool breeze was blowing through the leaves.

"The kestrels and the hawks, with their eyes,
Sharp as quartz,
Are gazing down at the valley of the gems..."

"...Where the rabbits and the voles,
and the mice and the moles,
wear spectacles with sparkly di'mond lens!"

"...Where..."

"Hold on!" said Jaxxon.

Leo stopped singing. "What's wrong?" he asked.

"There's someone up ahead! Over there!"

Leo turned. "Where?"

Jaxxon pointed to the stream nearby. "See?"

"Oh yeah!" said Leo. "C'mon...Let's go see!"

The two boys climbed over rocks and boulders and headed towards the stream.

"Hey!" said Jaxxon, "You there!"

In the stream, the figure started! He jumped out, threw on his clothes and started running!

"What the...Hey come back!" said Leo. "Jaxxon quick!"

The two boys chased after the figure who stumbled, tripped, slipped and slid along the riverbank! Jaxxon drew out an arrow and loaded it into his bow.

"Jaxxon don't!"

Twang!!............Shunk!!

When the boys finally caught up, they found the figure pinned to a tree by the arrow, which had gone through the sleeve of his tunic! He was desperately trying to pull himself free, but was well and truly trapped!

"Woah! Calm down!" said Leo as he approached. The escapee looked terrified!

When they got closer, they realised that he was a boy! Probably younger than they were! He looked about seven or eight years old, with white blond hair and thin, starving features. He looked absolutely petrified!

"Calm down!" said Leo. "It's alright...It's okay!...OUCH!" he yelped when the boy lashed out and scratched him on the arm!

"Hehe. I'll handle this..." said Jaxxon.

"YOU? You nearly shot him in the back!"

"Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm!...I NEVER miss!"

"You missed that time two weeks ago when father took us out hunting for pheasants..."

"The SUN was in my eye!"

"Dah shun whuz in mai eye! Wah-wah-wah!!"

"Oh shut up! Hey buddy, here, lemme get that off you...Hey hold still! Jeez you're jumpier than Cinnamon when I fed him up on Lord Vanderstorm's rock whiskey..."

"YOU FED MY SISTER'S PET RABBIT WHISKEY!?"

"I thought it was apple juice!"

"No wonder that stupid thing kept falling down the stairs!"

Jaxxon laughed. "Okay...there you go, all free now. You don't have to be scared! I'm Jaxxon, and this is my friend Leo".

The boy stared at them blankly.

"Jaxxon", said Jaxxon, pointing to himself, "Leo", he said, pointing to Leonardo.

"You?" he pointed to the boy.

"Dimitri Valentin Vasily Aleksandrovitzch".

"Eh...We'll call you 'Bob'".

"Jaaaaaxx!...Um...Hi Dimitri...I'm Leonardo Vanderstorm, and this is my friend Jaxxon DeJaeger...and um...We're friends".

"Do you know what we're saying?" Jaxxon asked.

The boy nodded, very slowly.

"Da", he said. "I...I speak...I speak little bit, yes..." he said, haltingly.

"How old are you?"

The boy seemed not to understand.

"We're both nine", said Leo, sticking up nine fingers.

The boy nodded. "Dimitri...eight", he said softly.

"Oh", said Leo, "So you're a year younger than we are".

The boy nodded.

"Are you hungry? Or cold?" Leo asked. "What are you doing here?"

Dimitri swallowed slowly.

"Dimitri...run...run away..." he said softly, "run from...from..."

He wasn't sure how to finish the sentence.

"Listen, perhaps you should come with us", said Leo, "We've got a camp back here where you can rest. We've got food. Do you like venison? We killed a deer..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Come on, Dimitri!" said Leo, "We'll take you back to our camp!"

"Take...Dimitri...camp?" the boy asked slowly.

"It's this way! C'mon! We've got food!"

The boy's stomach rumbled and gurgled uncomfortably.

Food?

Maybe these boys weren't so bad...

Dimitri followed the two boys through the woods. He could tell they were Mountanian by their accents, their manners and the fact that they seemed to be perpetually armed. He'd heard fearsome stories about Mountanian strength and power, from the guards in the castle and dungeon where he grew up. He had no idea if they told the truth, exaggerated it, or played it down out of fear, anger or disgust.

The young Vladian boy found that the camp was pitched in a small clearing. It was composed of two logs for seating, a fire-pit, and a large tent. Wrapped up in paper were sausages, cheese, bread and butter. Jaxxon started cooking for three, and Leo sat down, staring at Dimitri. The boy was unlike anybody he'd ever met before!

"Where do you come from?" Leonardo asked.

"Vladia", said the boy. "Name is Dimitri Valentin Vasily Aleksandrovitzch".

"Yeah um...where were you BORN?"

The boy seemed not to understand.

"Where did you live in Vladia?"

"In...in...Ostrog..."

"Where's Ostrog?"

"Ostrog...castle...um...castle room...below stairs..."

"Oh! You mean a dungeon?"

"Da! Dungeon! Dimitri...Dimitri escape dungeon. Run for many days. Dimitri parents dead..."

"Oh you're an orphan? No parents?"

Dimitri frowned, "No...da. No parents...All dead!"

"Aww...Well...um...I suppose you'll be safe with us. You can come back to the castle with us!"

Dimitri stiffened. Castle!? A look of panic flitted over his bony face.

"It's alright!" said Leo, "I live there. It's my home! You'll like it. It's all clean and warm and comfortable! And there's lots of food, and clean beds, and my papa would love to see you!"

"I wouldn't be so sure about that, Leo", said Jaxxon. "You know what he's like".

Leo shrugged. "Who cares?!? You're coming home with us! We'll leave tomorrow morning".

"Alright", said Jaxxon, "But don't be surprised if..."

"Jaxx, it's winter now. It's getting colder and colder every day. In a couple of weeks it'll probably start snowing! He's gonna freeze to death!"

Jaxxon sighed. Although Lord Vanderstorm was more patient than his own father, Jaxxon was ready to bet his life that the sight of a Vladian runaway was going to send his blood boiling! And he didn't want to be there when the kettle exploded!

Trying not to think about it, the young Mountain boy climbed into the tent with his best friend and their new companion, and tried to get some sleep.
