1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Oh don't worry, Dimitri! Papa's not THAT scary! And you'll love the castle! It's so big and beautiful!"

The young Vladian boy seemed unconvinced. And perhaps rightly so, when he found out who Leonardo's father was.

Eldonia sat in her husband's lap, caressing his impressive form. She kissed him and hugged him and Fortis growled at her. She giggled. Someone knocked on the door. Fortis groaned.

"Yeah!?" he grumbled, irritated at having his few minutes alone with his wife interrupted. Eldonia got to her feet and stood up behind her husband. The doors to the lord's study opened and Leo peeked in.

"Papa, can Jaxxon and I speak to you about something?"

Fortis frowned. "Now?"

"Yes, father".

Fortis sighed. Eldonia kissed her husband. "I'll come back later", she whispered. She wafted past, smiled down at her eldest son, bent to give him a kiss, too.

"Mooother! Not in front of Jaxxon!"

She laughed and left the room. Fortis chuckled.

"What's the matter, boy?" he asked. He leaned back in his chair and waved the two youths in.

"Well..."

"Did you have fun, camping?"

"Yes, father!"

"Good, good. Now what's wrong?"

"Well...we found something while we were camping..."

"NO PETS! Your sisters already have their pet rabbits and you're not having anything else!...Not unless it contributes something to the household!"

"Like what?"

"A horse, a dog...something! I let your sisters have their bunnies, but that's it!"

"Well...we didn't find an ANIMAL...exactly..." said Leo. "But um...well..."

Fortis frowned. "What is it?"

Leo turned to Jaxxon who was standing by the door. Jaxxon entered, leading Dimitri after him.

"Papa...this is Dimitri".

Dimitri Valentin Vasily Aleksandrovitzch gawped at the giant sitting in the chair. Powerfully built and monumentally tall, he was every inch a Mountanian warlord...and he could tell at once, he didn't get his title just from sitting on his ass. This guy had seen SERIOUS combat! He swallowed, his jaw popping open in shock!

"Dimitri...huh?"

"Yes...father", said Leonardo.

Fortis slowly digested the name.

"Tell me...Dimitri. What brings you to my estate?"

"Father..." Leo began, but Fortis cut him off.

"I didn't ask you!" he snapped. "Boy! What is your business here!?"

"I...I...I run away from home!" Dimitri blurted out in a rush. He could tell at once, Lord Vanderstorm was not a person to be crossed!

"And what are you doing HERE?"

"I invited him here, papa! He's been on the run for weeks! Please let him day!" Leo pleaded.

"Leo, I will not allow a complete stranger to enter the castle and stay here!"

"Papa...papa please!?"

"Leo, you're not three years old anymore. That cutesy stuff don't work with me".

"Oh...Oooooh Emeraaaaald!"

"DON'T get your sister in here to butter me up! The answer is NO!"

"What on EARTH is all this shouting about!?"

Athena shuffled in, and stared at the scene in front of her. "Leonardo don't you dare talk to your father like that!"

"But grandma! Papa won't let us keep Dimitri!"

"Who's Dimitri and why do you want to 'keep' him!? You haven't brought back another pet, have you!?"

"THIS is Dimitri!"

The old woman turned around. "Oh my goodness! Oh the boy's filthy! And he's so thin! Fortis you can't send him back out again!"

"Grandma this is MY castle and I'll decide who comes, and who goes!"

"That's as may be, but your father and grandfather raised you better than that! You are a knight! And what is your chivalric pledge!?"

"What's that got to DO WITH ANYTHING!?"

"Don't you get sharp with me, young man! Recite it from the top!"

"What!?"

"NOW, Fortis!"

Fortis said something extremely rude under his breath, and sighed.

"As Knight of the Mountanian Kingdom, I solemnly swear this oath, to fight for the good for king and country, and the citizenry that reside therein. To dispatch with swift mercy, enemies of the realm, to aid the distressed, and to show compassion to..."

"Stop! What did you just say?"

"Aid OUR distressed, grandma!"

"The pledge says nothing about 'our' and 'theirs', Fortis!"

"How would you know!?"

"How...I am your grandmother! My husband was a knight, your father was a knight, and YOU are a knight! I know that pledge a damn sight better than you do! And while I am around, I will see to it that you uphold your chivalric oaths! Now do it!"

Fortis had very rarely been dressed down by his grandmother, but he knew from experience that she came from fierce and determined stock. Not easily frightened, swayed, or bullied.

"Yes, grandmother", he said. He grimaced as if he'd just drank a whole jug of lemon-juice.

"Oh very well! The boy can stay!"

"Thanks grandma!" said Leo.

"What, don't I get anything!?" Fortis snorted.

"YOU didn't do anything!" said Athena. "Leonardo, take the boy downstairs!"

"Okay grandma! C'mon Dimitri!"

"I can't BELIEVE you did that..." Fortis grumbled.

"I shall do more than that if you're not careful!" said Athena, gripping her grandson's ear and twisting it sharply. Fortis grimaced in pain! "Really! Excalibur could do better!"

"Grandma do NOT compare me to Excalibur!"

"I shall do no such thing! There isn't enough to compare!"

"Of course not!"

"Because he holds more virtue than you!"

"He spent half his life in prison!"

"And that's taught him a lot more than you know!"

Fortis groaned. Athena smiled and kissed her grandson, "There, there...granny loves..."

"Eldonia BETTER not find out about this!"

"About what?"

"Gran, no Mountain lord is ever kissed by his grandmother!"

"Well this one is!" she said. Fortis wailed in despair.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Come on, Dimitri", said Leo, "Let's take you downstairs to be washed".

Jaxxon led the way and took Dimitri into the kitchen.

"Mrs. Tibbs, Lord Vanderstorm asked for Dimitri here to be washed up", Jaxxon said.

The plump, homely housekeeper stared at Dimitri with a look of horror on her chubby face.

"Clean...Oh lord! Girls! Bring out the big tub! And the soap! And the scrubbing-brushes!"

"Okay!" said Matilda. "Come on Eliza!"

"I'm coming!" said Eliza. "Lucy! Go and get the soap!"

"I'm coming!" said Lucy, rushing off to find it.

"Eugh, just look at him!" said Matilda, filling up the bathtub. "He's all filthy!"

"Oh hurry up!" said Mrs. Tibbs. She started ripping off all of Dimitri's old clothes until he was stark naked! Eliza stared at him.

"He's not much downstairs..."

"That's because he's not a Mountanian!" said Matilda.

"How do you know!?"

"I heard His Lordship talking about it upstairs!"

"Listnin' at keyholes again!" Mrs. Tibbs scolded.

"No I haven't! His Lordship's got a very deep, heavy, POWERFUL voice! It goes through the whole house!"

Both girls giggled.

"Oh get into the tub with you!" said Mrs. Tibbs.

Dimitri climbed into the tub of hot water and sat down. At once, the three girls started cleaning, while Mrs. Tibbs supervised.

"Oh forget about washing his hair, Lizzie! Just cut it all off! I daresay the child's SWARMING with lice!"

"Yes, Mrs. Tibbs! I'll ask Lady Athena for her cloth-shears..."

"You'll NOT be using her ladyship's tailoring shears on hair as this! Take the clippers out of the knife-box!"

"Yessum!"

Dimitri felt himself being scrubbed all over with sponges and brushes! And then he felt his wet hair being clipped off with a pair of old shears.

"Hey! Careful whith zhe ears!" he gasped.

"Oh hold still!" said Eliza.

"His nails are filthy!"

"Woah!" said Zacharia the pageboy when he entered the kitchen, "What's going on!?"

"Never you mind, Zachy!" said Eliza.

"You look like you're trying to clean him to death!"

"We may have to!" said Matilda. "Oh just LOOK at how filthy his legs are! Eugh! Lord Vanderstorm let him walk barefoot around the castle like this!?"

--- --- --- ---

Fortis sighed.

A Vladian! In HIS HOUSE!

There HAD to be some sort of law about this...

He paced back and forth in his study. He groaned. He had to relax.

He'd go to his bathroom and have a shave. His stubble was getting kinda hairy, and Eldonia liked her man lookin' rugged...not caveman!

...Although...

He laughed and headed into the bathroom.

Fortis filled up his shaving-scuttle from the hot-water tank, and lathered up his soap. But then he stopped.

"KOVIAC!"

"Yes sir!" said his squire.

"Where are my razors!?"

"Razors? I haven't touched them!"

Fortis sighed and headed downstairs. The housemaids were always hiding his razors. They said they liked working for a 'rougher master'. He smirked. Well...

"Eliza!" he shouted, when he saw one of the housemaids hurrying past with towels. "C'mere!"

"Yes m'lord!" said Eliza, curtsying.

"WHERE are my razors?"

"Oh, Matilda borrowed them!"

"What for?"

"To shave that boy's head!"

"To...to...she took my razors...to SHAVE his flea-ridden, lice-infested head!?"

"...Yes m'lord..."

"Oh no..." Fortis groaned. "Well clean them COMPLETELY before you put them back upstairs!"

"Yes sir!"

Eliza hurried into the kitchen, where Dimitri's bath was done. it had taken over two hours to clean, scrub, brush, rub, cut, scrape, shave and trim all the gunk off of him, but he finally looked like a human being! Dimitri dried himself down and stood there, his whole head completely bald, his pale skin clean, his blond hair shaved off entirely!

"I feel like baby!" he said, staring at himself as he wrapped one of the towels around his body. "What am I going to wear!?"

"Well you can't wear those old rags again!" said Mrs. Tibbs. "I burnt them! Mattie, go upstairs and find some of Master Leonardo's clothing! Perhaps he can wear that..."

"Alright!" said Matilda. "Come on Dimitri..."

Dimitri followed Matilda through the house. He stared at the heavy wood panneling, the suits of armour, the swords, the portraits, the intricately carved furniture, the paintings, and the amazing displays of wealth and power.

He hoped that he'd be allowed to live here...

"ABSOLUTELY NOT!"

"LEO VANDERSTORM! When your father says NO he means NO! And NO is exactly what is gonna happen! So NO!"

"Awwww! Please!?"

"I SAID NO!"

"Don't you worry, Leo! Mother will sort this out for you..." said Eldonia.

"I don't think you're gonna convince him of anything, mama. I mean papa's pretty BIG..."

"My dear, you're a child. There are other ways to bend the wills of men..." she said. "Give me an hour".

Eldonia entered her husband's study to find him brooding in a chair. She walked up to him, shrugging off her cloak, revealing a form-hugging dress.

"My lord..." she said softly.

Fortis looked up.

"Oh go away! I'm not in the mood! I know what you're trying to do! It ain't gonna work! Piss off!"

Eldonia moved closer. She straddled her husband's lap, feeling her buttocks resting on his tight, muscular thighs. She leaned in close, pressing herself up against his chest.

"Forty sweetheart...Why are you so angry?"

"I DO NOT want some..."

"Fortis!" said Eldonia. She lowered her voice and moved up, kissing him softly. "The boy's only eight years old! What kind of damage can he do?"

Fortis snorted.

"You are worried for nothing!" she whispered. "And at any rate. I think it's SILLY that you're worried!"

"I'M being silly!?"

"If the boy WAS a threat...I'm sure he wouldn't be a threat to YOU..." she said softly. "My big, brave Mountain protector..." she added, wrapping her arms around his colossal chest and pulling herself in.

"I don't want him in the house!"

"He doesn't have to be, darling! He can be outside!"

"Good!...Doing what?"

"He could be a farmer, or a woodcutter, or a stableboy..."

"Stable-boy?"

"Well we DO have a lot more horses now, darling. We could do with another stable-boy..."

"You think?"

"One who can handle our mares and steeds...especially the ones...which are um...in heat..."

Her left hand slipped down, rubbing her husband's impressive equipment. She squeezed it playfully.

Fortis shivered.

Eldonia grinned to herself.

"Daaaaarrrrrrling..."

She continued to kiss and grope. Fortis sighed.

"Oh alright! The boy can stay!"

Eldonia smiled. She got up, and buttoned up the front of her dress. Fortis looked disappointed. She kissed him on the cheek.

"I'll see you tonight..." she whispered. She picked up her cloak, and left the room.

"Vallius! Baltus! Get your butts out here!"

Two young men hurried out. One of them held a broom, the other one held a pair of brushes.

"M'lord!" said Vallius.

"This is Dimitri", said Fortis, pointing at the waif of a child who jogged along behind him to keep up. "He's gonna be your new assistant stable-boy".

"Yes sir!" said Vallius.

Vallius's family had served Fortis's for generations. Ever since the death of Vallius's father in a riding-accident a few years ago, and the retirement of their uncle, Vallius and Baltus did most of the horse and stabling work on the estate. Vallius doubled as coachman and groom, and Baltus did much of the general stable-boy chores, like cleaning, sweeping and feeding. He looked mighty pleased to have another set of hands on the job...Castle Vanderstorm had a large number of horses.

"Do you know anything about horses?" Baltus asked Dimitri. The boy nodded. He knew how to feed and water horses and how to clean stables, and how to house and protect them. He'd had to do that to the guards horses at the castle prison, when he lived in Vladia.

"Good", said Vallius. "Alright, I guess we can take him on", he concluded.

Fortis nodded. "Fine. Teach him good, and make sure he doesn't screw up!"

"Yes sir".

"And don't you let him anywhere NEAR Vortex until you KNOW he can handle the horses right!"

"Yes sir!"

"Good".

Fortis sighed. After this whole Dimitri Debacle, he needed a damn drink!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Good afternoon, my lord!"

"Bacchus".

Fortis sat down at the bar in the Hammer and Tongs. Bacchus the bartender and landlord stood opposite him. His bountiful daughter Ophelia smiled at the handsome Mountain lord. She swanned up to him and gave him a kiss.

"Don't do that when Lady Vanderstorm's here or she'll slap your teeth out", Fortis rumbled. He smiled and she giggled.

"Go help momma, Philly", said Bacchus.

"Okay papa", she said, and hurried away.

"She married yet?"

"No".

"Hmm. Didn't see her staying single very long..."

Bacchus chuckled. "She'll be my comfort in my old age, my lord", he said.

"Hmmm..."

"BARKEEP! I got an empty flagon! Do somethin' about it!"

Bacchus groaned.

"That's enough, Xavius! You've had your fill!"

"I SAID FILL IT UP!"

The man threw some coins over the counter. They clattered on the floor below.

Bacchus sighed. "Alright! Alright...But this better be your LAST one, Xavius!", he said, and started filling up the pewter flagon on the counter.

The bartender's muscular hands and arms flexed. He reached under the counter for a heavy wooden club that he kept for instances like this. Fortis knew from experience that Bacchus was well-capable of dealing with any drunkards in his bar.

"That guy's been driving me nuts..." said Bacchus.

"Who is he?" Fortis asked.

"His name's Xavius. You probably haven't seen him much".

"Probably not if he moved here when I was out at war".

"You know, I think he did. During that long stretch when you weren't around..."

Fortis groaned. He remembered. Year after year away from home travelling the country on military duties. If not for the fat sacks of gold that the king paid him, he wouldn't have bothered spending so much time away from home and family.

"He sounds like a pain in the ass", said Fortis.

Bacchus sighed. "You could say that..."

"What's he do?"

"Do? I have no damn idea! He comes in, he sits at the bar...if he sits there any longer, his ass is gonna grow onto the stool!"

Fortis laughed.

"BARKEEP!"

"Oh for the love of sulphur and brimstone...Xavius I said that's ENOUGH!"

"Fuck you!"

Fortis groaned. He got to his feet and lumbered over.

"Listen buddy, the bartender here's a good buddy of mine. I don't like hearin' him bein' mouthed off to. You gonna apologise and you gonna get the heck out of his bar right now!"

"You and what army!?"

The games of cards, chess, and dice, the conversations and debates, the meals and drinks all stopped when a heavy, meaty thud echoed through the bar. Villagers all looked up from their tables and benches to see the man Romulus, a fat, beer-bellied individual who looked like he hadn't shaved in a month, flat on his back on the ground. Blood dribbled down from a fat lip where Fortis had punched him in the face.

"These armies!" Fortis said. raising up his thick biceps and triceps, balling his fists, shifting back and forth on his feet.

Xavius grunted and got to his feet, spitting blood. He looked kinda dizzy. He could barely stand up! He held onto the bar and Fortis lowered his fists.

"Fuck you too!" he swore.

Whack!!

It sounded like that noise when Mrs. Tibbs was busy tenderising chicken to make schnitzels for dinner. A heavy, wet, meaty thudding sound. The man doubled over in agony and collapsed on the ground!

This time, he didn't get up.

"You...you!" Fortis said, pointing to two of Bacchus's sons. "Get that piece of shit outta here. I don't like havin' my beer interrupted!"

The two young men eagerly grabbed the unconcious drunk by the arms and legs and carried him out.

"One..."
"...Two..."

The two brothers looked at each other.

"Three!"

The passed-out drunk was chucked into the street.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"It's appalling!"
"He is SO RUDE!"
"And he smells!"
"He threw up on me last time I was here!"
"Eugh!"
"Yeah that's why I haven't mentioned it before now..."
"He fondles Bacchus's daughter!"
"Hey we all fondle Bacchus's daughter..."
"Yeah but...Well she don't like it when this guy does it!"
"She thinks he's a sleeze-bag!"
"She and half the town!"

"Guys, guys!" Fortis shouted, trying to silence the shouts of protest. "Listen I know I've been busy, I haven't been keeping up with local gossip. Who is this shitbag?"

"His name's Xavius! He moved into some cottage in the woods between here and the castle, on the Western Road, I think..." said the village cooper.

"That little shit-hole!? That's not a cottage, it's a box with a fireplace!"

Everyone laughed.

"Does he have family?" Fortis asked.

"We dunno", said another man. "He must have something, because he brings it here all the time and blows it on booze!"

"I think he goes hunting!"

"Hunting!? How the heck does he kill anything!? Every time I see him, he can hardly stand up, let alone swing a sword! Hell, he'd probably chop off his own head!"

Roars of laughter exploded through the tavern.

Fortis sighed. The Vanderstorm family had held the title of Earl of Dynamos for generations. It was a title of extreme privilege and prestige. But one which came with large responsibilities. It wasn't just a matter of swanning around and acting rich and powerful - the king expected certain services in return for his fortunes and favours. And if such services weren't provided, Fortis's family could lose their privileged position...

Fortis's duties were numerous. He was the local judge and magistrate, the local justice and keeper of the King's Peace. He was expected to uphold and enforce all the laws of the land, and punish those who had broken them. He was expected to collect taxes in coin and grain and food or livestock, and was expected to keep an eye on all lesser lords and knights within his realm. His long list of titles was impressive, but they also commanded respect. But respect had to be earned. Earned, in this case, by dealing with troublesome drunks...

"I suppose you wish for me to handle him".

"WE can handle him!" said one of the angry villagers. There were shouts of agreement.

"Then why haven't you?"

"Well...we wanted things to be done...the right way. You're our...representative in these matters, Lord Vanderstorm. It's YOUR job to deal with it...as you see fit. And if how you see fit should result in Xavius...departing this life in a sudden and abrupt manner...I'm sure there would not be anyone here who would say that it was not in self-defense on your part..."

Again, there were murmurs of agreement.

"...although, I think the king would be suspicious of you having to legitimately defend yourself against anyone..."

"Not necessarily, Mr. Von Pann!" said another regular at the bar. "Xavius is usually drunk! He'd probably take on Lord Vanderstorm anyway!"

People shouted in agreement.

"Alright!" said Fortis. "Where's this flea-bag live?"

Flaming torches let out wisps of white smoke and men armed with pitchforks, axes, swords and daggers marched down the road, led by a towering giant wielding a fearsome blade before him.

"Is THAT where he lives?"

'That' was a tiny hovel. It was three, maybe four rooms, with a slate roof, stone and wood walls, and a few tiny windows. There was a wood-pile and a rusty axe out on the porch, and that was it. Inside, everyone could hear screaming, shouting and the crashing of something heavy.

"Sounds like there's at least two people in there..." said Fortis. "Come on!"

The crowd of angry villagers approached porch and front door. Fortis stepped forwards and slammed his fist against the door, beating on it with such force, the simple door-knocker made out of an old horse-shoe rattled loudly!

"XAVIUS! GET YOUR ASS OUT HERE RIGHT NOW!"

"Fuck you! Who is it that orders me thus!?"

"YOUR LORD AND MASTER ORDERS THEE THUS, DAMN YOU! IN THE KING'S NAME PRESENT YOURSELF AT ONCE!"

When his order was not met with a response, Fortis grabbed the door and ripped it off its hinges, throwing it to the ground! Inside, a woman screamed, huddled in the corner with three children. One of them was holding something in his hand. Broken plates were everywhere. Outside, the villagers waited to see what might happen...

Glass shattered! Wood splintered! A man tumbled out of the house and sprawled on the grass, blood running from a fat lip! The crowd stepped back as Fortis exited. His already gigantic frame looking twice as large again. He easily hoisted Xavius into the air, a good twelve feet!

Before anyone could stop him, Fortis slammed Xavius into the nearest tree, over, and over, and over again! It took six grown men to force their lord to relinquish his prize. Fortis eventually dropped Xavius onto the ground, an unconscious, bloody heap.

"What did you find in the house, my lord?" one of the villagers asked.

"You can come out!" Fortis shouted.

Emerging from the house were four figures. A woman, young. In her mid-twenties, perhaps. And three children. A boy about eight, another boy about five, and a girl about two or three years old. The oldest boy carried what looked like a broken kitchen-knife in his hands.

"Okay kid, you can put that thing down", said Fortis. The children huddled around their mother, who stared about herself, fearfully.

"Go on!" Fortis shouted. "Back to the village!"

The villagers slowly dispersed, all hissing and talking to each other in half-tones.

"Well..." said Fortis, staring at the girl. And at the three children. "What ARE we going to do with you, then?"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis stared at the sobbing girl on the ground. She looked very young. Maybe twenty. Twenty-five at her oldest. She had three children, a girl, about two, a boy, probably a year or two older, and another child, probably seven or eight. The boy seemed to be trying to comfort his mother who appeared to be having some manner of mental breakdown. He sighed, his huge chest rising and falling slowly.

"Are you alright?" he asked as softly as he knew how. He got slowly to his knees. The woman shrieked and batted his hands away when he reached out for her.

"It's alright..." he said softly. She shrieked and kept crying! Fortis grabbed her forcefully, holding her arms back, then slowly relaxed, and held her. She exploded into tears and started sobbing against his chest and shoulders. Fortis rubbed her back gently, trying to help her calm down. The woman babbled something completely insensible to Fortis, and continued to cry. His grip tightened and he rubbed her slowly, in firm, pressing circles.

"It's okay, it's okay..." he said.

A horse whinneyed. Fortis turned to see a large, chestnut steed galloping towards him. On top was a buff young man with blond hair of a similar length and shade to his own. The rider approached and then dismounted.

"Well, cousin. Keeping the damsel in distress all to yourself, huh!?"

"Oh shut up, Cal..."

The sight of the two tall, handsome strangers seemed to buck the girl up a bit. Perhaps she felt so silly crying in such alluring company. Perhaps she wanted to seem like more of a mother.

"S-s-s-say t-t-thank-thank you t-to the n-nice man, L-Lucius..." she sobbed. The oldest boy, with black hair nervously approached Fortis. He held out what Fortis now recognised as a small kitchen-knife, and threw it into the ground, point-down. Fortis smiled and hugged the boy.

"Hey Lucius", he said. "You and your mother alright now, huh? And your brother and sister?"

Lucius nodded. The younger boy toddled forwards

"Lucywuss...Wussah gunna happennah pappa?"

"It's okay, your papa's not gonna do anything anymore", said Fortis.

"Yeah! That's cause he's dead!" said Excalibur. The woman shrieked!

Excalibur was bent over the body of Xavius on the ground. He whistled loudly.

"Daaaamn cuz. You got ANG-GRY! I think you bashed his nose halfway through his head! You nearly chopped the whole fucking tree down beating his teeth into the fucking thing!"

"Cal! Don't swear!" Fortis hissed.

"Huh!? Oh yeah...gotcha...C'mon lady, let's back to the castle..."

"You take her", said Fortis. "I'll handle the kids".

"Gotcha".

"And NO FUNNY BUSINESS on the way!"

"Hey cuuuuz! Ain't my fault she gonna find me all tall and dashing and..."

"...and a failed knight? Yeah that's a real allure".

Excalibur snorted, lifted the woman up and hauled her onto his horse.

--- --- --- ---

"Oh my lord!"

Mrs. Tibbs' hands flew to her mouth when she saw Fortis and Excalibur enter the castle.

"What happened!?"

In very few words, Fortis explained.

"Oh dear! Oh dear, oh dear, oh dear! And children, as well! Take them upstairs, my lord! I'll come up presently!"

"Alright", said Fortis. "C'mon Excalibur...Cal?"

"C'mon lady, I'll take you up to MY room..."

"EXCALIBUR VANDERSTORM! YOU'LL TAKE HER TO THE GUEST-ROOM AND NOWHERE ELSE!"

"Sheeessshh! Fine! Spoil-sport..."

--- --- --- ---

"This is appalling!" said Athena.

"Grandma I really wish you would've stayed in your ROOM!"

"Certainly not! EVERYTHING that happens in this castle is MY concern!"

"Even when it's MY concern?"

"ESPECIALLY when it is YOUR concern! Move aside! Oh dear! Just look at her hands! And her face! And..."

Athena clucked disapprovingly. "What a beast! I DO hope that you arrest the man!"

"Oh he can't, grandma. He's gotta build his coffin, first", said Excalibur, who was busy looking over the children in the guest-room.

"FORTIS!"

"Things got a bit out of hand..."

"Yeah, he slammed him repeatedly against a tree-trunk..."

Mrs. Tibbs entered the guest-room with some bottles.

"Here you are, m'lady".

"Thank you, Mrs. Tibbs! We'll give them all a bit of this in their drinks", said Athena. "It'll dull the pain and knock them out for a bit. Let them sleep! Once they're ready, they can come down and eat dinner".

"Right", said Fortis.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Her head ached. Her joints screamed and her stomach rumbled.

The girl was young. Twenty-one. But already with a seven-year-old boy and two other children. Her story was hardly enviable, but one, she suspected, was hardly rare, either. She groaned and opened her eyes. Where was she...?

She sat bolt-upright in bed, panting! She stared around.

She was in a large, whitewashed room. The floor was heavy wood, and the walls were paneled and painted. The outer walls were stone. There was a fireplace in the corner, with a fire burning in it. Sleeping in a cot were her two youngest children, and snoozing away in a chair by the window, was her oldest son.

What had happened?

She tried to remember. Her husband coming home in a furious rage. Drunk to the gills and reeking of stale beer. Not that he didn't always reek of stale beer...shouting...screaming...then a lot of noise...then a long ride...she had been semi-conscious for so long, she had forgotten almost everything that had happened!

Slowly, she got out of bed. She yelped! She hadn't realised she was completely naked! She stared around and saw clothes draped over the back of a chair. She pulled on the various layers of the simple garments left out for her, which fitted her surprisingly well, and then tiptoed out of the room.

The castle was enormous. Enormous and grand. Dark, heavy stone and oak, and intricate, leadlight windows were everywhere. Tapestries hung off the walls, and suits of towering armour were everywhere. Judging by the coats of arms and swords, she had found herself in the house of someone extremely important!

Slowly, she crept downstairs. She heard noises coming from some chamber down the corridor. She stopped at the ground floor and turned right. She headed along the corridor and then peeked around the corner of a huge pair of doors into the chamber beyond.

Candles and torches burned brightly. Several people were seated around an enormous dining-table laden with food.

At one end, a towering giant of a man sat with a woman in his lap, who giggled and blushed. He fondled her roughly and pulled her close. Children nearby made faces of disgust. An older woman chided the hunk, who simply smirked and teased the woman's hair, which made her laugh.

Further down the table, two younger men chatted with each other. And at the chair closest to the doors sat another impressively-sculpted Mountanian specimen.

"Nutmeg! Come back!"

Sapphire hopped off her chair and jogged after her runaway pet rabbit! She ran to the doors and scooped it up.

"Bad Bunny! You sh-YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!"

Fortis choked!

"Sapphy! Don't scream!"

Excalibur whirled around in his chair. He smirked.

"Heeeey!" he said, getting up. "Look everybody! Someone woke up!"

The girl gasped and backed away into the shadows, but Excalibur grabbed her and pulled her into the room! Sapphire ran back to her father, cradling her pet rabbit for comfort!

"It's okay honey, you don't have to be scared", said Fortis. He got to his feet, disentangled the clamoring hands of his eager wife, and stepped around the side of the table.

"Good evening, ma'am", he said. "Welcome to Castle Vanderstorm".

"H-Hello..." she said. Her voice was very soft and meek. It was like audible silk.

"You're cute!" said Excalibur, shifting her body around to look at her. Fortis grabbed his cousin's arm and with considerable force, twisted his wrist off her shoulders.

"You'll excuse my cousin Excalibur. He's under delusions of grandeur. He thinks he's a famous womaniser...EXCALIBUR SIT DOWN!"

"Awwww...Spoil-sport..."

"My name is Lord Vanderstorm", Fortis said. "And this is my family. You will stay with us until you are better", he said firmly. The girl nodded.

"Oh get away from her!" said Athena, hurrying forwards, "Useless men! Come along here, darling! Sit down and have something to eat! What is your name, my dear?"

"H-Harriet!" she gasped, and sat down, her joints still all stiff and achy.

"It's very nice to meet you", said Athena. "Mrs. Tibbs! Bread, meat and cheese for the young lady! And a stiff drink!"

"Yes m'lady!"

"Well, Harriet. You and your children will stay with us until you are all quite better. And then his lordship will help you set your life in order. Won't you, my darling Fortis?"

"Yes grandmother", said Fortis. Harriet watched as the towering beast knelt beside the old woman and fondled her lovingly, and then kissed her on the cheek. She giggled.

"Oh Fortis! Not now!" she said. But Fortis refused to listen. She laughed and kissed him back. Then, Fortis moved away.

Harriet had never been part of a loving home. So she felt rather overwhelmed seeing all the people here interacting with each other in the way which they did. She thought that big, young hunk who had handled her when she entered the hall was kinda...kinda cute... He certainly had a very playful nature about him, she could tell that. The other big boy seemed more serious. He was older and more battle-worn, and seemed to have settled down more. Harriet slowly started eating what had been placed before her...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"This is Vortex. He's Lord Vanderstorm's horse. This is Nightwind, that's Master Excalibur's horse. These two are Dynamo and Fireball, they belong to Lord Jupiter and Lord Cannius. This is Lightning, he's Lord VonGewalt's horse. These six horses here are for the carriages and coaches and stuff. These are spares over here. This is Sunflower, she's old Lady Athena's horse. This is Daisy, she's Lady Vanderstorm's horse..."

Dimitri felt dizzy trying to remember all the horses! There were so many of them! Riding horses, driving horses, spare horses...it seemed like every member of the Vanderstorm family had a horse!

The stables were huge, wood and stone structures. They consisted of the horse-stalls, feed-stores and hay-lofts, and the stablehands' quarters, where Dimitri found out, he would have to live!

The stablehands' quarters were not luxurious by any stretch of the imagination. A cold stone floor, four beds, a table, four chairs, a fireplace with a hob grate, some chests and boxes for storage...and that was about it. It was a far, far cry from Leonardo Vanderstorm's bedroom up at the castle!

Dimitri supposed that he should be thankful, either way. At least it was clean and comfortable!

"Through here are all the carriages", said Vallius. He led Dimitri into another huge building which had all sorts of vehicles parked inside it. There was a trap, a wagon, a large, stately-looking official carriage, and a few other smaller vehicles, like dog carts and such.

"Where do I eat?" Dimitri asked.

"All the lord's servants eat in the servants' hall and kitchen at the castle", said Vallius, "That's where you'll eat. Three times a day. Breakfast, lunch and dinner. Any other eating you want, you'll have to buy or pay out of whatever wages you get, whenever you go into town".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Mrs. Tibbs stared up at the broad, chiseled form of her employer as he shrugged off his cloak and hung it on a peg.

"My lord!" said the fat, homely Fatlantean housekeeper, "A letter arrived for you, while you were out!"

"Hmm!" Fortis grunted. He was still not convinced about the Dimitri boy.

"I...I put it upstairs! On the desk in your study".

"Mmm. When's dinner?"

"Five o'clock as usual, my lord!"

"Good".

The imposing Mountain lord entered his study and stared at the letter on the desk. He broke the seal and unfolded the document.

"To...Lord Sir Fortis M. Vanderstorm, 9th Earl of Dynamos, yadda-yadda-yadda...Sir, I have heard from such-and-such that you helped him in whatever...and...hmm...uh-huh...WHAT!?"

The study door opened.

"OUT!"

"Fortis!..."

"I SAID GET OUT!"

"Don't YELL like that! You'll wake up the girls! And I just got them down for their nap! Now what are you screaming about!?"

Eldonia hurried up to her husband and took the letter from him. Fortis grumbled.

"Mr. VanStaal wants you to take in his son?"

"He says he heard that I took in Lord DeJaeger's boy to straighten him out! And now he wants me to do the same thing with HIS boy! Like I run some sort of fucking reform-school or something!"

"Oh darling! You're doing wonders with Jaxxon!"

"He's not a problem child! He's just...he just needs inspiration! That's all I'm doing! He's a smart kid! Not some hopeless idiot!"

"I'm sure this other boy can't be that bad!"

"Have you ever MET Kannon VanStaal?"

"Em...Hmm...eh...I don't think so..."

"Trust me, if you met him, you wouldn't forget him! The kid's a nightmare!"

"How come YOU know him?"

"I met his father when I was in Ferramount last time, and that brat of a son was with him!"

"Sweetheart. You DO have a way with people...maybe you can help?"

"A way?"

"Well...you are tall...handsome...cute...sssssexy..."

"He's a BOY, you crazy woman! Not a milkmaid!"

"Well perhaps all the boy needs is someone to show him who's boss!? And you can do that!" said Eldonia, moving aside as her husband stood up. "After all you're tall and strong and...commanding...powerful..." she gulped. "...Dominating..."

Fortis pinned his wife easily to the nearest wall.

"The only thing I wanna be dominating is your sex-life".

Elonia trembled at the very thought.

"Aww look at you! I need your help to get something down from the attic!"

"I'll need to come with you", she said. Athena headed upstairs, her grandson following him. Jupiter sneezed. It was very dusty up here. He held a lamp in one hand. Athena pointed to a large, old trunk near the head of the stairs. It looked very dusty.

"What's that?" he asked.

"Take it downstairs and put it in my bedroom", Athena said.

"Sure grandma...here's the lamp..."

Athena held the lamp, and Jupiter got down on his knees. He hoisted the trunk up in his arms. The trunk itself was fairly heavy, but he could tell that whatever was inside didn't seem to be much. He carried it downstairs and into his grandmother's bedroom.

"What's in this thing?"

Athena took out a key from a drawer in her dressing-table.

"The family jewels!" she said, approaching the chest.

"I thought that's what us boys have, grandma!" said Fortis, coming in with his wife. "What's going on?"

"Boys!" Athena sighed. Eldonia giggled. "What's in there, grandma?' she asked.

Athena lifted the lid on the trunk, and shook off some old linen sheets. Then, she reached in and pulled out beautiful glittering sets of jewellery. Eldonia gasped!

"Oh wow!"

Athena held up a glittering white gold and diamond tiara, with matching earrings and necklace, some rings, a brooch, a few pins and other assorted jewellery. They gleamed and sparkled in the candlelight.

"Gran they're so pretty!" said Eldonia. "I didn't know you had so much!"

"So much?"

"Well I mean, along with all the other jewels you have..."

"Other!? Girl! Those aren't jewels!"

"...Aren't they?"

"Certainly not! They're fake! They're all glass! I'd never wear anything but the best for a really special occasion!" she chided. "I wear costume jewellery most of time! But Minerva's coming, and we have a royal visit!...And I expect ALL OF YOU to look your best!"

"Hey grandma, can I go naked?" Excalibur shouted from the hallway.

"CERTAINLY NOT!"

"You said look my best..."

Eldonia squealed with laughter and Fortis chuckled. Jupiter sniggered.

"I hope you'll let me wear some of that, grandma!" said Eldonia. She picked up some of the jewellery and examined it. Her heart was set on a beautiful sapphire brooch.

"Some of this will go to you when I am gone", said Athena. "And some will go to Minerva. And some will go to the girls".

"Oh grandma, I was gonna have somethin' special made for the girls...when they're old enough", said Fortis. "I was gonna have jewellery made for them!"

"Oh Forty you're so sweet!" said Eldonia. "But they should have something special from their great-grandmother..."

Eldonia lifted up the glittering diamond tiara.

"Oh it's so beautiful..."

"That was a wedding-present from YOUR great-grandmother, when I was married", said Athena, staring at Fortis and Jupiter. "Isn't it stunning?"

Fortis picked up the tiara and carefully put it on his wife's head.

"It's too glittery for me!" Eldonia said. "But it's very pretty!"

"You can wear the necklace!" said Athena. "I'll wear the tiara".

"Hey uh, there's nothin' else in there, is there? You ain't got like a diamond-studded cock-ring or somethin'..."

"EXCALIBUR! REALLY!"

"Alright, just kiddin'..."

"Oh get outta here before you give granny a heart-attack!" Fortis grumbled.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Athena digs out the family jewels for the ball....

Kannon slowly improves while living at Castle Vanderstorm.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Excalibur smirked and headed back to his bedroom. Fortis left his wife to drool over a different sort of family jewels, and headed to the library. He sat down in his chair by the fire and took up a book to read.

Someone knocked on the door.

"Come!"

Mrs. Tibbs entered. She curtsied.

"Ah! Mrs. Tibbs. How are the preparations?"

"They're going very well, my lord! I have a visitor!"

Fortis frowned and stared at the towering longcase clock standing against the wall.

"Visitor? NOW?"

"Yes sir! He said you sent for him!"

"Did I? I don't think so".

"Something about music for the ball?"

"Oh! Right! Yes, yes, yes, send him in! And perhaps bring up some sandwiches and something hot to drink!"

"Yes m'lord! Right away...in here!"

A man about five feet, nine inches entered, removed a feathered cap, and bowed.

"Eventide to thee, Good Master Vanderstorm!" said the man, in a quaint, old-fashioned manner of speech.

"Good evening, Eldred".

"I am not Eldred. I am Isaiah. Eldred my father is not with us any longer..."

"Sorry?"

"He is to the clouds, my lord".

"He...Oh! Oh I'm sorry...I liked Eldred..."

"And he you, my lord. We recieved thy missive as left to us in our usual camping grounds, at the far end of thy estate, my lord".

"Yes, yes, quite right..."

Mrs. Tibbs entered with sandwiches and hot chocolate.

"Thanks Mrs. Tibbs, just here in front of the fire...Sit down, Isaiah".

The man sat down, and helped himself to the hot chocolate.

"I hope the rest of your troupe...gang...family...band...whatever! Is um...is alright?"

"Very much, my lord! And we have considered your message. I come to ask for more information".

"Yeah sure...My sister the Crown Princess and her husband will be visiting here in a week. We wondered if you would agree to provide some of the entertainment for the ball and banquet that we have".

"Indeed, your lordship?"

"Oh you know! Music, fire-breathing, sword-swallowing, knife-throwing! Stuff like that!"

The man blushed. "Thou thinkst our skills are so high?"

"Well aren't they?"

"We aim to please his lordship, who hath shown us such kindness. It would be our honour to entertain at thy gathering. But my brethren and I ask what compensation?"

"Well, free food and drink. And whatever charity we can provide", Fortis said. He knew that the Valleyans lived on casual work and charitable donations. They mostly lived off the land.

"I shall hold counsel with my brethren and sisters", said the leader of the troupe. He got up and bowed. Fortis nodded. "Alright Isaiah. You come back sometime within this week to let me know what you decide on, okay?"

Isaiah nodded. "I will, my lord. Good evening!"

"Goodnight".

"Forty! What do you think!?"

Eldonia entered the library. She wore a glittering, V-shaped diamond necklace, that ended in a beautiful pendant shaped like a star, that nestled between her generous breasts.

"Oh...oh...oh my...Oh that's very pretty..."

"You think so!?" she gasped, and hurried up to him, standing before him and staring up. Fortis stared down.

"Oh yeah. Very nice. And the necklace ain't bad, either..."

"FORTY!"

Fortis laughed and hugged his wife. "Nah you look pretty, woman! Move back! Go on!"

Eldonia took a few steps back. Fortis nodded.

"That's pretty..."

He moved forwards and lifted her up and into his arms.

"You're pretty".

He kissed her and she squealed. She hugged him back, her arms wrapping around his neck, chest and shoulders, feeling his hot breath on her cheek. She sniffed and kissed him and squeezed him. Or squeezed him as best as she could...which was nowhere near as best as Fortis could, giving his wife a spine-crushing hug!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The head of the gypsy band visits the castle th...

choices: Lady Athena and Mrs. Tibbs examine the family silver.
Leonardo and Jaxxon ride into town.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Fooooorty..."

"Mmmm?"

"Who's Lucius?"

"Huh!?"

Eldonia was leaning over her husband's huge desk, reading a copy of the guest-list for next week.

"Lucius & Atlas Wolvenberg", she read.

"Oh they're old fightin' buddies...they live a few miles away...You've MET Atlas haven't you?"

"Is he that cute boy with the blond hair?"

Fortis simmered. Eldonia laughed! "Oh darling don't be jealous!" she hissed. "I love YOU!" she whispered. She reached down between his legs. "And there's PLENTY to love...plenty..."

Fortis circled the names.

"Well, they're coming..."

"Who's Wolfram...Excelsior...Vuurden?" she asked, trying to read her husband's handwriting.

"An old friend. Very old. I think he's your father's age..."

"I RESENT THAT!"

Eldonia squeaked and sat up! Lord VonGewalt entered, his twin granddaughters in his arms.

"Wussah maddah gwanpa?" Ruby asked.

"YOUR FATHER seems to think I'm nothing but a wrinkled up old cripple!"

The girls giggled.

"Oh papa! Forty doesn't think that at ALL!" said Eldonia. "DO YOU?"

"Sure not!" said Fortis.

"Whussah papa doin'?" Ruby asked, leaning over the desk.

"C'mere girl!" said Fortis, grabbing Ruby and giving her a kiss. "Papa's deciding who's coming to the party next week!"

"Are lots of people coming, then?" Venatarius asked, looking at the list.

"Quite a few", said Fortis. "I'm inviting the villagers as well. It may not be the KING, but royalty is royalty, and they should have a chance to meet the Crown Prince".

"I always thought you didn't LIKE Cassius..." said Eldonia.

"I'm jealous and protective".

"In other words, you don't like the idea of another man taking care of Minerva because you think it means that you're not big and strong enough to take care of her yourself, and they wouldn't do such a good job as you?"

Fortis blushed.

"Well...?"

"...No".

"Oh Fortis you were always a terrible liar!" said Eldonia. She giggled. "Come along, girls! Let's go see what Mrs. Tibbs is preparing!"

Venatarius sat down next to Fortis. He chuckled. "It's good that you are what you are, Fortis", he said. "A wife needs to know that her husband protects her. And a father needs to know that his daughter is in capable hands".

"Yes sir", said Fortis.

"Oh you're NOT inviting the VonEisenwald triplets, are you!?"

"Sure! Why not? They're funny..."

"You know last week they started a brawl at the Hammer and Tongs. Bacchus was extremely upset!"

"That was NOT their fault! Besides, Bacchus should know to keep the shutters closed to stop the windows from being broken!"

"Fooortis..."

"They're good people!" Fortis grumbled. "Besides, they're funny. If nothing else, they'll keep the maids entertained".

"Oh I'm sure they will...very 'entertained' indeed..."

"Oh come on, grandpa! They're not that bad!"

Venatarius grunted and left the room.

"Papa, papa! Can my friends come to the party too!?"

Fortis looked up. Leo jogged into the room.

"Good afternoon, son", said Fortis. "What's that?"

"I want my friends to come to the party!"

Fortis frowned. "What friends?"

"Well, you know, the kids of the local minor lords and knights, the boys in the village..."

"They'll all be there".

"Wow really!?"

"Well I invite entire families when I can, my lad. Not everyone gets to meet the heir to the throne and his beautiful wife".

"Eeew!"

"You don't think your Aunt Minerva is the most beautiful lady in the kingdom?"

"Weeeell..."

Fortis laughed. "Go on, scram! I'll sort out your friends, you don't worry about that..."

"Thanks, papa!"

"You can stay for the dinner, but once the ball starts, you all go upstairs and play in the nursery".

"The NURSERY!? Aww pops! I'm not THREE!"

"Well the younger kids will be going to bed right after dinner", said Fortis. "Your brothers and your sisters. I'll let YOU stay up with your friends. But don't make so much noise you wake up the kids or you're putting them back to bed, got that?"

"Yes papa!"

"Alright then".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"I want these tureens. And these platters...These candelabrum for the dining-room..."

"Yes m'lady..."

"This chiller for the champagne...and this font for the hot chocolate..."

"Yes m'lady..."

"And I want the carving-trolley as well!"

"The carving-trolley, m'lady?"

"Certainly! I want the main roast to be presented on that!"

"Ah! Yes of course, m'lady! You writing all this down, Emily?"

"Yes Mrs. Tibbs!...What's the carving-trolley?"

Lady Athena entered the silver-store and came out pushing a large, solid silver trolley with a large platform and platter on top, with a huge, domed lid. It sparkled.

Emily whistled.

"That was a gift from my husband's father when we were married!" said Athena. She beamed. "Isn't it beautiful? You best take VERY good care of this, Mrs. Tibbs!"

"I shall! It's very handsome!"

"And I'll want the best silverware, and the best crystal. And make sure that the decanters and bottles and glasses are all washed!"

"Yes, m'lady! And fresh candles?"

"Absolutely!"

"Very good, madam! I'll speak to His Lordship about the wine..."

"Oh good heavens don't do that! Fortis would insist on everyone drinking BEER! Speak to Lord VonGewalt about that. He knows more!"

"Very good, m'lady! I'll do that!"

"Excellent! Eliza! Are all those guestrooms cleaned and prepared?"

"Yessum!" said Eliza, curtsying.

"Wonderful!"

choices: Upstairs, the Vanderstorm kids play.
Downstairs, the adults go into the dining-hall for the banquet.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis brushed his hair down and strode around his bedroom, naked, apart from slippers and his undershorts. He pulled on a pair of breeches and then a tunic and doublet. He tied the red and gold sash of his knightly order around his shoulders and torso and then opened a cabinet in the wall, to take out his medals and decorations, which he pinned to his sash and tunic. He wrapped a belt around his waist and buckled it in place, before selecting a gleaming ceremonial sword. He hooked it in place and stared at himself in the mirror. He sighed. Something was missing...

Someone knocked at his door.

"Come in!"

Eldonia glided in, wearing a sky-blue, floor-length ball-gown, dripping with diamonds and gold and sapphires. She was wearing that moon-and-stars necklace with the pendant at the end that sat so comfortably between her breasts. Fortis cleared his throat. He nodded.

"You look very nice".

Eldonia blushed. She turned around and smiled. "I tried to wear grandma's tiara, but it doesn't fit", she said. "So she'll wear it instead".

"I feel all weird!" said Fortis.

Eldonia smiled. She stared at her husband's outfit, which was black, gold and dark, royal red.

"I think it's beautiful!"

"Yeah! But it's not complete!"

Eldonia hurried to her husband's wardrobe and peeked inside.

"How about...No...Oooh!...No!...Oooh! Oh yes...Come here!"

Fortis stared at his wife.

"Noooo!"

"Yes! Come on!"

"I...I..."

"You'll look so dashing!"

Fortis SERIOUSLY doubted this, but he lumbered towards his wife anyway. She threw the garment in the air and caught it, wrapping the long cloak around her husband's back, arms and chest. She reached up on tip-toes to do up the gold clasp and chain at the front.

"There!"

"I don't know...It's too red!"

"Oh alright fine!" she said. She turned the cloak inside out, so that the black velvet was on the outside and the red silk was inside.

"There! Oooh you look adooorable!"

Fortis shuddered.

"You've never been called adorable?"

"Not by you!"

"Well you are!" she said. "Oh I'm gonna go wear my red ballgown instead!"

Fortis groaned. WOMEN!!

"You look fine!"

"No no no! You're dressed in red and black and gold, and so I'm going to wear that wine-coloured one that I have..."

"Doesn't that mean you'll have to change your jewellery as well!?"

"Oh gosh you're right!"

"DAMN IT!!"

Eldonia giggled. "Don't worry darling! I won't delay you!"

Fortis looked at his watch. He hoped not!

At the end of the corridor emerged a vision of silver and white. Athena sparkled like a diamond.

Fortis whistled.

"Why Fortis!"

"You look nice, grandma", he said.

"Oh I do hope so! I haven't worn this gown since your parents' wedding! Do I look alright?"

"Fine, grandma, just fine..."

"Excellent!"

At the end of the corridor to the left, another door opened and the two guests of honor emerged. Fortis smiled.

"Weeeell...Hello, girl..."

Minerva giggled. "Foooorty!" she squealed.

Fortis lumbered over and stared down at his sister. "You are so...damn...cute!" he kissed her between words. Behind his sister, Cassius emerged.

"Lord Vanderstorm".

"Your Royal Highness".

The two men shook hands. Fortis noticed his sister's belly, full and pregnant.

"Been busy, huh?"

"Well...duty calls..."

"So I see..."

"Foooorty, don't be that way!"

"Hi Uckle Forty!"

Fortis got down to greet his nephew.

"Well Ares! Look at you!"

"Ooooh! Sword papa! Sword!" Ares squeaked, trying to pull the heavy ceremonial sword out of the scabbard strapped to Fortis's waist.

"Careful son!" said Cassius. Fortis got up and whipped the sword out! The blade whistled past the tyke's head, whipping off a tuft of hair!

"Wooooooooooooooooooow!!"

"Forty! Do be careful!"

"Relaaaax girly! I wouldn't wanna hurt the next heir to the kingdom, would I?" he asked. He kissed his nephew on the head. "Go on, kid! Go play with your cousins..."

"Okay...Tunder! Gabbywell! Awez wanna play hideyseek!"

Fortis and Minerva giggled as they watched the toddler rush away to find his cousins.

With the family assembled, they headed downstairs. Eldonia put her arm around her husband's. Athena went down with Lord VonGewalt, and the three bachelors of the family followed behind.

"Is that ALL you're wearing?" said Jupiter, noticing Excalibur's bare chest.

"Sure!"

"GO UPSTAIRS AND GET DRESSED AT ONCE!" Athena snapped.

"Awwwwww...But grandma..."

"UP!" she barked, striking him on the buttocks with her walking-stick.

"Alriiiiight..."

"How do I look, papa?" said Leo, sliding down the railing. He wore black and white, and had a dagger on his side.

"Very nice, son", said Fortis. He brushed his son's hair back.

"Papa! LEAVE IT! I spent...Oh great now I gotta do it again..."

"Trying to impress a girl?"

"Well...Ophelia's gonna be here ain't she?"

"HAH! She's tooooo old for you, son!"

"So? She's cute..."

"Eh. The boy knows what he likes..."

"Fortis don't encourage him!"

Mrs. Tibbs opened the front door to the first guests. Lord and Lady DeJaeger and their dasughter.

"Hi papa!"

Bastion DeJaeger smiled.

"Jaxxon. You behaving yourself?"

"He's been a darling", said Eldonia. She curtsied. "My lord".

Bastion bowed. "Ma'am. Thank you so much for the invitation. Fortis", he added. Fortis nodded.

Karenina DeJaeger was dressed in a similar, wine-red dress, her dark brown hair flowing down her back, done up in bunches and curls. A gold amulet seemed well-protected in the crevice between her bountiful bosom. Something not lost on the younger members of the Vanderstorm family.

"Well hello there", said Excalibur. She blushed.

"Master Excalibur", she whispered.

"You and me, later".

"Oh drop dead!"

Everyone laughed.

"Cal, you gonna have a looong way to go before you get her", said Fortis.

"You just wait", said Excalibur to his cousin. "I will...I'll get her..."

Fortis sighed.

"COUSIN FORTIS!"

Fortis looked up and smiled at Wolfgang Vanderstorm and his wife Vesta.

"Eldonia darrrling!" said Vesta. She hugged her.

"Grandma", said Wolfgang, kissing his grandmother on the cheek.

"HEY LEO!"

Champion Vanderstorm and his little sister Astril raced past everyone and sprinted upstairs.

"CHAMPION! ASTRIL!! COME BACK HERE!" Wolfgang shouted.

His son and daughter skulked back downstairs, looking very embarrassed.

"WHAT DO YOU SAY?"

"Hello Uncle Fortis, Aunt Eldonia", said Champion.

"Good boy. And...?"

"Grandma...Uncle Excalibur, Uncle Jupiter, Uncle Cannius".

"AND?"

"Hello Aunt Minerva, Uncle Cassius, sir".

"And DON'T YOU FORGET IT!"

"No sir!"

"Alright, upstairs with you!"

The two children headed upstairs, looking very embarrassed.

"They grow up so fast..." said Vesta, sighing.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: A week later, the guests start arriving

choices: People start mingling during the dancing. Eldonia is fascinated by everyone.
The kids sneak downstairs to witness the ball.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Before long, the entire foyer and parlour were crowded with people. Athena moved between the crowds, shaking hands and hugging. She smiled and waved. The old woman knew almost everyone there. At least, everyone worth knowing.

The children of old friends had now grown up. What were once toddlers and youngsters were now glamorous daughters of the aristocracy, or steaming muscular hunks who had transformed themselves into guards, warriors, soldiers, knights, sailors, loggers, blacksmiths, masons, miners, professional jousting-challengers...

A gong sounded. Eldonia stood in the corridor.

"My lords, ladies and gentlemen, guests of honour, dinner is..."

"They ain't gonna see you down there, lady!" Fortis grunted. He hoisted his wife up onto his broad shoulders. Everyone laughed. She squealed and giggled.

"Dinner is served in the dining-hall! Forty put me DOWN!"

More laughter. Everyone started heading towards the dining-hall.

The usual central table had been moved. It was now up against the far wall, closest to the kitchens. Several long tables had been set up, perpendicular to the head table, and everyone took their seats. Close friends and guests of honour sat up on the high table.

"When's the baby due?" Fortis asked his sister, rubbing her pregnant belly.

"Not for another three months!" Minerva said. "Ares is all excited about another baby brother!"

"Is it going to be a boy?"

"We hope so!" said Minerva. "Don't we, Cassie?"

Cassius nodded. "Absolutely. Ares says once we make him a little brother to play with, we can have all the girls we want!"

"Champion's growing up fast!" said Fortis. "How old is he now, Wolfgang?"

"He is...fourteen! And his sister's ten. How old is Leo now?"

"Nine".

"He doesn't LOOK like he's nine!"

"Hey, he grows up fast!"

"He sure does. Champion will be my Squire soon. And once he's finished his training there, I'm enrolling him in the next knighting ceremony! And he'll be SIR Champion Vanderstorm!"

"Oh I'm sure the girls will like that!" said Minerva. "Sir CHAMPION...WOLFGANG!...Vanderstorm!"

Everyone laughed.

"Hey girl, your boy's gonna be the most eligible bachelor on this table!" said Fortis.

"HEY!" Excalibur shouted.

"His Royal Highness, Crown Prince Ares!"

"Does he have a second name?" Eldonia asked.

"Ares Dominus VanDraconis!" said Cassius. "Dominus was one of my ancestors. I like it. It's a good, strong name..."

"Not Cassius?"

"It sounds too cute!"

"Yes it does!" said Minerva, and gave her husband a kiss.

Courses of food were brought out to great applause. Peacock pie! Roast venison, venison pasties, roast goose, smoked salmon, suckling pig, bread rolls, sausages, steaks, pies and cakes! Mrs. Tibbs stood at the doorway that led down the corridor to the kitchen, as her maids filed past her.

"Mrs. Tibbs, our resident housekeeper and cook!" Fortis shouted. Everyone applauded. She waved her hands, and the housemaids exited from the kitchen, each one carrying a platter, which they paraded around the room, before putting on the tables.

"Boy we had to go huntin' for so damn long to hit those deer!" said Excalibur.

"Who hit what deer?" Fortis said. "Leo shot it from the North Tower! You didn't kill anything!"

"Upstart little kid showin' off in front of his uncle..." Excalibur grumbled.

Fortis chuckled. "Hey, the kid's a good shot, okay?" he said. "Relax!"

"What's wrong?" Eldonia whispered.

"I think Excalibur's getting a little bit of an inferiority complex going..." Fortis whispered back.

"Oh I'm sure that'll change once we get out into the ballroom! He'll probably be showing off all night!"

"I dunno about that, lady. I don't ever remember Excalibur being someone who could DANCE".

"He knows how to play the horizontal two-step..."

"Yeah and that's about it!"

Eldonia giggled. "Sweetie! Don't be so mean!"

Suddenly, trumpets flourished! Everyone turned to watch as Valleyan performers entered the dining-hall! They tumbled, juggled, threw, tossed, caught, blew fire, and swung through the air on the heavy, oak rafters in the ceiling.

"Ooooh!" said Minerva. "How wonderful!"

One acrobat flew over the head table, sprinkling flowers everywhere! People laughed and applauded loudly.

After two hours of feasting and drinking, with everyone fed and watered sufficiently for the rest of the night, and some perhaps a little too sufficiently watered, the guests sauntered, swaggered or staggered into the ballroom at the end of the corridor. Lady Athena opened the huge double doors and everyone filed in. Up in the musicians' gallery, a troupe of minstrels played a flourish as everyone entered. They had violins and trumpets, cellos, double basses, guitars, drums and even a hurdy-gurdy.

"Perhaps we can start with something slow!" said Athena. "So we don't have any...digestive incidents on the dance-floor. Perhaps a waltz..."
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Downstairs, the adults go into the dining-hall ...

choices: Feeling intimidated by Romulus's presence, Excalibur challenges him to a fight.
Romulus makes a move on Eldonia. Fortis is furious!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Eldonia! You should mingle more!" said Athena as everyone spread out around the ballroom.

"A woman's place is beside her husband!"

"Not all the time!" Athena snapped.

"Naw gramma. Sometimes, a woman's place is on top of her husband!"

Eldonia squeaked and giggled. Fortis wrapped an arm around his wife and squeezed her affectionately.

"Oh Forty! I don't know half of these people!" she said.

"Well! You know the other half..."

"Yeah but...well like...who's that?"

She pointed to a tall, slim, youngish-looking man with short brown hair.

"That's Kovan Van Dien. He's the jousting master of that boarding-school at the edge of the county..."

"And who's...THAT!?"

She pointed now to a tall, burly figure with long, dirty blond hair that went down to his shoulders, pulled back into a sort of rough ponytail. The man looked old. Fifty or sixty at least, and his hair was starting to whiten up.

"Oh!" said Fortis. He waved a hand.

The man grunted and turned around. Eldonia flinched! The man had one eye missing, half a leg gone and what she could see of his flesh was swathed in tattoos. He looked like half his mouth was devoid of teeth! He limped over on his peg-leg and crutch. He held a hip-flask in one hand.

"Evening, Cap'n!" said Fortis. He gave a salute out of habit. The older man grunted and gave a drunken salute in reply.

"I didn't know you were coming!"

"Yurr gramma done invited me...*hic!*" the grizzled old man slurred.

"Sweetheart, this is Captain Wolfried Maxillian".

The captain frowned. "Whussatcher sayin', young Forty? Who awn earth is THIS fine lady...!?"

"Captain, this is my wife. Lady..."

"WIFE!? Hot damn! Ain't no WIFE! Cute, purdy thing like you! All young an'...Mmmm! Tell me, he your papa ain't he? Big ol' boy like him...you too young for him! Hain'tcha?"

"Why captain!" said Eldonia, giggling. "Oh I think I like him!" she whispered to Fortis.

"Only because he thinks you're young and cute..."

"And you don't!?"

"Sure I do!"

The captain grasped Eldonia's hand and gave it a kiss. She blushed.

"Why thank you, captain!"

"Ma'am...AH!" he cried out, when he saw Leonardo and his friends enter the ballroom. Fortis chuckled.

"Don't be scared, kids!" he called out, "He ain't gonna hurtcha! He just acts tough..."

Eldonia turned when she heard screams and squeals emanating from one of the doorways into the ballroom. Obviously, something very fascinating to the female sex had just made quite an entrance!

"Hehehe weeeell...what's your name, sweetie?...Uh-huh? Yeah? You, me, later. But right now..."

Eldonia watched as a towering hunk lumbered through the ballroom. He was wearing almost nothing but a pair of breeches, boots and a long cloak, his bare torso, chest and arms open for all to see...and touch, by the look of things.

The minstrel band up in the gallery changed tunes. Partners took up hands.

The average height-difference between a Mountanian man and woman was considerable. But they still found ways to pair off and dance. But Eldonia had never expected to see what she did. This new stranger was dancing a slow tango with two girls at once! One in each arm. She figured when a guy was THAT big...well...

She turned to her own husband and they moved onto the dance-floor.

"Who is that!?" she hissed.

"Huh?"

She pointed. Fortis swung his wife around to look.

"He's got a dagger in his teeth!" she squealed, feeling a little hot and bothered.

"Oh! Romulus Vandenburg! His grandpa's Lord Vandenburg. They live at Ravensheart Hall. That estate in the next county..."

"Is it that big, black house with the ivy all over it?"

"That's the one!"

"Wow!"

"Would you LOOK at him!?"

Eldonia squealed and tripped over! She turned around and stared at Excalibur. He looked incredibly unhappy.

"What's wrong?"

"Just...LOOK AT HIM!"

"Oh I aaaam..." said Eldonia.

Romulus Maximilian Vandenburg was a specimen and a half.

Easily Fortis's height, he looked just as, if not even more intimidating. Broad-chested with huge shoulders, sliced abs, huge arms that bulged and flexed, tanned skin, an angular jaw and body, a face that was unshaved for at least two or three days, and longish, almost shoulder-length brown hair. When he moved, his cloak whipped up, revealing tattoos on his back. His name, in huge gothic letters, what looked like a mountain, and a snake or a dragon on top of it.

Eldonia leaned against her husband. She could feel her legs trembling a bit...

The music stopped. Romulus left the two girls he was dancing with, tottering and swaying on the lingering memory of his presence, before he lumbered across the hall. He stood in front of Fortis and bowed.

"Lord Vanderstorm, sir..." he said. His voice was deep and heavy. He looked to be in his late twenties.

Fortis nodded.

"Master Romulus".

"That's quite alright", said Fortis. "Romulus, this is my wife..."

"Hiiii!" said Eldonia, blushing a bit. Romulus bowed, grasped her hand and kissed it. She gasped!

"Oh he is wonderful!" she said.

Excalibur snorted.

"I think someone's jealous..." she whispered at her husband.

"I am NOT!" said Fortis.

"Not YOU!..." she pointed to Excalibur, who looked about ready to punch Romulus in the face!

Fortis chuckled and elbowed his cousin in the ribs.

"Feeling a bit outclassed, cousin?" he asked.

"I am NOT!"

"Suuuuuure Cal, sure..."

Minerva squeaked as her cousin shoved her aside and lumbered past! She stared at her brother with a half-angry, half-confused look on her face!

"Ignore him!" said Fortis, taking his sister by the arm. "He's just feeling inadequate!"

"I've never heard that word being used to describe a Vanderstorm boy before..." said Minerva. Eldonia erupted into giggles. She struggled to stop laughing, and then briefly explained the situation to her sister-in-law, who turned bright red and struggled not to laugh.

Whump!!

"Uh...um...y-yeah!" she said. "Sure!" she added.

Romulus put one arm on her shoulder, and then slipped under her armpit to rest on her back. Eldonia held out her other arm and he grabbed it firmly. She reached up and felt his shoulder...man he was tall!

Instead, her hand slipped down...he had a nice ass... But probably not as nice as Fortis's...

Together, they moved out onto the dance-floor in a slow waltz. Eldonia felt her body being moved around...side...to side...in a slow, dreamy, spinning circle. Suddenly, she felt something against her forehead...something moist and wet...

Suddenly, this whole dreamscape thing disappeared! She felt herself being pulled back! This was followed by a heavy, meaty thudding sound! Violins scraped and the music stopped suddenly! Eldonia spun around to see Romulus with a hand to the side of his mouth. His lip was bleeding!

"You dare to take advantage of my hospitality in this way?" Fortis asked, calmly, but loud enough for everyone to hear.

"Fortis!" said Eldonia.

"Stay out this, lady!" Fortis rumbled.

The crowd watched. But like his sister, the wife of Fortis Vanderstorm had learned toughness. It was something she had to learn when she lived in a household run by big, burly menfolk all the time.

"Forty! Don't be like this!" she said, "Lord Romulus was just being friendly!"

"Asking for a dance is being friendly. Giving you a kiss in public like that!?"

Eldonia sighed. Mountain men and their jealousies...they could be a huge turn-on, or they could be a gigantic pain in the ass...

Minerva stepped forwards, and put her arms around her brother.

"Forty..." she whispered. "You don't have to defend everyone..."

"I'm NOT defending everyone..." Fortis rumbled. "...just trying to keep the hands of that filthy horndog off my WIFE!"

Laughter rippled through the ballroom.

"Fortis, you're being silly!" said Minerva. "And Lord Romulus is a perfectly nice person! But I really think he should keep his attentions reserved to UNmarried women..."

Murmurs of agreement rolled around the room.

"So...shake hands and can we PLEASE go back to the party?"

Fortis sighed and shook Romulus's hand.

"I'll speak to you later..." Fortis rumbled. "Eldonia!" he snapped. "Here!"

Eldonia hurried to her husband's side.

"Let's dance and forget about all this crap..."

"Are you alright, sweetheart?"

Cassius sat down on a bench next to his wife. Minerva blushed. She rubbed her round, full belly. She'd been pregnant for nearly her full term, now. She was too full-up to actually dance, but she kept her husband company between rounds, and made conversation with the locals. Many of whom had commented on her current state, and her presumed addition to the royal family which grew therein.

"I...I don't feel so good!" Minerva gasped.

"What's wrong?"

"Well...well I..." she gasped. She gritted her teeth. "Oh gosh!"

Cassius turned around. He saw all the men doing a traditional Mountanian sword-dance, while the women clapped and cheered. Others swarmed around bottles of wine or slices of bread and butter and oil, sweet buns and other desserts and snacks.

"Are you feeling unwell?"

"I...I think it's coming!" Minerva gasped. She felt the same tightness, cramping and discomfort that she had when Ares was born. "Cassius I think it's coming! It's coming now!"

"Coming now!? Oh gosh...um..."

"F-find my grandmother!...And Fortis! And...And..."

Fortis edged his way through the dancing crowds. He stared around, standing head-and-shoulders above most of the others there. He frowned when he spotted his sister lying on one of the benches. He strode over and stared down at her.

"Girl, what are you doin' lyin' down when you should be sitting up entertaining people with your...what's wrong?"

Minerva gasped and gritted her teeth. "F-forty! Y-you're about to have another niece or nephew!"

"Uh-huh...WHAT!?"

Fortis's last word exploded through the room like a bomb going off! The valleyan minstrels stopped their playing and everyone turned to watch.

"Oh gosh!" Fortis spluttered. "Hold on! C'mere girl!" he said. He hoisted his sister into his arms.

"Hey! I'm her husband! I carry her outta here!" Cassius started.

"This is MY damn castle! And I will carry her outta here!" Fortis shouted back. Some people laughed.

"Forty, what's going on?" Eldonia asked. Minerva let out a groan!

"Ooooh..." said Eldonia. She'd given birth to six...she knew the signs! She hurried away.

"Mrs. Tibbs! We need towels! And hot water! And a knife! And string!..."

Fortis carried his sister upstairs and into the guestroom where she was staying with Cassius. He lowered her onto the bed and went to get some pillows.

"It's okay, sweetie!" said Cassius, kneeling by the bed. "It's just a baby!"

Minerva gasped as another cramping contraction shot through her body! Her hands clasped onto whatever she could find with surprising strength! Fortis returned and put the pillows around her body and under her back. Mrs. Tibbs came rushing upstairs!

"It's alright, my lady!" she said.

"Actually, it's your..." Cassius began.

"OH SHUT UP CASSIUS THIS ISN'T THE TIME FOR PROTOCOL!" Minerva shrieked. Fortis burst out laughing.

"AND YOU SHUT UP TOO!"

Fortis and Cassius both collapsed against a wall laughing. Athena and Eldonia hurried in to help!

"Easy now!" said Athena. "Deep breaths!"

"Oh all you useless men get out of here!" Athena snapped.

"Where's Ares?" Leo asked.

"I put him to bed already", Fortis said.

A loud groan echoed from the birth chamber. And then, silence.

Everyone started whispering when they heard a loud wailing sound coming from within.

Mrs. Tibbs opened the bedroom door. She looked exhausted!

"How is it?" Fortis asked.

"Your sister must REST, my lord!" she said. "BUT...she is delivered!"

"Thank goodness!" said Cassius.

"She had another boy!? Oh wow!"

Mrs. Tibbs nodded. "What will you call him?"

"Oh gosh...I dunno yet. We thought we were going to get a girl this time..."

Slowly, everyone filed into the bedroom.

Minerva sat, bolstered up in bed. She looked very tired, but happy. In her arms was a sizable bundle wrapped in white cloth.

"Forty...come and say hello to your new nephew..." she whispered.

Fortis knelt down and took the little fellow in his arms.

"Hey there you little rascal...Aren't you cute, huh? You're a little prince, aren't you? Yes you are! And you're a cute little rascal ain'tcha?"

Cassius smiled down.

"Forty, give the baby to Cassius..." Minerva whispered.

Slowly, people crowded around the bed and the baby. The wide-eyed youngster stared at everyone, and everyone stared at him.

"What are we going to do with it?" Mrs. Tibbs asked.

"We can put him in Leonardo's old crib", said Fortis. "It's in the nursery..."

She sheathed her grandson's sword, and pulled out a handsome, jeweled dagger, a present from her husband, more years ago than she wished to admit. She turned the cold bottle of champagne around in her hands, holding it up to the light. She nodded. Everyone watched...

She tapped the bottle with the blunt, back edge of the dagger, running it up and down the neck, along the seam that joined the two halves of the bottle when it was made. She held the bottle out, aiming it towards a relatively empty part of the ballroom.

Shiiiiiing! BANG!! Pop!!

Outside, a storm raged. The wind wailed and shrieked and howled through the trees like a thousand sobbing babies. Rain poured down outside. Wind blasted down the chimney and curled in the smoke-box. The fire in the grate roared and crackled.

The heavy red curtains were drawn, the windows were shuttered, bolted and closed. The fire in the grate was roaring and hot. Thick rugs covered the floors and Fortis wore his red and gold nightgown over his old nightshirt, the one that was really tight and starting to rip at the seams.

He had ensured that everyone else was settled in for the night. He'd seen personally to it that his grandmother had everything she needed. A hot water bottler, her nightgown, a hot fire, and a huge mug of hot chocolate.

Fortis stripped off his nightgown and hung it on a stand. He climbed into bed and drew the curtains around it.

The bed was enormous. Built from beams that were made up of entire oak-tree trunks, carved and stained and slotted together, it was well-capable of holding his gigantic frame. The Vanderstorm marriage-bed had never moved from its position in the Master Bedroom. But countless moving had been done...within its sheets...

Every single tryst that Fortis had enjoyed with his wife that ever produced a child had happened here. Or, almost every one.

Fortis left one curtain half-open, to let in the heat and some of the light from the fireplace. He felt the two copper hot-water bottles that were in bed with him, wrapped up in neatly-knitted wool cosies. He put one down by his feet, and wrapped a huge arm around another one. He lay there on his back, spread out...and soon fell asleep.

Fortis never shared a bed with his wife. At least, not when they weren't enjoying each other's company. It just wasn't the done thing. Sharing beds was what people in poorer houses did, who couldn't afford beds for each person! Besides, girls needed their privacy. Fortis knew this from his sister. And he had no desire to share the master's chamber with bottles of scent, powder, makeup, and earrings! Eugh...

Nevertheless, sometimes he left his bedroom door unlocked at nights. That way if his wife ever decided that she required companionship, she could sneak in and play...

Fortis yawned and was soon asleep.

A click!

Fortis grunted. Huh?

The door opened. He reached under his pillow, for a large dagger. He heard soft footsteps.

A woman!

He relaxed his hand. His lady must be lonely this night...He'd soon take care of that...

"Papa?"

Fortis blinked. Huh!?

The curtains rustled, and Fortis rolled over to see three girls standing by his bed. Two small ones, and one slightly older. He sighed.

"Giiiiiirls...what are you doing here? You should be in bed!"

"Is skawey, papa!!" Emerald burbled. "Girlies sleep with papa. Papa not get angried. Papa love girlies!"

Fortis chortled. Yeah...

"Ooooh alright..." he rumbled.

The girls squeaked and crawled into bed! Fortis wrapped his arms around his daughters. Sapphire crawled onto her father's torso and laid down on her belly, smiling at him. Her two little sisters curled up in the shapely crooks of their father's arms, their forms wrapping around his massive biceps, their heads resting on his broad, muscular shoulders. Fortis was pinned down by pint-sized succubi, who were intent on snuggling their prey into submission.

Fortis yawned and relaxed back into the mattresses. He was about to doze off, when...

Nibble!

"Waugh!" he gasped, jerking upwards. Something was chewing on his ear!

"Papa not gonna hurted Cindamon!?"

"What the heck!?"

Fortis shifted. In the muted light from the fire, he saw a fat, fawn-coloured bunny curled up on his pillows. It playfully nibbled on his right earlobe.

"Gaugh! Geddoffame!!"

"Nooo!!" the girls squeaked. "Papa not hurted Cindamon!"

Fortis felt something else on his other side. He groaned.

Nutmeg and Cinnamon, his daughters' two pet rabbits. He might've known!

He was about to say something like "No pets in bed!", but he wasn't in the mood to have a crying-fest on his hands. He stroked the rabbits and tried to get back to sleep. His daughters cuddled up around him...
