Eldonia watched Fortis carrying trunks downstairs. One for Leo, one for Jaxxon, one for himself, and then others which seemed to belong to the servants. Koviac, Zacharia and Hermes. She smiled when she watched her husband's huge arms flex and bulge as he carried them out of the castle.

She knew that Fortis COULD get the servants to carry the trunks, but then what was the point? It wouldn't be a workout, otherwise.

Parked in the carriage-house behind Castle Vanderstorm was an impressive array of horse-drawn vehicles. Dog-carts for the hunting-dogs, gigs and traps, wagons, folding-top landaus, and, parked apart from the other vehicles...

Fortis entered the carriage-house with a lamp. He used the flame of the lamp to light the two carriage-lamps on the sides of an enormous, red and black coach. The coach towered at least seven or eight feet high, which was still two feet shorter than the Mountanian giant. He grabbed the carriage by the shafts and dragged it physically from the building into the carriage-house yard. The stable-boys approached with horses.

"We're not taking a full load", Fortis said. "Two horses this time. Not four".

"Yes, my lord", said Vallius, the head stable-boy.

The carriage was enormous. Of the variety known as a "Park Drag", used for private, long-distance travel, or for public transport or the delivery of mail and packages. This particular Park Drag, painted red and black, with coats of arms on the doors, had been in the Vanderstorm family longer than Fortis could remember. The brasswork sparkled in the firelight. Fortis opened the storage-compartments under the seats and lowered the trunks into them.

The coach could hold many, many people. There was space for two in the driver's seat. Space for four over the back luggage-compartment, space for another four on the roof, and space for even more people inside. It could probably have transported the entire family. Right now, it was only transporting Fortis, his son, his son's friend, and a few servants. But it was the perfect vehicle for long-haul traveling.

Leo and Jaxxon appeared, all ready for their journey.

"Alright boys, inside", Fortis said. He opened the carriage doors and Leo and Jaxx climbed in, one after the other. Koviac, Zacharia and Hermes climbed onto the roof, and sat in the back seats. Fortis stared around, making sure he had not forgotten anything.

"Lord Vandershtorm!"

Fortis froze. He turned. Standing in the yard was the waif, Dimitri.

"What do you want, sirrah?"

"I heard that you were going on a journey", said Dimitri, "I thought perhaps I could come with you".

Fortis frowned. "Why?"

"I have never seen anything of Fatlantis. I have never seen anything of Mountania until I left Vladia", he said simply.

Fortis scratched himself thoughtfully.

It would be a way to keep an eye on the boy...

"Koviac!"

Koviac jumped down.

"My lord!"

"You'll stay back and keep an eye on the womenfolk".

"Yes sir!" said the knight's squire firmly. He paused. "Can't your brothers and Master Excalibur do that?"

"I daresay. But I wouldn't trust Excalibur with a butter-knife, let alone a sword. Especially when he drinks".

"Yes sir. I'll get my bag..."

"Alright kid, up on the back!" Fortis said. Dimitri climbed up the back steps of the carriage and sat in the back, between Hermes and Zacharia.

Inside the carriage, Leo turned up the light on an oil-lamp hanging from a hook in the ceiling. Suddenly, the lamp, and the whole carriage, creaked over to one side! The lamp swung and swayed back and forth, oil sloshing inside the glass reservoir underneath the wick! Leo pulled a leather strap in the door and the window dropped down. He stuck out his head.

"Papa!?"

Fortis had grabbed the handholds on the sides of the carriage and hauled himself into the driver's seat, his huge bulk causing the suspension-springs to creak and flex. He sat down, grabbed the reins and flicked them firmly.

"Yah! C'mon!" he shouted.

"Do you love Fortis?"

"What's that?"

Athena sat by her bedroom window staring out into the night. Eldonia entered her grandmother-in-law's bedroom and stood by the chair.

"I said, do you love Fortis?"

"Of course I do! He's my grandson! Don't you?"

"Yeah but...Sometimes I feel like I married a bull".

Athena frowned. "A bull?"

"Big, strong, sexy, huurrrrghhh!...But sometimes...just sometimes...he's dumb as a post!"

Athena burst out laughing.

"I'm serious!" Eldonia said. "I mean, look!" she said.

She opened the bedroom windows. Wind blasted inside and rain poured down outside! She slammed them shut again.

"WHY did he leave for his trip to...where-ever!...In this weather!?"

"Well at least he took the boy Dimitri with him!" said Athena. "It'll give him some time to get used to the boy. Fortis has always taken time to warm up to strangers..."

"Oh sure, grandma. He warmed up to me real fast. About nine months..."

Athena sighed. "Fortis was different then! Younger!"

"Yeah, and perhaps even smarter. I think all those years splitting rocks have cracked his own head wide open! He's gonna get sick out in that storm!"

"My dear! Fortis is very resilient! He'll do no such thing! He wouldn't dream of getting sick!"

"Why not?"

"Well, because then it would mean lying in bed and having you fawning all over him taking care of him and...hmm...actually he might get sick after all..."

Eldonia giggled. "I'm going to check on the babies..." she sighed.

--- --- --- ---

Hermes, Zacharia, Jaxxon and Leo sat inside the carriage as it rumbled along. Fortis sat in the driver's seat, cloak over his broad shoulders, and Dimitri sitting next to him, holding a lantern. Rain poured down over them and both of them were soaked through!

"How much further!?" Dimitri shouted.

"Over the bridge, and then there's a village a little further on!" Fortis shouted. "Now hold that stupid light steady!"

Inside the carriage, the boys and servants grumbled.

"Why'd your pops have to take the cab-light too!? He already has the two front lamps!" Jaxxon grumbled. "That lamp was our only source of heat!"

"I'm sure we'll be fine!" Leonardo said. He yelped when the carriage hit a stone in the road and bounced hard! As they kept on, Fortis seemed to be urging the horses on faster and faster!

Huuurrreeeeeeeeeeaaaaaaahhhh!!

"Woah!" Leo yelped as he was thrown across the carriage, almost breaking his nose against the wall! The horses let out loud whinneys and skidded to a halt! The carriage rocked and then crashed down upon its four wheels!

"What're we stopping for!?" Hermes shouted. "We can't be there yet! And it's freeeezing!"

The carriage creaked, leaned heavily to one side, and then sprung back upright again. Leo opened a window and stuck his head out into the rain. He could see his father carrying a lamp, but couldn't see anything else. He opened the door and climbed out. Jaxxon followed.

Over the pouring rain, Fortis didn't hear a thing. The two boys closed the carriage door and unhooked a lamp from the front. Leonardo hoisted the lamp up into the air and shone it around.

Although it was pouring down, he did notice one thing...a set of wheel-marks...what on earth...

"Papa!?" he shouted. Leo rushed forwards, with Jaxxon close behind. Then they saw what had caused Fortis to stop.

Ahead of them was the bridge that Fortis had mentioned earlier. On the approach to the bridge were thick, wooden rails wedged into the earth on either side of the road, forming a crude barricade. One of the barricades had been broken through! A mess of tracks vanished beyond the light of the lantern and into the darkness...

Fortis hurried through. The ground was wet and slippery! Down the steep embankment, Fortis could spot something at the bottom. The mangled wreckage of a carriage, half in the river. He slid down, holding onto branches of trees along the way and reached the river.

"Papa!"

Fortis turned around.

"LEO DON'T YOU MOVE A STEP!" Fortis yelled. "It's damn slippery here! Go back to the carriage! Inside, under the back seat, there's some rope! Go and get it! NOW!"

"Yes, papa!" said Leo. "Jaxx! Hold the lamp! I'll be right back!"

Leo jogged off through the rain. He was now soaked through! He opened the carriage door and lifted up the back seat. He pulled out several yards of rope and then hurried back.

"I think he wants us to tie it to a tree or something!" Jaxxon shouted over the rushing water. Leo wrapped the rope around the nearest tree of significant girth, and tied it off tight. He then tied the other end of the rope to a stone and threw it into the river!

Fortis had now reached the carriage. He drew out his sword and used the heavy pommel to smash through the glass. Inside, he could see two figures. They looked like a boy, and an older woman who was probably his mother. Fortis grabbed the carriage door and tried to open it. It wouldn't budge!

"Damn it!" he swore. He grabbed the door in both hands, and with Herculean strength, he ripped it off its hinges and threw it into the water! The sounds of splintering wood seemed to bring the woman 'round. She screamed! Fortis ripped the windows apart and leaned in.

"Woah! Hold it, lady!" Fortis shouted. "Don't move nowhere!"

He reached in and grabbed her. The carriage shifted in the water! She stared at the big hands reaching in for her and she grabbed them! Fortis hauled her out and then reached in for the boy who looked a lot worse for wear.

"Is there anyone else!?"

"Where's my coachman!?" the woman asked. Fortis stared around. There wasn't anyone else there. Then, he saw a body half in the water. He hurried over, but a large, bleeding wound told him he was too late...

Fortis carried the woman and her son back to his carriage, their bodies draped over his shoulders like the cloak on his back. Leo untied the rope and together with Jaxxon, they followed behind, nervous and unsure.

"Aren't you going to do anything?" Jaxxon asked Lord Vanderstorm.

"Why should I? It's good watchin'..." Fortis said. But he spoke too soon.

"HUUURGGGHH!!"

CRACK!!

The villagers gasped as Leo's rake shattered! Split right down the middle, the rake now had neither the weight, nor the length to make it a decent fighting-weapon! The older boy had struck the rake right in the middle of the shaft, the heavy axe-head snapping the rake in half like a dry twig!

Everyone now thought that the duel or impromptu tournament would be over. And Leo dropped his rake to the ground in defeat. He was about to back away when the axe whistled over his head, brushing against his hair!

"Hey!" he said, "No fair!"

"Who said anything about fair!? You stole my fucking horses! I don't call that fair!"

"We were just...looking!...at...them!" Leo yelped, now dodging and weaving out of the way, "One of them...got...spooked! And we were...just...trying...to put him...back in...the stall!"

Swing after swing, Leo skirted, skipped and dodged.

"Hey, no fair!" said Fortis. He stopped leaning against the railing outside the local inn, and started walking into the square.

"Stop movin' around you little shit!" the older boy shouted. "Stand still so I can kill you! Your pappy ain't here to save your pathetic little ass! So you may as well give up!"

CLANG!!

An axe-swing was cut off halfway through, connecting unexpectedly with something long and hard. But this time, it wasn't made of wood. The crowd hushed as the scraping of steel echoed through the square.

"You defeated the kid..." Fortis said. "Let's see how well you do against a grown man...Huah!"

Fortis stepped in front of his challenger and swung his sword through the air, nearly slicing the man's arm off!

"C'mon! C'mon! Move your lazy ass! This is BORING!"

Fortis swung left and right! The teenager swung the axe up and down, but the weight of the axe-head and his prolonged combat had worn away the edge of his strength! Fortis, fresh, strong and ready for a prolonged fight, wielded his sword with military expertise. His enormous arms and their equally impressive muscles well-capable of swinging and maneuvering the heavy steel blade. People watched his biceps and triceps flex and bend with every swift, potentially lethal swing. Unlike his son, Fortis was barely moving. He simply kept his opponent busy, and then blocked whatever attacks he threw back.

Furious and getting more and more exhausted, the teenager raised the axe for one last, desperate swing! Fortis ducked as the axe hurtled towards him!

CRACK!

The crowd gasped! A few women screamed! The sword broke the axe-handle clean off! The sharp axe-head whistled through the air, hitting Fortis in the face! Leo yelped! Fortis ignored the pain! He swung his sword again, tripping the boy over and, with another flourish, brought the blade to within an inch of his throat. All it would take was one thrust, and the boy's head would be decapitated faster than chopping the head off a carrot. The cocky teen gulped nervously.

"O-okay! Y-you win! I-I'm sorry! I'm sorry I picked on the kid! I'm sorry I..."

"I'm sorry...WHAT?"

The boy gulped, thought quickly, and then offered: "I-I'm sorry, sir! I...I really am! I..."

"SIR!? YOU THINK I SPENT ALL THESE YEARS KICKING VLADIAN ASSHOLES AND SCUM LIKE YOU...TO BE CALLED 'SIR'!? You are talking to a military veteran and a professional warrior here, sirrah! That's 'sorry, my LORD'! to you, you little sniveling, snot-licking excuse! Now pick up that pathetic hatchet of yours and get back to your damn horses before I change my mind about not sheathing my sword through your NECK!"

The crowd broke into applause as the trembling bully, all the fight and bravado sucked out of him, crawled backwards on his elbows, snatched up his once-upon-a-time axe, and hurried away!

"Papa! You're bleeding!" Leo shouted, hurrying up to his father. Fortis touched a hand to his face and felt warm red blood, and a distinct stinging sensation on his cheek. The axe-blade had sliced into him when it had flown off the handle.

--- --- --- ---

"That was some fightin'!"

"Thanks..."

"That punk gets sore at anyone. You weren't to know that. Your boy does some good fightin'. I suppose you're trainin' him to be like you, right?"

"Yeah...Aurgh!"

"...Sorry...You oughta be proud of him..."

"Yeah..."

Fortis sat at the bar inside the inn. The bartender, used to patching up the results of tavern brawls, cleaned the wound with salt and water, and was now slowly sewing the gash together.

"It'll heal soon enough, so long as you keep it clean and wash it each day with warm, salty water", said the bartender. "But I'm sorry, it'll leave a scar at any rate..."

"Does that mean he'll be disfigured for life?" Leo gasped.

"I don't get disfigured you little idiot!" Fortis said. "I get rugged! Your mother is gonna love seein' this scar once we get home..."

"Eugh!"

Fortis chuckled. Women were magnetically attracted to tough, battle-scarred heroes, and Fortis was sure that the little nick on his left cheek was going to have Eldonia's heart going all pitty-patter...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo is disarmed. Fortis draws out his sword and...

choices: That night, Helena "thanks" Fortis for helping her and her son.
They prepare to leave for the village of Sugarloaf Hill the next morning.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"You're going to Regis City, aren't you?" Fortis asked.

"Yes!" said Helena.

It was evening, and Fortis, Leo, Jaxxon, Dimitri and Apollo were eating in the inn. They were munching on beefsteak sandwiches with egg and mustard.

"Papa works at the Mountanian Embassy!" said Apollo, proudly, trying his best to eat his sandwich with one hand, since his other arm was in a sling.

"You can't travel that far on your own. And your son can't ride with a broken arm", Fortis said. "We'll take you to Regis City. You'll travel with us in our carriage".

"Oh my lord! I couldn't possibly..."

"We're going to Fatlantis anyway. You'll travel with us. I absolutely insist!"

"Uh...w-well!...T-thank you!" said Helena, blushing.

"We'll leave tomorrow afternoon", said Fortis.

"I saw you doing all the fighting!" said Apollo.

"Thanks. I was good, wasn't I?" Fortis asked.

"I was talking about Leonardo!"

Fortis laughed. He put an arm around his son and gave him a rough squeeze.

"I wish I could fight like that, but papa wants me to be a diplomat like he is!"

"No reason you can't learn basic swordsmanship", Fortis said. "Every boy should know that", he added.

"Are you training to be a knight like your father, Leo?" Helena asked. Leo nodded.

"Papa says our family has a long history of knighthood".

"Ah, but you shouldn't do it just because it's history!" said Helena.

"Leo wants to be like his old man!" said Fortis, smiling. "And I don't blame him! Look how good he is!"

"Papa!!" Leo fumed. Helena giggled.

"Alright boys, let's head upstairs", Fortis said. "It's time for us to be in bed, if we want to leave by lunchtime tomorrow!"

"Awwww..." they groaned.

"BED!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Fortis's party takes Helena and her son to ...

choices: Fortis's carriage reaches the home of his friend, an old army comrade.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"After you, Apollo".

"Thanks!"

Apollo Excelsion climbed into the carriage, followed by Jaxxon, then Leonardo. Hermes and Zacharia closed the carriage doors, and then climbed into the back seat, where servants rode.

"My lady..."

Fortis held out a hand to Helena. She smiled up at him.

"My lord", she said, curtsying slightly and grasping his hand. Fortis suddenly whisked her into his arms, and, holding her firmly with one massive bicep, grasped the side of the carriage with his other arm. He hauled himself and Helena easily into the driver's seat and sat them both down. She laughed.

"Oooff!! Th-thank you my lord!" she gasped. She smoothed out her dress and Fortis smiled.

"Yah!" he shouted, "C'mon! Walk on boys!"

The horses snorted, and, with a rattling of bridles and a creaking of straps, the carriage started rumbling out of, and away from the inn yard.

Helena gulped. She felt a bit uneasy riding on this carriage, with this handsome, unknown Mountanian warrior-lord. Everything about him was just so gigantic...and...powerful...

Fortis leaned back in the driver's seat and stretched his legs out. This had the unintended effect of giving Helena an excellent view of his wedding-tackle.

...Or at least, the incredible bulge created by it.

"You must have a large family, my lord...?" she asked. Fortis nodded.

"Oh yeah", he said. "Six kids!"

"Six!? Oh my! Your poor wife!"

Fortis chuckled.

"I'm sure she was a lovely woman", said Helena. Fortis looked at her.

"Was a lovely woman? She is a lovely woman, thank you very much. An exquisite woman, to be precise..."

Helena hoped the shock didn't register on her face! She stared once more at the colossal cannon resting between Fortis's thighs. Any woman who could handle six enormous, painful, no-doubt, aggressive penetrations from such a monster as that must be a woman of exceptional character...

Helena decided at once, that she would very much like to meet Lady Vanderstorm! Any woman who could handle the Truncheon of Doom was well-worth knowing!

"Is Leonardo your oldest son?"

"Yes..."

"You must be very proud of him!"

"Hah...Yeah..."

"Do you have others?"

"Six. Three boys. Three girls".

"Oh my! What are they like?"

"The girls cling too much..."

"What do you mean?"

"They like sleeping with their father far too often".

Helena giggled. She could imagine ANY girl wanting to sleep with Fortis far too often...

"I think it's sweet", she said.

"What is?"

"Three little girls all cuddled up with their father".

Fortis laughed. "Yeah I guess".

The rest of the journey passed in relative quiet. Inside the carriage, all the boys had fallen asleep. Helena put her arms around Fortis's torso, and he draped one arm over her shoulder, keeping the other on the reins. Up ahead, he saw a looming stone wall. As the carriage drew closer, he noticed it was some manner of fortification. Then he realised it was a border-guard.

Built across the road was something that amounted to a small castle. It was built on a hill, over which the road passed, with walls extending out on either side. Soldiers patrolled the gates and walls.

"Halt!" a man shouted. Fortis pulled slowly on the reins and the horses stopped. Guards hurried forwards.

"What is your business here?" asked a man who looked like he was the one in charge.

"Good afternoon, Sergeant", said Fortis. "My business is my own. I travel to Fatlantis to visit friends".

"Who are your passengers?"

"My family and travelers picked up on the way. Let us pass".

"I will need to see some identification".

"Identification, is it?"

Fortis pointed with his whip to the coat of arms painted on the carriage door.

"I'm afraid that is not enough, sir".

Fortis stared at the sergeant.

"You want more identification?"

"I do".

"You think a Peer of the Realm needs to provide more identification than his armorial bearings?"

"I do".

Fortis sighed. He dismounted from the carriage and drew out his sword. The sergeant inspected the blade and nodded.

"Very well...my lord", he added. He bowed and stepped back.

"Open the gates!" he shouted.

Fortis climbed back onto the carriage and flicked the reins. The horses started up again.

"Imbeciles!" he grumbled as the carriage rumbled through the gates, through the courtyard of the guard-post, out the other side and into the Kingdom of Fatlantis...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: They prepare to leave for the village of Sugarl...

choices: Leo and Jaxxon are worried about going to Dragon's Heart Academy
After dinner, the boys explore the town, and get their first look at Fatlantis.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"You took long enough!"

"Yes. Hello to you, too".

A tall, battle-worn man with an unshaven face limped forwards. From the carriage, Leonardo and Jaxxon stared at the man.

He looked about Fortis's age and height, but other than that, was almost entirely different. The man had no left leg, and no right arm. Instead, he walked with a crutch and had a sort of metal attachment added to the stump where his right hand used to be. The man was tall, but not as tall as Fortis, muscular, but more solid than Fortis. And he looked dangerous, despite his lack of appendages.

The man held out his left hand, and Fortis shook it.

"Damascus".

"Fortis".

"You got a new piece for your arm, I see".

Damascus nodded. "Yes. It slots in, and when I want to change it, I just slot it out again. I have a whole heap of these things. The blacksmith around here is quite handy with his forge and hammer".

The crippled Mountanian stared at the carriage, and the faces looking at him.

"Aren't you going to introduce me?"

"Oh...Boys, come out and say hello".

Jaxxon and Leo, with Apollo following behind, climbed out of Fortis's carriage. The carriage was parked in the gardens of a comfortable, but small villa with walls built around the gardens. The boys bowed.

"This is Leonardo. His friend Jaxxon, and our young companion here is Apollo. His mother Helena. They are traveling with us to Regis City".

"Traveling companions, eh?"

"Their carriage was wrecked in a storm. I offered to take them the rest of the way".

"Hmm. Always were the charitable sort, weren't you, Fortis? Yes well, you can't all stand out here. Come inside..."

Arriving in the village of Sugarloaf Hill was, to Leonardo Vanderstorm, as different as night and day.

The village was filled mostly with fat, cheerful Fatlanteans, who mostly walked around with the minimal of clothes, in order to show off their, in some cases, formidable girths. Leo, who had always prided himself on his slim figure, was rather taken aback by everything that he saw.

"I'm amazed that you haven't put on more weight living here in Fatlantis", Fortis said. His friend Damascus laughed.

"I have put on a bit", he said. "It's hard to exercise when half your limbs are missing, but I don't generally eat much, anyway", he said. "But I suppose that you fellows are all hungry. Sit down in the dining-room", he gestured towards the chamber in question, leading off the foyer of his villa, "And I will inform the cook to serve dinner", he said.

The dining-room was warm and comfortable, and the gaggle of travelers shuffled sleepily into the chamber to a cold supper of pie, sandwiches and lemonade. Fortis was glad for it - he was not in the mood for anything too extravagant so late at night.

"I thought that you had a son?" Fotis said as he tucked into the cold cuts and beer. Damascus nodded. "I do", he said. "You are wondering, perhaps, why he is not here, FOrtis".

Fortis nodded.

"It's simple, I sent him away".

"Sent him away?"

"Yes. I know, I know, I'm supposed to train him to be a knight and gentleman d everything, but look at me, Fortis! I can't do that stuff anymore. And the boy is not going to learn if he doesn't see things in action. So I sent him to boarding-school".

"Boarding school?"

"Absolutely. Perhaps you should send your son there? Dragon's Heart Academy is a fine institution".

Fortis nodded. He knew Dragon's Heart Academy. It was an ancient boarding school for Mountanian boys. Part boot-camp, part military academy, part boarding-school. Acceptance into the Academy was extremely hard, but the results were often worth it.

"An interesting idea", said Fortis. "Leonardo and his friend Jaxxon here might learn a lot more than I can teach them".

"Oh I'm sure you teach them fine!" said Damascus, "But at the Academy, they'll learn a lot more than what simple home-schooling can provide".

Fortis nodded, That was true.

"I shall give you the address and details of the headmaster, after dinner", Damascus said.

"Boarding-school!?" Leo said.

Fortis nodded. "It might be good for you, son", he said. "And Jaxxon. I'll write to your father, Bastion, and see what he says".

choices: Days later, Fortis and his traveling companions move onto Regis City!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
A youth stood before Fortis Vanderstorm. He was tallish for his age, slim, good-looking, with light blond hair and light blue eyes. He wore what looked like winter robes, despite the fact that it was nowhere near wintertime. He looked to be many years older than Leonardo, and appeared to be in his late teens.

"Excellent, excellent..." Fortis said, reading over the papers in his hand. "Very good. I'm surprised..."

"Good news, my lord?" the youth asked.

"Oh yes...Huh! Skinflint bastard...I knew he had the money! Yes...very nice. Well, thank you for being so swift with your deliveries, young Lord Merlin. My best wishes to your grandparents".

The young wizarding lord bowed.

"So your son and young Master Jaxxon will be going to Dragon's Heart Academy".

"It seems so. Sir Bastion has agreed to the change in his son's education and I think he rather enjoys the change. At any rate, it will give the boys a chance to learn more and spend time with people more their own age...And they'll be there with Damascus's son".

"And my younger brother, my lord".

"Your brother?"

"Absolutely, Lord Vanderstorm. You remember Lazarus?"

Fortis groaned. "Is he that wretched boy who poured ink into my wine when I hosted your grandparent's wedding anniversary two years ago?"

"Uh...yeah that sounds like him..."

Fortis sighed.

Clunk...creak...clunk!...creak...clunk!...creak...clunk!...creak...

"Aah! Young Merlin!"

"Lord Adlerseele!"

Merlin bowed to Damascus. The crippled warlord smirked. "So, your brother and my son will have two new companions when term starts in a few weeks, eh?"

"Yes sir. I was just finalising all the details, speeding the letters back and forth..."

"So handy having magical connections, isn't it, Fortis?" Damascus asked.

"Absolutely", said Fortis. "This trip to Fatlantis will give Leonardo and Jaxxon time to relax and get over the shock. Once we return to Mountania, the boys will be sent off to Dragon's Heart Academy. There, they'll get a chance to meet Kannon and Lazarus".

"Indeed", said Damascus, "I came to tell you that dinner is served".

"Oh! Good!"

"Merlin, you'll stay for dinner".

"Oh! Thank you, Lord Adlerseele".

"You're welcome! This way..."

--- --- --- ---

"I dunno papa..."

"Lord Vanderstorm, did YOU ever go there?"

"Certainly did", said Fortis. "I learnt the basics from my father, and then I went off to Dragon's Heart Academy. So did your uncles, Leonardo".

"Even Uncle Excalibur?"

"Uh...no. Uncle Excalibur was too stupid to go to Dragon's Heart..."

Damascus laughed. "That crackpot cousin of yours!? I thought he got in!?"

"You mean he snuck in and tried to steal stuff from the potions laboratories. Master Hawkeye caught him and gave him a...Yeah well, better not talk about that here..."

"Awww!" Leo wailed.

"Master Hawkeye was the fencing-master", Damascus explained, "Or he was when your father and I were at Dragon's Heart. Fearsome guy. He lost one eye once, a long time ago. He wore a leather eye-patch, but you'd never know it. He'd spot anything! Like your uncle trying to jump out of a second-storey window..."

Fortis nodded.

"You never thought about sending your son to school, Lady Excelsion?"

Helena sipped her wine.

"Oh no! Well, not to Dragon's Heart, anyway. But my husband and I are thinking of sending him somewhere. We just haven't decided yet".

"Moooother!!" Apollo fumed. Everyone laughed.

"Oh you boys will love it there!" said Fortis. He stared at Damascus. "Who's the headmaster there now, anyway?"

"You probably know who he is".

"Do I?"

"Yes. Tacitus VonGewalt..."

Fortis frowned. "Do I know him?"

"I think he's your wife's...something...He was at your wedding, remember!?"

"He's not that old guy with the white hair and the scar, is he?"

"That's the one!"

"Thor's Hammer...I remember now..."

"Does that mean he's my...great...something?" Leonardo asked.

"He'll be your great-uncle, yes", Fortis said. "Didn't you know that?"

"I've never met him!"

"Oh yeah that's right, you wouldn't have. Don't worry, I'll introduce you, son!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo and Jaxxon are worried about going to Drago...

choices: The next afternoon, the carriage approaches Regis City. Leo is in awe!!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Mrs. Eddys!"

"Coming, my lord!"

"Aaah, Mrs. Eddys! Wonderful. Fortis, take the basket from Mrs. Eddys".

Fortis lifted a fat, well-packed wicker hamper from the hands of a short, stout, cheerful-looking cook. She blushed.

"Mrs. Eddys is a master when it comes to packing food for journeys! Probably because I go away so many times", Damascus said. "All that food should keep you well-fed until you reach Regis City!"

"Sure looks like it!" said Leo, helping Zacharia to tie the hamper to the roof of the carriage. "Hey look..."

He opened the lid and peered inside.

"There's pies in here!"

"Leo! Leave them alone until you're actually HUNGRY", Fortis said.

"Yes father..."

"Well, thank you very much for your hospitality, Damascus".

"Any time, old friend, any time! And you WILL stop here on your way back home!?"

"Certainly if you wish it?"

"I would! We could go hunting!"

"You can't hunt like that!"

"Watch me! I'll shoot an arrow further than anyone you ever met!"

"Leo did you hear that!?" Fortis shouted. Leo and Jaxxon burst out laughing inside the carriage.

"What's so funny?" Damascus demanded.

"Nothing! Nothing really!" said Leo, blushing.

"Come along, Helena!" said Fortis. He helped her up into the box. Apollo climbed into the carriage, the doors were closed and locked, and with a wave, everyone departed.

"FORTIS! Don't forget the LETTERS I gave you for Dragon's Heart!" Damascus shouted. Fortis pulled them out of his cloak and waved them in the air. He hadn't forgotten!

"Papa! How far is it to Regis City?"

Fortis turned to see his son leaning out of the carriage.

"About a day and a half", he replied. "We'll camp overnight, and then we should reach Regis City by about noon tomorrow".

"Is it safe to camp?" Helena asked.

"Oh Fatlantis is a very peaceful sort of place", said Fortis. "You don't get many highwaymen around here".

"Have you been to Regis City often?"

"A few times when I was a boy. My father had to come here on diplomatic duties, so he dragged me along...Great food!"

Helena giggled.

"So your husband lives at the Mountanian Embassy in Regis City?"

"Yes, he's Secretary to the Ambassador".

"Oh I see. How nice!"

"Papa! What will Regis City be like?" Leonardo called out.

"Oh I think you'll love it, son".

"Where will we stay?"

Fortis frowned.

That...was a very good question.

The Vanderstorm name didn't carry much 'weight' in Fatlantis. In his native Mountania, the Vanderstorms had always been treated with respect, obedience, deference, even. They had been known for generations as a powerful, influential, and well-connected aristocratic family - a family of the elite warrior-nobility class, with connections at the Mountanian royal court.

But not much of that counted for anything in Regis City. Fortis wasn't even sure if he'd the king. He knew his name, but that was it. King David, and Queen Isobel... but he knew nothing more.

"When we meet him tomorrow, I'm sure my husband will be able to help!" said Helena, smiling.

choices: They travel to the palace. Sir Rubicon introduces them to the royal family.
Leo and Jaxxon want to explore the city instead.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Halt! Who enters the city?"

Fortis pulled on the reins. The carriage stopped. Standing at the enormous gatehouse were six fat, burly-looking guards. Despite their weight, they certainly looked like capable men. Each one carried a halberd, wore a helmet and had a small sword strapped to a leather belt. Fortis pivoted, swung his legs over and landed on the ground, dust rising, his cloak billowing in the wind.

"Good afternoon, gentlemen", the Mountain lord said. He towered over the guards, most of them only coming up to below his chest. He unbuckled his cloak to show the chain and medallion he wore around his chest. One of the guards nodded.

"My lord", he said. "The Mountanian Order of the Dragon?"

Fortis nodded. "My family and my traveling companions seek entrance into the city. The lady's husband serves as secretary to the Mountanian ambassador".

"Dame Excelsion!" said one of the other guards, who had a neat, goatee beard. Helena smiled and nodded. The guard hurried to his friends and chatted. They nodded and stepped aside.

"Open the gates!" someone shouted. Fortis climbed back into his carriage.

"Yah!" he shouted, and the carriage rumbled through, the coat of arms on the door sparkling in the strong, afternoon sun.

"Would you look at that guy..." said one of the guards as the portcullis slammed shut after them. "I reckon he would've got into the city even if we didn't let him in!"

"This is why the King ensures we remain on good terms with the Mountanians, Charlie. You wouldn't want them as your enemy, would you?" said another guard.

Charlie nodded. "Yeah! No wonder their army's never been defeated if it's got those guys leading it! Just looking at him makes me hungry!"

"Huh?"

"Imagine how much a beast like him eats!...Hey are there anymore of those ham and cheese sandwiches left..."

"Woooooow!"

Leo and Jaxxon and Apollo stared out the windows of the carriage as it rumbled through town towards the Diplomatic Quarter near the palace. The streets were filled with people. On almost every street-corner, there were carts and trolleys parked, with people selling food. Sausages, steak sandwiches, fried eggs, bread rolls, and hard candy treats. Leonardo licked his lips!

"Gosh I'm hungry!" he said.

The carriage parked outside an imposing stone building. At once, street-children swarmed around like ants! They opened the doors, folded down the mounting-steps, and waited eagerly. Leonardo and his friends climbed out into the warm, inviting sunlight.

"Give us a shillin'!" said one of the boys, holding out his cap. "C'mon guv!"

"OY!"

Fortis leapt from the top of the carriage and landed on his feet, his cloak flapping in the summer breeze.

"Beat it, you little scamps!" he grunted.

"Cooooor! Look at him!" said one of the boys, "Hey mistah! Openin' a door's a livin' around here!" he said, obviously not as intimidated by Fortis's size as the others around him. Fortis stared at the waif, who had to be about eight years old. He reached into his pouch and tossed a few coins on the ground.

"Mind your horses, guv?" said another boy, hurrying up. "Only a shillin'!"

Fortis handed the boy two shillings.

"If I find one thing missing from my carriage when I return, you'll be hanging upside down from a lamppost by your guts, understand, boy?"

"Yes sir!" said the youth. "OY!" he shouted to others. "PISS OFF! I've got this one! Go find another coach to pester! C'mon Albert! Let's look after this thing..."

Fortis escorted Helena into the Mountanian embassy. A large red and gold flag fluttered from the roof.

"May I help you?" said the receptionist, a man sitting behind a desk, fanning himself slightly.

"I'm here to see my husband, the Ambassador's secretary", said Helena.

"Yes ma'am. He'll be in the ambassador's suite. This way..."

They were led into a huge, grand-looking office, with doors leading off in various directions.

"Mr. Ambassador, we've got guests!" said the receptionist.

"Thank you, Hermes...Why Dame Excelsion! Your husband told me you were coming!"

She smiled. "It's so nice to see you!" she said. "Sir Rubicon, this my traveling companion, Lord Vanderstorm".

"Aah, the noble Lord Vanderstorm..." said Sir Rubicon, a tall, tanned man with brown hair, and a full beard. "How nice to meet you! Wait here, I'll fetch your husband, ma'am..."

The man turned and entered another room. He returned a couple of minutes later with another man.

"Papa!" said Apollo loudly.

Lucius Excelsion smiled. "Apollo my boy!...What on EARTH did you do to your arm!? I expected you here two weeks ago!"

"Our carriage crashed in a storm, papa! And we nearly DROWNED in a river! And then this man saved us, papa!" said Apollo excitedly. Lucius looked up. He bowed.

"My lord!" he said.

"This is the Earl Vanderstorm of Dynamos County, Lucius", said Rubicon, "One of the grandest old families in the king's court! I didn't know you were coming!"

"It wasn't planned", said Fortis. "But my boy here's never seen Fatlantis and I thought it might make for an educational trip. Unfortunately we don't have anywhere to stay..."

"Oh you can't stay here!" said Sir Rubicon. "We don't have the room. This is an embassy, not a hotel! But...I am expected at the palace in..."

Sir Rubicon looked at a handsome clock standing on a shelf. "...four hours' time", he said. "I think I could pull a FEW strings, and have you stay there!"

"Stay at the palace!?" said Apollo.

"I have a rather good relationship with King David, and he is a charitable sort of fellow. I don't see why not. I'll just tell him some friends arrived unexpectedly. I have to go there now anyway, so...Perhaps you should come along?"

The ambassador held up a thick wad of paper. "This is our new water-trade agreement that the king has to sign. It's about that canal system that runs from Mountania to Fatlantis. You may as well come with me!"

"Alright", said Fortis.

"Would you wish me to accompany you, Sir Rubicon?" Lucius asked.

"...Yes you better", said Rubicon. "Bring your family, Lucius. It's not every day they get to meet royalty!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The next afternoon, the carriage approaches Reg...

choices: Crown Prince Cameron and Prince Edmund take the boys to their guestroom.
Fortis is given a tour of the palace by Sir Rubicon.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Two carriages approached the gates of a towering stone wall over a huge moat.

"Who enters here?" a man from within shouted.

"The Mountanian Ambassador with his secretary and friends!" Sir Rubicon shouted. "We have an audience with the king!"

A door opened and a stout gatekeeper waddled out. "Do you have a letter?"

"Yes".

The gatekeeper read over the document. He nodded. "Very well!...Open the gates!"

The gates were hauled open, and the two carriages rumbled in.

Once they were beyond, Leo and his friends gasped.

The estate was enormous, with manicured lawns and gardens, and a towering, sprawling grand palace before them. He whistled loudly.

"Wow!!...Makes our place look like shit!"

Jaxxon laughed. The carriage parked outside the main entrance and everyone climbed out. They entered a cavernous and bright central foyer, with a towering lemonade-fountain in the middle of the room. Ramps and doors and passages all led off in various directions.

"May I help you?"

An enormous man waddled forwards. He had to be four or five hundred pounds, with neat, blond hair and red robes.

"We're here to see the king", said Sir Rubicon. "We have business".

"Indeed?" said the man. He held out his hand, and Rubicon handed him the letter. The man glanced at it, and then glanced at the package in Rubicon's hands.

"Aah yes. The Mountanian trade deal...Yes yes...The King is in the throne-room with his family. I'll see if he will grant you an audience".

The man knocked on the throne-room doors, then entered, and closed them behind him. He returned a few minutes later.

"You may enter", he said. "Sir Rubicon, your Majesty!"

Slowly, they entered. They walked along a thick, wide, red carpet. As they got closer, Leo and Jaxxon gawped.

Sitting on two thrones were an immensely obese man and woman. Leo assumed they were King David and Queen Isobel. Sitting between them were two colossal boys!

They looked older than Leo and Jaxxon, but not by much. They were perhaps thirteen and fifteen. They both had blond hair, one slightly darker than the other. And they were both equally obese. They had to be at least a thousand pounds each!

Leo was so transfixed, that the droning words of Sir Rubicon buzzed in his ears and made no sense at all. Fortis nudged his son. Leo snapped back to attention.

The Mountain lord drew out his sword and knelt. Everyone else followed suit.

"Lord Vanderstorm, it is an honour to have you in our court. Your reputation precedes you", said King David. "Your tales of bravery in the Vladian Wars are well-known in our court!"

"Are they, my lord?"

"You are related to Lady Athena Vanderstorm? She is a close friend of your king..."

"She is my grandmother, your Majesty".

"Aaah! Excellent! Absolutely, it would be our pleasure to host your stay here at the palace, while you visit Regis City! And my sons shall see to the needs of your own sons!"

"Only Leonardo is my son, your Majesty. This is his friend Jaxxon, and this is their friend Apollo, son of the ambassador's secretary".

"No matter!" said the king firmly, "Jaxxon and Leonardo shall be well taken-care of! And..."

"Hey what's goin' on here?"

Fortis turned when he thought he heard a familiar accent. Standing in a side-door was a powerfully-built Mountanian teenager.

"Woah!" he said, coming in, waving a sword casually around like a folded umbrella. He stared up at Lord Vanderstorm. "Cool!"

Fortis sized the youth up. Then he recognised the gold coronet on his head.

"Good afternoon, your Royal Highness", Fortis said. Fortis nudged his son, who bowed. "Leonardo, Prince Gladius".

"Oh!" said Leo, blushing. "H-hello!"

"Hey", said Gladius.

"Young Master Gladius's Mountanian casualness infiltrates all chambers of the palace...even those which he is not permitted entrance to when there are private audiences..." said Queen Isobel. Everyone laughed.

"Show Lord Leonardo and young Master Jaxxon to a guest-suite close to the princes, Gladius!" said the king.

"They can sleep in my guest-suite!" said the fattest boy, heaving himself up from his throne. "Come on! This way!"

"Hey!" said the other boy, "Wait for me!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: They travel to the palace. Sir Rubicon introduc...

choices: Gladius leaves, his ego bruised, and seeks out Fortis's company.
Leo and Jaxxon talk to Cameron and Edmund and pepper them with questions!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Leonardo couldn't help but STARE, slack-jawed at the two monstrously obese boys who were now waddling towards him! How they were even able to move seemed to defy the laws of physics and nature! Both boys were so staggeringly obese, it seemed impossible that they could even stand!

Neither prince could see his feet, and he waddled forwards, leaning heavily on an elegantly-carved walking-stick. Both princes moved at a snail's pace, panting heavily, and plodding one foot laboriously in front of another, as if trying to haul them out of thick, sucking mud! Leonardo turned to Jaxxon, who had also been paralysed into catatonia by their mindblowing girth!

"C'mon you guys!" said Prince Gladius, "Move it!"

In stunned silence, the two youths wafted out of the room in a trance-like state, like zombies.

Several times on the way to their rooms, both princes had to stop for breath. Once at the doors of the throne-room, once at the intersection of a passageway, and then at the intersection of another...and another...

Leonardo was beginning to understand why there wasn't a single flight of stairs ANYWHERE in the palace! Two such enormously...FAT...princes...couldn't POSSIBLY climb stairs!

"They're not NORMALLY this slow..." Gladius whispered. "But uh...they DID just finish lunch..."

Leo gulped! Just THINKING about food was beginning to terrify him!

As the fattest prince reached the end of a corridor, a pair of gigantic doors opened. Two boys, plump, but not especially fat, and dressed in what looked like white and gold servants' uniforms, bowed.

"Master Cameron, sir", the boys said.

"Ryan...E...Ethan..." Cameron panted. He waddled inside and groaned as he collapsed into a huge armchair and let out a pained wheezing sound, clutching his belly. One of the boys immediately got to his hands and knees, and started working on the prince's belly, gently massaging out the cramping knots of an agonising stitch that was forming in his fat-rolls. Cameron let out groan like a dying man.

"T-these are...Lord...L-Leonardo and...J-Jaxxon D-DeJaeger..." Cameron wheezed. "T-th-they'll HUUURGGHH!" he grimaced as the stitch tightened up in his belly and he curled up in agony!

"Th-they'll be staying with us...for a while!" Edmund panted, completing his brother's sentence.

The remaining servant-boy bowed. "Yes Master Cameron, Master Edmund, sir", he said.

"G-g-give th-them my...g-gu-guestroom!" Cameron whispered, barely able to speak. He let out another horrible groan. "OOOOOH! I should never have eaten that stupid pizza!...BURRRRRRRP!!"

"Well you...you did, anyway!" Edmund fumed.

"YEAH! Otherwise you would've...e-eaten it!" Cameron protested, and coughed loudly. Edmund sighed.

"My brother is NOT the smartest person around..." Edmund said.

"That's treason!"

"You're not the king yet, you stupid fat blob! So no, it isn't!" Edmund snapped back. Everyone laughed.

The remaining servant-boy, who Leo found out, was named Ryan, led Leo and Jaxxon into a chamber off the main suite. It was surprisingly luxurious, and had an enormous, four-poster bed against the wall, and large windows that gave views onto the gardens and the walls outside.

"Wooow!" he said.

"You can share the bed if you like. Or we could set up another chamber, if you wish..." Ryan said.

"Uh...gosh..." said Jaxxon. He didn't like the idea of getting LOST in a place THIS huge! "Uh...We'll stick with the ONE room, for now..." he said. Leo nodded. He liked that idea!!

"Here you go, boys!"

Fortis entered the princely chambers, carrying two enormous trunks in his massive arms. Edmund and his brother Cameron gawped at the raw, bestial strength, and their servant-boys backed quickly away as the Mountain Lord entered the guest-room and dumped them on the ground. He stood up, straightening his back, loud cracks and pops echoing, his muscles stretching, flexing and rippling.

"Uuuurggghh!! You know, it's lucky these people don't believe in stairs! Otherwise I would've tripped over three times getting here! Anyway, I reckon we can stay here a week, and then we can head home. You boys get comfortable now..."

Fortis left the room and a couple of minutes later, a full-figured, buxom-looking maiden entered. She looked like a palace laundry-maid and in her arms, she carried fresh linen.

"Well hey, Tanya..." said Gladius, "Maybe I could help you..."

"Listen, Baron Von Thunder-Junk, the other laundry-maids might think you're cute, but you're too young for me!" she said firmly.

Cameron burst out laughing. "Gladius, give it up! She's nineteen!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Crown Prince Cameron and Prince Edmund take the...

choices: The Princes ask Leonardo and Jaxxon about Mountania.
In the king's study, Ryan discovers that the princes are LOSING weight!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"My darlings! My dumplings! Are you alright?"

"M-m-m-m-m-m-MOTHER!!!"

"Eeew! OH NO! NO!! NO!!! MUUUURRRRRGGGHHH!!"

Cameron and Edmund groaned and grimaced as their mother plastered their fat cheeks with kisses!

"MOTHER!! NOT IN FRONT OF THE MOUNTANIANS!!" Edmund fumed.

"Oh but you're so nice letting them share your rooms!"

"They're NOT sharing my room!" said Cameron, "They're sharing my GUEST-ROOM. There's a difference!"

"Now don't you take that tone with me, young man!" said Queen Isobel. "Lord Vanderstorm demands respect! And I want you...BOTH of you, to take good care of his son and his friend while they're here! Do you understand!?"

"Yeeeeees mother!!"

"Good little puddings! Muah!...Muah!"

"Eugh!" said Jaxxon. "Does YOUR mother do that!?"

"To the girls, not to me!" said Leo, shuddering. Cameron and Edmund looked mortified!

"C-can we sit down?" Leo asked. Cameron nodded and pointed to the sofa in front of the fireplace, between the two armchairs occupied by the princes. Leo and Jaxxon sat down.

"So...um...Hi!" said Leo, uncertainly.

"Hello", said Cameron.

"You sure are FAT!" said Jaxxon.

There was silence. Then Cameron and Edmund burst out laughing. Leonardo giggled and Jaxxon smirked.

"We wondered when you might notice..." said Cameron, chortling. "It's nice to meet you!" he said.

"Thanks", said Leo.

"Yeah. Gladius has been BORED without any other Mountanians around. Be careful. He might challenge you to a duel".

Leo barely heard what Cameron was saying. He was too busy ogling at Cameron's tons of warm, soft, jiggling flesh. The acres of adipose existence that wobbled and jiggled and sloshed hypnotically, as the prince made himself comfortable in his chair...

"Do you want to touch it?"

"Huh!?"

Leo snapped back to reality. "W-what?"

"It's okay, you know", said Cameron. "Everyone does". Cameron wobbled his huge belly that sagged to the ground between his legs. "Our weight is our symbol of authority and power. People rub our bellies to show respect, love, admiration, adoration...and for good luck!"

"Does that happen often?" Jaxxon asked.

"Every day!" said Edmund. "It's why we almost never wear anything that covers us up. Just our cloaks, most of the time. People EXPECT to us!...As MUCH of us as possible".

"Your father must know what that's like, huh?" Cameron asked, looking at Leo, "With a body like he's got".

"Eh...Oh!" said Leo, finally making the comparison and connection. Now that he thought it over, he figured it didn't seem so stupid after all...

"Yeah!" he said. "Gosh I...I never thought of it like that...I...wow...How MUCH do you two weigh!?"

"Eh...Oh damn..." Cameron mumbled. "Uh...RYAN!"

One of the servant-boys emerged from a chamber.

"My lord!"

"Where's the public registry-book of our weights?"

"In the king's study, your Royal Highness!"

"Go and find out what they are, would you? I don't remember..."

"Yes, master!"

"Thanks..."

"It must be nice having servants", said Leonardo.

"Don't YOU have servants?"

"Well yes, but...not...personal servants. Not in Mountania. It's not the...'thing'...really".

"Yeah I bet", said Edmund. "No, no, no. Here in Fatlantis we're expected to have servants. It's very bad for national morale to see the princes serving themselves."

"Really, why?"

"It suggests that the king can't afford staff. And if he can't afford to live in luxury, then what hope is there for the rest of the kingdom? It also suggests that we're not fat enough to need servants! And that's even WORSE!"

"Why's that worse?" Jaxxon asked.

"BECAUSE it means that the future of the monarchy and the royal inheritence would be in jeopardy!"

"Oooooh...Wow...I think I've learned more in the past ten minutes than I have all day..." said Leo.

"So we can really touch you?" Jaxxon asked.

"Go ahead!" said Edmund, proudly. "Everyone does, anyway! FEEL the WEIGHT OF ROYALTY!"

Everyone laughed.

The two Mountain boys got on their knees before the princes and let their hands sink into the cool, soft, tender, impossibly loose, doughy, melty blubber.

"Oh man..." said Leo. He'd never touched anything like this before! It was like a living, breathing, growing, feeding feather-bed. It was incredible!

"Take as long as you like", Cameron said. He looked up at the clock, "We won't be expected for dinner for another...four hours..." he said.

choices: Cameron shows Leonardo and Jaxxon around his bedroom.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Never felt anything like that north of the border, huh?" Cameron teased. Leonardo shook his head. Never!

"The weight of royal duties..." Edmund mumbled. He yawned and put his feet up on a foot-stool. Just then, the doors opened and Ryan and Ethan returned, pushing a trolley with drinks and snacks on it.

"Oh thanks Ry..." Cameron yawned. "I was gettin'...huuurrrgh...hungry..."

His belly let out an audible gurgle. Leo stepped back in shock. Cameron thumped his chest and belched.

"Aww jeez!" Edmund groaned.

"Sorry bro..." Cameron grunted. He sat up in his chair and stretched.

"Gosh...you two must feel SO uncomfortable around us right now", said Cameron, and laughed. Leo blushed. He wasn't going to lie...he DID feel rather uncomfortable. Cameron smiled.

"You said you don't have personal servants. What DO you have?" he asked.

"W-well...um...We have a cook-housekeeper, Mrs. Tibbs. She has her kitchen-maid, Emily, and then there's the housemaids. Eliza, Matilda...We have Penny, who is mother's maid. Then there's Perseus and Zacharia. They're the pageboy and hallboy...They came with us, actually...and then there's Koviac, but he's not really a servant...uh..."

Leo paused.

"Katie. She's Perseus's little sister. Zacharia, Hermes and Lucy are all brothers and sisters...and..."

"You sure have a lot of servants!" said Edmund.

"Well we have a big family!" Leo protested. "There's father, and me, and mother, and I've got two little brothers, Thunder and Gabriel. And then I've got three sisters! Sapphire, Emerald and Ruby! And then there's grandmother, and Uncle Jupiter, Uncle Cannius, Uncle Excalibur..."

"Wow! That is a huge family!" said Cameron, and he whistled. "Where do you live?"

"We live in a castle! It's not like this...It's big and dark and it's made of stone...and...but it's nice. We like it. Lots of room and plenty of space..."

"Your father looks SCARY!" said Edmund. Leo blushed.

"Papa's a knight and a commander in the king's army!" he said proudly. "I'm gonna be a knight too, one day! So is Jaxxon! That's why he's living with us. Papa's training us!"

"Trying to train you, you mean".

Everyone jumped! Nobody had heard Fortis enter.

"Sorry about that. The doors were open. Are you boys behaving yourselves?"

"Yes father!"

"Yes, Lord Vanderstorm!"

"Good, good. Your Royal Highnesses", Fortis added. "We'll be joining you for dinner".

"Of course you are!" said Crown Prince Cameron. "And you can use those big muscles of yours to keep Gladius in-check!"

Fortis laughed. "What's wrong with Prince Gladius?"

"He plays with his cutlery!"

"I'm sure it's not that bad..."

"He turned my fork into a cork-screw!!"

"...oh".
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The Princes ask Leonardo and Jaxxon about Mount...

choices: Leo and Jaxxon are stunned by the enormous spread of dinner!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Can we look around your bedroom?" Jaxxon asked.

"Sure!" said Cameron. "Just don't expect me to get up!" he said. "I'm pooped!" he panted.

Jaxxon and Leonardo started exploring the chamber. They saw the prince's bed, the portraits and paintings hanging on the walls, the huge windows, curtains, plush, soft carpets, the wardrobe with its gigantic garments, the fresh, clean bathroom, and even the rooms set aside for his servants.

"Hey!" said Leo, peering under a chair in the corner, "There's something here!"

Miaow!

"Honeymunch! Come here!" said Edmund. A fat, marmalade cat scampered across the floor and jumped onto Edmund's belly. The younger prince squeezed and stroked the cat, which nuzzled him affectionately.

"Pooooor Honeymunch! Did the big scary Mountain boys hurt you!?"

"Oh shut up, Eddie! The cat's fine!" Cameron grumbled.

"This place is amazing!" said Leo. Cameron blushed.

"If you like, later, we could..." Cameron began, but he heard a bell ring outside. He glanced up.

"Oh damn! It's dinner time already! C'mon guys!"

The princes and their friends left the bedroom. Leo had to remember to walk slowly, otherwise he'd leave the princes far behind! Prince Gladius seemed relieved to have another Mountain boy to talk to, and they had a whispered conversation as they headed towards the Dining Hall...

choices: Leo and Jaxxon head into town at night. Fortis tags along for the ride.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Leonardo Vanderstorm groaned.

He sat between the two fattest boys on earth, and watched in horrified dismay as they both snorted down trays of food. It was a dizzying display of gluttony. Sausages, mashed potatoes, fried potatoes, boiled potatoes, toast, roast pork, roast beef, roast chicken, roast mutton, soups, seafood, dinner-rolls, butter, cream, oil, and a dozen other things besides! Leo stared around him in horror!

To his surprise, his father seemed to be wolfing down food just as fast as the princes!

"Hey, I hauled all your damn luggage in, I had to handle the horses and the carriage, and I'm three times your size, boy!" Fortis grunted at his son. All of which was true. And he packed it away with speed and ease! King David smiled.

"You've got a healthy appetite, my lord!" he said. "I expect a Mountain warrior needs a lot of food!"

"Yes sir..." said Fortis, helping himself to another huge steak and slathering it liberally with mustard.

"An appetite not shared by your son, I noticed".

"Leo? Oh he'll grow into it!" Fortis snorted. "Won'tcha boy!?"

"Y-yessir!" said Leonardo. King David laughed.

"I hear you're enrolling your son and young Jaxxon into Dragon's Heart Academy".

"Yes indeed".

"BURRRRP!...w-what's d-Dragon's HUUUBRRRRP!...Heart Academy...p-papa?"

"Edmund!" Queen Isobel hissed.

"Huh...Oh...Sorry..."

"Dragon's Heart is an extremely old, extremely prestigious school for Mountanian boys", the king said. "It trains them in all sorts of things. Knighthood, soldiering, being a warrior, being a craftsman or a scholar, for working in civil service...It's a very very old school".

"Papa how am I going to get in!?" Leo said. "Or Jaxxon, for that matter!?"

"Your great-uncle is the headmaster. I think I can pull a few strings..." Fortis said.

"Ah, so you're related to Sir Tacitus VonGewalt..."

"Yes sir", said Fortis, addressing the king. "He's my uncle-in-law".

"Aaah!! That's very interesting. I'm sure your son will do well!"

"I hope so!" said Fortis. "String-pulling only goes so far..."

"You'd better start pulling them pretty soon, Lord Vanderstorm. You'll want to get Leonardo enrolled before school holidays end".

"Quite", said Fortis. "Quite so".

"My sons will take your youngsters out on the town!" said the king brightly. "Why, you can start tonight!"

Cameron let out a thunderous belch that exploded around the dining-hall.

"...or tomorrow..." the king said.

Cameron groaned. "Papa you...*cough!* G-gotta be kiddin' me! I can't hardly...BURRRRRP!...move!"

"Oh fiddlesticks! A walk will make you feel better!" the king said, firmly. "It aids the digestion!"

Edmund groaned and flopped back in his chair, falling asleep at once...

"I suppose...w-we c-could take...take...t-them to the...n-night m-market..." Cameron yawned.

"And make sure Gladius goes with you".

"W-what!?" Edmund groaned. "Oh fiiiiiine!"

"Sweeeeeet..." said Gladius, leaning back in his chair, and picking his teeth with a dagger.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo and Jaxxon are stunned by the enormous spre...

choices: At the end of the week, Fortis, his son, his servants and Jaxxon head home.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"HOTDOGS! GETCHER HOTDOGS HERE!"
"GRILLED CHEESE! WITH HAM AND TOMATOES! GET YOUR GRILLED CHEESE SANDWICHES!"
"LEMONADE! ORANGEADE! LIMEADE! STRAWBERRY FIZZLE!"
"Sausage-rolls! Hot and fresh!"
"Pies! Pies! Blueberry, apple, strawberry, cherry! Mutton, beef, chicken, pepper-steak!"

"I feel so STUPID out here!"

"Why's that?"

Fortis stared at Prince Gladius.

"I'm supposed to be the princely bodyguard...What kinda guarding do I have to do when you're around!?"

Fortis laughed. He wasn't sure if Gladius was jealous, or relieved.

"You!" Fortis said. A pair of boys and their father manned a sandwich-stall in the square.

"Y-yessir!" said the man, stepping forwards, "H-h-how c-can I help you, sir?"

"One sandwich. Grilled cheese".

"Y-yessir! A-Anything with?"

"Ehm...tomatoes...ham...and...and some...and give me some onions in it, too!"

"Yessir!" said the man at once. One of his sons started frying everything up on a griddle and loading it into a toaster-rack. Beads on an abacus clattered up and down as the man worked out the price.

"Yes sir!" he said. "That'll be a shilling!"

Fortis frowned. "That's quite a lot, isn't it?"

WHAM!!

A huge knife slammed down into a chopping-block, and the boys stepped forwards with two gigantic sandwiches!

"What's that?" the man asked.

"Uh...nothing", said Fortis. He handed the man his money. The man dropped the coin into a wooden box and a bell rang on top.

"Here son", said Fortis.

"Ooh, thanks pops!" said Leo.

The squares of Regis City were packed with after-dinner shoppers and walkers. The five main squares of the city, set out in a cross, were filled with flaming torches, burning braziers and towering street-lamps. Carriages rumbled past in the streets. The two fat princes waddled slowly along. People stopped to shake their hands, rub their bellies, hug them, squeeze them, pinch them, or bow respectfully.

"I say! Careful!...Woah!...HEY!"

Fortis looked up. A fat man with white hair and a moustache waved his walking-stick at a youth who was sprinting towards him. A jingling sound at once betrayed what had happened. Gladius drew out his sword, but...

"Woah!"

"GOTCHA!"

The boy yelped as he found himself dangling upside down, over ten feet up in the air!

"Hey! Help! Put me down!"

Fortis had the boy by the ankles. He started shaking him like a bell, until with a soft 'Chink!', a coin-purse fell out of his pockets. The fat man waddled up and Gladius picked up the man's purse.

"Th-thank you, young man!" said the old man, stuffing the purse into a pocket of his robes. He stared up at Fortis with wide eyes.

"Evening, sir", said Fortis. "Oh I'm sorry..."

"WOAH!!..."

WHUNK!!

"Uuuurrrgghhh..."

Fortis let go of the boy, who crashed to earth, and held out his hand to shake.

"And thank you, sir!" said the man.

"You're welcome", said Fortis. "Alright you, up!"

The boy gulped.

"I didn't do nothin'! Honest, sir!" the boy burbled.

"Bertie you were always a terrible liar", said Prince Cameron. The boy swore and gulped!

"You know who this guy is?" Leo whispered.

"Sure we know who he is!" said Edmund. "He's a local character called Buttery Bert".

Leo and Jaxxon burst out laughing.

"Slick and smooth, like butter!" the boy smirked.

"Not so slick and smooth this time, are you, boy?" Fortis said. "Tell me, Prince Cameron, what's the punishment for purse-snatching around here?"

"Oh don't waste your time, Lord Vanderstorm", said Cameron. "Bertie's no real threat. He's a horrible pickpocket, as you can see. Let him go, he won't be any trouble...WILL YOU, Bertie?"

"Not on your life, Y'right royal rotundity!" the boy said quickly, bowing. Cameron snorted, in a 'yeah, right!' sorta way.

"Honest!"

"Oh go on!" Cameron grumbled. "Come to the palace tomorrow night. Get through the north garden gates. We'll find you something to eat..."

"Yes sir!"

"Oh...um...you could have this", said Leo. He handed the boy the sandwich his father had given him. Leo was still full from dinner.

"Cor! Thanks!" said the boy. He snatched up the sandwich and started stuffing his face with it, before jogging off down an alleyway.

"Bertie's one of the um...local characters..." Cameron said. "He's harmless, really. Just another one of the poor street-kids around here. There's a children's home and orphanage outside of town that they're supposed to go to, but they like it here too much...Occasionally we sneak them into the palace and give them something to eat. Father doesn't like it. He thinks it makes them dependent or something. But...well..."

"You do good, Prince Cameron, which is all that should be expected of us", said Fortis. "Oh look, a blacksmith's forge..."

Eldonia has the first night of serious passion that she's had in a long time...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Write as often as you like!"
"Write all the time!"

"We will! Thanks!"

"Bye!"

"Bye!"

"Papa, I wish we didn't have to go!"

"I know son, but we don't want to be rude. We'll swing by the embassy to say goodbye, but then we really have to start heading home. Okay?"

"Okay papa...C'mon Jaxx..."

"Coming!"

"Nice to see you boys are making friends with the princes!" Fortis grunted. "Especially Cameron!"

"Why's that nice, papa?" Leo asked.

"Because your Aunt Minnie is married to your Uncle Cassius".

"And?"

"And your Cousin Ares is the second in line to the Mountanian throne".

"And?"

"And Cameron is first in line to the Fatlantean throne".

"So?"

"So you're related by marriage to the future king of Mountania, my son! He is your first cousin!"

"Oh!...Yeah..."

"And you being friends with the future King of Fatlantis could be very useful to your cousin".

"Papa! that won't happen for years!"

"True!" Fortis grunted. He strapped down the trunks and thumped them with his fist. "But it's nice to think about it...Alright boys! Get in!"

The ride home was long and boring. By the time they reached Castle Vanderstorm again, they were exhausted and glad to back in their familiar, family estate.

All in all, they'd been gone almost a month. And when they'd got back, things certainly looked and felt very different...most of all, for Leonardo.

"Man..." he said as he entered the foyer of the castle. "Everything kinda looks...smaller..."

Fortis chuckled. "You're growin', boy!" he said. "You're almost six feet! Go on, get your stuff up to your room. I need to find your mother..."

It was after dinner when Fortis returned home. And as a result, he found his wife slumbering on a couch in the drawing-room, a half-open book in her limp hand. Fortis removed the book, put it on a side-table, climbed onto the couch, wrapped his arms around her form, fondled her gently and kissed her.

Softly, at first...

...then teasingly....

As she woke up, Fortis planted his lips on her face and gave her a huge smacker! Eldonia moaned loudly, and then pushed her husband away! Fortis grabbed her and drew her in! He wrapped his arms tightly around her and squeezed her against his body! Eldonia moaned...and went limp....Fortis continued to kiss. Eldonia continued to moan softly. Fortis stroked her hair. She continued to moan.

Finally, Fortis broke away, Eldonia gasped and blinked!

"You're home!" she gasped. Fortis smiled.

"I'm home".

She smiled. "I missed you..." she whispered in his ear. She wrapped her arms around her husband's body and snuggled up next to him.

"Honey...Your uncle Tacitus is still the headmaster of Dragon's Heart Academy, isn't he?"

Eldonia frowned.

"Yes. You know he is...Why?"

"Oh nothing...nothing. I was just thinking of how...WONDERFUL it would be...if one of our sons got to attend such a prestigious institution..."

"Oh Forty! Leo's too young!"

Fortis groaned. "He is NOT too young! He's almost ten! That's more than old enough to be admitted! Most kids start at seven!"

"I suppose you're right. And it would be nice for him to receive a formal education!"

Fortis nodded. "So you'll write to your uncle?"

"No. I'll speak to father, first. And then I'll write to Uncle Tacitus!" said Eldonia, firmly.

Fortis nodded. "Fine", he said. He got up to leave, but Eldonia took him by the hand.

"I have missed my lord's loving fondles and touches these past four weeks..." Eldonia whispered. "Allow me to enjoy them a little more..."

Fortis smiled. He wrapped his arms around his wife...and slowly lifted her from the couch. He held her close and carried her carefully upstairs.

"That could be arranged..." he whispered. Eldonia giggled.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"What do you think, papa?"

"Hmmm...Dear Uncle Tacitus...writing to ask if it would be possible to enroll my son, and your great-nephew, Leonardo Vanderstorm...in Dragon's Heart Academy, starting this new school term, along with the son of a friend of ours, who has agreed to this arrangement. The son of Sir Bastion DeJaeger...Yes yes, very good...But you should mention the ages of the boys..."

"Oh I do, next paragraph".

"Oh I see...da-da-da-da-dah...dum-dee-doo...Father sends his love...your affectionate niece...Lady Eldonia Vanderstorm...Haha! Yes, very sweet, my dear!"

"Haha! Thanks papa!"

*tugtugtug*

"Yes?"

Eldonia turned to see her two younger sons, Thunder and Gabriel.

"My darlings!"

"Mama! Mama done writing with gwandpa?"

"Yes sweeties".

"We wanna play wiff gwanpa!"

"Alright!"

"C'mawn gwanpa! Wanna pway swordies!"

Venatarius chuckled. "I'll go get the wooden swords", he said, smiling. "Come along my little warriors! Let's go outside into the gardens!"

"Yaaaaaay!!"

Eldonia smiled. She reached for a bell-pull and rang it. A couple of minutes later and Zacharia entered the castle library.

"You rang, my lady?"

"See that this reaches the Dragon's Heart Academy, and into the hands of the headmaster, will you, Zachary?"

"Yes m'lady!" said the servant-boy. "I'll give it to one of the stable-boys to deliver!"

"Good, good!" she said, "Thank you!"

--- --- --- ---

"Leonardo?"

"Grandma!"

Leo Vanderstorm hurried into his great-grandmother's bedroom and hugged her. Athena smiled.

"Oooh! You're getting so BIG!" she teased. "Just like your father!" she observed. Leo blushed.

"I am NOT as big as papa!"

"Oh I'm SURE you will be, my darling!" she said. "Your father says that you're going to Dragon's Heart!"

"It seems like a very poorly kept secret..." said Leonardo. "Yeah, Jaxxon and I are going to Dragon's Heart".

"Awww! Your father went there. And your grandfather. And your great-grandfather!..."

"Okay, okay, I get it. Big reputation to hold up..."

Athena laughed. "Oh darling! You'll love it!" she said. "Your father did! So did your Uncle Cannius and Uncle Jupiter!"

"What about Uncle Excalibur?"

"Dragon's Heart wouldn't take Excalibur...something about lacking a moral compass..."

Leo giggled. He'd heard all kinds of stories about his disreputable Uncle Excalibur.

"I have to pack, grandma", said Leo, "In case Uncle Tacitus says I can go", he added.

"Well make sure you pack a good cloak!" said his grandmother. "It's extremely cold that far north!"

"Okay..."

Leo headed back to his bedroom, dragged out the trunk that he'd unpacked only a few days before, and opened his wardrobe to decide what he should bring.

Leo hadn't worn his winter cloak in ages. He hadn't bothered bringing it with him when they traveled to Fatlantis, either. He brought out the dark red cloak with its brass buckle-clasp and tried it on. He rested the cloak on his shoulders and tried to buckle up the chest-clasp...

"Gurgh!...C'mon!...Stupid...GURGH!...Maybe if I bring UP....and then...yeah but then it doesn't...Urgh!"

"Weonado, Whutcha doin'?"

Ruby, his sister, stuck her head around the corner of his bedroom door.

"Hey Ruby. I'm trying to put my cloak on!"

"Hehe! Looks silly!"

"You think so?"

"Cloak all trailing behind you like a ponytail! Issa posed tah go on dah shoulders!"

"I KNOW! The stupid thing's too small!"

His little sister giggled and jogged away. "Gwamma! Gwamma! Weonado's ripping up his clothing!"

"I am NOT!"

Athena shuffled in. "What's this I hear!?"

"Gran I can't fit into my winter cloak anymore! I mean look! It doesn't fit over my shoulders! And the chain's too short!...And it's...It doesn't even go down past my knees at least, anymore! It'll be lucky if it even covers my ass!"

"Well my darling, you have grown nine inches..."

"No I haven't!"

"Oh yes you have!"

"No way!"

"All that good Fatlantean food must've boosted your growth-spurt!"

"I can't have grown nine inches in a month!"

Athena reached up and adjusted the cloak, and then glanced up and down.

"No no no! You can't POSSIBLY wear this to Dragon's Heart! Your legs are going to freeze! Take it off!"

"Take what off, grandma?" Fortis asked as he came past.

"Your son's growing out of all his clothing!"

"Oh good!"

"NOT good! What's he going to wear to school!?"

"Well uhm...He could have one of my cloaks..."

"Don't be an idiot Fortis! The boy can't wear the clothes of a fully-grown man!"

"Oh fine! He can have one of my OLD cloaks!"

"He can't have anything with holes and stains in it, either!"

"Semen washes out!"

"WHAT WAS THAT!?"

"Nothing grandma!"

"I'll measure up a new cloak", Athena said.

"Thanks granny", said Leo. He hugged his grandmother and kissed her. She stroked him lovingly and hugged him back.

"And you, Forty..."

"Oh gran, I'm too old for that crap!...Oh alright...Muah!...Love...you!"

"Awww! Granny's big strong sexy boy!"

"GRANDMA!!!" Fortis growled, clearly embarrassed at his grandmother's admiration of her grandson's...'prowess and abilities'. She giggled. "Oh darling! Every woman needs a man who she can hold onto..." she said softly. "I can see Eldonia loves you very much!"

Fortis groaned.

"Come along, young Leo! Let's measure you up!" said Athena, brightly.

"Gran he's too young for a cock-sock!" Excalibur called out from the corridor.

"FOR A NEW CLOAK!" Athena hissed.

"Oh..." said Excalibur. "Gotcha. Keep it in your britches, Leo. Keep it in your britches..."

"If only YOU could do that", Fortis grumbled.

"Too fat and long, cuz...too fat and long..."
