1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
A bell tolled somewhere in the distance. A large carriage rumbled through the woods towards an enormous castle complex of red bricks in the distance. In the driver's box, Fortis and Bastion DeJaeger sat. Their sons sat inside, with their school trunks loaded onto the roof.

"I haven't been back in years!" said Bastion. "But then I really don't have a need to".

"I haven't gone back since...my...tenth graduation anniversary..." Fortis said.

"Oh no. I HATE attending those stupid things!...What houses or clubs are our kids gonna be in, Forty?"

"Oh they go by family records. You get put into the same house as your father or older brother".

"Oh good! Then they'll both be in the same house!"

"Yes".

"Excellent..."

The carriage rumbled through a huge archway into a large, central quadrangle, and then through the mews on the side. The stableboys helped the two Mountanian men down, and helped the boys out of the carriage. While the stable-boys watered and fed the horses, Fortis led the boys through the school.

"Coming, Bastion?"

"No no, I'll wander around", said Bastion. "I haven't been here in so long..."

"Alright, I'll find you later", said Fortis. "Come on, boys!"

"Bye, papa!" Jaxxon waved.

"You be good, son!" Bastion shouted.

"C'mon boys! Keep up!" said Fortis. He strode through the quadrangle, everyone staring at him, and the two boys who dwadled along behind him, twisting this way and that, trying to stare at everything!

Everywhere they went, people stared at them.

Fortis wore his cloak and robes, and a large, ceremonial steel breastplate that was perfectly shaped to his abdomen. Underneath his cloak, were two swords and a pair of daggers. The wind caught the fabric and blew it back, and the steel glinted in the sunlight. The boys watching gasped. The buckle on the cloak displayed the Knightly Order which Fortis was a member of. Whispers followed them everywhere.

"Who IS that guy?"
"He's HUGE!"
"Man he's ARMED!"
"Look at those swords!"
"He looks badass!"
"What's with the cloak thing?"

"Hey I think I recognise him!..."
"He's not a student!"
"I think he's an old boy..."
"He's certainly a BIG boy!"

Fortis entered a large building, an the boys followed.

"Can I help you?" said a man sitting behind a desk.

"Lord Fortis Vanderstorm to see the Headmaster".

"Yes sir. He's expecting you. This way!"

The man knocked on a pair of doors.

"Come!"

The man opened the doors. "Lord Vanderstorm, Headmaster!"

"Ah!! Excellent, send him in!"

Fortis entered, his son and Jaxxon coming after him.

Sitting behind a desk was an old man. He looked to be in his sixties or seventies at least. He got up and nodded as Fortis entered.

"Fortis my boy! You're looking well!"

"Yes sir", said Fortis. "Tacitus, this is my son, Leonardo. And his friend, Jaxxon. The two boys you agreed to take in".

"Quite right! We have spaces, and everything has been arranged! They'll be housed in Swordmaster House. Which was YOUR old house, if I remember".

"Yes sir!"

"Haha! Excellent! They'll be there with another boy...Kannon..."

"Ah. Kannon's the son of my friend Sir Damascus".

"Yes yes, Damascus wrote to me, explaining the situation. Kannon will help your boys here settle in very well! Come here, Leonardo!"

Leonardo moved forwards and bowed. The man smiled.

"No need to bow! But remember...just because we are family does not mean that you will be treated any differently. Is that understood?"

"Yes...Uncle Tacitus?"

The man nodded. "When we are alone, you may call me Uncle Tacitus. Otherwise, it will be Headmaster or Sir. Do you understand?"

"Yes sir!"

"Good! Good! Well, shall we walk around the school?"

"Yessir!" said Leo.

"Good! This way!"

The old man put on his mortarboard hat, and they headed out of the office.

"Off giving a tour, Icarus! I'll be back in an hour or two!" said the headmaster.

"Yes sir!" said his secretary.

"Right..." said Tacitus. "That's the jousting-run...over there...that's the archery range...That field there is the tournament-ground for duels, fencing, swordplay etc...that's the adjoining School of Magic, across the river. There's a bridge over there", he pointed further down the road.

"These wings here...and here...and...here...are the dormitories. Each dormitory is divided by house and year-level. Each dormitory has its own dining-hall. Next to each dormitory are the classrooms. Then here is the gymnasium...and the school infirmary...and the assembly halls, offices, meeting-rooms, etc..."

"Uncle Tacitus, what are all those, over there?"

Leo pointed to a cluster of buildings on top of a series of hills, away from the main campus.

"Ah, those are the various academy fraternity houses and club-houses! We have clubs for archery, fencing and swordplay, racing, riding, hunting, jousting, athletics..."

"Archery!?" said Jaxxon. He stared excitedly at Leo, who grinned.

"Your great-nephew is a very enthusiastic archer, Uncle Tacitus", Fortis explained.

"Oh I see!" said the headmaster. "Excellent! I'll take you over there!"

The frat-houses and clubhouses were mostly filled with older boys, teenagers, and some even in their twenties, but there were some youngsters there as well.

Each house seemed extremely noisy. There was a lot of shouting and cheering coming from most of them.

"Aaah!" said Fortis suddenly. He stared a huge, stone structure. A flag fluttered from the roof. A large foundation-stone on the front porch read: "SWORDMASTER FRATERNITY".

"Your old house, Fortis?"

"Oh yeah!" said Fortis, slapping the stone walls fondly. "I spent a lot of fun times here..."

He chuckled. "A LOT of fun times..."

"Hey!" a voice called out from an upstairs window, "Big guy!"

Fortis chuckled and waved.

"Brutus who are you shouting to!?" another member of Swordmaster House asked.

"That guy out there!" said Brutus. "With the cloak!"

"What? Where? Oooh...Oh woah!"

"What?"

"I think I know him!"

"Decimus, you do NOT!"

"Yeah I do! I've seen him somewhere..."

"Where?"

"C'mon! This way!"

The two frat-boys rushed through the house, downstairs and into a room at the back. The Swordmaster House Wall of Fame.

"Uh...uh....um...Here he is!"

Decimus, a tall, blond boy with a slim build, pointed to a pencil-sketch portrait framed in glass.

"That's him! Fortis Vanderstorm! Oh he was SO cool!"

"Cool?"

"He could kick your ass in like twelve different ways! And he could fight off like four guys at once! He's badass, man! He could pump iron and stone and he was a BEAST! He was like one of THE best this house ever made! He was a star, dude! He was a member of the Swordmaster Frat, the Bodybuilder Frat, the Hunting Frat, Riding Frat...He OWNED Dragon's Heart!! C'mon! I wanna meet him!"

"He had some kids with him!"

"They're probably his sons! C'mon!"

"But Dec..."

"C'MON DAMN IT! Before we lose sight of them!"

Brutus groaned. "Alright, I'm coming! Sheesh!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"That's the climbing-tower, the rope-climb-rack, the hand-over-hand crossing...sheer wall..."

"What did you do, papa?"

"Oh I loved the climbing-tower!" said Fortis. "Gosh it was fun! All the way up! All the way down again! I loved that! I did it three or four times in an hour!"

"A hundred feet up, a hundred feet down again!" said Sir Tacitus. "Yes! I quite understand! I'd do it myself, only my knee doesn't let me climb anymore!"

"Hey! Hey you!"

The tour-party stopped and turned to see two boys about seventeen or eighteen come sprinting towards them!

"Boys!" said the headmaster, turning, his robes flapping in the wind. "'Hey You!' is not an acceptable form of address to..."

"We know who this is, headmaster!" said the boy with blond hair. He panted and gasped. "H-hi!"

"Um...Hello", said Fortis.

"It is you!"

"Ehm...yeah".

"Fortis Vanderstorm!"

The headmaster scowled!

"THIS is Lord SIR Fortis Vanderstorm, my boys! The Earl of Dynamos! Don't you DARE address a knight and peer of the realm in such a cavalier manner again!"

"We recognised your face from the wall!" said the blond-haired boy again.

Fortis frowned. "Wall?"

"You're Fortis Vanderstorm! The star of the Duellists Club, The Hunting Club, the Archery Club, the Swordmaster's club, riding, fencing, boxing, wrestling, bodybuilding..."

"Oooooh no..." Fortis groaned.

"Papa, what's he talking about?" Leo asked.

Fortis cleared his throat.

"Well...son...When I was here...um...let's just say I had a...small...reputation..."

"Small!? His name's engraved on every single trophy-cup the school has!"

"Uh...well...um...See Leo? You work hard, you get recognised!"

"Really boys! This is too much!" said Sir Tacitus, "I demand an explanation at once!"

"Oh FINE! We'll SHOW YOU!"

The tour-party returned to the Swordmasters' House, the fraternity and club-house for the school's expert swordsmen. They headed to the back of the house where a large room showed portraits hung on the back wall.

Pride of place in the center was an upper-body pencil-drawing of someone that Leo thought looked familiar. Written in neat cursive at the bottom of the sketch was...

"Fortis M. Vanderstorm"

"Hey pops! It really is you!" said Leo, staring at the picture. He noticed a long list under the portrait. "What's this?" he asked. He stared at it.

"Five-star winner of jousting for First Years...Second Years...Third Years...Fourth Years...woah! First-Class Swordsman Award, five years in a row! Completed 'The Torture-Chamber' challenge six times!...What's that, papa!?"

Fortis chuckled. "Oh the Torture Chamber was an endurance, strength and fitness challenge all prospective knights had to go through!"

"We'll show it to you!" said the blond-haired boy, brightly. "I'm Decimus, and this is my buddy Brutus! Hi!"

Leo kept reading.

"...Student Huntmaster...three years running...Excellence of Craftmanship awards in blacksmithing and carpentry...Winner of the King Dominus Prize for Bodybuilding and weight-lifting!?"

"Oooh that's hard to win!" said Brutus. "I think I broke my arm last year trying to do that..."

Sir Tacitus smiled.

"I didn't want to tell you, but your father was one of Dragon Heart's most accomplished pupils! Extremely competitive! He won more awards than most people ever do in their lives! Although he still failed his geometry classes..."

"Okay, so maths wasn't my strong-point..." Fortis grunted.

"Now boys, thank you for sharing all this", said Tacitus. "Doubtless after showering his lordship with praise, he will overlook your thoroughly disrespectful forms of address which attend his latest accomplishments!"

"Huh?" said Brutus. "OH!! Oh...uh...s-sorry, um...uh...Lord...Va-va-Vanderstorm...sir!"

Fortis chuckled. "It's alright boys, I understand. Gosh...I haven't been inside this place in years!"

"I don't understand how it works, papa", Leo said.

"Well, every student joins one of the main houses at Dragon's Heart. They're all about different military disciplines. You join the one which your family joined. It's tradition. You'll join here at Swordmaster's House...when you're old enough. But you can also join other houses and compete and contest yourself there, too!"

"Ooooh!! Oh that sounds like fun!"

Fortis chuckled. "Oh it sure is! The houses here serve as club-rooms and meeting-rooms and training-rooms. But you won't be LIVING here..."

"Certainly not!" said the headmaster. "Come along! I'll show you the dormitories and living-quarters! This way!"

Leo and Jaxxon stared at each other in shock and amazement. Leo gulped! He now felt he had a lot to live up to! At least three generations of Vanderstorm boys had gone to Dragon's Heart, and each generation had come out better than the last!

When the tour-party reached the residential areas of the academy campus, the headmaster started more pointing-out.

"The dormitories are separated by age and grade", said the headmaster. "First-years, second-years, and so-on. The normal progression is from the age of nine or ten, up to the age of twenty. Those who want to improve themselves further and become better knights, warriors, combatants or soldiers can take the extended course which is another five years. They graduate at the age of 25! The dormitories are therefore broken into three segments!"

The headmaster pointed with his walking-stick.

"First-grades to fifth-grades there...that's ten to fifteen years of age! Sixth to tenth grades...there! That's sixteen to twenty years of age! An then there's ten to fifteenth grades! There! That's Twenty-one to twenty-five years of age!"

"Wow!"

"As 'raw recruits', you boys will be in that wing over there. They're divided by floors and ages again. The youngest always on the bottom, older boys on the floors above. You'll sleep in four-bed dormitories, and there are bathrooms at the ends of each corridor. At the end of the buildings are communal rooms - games rooms, common-rooms and such. Beyond there is the Grand Dining Hall. This houses the school kitchens and dining-halls for all the students and staff!"

"Any questions!?" Sir Tacitus asked, turning to his group.

"Uuuh...Do we get to write home?" Leo asked.

"Yes, you may write home. We have a messenger who leaves the school every Friday evening. Post all letters and parcels home in the mailing-chest in the Great Hall, and they'll be posted for you. Anything else?"

"I don't think so".

"Good! I'll show you to your rooms! This way!"

The First to Fifth Years' dormitories were mostly empty. As they entered, the saw a tall, scarred man in his office.

"Headmaster!" he shouted, when he saw the man's entrance.

"Ah! Boys, this Master Ravenhurst! Master Jonas Ravenhurst teaches Mountanian History. He's also the house-master for the one-to-fives! Master Ravenhurst, these are our two new pupils I was telling you about last week!"

"Oh I see! You must be young Master Leonardo...and you are Master Jaxxon".

He shook their hands.

"What happened to your face!?" said Jaxxon, indicating the long, splitting scar, that ran across the man's face.

"Jonas was in one of the Vladian border-skirmishes a couple of years back. He's retired from military life. He now teaches Mountanian Military and National History", Sir Tacitus explained.

"Oooh..." said Leo.

"Shall I take over your tour, Headmaster?"

"If it's no inconvenience!"

"No no no! Absolutely not! This way, boys!"

The headmaster said his goodbyes, and the house-master led them through the building.

"As first-years, you'll be down here on the ground floor. Each dorm-room has bunk-beds. Four boys to a room. You'll each have a desk and a locker and space for personal items. Bathrooms are at the ends of every corridor. Curfew for grades One to Ten, ages ten to twenty, is 10 o'lock every night, unless otherwise stated. And the doors are LOCKED at that time! Curfew for grades Eleven to Fifteen, ages Twenty to Twenty-five, is two o'clock in the morning, unless otherwise stated. But you're too young to worry about that now. Your room will be here..."

The man opened a room. Fortis entered.

"Ooooh man..." Fortis groaned. "These rooms still look like crap after all these years..."

"Be lucky that this is an end-room. You have windows and fresh air and light!" said the house-master. "Rooms in the center block of the dormitory building just have tiny little slits in the walls up near the ceilings! This must bring back memories, do they not, Lord Vanderstorm?"

"Oh yeah!...Bad memories! I could never sleep on these stupid beds!...And they look a LOT smaller than what they used to!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The two frat-brothers catch up with Fortis and ...

choices: Leo & Jaxxon try to settle into life at school.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Hey! What're you all doing in my room!?"

Everyone turned to see a tallish, slim boy with brown hair. He looked the same age as Leonardo.

"Kannon, this is Leo Vanderstorm. And this is Jaxxon DeJaeger. They'll be your new roommates".

"Oh..." said Kannon. "Hi", he said.

Poof!!

"Woah!..."

CRASH!!

"Ooooww!!"

A boy with white blond hair fell off the top bunk and crashed onto the ground! He groaned and massaged his head. The smoke from a recent apparation filled the room.

"Still haven't mastered your teleportation I see, Master Lazarus!" said Sir Tacitus.

"Ooooow!!" the boy groaned, massaging his forehead. "Oh grandpa's gonna KILL ME if I don't pass this test! Oooooh!!" he groaned. "I think I twisted my ankle!"

"Oh stop crying, Laz!" Kannon said. "You can be sick in your own time! This is Leo, and this is Jaxxon".

"Hello!" said the thin, blond boy, rubbing a growing lump on his forehead from where he'd fallen off the bunk-bed and hurt himself. "You must be the boys that my brother Merlin talked about!"

"Yeah", said Leo, "Hi!"

"Hi! Oooh man I need some ice or somethin'!"

"We'll leave you boys to get acquainted. You'll be sharing this room from now on", said Master Ravenhurst, the housemaster for the 1-5 years' students.

Fortis nodded. "Bye, son!" he said. "Write if you need anything!"

"Sure pops!" said Leo.

"Don't be scared!" said Fortis, when he saw a glint of a tear in his son's eye. "You're a VANDERSTORM, damn it! No sniffling around here!"

"Yes-yessir!" said Leo, but he still felt a bit uneasy.

"We'll look after him, sir", said Kannon. "My father told me about things, too!"

Fortis nodded. "Good. Good. Come along, then, Master Ravenhurst, let's leave them be".

--- --- --- ---

"Fortis!"

Fortis was preparing to leave Dragon's Heart, along with Bastion. Both men turned. Sir Tacitus VonGewalt, Fortis's uncle-in-law, came jogging up to them!

"Yeah?" Fortis asked.

"C-could I speak to you, privately for a minute?"

"Um...yeah...Hold on, Bastion! I got stuff to do!"

"Okay..."

The two men headed around the corner of the campus mews, and the headmaster cleared his throat.

"Fortis...I know I've no right to ask this of you...but...I wondered. Would you be interested in teaching a course here at Dragon's Heart?"

Fortis frowned. "A course...?"

"Three months! Might become six months! Possibly nine. Maybe a year! Um...the thing is...well..."

"What IS IT?"

"We have a course which covers the basics of knighthood. It inspires the boys here who are training to be knights, to pursue their chosen career-paths! But I'm having a lot of trouble finding someone who will do it!"

"Um..."

"Oh it's easy! Just teach them what they have to do, explain the equipment, the fighting, the armour, the weapons and how they're used! Make it fun and interesting!"

"Why ME?"

"Weeeeell, no knights from any of the other knightly orders of the kingdom have replied to my messages, and those which have, have all declined the offer. And I thought that you would be ideally..."

"You mean because I was the school's prize star pupil for...ten years...you want me to come back and teach it all!?"

"Well..."

"No!"

"Oh Fortis please! It would be excellent for the boys to see what they could REALLY achieve when they see you! And um...it would make young Leonardo's time here, his first year...more comfortable..."

"No!"

"It would pay well!"

"Yeah? How well?"

"Five thousand sovereigns a month!"

"WHAT!?"

"It is a...a rather specialised set of classes and lessons. And very few people can teach it. So the money is very high indeed..."

Fortis whistled. He swayed back and forth on his feet, turning the thing over in his mind.

"Gurgh! Oh fine!"

"Excellent! I'll see you in a month!"

"A...WHAT!? WAIT A MINUTE!"

"See you in four weeks, Fortis! Give my love to your wife!"

"BUT!..."

"You can think up everything you want to teach them! It'll be fun!"

"But!..."

"You'll have comfortable lodgings and excellent food!"

"Yes, but!..."

"Goodbye!"

"Oooooooooooooooh SHIT!"

"What's wrong?" Bastion DeJaeger asked, when Fortis returned to the carriage.

"Never mind!" Fortis grunted. "Let's get the hell out of here!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Enter - Kannon Adlerseele

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Oh wow, this place is kinda crazy", said Leo.

"We'll help you unpack!" said Kannon. Lazarus VanToveren took out his wand.

"Allow me!"

"Laz, the last time you did that, you set my cloak on fire! Let ME do it!"

"Oh alright..."

Kannon Adlerseele opened Leo's trunk. He snorted and laughed.

"What's so funny!?" Leo demanded.

Kannon picked up a yellow and white creature with an orange tail, paws and ears.

"What's this thing!?"

"Hey! Give it!...Nobody touches Mortimer but me!"

"MORTIMER!?"

"He's a gift from my grandmother!"

"Awwww..."

"Oh shut up!"

Kannon laughed. "It's cool man. We all got little trinkets from home around here. But I suggest you keep that one hidden. Some of the older boys will use that to start pickin' on you..."

"Oh...thanks!" said Leo.

Someone knocked on the door.

"Come in!" Kannon shouted. The door opened. Master Ravenhurst was standing in the doorway.

"Good day, boys. Kannon, the boys will be following YOUR timetable for this year. I've made copies of it, for them to carry around". The house-master handed them sheets of paper. "I suggest you make copies of them yourselves, boys, and keep them somewhere safe, in your beds or in your trunks or lockers, in case your original copies get lost. All the books you'll need for your lessons will be on the bookcase over there in the corner of your dorm-room".

"Yes sir", said Leonardo, "Thank you, Master Ravenhurst".

The man nodded and left the room. "Dinner in...four hours. You'll start lessons tomorrow!"

"Yes sir!"

"You'll soon get used to everything", said Kannon. "Wakeup is at eight. Breakfast is eight-thirty. Classes start at nine. Then ten, then eleven. At noon we stop for an hour for lunch and play. Then it's one to two, and then two to three, and that's when class ends. And we can do whatever we want, or go to club-meetings and stuff".

"Oh that sounds cool!" said Jaxxon, kicking his trunk under his bed.

"Come on, I'll show you around, so long as Stupido the Magnificent here doesn't set the beds on fire!"

"OH ONE TIME!!" Lazarus shouted. "So I got a little enthusiastic with the fire-casting spell!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Leo & Jaxxon try to settle into life at school.

choices: The next morning starts with combat-training.
The next morning starts with Mountanian National History
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"C'mon! This way!" said Kannon, "I'll show you to the school dining-hall!"

"Why's Lazarus here? I thought the magic school was across the river?"

"It is!" said Kannon. "But we tend to share facilities every now and then".

"Is there anything we should know about how stuff...'works'...around here?" Jaxxon asked.

Kannon frowned. "Yeah", he said. "Be careful around the older boys. Well, not all of them, but some can be real pains in the ass. Trust me, you'll see them when ad know them when I point them out to you".

"What do you mean?" Jaxxon asked.

"You'll recognise them for what they are, the moment you see them", Kannon said.

"Most people aren't that bully-ish around here though", said Lazarus. "Probably because everyone knows that everyone else around here can kick their ass!"

Leonardo laughed. He guessed that made a lot of sense. In a school where combat-training and jousting made up physical education classes, it was unlikely that anyone picked a fight with anyone, knowing full well they'd have a real beatdown on their hands.

The main quadrangle was packed with students. They were playing cards, or chess, or coin-tosses, a few were doing push-up and sit-up contests. One teen with very short blond hair had two smaller boys sitting on his back while he did push-ups on the grass, with all his friends looking on.

"Whatever you do, don't ever be late back to your dorm-buildings. The doors lock at ten o'clock. And if you're caught out...you're stuffed".

"Is there any way in?"

"There's two sets of doors, and they're both locked at ten. If you're lucky, you'll know someone who sleeps on a ground-floor room with a window. You COULD sneak in that way".

"WE sleep on a ground-floor room with windows!"

"Haha, yeah we do. So I guess we're luckier than most..."

The four boys wandered through the school, chatting and laughing, while Kannon pointed out various rooms and buildings. Leo was about to ask where the library was, when a bell started ringing somewhere.

"Oh! Dinner!" said Kannon, "C'mon guys! Move it! Or we won't get good seats!"

At once, throngs of hungry boys and young men charged towards a huge building with towering stained-glass windows. They headed inside and lined up.

"How do we do this?" Leo asked.

"Take a tray, and a plate, a fork, knife, spoon, a bowl if you want it, a beaker, and then get in line!" Kannon said. "Hurry up! Or all the good food will be gone!"

The boys streamed past the buffet set at one end of the huge dining-hall, helping themselves to the food.

And what food!

Bread-rolls, sausages, steaks, mustard, tomato ketchup, pasta, crisp garden salads, smoked salmon, cold ham, bacon, baked potatoes, four different roast meats, thick, tangy soups, and delicious fried eggs! At the other end of the room was another long buffet table, filled with desserts.

"We'll come back for that!" said Lazarus, "C'mon guys! Let's find our table!"

The boys managed to stake out the end of a long table at the back of the room, and sat down.

"Man this place is packed!" said Leo.

"Oh yeah!" said Kannon.

"Don't the teachers eat here?"

"No! The schoolmasters dine at the Headmaster's Residence".

"Oh. So what happens if there's...something here?"

"The school prefects handle it".

"Who are they?"

Kannon pointed out tall, burly, bare-chested boys, much older, eighteen at least, with brass badges on their waists.

"Oh".

Leo stared around. There was a lot to take in here!

"Man this is crazy!" Jaxxon hissed. "I dunno how we're ever gonna get used to this!"

Leo nodded. "Totally!" he hissed back.

Leo finished off his food and wiped his mouth on his napkin.

"Hey where's the desserts?"

"Over there!" said Kannon. "That long table at the other end of the room!"

"Oh! Okay".

"Stack your dirty plates and stuff by the kitchen, and then get fresh ones!"

"Right!"

Leo did as he was told, got a fresh tray, plate, bowl and spoon, and headed towards the dessert-counter.

One look told Leonardo that the school HAD to employ Fatlantean chefs. There was so much amazing stuff here!

Blueberry pie, strawberry shortcake, buttery soft shortbread-cookies, sticky date puddings, and incredible firebrand custard! A cold, yellow, goopy thing set into little bowls, sprinkled with sugar and then blasted with flames to caramelise it. Leo took two or three of those!

Leo picked up a few other things for his friends, and then headed back to their table, beginning to regret their decision to eat right in the corner! It was a long walk, made even longer by having to weave in and out of people's legs and other students moving around in search of more food.

Crash!!

Leo was so busy trying to find his way back to his table that he crashed right into something! His own tray of food was fine, but the other guy had spilled his food everywhere!

"Hey watch it you little fuck punk!"

Leo stared up at a huge tower of a boy. He had to be seven or eight feet tall at least, with short, blond hair and a pale complexion, but with an impressive build, nonetheless!

"S-sorry!" Leo gasped.

"SORRY!? THESE ARE NEW BRITCHES YOU LITTLE SHIT!"

"I...oh...um..."

"Hey Voltus man, calm down..." said a voice next to him. "The kid's new here!"

"I don't give a shit if he was born last week! Pick it up!"

Leo put down his own tray of food and bent down to pick up the dropped tray and the bowl and plate and cutlery.

"Now go and get my dinner!"

"W-what!? I dunno what you were eating!"

"Well then find out!" the older boy shouted, pushing Leo back until he fell over!

"Voltus! I said that's enough!" said the voice from earlier.

"Shut up, Brutus! The little punk has to learn who's boss around here!"

"Oh jeez, not this crap again! Voltus shut up and sit down! Hey kid! C'mere!...Oh crap!"

Leo got to his feet and turned to the boy sitting at the table across the aisle and gawped when he recognised the tanned, brown-haired, muscular form of one of the teens who had chased after his father earlier that day! Brutus stared at Leo in shock! Then he got up.

"YOU IDIOT, VOLTUS!"

"What!? Now you're defending this little prick!?"

"THIS little PRICK is the son of Fortis Vanderstorm!"

The last words rippled through the dining-hall, and a silence rumbled through the room after it.

"Oh piss off!" said Voltus, "This little shit!?"

"What's your name, kid?" said another senior, who had apparently taken an interest in the proceedings.

"L-Leo!"

"Your FULL NAME, kid!" the older boy said.

"Uh...oh! Um...L-Leonardo Fortis sir. L-Leonardo Fortis V-Van-Vanderstorm!"

At once, people started talking. Leo felt rather bashful! Even Voltus looked extremely guilty!

"I um...um...sorry!" he said at once. "Here, l-le-lemme take that for yah!" he said, snatching up Leo's tray and shoving his way through the crowds, "hey move it you assholes! My little buddy Leo's comin' through here! Taurus! Move your ass!...Here you go, little buddy! Where you sittin' down? Over here? Okay...There you go! Have a nice dessert, okay?"

"Uh...um...uh...y-yeah, t-thanks Voltus..." said Leo, rather taken aback!

"Hey uh, n-no hard feelings, yeah? I knew who you was! I was just um...testin' yah! Seein' if you was tough like your old man! Yeah! Th-that was all!"

"Um...Sure Voltus".

"R-right! Um...Bye!"

"What was THAT about!?" Kannon asked. "Voltus Tynus is the biggest bully in the entire school! He's eatin' out of your hand!"

"Um...uh...I dunno!" said Leo.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Kannon takes his new friends to the school dini...

choices: Back at Castle Vanderstorm, Fortis prepares himself for his course...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Alright boys! You're all first-years! Most of you are also knights-in-training! What are you!?"

"Um...Squires!" said one boy.

"NO! WHAT ARE YOU!?"

"Pages, sir!" said Leonardo.

"Very good!" said a stout, bullish man with thick arms and a large, hairy body. "You are PAGES! I will be showing you some of the skills you will need. I will not cover everything, that is the job of your masters! MY task is simply to build on what they have already shown you, so that you do not become rusty! Every boy will select a sword and form two rows!"

Every boy hurried forwards and picked up a wooden sword and a small, wooden shield, then lined up.

"Closer! Closer!...That's right! Good! Very good...Now...Your sword is held in your..."

"Right hand!" Jaxxon shouted.

"Good! RIGHT HANDS, EVERYBODY! Your shield is in your left! Or if no shield, then your dagger!...YOUR RIGHT HAND, MASTER ICARUS! RIGHT!"

"Oh! So-sorry..." said a timid, blond boy, and quickly changed hands.

"Boys on THIS side...FORWARDS! Boys here! STAY! Boys here, STRIKE! Boys here, deflect! DOWN!...You step BACK and OUT! Remember - You CREATE distance, or you REMOVE distance! You don't stand around like an idiot waiting for your partner to do something FOR you! That's how you get STABBED!"

Their combat-master strolled around, watching the boys.

"No no no! Don't GRAB IT! Deflect it, boy! Back! Like this! YAH!! That's a BLADE! Not your grandmother's broomstick! You do that in a REAL battle, boy, you'll slice off all of your fingers!"

Leo and Jaxxon were fighting together, back and forth, up and down. Their combat-master nodded.

"Excellent! Jaxxon! Move your feet, boy! Leo, slow down! This isn't a race!"

"S-sorry sir!" Leo said.

"Very good! Very good! Ah! Careful! SIDE ON, BOY! You want to be stabbed in the guts!?"

After several minutes, their combat-master blew a whistle.

"Alright boys! That's enough! Put down your swords! Now we'll discuss disarming tactics! As always, distance! Use it, or lose it! Either get AWAY!...Or if you cannot get away, then get IN! And give them a bloody hard time of it! Um...Vanderstorm! Come here!"

Leo got up from the grass. Their combat-master pulled out a wooden dagger.

"Disarm me, boy!"

"Um....okay!"

Leo moved in and reached up for the dagger.

"No no no! I'm not going to GIVE you the bloody thing! This is MY dagger! Not your birthday present, boy! TAKE IT!!"

Some of the other boys laughed.

"COME ON BOY! I'LL STAB YOU ROTTEN! DO IT!"

Leo remembered something he'd seen his father do. He moved in, locked his leg behind the schoolmaster's, jerked back and pushed forwards! Then, he threw himself on top and twisted the dagger from the man's hand by grabbing his wrist and jerking it hard!

"Agh!" the man grunted. He got to his feet and brushed himself down!

"Very good! Very good! Be CREATIVE, boys! You have to learn how to work with what you have! Leo closed the distance and got near enough to disarm me! He put me down! A distraction! Very good! Now, I want each of you to take a dagger, and practice with your partner!"

School went on like this for most of the day. Combat-training, then horsemanship, then lunch, then English, Latin and Mathematics, and then dinner.

There was no homework issued to the children. This was a longstanding Dragon's Heart tradition. Much of the education at Dragon's Heart was extremely physical, there was nothing to be gained by also taxing their brains as well as their bodies, and most boys just wanted to relax at the end of the day.

It took about two weeks for Leonardo and Jaxxon to establish something resembling a routine. They regularly hung out together, and Kannon showed them how things worked around the school. Lazarus wasn't a student of Dragon's Heart, but he was a pupil at the Silver Star College of Witchcraft and Wizardry, which had a campus across the river.

Students from both schools often crossed the bridge which joined them together, making use of each others' facilities, although there was a strict 10 o'clock curfew, after which, the bridge-gates were locked, not to be reopened until dawn the next day.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Forty, honey...come to beeeeed..."

Eldonia draped her arms around her husband's huge, firm shoulders. Her hands rubbing his chest and arms, kissing him on the back of the neck.

"Oh leave me ALONE! I'm working!" Fortis grunted. Eldonia stared over her husband's shoulder at the sheets of parchment on his desk.

"What're you writing, sweetie?"

She sniffed his hair. Mmmmm.....

"I'm putting the finishing touches to my lesson-plans for the boys at Dragon's Heart".

"So you're really gonna do it?"

"Yeah I reckon so. Hey, we could always do with more money..."

"And I'm sure the boys would be excited to have such a big, strong, brave knight teaching them what to do!"

"Uh-huh..."

"Could you teach me how to do a few things?"

Fortis snorted. "Yeah? Like what?"

Eldonia slinked into her husband's lap, her hand rubbing the fat bulge in his britches.

"Oh...I have...no...i...-dea..." she said, squeezing the thick lump and rubbing it vigorously. Fortis chuckled.

"Go on, lady! Scram!...I'll deal with you later..."

Eldonia shivered. Yeah? Oh yeah! Of course, my lord...

She kissed her husband and sidled out of the room. Fortis checked over his paperwork one last time, folded it up, and put it into a leather satchel-bag next to his desk. He blew out the candles and left his office, heading down the corridor to the master bedroom. He opened the door, slammed it, and heavy footsteps crossed the room. A muffled creaking noise...

A loud gasp, followed by a long, drawn out groan.

"Ooooh Forty!!..."

"Bye papa!"

"Muah!"

"Bye papa!"

"Muah!"

**SMACK!!**

"Ooow! Damn it!"

Fortis's five remaining children shrieked and giggled as Fortis struck Excalibur in the face.

"Don't be a smartass while I'm gone!" he said.

--- --- --- ---

"Lord Vanderstorm is here to see you, sir".

"Thank you, Hermes".

"Tacitus..."

"Fortis, my lad...sit down..."

The chair creaked as the behemoth sat down. Tacitus smiled. "I heard from your wife that the King has given you another promotion!"

"Huh? Oh!...Oh that was...that was nothing..."

"Not NOTHING, my boy! Lord Sir Fortis Vanderstorm. Ninth Earl of Dynamos, Knight of the Order of the Dragon, Knight Grand-Cross! Very very impressive!"

"Oh gosh! STOP! You have no idea how much my grandmother won't shut up about it!"

Tacitus laughed. "Congratulations, my boy, very good indeed! Now, you've settled in?"

"Not yet".

"Ordinarily you'd be housed in the Masters' Quarters. But you are family, in a sense, and I thought it might be better if you took a room in my personal quarters, the Headmaster's Residence".

"Oh...thank you!"

"Nervous?"

"A bit..."

"Oh you'll be fine!" said Tacitus.

Outside, a bell tolled.

"Oh gosh, I remember that sound..." Fortis groaned. Tacitus laughed.

"The children will all be busy with their classes now. I'll take you around to my quarters. Come along, young Fortis!"

"Yes sir".

"How are your other children?"

"Fine, fine...The girls are driving me up the wall..."

"Hahah! What's the matter?"

"Oh, the usual crap. 'Papa we love you! Papa cuddle us! Papa we wanna sleep with you! Papa we're scared and it's cold and stormy outside and you're so warm and loving!'"

"Awwww!"

"Oh shaddup! It's a nightmare! They won't let me sleep on my own anymore!"

Sir Tacitus laughed. "Such is the price of fatherhood, my lad!" he said, chuckling.

Once Fortis had settled in, Tacitus sighed. "Now, do you want some time to get used to the old place? Or..."

"Uncle Tacitus, I was a student here for fifteen years! I think I know my way around..."

The old man laughed. "Quite, quite...Well I had prepared for your um...entrance in the school assembly hall as a treat for the first-year students after dinner tonight. Just for an hour. I'll make a short speech, I'll introduce you, you'll come on, do a bit of talking, answer some questions, explain why you're here, and so forth..."

Fortis nodded. "Fine, fine..." he said. "You DID do what I asked you?"

"What was that, my boy?"

"Simply to introduce me as 'Sir Fortis' right?"

"Yes of course! But why?"

Fortis sighed. "My SON is in the audience, Tacitus, I don't want him to be embarrassed right away!!"

The old man chuckled. "Oh don't worry! I've kept your incognito, and you can reveal yourself and who you are, when you are ready to do so", he said. Fortis smiled.

"Thanks", he said. "Now where do I eat? I'm damn hungry and from what I remember, this place used to serve shit to the students!..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
When the boys finished their dinner that night, the headmaster entered the dining-hall.

"Please, sit!" said Sir Tacitus. "I'm here to make an announcement! All students from First to Tenth Grades who are currently undergoing knightly training, please stand up!"

Almost everyone in the aforementioned year-levels stood up.

"Good! You'll be pleased to know that I have found a schoolmaster to fill the place of our Knighthood Training Course! I want to introduce him to you tonight. This will only take an hour, in the Assembly Hall, and then you may leave and return to your dormitories and common-rooms for the rest of the night! So will all boys in First to Tenth Grades currently training to be knights, head to the Assembly Hall! Thank you!"

"Why do we have to have ANOTHER combat-teacher?" Kannon whispered. "Isn't Mr. Bannus enough?"

"Mr. B. teaches attack and defense, swordfighting and dagger-skills, shield-stuff...there's more to being a knight than that!" said Jaxxon.

"Yeah", said Leo. "I wonder who he is?"

The boys headed into the Assembly Hall and sat down near the front.

"Alright boys!" said Sir Tacitus. "I'm about to introduce you to your new Knighthood Training Master. I know you're all very eager for this!..."

"YEAH!!" an older boy about eighteen at the back yelled out. Some boys laughed.

"Yes, Voltus, thank you! Now I have the VERY great privilege and honour, to introduce to you one of the BEST knights currently in our king's military service! He has won The King's Medal of Valour three times, The Golden Cross twice, he has reached the very HIGHEST rank of knightly promotion and is the head of his knightly order, the prestigious Royal Order of the Dragon!"

Rumbled whispers rolled around the room.

"Will you come out onto the stage, please?"

The stage creaked. Steel clanked and clinked. A towering giant of a knight dressed in full battle-gear, wearing a large, ceremonial cloak and helmet lumbered onto the stage.

"Wooooaaaaaah..." said an older boy behind Leo, "He looks badass!"

"I wonder who it is!?"

"Sir Fortis, will you remove your helmet, please?"

The knight lifted off his helmet and put on a table on the stage, and then peeled off the chainmail hood, and the woolen protective hood which was underneath that, as well! Long, thick blond hair flowed out, and a grizzled, stubbled face stared around the room. People started talking at once!

"Leo! It's your paw!" Kannon hissed. Leonardo's jaw dropped!

"Oh no!" he groaned.

"C'mon man! He's cool!"

"He's gonna embarrass me, I'm sure!"

"Naw man! Your old man's kickass! He would NEVER do something THAT uncool!"

Leo gulped. He hoped Kannon was right!

A loud, rumbling echoed around the room. Fortis started pacing back and forth, his armour clinking softly.

"MY NAME!..." he rumbled, it echoed through the chamber. "IS...Lord Sir Fortis Maximus Vanderstorm..."

Gasps echoed everywhere.

"Knight-Commander of the Order of the Dragon, Knight Grand-Cross of the Order of the Dragon. I am a veteran of four Vladian wars. I graduated with full colours from Dragon's Heart at the age of twenty-five. I was a page and squire like you! I know how hard this crap is! Being a knight is not easy!...You!"

He pointed to a boy of Leonardo's age. Leo recognised the boy as Icarus, the boy who had fallen foul of their swordplay master.

"Here! Now!"

The boy hurried up on stage. Fortis unsheathed his sword.

"Hold this!"

The boy grabbed the sword. It was immense! Fifty pounds of solid steel at least! He gasped and it crashed to the stage! Fortis picked it up and whirled it over his head with one hand. The boys gasped!

"Yeah, you like that don'tcha!? You wanna learn how to stuff like that!? I'm gonna show you! It's my job to show you EVERYTHING you need to know, if you expect to be a REAL KNIGHT and how to KICK ASS!" he roared. The boys chattered loudly now! They were getting really excited!

"Some of this crap is gonna be boring! Some of it might be fun!...ALL OF IT is important!...Any questions!?"

A boy of twenty at the back put his hand up.

"Yeah!"

"Are you that guy who has that big statue outside Swordmaster House?"

"Does the plaque say Fortis M. Vanderstorm?"

"Yeah".

"That's me".

"Wooooaaaaah..."

"Anything else?"

No-one else raised their hands.

"Right! I'll see you tomorrow, starting with the first-years!" Fortis said.

"Thank you, boys!" said Sir Tacitus, "You can return to your dormitory rooms, now!"

Leo and Jaxxon and Kannon rushed up onto the stage.

"Hi papa!"

Fortis turned. "Hey son!" he said. "How's school, huh?"

"Fine papa! Wow so you're really gonna teach the whole school!?"

"I'll be teaching two thirds of it, yes. Not the older boys, they should know most of this stuff, but those boys who are still training, yes".

"Cool!"

"Yeah yeah, don't expect no special treatment, okay?"

"Okay papa...sure papa..."

Fortis smiled. He ruffled his son's head. "Alright kids, scram!"

"This is so cool!" said Kannon. "Wait til the others hear about this!"

"NO!" said Leo.

"What!?"

"NO! Kannon you can't tell ANYONE!"

"Why not!?"

"It's embarrassing!"

Kannon sighed. "Yeah but..."

"Kan, NO!" said Jaxxon, "Leo's right. Let the other guys find out by themselves, okay?"

"Oh alright..." said Kannon. "Spoilsport..."

As they reached their dormitory, they passed by their windows to head to the back doors. Suddenly, there was a loud blast! The window-glass blew out followed by a huge fireball and plumes of smoke!

"LAZARUS!!!" Kannon shouted. A sooty blond boy stuck his head out of the broken window.

"S-sorry! I was trying to light a candle!"

"Great! NOW where we gonna sleep tonight!? This sucks!"

"I hope he didn't burn everything!" Leo groaned.

"C'mon, let's go see what kinda damage he did..." Jaxxon said.

"I'm SORRY!" Lazarus said.

"I guess it could be worse..." said Kannon, staring around the smoke-damaged room. "Laz, you think you can clean this crap up without blowing a hole in the ground?"

"I'll try", said Lazarus, "Um...cleaning spells, cleaning spells...um...Aqua Scourgify!..."

"Sorry Leo! Um...uh...Evictus Stercora!"

Kannon groaned. Yeah, that was one way of putting it.

"Let's just go to bed!" Jaxxon said. Leo and Kannon agreed. They blew out their candles and climbed into bed.

Leo was having a hard time getting used to the beds at Dragon's Heart Academy. They were large, of course, but they weren't as large as the bed Leo had at home. Not big enough to just spread out in and roll around on. There was enough room to lie down comfortably and sleep, but that was about it.

In bed, Leo wrapped his arms around his plush-kitty. He stroked Mortimer's fuzzy, wooly body and hugged him close to his chest. His one, precious little link with home. He kissed the toy on the head, squeezed it, curled up, rolled over and went to bed...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The room isn't too bad. Lazarus magically r...

Fortis talks to Mr. Bannus the swordfighting instructor, during lunch.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
A group of two dozen boys sat on the grass. Fortis stared them over. He sighed.

Gosh he knew what it was like. Sitting there, not knowing a damn thing...

He cleared his throat and headed outside.

"Good morning, class", he said.

"Good morning, Sir Fortis!" the boys all said in unison.

"Right. Mr. Bannus has told me about your swordplay training and your attack and defense. And that's all very important. But a knight does a lot more than just wave a sword around. A knight also has to know how to ride a horse!...How many of you here, ride?"

Most boys put their hands up. Leonardo, Kannon and Jaxxon among them.

"Good, good. One of the most important parts of being a knight is knowing how to ride. And there are many parts to being a knight. You must master a wide range of skills! This is why not everyone can become a knight! BUT...those who do, must be, and will be, exceptional at everything that they do".

"We'll start today with some of the basics. I want you to identify everything that I'm wearing".

Fortis had been walking back and forth, dressed in his armour. "Let's see...You!"

He pointed at Icarus. "Come up here, boy..."

Icarus stepped forwards. Fortis handed him a wooden rod. "Start! Top down!"

"Uh...Helmet...visor...gorget...um...shoulder-plates?"

"Besagues! These protect your shoulders and upper-arms!...Carry on!"

"Oh, uh, besagues! Upper vambraces, lower vambraces, couters...gauntlets..."

"Good, good...An upper vambrace is also called a...WHAT?"

"Uh...um...rerebrace!"

"Good! What else?"

"Tasset...Cuisses, poleyns...um..fauld on the insides...tassets on the outsides...um...yeah!"

"You forgot something".

"Uh...um...eh..."

Fortis glanced at his feet.

"Oh! Um...sabatons!"

"Good! Now you can get dressed! But you still have to know how to use a sword! That's another part of being a knight!...You!"

Kannon stood up.

"Come here..."

Fortis drew out his sword. "Identify!"

"Um...cross-guard, blade, edge, point, grip or handle...blood-channel...uuh...scabbard..."

"You missed something".

"Um...what?"

Fortis twisted the sword in his hand and thrust backwards! He missed Kannon's head by an inch!"

"The POMMEL, boy! When you're fighting more than one opponent, you SWING! forwards! You swing back! THRUST! There's another bastard behind you!...WHAM!! Right in the face!"

The class laughed and clapped loudly.

"EVERY part of your sword is there for a PURPOSE! Not just to look cute! If you don't know what that purpose IS, you'll never make full use of it! WHAT is the purpose of the pommel!?"

Leo put up his hand.

"Yes, boy?"

"To strike your opponents, to give balance to the sword, and to help maintain a grip!"

"Excellent! Your father must've taught YOU very well!"

Leo struggled not to laugh.

"Now, let's see how much you've learned from Mr. Bannus...um...you!"

He pointed at Leonardo again. "Come here!"

Leo stepped forwards. Fortis handed him a smaller sword. Fortis swung his sword through the air! Leo ducked and threw his up!

CLANG!!!

The jarring vibrations rattled through Leo's body so hard, he thought his eyes might pop out!

"Left!...Right! Down! UP BOY! UP! SIDE ON! Good! Good! Back! Don't just stand there! Move around! Make it DIFFICULT for me! EASY for you! You STAND THERE, it's easy for me because you're not moving around! YOU move, it's harder for me! You move AROUND me, you can hit me where I can't reach! Come on, boy!"

Leo swung his sword around, left, right, ducking and weaving. Fortis matched every strike and swing!

"Good! Good!..."

Fortis connected with Leo's sword, ran his blade all the way up the edge and smashed into the cross-guard at the end! The force ripped the sword from Leo's hand! It spun out, flipped through the air and hit the ground several feet away!

Fortis shook his head. "You're good..." he said, "But always remember to keep BOTH hands on your sword as often as possible! Or else it's FAR too easy to disarm you! See?"

"Yes f...yes sir!" said Leo.

Fortis patted his son on the shoulder. He bent down, as if smoothing out his clothes.

"Not bad, son...not bad..." he whispered in his ear. "Go sit down".

Fortis spent the rest of the lesson testing the sword-skills of the other students, before pairing them off and watching them duel each other. At midday, the bell tolled for lunch. Everyone had crowded around Leo as he headed back to the school campus.

"Boys! You're all squires now", Fortis said, as the lunch-bell tolled. "That means more advanced training. In our next lesson, we'll be going over riding, and using the quintain! I hope you boys all have good balance!"

"Hey Vanderstorm!" said one of the boys, running up to Leo.

"Yeah?"

The boys were heading back to the school dining-hall now, ready for lunch.

"Do you KNOW that guy or something?"

"Uh...why?"

"Well me and some of the other boys was watchin'. That guy is SCARY!"

"Scary?"

"He's HUGE! And he could rip our guts out with his bare hands if he wanted to! You were the only one in the entire class who didn't drop his sword!"

"Uh...oh!" said Leo. "Um...I guess I'm...just...um...just have a better grip", he said.

"It's GOTTA be more than that!" said Icarus, hurrying up.

"It...it isn't, really!"

Kannon stared at Leo. He opened his mouth.

"Don't you dare!" Leo hissed.

"Don't dare he do what?" Icarus asked.

Just then, four older boys came past. They were all seventeen or eighteen-year-old teenagers. A couple, Leonardo recognised from the swordplay fraternity house.

"Hey Vanderstorm! Your old man's pretty cool!"
"He can kick ass, though!...Damn it he kicked mine! I can't even walk straight!"
"No WONDER he was the school's star athlete and warrior!"
"You gonna be like him one day, huh Leo?"

The four older boys laughed and headed off. Leo froze as every single one of his classmates surrounded him.

"He's your FATHER!?" the boy from earlier, Wolvern, shouted!

"Uh...um...y-yeah...um...w-wasn't that obvious?"

"No! I mean...he's GIGANTIC! And you're...Well...you're not SMALL...but..."

"No WONDER you weren't scared!"
"What's he like!?"
"Is he really as cool as they always say!?"
"I bet your old man could kill all of us with one hand!"
"Leo you must be SO GOOD at...EVERYTHING!!...if you've got Fortis Vanderstorm for a father! He carried off every single prize the school has!!"

Leo blushed. "I...I..."

"Hey guys shut up!" Jaxxon said, "And if we don't hurry, we're not gonna get lunch! Now move it!"

Um...two younger brothers, and three younger sisters!"

That night, Fortis lay on his bed in the guestroom at Sir Tacitus's residence on the school grounds. Something small and fuzzy lay on his chest.

Hoppit.

Ruby and Emerald, Fortis's two youngest twin daughters, had insisted that their father take Hoppit with him, to keep him company at night. Hoppit was a little white and brown bunny-rabbit plushie which their grandmother had knitted for them, out of wool, stuffed with fleece, and then had eyes and ears sewn on.

Fortis felt rather silly taking a toy rabbit with him. But he didn't want to disappoint his daughters. Besides, at home, they were probably cuddling up to the real thing - their pet bunnies, Nutmeg and Cinnamon.

Or, even more likely, cuddling up against the body of the next big, muscular male in the Vanderstorm household. Fortis laughed as he imagined Excalibur being pestered by two little girls, begging to sleep with him at night...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Hey Leo! Where's your father?"

"I dunno!"

The first-years stood on an open field. There was nothing there apart from a shield attached to an arm. On the other end of the arm was a sack of sand. The whole thing was balanced on a pivoting, swinging post and stand. A quintain.

A loud horse-whinny echoed across the grounds. A powerful chestnut steed came thundering past! A flash of steel! A crunching noise! A whirl of dust!...

And the shield lay on the ground, cracked and shattered to pieces.

Fortis Vanderstorm brought the horse around and dismounted.

"Good afternoon, class!" he shouted, landing on his feet, wearing his battle-armour. "Today, we're gonna be practicing your horseback combat! Every knight has to know how to fight on horseback! Everyone come here!"

The boys crowded around.

"This beast here is called Vortex! Everyone, say hello to Vortex. Go around and stroke him. Let him get used to you..."

A boy put up his hand.

"Yes, Xerxes?"

"What IS Vortex, Lord Vanderstorm?"

"Ah, good question! Vortex is a Mountanian battle-stallion! These horses are bred for speed, power and strength! And when you become knights, you'll have to know how to ride one of these! So you better get used to it! Today, you're all going to ride Vortex! Once around the oak-tree over there, and back. And once you've all done that, and I've assessed your riding-skills, we're gonna have a shot on the quintain! Leo!"

"Yessir!" said Leonardo.

"Find me another shield and stick it up on the arm, wudja, son?"

"Yes father...uh...y-yessir!"

Some of the boys laughed.

"Now now..." said Fortis, "I know you all found out. I know. I know. But I can assure you that young Leo here isn't gonna get ANY special treatment because he's my son! And sure as hell neither are any of the rest of you! Xerxes! C'mere boy! Get your ass up on ol' Vortex here and see if you can hold on for the ride!"

"Okay!" said Xerxes. He held out his hands. Fortis backed away.

"I ain't here!" Fortis said. "YOU get up on the horse!"

Xerxes stared at Vortex, a tower of muscle and sinew, just like his master. He gulped nervously.

"Up on THAT!?...On my own!?"

"Go on kid! UP!"

"Uh...o-o-oh-kay..."

Xerxes reached up and grabbed the mane. Vortex neighed loudly!

"Oh! S-Sorry! Um..." He grabbed the reins, put his right foot in one of the stirrups and then, pushing down hard, threw his left foot up and over!

"WOAH!!" he yelped, and crashed down the other side! "Ow! My arm!"

The other boys laughed. Fortis chuckled.

"C'mon boy! You know it helps if you lean forwards!"

"Oh! Um...Right!"

Xerxes tried again. He remounted the horse, leaning forwards, bracing himself against the horse's neck using his arms.

"Good! Good! Alright! Ride! Once around the tree at the end of the field, and back!"

"Okay! C'-C'mon, Vortex! Uh...G-Good horsey!...uh...Tch-tch-tch?"

Xerxes shifted his legs slightly and squeezed the horse's flanks. It snorted and started trotting off.

"While we're young, Xerks!" another boy shouted out.

"Who was that!?" Fortis snapped. A boy put his hand up.

"Silas, you just volunteered to go next!"

Everyone laughed.

Xerxes returned a few minutes later, and slowly dismounted.

"How was that?"

"N-not bad! But it's kinda weird being so high up!"

"You'll get used to it! Silas! Up!"

Silas put his right foot into the stirrup on the right side of the horse, and then reached up. He grabbed the reins but his hand slipped! He snatched out wildly and his hand caught Vortex's mane! The horse snorted and whinnyed loudly! Silas yelped! Suddenly, Vortex was off! Silas slipped and fell backwards, his right foot hooked into the stirrup! He screamed as he was dragged across the ground on his back! The other boys screamed and hooted with laughter!

"VORTEX!" Fortis shouted, "Come back!"

"I got it, papa!" Leo shouted. He sprinted after the horse! "Vortex! Vortex calm down!" he shouted. He cut across the horse's path, holding out his arms and barring the horse's route.

"Calm down Vortex! Calm down! It's me! It's Leo! You know Leo! It's okay! Good horsey! Good horsey! What did that bad naughty boy Silas do to you? Did he try and pull off your mane!?"

"BAD NAUGHTY SILAS!? That horse nearly killed me!" Silas gasped, finally getting his leg out of the stirrup!

"Oh don't be an idiot, Silas! Vortex is sweet!" said Leo, patting the horse affectionately. "Aren't you, Vortex?"

SLURP!!

"EEEWW! OH GROSS! HORSE-SLOBBER! VORTEX!!"

Having recovered the horse, Fortis sent every other boy around the tree on Vortex's back. Most did very well. A couple fell off, one or two found the horse hard to control. Leonardo did the best of all of them, though. Having grown up with the horse, Leo knew how it behaved. He galloped at full-speed across the field, rounded the tree at the end, galloped back, whipped past the class and then slowed to a canter, then a walk, then a trot, then he dismounted.

"Excellent!" said Fortis. "Well...apart from Silas. He'll be in the school infirmary with that twisted ankle of his for a few days...Now! Let's move onto the quintain! You should all know how this works, so I don't have to explain it to you. But just so we're clear, what is a quintain used for?"

"Target-practice for jousting and horseback swordfighting, sir!" said one of the boys, loudly.

"Good! So you're not all idiots!...That's a relief!"

Everyone laughed.

"Right! I want you all to pick a practice-sword, line up and then you'll mount Vortex, ride down, strike the target and then ride back! If you fail, then you ride down again! You'll do it until you hit it! Once you hit, you dismount, and the next boy goes! Right! And remember, this isn't some walk in the park! You're expected to put some speed into this! No knight ever killed a guy by going out for an evening walk!"

"A fine animal, that 'Vortex' of yours!" said Sir Tacitus. He had been watching the tail end of Fortis's lessons on riding.

"Thank you, headmaster".

It was the end of the day, a couple of hours before dinner. Fortis and Tacitus stood talking. Just then, Mr. Bannus the combat instructor jogged up.

"You gentlemen just standing around, or do you want to go for a ride?"

"Ride?" said Tacitus.

"A couple of us are going for a ride around the estate".

"Oh I'll come!" said Tacitus.

"I didn't know you could ride!" said Fortis.

A group of about a half-dozen schoolmasters mounted their horses and started riding around the estate at a leisurely pace, chatting as they rode.

"Tell me, Lord Vanderstorm, do you have ANY professional teaching-experience?" asked Mr. Ravenhurst, the history-teacher.

"Some", said Fortis. "I've two squires under my tuition, and I've been entrusted with the tuition of the children of several other knights and lords in the past".

"The older boys are dying for you to teach them something!" said Mr. Bannus.

"The older boys should know it all by now! How many of them have been knighted?"

"None!" said Tacitus, "That won't happen until the ceremony at the palace at the end of the year!"

"Oh yeah that's right".

"YOU were knighted at eighteen!"

"I was exceptional".

"Oh shut up, Fortis!"

Everyone laughed.

"What else will you be teaching them?" Mr. Bannus asked.

"Everything that I know and everything that they need to know", said Fortis. "Which will be a lot", he added.

"I think you're doing an excellent job", said Sir Tacitus. "Perhaps I should sit in on your next class and see how things are going! What is it?"

"yeah!"

"How did you DO THAT!?"

"Papa, another ten feet!"

He stared at the dead duck lying on the ground.

The headmaster silenced them all with a look.

"Hey you!"

Leo and his two friends were heading back to their dormitory. Kannon was excited about being taught proper archery. They didn't hear the 'salutation' at first.

"I said 'Hey you!' Vanderstorm! Get your papa's-boy butt over here!"

Jaxxon gripped Leo by the shoulder and turned. He saw a youth of about eighteen or nineteen standing outside one of the school fraternity-houses.

"Ignore him!" Jaxxon hissed as they walked nearer, and then started walking back.

"Flavius leave the kid alone!" another older-voiced boy said. "It's not his damn fault you suck!"

"HEY FUCK YOU! VANDERSTORM! GET THE FUCK OVER HERE!"

"Ignore him!" Jaxxon hissed. Leo took a deep breath and let it out slowly.

Leonardo tried, but then things changed when they heard heavy footsteps coming up behind them!

"Are you a fucking TREE or something!? I SAID GET THE FUCK OVER HERE!"

Leo winced when he felt a hand grab his shoulder and spin him around!

Leonardo was a fast grower. Like his father before him, Leo was already six feet tall. And he wasn't even approaching his teenage years yet. But the boy who accosted him was even larger! He towered over the youth at least another two feet!

Before Leo knew what was happening, a fist hit him in the face! He gasped when he felt blood running down his nose! Warm, salty and sharp! He fell to the ground and staggered up again!

"Your old man failed my unarmed combat! Who the hell does he think he is!? I can fight just as good as anyone else! Get up!"

"Flavius! Stop it!" a voice shouted. Leo gasped and wiped the blood from his nose. He put up his hands as if he was trying to diffuse the situation.

"What!? You can't fight like your old man!? Yah!" the enraged Flavius snapped, flicking another punch that missed Leo's head by an inch! Leo ducked and punched back! He hit Flavius in the chest! A heavy, meaty 'thunk!!' Leo tried not to show that the punch did more to him than it did to the much older, taller, stronger boy he was fighting! Flavius kept punching! Leo ducked and scooted back! He tried to remember what his father had taught him.

Combat of any kind is a door on its hinges. Open it or close it! Never leave it ajar!

Leo ducked back! Then he swung around! He kicked Flavius hard in the ribs! The older boy was caught off-guard and let out a loud grunt of surprise! He staggered back! Leo shifted in! Whunk! Whunk! Crack!! He punched Flavius hard in the chest, jaw and face! The last strike repaid the bloody nose! By now, a small crowd had formed. Flavius was taller, stronger and bulkier, but Leo had the advantage of speed. And a vicious right hook.

Years of archery practice had built up Leo's torso and upper-body. Pulling and flexing bowstrings, lifting the heavy wooden bows and firing countless arrows had given him a powerful chest, back and arms. He was able to land vicious blows, one after the other, after the other! Older boys watched as the young tornado ripped into his opponent!

"STOP THIS AT ONCE!"

Sir Tacitus broke through the crowd, waving his walking-stick through the air. "Flavius! Leonardo! MY OFFICE! NOW!"

--- --- --- ---

"Because...you are my niece's firstborn child and son, and heir to your father's title, fortunes and estates, I will grant you this ONE chance to exploit nepotism, and let you tell your side of the story FIRST".

Despite being in his seventies, Sir Tacitus VonGewalt was a hard man. He was not especially tall or muscular. He didn't look like an old war-dog like his brother Venatarius, but he nonetheless managed to command respect. Leo gulped.

"Nothing happened, Uncle Tacitus. We were walking back to our dormitory after talking to you and papa! We didn't know anything! And he started shouting and swearing at us, and telling us all these things and calling us names!"

"Then you should ignore it!"

"We DID! He came after us! He grabbed me and nearly ripped my arm off!"

"And you hit him!?"

"Not first! Jaxxon and Kannon were there! That Flavius guy hit me first! I think he broke my nose!"

"Then what?"

"Well I didn't have a choice! I hit him back!"

"You didn't have a choice!? You could've walked away!"

"And had my head ripped off!?"

Tacitus nodded. "Well, then what?"

"I dunno! Everything just went nuts!"

"But you fought him after his provocation".

"Yes".

"And from what I saw, you probably beat him".

"W-well...um...I...maybe..."

Sir Tacitus chuckled. "Leonardo you are REALLY your father's son! Very well. You may leave".

"W-what?"

"Dragon's Heart Academy is a military training school, my boy! If you can't hold your own in a one-on-one fight you have no business here! I can see that you have inherited your father's fighting spirit! Very commendable!"

Leo blushed.

"I shall tell your father about this and explain things to him. But you better get that nose of yours attended to! Get your friends to take you to the school infirmary".

The headmaster struck a bell on his desk. A young man entered.

"Master Leonardo is not to receive any punishment. Fighting in self-defence is not a crime", said Sir Tacitus. "Escort him outside and see that his friends take him to see the matron. Then, send in young Master Flavius".

"Yes sir!" said the headmaster's secretary.

Flavius fumed. He'd been flogged by the school discipline-master for starting an unprovoked fight. His back burned with the welts of the heavy whip that had sliced into his skin. It stung like a million needles from where salty water had been washed over the wounds to keep them clean. A dozen vicious lashes.

Now, he sat at the back of a group of upperclassmen. Older teenagers who were in their secondary stages of schooling at Dragon's Heart Military Academy.

Originally, Fortis had only agreed to teaching the younger children how to do the basics of being a knight. But eagerness and pressure from older students meant that he'd started teaching them, as well.

"Alright!" said Fortis. "Today I'm gonna be teaching you unarmed combat. This is something you all need to know! How to fight without a weapon! You won't always have your sword! You won't always have a shield or a dagger or a spear or a crossbow or anything like that! Today I am going to teach you how to literally kick someone's ass!"

Fortis stared around.

"Brutus!"

The tall, bronzed, brown-haired hunk got to his feet. "Sir!"

"Get over here".

Brutus stepped eagerly forwards. He stood in front of his classmates at the edge of a sporting-field.

Fortis handed him a sword.

"You have disarmed me. I don't have a dagger, I don't have my sword. I don't have my shield. You are attacking me. What do I do?...Go on!"

"Oh! Uh...okay..."

Brutus swung his sword down! Fortis threw a left arm up! He blocked the downward sword-swing, twisted his wrist, grasped Brutus's arm, grabbed his wrist with his other arm and bent! Brutus grunted!

"Twist his arm! Back! Back! Back! CONTROL IT! Make sure he can't use this thing to do anything against you!...Get...BEHIND!...HIM!...And TWIST!"

"AUGH!!" Brutus yelped. A jolt of pain shot up his arm and he dropped the sword on the ground!

"There!" said Fortis. "Now...We're both disarmed. Now what?"

"Uh...Unarmed combat".

"Good! You're all big strong boys! I assume you all know how to throw a punch?"

They all nodded confidently.

"Alright. But do you know how to fight? When you're doing this on the battlefield, you don't want to be disarmed too long. You want a quick fist-fight to beat the crap out of your enemy so that you can go and pick up your sword again! That's what I'm going to teach you. You have to learn how to move fast and decisively. How to make blows that count!"

Fortis looked at the small crowd.

"Sit down, Brutus. Flavius! Come here!"

Whispers started at once.

Flavius took a deep breath in...and out. He got slowly to his feet and walked forwards.

"Yes yes yes, we've all heard!" said Fortis. He paused. "Who hasn't heard?"

A couple of hands went up.

"Oooh..."

The boys laughed.

"Flavius here picked a fight with a boy. A boy half his age, and a boy half his size. A boy who beat him up and broke his nose. My boy. Leonardo".

"YEAH!" someone shouted at the back. More boys laughed.

"This proves two things. That I know how to teach, and that Flavius does NOT know how to fight. Today I hope to remedy this issue. For all of you".

Fortis stared at his class. "Alright boys! Stop! Stop! Get up! Get into pairs. I want you all to practice simple takedown maneuvers. How to get your opponent on the ground, so that you can make a kill-thrust with your sword or knife. I'll show you a few here, using Flavius..."

The two women headed to the castle library and sat down at a desk.

"Her...Oh yes I forgot you were friends! Okay...Wait...who is this painter?"

Fortis yawned and rolled over in bed. He slowly opened his eyes.

Something was wrong...what was it?

The bed was very small...no that wasn't it...He rubbed his eyes. As his vision cleared, he realised what it was.

The bed was empty!

"Girl?" he rumbled. He got up. "Girl!?"

He shuffled to the door and headed downstairs.

"GIRL!"

Fortis lumbered into the dining-room. The entire Vanderstorm family was gathered there. The housemaids curtsied as their master entered.

"Good morning, my lord", said Eliza. Fortis grunted. His dark blond hair was a mess, he was naked apart from his undershorts, and he looked exhausted.

"Wow, someone slept in..." said Jupiter. Cannius laughed.

"Boys, enough!" said Athena. "Good morning, Fortis".

"Gramma..." Fortis mumbled. He sat down heavily and stared around. It was so strange to be back... At the other end of the table, Eldonia sat with her father while she played with her three daughters. His three daughters.

Three girls...what a nightmare. Dowries and husbands and boyfriends and...oy...

Fortis felt a slender arm around his own massive bicep. He looked to his right. He smiled.

"Hey girl..."

"You sleep well?"

"You saying I don't sleep well when I sleep with you?"

"Of course not!"

"Mmmm..."

"Aaah! Forty! Don't muss up my hair! I just combed it!...Oh great now I have to do it again..."

Vesta laughed. She kissed her husband.

"Ooooooh!" said Leo.

"Boy! You keep it shut!" Fortis barked.

Leo ducked his head.

Two boys of five toddled up to their father.

"Hi papa!"
"Hi papa!"
"We love you!"

Fortis let out a weak grin.

"Boys".

"Awwwww!!" said Minerva, as Thunder and Gabriel hugged their father. Fortis smiled and wrapped them in his huge arms. He ruffled their heads and kissed them both.

"Go on! Go eat your breakfast...Leo! You got two brothers and three sisters. You used to it yet?"

"Yes papa!"

Fortis laughed. "Suuuure..." he said.

"Oh Ares! You naughty boy!" said Minerva, cleaning the porridge off of Ares's cheek. "The spoon goes IN the mouth! Good boy! Good boy..."

"Nuuugggaaarrggghhhh!!"

"WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!"

Fortis and his brothers burst out laughing.

"Fortis! That was very mean!" said Minerva, "Oh there there, Ares! It's okay. Uncle Forty loves you very much! Don't you?" she asked, shooting her brother a dirty look.

"Huh...sure...C'mere kid...heh. You look like your momma! You got her brown hair...don'tcha got her brown hair? Who's got brown hair!? Who's got brown hair!? Pretty pretty pretty hair! Huh?"

"Oh Forty don't tickle him! He's eating!" Minerva cried out.

"Hi everyone!"

Everyone at the table turned to see a tall, good-looking young man enter. Crown Prince Cassius, now aged twenty-three, sauntered in. Fortis turned in his seat.

"Your Royal Highness".

"Oh...um...My lord".

"I hear that you've been busy in my absence".

"Um..."

"And you did not see fit to ask my permission?"

"Well...see, the thing is..."

"You dare to marry my sister without the permission of her older brother and master of her household?"

"It wasn't like that! I..."

"So it was a marriage of necessity, was it?"

"What!? No!"

Before anyone could say anything, Fortis got up.

"You. Me. Upstairs".

"Fortis!" Minerva began, but Athena gave her a "Sit down!" sort of look. Cassius followed Fortis out of the room, and upstairs to the study.

Fortis was older than Cassius, although they were now almost the same height.

"You dare to marry my only sister without asking my permission?"

"Now...my lord..." said Cassius, raising his hands defensively, "I didn't do anything wrong! We just thought that..."

"You dare to relieve her of her virginity?"

"Well to be technically correct, she..."

"Let me make a few things clear...You have married her. You have enjoyed her. You have made a child with her. With possibly more on the way. I won't complain. I want her to be happy. And if marrying YOU makes her happy, then I will not intervene. But understand this very clearly..."

Fortis stared Cassius right in the eye.

"When your father dies, you will be king, and my sister will be queen. King, or no king, crown or not, if you make my sister cry for any reason, I will hunt you down like a wolf, and I will do things to you that you will remember for the rest of your life. Do I make myself clear?"

"You cannot intimidate me!" Cassius said, "I'm not fifteen anymore!"

"Do I make myself clear?"

"My Lord Vanderstorm, I know that you come from an ancient and proud family of excellent warrior stock, and that you want to protect that. Like you said, when I am king, your sister would be the queen. I assure you I will forever treat her as nothing less than what she deserves".

"I hold you to that until your last breath", said Fortis, softly.

"Yes sir".

"Very well, then", said Fortis. "Now...Young Prince Ares...which is, I suppose, what he is...you find him to be a fine lad?"

"Yes sir. Very lively and active".

"Hmm. Far too timid".

"He's two!"

Fortis shrugged. "I need to start training my own boys..." he said.

"Training?"

"If they're to earn their knighthoods, they need to learn from a knight!"

"Oh! Yes of course! And I heard you earned a Knight-Commander rank..."

Fortis nodded.

"Impressive!"

"And I suppose you hold the same thing?"

"Lord Vanderstorm, you KNOW my father doesn't hand out honorary titles and ranks! Listen. Now that everything's over...Why don't we go hunting? All us men?"

Fortis frowned, "Hunting? Where?"

"Here on your estate!"

Fortis slowly nodded. "Fine", he said. "Tomorrow. We can go out all day".

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Eldonia lay in bed.

She was used to not having her husband sleep with her.

But she was not used to waking up and not at least occasionally finding him standing over her, staring longingly at her ripe, youthful form, desirous of marital...exercise. It wasn't uncommon for Eldonia to wake up to find her husband already in bed with her, gently fondling her, rubbing her, stroking her tenderly, wrapping himself around her and running his big, rough hands through her hair.

She would twitch and roll over and sniff his musky masculinity...and tease him...and snuggle...if she was awake enough, she might initiate proceedings...but usually Fortis would whisper something in her ear and pin her down, while getting himself into position. Eldonia would pretend to fight him off before succumbing to the will of her lordly master...And once it was all over, she knew it was silly to fight him anyway...

But for over a month, now, such nighttime trysts had been nothing but playful memories! And once again, Eldonia was doomed to a sexless slumber, without at least her husband's vast, powerful form to snuggle against and cuddle lovingly... What a thorough disappointment!

And it didn't get any better when Eldonia woke up in the morning. As she wandered the halls, chambers and passages of the ancient family castle, everything reminded her of her husband!

The ancestral suits of armor reminded her of Fortis's military background and breeding, the grand chambers reminded her of how wealthy he was. The high doorways and towering ceilings reminded her of his gigantic physique and height!

And she couldn't BEAR to enter his bedchamber! The master's bedchamber, and the bed where he had so often thrown her onto the mattress and jumped upon her, to ravish her form in ways so memorable.

Four of those memories were busy keeping her busy. Leo toddled around the castle after his mother as she entered the nursery. She sniffed.

"Whyza momma kwy?" Leo burbled.

"Momma's just sad about your papa, Leo. He's been gone away so long now!"

"Weo missa papa...Papa cuddles!"

Eldonia smirked. Oh yes. Papa certainly knew how to cuddle...and stroke...and kiss...and...Oh damn!

"Yes, darling", she said. Ooooh Leo looked so much like his father!

"One day you're going to be Lord Vanderstorm! Just like your papa!"

"Yaaaay! Wawd Weo Wandlestorm!"

Eldonia giggled. "Yes darling", she said softly. Eldonia headed downstairs to the dining-hall to have breakfast. A plate with eggs, bacon, buttered toast, grilled tomatoes and two enormous sausages lay at her place at the table. Eldonia stared at the two fleshy flanks of...Oh Forty!

"There now!" said Athena, understandingly. "You get used to it, my dear! Your husband being at war!"

"But granny what if he doesn't come back!? I'm too young to be a widow! And I've got four babies! And I might even have another coming!" she said.

"Don't be stupid! He's a Vanderstorm! Vanderstorms never die in battle!...It's not polite! They die at home where people can keep an eye on them!"

Minerva giggled at her grandmother's sensibilities.

"Oh granny! Don't say that to Eldonia! It'll only make her feel worse!"

"You listen to me, my girls! The boys will return!" said the old woman.

"Gwamma 'Teena wite!" said Leo, sitting next to his great-grandmother and nubbling away at his porridge, "Papa come home!" he squeaked.

"There! See how smart the boy is!?" Athena said, proudly, "You're a very smart boy, Leo!" she cooed.

"Papa come home!..." Leo mumbled again, and went back to trying to feed himself with the wrong end of his spoon.

Eliza the head housemaid smiled at the three slumbering tots in their cots. Downstairs, a bell jangled.

"I'll get it!" Eliza cried out, and hurried out of the nursery and down the wide main stairs to the foyer. She approached the door and opened it.

At once, everyone sprang into action, with Mrs. Tibbs taking the lead.

"Eliza, Mattie! Both of you upstairs to air out the guestrooms! Hermes, Perseus, I want the stables and the mews swept out and cleaned! Lucy, Katie, I need you to sweep the floors and make sure that everything is spotless and clean! I want nothing left to chance! Well!? Hop to it! We don't have a lot of time!"

"...I really think you should spend more time with him, Minerva".

"Mornin' girls" said Fortis, entering his grandmother's chamber, "grandma".

"Something wrong, Fortis?" his grandmother asked.

"Huh? No...But we are expecting visitors".

"Wh...WHEN!?"

"This evening. Wolfgang and his family are coming over. To see the babies, I think".

"Oh my!"

It had, after all, been a couple of weeks since Eldonia's pregnancy. Athena had completely forgotten that she had written to them!

"Oh dear! I completely forgot that I invited them to see the babies! I hope the house will be ready!"

"The servants are on it, don't worry, grandma!"
