"IT WAS FOURTEEN INCHES LONG!"

When he first came home after the war, everything seemed right and wonderful in his life. He had returned home a hero, a vanquisher of Vladians. But his wife began to resent him and all the time spent away from her--time doing hard, physical labor that made him too tired to even make love to his beautiful wife! Though he had been trying to protect her against the Vladian outlaw raiders, because of his inattention for a mere half hour of time, and because of his...ineffectualness (a word that stuck in his craw), Eldonia was now pregnant with some stinking Vladian warlord's child...and she couldn't even bear to have him touch her!

Loki saw this and grit his teeth in rage. "What do you two think you're doing?!" He ducked another swipe from Fortis's sword and took several quick steps closer to his nephews. "Fight back, blast you! They're only Mountanians!"

"Ha! Only Mountanians!" Jupiter said with a sneer.
"He obviously hasn't fought many Mountanians if he thinks we're so easily beaten," said Cannius.

The two brothers quickly took the arms of the two Vladians and held them roughly behind their backs, preventing the invaders from moving.

"How dare you enter my home and attack my sister and think you can easily have the upper hand!" Fortis yelled, striking at Loki's head.

Loki ducked again and staggered towards the window. He leered at Eldonia. "I've already HAD the upper hand!"

Eldonia flushed and turned away.

Fortis roared. "Quit looking at my woman! You may have taken her without her consent, but she's NOT YOURS! SHE'S MINE! AND SHE ALWAYS WILL BE!"

Loki parried and thrust, giving another nick to Fortis's forearm, making the Mountain lord swear. "Then, why is she carrying MY child, hmm? Seems SHE IS my woman! At least I can get her with child--something you obviously couldn't do!"

"HOW DO YOU KNOW THAT? HOW DARE YOU TAKE ANOTHER MAN'S WIFE! I HAVE YOU KNOW WE ALREADY HAVE A CHILD TOGETHER, AND YOU'RE LUCKY SHE DIDN'T ABORT THE CHILD SHE NOW CARRIES! AFTER SHE'S HAD THIS CHILD, I'LL GIVE HER SO MANY CHILDREN, THE VANDERSTORMS WILL BE ABLE TO INVADE VLADIA AND SUCCESSFULLY CONQUER YOU HEATHENS JUST ON OUR OWN!"

Eldonia blushed at Fortis's words, but hope bloomed in her heart. While she and Fortis had been much more at ease with each other over the past couple of months, there was still a small, lingering distance between them, primarily caused by Fortis's continued guilt over what had happened to her. Hearing and seeing him fiercely defend her honor and proclaim how much wanted to still make a family with her made Eldonia feel that last bit of distance wash away.

Loki's eyes widened. With the fury rolling off Fortis in waves, Loki could practically see his death in the Mountain lord's eyes. Loki was tired and had lost a lot of blood. He knew he wouldn't be able to win this fight...without resorting to other means. Loki transferred his sword to his other hand, then grasped the pistol he had stashed in his waistband behind his back. He drew it quickly and cocked it, levelling it so that it pointed right between Fortis's eyes.

"I don't think so, my lord," Loki smirked. "Now, you will let me and my nephews go, or I will kill you right here in front of your family."

A shot rang out, and Loki looked at Fortis in surprise...before he looked down and saw fresh blood blooming from his stomach. He turned over to look at the old woman, who had a smoking pistol held solidly in her hand.

"You!" he gurgled, recognizing the woman who had killed his older brother.

Loki's eyes rolled back in his head, and he collapsed to the floor.

"Thanks, Granny," Fortis grunted, "but I had it all in hand!"

"Hmph!" Athena said. "I save your life, and you complain! Such gratitude!"

Fortis chuckled and went over to scoop his grandmother up in a smothering hug. "Thanks, Granny!"

"Is he...dead?" Eldonia asked quietly, pointing at the still bleeding Loki.

Fortis scowled and stalked back over to the fallen Vladian. He saw Loki's chest rise and lower slowly, indicating the man was still breathing. Fortis sighed and ran an agitated hand through his hair. "No. He's not dead. Just passed out."

"We should let him lie there and die!" said Jupiter with a snarl.
"I agree! He invaded our home, and we were merely defending ourselves!" added Cannius.

Fortis sighed, internally agreeing with his brothers' sentiments. Death would be a just sentence for all the crimes Loki had committed, particularly against his own family. However, the political part of the earl realized that he should put the three Vladians in the holding cells in his basement so that they could await trial. Fortis figured he'd have to appeal to the king to hold trial for these three.

"I agree with you," Fortis said between gritted teeth, "but you know as well as I that these three SCUM have to stand trial for their crimes. Since we're the wounded party, I can't in good conscience preside over their trial. I will write a letter and send it off to the king as soon as possible, appealing to him to serve as judge."

Everyone nodded. They knew that King Leviathan would see that justice was done.

Fortis sneered down at Loki, but gathered up the Vladian roughly in his arms and carried him down to the basement; Jupiter and Cannius followed, prodding their captives along with them.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"A letter for you, my lord", said the king's page.

"Thank you, Vallerius", said Leviathan.

"It comes from the Earl Vanderstorm, my liege".

"Hmmm...How did you know that?"

"The seal, my lord".

"Huh? Oh! Must be important! I don't normally get letters from him..."

The king broke the seal on the letter and unfolded it on his desk.

"My Liege...Vladians...arrested...holding in castle...hold trial...hmmm..."

"Something of importance, my lord?" Vallerius asked.

"Indeed, so", said Leviathan. "Where is my father?"

"I believe he's in the cellar, my lord".

"Oh dear. Isn't he always?"

Vallerius blushed, "He do like him his um...'beverages', my liege..."

"Indeed..." said Leviathan slowly, "Find him. And tell him to round up a band of guards. At least twelve. Prepare a prison-carriage, and to pack for a journey to County Dynamos. He's to pick up these miscreants and bring them here to stand trial. Also...what are you doing?"

"Writing it down, my liege. I would not remember it, otherwise..."

"Oh very well if you must...where was I?...Oh yes. Um, and also send a letter to Lord Vanderstorm. Tell him that I have agreed to his request to have the prisoners transported to the capital. Also, that he is to come with my father when they return here".

"Why, my lord?"

"Well I need a bloody witness, don't I!?"

"Oh! Right!...Yes sir!...But...just him?"

"All the details are explained in this letter", Leviathan said, "But I would like to have him here, just in case".

"Very good, your Majesty. I'll do that at once!"

"Thank you".

Tap-tap-tap!!

"Come in!"

The heavy oak doors to the king's office swung inwards. Cassius entered.

"Father", he said.

Vallerius bowed, "My Lord Cassius", he said.

"Did I hear that grandfather would be going to Castle Vanderstorm?"

"Eavesdropping at keyholes again were we?" Leviathan rumbled.

"Well..." Cassius blushed. "I thought...If grandfather WERE going...then perhaps I could come too?"

"He's only going there to pick up some Vladians and bring them back here".

"Surely he'll stay a few days!?"

"No. Right there, and right back".

"Couldn't I go with him? He could go back, and I could return once Lord Vanderstorm comes home?"

The king frowned.

"This wouldn't have anything to do with a certain young maiden with flowing brown hair, a youthful complexion and sweet-natured personality, would it?"

"Um...maybe..." said Cassius, shuffling his feet.

"I thought I forbad you to have contact with her, after your last little escapade?"

"Papa! It's been weeks! Months! Please!? Pretty please?"

Leviathan sighed. "I will think about it", he said.

"Awwww..."

"None of that, boy!" Leviathan snapped. "Out! Vallerius what are you still doing here!?"

"Huh!? Oh!" said the page, and dashed out of the room to fulfil his orders...

--- --- --- ---

"It seems rather routine", said Old King Hercules.

"Indeed, father. But there is something else to consider", said Leviathan.

"Hmm?" the old man asked, "What's that?"

"A certain grandson wishes to go with you".

"Oh?"

"He is desirous of seeing a young lady..."

"Ooooh..."

"Father!"

"What?"

"I told him he wasn't to see her. She was the same one who had a little...incident here, a few months back".

"A few...Oh yes I remember..."

"In all fairness, it has been several months...and...well he's been a good boy. And I would LIKE to send him there...but..."

Leviathan sighed.

"The way I see it, you have two options", said Hercules.

"What options?"

"It's about trust, my son. Do you trust him to be alone with the young wench?"

"Well..."

"He took the suitable precautions, did he not?"

"Well...YES..."

"So what's to worry of!? Honestly I don't see the problem".

"Yes but...without a chaperone..."

"Lady Athena will be there. I've known her my entire life. She'll keep a sharp eye on both of them".

"Yes but..."

"Leviathan..."

"Oh very well!!"

"I'll go and speak with the guards", said Hercules, "You think about what to say to that young son of yours".

--- --- --- ---

"Papa?"

"Come in, Cassius".

"So have you thought about it?"

"I have. I've spoken to your grandfather".

"Ooooh boy..."

"And we have decided that you MAY go...".

"Yes!!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"NOT so fast..." said King Leviathan.

"Damn it!"

"You will conduct yourself as a Mountain prince at ALL times. You will be polite, civil, chivalrous, and knightly. You will show proper decorum and respect to the ladies of the household and appreciation of the household staff. You will obey the instructions that might be given to you by Lady Athena and..."

"Papa!"

"May I remind you that your grandfather and Lady Athena Vanderstorm are very close friends, Cassius? Your grandfather will be EXTREMELY displeased if he hears that you have not been acting accordingly".

Cassius sighed, "Yeeeessss father..."

Leviathan nodded.

"Your grandfather is going there to pick up these miscreants and he is returning with them here to Ferramount, along with Lord Vanderstorm. After the trial and...um...resultant matters...they will return to Castle Vanderstorm, whereupon you will return to Ferramount with your grandfather. Is this understood?"

"Wh..."

"Cassius, I am being extremely generous, considering what happened last time. Now, do we have an understanding?"

Knowing that it would be extremely foolish to push his luck, Cassius nodded.

"Yes, father".

"Very well, then. See to it that you are packed and ready to leave by tomorrow morning".

"Yes, father".

"And if I hear of so much as a single incident from either Lady Athena, or your grandfather, you'll be grounded for six months! No friends, no callers, no leaving the castle, no attending jousts, tournaments, contests, competitions, parties, feasts, balls..."

"FATHER!"

"ABSOLUTELY NOT!"

"My word!"

The door opened and a woman with chestnut hair entered. She put an arm around Cassius's shoulder, "My lord, what is going on here!?"

Leviathan swallowed, and cleared his throat.

"Nothing, my dear. Just um...having a conversation with our son".

Queen Athena nodded. "So I see", she said. "Is this concerning his actions for which he was dealt with last time?"

"Not exactly..."

The queen frowned.

"Cassius, I would expect such things from your brother Gladius, and not from you! We have had to deal with his misdemeanors as you have seen. You are meant to be our heir and our example. See that you act like it!"

Cassius groaned, "Yes, mother..."

The queen gave her son a kiss. He was certainly growing much taller now that he was in puberty. She stroked his golden hair and pinched his cheeks.

"MOTHER!!!"

The king chuckled. "Away with you, son, but mind what I told you!"

"Yes father".

"Now..." said Leviathan, once the door closed. He grabbed the queen and twisted her around, "What brings my lady into my chambers?"

The queen smiled. "My lordship's presence therein, of course..." she whispered. She reached up to his broad shoulders and wrapped herself around him. Leviathan chuckled.

"Is that all?"

Athena slipped her husband's robes off of his shoulders, "I should hope not, if his majesty will allow..." she whispered...

--- --- --- ---

"Cassie, where are you going?"

"Out".

"Out where?"

"Visiting".

"Visiting who?"

"People".

"People where?"

"Out"

"What people?"

"Mountain people".

"Do I know them?"

"No".

"Papa said you were grounded!"

"He changed his mind".

"Are you going to see that pretty girl?"

Cassius blushed. "No!" he lied.

"What's her name? Minestrone?"

"That's MINERVA!"

"Are you going somewhere special?"

"Wha...no!"

"Then why are you packing your princely sash?"

"I like it".

"No you don't! How come you're packing your scent-bottles and your razor?"

"I like to be clean!"

"Is it for a girrrrrrrl?"

"NO!"

"Is it for Minerrrrva?"

"TRITON WILL YOU PISS OFF!?"

"MAMA! CASSIUS IS SWEARING AT ME!"

Cassius slammed his travelling-trunk shut! Great! This was all he needed! His stupid little brother...

"MAMA! CASSIUS IS MFFFFFFFF!!"

"Don't you DARE!" Cassius hissed, "I'm skating on thin ice already!" He clapped a hand around his little brother's mouth so hard, he nearly broke Triton's jaw!

"Cassius, don't forget to...Oh you two are playing..." said King Hercules, coming into his grandson's room.

"Grandpa! Cassius is trying to..."

"GET OUT, TRITON!"

"Awwwww..."

"Triton, don't disturb your brother while he's packing..."

"But he's..."

"GOOD DAY, TRITON!"

"Rats! Why does everyone yell at me!?" Triton fumed, and sulked off back to his own room.

King Hercules chuckled. "Don't worry so much, my boy. Tomorrow you won't have to deal with him for at least a week!"

"I hope so!" Cassius said. "Stupid..."

"Aaah, he's your brother!"

"He's still stupid!"

"Cassius don't say such things about Triton. He loves you very much!"

"Then why is he so damn annoying!?"

"He just wants to spend time with you!"

"Well why can't he do it more quietly!? Asking questions, looking at my stuff, touching things..."

Hercules chuckled. "Relaaax, my lad! Go on, finish your packing..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Remember, Cassius..."

"YES, grandfather..."

"Best behaviour..."

"YES, grandfather..."

"You're..."

"I KNOW, grandfather!"

Hercules chuckled. He hugged his grandson and ruffled his hair.

"GRANDPA! I just straightened that out! Oh jeez, now I gotta do it all over again..."

The old king laughed, "I don't know who has more vanity. You, Gladius, or your mother!"

"Hey, I'm meeting a girl..."

"I thought you'd be used to that by now..."

"GRANDPA!"

The old king laughed again. "Aaah..." he sighed.

The king reached up with his walking-stick, and pulled on a long rope hanging from a chain by the front doors of an enormous, ancient castle. Inside, he could hear a bell jangle.

There was a moment's pause, and then the doors opened.

"Ah! Your Majesty! Your Royal Highness".

"My dear Mistress Tibbs", said Hercules. "How do you fare?"

"Well, my liege", said the old woman, "Come inside!"

"We'll be staying for dinner. And overnight. Then Lord Vanderstorm and I will be leaving in the morning, after breakfast", said Hercules.

"Yes, your Majesty. Your guestrooms have been prepared upstairs. Eliza!"

The head housemaid approached and curtsied. Her eyes flickered over the slim, handsome form of the young prince.

"The servant-boys will bring up your trunks", she said. "If you'll follow me upstairs", she said.

She led them upstairs, and down a corridor to the right, far from the main wing of private apartments. The two private chambers had been aired and prepared and candles burned in the sconces and fires burned in the grates. What a wonderful arrangement!

And to think, Cassius considered...he'd be here for at least a week. He relaxed and dressed, and then went exploring. At the end of the main corridor, he could hear a deep, male voice singing as he packed a large trunk for an upcoming journey.

Lord Vanderstorm seemed to be in a good mood. Cassius hoped that it would stay that way. The last time they'd seen eye to eye, the hulking mountain lord had nearly throttled the life out of him!

"Who you?"

Cassius stopped and turned around. A blond-haired toddler stood in the middle of the corridor, holding a fat, yellow plush-cat.

"Well Hi!" said Cassius, getting on his knees, "I'm Prince Cassius!"

The boy suckled on a thumb. "Pwins Cassicus?"

Cassius smiled, "Close enough", he said. "What's that, huh?" he pointed at the toy.

"Dis Moo-moo!"

"That's Mortimer!" said a woman's voice. Lady Athena glided down the corridor and squatted down to pick up her great-grandson.

"Gwamma! Pwinz Cassicus!"

"Yes I can see that, my dear! It's very nice to see you, my lord".

Cassius bowed, "Madame..." he said.

"My Lady Athena".

Athena turned to see Hercules striding towards her. She smiled.

"Your Majesty", she said, bobbing in curtsy.

"Please", said Hercules, raising a hand, "Keeping a grip on your grandchild is more important than formalities", he said. "Hello young fellow!"

Leo giggled.

"What's your name?"

"Weo!"

"Huh?"

"Leo!" Athena said, "Leonardo Fortis Vanderstorm".

"Aaah..."

A door down the corridor opened and two girls came out. Eldonia, who looked visibly pregnant, and her best friend, Minerva. The two girls froze at the sight of the king and his grandson.

"Do you think they see us?"
"What do you mean?"
"Maybe they don't".
"Don't be silly!"
"...The prince is staring at you, Minnie..."

Athena laughed, "oh come here, girls! Don't be silly!" she said.

"Mama! Mama! Pwinz Cassicus!" Leo burbled.

Eldonia hugged her son, "Yes my dear, that's right", she said.

Eldonia kissed Cassius's hand, "My lord".

"Lady Vanderstorm".

Just then, Fortis came out, carrying his travelling-trunk.

"Little girl...you're the one girl for me,
Little girl, you're as cute as can be,
Little girl, you were mine from the start,
The moment we...YOU!"

With a jolting 'BANG!' Fortis dropped his trunk in the middle of the corridor and stared at Cassius.

"WHAT are you doing here?"

"Now Fortis..." said Athena.

"Stay outta this, grandma! You! Now you get this through your head! You put a FINGER on my sister and I'll..."

"Fortis!" Minerva hissed. The influence Minerva seemed to have over her oldest brother seemed to have almost no limits, and Fortis took a deep, heavy, but reluctant breath.

Like the squaring off of lions, Cassius stepped forward.

"My Lord Vanderstorm", he said. "I swear to you on my honour as heir to our Mountain Throne, I will ever treat your valued and treasured sister, the Lady Minerva, with affection, love, friendship, respect and kindness, and that..."

Fortis snorted.

"Fortis! What happened was...well it was...consented!" said Minerva.

"It wasn't consented by me so the hell it was!" Fortis snapped.

"It was consented by me!" Minerva hissed, "Or does that not count!?"

Fortis groaned, "'Course it does...girl..." he mumbled, and draped an arm over her shoulder. Everyone seemed to wait for Cassius to continue.

"I know why you're upset, and I swear to you, I would never do anything to harm your sister, or bring dishonour or disgrace upon her, or your noble family and household. Your sister's a very beautiful and intelligent girl and...well I want to be friends with her. That's all".

Fortis took another deep breath.

"Alright", he said. "BUT..."

"My Lord Vanderstorm", said Hercules, "I can assure you that if there was ever any 'buts' about it, my retribution would be far swifter than yours".

"Perhaps, your Majesty, but certainly not as effective".

The old king chuckled. "With any luck, we won't have to find out".

For the first time since he spotted the royal party...Fortis let out a smirk.

"Alright whatever", he said. "I gotta get this stuff downstairs. Grandma when's dinner?"

"Not for half an hour".

"Damn! I'm hungry already..."

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Downstairs, a gong sounded.

"Dinner, everybody!" said Athena, "Come along. This way, your Majesty..."

Fortis took his wife's arm, and the king linked hands with Athena. Minerva stared around. Her two other brothers had already headed downstairs...inconsiderate snobs...

"I'll escort you to dinner, my lady", said a voice. Minerva turned to see Cassius standing behind her. Minerva blushed,

"Thank you", she said. Gosh, he looked so handsome...Had he grown even taller??

Athena followed Cassius downstairs, arm-in-arm. They entered the dining-room where dinner was being served.

"What have we tonight, Mrs. Tibbs?" Fortis asked.

"We've got pheasant pie, roast pheasant, mashed potatoes with gravy and peas, garden salad, potato-chips, fresh, crusty bread with butter, and for dessert, I've made you a very nice blueberry tart".

"Thank you", said Fortis, "Could we have something to drink as well?"

"At once, my lord. I'll bring out some flagons of ale..."

"You'll do no such thing!" said Lady Athena. She seemed offended at the very notion! "You'll bring out some of my late husband's best aged port! Fortis, ALE? When we have such distinguished company...really!"

The table laughed. Mrs. Tibbs smiled and went to find the wine.

"Where is it that these miscreants are being held, Lord Vanderstorm?" King Hercules asked, as he got up to carve the roasted pheasant.

"Down in the basement cells", Fortis said. "The servant-girls have been feeding them tea and buttered toast. And ONLY tea and buttered toast. I would have insisted on water, but Girl...well..."

"Fortis, you can't just give them BREAD!" Minerva shot back.

"This is my damn castle! I'll serve what I like to whoever I like!"

"Quite so", said King Hercules. "Fresh butter to be wasted on the likes of Vladian raiders. Lady Minerva I can't agree with you. Such a wanton extravagance on persons of no importance..."

"My sister is invested with a more tender heart than us men", Fortis said.

"So it would seem", said King Hercules.

Cassius sat next to Minerva and held her hand under the table. He squeezed it, and she blushed.

"He's right, you know..." Cassius whispered to her. She tried to hide a grin.

Dinner progressed smoothly. Mrs. Tibbs was not afraid of overfeeding her master and his family; Mountanians ate almost as much as Fatlanteans did, the only major difference was how tall they were and what happened to the food once it had entered the body.

"Mmmm...delicious pie, Mrs. Tibbs", said Fortis. "And the gravy was spectacular".

The cook blushed, "Thank you, my lord! I'm very glad you enjoyed it!"

"I certainly did. I think everyone did".

There were murmurs of agreement around the table.

"Oooh...That was wonderful", said Eldonia.

"You must be very full", said King Hercules, "Eating for two".

"Stupid Vladian stealing our food..." Fortis grumbled.

"What was that, Lord Vanderstorm?" Hercules asked.

"You know what I said! That bastard inside her is eating all her food!"

"Fortis! It's a baby!" Eldonia said.

"I don't care WHAT it is! But before I get back from this trip, the only thing that monster's dick is gonna be shoved into is a coffin!"

"Now Lord Vanderstorm, we don't know..."

"Assault, battery, home-invasion, use of a lethal weapon and offences against one of your kingdom's oldest and most noble families, my liege. A family which has served yours loyally for generations! Right grandma!?"

"Huh!?...Oh, right!" said Athena. She was busy wiping cream from Leonardo's mouth ("Maw kweem gwamma! Weo wike dah buuberry taht!")

"So I expect some sort of damn justice here!" Fortis said hotly. "I want those guys strung up like geese in a butcher-shop window!"

"Lord Vanderstorm, I can assure you that everything will be taken care of in the proper manner and that due justice wil be served", said King Hercules.

"It better be! I don't like people touching my sister!"

"Oh Fortis!" Minerva sighed. "Honestly your over-protectiveness can get rather tiresome at times! I was perfectly capable of looking after myself!"

"Not against three armed men, girl!" Fortis snorted.

"And I suppose that's your job!?"

"You're damn right!"

"Fortis! No arguing at the dinner-table!" Athena snapped, "I'm very sorry, your Majesty! But as you can see, my grandson cares deeply about our family, its rich history and deep sense of honour".

"No need to apologise. Every family should preserve their honour", said King Hercules. "Not to divert attention, but I think I should get to bed early. We have a long day tomorrow".

Fortis nodded, "We do, don't we? Alright..."

Fortis and King Hercules headed upstairs. Slowly, everyone dispersed to have an early night...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Cassius headed upstairs to wash before bed. He entered his guestroom and headed into the bathroom to clean up. He smiled at himself in the full-length mirror. A handsome teenage boy with blond hair and blue eyes, and with an increasingly muscular form, smiled back at him. Cassius couldn't help but try a couple of poses for his own ego.

After he'd washed up, he removed most of his clothes, and climbed into bed wearing just his undershorts. He yawned.

Nibble-nibble...

"Huh!?"

A fat, toffee-coloured bunny-rabbit bounced across the bed towards the door. It sat in front of the door, waiting.

"Oh..." said Cassius. He got up and opened the door. The bunny hopped off down the corridor...

Cassius frowned as he stared down the corridor. He wondered which room was Minerva's? It would be kind of thrilling to spend some time with her late at night...in her own room...all alone...together...

Cassius pulled on his dressing-gown, a deep wine red with gold trim and lining, and headed down the corridor. He turned right at the end, past the stairs, and stared down the passage. With only his candles to guide him. All the wall-sconces had been extinguished.

He took a deep breath. He didn't know which door belonged to Minerva's bedroom! There were so many...The huge pair of double doors at the end of the corridor obviously belonged to Fortis, and led into his huge private apartment. Cassius made a mental note to stay the hell away from there.

He tiptoed down the corridor, and stopped outside a door with light showing underneath. He turned the handle and peeked inside.

No, this was the nursery...

"Prince Cassi..."

"Waarrghhh!!"

Cassius yelped! He whirled around!

Lady Athena stood behind him. Cradled in her arms was a very sleepy Leonardo. Cassius gasped and panted...

"May I ask what you're doing still awake?" the old woman asked, as she headed into the nursery to put her great-grandson to sleep. Leo wriggled in his grandmother's arms.

"Gwamma...Weo wanna sweep wiff papa..."

"Oh you can't do that tonight, honey. Papa's going out in the morning".

"Den Weo go wiff papa!"

"He'll be very busy. He wouldn't be able to play with you".

"Aww...Awwwwwhhhhhh...Weo sweepy gwamma..."

Athena kissed her great-grandson on the forehead and put him into his crib. She handed him Mortimer, his yellow plush-cat. Leo hugged the toy possessively.

"Were you looking for something?" Athena asked.

"Only to ask which room belonged to Lady Minerva", said Cassius. He blushed, "I...I wanted to say goodnight to her", he added. Somehow, a look on the old woman's face told him that she wasn't fooled, but that she acted as if she believed him.

"Last one on the left", she said. "Goodnight, your Royal Highness".

Cassius nodded, and headed back down the corridor. He reached the last door on the left and peeked through the keyhole. There was still a light burning. She must still be up. Cassius took a deep breath, raised a hand, and knocked...

There was a pause.

"Who is it?" a girl's voice called out.

Cassius took a deep breath. "It's me", he said.

Cassius heard footsteps moving behind the door. Then, the doors opened...

Cassius heard a key turning in the lock. Then, the door opened a crack. Minerva appeared, holding a candle.

"Can I come in?" the prince whispered. Minerva nodded, and backed away. Cassius entered. Now six and a half feet tall, Cassius smiled down at Minerva. Gosh she was so pretty...that delicate, excellently cleaned hair which was so soft and silky. That cute little face, and that wonderful shapely body. Cassius closed the door and Minerva locked it.

"Can I help you, my lord?" Minerva asked.

"Oh...Well I...I um..." Cassius shifted his weight uneasily from foot-to-foot, "I just wanted to say um...h-how nice you are. I, I mean...how nice it is...to see you...um...Y-you're looking...r-really pretty and...um...I...I hope your brother isn't um...isn't too mad...and...uh..."

Minerva smiled, "I didn't think big brave warrior princes got scared of little girls..." she whispered, moving closer.

"Wha!? I...No! I...I um...You're not little! I...no...I mean...you're...um...Oh gosh!..."

Minerva stepped closer. She was beginning to feel a boiling within her. Cassius was so tall and svelt, and cute. He had that cocky, cute grin and that beautiful wheat-gold hair and the big eyes. The perfect teeth and his body smooth with a hint of a tan. All that military training was really building up his body...in the right places...

"Do not be afraid, my lord", Minerva said, "Little Minnie won't hurt you..."

Cassius laughed nervously and Minerva grinned.

"I mean...we're...cool...after what happened...in the castle...MY castle...um..last time...right?"

Minerva's eyes seemed to glaze over as the memory of that night wafted back into her head in the same way that the smell of hot buttered toast might waft up her nose.

"It was...it was fun..." she said softly, "I like it when you hold me?"

"You do!?...I...I mean...Of course you do!...what could these big beefy arms not do to make you happy, huh!?"

Minerva laughed! Cassius chuckled.

"Oh not so loud!" Minerva hissed, trying to stop giggling, "Fortis might hear!" she said. Cassius smiled.

Together, they moved closer to the bed and sat down.

They sat closer together, and slowly, Cassius put his arm around Minerva's shoulders. She was getting older now, and seemed to be developing nicely. He reached around and rested a hand on her...chest. Minerva gasped. She shifted slightly, until they were face-to-face.

It seemed almost impossible that Cassius could look so perfect. It was as if the queen had sculpted him out of clay and painted him. No marks, no pimples, not even freckles. His hair was kinda ruffled up and messy and it made him look cute. She reached out and felt his cheek. Then, the two young lovers moved closer together and he put his arms around her and she slipped her hands under his arms and around the back. He kissed her and Minerva kissed him back. They overbalanced and rolled onto the bed, continuing to hug and rub and kiss.

Cassius gulped when he felt Minerva rubbing other parts of his body with her hands. He started returning the favour. Then, he slowly took off his dressing-gown, revealing the fact that he was wearing almost nothing at all. Minerva felt his slim, tight body against her, and her hands felt the round, tight orbs of his backside. Such a pert little posterior...

Cassius groaned and gasped when he felt Minerva touch him in such a personal place! How dare she...

Before he knew what he was doing, Cassius found himself tugging against Minerva's nightgown, shifting it above her legs and tugging at her undergarments. Minerva gasped at this bold intrusion! Fumbling with one hand, Cassius awkwardly tugged down his shorts and his pulsating pony bucked and kicked!

It all happened so fast! Minerva felt herself being pushed back, and then she felt hands pressing on her chest!

"Does my lady consent?" Cassius whispered. Minerva opened her mouth in shock!

"Cassius!" she began, "I..."

"Yes!"

"No!"

Cassius moved in, but Minerva backed away! "No!" she cried out, "Don't touch me!"

"But you're so pretty!" Cassius said roguishly, moving closer and putting his hands against her shoulders, "And you like this don'tcha!?"

"No! Don't you dare Cassius Van Draconis or I'll scream!"

"But I want to! And you want it too, you little vixen..."

Minerva's mouth opened as she felt his hand touch her bare breast! The NERVE! But...it felt so tender...and soft...

She let out a shivering moan. A smirk crossed Cassius's face.

"Only if...we do...what happened last time", Minerva gasped.

"What did we do last time?"

Minerva reached down and grasped Cassius's member and squeezed it!

"Huh?...Oh right..."

Cassius reached for his dressing-gown and reached into one of the pockets. He pulled out a condom in a waxed paper packet. He ripped it open and fumbled to get it onto his trembling member. Minerva laughed when it slipped and missed a couple of times, but he finally got a grip on things and rolled it down.

The next thing Minerva knew, the royal ramrod was being driven inside her! This being only the second time she'd experienced it, she let out a low groan! Cassius put his hand over her mouth!

"Shhh! You don't wanna get Fortis bursting in on us again!" he whispered.

"I'm sorry!" Minerva gasped, "B-b-but I-I forgot how good it is..."

"Of course it is..."

"Oh YOU!" Minerva cried out, and Cassius laughed.

Minerva lay there while she let her royal boyfriend plunder her depths. It felt so strange, and at the same time, so wonderful, the way he acted, the way he touched her, and made her feel...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Minerva gasped as Cassius ploughed her innards with passion and lust. She felt her chest heaving and rising and falling...

"You like it, huh!?"
"Oh yes! Yes! Yes! Uuuugh...Oooooh...His Majesty is majestic indeed, my lord..."

"But of course, my queen...What else should he be, hmm?"

"Procreative, my lord".

"Hehehe...We've had lots of that, haven't we?"

"My lord!...Yes we have, haven't we?"

An older Cassius hugged his queen and kissed her. Minerva stared up at her lord and master, her sovereign and husband. She got unsteadily from the bed, and put on her dressing-gown, and shuffled out of the royal bedchamber.

"YAAAAH!!"
"YEEK!"

"LEO!"

"Aww jeez, pops..."

"Leave your Aunt alone! Go on, shoo!"

An older Fortis moved forward, and put his arm around his sister. Queen or no queen was not gonna stop from treating his sister the same way he always did.

"Hey girl", he said. He hoisted her up and kissed her. "How's stuff, huh?"

"Oh Forty..."

"What were you two doing in there?"

"Trying to add another heir to the throne".

"Damn, girl. You have an heir and three spares already! What else do you need!?"

"A princess".

"You ARE a princess, girl. Quit trying".

Minerva laughed.

Ever since she'd married, and her nephew Leonardo had come to stay at the palace in Ferramount, her brother Fortis had been paying a lot of attention to her pregnancy cycles. Just then, there were blurs of brown and gold as four towering princes rocketed past!

"WE'LL GET YOU, LEO VANDERSTORM!!"

"Boys! No running in the palace! And play nice with Cousin Leo!" Minerva called after her four gigantic sons.

"But momma..."

"Apollo, Bastion, Kannon, Daemon, don't let me warn you again!"

"...Yeees mother..."

"Now play nice!"

"Fine...Hey Bastion, go get the swords..."

"I SAID NICE!"

"What? We just wanna duel..."

Minerva threw up her hands. A queen's work was never done...

--- --- --- ---

Thump-thump-thump!!!

Minerva jerked awake!

She suddenly realised it was morning! Did she fall asleep!?

With his arms around her, and fast asleep, Crown Prince Cassius slumbered.

"Girl!? Open up!"

"Oh no!" Minerva gasped. "Cassie! Cassie wake up! Fortis is coming!"

"Huh!? Oh crap!" he gasped. He scrambled to his feet and stared wildly around the room. He quickly ducked behind Minerva's dressing-screen, just before the door opened.

"You okay, girl?"

"Fine!"

"Was there someone else in here, hmm?"

"No!"

"Uh-huh...Then why is there a male dressing-gown at the foot of your bed?"

Minerva gasped! She'd forgotten about Cassius's dressing-gown!

"Um...Prince Cassius gave it to me!"

"He's a foot taller than you!"

"To MEND!" Minerva said, "He ripped a pocket".

Fortis nodded, seemingly satisfied.

"I'm leaving", he said, "We rounded up those Vladians and King Hercules is ready for the Off. I'll be back in a couple of weeks".

Minerva nodded.

Fortis grabbed his sister, hoisted her up into his arms and gave her a kiss.

"Be safe, girl".

"Of course!"

Fortis nodded. He bent down and picked up the dressing gown. Then, with a CRASH! He pushed the dressing-screen aside! Cassius stood there, buck-naked apart from a towel wrapped around his waist.

Fortis snorted, "I might've known..." he muttered. He grabbed Cassius by the shoulders, hauled him up and pinned him to the nearest wall.

"Because of your grandfather, I will consent to having you stay in my house as my guest in my absence. But, if I find out that Minerva's pregnant, I will know why, and by whom. And when I do, you will either stop breathing, or you will marry her and make her your queen. Do I make myself clear?"

Cassius nodded.

"Good. Have a nice holiday".

"Fortis! You can't treat him like that!" Minerva hissed.

"Why, because he's a prince!?"

"Because he's my boyfriend!"

Fortis turned on his sister.

"You are my sister. And I'll be damned if anything happens to you. You understand!?"

"Nothing's GOING to happen!" Minerva said, "Now don't worry! Besides, grandmother's here! She'll be our chaperone".

"Some chaperone!"

"I beg your pardon?" said Lady Athena, entering her granddaughter's bedroom, "Fortis, you better hurry; King Hercules won't wait, you know".

"Cassius snuck out of his room into girl's room and you didn't know!?" Fortis snapped.

"Wh...of course I knew! I told him where it was!"

"YOU WHAT!?"

"Fortis! It's not a secret!" Athena said. "Besides. I knew he was a sensible boy. He'd brought the necessary protection".

"Ho-how..."

Cassius and Fortis gawped at the old lady. Athena smiled.

"I could feel the paper packets in the pockets of the prince's dressing-gown. Fortis, you should trust him more. You'll get along better. His intentions are always honourable and safe".

Cassius nodded, glad that someone was on his side, for a change!

"Fine!...I...I gotta go", Fortis said, and hurried downstairs.

"You could just say that I was right!" Athena called downstairs. Minerva and Cassius burst out laughing.

"Now come along", said Athena, "It's time for breakfast!"

"Yes grandmother. Come along, Cassius. You can just wear your dressing-gown", Minerva said. Cassius nodded. He bent down and picked it up. Several more paper-wrapped packets fell onto the floor. Minerva gawped at the selection on the ground.

"If you're expecting to use all those up before my brother comes home, don't get your hopes up..." she teased.

Cassius blushed and quickly picked them all up again.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"MAMA!!!!"

Athena hurried down the corridor and entered the nursery.

"Oooh there there!" she said. Leo wailed and sobbed, holding tightly to his toy kitten. He had a death-grip on his little animal comforter.

Outside, thunder rumbled and crackled. Lightning flashed, and rain poured down.

"It's alright, it's just a thunderstorm!" said Athena. "It's just a..."

BOOM!!

"AAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!"

"Shhh! Shhh...there there..."

Athena pushed the rocking-chair over to the windows and sat down. Leo sat in his great-grandmother's lap, his head pressed against her chest, sobbing.

"Look Leo...Leo look! See? It's just rain...see? Just rain..."

Rrrrrruuuummmmble...

"Uuuuuuuh..."

Lightning flashed across the sky, lighting up the room a brilliant white-blue for a second, and then vanishing. Leo sobbed and cried.

"Look Leo!" said Athena, "It's alright. Look at the pretty lightning..."

Leo sniffled. He was being SILLY! Papa wasn't scared of the stormlights! He wasn't going to be scared either! No way! No sir! No ma'am! No...

CRACK!

"Waaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaah!!!"

"Hahahahah!! What's going on!?"

Cannius and Jupiter came in, carrying candles. They watched as their nephew trembled against his grandmother's chest.

"I'm just trying to acclimatise him to the storm", Athena said, "Like I did with you two when you were his age".

"Oh yeah", said Jupiter, "Hey Canny, remember the Lightning Lord?"

"Whitening waud?" Leo mumbled.

"Oh yeah", said Cannius, "The Lightning Lord is someone who lives in the sky. He sends down the big bolts of lightning to light the way for travellers who are out in storms, so that they can find their way to safety".

Athena laughed. The Lightning Lord was a character she'd made up, to try and calm her grandsons' fears! She'd completely forgotten.

"Gwamma! Uckle Candywuss whying!"

"Oh no he's not! There really is a Lightning Lord. See, when storms come, it's so dark and scary and all the candles and lamps are blown out! So he sends down lightning to brighten up the stormy skies, so that people can find their way home safely, and get out of the rain!"

Leo stared at his grandmother. If granny said it, then it HAD to be true! Granny never lied about anything!

Leo turned around, and pressed his hands against the arm of the rocking chair. He watched as bolts of lightning flashed against the sky. It was so mesmerising and dazzling...

--- --- --- ---

Outside in the bucketing rain, which was being driven sideways by the relentless wind, a cloaked figure huddled along a dirt road, leaning on a staff. The cloak was drenched through and the figure beneath was freezing, and soaking wet. He may as well have swum through a river instead of walking.

A lightning bolt exploded over the sky and in the flash of light, the traveler spotted the silhouette of a towering castle against the stormy night sky. Lights burned in the windows, so someone was obviously home. Shivering, the figure kept walking. The only way this night could possibly get any worse was if it started snowing.

Fighting the soaking rain, the figure entered the castle grounds and staggered up the main driveway towards the front doors. On his last legs, he raised the heavy knockers on the front doors and dropped them back...

--- --- --- ---

WHAM!!...WHAM!!

Just getting over his fear of the lightning, Leo burst into tears again!

"What was that!?" said Athena.

"Sounded like the knockers on the front door", said Jupiter, "But it's raining sideways outside! There can't be anyone out in THIS kind of weather!"

WHAM!!...WHAM!!

"Maybe Fortis forgot his keys?" Cannius asked.

"Don't be stupid. If Fortis forgot his keys, he'd climb up through one of the windows".

"Oh yeah..."

"There's someone at the front door!" said Minerva.

"Who is it?" Athena asked.

"I haven't looked..."

"I'll go", said Athena, handing Leo to her granddaughter.

"Oh granny be careful! It might be mean people!"

Cassius held onto Minerva. "It's okay. You, Jupiter, Cannius, you better go too".

"Who are you tellin' to...Oh right, prince, prince...I keep forgetting..." Jupiter said. "Alright, we're goin'..."

Slowly, the entire upstairs household made their way to the front door. The knocking continued. Leo calmed down now that he realised it was the doorknocker.

Athena approached the door. Cannius picked up a fireplace poker from the parlour, just in case.

Slowly, Athena drove back the bolts and pulled the door open. Despite its height and immense weight, Athena had been opening and closing these massive doors every day for fifty years. She could easily handle it.

Standing in the alcove was a figure about seven-and-a-half feet tall, and soaked to the skin! Suddenly, a walking-staff in his hand clattered to the ground and without a word, the knocker keeled over and collapsed in the hall! A sack, presumably holding his possessions, dropped to the ground at his feet. Athena gasped!

"The poor fellow! He must've been travelling all day like this! Jupiter get him inside quickly before he dies of the damp!"

"Damp!? Gran he's soaked through!" Cannius grunted. He grabbed the figure by his arms and hauled him inside while Jupiter closed the front door.

"Who is he?" Minerva asked. They pulled the hood off of the cloak. The face was unkempt, and unshaven. He looked like he hadn't seen a razor-blade in at least two weeks. The face was youngish. Perhaps seventeen, despite the weathering and the grizzled stubble, Minerva could tell that he had a rough sort of handsomeness about him. He looked somehow familiar...She frowned as she tried to figure out why...

"We better get him upstairs and out of those clothes..." said Jupiter. He bent down to grab the man's arm while Cannius put his own arms under the man's legs. Together, they hoisted the man up in a sitting position, and started to carry him up the stairs. Normally it would only take one of the Vanderstorm twins to do this, but the man's heavy clothes were soaked through with water, which almost doubled his bodyweight. Through the damp, Cannius could feel the man's muscular back and shoulders.

"Down here!" said Athena. She opened a door to a guest-room. "I'll tell Eliza to light a fire. Someone get him out of those clothes! And BURN them! They smell horrible!"

"You can do that, Minnie", said Cannius.

"No way!" said Minerva, "I'm not touching him! He's filthy!"

As Eliza the housemaid lit a fire, the Vanderstorm family gathered around the bed. The figure lying upon it coughed, and slowly opened his eyes. He spied Cassius and moaned.

"F-f-f-For-forty...Uh-huuuugh...uuuunngh...Ulp!..."

And then he passed out.

"Forty!?" said Cassius, "I'm not Forty! I'm 16!"

"I THINK he means Forty!" said Minerva, "Fortis! That's always been his nickname in the family".

"You think this guy is family?" Cannius asked.

"He looks kinda familiar..." Jupiter mumbled. They all turned to Athena.

"We'll know more when he wakes up," she said. "Someone undress him, and then dry him, and then let him sleep".

Minerva picked up the sack which held the stranger's belongings. Without warning, the water-rotten base suddenly ripped open! All the sack's contents exploded onto the floor!

"Oh dear!" she gasped. Jupiter left, and returned with an old barrel.

"Here, put all that stuff in here", he said, "That sack is useless!"

Jupiter put the barrel on a table and Minerva started picking everything up. It was an odd assortment of things.

"A money-pouch...with...fifty sovereigns in it...a set of keys...Some sort of uniform...Handcuffs...chains..."

Minerva picked up something about six feet long and very heavy. She unsheathed a rusty old sword.

"Eeeewww!!" she yelped, and dropped it! "That thing is FILTHY!"

Cassius picked it up. "It's a pretty standard sword. Looks old".

Minerva reached down and picked up a metallic disc on a chain. Scratched into the steel plate was a series of letters and numbers.

Cassius grabbed the disc.

"I've seen these! Papa showed them to me..."

"What is it?" Athena asked.

"It's a prison-plate", said Cassius.

"A WHAT?"

"A prison plate", he said again, "They're worn around the neck on a chain, by convicts. They have stuff like name, date, crime, and all that stuff".

"What does it say there?" said Athena.

Cassius held the plate up to the light. It was made of copper. Engraved into it were some letters and numbers and words.

"This is his name..." Cassius said. "Um...His initials and stuff. It says 'Excal. R. V/D Storm..."

Athena's mouth opened slowly, "V...Van-Der-Storm?"

"Yeah!...Oooooh..." Cassius said, when he realised what that meant. "Um...and then this is the date of his imprisonment and...wow it's been extended three times over!"

"What else is there?"

"Then down here is the crime he would've been imprisoned for. It says here, thievery, robbery, ungentlemanly conduct and...something I can't read...Oh, brawling..."

"Oh dear..." said Athena.

Cassius turned the plate over to the other side.

"This should have the prison where he was held. Oh wow..."

"What is it?" Minerva asked.

"'Castle Ravenwood..."

"Woah..." said Jupiter, "I heard about that place..."

"What's Castle Ravenwood?" Minerva asked.

"Castle Ravenwood is a prison", Cassius said. "It's up in the northern highlands, near the Vladian border. It's got gold and silver mines there. And the prisoners carve and split rocks, they make chains, they do ropemaking, quarrying. It's freezing cold all year round..."

"Sounds like a horrible place!" said Minerva, hugging her boyfriend for comfort.

"If that's where this guy came from, he's come a VERY long way", said Cassius. "What should we do, Lady Vanderstorm?" Cassius asked his hostess.

Athena sighed. "I will take the plate", she said, indicating the prison-plate. "I want to find out exactly who this person is. Minerva, go downstairs and find Eliza or Mrs. Tibbs. Tell them to prepare some buttered toast and some tea for him. Then find one of Fortis's razors..."

"I can't do that!" said Minerva.

"Why not?"

"Fortis's razors are made of Obesitan ivory! They cost a fortune! AND they're antique AND a family heirloom! I wouldn't trust them around someone like...THAT!"

"Someone like THAT might be a relative of yours!"

"No!"

"Well...you could at least undress him, and lay out some of Fortis's old clothing for him to wear".

"Alright I'll do that", said Minerva.

"Where's Eldonia?" Jupiter asked.

"She's in bed. This pregnancy is wearing her out", Cannius said.

As everyone dispersed, Minerva went to her bedroom and came back with her tailoring shears, enormous, razor-sharp scissors used for cutting cloth. Fortis had honed them on a sharpening wheel until they were so sharp they'd draw blood.

The giant on the bed was out cold. Cassius entered, holding a knife.

"I thought I'd keep you company, just in case he wakes up or something", Cassius whispered. Minerva nodded.

Starting at his chest and shoulders, Minerva began to cut. The shears chomped through the thick woolen fabric, down his chest, past his heart, and down to his navel. Minerva slowly peeled back the soaking layers of cloth, and then she started removing his sleeves from his tunic and robes. She removed the hood and the cloak, and threw the soaking scraps of fabric onto the fire. The fire hissed and sizzled from the moisture, and let off great clouds of steam.

The beast had dark brown hair and thick, bulging, tightly-formed muscles. Minerva gawped at the size and apparent virility of the monster. He was very tall. At least seven feet. Even through his beard, she could see he had a strong, angular jaw. His body was bronzed and dark, and the skin on his hands was rough and callused.

"The rock-splitting, the mining and the chain-making makes them incredibly strong", Cassius said. "All that physical labour builds up HUGE muscles".

Minerva nodded. She bet!

"Well...that's everything!"

"No, you still have to do his pants!"

"Pa-pants?"

"Sure!...C'mon...you know what's inside pants, huh?"

"Prince Cassius!"

Cassius laughed, "here, I'll help you".

Cassius took the shears and began slicing down the pant-legs, and removing the underwear as well. A fat, flaccid phallus flopped out.

"Oh my..." said Minerva. "He's rather impressive".

"Minnie!"

"Y-you are too!...or you will be, once you've finished growing..."

Once the body had been stripped, Minerva dried it off with a large towel.

"We need to shave him", said Minerva.

"I better do that", said Cassius.

"Do you know how to shave?"

"Sure...but I've never done it on someone else before".

Athena came in, carrying a tray of buttered toast and a pot of tea.

"My goodness. He's quite a specimen, isn't he?"

"Have you found out who he is yet, grandma?" Minerva asked.

"Not yet...what's wrong?"

"We need to shave him, but we're not sure how", Minerva said.

"Oh I'll do it", said Athena.

"You know how?"

"I had to do it to your grandfather. Well...not...HAD to...but I liked to shave him, and he liked being shaved. It was a 'thing' that we had", she said. "Alone-time together".

Athena left, and came back with another tray, loaded with shaving-equipment. Eliza came upstairs, carrying a large bucket.

"The hot water you asked for, my lady", she said.

"Oh thank you, Eliza. Just put it in the jug over there, please", said Athena. Eliza poured the steaming hot water into the wash-basin jug on the washstand, and left. Minerva and Cassius watched the old woman as she worked.

She lathered up the soap and the shaving-brush, and warmed up the stranger's face with a hot, damp towel. Once she was done, she lathered up his face all over his whiskers, and then, she opened one of the straight-razors.

The lord's straight-razors were massive. Six inches long by two inches wide, and lethally sharp.

Athena moved behind the bed and pulled back the man's head. She started at his throat and began pulling the blade up. Shaving-cream and thick stubble came with it. She did the other undercheek...then across the throat...then down one cheek, and then the other. She shaved the chin, and then the moustache under the nose, and then the angles of the jaw. She ran a hand over his face.

"Not the best shave I've given", she said. "I am rather out of practice, but it'll do for the time being..."

With his beard gone, Athena stared at the figure on the bed.

"He looks familiar..." she said.

"Who is he?" Minerva asked.

"Come, let him rest. My lord, I could use your arms if you don't mind".

"Sure", said Cassius.

They left the room, leaving the naked hunk slumbering, with tea, toast and fresh robes, old ones taken from the attic, resting at the foot of his bed. A fire and candles burned in the room, to warm it up.

Athena entered the library, and indicated a huge old family record-book. Cassius heaved the heavy tome over to a desk, and opened it. She scanned the names and family trees and all the birth-records, until Athena stopped, and pointed at something with her magnifying-glass.

"That's him!" she said, "I thought that name and face looked familiar".

Minerva bent over. "Excalibur Rubicon Vanderstorm...I've never heard of him!"

"He came from your Uncle Versuvius's side of the family".

"Uncle WHO?"

"He was your father's cousin".

"Never heard of him..."

"No, I suppose not."

Minerva looked at the birth-date.

"He's only seventeen!...Why is he so HUGE!?"

"The prison labour", Cassius said.

"How..." Minerva had to sit down. It was a lot to take in. Athena sighed. It was all coming back, now.

"You wouldn't have remembered, Minerva. You would've been...two? I think...? Young Excalibur was always getting in trouble. He was your Uncle Versuvius's only son. Only child. And I suppose he spoilt him. After the death of his mother. Excalibur got in with bad people. He drank, he would fight, he had countless...escapades...with the village maidens. Eventually, Versuvius disowned him and disinherited him! I begged him to give Excalibur another chance. But your grandfather said that Versuvius had brought this on himself, and that there were no more chances left to give".

"What happened then?" Cassius asked?

"He ran away from home. We never knew what happened to him. The next time we heard of him, he was fifteen. He'd been arrested for housebreaking. And there were already charges of brawling and rape and...goodness knows what else..."

"Rape!?" Minerva gasped.

"I don't think those were ever proven in court...but then he was sent to six months' hard labour. In prison he brawled, he took part in riots...strikes...his sentence was extended over and over. It broke his father's heart. He died shortly after. After that, we just forgot he ever existed. Until he showed up now, I'd completely forgotten about him!"

Bang! Crack!

"Aww fuck! What the hell..."

The giant lying on the bed groaned and rolled over. With a 'thud!', he hit the floor! He groaned. What the hell was going on!? Where was he!?

He got unsteadily to his feet and stared around. He was in some sort of bedroom, with a fire burning, and tea and toast, and...woah he was naked!...and shaved...and...clean! His belongings had been placed in a box on a table. He stared around and saw clean robes folded at the foot of the bed. He picked them up and tugged them on. They fit...sorta. If he was honest, they were actually a bit loose.

The hulking giant tugged up the smalls and tucked his snake into them. It flopped around without any blood inside it. Loose and slack. He did up the belt, the hood and everything else and got to his feet, stretching to his full, eight-foot height. He shuffled over to the table and sat down. The tea was still warm. He wolfed down the half-loaf of buttered toast, and slurped down the tea. Bleeerch! TEA! Where was the fucking beer...

He let out a loud belch and yawned. He didn't notice the door behind him swing open.

"Aaaah..."

*suck-suck-suck*

A little blond-haired toddler entered the room, sucking on his thumb.

"Oooh...Waaaah!!!"

The hunk turned, "Woah! A baby...Hey little dude..."

The toddler plomped onto his bottom and burst into tears! Just then, two women hurried in. One was old, at least sixty. The other looked...well she looked just fiiiiiine...

"Oh there there, Leo!" said the old woman, scooping him up, "It's alright!"

"Who are you people...?" the hunk groaned.

"This is Castle Vanderstorm", said the old woman, "And you Excalibur, son of Versuvius, cousin of the late lord".

"I...Yeah..." said the hunk, "Yeah! Hey um...so who are you?"

"I'm your grandmother!"

"Grand...Ooooh...It's um...Antelope or something..."

"Athena".

"Oh yeah...Aww geez...um...hi..."

The hunk shifted his feet uneasily. The girl stared at him. He seemed to breathe muscles. He towered over top of her by a good two feet, at least, and he had scruffy brown hair and a dark tan on his bulked up body.

"So this is like...your...granddaughter?"

"This is your Cousin Minerva. Minerva, this is Excalibur".

"H-h-Hello..."

"Well heeeey...Hehe...You're cute...So where's Ol' Uncle..."

"I'm afraid that he's been dead for over a year already".

"Oooh...So who's the boss around here?"

"Fortis, of course".

"Forty!? Oh wow...Geez. Last time I saw him, I was...um...twelve or somethin'...woah...Where is he?"

"Out", Athena said. "He's the new Lord Vanderstorm".

"Haw...cool..."

Excalibur seemed distracted and nervous. He flexed his arms and shoulders out of habit. "So um...Hi..."

"Perhaps we should go downstairs...?" Athena suggested. Excalibur nodded and followed his grandmother and his young cousin downstairs. They entered the parlour and sat down.

"Why did you come back?" Athena asked.

Excalibur swallowed.

"I just got sick of it all..." he said. "I got tired. I got bored! I fucked the whole thing up and you know it! I was sick of running around and not doing anything. I just wanted to come home. But I couldn't go HOME-HOME...So I came here. I just wanna be part of a family again".

"Need I remind you of the scandals you brought upon our house?"

"Gran'ma..."

Athena sighed. "I want to feel like you can change..." she said, "But you've done some terrible things!"

"I just wanna come home!" Excalibur said. "I wanna sleep in a bed. I wanna eat at a table! I wanna wear my own clothes! I wanna joust and duel and chop wood and build things and work out and do stuff! I'm sick of being on the run all the time!"

Athena sighed. "I would like to help, but the running of the castle isn't in my hands. You'll have to ask Fortis when he comes back. But until then, I suppose you can stay, provided you behave yourself".

Excalibur nodded.

choices: Excalibur discovers the wine-cellar...
Meanwhile, in the village, Minerva shows Cassius around town.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Just then, a handsome teenage boy entered the parlour.

"Hey Minerva! Have you had breakfast yet? I was wondering if...Oh hi!"

Athena got up, "Good morning, your Royal Highness. Did you sleep well?"

"Yes", said Cassius. "Thanks. It's just that, well, I don't wanna waste any time, so I thought I could accompany Minerva into the village and she could show me around".

"I'd love to!" said Minerva. "Excalibur won't want us bothering him, anyway. Come along granny".

"I'll just check on Eldonia upstairs", said Athena, "this horrible pregnancy is making her very ill".

Everyone rushed to get ready.

"What am I gonna do?" Excalibur asked, standing up.

"Explore the castle!" Minerva called down the stairs, "I suppose you haven't been here since you were ten!"

Excalibur nodded. Good point.

Once the castle was empty, and Jupiter and Cannius had gone hunting, and Minerva, Athena and Cassius had headed off into town, Excalibur started exploring.

As with any curious teenager, one of the first places he went to were all the bedrooms, starting with Fortis's. He tried Eldonia's room, but the door was locked. He supposed that she was sleeping. He headed downstairs and explored all the reception-rooms: The parlour, the dining-room, the drawing-room, the ballroom, the morning-room and the billiard-room.

Excalibur headed out of the dining-room and pushed open a pair of swing-doors that led to a long passage. He didn't remember this from his last visit. He headed down the corridor to a pair of doors at the end. He certainly didn't remember these! He slowly pushed them open.

"So I told her, I said, I don't care what you think, she's a wonderful person, and she deserves him!"
"Too right. I mean he's a nice boy, really. And I think his lordship worries too much"
"He only wants to protect her. And can you blame him? She's very pretty. I wish I had a brother like that"
"You do!"
"No I don't! He's useless! Why do you think my mother sent me here? Because at least here I get paid! My brother doesn't work at all! A total layabout!"
"What a shame..."
"I know...ah, what're you gonna do?"

Eliza, Emily and Matilda, the three young housemaids sat around the kitchen table, chopping vegetables and meat for Mrs. Tibbs' pie for that evening.

"Penny can be very possessive about her".
"Well she's lucky. I mean one day, I might become a ladies' maid, too..."
"Would you want to?"
"Hey it's just a short step from there to retirement with benefits, sweetie..."
"True...true...Oh damn I HATE cutting carrots! These stupid things roll everywhere...Oh now look!"

Eliza put down her kitchen-knife and turned around to pick up the carrot that had rolled towards the door. She bent down and picked it up, before slowly getting to her feet.

"Aaaaaaaaaaah!!" she squeaked!

The other girls turned!

Standing in the doorway was a tall, broad-shouldered hunk of the genus hom-mountanius Maximus. With beautiful chocolate-brown hair and a strong tan and rippling, solid muscles...

"H-hello..." said Eliza. "Y-you must be um...Uh...you're um..."

"How about you just call me 'Cutie', huh?" said the hunk, entering the kitchen.

The girls stared at him. He was nowhere near as tall as their lord and master, but he had a certain brutish charm about him.

"Excalibur Vanderstorm".

"Yes, my lord", said Eliza, curtsying.

"You know, we heard stories...my lord..." said Matilda, getting to her feet, "Are they...are they true?"

"Whadda you think?"

The two girls squealed!

"So...are you the only girls here?"

"Well there's Penny, but she's gone out. There's Mrs. Tibbs the cook, and then there's just the servant-boys, Zacharia, Hermes, Perseus, and then there's his lordship's squire, Koviac".

"Sweet..." said Excalibur.

choices: Leonardo is fascinated by this new "Uckle Salad", and tries to play with him.
Excalibur raids Fortis's personal liquor-cabinet as well!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Excalibur stared around the kitchen. At the far end was a large, open room with a couple of tables in it, and a fireplace. And beyond that, a long corridor that went down into darkness.

"What's all that?" he asked.

"That's our quarters, my lord", said Eliza. "Mrs. Tibbs the housekeeper and cook, has the room at the very end. Then all of us use the other rooms".

Excalibur pointed to a pair of large, double doors at the mouth of the corridor, to the left.

"What's that?"

"Those doors lead to the basement, my lord. We store food and firewood, tools and other things in there. Old furniture and such. It's also the location of the family vaults, the cells, the root-cellar, and the wine-cellar..."

Excalibur smirked, "Wine-cellar, huh? Cool..."

The towering hunk picked up a candlestick. "I think I'll go um...check it out..."

Excalibur opened the double doors and headed inside. The first couple of yards were a landing, but beyond that was a large, stone staircase leading slowly down, protected on one side by a stone balustrade. Excalibur headed down, his candle flickering and burning as he went deeper and deeper. Every few steps, there was another landing, but he did eventually reach the bottom. Here, he saw the cells, and the various store-rooms, as well as the thick, clay pipes used to channel water and sewerage away from the castle.

At the bottom of the stairs, to the right, he entered a large chamber filled with racks and barrels and shelves. He smiled. Jackpot!

Lighting a couple of lanterns, the young mountain lord stared at everything. Sherry, whiskey, brandy, port, vodka, rum...it was all there!

Taking an old sack, Excalibur started dumping all kinds of things into it. Bottles of whiskey, sherry, brandy, port, rum, even a couple bottles of Vodka. Vladians weren't very smart, but they sure knew how to make a nice vodka. Along with that went some of the lighter drinks, such as ginger beer and sarsaparilla.

In the end, he'd filled up two sacks! Slinging them over his shoulders, Excalibur carried them back upstairs. He peeked out of the basement...all the servants had gone off to do their chores. He quickly took the back stairs up to his bedroom. Boy, he needed a drink...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Excalibur discovers the wine-cellar...

choices: Two mornings later, Fortis arrives home unexpectedly...
In Ferramount, Fortis stays as the guest of King Leviathan and Queen Athena.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Excalibur headed into his bedroom, one of the guestrooms, and dumped his haul of booze on the bed. Then, he left the room and headed down the corridor. Where else was there likely to be booze in this place? Grandma probably kept a tipple or two for cold nights, but she'd probably shriek up a storm if she knew he'd stolen it. Wanting to keep on her good sides, Excalibur went instead to the master's bedroom.

The lord's liquor cabinet was the master's private stash of booze. It had been restocked since the last time Fortis went on a serious bender, but now that Excalibur was looking for a sip, anything was fair-game.

Picking the lock with a bent nail, Excalibur opened the cabinet and carried off all the decanters and bottles back to his room. He could easily finish them off and have them back before Fortis returned.

Excalibur headed back to the kitchen and came back with a shoulder of mutton, and a large hunk of cheese, and a loaf of bread. He'd have a nice dinner of bread and meat and cheese...and booze. Lots of booze... He'd missed being able to just eat and drink while he'd been out on the road, constantly having to move from town, to town, having to beg, borrow or steal, having to do menial work for a meal or a bed. As a mountain lord, such things should've been beneath him, and they probably were, but Excalibur also had a rebellious streak in him. He never liked doing things in the prescribed manner.

And that, really, had been what had started his life of misery and his reputation in the family, to begin with! But it was, oddly enough, just how he liked it!

Being a solid and bulky eight feet tall, Excalibur could drink a lot without passing out. Of course, Fortis could drink more, but Excalibur, like most mountain men, was a heavy drinker at the best of times. The backbreaking work which so many mountain men did was what had made them heavy drinkers. Sawing, felling, splitting, mining, digging, quarrying, delving, thatching, hammering, carrying, lifting and shifting. The very labours which gave the men of the Mountanian kingdom their powerfully built and renowned physiques, were also the source of their legendary capacity for alcohol.

After several hours of eating and drinking, Excalibur felt dizzy, lightheaded and sleepy. He staggered to his bed from the table where he had been having his little bender, and flopped onto the mattress. Within fifteen minutes, he'd passed out and fallen asleep.

King Hercules knows of Excalibur's reputation, and tries to speak to Fortis.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Eliza entered Lord Vanderstorm's bedroom. The head housemaid began dusting and sweeping. She shook off the bedsheets and laid down fresh ones, she swept down the dust, brushed out the chimney, flue and grate, and polished the windows. She was busy trying to push the enormous linen chest across the floor to sweep under the bed, when the double doors burst open!

"Aaah!" she squealed, and whirled around!

Fortis Vanderstorm entered. He towered over her, a prime example of the Mountanian warrior elite. He dumped his travelling bags on the floor and tore off his sweat-drenched tunic, revealing his glossy, sweat-smeared body. He had obviously just arrived home and had come straight to his room. He looked rough and grungy, as if he hadn't washed...or shaved...in three whole days. And it looked like he'd been on the move the whole time. He grabbed the linen chest and shoved it roughly across the floor. It slid over the smooth flagstones and banged up against the far wall. His powerful biceps and broad shoulders rippled as he exerted his brutal force upon the heavily-loaded chest.

"Th-thank you, my lord...I'll...I'll be done soon".

Fortis merely shrugged and nodded. He headed into his private bathroom and started working the pump that filled up his enormous bathtub. Eliza couldn't help but peek through a crack in the door as his powerful muscles worked up and down, driving the pump handle back and forth to bring water from the main cistern to his bathtub. Then, he started working another pump, and water from the boiler downstairs in the kitchen started gushing out. The water was hot and steamy. Finally, Fortis disrobed completely and climbed in. He let out a loud groan and sank beneath the water, stretching out to his full ten-foot height...even though the bath was almost double that size, to accommodate the extra length of his arms. He grabbed a sponge and started scrubbing all over.

"Eliza! What are you looking at!?"

Eliza jumped! She whirled around to see Lady Athena.

"Uh...um..."

"What are you doing moving the furniture around!? What's all this stuff on the floor!? Oooh that Excalibur's been in here already and...who's in the bathroom!? If he's in there making a mess, I'll..."

Before Eliza could say anything, Athena pushed the door open the whole way...

"HEY!!!"
"Aaaaaaaah!!!"

There was a violent splashing, the splatter of wet feet, and a flurrying of linen!

"GET THE HELL OUT! I'M HAVING A BATH IN HERE!"

Athena backed quickly out of the room. She was proud of her oldest grandson and everything about him...although she blushed a bit, at seeing him in his bathing attire of...nothing!

"I was about to say that his lordship just got back..." Eliza said, blushing.

"He's...Oh my! Then that must mean..."

"My lady".

Athena turned around to see King Hercules. She kissed the king's ring, while Eliza curtsied.

"Your Majesty", Eliza said. She bowed, and went back to her cleaning.

"When did you arrive?" Athena asked, "We thought you weren't coming back for another three days at least!"

"Things wrapped up rather quickly", Hercules explained. "If it be your pleasure, my lady, my grandson and I will spend the night here, and then be on our way tomorrow morning".

"Oh yes! Of course! Eliza, tell Mrs. Tibbs we'll be expecting company for dinner".

"Yes m'lady!" said Eliza, and she hurried downstairs.

Just then, the bathroom door opened and a full-naked Fortis lumbered into the room, a towel over his head. He opened his closet and reached for a fresh shirt. He tugged the towel off and threw it over his dressing-screen, and turned around...

"WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAARRRGGGHHHH!!!???"

Hercules and Athena burst out laughing!

"CAN'T NOBODY GET NO PRIVACY IN THIS DAMN HOUSE!?"

King Hercules doubled over, laughing. "My good lord Vanderstorm, I...hahaha! I assure you...your...hahahahaha! Your grandmother and I have seen it ALL before!...Come, my lady. We shall leave your good grandson to dress and retain what little of his dignity he still possesses!"

Fortis let out a frustrated groan and went back to dressing. He tugged on his hose and then reached for his codpiece, an enormous, sock-like fixture which he tied around his waist to stop the girls from screaming at the size of his...aristocratic attachment...something that happened pretty often, he was proud to say...

He was just tying things up, when the doors opened again. A tallish, brown-haired hunk entered, carrying bottles of alcohol.

"Oh wow...um..."

Fortis stared at the hunk.

"Who the heck are you?"

"I-i-I'm...wait a minute...who the hell are YOU?"

"This is my castle! And I am its master! And you will answer me when you're spoken to, sirrah!"

"Woah, chill out...So...Oh yeah you gotta be Forty!"

"I beg your pardon!?"

"Forty! It's me!"

"...who?"

"Don'tcha remember? It's me! Remember your little cuzzy?"

"...No. Get out".

"Foooorty. It's me! It's Excalibur! Remember? Last time we saw each other, I was ten and you were...what? Thirteen or fourteen? Minnie was like seven..."

"No".

"Yeah well I spent a couple of years up in Castle Ravenwood..."

A look of dawning settled on Fortis's face.

"NOW I remember you...What the hell are you doing in my house!?"

"Woah, cuz..."

"GET OUT!"

"Alright, I'll come back later..."

"NO! I MEAN GET THE HELL OUT OF MY CASTLE! NOW! PACK YOUR SHIT AND LEAVE OR I'LL THROW YOU OUT OFF THE ROOF!"

"Sheesh! What crawled up your ass and laid an egg!?"

"YOU KNOW DAMN WELL WHAT YOUR FUCKING AROUND DID TO OUR FAMILY! WE NEARLY LOST OUR WHOLE REPUTATION THANKS TO YOU!"

"Woah calm down, Forty! I done my thing! I screwed up! I come back! I just wanna settle down..."

"How'd you like to settle six feet under!?"

Fortis crossed his room. Then, he noticed the bottles of alcohol.

"What..."

Fortis turned and stared at his empty liquor-cabinet.

"HAVE YOU BEEN DRINKING MY STASH!?"

"Weeeeeeell..."

"YOU BASTARD!"

"Hey watch it, cuz! I brought it back, see? I was gonna top it up!"

Fortis drew a sword out of its scabbard on a rack, "GET...OUT! NOW!"

Athena hurried upstairs. "Fortis WHAT is all this shouting about!?...PUT DOWN THAT SWORD AT ONCE!"

"Tell him to leave!" Fortis snarled, "We got no space in our house for Vanderstorms who bring disgrace to the family name!"

"Now see here, Fortis!" said Athena, "You might be master now, but I am STILL the family matriarch for as long as I draw breath! And as such you WILL obey me! You know that Excalibur is your cousin! You will give him bed and board while he stays here!"

"Says who!?"

"Says ME! I will NOT allow you to turn FAMILY out into the streets and the wilds! Excalibur has paid hard for his wrongs, and has come to make amends and a new start in his life!"

"Well he can make that start SOMEWHERE ELSE!"

"Fortis don't be a child!" Athena shouted, "Excalibur HAS nowhere else! Ever since his father died..."

"And a good thing too, the shame he brought on him!"

"DON'T YOU DARE TALK ABOUT YOUR UNCLE VESUVIUS LIKE THAT! Ever since he died, Excalibur HAS nowhere to go! So he came here! The least you could do is show him common familial mercy!"

"Mercy my ass! I want him OUT within an hour!"

"Absolutely not! Excalibur, go back to your room!"

"WHAT!? YOU GAVE HIM A ROOM!?"

"Well of course! Where else!?"

"HE CAN SLEEP IN THE PIGSTY FOR ALL I CARE!"

"Fortis! What's this shouting about!?"

"NOT NOW GIRL! I'M IN NO MOOD FOR ALL YOUR SWEET SHIT!"

"Fortis! Excalibur's been a big help!" Athena said, "He's been helping around the house! He's been doing the things that you couldn't do because you were away!"

"Well I'm BACK now, so he can beat it!"

"Oh Forty! But he's really nice!" Minerva said, "He even plays with the baby!"

"YOU...HE...DON'T YOU DARE LET THAT DEGENERATE NEAR MY KID OR I'LL..."

"You wouldn't dare!" Minerva fired back.

Fortis looked like he was about to erupt. He strode up to his cousin, grabbed him by the neck and slammed him against the nearest convenient wall.

"You stay the HELL away from my kid! You so much as LOOK at him I'll slice your ears off and boil them in a pot of oil! I don't need YOU passing on all your FINE traits to him like your whoring and brawling and cussing and drinking!"

"Yeah, this..fr-from a...a-g-guy with a...b-bbooze c-cupboard i--in his own room!" Excalibur coughed out as Fortis's hands locked around his throat.

"GET...OUT!" Fortis growled.
