choices: That evening, the two alpha-hunks duel in the castle gardens.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Around the table, King Hercules, Fortis, Jupiter, Cannius, Koviac and Cassius sat down. On the table in front of them were pies and roasts, crispy garden salads with rich sauces and dressings, loaves of bread, and olive-oil, and butter.

Athena and Minerva entered the dining-room. Fortis and the king stood up, both men gesturing their desired females closer to their sides.

"How fares your wife, my lord?" Hercules asked, sitting back down, "She does not join us?"

"Lady Eldonia is still feeling poorly from her pregnancy", Athena explained, "What DID happen to that scoundrel who planted his seed within her?"

"He has been dealt with", said the king.

"You had him executed?" the old woman asked, matter-of-factly.

"No..." said Fortis, grumbling, "KIng Hercules wouldn't allow that".

"My dear fellow, I know precisely what you wanted", said Hercules, "But the fact is, those miscreants are worth more to us as prisoners than corpses. We have put them to work in the salt-mines", he explained to Lady Athena. "Their addition to the prison-labourers allowed us to release three Mountanian men on good behaviour".

"That sounds very nice", said Athena.

"I still wish you'd had them hanged", Fortis grumbled.

"I wanted to do what was best", Hercules said.

"That WAS best! What if they escape!?"

"I can assure you that won't happen. To get out of Castle Ravenwood they'd have to escape across the gorge and river, first...and then up the mountains...and through the valleys..."

"Y'know he's right, Forty. It ain't easy gettin' outta that place. Trust me, I tried!"

Fortis stopped and looked up. Excalibur stood in the doorway. The young hunky teenager gave a cocky grin.

"Heh. Remember me, Forty? I come back! It's your ol' buddy cuzzy Cally!"

Fortis's eyes narrowed. "What is HE doing here?"

"Now Fortis", Athena said, "I invited him to dinner".

"He can have his dinner up in his room".

"No. He'll have his dinner here. I want him to be with family".

"WE ARE NOT HIS FAMILY!"

"We are the ONLY family he has left!"

"And who's fault is that? Ours or his? I won't sit around with someone who disgraced his family and nearly ruined ours!"

Athena sighed, "Fortis. Stop being a child! Excalibur. Sit down here. Eliza. A plate and cutlery and a bowl and a goblet for Lord Excalibur".

Fortis turned to King Hercules, "I thought noblemen lost their titles after they'd been convicted of crimes!?"

"Do they?" Hercules asked, "I wasn't aware of that".

"WELL THEN IT SHOULD BE A LAW! He's not a lord! He's lucky to be alive!"

"My good Lord Vanderstorm. Your cousin, despite his misdeeds, has served his time and has been released lawfully back into society. He has come to you for a home and for mercy. I would think someone as noble and generous and honourable as yourself would grant him both".

"I didn't have any honour when he went to jail! We only just got it back!"

"Oh Fortis you're exaggerating things!" Athena sighed.

"You are young, Lord Vanderstorm. You are but...what? Twenty-one? Twenty-two? In time, you'll learn mercy and tolerance and patience".

"I have plenty", Fortis countered, "But NOT for scoundrels who blacken our family name!"

Fortis felt a pair of arms wrap around his massive left bicep. His sister.

"Fooorty...Please be nice...Excalibur's really sweet!"

"YOU TOUCHED MY SISTER!?"

"Woah calm down!" said Excalibur, "It's not like I tried farming her! Sheesh!"

"Fortis, Excalibur was perfectly honourable and sweet!" Minerva said, "Why can't you see that!?"

"Oh whatever...Eliza!"

The housemaid stepped forward, "Yes, my lord?"

"Another bottle of port".

"No, my lord".

Fortis glared at her.

"What do you mean 'No, my lord'? I said port! Now!"

"There's none left, my lord".

"W...THERE WERE FOUR BOTTLES OF IT! Where's it gone!?"

"Oh was that what that stuff was? Gee it was good..." Excalibur said.

"YOU DRANK FOUR BOTTLES OF MY BEST PORT!?"

"Hey it was good..."

Fortis groaned. He got slowly to his feet and bowed to the king.

"If you'll excuse me, my liege, but my...COUSIN...and I...have matters to deal with. Excalibur! Come!"

Fortis left the room and dragged his cousin with him, and down to the cellar. He lit the candles in the sconces and stared around. He gawked.

"What? It was...it was good booze..."

"HOW MUCH DID YOU TAKE!? HOW MUCH DID YOU DRINK!?"

"I...I dunno...um...maybe um..."

"HALF THE BOTTLES ARE GONE!"

"Oh...okay um...in that case, I drank half of the stuff you got..."

"Ooooooh mountains above...Did you write any of it down!?"

"Write it down, what for?"

"W...SO I KNOW WHAT TO BUY NEXT TIME!"

"No...I didn't know I had to..."

"There's a BOOK right here!"

"Oh is that what it is? I thought it was some stupid math-book. It had all these fractions and numbers in it..."

"Those are the numbers of BOTTLES you idiot!"

"W...like that song?"

"What song?"

"You know...99 bottles of beer on the wall, 99 bottles of..."

"SHUT UP!"

Before he could restrain himself, Fortis landed a punch on Excalibur's cheek! Excalibur staggered back against the wall, the bruise rising, and smarting, on his face!

"Hey cuz! Sheesh! If you wanted to play rough, you should'a told me! I can do that too, y'know!"

"Is that a challenge!?"

"Hell yeah if you want it...Duel to first blood, huh? Tonight?"

"Fine!" said Fortis. "Tonight! After dinner!"

"Fine!" Excalibur said. "And your wine was delicious!...Oh thank you, Excalibur, I'm glad you liked it..."

"SHUT UP BEFORE I POUND YOU AGAIN!"

"Aww jee cuz, I appreciate the sentiment, but I'm really not into boy-boy sex..."

Fortis felt his temples pulse and the blood rise in his neck and chest...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis and Excalibur were dressed in white dueling singlets, that showed off the musculature of their chests, abdomens and especially, their shoulders and arms. Down below, they wore white hose. They stood out in the castle gardens. Everyone watched from the open dining-room windows. Between them were two identical dueling-swords. The two parties stepped forwards and selected their blades, and then began to square each other off, slowly circling around each other.

Koviac frowned and drew near the cell. He stood up on his tiptoes to peer through the bars in the door. He immediately drew back when Ranulf's face greeted him.

"Hey! You listenin' to me?!" Ranulf asked angrily, trying to put a hand through the bars to reach out towards Koviac. "My brother needs help!"

Koviac took a step back and raised an eyebrow at the Vladian. "What, you think I was born yesterday? You can't fool me with the old 'my brother is sick' trick!"

"Out of the way, Ranulf! Let me talk some sense into this kid!" came a low, gruff voice near the door.

Loki's stern face appeared between the bars, and he glared at Koviac. "You think we would waste your time, boy, on some sort of trick?! My nephew needs medical attention, and he needs it NOW! So, you better get your butt and your keys over here, or you might have a dead Vladian on your hands before morning!"

Koviac snorted. "Puh-lease!" However, Koviac turned his head when he felt a tugging on his sleeve. "What?" he whispered to Lucy.

"Kovi, um, one of them was coughing and stuff yesterday."

"Yeah," said Katie, "and he was sniffing real bad and sneezing."

"You're not really gonna let him die are you?"

"Oh, please, don't let him die! That's mean!"

Koviac sighed. "Look, girls! They're faking! What do you think they're gonna do once I open that door? They're gonna escape, that's what! And I'd be lucky to keep my hide once Lord Vanderstorm knows I'm responsible for it!"

"But I don't think he is faking, Kovi!"

"Yeah, and what if they promise to not escape if you unlock the door and take a look at the sick man?"

Koviac rolled his eyes, but felt himself giving in.

"Yeah, Kovi," Loki sneered, "we'll be good and promise to not escape if you come take a look at my nephew here."

"See? He's gonna be nice!"

"Fine!" Koviac scowled at Loki and drew his sword. "Step back away from the door and keep your hands where I can see them!"

Loki made a show of holding his hands up so that Koviac could see them before moving away from the cell door.

Koviac kept his sword at the ready as he fumbled with the key-ring at his belt. Finding the correct key, he unlocked the door and slowly pushed it open.

"Stay back!" he hollered, brandishing his sword.

"What, you think we'd rush you when we're completely unarmed?" Ranulf asked, scoffing.

Koviac took several small steps into the cell, keeping one eye on Loki and Ranulf, while briefly glancing at the third Vladian. The sick man was lying in the far corner of the cell, curled up in a fetal position, moaning every once in a while, and shivering violently.

Koviac kept slowly walking into the cell. He was just beginning to think the Vladians were telling the truth, for the moaning man's face appeared flushed with fever and sweat, when....

"NOW!"

Suddenly, Koviac found himself swordless. A hard knock on the head with the butt of his sword had him falling to the stone floor, out cold.

Before Katie and Lucy could even scream in alarm, Loki and Ranulf had caught them and clamped large hands over their mouths.

"You'll stay quiet if you know what's good for you!" Loki snarled at them.

Loki and Ranulf hauled the girls into the cell, gagged them with strips of cloth they tore from the girls' skirts, and tossed them in the corner next to the passed out Koviac. Adolf, meanwhile, had gagged the squire for good measure and relieved the boy of his keys.

"Well, that went off without a hitch!" Ranulf said clapping a hand on his brother's shoulder. "Way to act, bro!"

"Quiet, you fool!" Loki hissed. "We're not out of the woods, yet!"

"We ARE going to leave now, right?" Adolf asked with a raised eyebrow.

Ranulf noticed the gleam in his uncle's eye and said, "Oh, no! You're not seriously considering going back after that woman, are you? Come on, Unc'! Let's just go home!"

"And leave such a great opportunity?! Besides the woman, the Old Mountain King is certainly occupying one of the guest quarters of this castle! If we take him captive, just imagine how much we could ransom him for!"

"Oh, please!" snorted Ranulf. "The old king would probably rather die than have the reigning king pay any sort of ransom for him."

"I agree," said Adolf. "If we have to leave with someone, I'd rather it was the woman."

"Well, now," said Loki with a smirk. "That sounds more like it!" Loki swished Koviac's stolen sword a few times through the air before pointing towards the open cell door. "Let's go, boys!"

Adolf locked the three servants in the cell, and the three Vladians crept up the stairs towards the house proper.

This time, Loki was NOT going to screw up. He left the basement with Adolf and Ranulf, and the three of them bounded up the stairs. This time, he was NOT going to make a mistake. No sir! No ma'am! He was gonna get the RIGHT door and get the RIGHT girl this time!

Loki approached the door and tried the handle. The stupid thing wasn't even locked! He pushed the door open slowly. Eldonia was asleep, heavily pregnant, exhausted, and lost to the world. She never heard them creep in. But she felt them when they put their hands on her!

They hurried out of the room and downstairs, and then out the back door, through the gardens, out a side-gate, around the castle, and then off into the woods down the road...

Mrs. Tibbs yawned. She woke up early today. She knew that his lordship would want to be ready to leave as soon as possible. She turned off her alarm-clock, wound it up, and shuffled out of bed. What a night... she headed out of her bedroom and shuffled down the corridor. She frowned. Something was wrong.

The doors to the basements were wide open. That was never meant to happen...

Lighting a torch, she headed downstairs. The basements stored barrels, sacks and crates of things; firewood, tools, Lord Vanderstorm's workshop, old furniture, gold, food-stores...

"Shhh...someone's coming..."
"What do you mean 'Shhh!'? HEY! HEY WHO IS THAT!?"

Mrs. Tibbs jumped! She hurried to the bottom of the stairs and ran to the four holding-cells that were to be found under the castle. She screamed when she realised what had happened!

"Mrs. Tibbs get us out of here!" Katie yelped.

As housekeeper, Mrs. Tibbs naturally had a set of keys to every lock in the castle; her very job depended on them, of course. But while she had keys to the basement, only Lord Vanderstorm had keys to the cells!

"I don't have the keys!" she said. "I'll have to ask his lordship!"

"Now don't panic! I'll go and explain what's happened!" said Mrs. Tibbs, and she jogged upstairs.

--- --- --- ---

"My lord..."

"Mmmmm..."

"My lord do wake up!"

"Huh...Hmmm..."

"Lord Vanderstorm! Wake up!"

"Huh!? What...Mrs...What are you doing here!?"

"Something's happened! The Vladians escaped in the night. I think they overpowered Koviac and the girls when they brought them their food. They locked them in the cells and we can't find the keys!"

"WHAT!?"

Fortis leapt out of bed, "WHAT!?"

"I don't know what happened!"

"Oooh shit!" Fortis groaned. He rushed out of the room and then kicked open his sister's bedroom door! Minerva shrieked! Cassius fell out of bed!

"I swear nothing happened!" Cassius blurted out.

Realising that Minerva was safe, although possibly pregnant...Fortis moved to the next door on the other side of the corridor. He rushed in and whipped the curtains back!...Eldonia's bed was empty!

"FUCK!!!!" he roared. In a fit of blind rage, he slammed a fist into the fireplace mantle! Some ash-buildup actually crumbled out of the chimney and landed with a "poof!" in the fireplace below.

Fortis lumbered out of the bedroom and headed downstairs. He went through the kitchen. Cupboards were open. Food gone! He lumbered downstairs to the basement. Koviac saw the furious state of his master and mentor and backed against the wall of the cell.

With a deafening screech and scraping, and cracking noises, Fortis grabbed the cell door and physically ripped ot off its hinges, in his uncontrollable rage! He threw it across the basement, narrowly missing Mrs. Tibbs. It crashed to the ground several feet away.

"WHAT THE HELL DID YOU DO!?" he roared.

"My-m-my lord, I -I swear!..." Koviac began.

"YOU'LL BE DOIN' A LOT MORE THAN THAT, BOY, WHEN I TELL THE KING WHAT YOU DONE! YOU CAN FORGET ABOUT YOUR FUCKING KNIGHTHOOD AND GO BACK TO YOUR FUCKING PARENTS TONIGHT!"

"My lord!" said Mrs Tibbs.

"WHAT!?"

"...nothing!"

The girls rushed out of the cell and Koviac followed. Fortis grabbed him and slammed him against a nearby pillar.

"You better talk FAST, boy, or I'll be sending you back to your parents in a BOX!"

"W-w-we c--ccame d-d-ownstairs t-to f-f-...feed..."

"FEED THEM BULLSHIT! WHAT HAPPENED!?"

"They tricked us! They disarmed me and pushed us into the cell and then they ran off!"

"YOU FUCKING IDIOT! HAVEN'T I TAUGHT YOU ANYTHING AT ALL, YOU STUPID BLOCKHEAD!?"

"B-b-b-bu-m-m-my lord! All they did was escape! Y-y-ou can-c-can f-find them again!"

"FUCK IT! THEY KIDNAPPED MY WIFE YOU STUPID BITCH!"

"O...oooh..."

"There better be a damn good explanation coming out after that..." Fortis said, his voice dangerous and rumbling. Koviac struggled to swallow, and shook his head. Fortis dropped him. Veins pulsed. He was BEYOND furious! Koviac got up and rushed upstairs!

--- --- --- ---

"What on EARTH is going on downstairs!?" Lady Athena asked Mrs. Tibbs when she came to her bedroom in tears!

"The Vladians escaped and they've taken Lady Eldonia with them! They locked Koviac and the kitchen-maids in the cells! His lordship is VERY upset!"

"So I heard!...I daresay the village down the road could hear him!" Athena said, "I better go and see him..."

"Oh don't do that, my lady! He's in a furious temper!"

"I don't care if he's stark-raving mad! Out of my way!"

--- --- --- ---

Downstairs, King Hercules was trying to reason with Fortis, who was pacing back and forth in the dining-room. He was breathing very heavily and he looked like he would rip someone's arms off!

"Fortis!..."

"WHAT!...is it...grandma?"

"You will STOP this display at once! You're acting like a child!"

"BULLSHIT!"

"I BEG YOUR PARDON!? FORTIS MAXIMUS VANDERSTORM YOU WILL SPEAK TO ME WITH RESPECT!"

Fortis collapsed into an armchair and, to the surprise of everyone...burst into tears!

"Awww there there..." said Athena, "Granny's sorry..."

"Oh shut up!" Fortis sobbed, "I fucked it all up! I can't even look after her AFTER she got back!"

"Fortis you have NOTHING to reproach yourself about!" Athena said, kneeling by her grandson's massive thighs, "You're a loving husband! A wonderful father! Nobody could've seen this happening! But we'll find them! And we'll bring them back!"

"The fuck we will!" Fortis croaked, "When I find them I'll tie them to a fucking tree! I'll GUT THEM ALIVE WITH MY OWN SWORD!"

"Lord Vanderstorm! You'll cease this display at once!" King Hercules said. "If you're truly deserving of the title which you have inherited, of the position which you hold, of the decorations and honours presented by your country's rulers upon your family's achievements, then you'll do less moping around and more action! We'll rally together a search-party at once!"

Fortis sniffed, and coughed...and took a huge sigh.

"I...I guess you're right..." he said, "I'm sorry...I...I feel like such a LOSER!"

"No-one with a record, temperament and personality like yours could ever be considered a 'loser'", Hercules said, fatherly. "Now come along, or all the good Vladians will be dead already..."

Fortis let out a weak laugh. Trust old King Hercules to treat this like a hunting-trip.

"Koviac!" Fortis called out, sounding more like his old self.

"Y-y-yes my lord?"

"Get upstairs. Find me my battle-armour..."

"Surely that's not necessary?" said Hercules.

"WHEN I FIND THOSE COCKSUCKERS THEY'RE GONNA WISH THEY HAD ARMOUR BY THE TIME I'M DONE WITH THEM!"

"...Right..." said Hercules, "Point taken...Lord Cannius, Lord Jupiter, you'd better both go and get ready as well".

"Yes, your Majesty!" they said, and hurried upstairs.

Minerva hugged Cassius and gave him a kiss! Cassius's mouth dropped open in shock!

"Oh isn't he a WONDERFUL person!?" She said.

"Who? My grandpa or your brother?"

"Both!"

"Oh!...yeah....yeah...they's...you can stop squeezing me so hard now..."

"Huh? Oh!...Sorry Cassius..."

Eldonia grimaced as her bottom bounced up and down on the hard saddle of the horse. She cringed from how close Loki was holding her to his body, as she was seated in front of him between the vee of his thighs. She felt disgusted and almost dirty at feeling his hard erection press firmly into the crease of her buttocks. She wanted to gag at how he thrust himself into her every once in a while, whether intentionally or involuntarily from the movement of the powerful steed underneath them. All she knew was that she was cold, tired, sore, and uncomfortable, especially as the steady trotting and running of the horse made her large, pregnant belly sway up and down too much. She tried to hold it to keep it from bobbing too much, but her hands could only do so much.

"Quit squirming, Krasivaya," Loki murmured into her ear, making her shiver in disgust. "You're not making this any easier on yourself. All you're doing is making me want you more."

He licked the shell of her ear, making her yelp in dismay.

Loki grinned. "Oh, yeah. I love the sounds you make. Tell me more."

Eldonia clamped her mouth firmly shut, but couldn't help the groans of revulsion that left her throat as Loki continued to press hot, slimy, wet kisses on her cheek and neck.

Loki chuckled. "That's it, Krasivaya."

However, Eldonia soon had to let out a different kind of moan. Her eyes clenched tightly shut, and she gripped even harder on her belly as she doubled over, gasping. Pain radiated through her middle--a pain she had felt before about two years ago--a pain that made her heart pound wildly in fear.

"What are you doing?" Loki hissed, his hand moving up from her belly (which he had been caressing fondly, feeling his child kick within her in delight) up to her bosom to press her back against him. "Are you trying to fall off this horse? Are you stupid?!"

"AAAAAHHHHHHHAAAAA!" Eldonia screamed as a horrible lance of agony raced again through her abdomen.

Loki frowned. He put his hand back on her belly and noted it felt rock hard, where before her belly had felt merely firm.

"Is...something wrong?" he asked, a tiny note of fear creeping into his voice.

Eldonia hissed in a breath. "I...I think...all this stress...has put me into labor!"

Loki's eyes went wide. "Labor?! But...but it's too early, isn't it?"

"Yes!" she hissed. "It's only been...seven months...but when the baby decides to come...he comes!"

"Well, then,...what should I do?"

"I don't know! When I...had Leo...it took almost a whole day...before he was born! But...these pains are coming...very fast together already! AAAAAHHHHHH!"

Loki held her close as she bent over her belly again in pain.

"I've never delivered a baby before!" he said harshly into her ear, trying to not let the panic he was feeling show. "Try to...hold it back before we reach the next village! I'll find a doctor or healer for you!"

"There's...there's no time!" Eldonia groaned, and Loki swore as warm wetness began to sodden his trousers.

"Gross, woman!" he growled. "Couldn't you have told me you needed to relieve yourself?"

"That was my...water breaking! The baby's coming...really fast! I...already feel the need...to push! OOOOOOHHHHHH!"

"Well, you're not birthing MY SON on the back of my horse!"

Loki whistled to his nephews and halted his horse.

"What's up, Unc'?" said Adolf, as he and his brother came up to a halt beside Loki.

"Yeah, why are we stopping?" asked Ranulf. "We're only a few miles from the border!"

"My woman's having her baby!" Loki kept a hand on Eldonia as he swung off his horse. He then gently cradled Eldonia to his chest and eased her off his steed before walking over to a soft pile of ferns and laying her down. Eldonia immediately rolled to her side and gripped her belly, moaning in pain.

Adolf and Ranulf looked at Eldonia in fear.

"B-b-baby?! Here?! Now?!"

"Yes, you idiots! Look at her!"

Loki knelt down next to Eldonia and tenderly brushed her hair off her sweaty forehead. "What can I do?" he asked her helplessly, quietly.

"Just...don't leave me!"

Eldonia grasped his hand tightly in hers and squeezed hard. Loki frowned as his hand was crushed. Trying to think, he looked over at his nephews, who were just standing next to their horses, gawking at his woman.

"You two! Tie up the horses! Then, go find some firewood and build a fire! We're camping here for the night! Also, find a rabbit or two for some stew! And find a couple of those blankets in my saddle bag!"

Having grown up responding to the swift note of command and barked orders, Adolf and Ranulf were soon scrambling to obey their uncle.

"Come, Krasivaya," Loki crooned, gently easing Eldonia onto her back and then to lean against a nearby tree. Eldonia's face was scrunched in pain, and she was panting and breathing rapidly.

"Oooohhhhh! He's...he's coming! I...I gotta push!"

Loki scrambled down to her legs and gently lifted her nightgown up to her belly, baring her womanly assets to the cool evening air. Loki's eyes were mesmerized by the sight of his child's head already visible and covered with fine blond hair.

"I...I see his head!" he choked out, an impossible grin splitting his face. He had never really thought much about being a father, but with the reality of it staring him right in the face, he found he rather enjoyed the idea!

"It...it hurts!" Eldonia whimpered.

Loki crawled back over to her side and ran his hand gently along her cheek. "I know, Krasivaya. But a few more pushes, and our child will be born. Come on, now. Push for me! PUSH!"

Eldonia let out a long groan and bent forward over her belly, pushing with all her might. Loki looked down between her legs. "That's it! I see more of the head! Keep pushing!"

Eldonia pushed and pushed, groaning and moaning, her face a study in concentration and pain.

Suddenly, Loki left her side and gently pulled. Eldonia screamed as the shoulders came free, and the baby suddenly left her body in a rush of fluid.

Loki lifted up the squalling newborn, his eyes raking over the new life in wonder. It was red and slimy, skinny and small. But it was all his. His...

An enormous grin lit up his face.

It was a boy! His son!

Loki laughed in joy and stood to his feet, lifting the unhappy infant above his head.

"Behold! My son! The fruit of my loins!"

He lowered the child and held him by his armpits in front of his face. "You will be a great leader someday, my son. Therefore, you need a strong name worthy of your position! I name you Odin, king of the gods, for you will be a ruler and leader among the Vladians!"

Loki wandered over to his nephews, who already had a roaring fire going and were busy skinning rabbits for supper. He grabbed a blanket and wrapped up his son, proudly showing off his new offspring to Adolf and Ranulf.

Eldonia, meanwhile, was temporarily forgotten. She lay on the cold ground in a mess of her own fluids. Her body was shivering from the cold and the shock of giving birth. She moaned as she passed the afterbirth, and then curled in on herself. She was sore and exhausted, and she soon slipped into an uneasy sleep.

"A boy, huh?" said Adolf, looking down at the newborn in his uncle's arms. "Congrats, Unc'!"

"Well, now that you have what you wanted," said Ranulf, "what are we gonna do? What're you gonna do with the woman?"

Loki looked up at his nephews and raised an eyebrow. "Why, keep her, of course! Who else am I gonna find to feed my son? Besides, she's a good lay and obviously fertile. I'm sure I can get a whole army of sons off of her."

"But, Unc'! That Mountain lord won't give her up without a fight!" warned Ranulf.

"No, but he first has to know where to look in order to find her."

Adolf and Ranulf looked at each other in confusion before turning back to their uncle.

"What do you mean?" asked Adolf.

"Boys, I think we'll need to leave Vladia for a while. Hide out in some other country for a bit, to make sure that Vanderstorm won't find us. After a few years, he'll give up looking and find a new wife. Then, we can return to Vladia and begin our mission of conquest once again."

"L-leave Vladia?! But, Unc'! It's the only place we've ever lived!"
"Where will we go?!"
"What if people recognize us?!"
"Won't our accents give us away?!"

Loki sighed and rolled his eyes. He couldn't believe his own family could be so stupid! He'd make sure to raise his son right so that he'd be intelligent and cunning!

"Shut up and listen!" Loki barked, stilling his nephews' tongues. "First we go back to the keep to get some money and supplies. Then, we go to Lucia or *gag* Fatlantis. Maybe even as far south as Fantasmia. We say we're refugees from Vladia, trying to escape the tyranny and unfair way of life."

He winked, and his nephews grinned, understanding the irony. After all, 'tyranny or death' was their family motto.

"And," Loki continued, "who would recognize us since we've never been to Lucia or Fatlantis or Fantasmia before?"

"But...what about the woman? Won't she make a fuss? Try to give away our cover?"

Loki smiled evilly. "She wouldn't dare. Not if I threaten the health and well-being of her child."

"Unc'! You wouldn't!"

" 'Course I wouldn't! But, she don't know that, does she?"

Eldonia's mind was filled with a whirlwind of strange dreams intermixed with a few snatches of awareness.

...She was at home with Fortis and Leo, showing her happy, laughing son his new sibling. Even Fortis seemed to accept the child....

...She saw a tall, dark, stone keep, full of armed men that eyed her with either lust or distaste. She shivered in fear and succumbed to exhaustion once more....

...She was in said keep with Loki, and he cuddled her close and gently to him as they lay in their bed. He pressed kisses into her hair and ran a hand along her arm, making her skin erupt in goosebumps. He aroused her slowly, warmly, and easily brought her to ecstasy with his hand before he gently entered her from behind, bringing them both to an amazing climax....

...Then, Loki was slapping her face, smacking her arm, and pushing her roughly to the stone floor of a cell. He laughed and mocked her, sneered at her, spat at her, and raped her again and again and again. She cried and screamed and tried to escape, but nothing she did succeeded....

...A jarring bump had her moaning and opening her eyes. She saw fields full of wheat and corn rapidly pass by. The sight made her feel dizzy, and she closed her eyes again....

...She was living in a small cottage on the edge of a large forest. She stood at a window looking out and saw six or seven children of all different ages playing outside. She smiled. They seemed to be all boys. Leo was the oldest, and there was even a set of twins. A pair of strong arms wrapped around her waist, and turned her head to receive the passionate kiss from her lover. His face was out of focus, but it didn't seem to matter to her who it was. His hand came up to rest on the small head near her chest, and she looked down to admire the baby in her arms. The baby was feeding hungrily at her breast....

Eldonia moaned and put a hand to her head. She felt weak and tired, hungry, thirsty, and sore. Pain radiated out from her nether regions, and when she tried to sit up, her abdomen protested. Her hand flew to her belly, and her eyes shot open when she realized it wasn't round and firm, but deflated and a bit soft. The memories came to her suddenly. She had given birth! But where...?

She then acknowledged that the suckling she had felt from the baby in her last dream had continued, even though she was now awake. A warm, squirming weight in her arm and a small, hungry sound had her looking down. A smile slowly spread across her face as she watched her child feed. The baby was small and thin, but as she examined the child (a boy, she discovered first), she found that he was perfectly formed. Ten little fingers, ten tiny toes, a cute little button nose, and wisps of blond hair covered his head. She placed a small kiss on his forehead before gathering him even closer to her body.

When Ursula had told her many months ago that the child she carried was not Fortis's, Eldonia had felt a sharp spear of betrayal pierce her heart. Even though she knew in her head that her kidnapping and rapes hadn't been her fault, bearing the evidence of it in the form of a child made her feel as though she had betrayed Fortis, betrayed her wedding vows to him. At the time, even though she didn't want to kill the unborn babe in her womb, she felt no love or longing for it.

However, now....

She had felt the child grow and kick and move inside her over the past several months. Yes, his father was Loki. But she was his mother. She bore him in pain and blood and suffering. He was hers. And well, how could she not love her own child? He was real to her now, as she held him in her arms and fed him milk from her body. He was depending on her for his life. Despite the fact that he was Loki's son, Eldonia merely saw her own looks on the child--her blond hair, the shape of her face, her nose, her mouth, her ears.

She would protect him with her life against anyone who would harm him. Against the whole world, if necessary. And especially against his own father.

Which brought to mind her once-again captor: Loki.

Where was he? It was just she and the baby in the homey room. Eldonia looked around her and noted the large, comfortable bed she was on, the colorful quilt and drapes, the rustic wood of the table beside the bed and the dresser across the room. Where was this place that Loki had brought her to?

As fortune would have it, the door opened, and Loki strutted into the room, his nephews following behind him, trays overflowing with food in their hands.

"Ah, my Sladkaya, you are finally awake," Loki said with a leer, settling himself on the bed near her hip.

Eldonia glared at him and shuffled away from him.

"And feeding my son. He's a hungry little thing. Demands to be fed every two hours! Had to support him myself when he fed from you while you were passed out with fever."

Eldonia swallowed hard, despite her dry mouth. "Wh-where are we?" she asked hoarsely.

"Adolf!" Loki snapped. "Don't just stand there! Fetch the lady a glass of water!"

Adolf quickly set down his tray and poured some water into wooden cup. Eldonia took it gratefully and gulped it down. She wondered, though, why Loki was being even remotely kind to her.

Loki sneered at her. "I will tell you where we are, Krasivaya, but only after we make a little deal."

"What sort of deal?"

Loki reached out a hand and gently cupped his son's head, copping a feel of her full, round breast as he did. Eldonia shuddered in revulsion and tried to scoot back farther on the bed, but Loki caught her arm and kept her from moving.

"I will tell you of our plans," Loki said softly, "where we are, where we're going, what we'll be doing, but only if you promise not to tell ANYONE what I tell you."

"And why should I do that?"

"Ah, my spunky woman. That's what I love about you. You see, my dear, if you tell anyone, in hopes of escaping from me, well, I'll just take the punishment out on your body. I'm sure you're familiar with my...methods." Loki licked his lips as his eyes raked down her form, still clad only in her ratty nightgown.

Eldonia shivered. However, steeling her courage, she stiffened her spine and spat back, "Yeah, well, since I am familiar with your methods and have endured such before, how can you be so certain that will deter me?"

Loki's eyes went hard and he yanked her close to him, making her yelp and causing the baby to wail. "Oh, I know it won't deter you. However, you are not alone now, Sladkaya. If you wish no harm to come to your son, you will keep your mouth shut!"

Eldonia looked at Loki in horror and held her squalling son tightly in her arms. "You wouldn't! He's...he's your son!"

Loki shrugged in nonchalance. "I can always sire more children, more sons. What is one small, scrawny boy in the long run?" Loki looked hard into Eldonia's eyes. "Now, do I have your word, on threat of your child, that you will not repeat what I am about to tell you to ANYONE?"

Eldonia gulped and nodded, her eyes wide.

"My nephews and I have decided to travel for a bit. The Vladian countryside has seemed...rather stifling lately. So, we're journeying south for a while. We're currently in Fatlantis, in an inn in Glastonbury, some fifty miles from the Vladian border. And, since I need a minder for my new son, we're taking you with us on our journey."

Eldonia didn't think she was being told the whole truth, but she figured Loki would reveal nothing if she pressed him for clarification.

"Where is your...our...ultimate destination?" she hesitantly asked.

"I haven't decided yet. However, I doubt we'll linger long in Fatlantis. Fatlantis is so...boring. And everyone here is so disgustingly obese." Loki shuddered with a grimace. "The only plus about journeying through this wretched country is that the food is always exceptionally good."

Eldonia's stomach decided that moment to growl. She blushed while all three men laughed.

"It has been two days since you've eaten anything, Krasivaya," Loki said. "Feel free to eat anything on the trays here that Adolf and Ranulf have brought up. Meanwhile, we'll look after the babe."

Eldonia tried to hold onto her still-crying baby, but Loki firmly removed him from her arms.

"There, there, now, my little Odin," Loki said, smirking down into his son's red face. "There will be plenty more milk for you in a couple more hours."

Loki's face grimaced, and he held out the upset infant to Ranulf. "Go change my son! He stinks!"

Ranulf cringed, but gingerly took the baby from his uncle. He and his brother had been responsible for burping and changing the newborn since they had left Mountania. Loki merely made sure the child was fed and warm.

After Ranulf and Adolf left the room, Loki turned his eyes back on Eldonia, who was trying to straighten her torn, tattered gown over her body.

"I'll leave you to eat," Loki said huskily. "However, I'll be back with better clothing for you to wear. And I'll expect a certain...payment for my generosity."

Eldonia gasped. "But...but I am not yet recovered from giving birth!"

Loki grasped her arms and hauled her to his body again, where she could clearly feel the hard bulge in his pants. "I care NOTHING for your travail! If I WANT YOU, WENCH, then I SHALL HAVE YOU! Is that understood?!"

Eldonia nodded her head, her body quivering in fear.

Loki let her go and got to his feet. "I'll be back in thirty minutes. You'd better eat what's on those trays, because you won't be fed anything else the rest of the night!"

The door slammed shut behind him.

Eldonia merely curled into a ball and sobbed. "Forty!" she whispered fiercely. "Forty, please, please, please find me!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Please, Grandpa?"

"Merlin, I said no!"

"But I promise to be on my best behavior!"

"The answer's still no!"

"Aww, come on! I haven't been to Regis City in months! I want to see the fat princes again!"

"Merlin, how many times have I told you not to call them that?! You shall refer to them by their names and their titles! They are royalty and deserve your respect!"

"Yeah, yeah, Prince Cameron and Prince Edmund. I want to see how much fatter they've gotten since I saw them last time!"

Draxon sighed and rubbed a handkerchief over his brow. While he well understood his grandson's obsession with the heirs to the Fatlantean throne (he had had a similar obsession himself when he was Merlin's age), his current task at the Fatlantean capital required discretion--something his grandson still didn't grasp.

"Merlin, for the last time: my appointment with King David is private and personal. Only I am expected at the palace. I can't just tote you along with me!"

Merlin frowned. "But I've come along with you tons of times before! Why not this time?"

"MERLIN! Challenge me one more time, and I will make sure your father tests you on the past thousand years of Fantasmian magical history...tomorrow! And if you don't ace the test, you will do nothing but study for the next month! No playing! No practicing of spells or potions! Nothing but studying and reading and revising for an entire month! Have I made myself clear?!"

Merlin gulped and nodded his head. "Y-yes, sir! I'm sorry, Grandpa!"

Draxon sighed again and held his arms open wide. Merlin ran into them, and the two embraced. "Now be good for your grandmother and your parents while I'm gone."

"I will, Grandpa. How long will you be gone this time?"

"About a week."

"I'll miss you!"

Draxon chuckled and ruffled his grandson's hair. "I'll miss you, too, you little scamp. Now, get on back to your studies!"

"Awww...."

As Merlin dejectedly left Draxon's room, Ursula came in.

"What was Merlin's long face for?" she asked her husband.

Draxon groaned as he waved his wand in a complicated pattern towards his dresser and closet and clothes magically flew into his waiting bags and trunk. "He wanted to go to Regis City with me. I'm afraid I had to be rather firm with him that he couldn't come this time."

Ursula chuckled. "He reminds me of Mordred when he was Merlin's age."

Draxon snorted as he fastened the clasps on his luggage. "He reminds me of ME when I was his age!"

Ursula laughed. "I bet he does."

Draxon sighed and embraced his wife. "I'm not looking forward to this visit, to be honest. To be called in as a special counsel for the Fatlantean and Mountanian crowns regarding Vladian activity near the border is not my idea of fun."

"No, I'm sure it's not. However, I know that Kings David and Leviathan will appreciate any intelligence and insight you'll bring to the table."

"Thank you for your confidence, Ursa." He gave her a kiss on the cheek.

"Now, is that any way to say goodbye to your wife?" She gave him a saucy grin.

Draxon grinned back before planting a solid kiss on her mouth.

"Mmm. Now that's more like it."

Draxon chuckled and gave his wife a mock shove away from him. "Tease me anymore, and you'll encourage activities that will give me a heart attack!"

"You didn't have a heart attack last night!"

Draxon blushed. "Hush, woman! You'll let the entire castle know our secrets!"

Ursula gave him a kiss on the cheek before whispering in his ear, "I love you, Draxie. Come home to me soon."

"I love you, too, Ursa. I'll be back in a week."

Ursula left the room so Draxon could finish packing. As Draxon was walking by his window, fastening his cloak about his shoulders, he caught sight of three horses in the distance, meandering along the dirt road that led passed the White Castle. While travellers weren't terribly common this far north in Fatlantis, he occasionally saw people on horseback journeying towards or from Mountania. Normally, seeing horses and riders outside his window wouldn't give Draxon pause. However, as soon as his eyes landed on the sight of those three horses and their riders, a feeling of foreboding chilled Draxon's heart.

Draxon laid his cloak on the bed and stepped closer to his window. He focussed intently on the travellers in the distance. Two horses carried just one passenger, with both of them appearing to be men, while the third and lead horse carried two passengers, with one of these appearing to be a woman. The sense of wrongness increased in Draxon's heart as he kept watch on the four riders.

He aimed his wand at the three horses and muttered a phrase in Latin, and suddenly it was as if he were looking through a telescope: the people in the distance now appeared to be just a few feet away from him. Draxon frowned. The men were nothing remarkable to look at, though he got awful waves of evil rolling off the man in the lead, who had the woman in his arms. Draxon's arms widened when he realized the woman was holding a young baby in her arms. He gasped when the woman raised her head, revealing her exhausted, pained, tear-streaked face.

The woman was familiar to him. He KNEW he'd seen her before...but where?

"Ursula!" he called. "Ursula, come here!"

"What, Draxon? I thought you'd be gone by now!"

"Come here to the window and look at these people passing by. Tell me if you recognize any of them, particularly the woman."

Ursula frowned, but came near her anxious husband. She peered through Draxon's spell in front of the window. She put a hand to her mouth and gasped.

"Eldonia! She's had her baby already! But that isn't Lord Vanderstorm or his brothers with her! Where have I seen that face before?!"

"So you recognize this woman?"

"Don't you remember the Earl of Vanderstorm's lovely wife? We attended their wedding and met their firstborn son, Leonardo."

"Oh, yes! I thought she looked familiar!"

"But she looks terrible! And who in the world is she riding with?"

"I have no idea, but I get the most terrible feeling that something is not right with her."

Ursula tapped her chin and thought. Her eyes widened when a particular memory came forward in her mind. She grasped Draxon's arms desperately.

"Draxie! Oh, no! I...I remember where I've seen the face of the man Eldonia's riding with before!"

"Well, who is he, Ursa?"

"He's that no good Vladian warlord who kidnapped her and raped her! He's the father of her newborn child!"

"WHAT?! Why that scoundrel! What in the world is she doing with him again?!"

"I have no idea! But it can't be anything good!"

Both Draxon and Ursula watched the riders a few minutes longer, full of concern and anger, with the sense of unease growing stronger and stronger the longer they watched.

"I have a feeling she's been kidnapped again," Draxon said softly.

"I think you're right, my love. What should we do?"

"I'm already on my way to meet with Kings David and Leviathan. It won't do for me to be late. I will inform them of what we have just seen. Together, they should have the force and power to help Eldonia."

"Yes. Meanwhile, I'll take Merlin and we'll got to Castle Vanderstorm. Lord Vanderstorm should be privy to what we know, as well. I can only imagine how the poor dear is coping with the loss of his wife yet again!"

"Very well. Take care, my dear. And make sure Merlin stays on his best behavior!"

"Of course! Would you expect any less from me?"

Draxon smiled. "No."

Giving each other one last kiss, Draxon teleported himself and his luggage to Regis City, while Ursula went to go round up her grandson and head to Castle Vanderstorm.

"YAH! Take THAT, you evil villains! And that! And THAT!"

Princes Cameron and Edmund watched, amused and munching on a large platter full of fruit tarts, as Prince Gladius swung his sword, parrying and thrusting against invisible enemies, in the large foyer of the Fatlantean royal palace.

"Ha! That'll show you to sneak up on Gladius the Great!"

"Eeeek!"
"Aiiiiieeeee!"
"Oh no! Not the famous Gladius the Great!"
"You mean the INFAMOUS Gladius the Great!"

"Ah, shut up, you two!" Gladius said, scowling at two laughing fat princes.

"Sorry, Gladdy. We can't help it!" said Edmund.

"Yeah," said Cameron. "You just look so funny waltzing around the foyer, poking your sword into nothing but air."

"Get stuffed!"

Cameron grinned and rubbed his large belly. "I'm trying to, believe me!"

Gladius glared. "Well, unlike you two porkers, who just have to sit around all day, eating and getting fatter, I have to actually TRAIN in order to keep up my skills. Otherwise, how can I be an able bodyguard for you lardos?"

"Hey!" Cameron protested. "We train! You think it's easy to get as fat as we are? We've had to train hard to eat as much we do and wrangle our stomachs into submission!"

Gladius snorted. "Yeah, right! I know how many potions you guys take so that you can eat more without puking your guts out! That's not training! That's copping out!"

Cameron glared at Gladius and was about to retort, but Edmund put his hand on his brother's arm. "It's not worth it, Cam," he whispered. Turning to Gladius, he said, "Point taken. But still...wouldn't it be better to train against an actual opponent instead of fighting against thin air?"

"Of course it would!" Gladius said in exasperation. "But where am I going to find a training companion HERE?"

"Well, you could always spar with some of our palace guards," Edmund pointed out.

Gladius snorted again. "Your guards may be stronger than average Fatlanteans, but they're still sacks of blubber!"

A loud *POP!* suddenly echoed in the foyer, and the three boys turned their heads.

"Hey, Draxon!" Cameron said with a smile.

"Hello, your royal highnesses: Cameron, Edmund, and Gladius," Draxon said genteelly, bowing at each prince in turn.

"What are you doing here?" Gladius asked.

Draxon raised an eyebrow at the rude question, but answered anyway. "I'm actually here to meet with your father and King David."

Gladius's face paled. "P-p-papa's here?!"

"You didn't know?" asked Cameron. "I heard that he arrived last night."

"Yeah," chimed in Edmund. "He and our father have been holed up in the war-room all day, since before breakfast!"

"Ah, crap!"

Draxon cleared his throat. "Master Gladius, if you would be so kind as to show me to this 'war-room'?"

Gladius sighed. He hated manners and following etiquette, but he didn't want word getting back to his father that he behaved less than respectfully to the aging wizard. "Sure, and then I'll take your luggage up to your room."

Draxon smiled. "Thank you, your highness."

Draxon bowed again to the fat princes. "Your highnesses."

"See you, Draxon!"
"Will you show us some magic tricks later?"

Draxon chuckled. "If I have the time, certainly!"

"Oh, boy!"

Gladius rolled his eyes as he led Draxon out of the foyer and down the large, stone hallways.

"So," Gladius said, "do you know why my father and King David are having their pow-wow?" His eyes glowed with curiosity and excitement. "Is it some hostile take-over threat? Are we going to be going to war?!"

Draxon chuckled and shook his head. "This meeting is completely confidential, your highness, and even if I wanted to speak of it, I wouldn't."

Gladius frowned and slumped his shoulders. "Man, I can't wait till I'm old enough to be able to sit on war councils!"

"All in good time, Master Gladius. You'll be grown up before you know it."

"Here's the war-room," Gladius said when they finally reached the large, closed double-doors near the throne-room.

"Thank you, your highness."

As Gladius left to go see to the wizard's luggage, Draxon rapped loudly on one of the doors with his staff.

A guard opened the door, bowed to the wizard, and admitted him entrance.

"Ah! Draxon! So good of you to join us!" came the booming voice of King David.

"Your majesties," Draxon intoned, bowing before the two imposing monarchs.

David was sitting on an enormous throne at the other end of the room at the head of a long, rectangular table. King Leviathan was pacing the length of the wall beside David, his steps and posture showing his agitation and unease. Colorful maps of Fatlantis, Mountania, Lucia, Fantasmia, Obesita, Vladia, and the entire continent were tacked on the walls.

"What exactly is the situation that prompted you calling my presence here today?" Draxon asked when he reached David's left hand and settled down into a large, comfortable chair.

"There have been many disturbing developments in Vladian activity and troop movement near the borders of Mountania and Fatlantis recently," said King Leviathan, pacing over to a map and pointing to several places on the Vladian border.

"While our spies have not heard or seen anything conclusive," King David explained, "for the safety of our people, we cannot discount these sudden upsurges in Vladian activity so near the borders."

"How long have these upsurges been taking place?"

"For about two weeks," said Leviathan, frowning. "Ever since I got back from visiting Castle Vanderstorm."

Draxon's ears perked up at this. "Was the Lady Eldonia there at the castle when you were visiting, your majesty?"

Leviathan scowled and cursed under his breath. "She was initially. I had gone to the Vanderstorm seat to transport some Vladian trespassers to Ferramount for judgment, but the Vladians escaped." Leviathan pounded his fist on the large, oak table in fury, making the heavy, solid table shudder. "They captured Lady Vanderstorm right from under our noses and took her with them!!"

David frowned. "Levi, why didn't you share this with me?"

"And admit to my failure?! The Lady Vanderstorm had already been kidnapped once by those awful brigands--tortured and abused and raped! She even had the indignity of becoming pregnant by one of the filthy, lawless, moral-less scoundrels! Then, to have her be kidnapped again by the same mercenaries?! And for me to not have been able to stop it?! I still hate my ineffectualness at protecting one of my own, David!"

Draxon cleared his throat. "If I may, your majesty, I believe I have some news that will lighten your burden."

"What is that, Draxon?"

"Before I teleported here, I saw some riders along the road near the White Castle. I got an awful sense of unease as I watched them, and my wife Ursula helped me to identify them. We clearly saw Lady Eldonia on horseback with a newborn baby in her arms. She was riding with three other men, whom I believe now are three Vladians who re-kidnapped her."

Leviathan's eyes widened, and he stalked over to Draxon. "You're sure it was Eldonia you saw?!"

"My wife was positive it was her, your majesty."

"Levi, might I suggest you go with Draxon, find the Lady Eldonia, and help her return to her family?" David said gently. "We can continue our discussion at a later point."

Leviathan ran a hand through his hair. "I don't want to leave just yet! I practically just got here!"

"And we're making little progress without better intelligence!"

"Your majesties," said Draxon, getting up and moving slowly over to the map of Vladia on the wall. "All of the Vladian troop movement seen recently are along these stretches of the border, correct?"

The two kings frowned as Draxon ran a gnarled finger along the map. "Yes," said Leviathan.

"You know, a large keep, used as a main stronghold of Vladian forces, is right here, a mere forty miles from all of these sections of the border." Draxon pointed at a large dot on the map.

Leviathan's eyes widened, and he stalked back over to the map. "That's the stronghold of former Overlord Ramius and his sons. They're the ones responsible for Lady Vanderstorm's kidnapping--both times!"

The room was silent a few minutes as the three men pondered this news.

"Levi, is it possible that these recent troop movements are merely a diversion?" asked David. "To distract us from looking for and finding Lady Eldonia and her kidnappers?"

"You said yourself, your majesty, that the rise of activity along the border began after Lady Eldonia was kidnapped again," Draxon pointed out.

Leviathan rubbed a finger along his chin. "That does sound possible."

"Levi, let us not worry about the borders for right now," said David decisively. "We'll keep abreast of any new information from our spies. However, if it's truly a diversion, we need to focus our efforts more on finding and rescuing Lady Eldonia."

"Agreed," said Leviathan with a nod. "Master Draxon, will you be able to find Lady Eldonia with your magic?"

Draxon frowned. "I should be able to scry her whereabouts, but only if I have a close relation nearby that I can touch: someone who shares her blood."

"Well, then, would you care to teleport us to Castle Vanderstorm?"

"Certainly, your majesty."

With a wave of Draxon's wand and a loud *POP!*, Leviathan and Draxon disappeared.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
As soon as Draxon and King Leviathan landed in the foyer of Castle Vanderstorm, they both cringed at the sounds of loud yelling reverberating through the stone walls.

"WHAT DO YOU MEAN YOU SAW MY WIFE?! AND THAT SHE HAD GIVEN BIRTH TO THAT NO GOOD VLADIAN'S CHILD?! WHY DIDN'T YOU RESCUE HER WHEN YOU SAW HER?! WHY DID YOU MERELY COME HERE TO GIVE ME SUCH NEWS, INSTEAD OF DOING SOMETHING ABOUT IT?! GO AND FIND YOUR GOOD-FOR-NOTHING HUSBAND AND HAVE HIM FIND MY WIFE AND BRING HER TO ME!!!"

"That would be Lord Vanderstorm," Leviathan said on a sigh.

"I was anticipating him being upset and angry, but I had no idea he would be this...volatile," said Draxon with a shudder.

"Well, how would you feel if your woman were kidnapped right out from under your nose--twice?! He's feeling understandably emasculated. There's a part of me that feels that way, too, considering she was taken from under my watch this second time, too."

The two men cautiously ventured over to the front parlor, where the cursing and swearing and angry litany of disparaging comments were still being yelled.

"Fortis Maximus Vanderstorm!" came Lady Athena's voice above the din. "How dare you say such things to Ursula! She has done NOTHING wrong! You should be GRATEFUL that any news has come to us of poor Eldonia's whereabouts, instead of berating Ursula for coming here and trying to help! At least we have an idea where Eldonia is now, and the search for her can begin in earnest!"

"Indeed, my lord," said Draxon as he and the King entered the parlor. "If I had not been called away to an important meeting, I would have followed Lady Eldonia and her captors in my crystal ball until they had stopped to rest for the night. Then, I would have made sure you were informed and able to form a rescue party in order to retrieve her."

Fortis ran his hands over his face. He looked notably tired, pale, and haggard, with dark purple bags under his eyes. He had obviously not been sleeping well since his wife's re-capture. His eyes were blood-shot and bleary, his clothes looked dirty and rumpled, and he had the distinct smell of strong spirits about him. Leviathan could only surmise that the young lord had been drowning his sorry and worry in liquor.

"Are you here with any good news for me?" Fortis asked Draxon hoarsely.

"I do not know where your wife currently is, my lord," the aging wizard said apologetically, "however, there is a way that we can locate her current whereabouts."

"Well, tell me, man! How much longer do I have to wait for someone to tell me where I can find my wife?!"

"Forty," said Minerva gently as she came over to him and put her arms around his waist. "Please, calm down! Uncle Draxon and Aunt Ursula are here to help! I know you're worried about Eldonia! I am, too! We all are! And we all miss her terribly! I'm weary of having to rock poor little Leo to sleep every night as he cries for his momma! But, now that we have such great wizards to help us, surely Eldonia will be back with us soon."

Fortis gave a weary sigh and put his great arms around his sister, holding her close in a desperate embrace.

"I...apologize, Ursula, Draxon," he said grudgingly. "You say there's a way to find my wife?"

"Indeed, my lord," Draxon said with a nod. "There's a special form of scrying that I can do that will allow my mind's eye to see her and then show you exactly where Lady Eldonia is."

"Well, then, let's do it already!"

"The only catch, my lord, is that in order for this type of scrying to work, I need a person that shares her blood to help me focus my magic and find her."

"So, you need a blood relative in order to locate Eldonia?" Minerva asked.

"Yes, my lady."

Fortis sighed impatiently. "We don't have time to go and fetch her father!"

"My lord, we do not need Lord VonGewalt for Draxon to perform the spell," said Ursula kindly, though she was still a bit bristled by how Fortis had treated her earlier. "We can use young Leo."

Fortis instantly rose to his full height and snarled, "No! Absolutely not! I will NOT let you take my son's blood or have him subjected to some...some weird blood magic!"

"My lord, your son will not be harmed at all, I can assure you!" said Draxon. "I do not need to collect any of his blood, or anything like that! I merely need to hold his hands while I perform the spell to give me special sight!"

Fortis looked taken aback for a moment. "You only need to hold his hands?"

"Yes, my lord."

"And you can guarantee my son's safety the entire time you do this...spell?"

"Yes, my lord. He will be perfectly fine. He won't feel a thing!"

Fortis sighed again, noticeably deflating. "Alright. You can use Leo to perform your spell if it can help you find E-ellie...."

"I'll go get Leo," said Minerva quietly before she hurriedly left the room.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
When Minerva returned holding Leo in her arms, the tired little boy was rubbing his fist in his eye. "Anta Minnie? Momma here?"

"Not yet, Leo, but Uncle Draxon is here to help us find her."

"Unca Dracsa!"

Draxon chuckled at the little tot and ruffled the boy's hair.

"You help find Momma?" Leo asked.

"I will, young man, and I need YOUR help, too!"

"Me? Me help find Momma? Yea!"

"Come here, my lad."

Draxon gingerly took the toddler from Minerva, sat down creakily on a settee, and settled the boy on his lap so that Leo was facing him. He gently took the boy's hands in his.

"Now, I'm going to use a bit of special magic to try and find your mother, alright, Leo? But for me to do that, I need you to hold my hands tightly." He smiled as Leo squeezed his hands in a death-grip. "And I also need you to close your eyes and think about your mother. Keep picturing her in your head--what she looks like, what her voice sounds like--and keep thinking of her until I tell you to stop. Do you think you can do that for me?"

"Yah! I fink of Momma fo' you, Unca Dracsa!"

Leo closed his eyes tightly, bit his lip, and thought hard.

Athena wiped a tear from her eye at how brave and strong her little grandson was being. Fortis, meanwhile, sat down on the settee across from Draxon. He looked stoic and strong, but everyone knew it was just a front to hide the turmoil he was feeling. Minerva settled next to her brother, and he draped his arm around her shoulders to hold her close. Jupiter and Cannius stood off to the side, clenching and unclenching their fists. They were anxious to go out and rescue their sister-in-law. They hated seeing their strong, formidable brother reduced to an ineffectual mess because of what happened to Eldonia. King Leviathan stood with Athena on the other side of the room, interested in seeing this bit of magic that Draxon was going to perform to find Lady Eldonia.

Ursula and Merlin came up behind Draxon, and they put their hands on one of each of his shoulders, closing their eyes and channeling their own magic into him in order to strengthen his Inner Eye.

Draxon closed his own eyes and chanted a spell:

"Blood of blood flowing through loving hands,
Too much time has passed through the sands.
Through the son, may the mother be found.
Show me the place; show me the ground,
That Eldonia Vanderstorm I may See,
As I will, so mote it be!"

A bright, white light surrounded Draxon, Ursula, Merlin, and Leo, making the six spectators look on them with growing anticipation. The three wizards and Leo stayed glowing for several minutes, with Fortis becoming more and more tense. He noticed Draxon's eyes roving wildly under his lined, sagging eyelids.

Suddenly, Draxon's eyes opened, and the six onlookers gasped. The old wizard's eyes were completely white, with no iris or pupil to be seen! He began speaking in Latin, and when he was done, a large image appeared, floating in the middle of the room for everyone to see.

Draxon stumbled and fell to his knees harshly on the hard ground, groaning in pain, as the rescue party rematerialized. Ursula staggered to the ground, as well, as she had been holding onto her husband's arm.

"Draxie? Are you okay?" Ursula asked in concern, running her hands over her husband's face.

Draxon grimaced and slowly opened his eyes. "I...I think so. My magic is just so weak after that scrying spell...."

"Where in the world did you bring us, old man?" came Fortis's gruff voice. "I thought we'd arrive in the middle of a forest somewhere, with Eldonia and those blasted Vladians nearby!"

"Yeah," added Cannius, his hand gripping the pommel of sword, ready for some action. "Instead, we're at the driveway of some sort of mansion."

"Mansion?" asked Draxon, breathing hard.

King Leviathan came over to Draxon and Ursula and helped the old wizard to his feet. "Do you know where we are, Draxon?" the king asked.

"Y-yes!" Draxon gasped. "This is the manor house of the Earl of Laceton!"

Leviathan frowned and looked up at the impressive building. He had never been to Laceton before, but he knew who resided here, and he was less than pleased with that fact!

"Would the Earl know anything about my wife or her whereabouts?" Fortis asked between clenched teeth. He was ready to get to his wife already! He had been waiting for weeks to get her back home, and now that they were on the cusp of rescuing her, they were dithering around!

"He might," Draxon answered. "The Earl is good friends with my son Mordred, and I have gotten to know the Earl fairly well. He usually keeps himself abreast of everything taking place near his home. Perhaps we should go knock on his door and inquire if he has knowledge of Eldonia's exact whereabouts."

"NO! ABSOLUTELY NOT!" thundered Leviathan.

Fortis and his brothers were taken aback at the king's vehemence. Draxon and Ursula, however, knowing exactly who the Earl of Laceton was and his relation to the king, looked at Leviathan in frustration.

"Really, your majesty," Ursula chided. "Isn't time to let bygones be bygones? What happened with Lucius was more than twenty years ago! What has he done since that time to earn your ire? I heard that he's been an exceptional ambassador to Mountania, and that he's smart and cunning. Besides, he knows this area of Fatlantis much better than we do! He could surely help find Eldonia easier than we can, and he might even be able to round up a few more men to help us find her. The more men we have in our company, the easier it will be to take those marauding, kidnapping Vladians down!"

Leviathan sighed and ran a hand over his face.

"My lord," Fortis said, turning to the king quizzically, "who is the Earl of Laceton?"

The king gritted his teeth and punched out, "My older, deposed, semi-exiled brother, Lucius."

Fortis, Cannius, and Jupiter's eyebrows all rose in astonishment. None of them had any idea that Leviathan had a brother other than the fun-loving, joking prankster Achilles, who lived down in Fantasmia.

"Ol-older, your majesty?" said Jupiter in surprise.

"So, why isn't he king?" asked Cannius.

"THIS IS NOTHING I WISH TO DISCUSS!" Leviathan shouted. He took a deep breath to calm down, then said gruffly, "Suffice it to say, I want nothing to do with my brother. But!" He raised a hand when Draxon and Ursula opened their mouths to argue. "I appreciate your reasoning in that he...might...be able to help us rescue Lady Vanderstorm."

Levi sighed, then scowled. "Alright! Let's ask for his aid. But, I swear to you, I want as little interaction with the man as I can get!"

"Thank you, your majesty," Draxon said with a soft smile.

The party, minus Levi, then hurried up the drive to the front door of the large, well-maintained estate.

"Psst! Draxon!" Cannius said under his breath.

Draxon sighed. "Yes, Lord Cannius?"

"How did the king's older brother become the Earl of Laceton in Fatlantis? And why have none of us ever heard of him before?"

"My lord, that is a tale for another time. Let us focus now on rescuing your sister-in-law, yes?"

When the parlor door opened again, everyone looked to the doorway eagerly. When Leviathan saw who it was, he sneered in disgust, then promptly turned so his back was to the door. "My lords, my lady, welcome to Laceton. It's a pleasure to have you in my home," he said kindly.

Lucius entered the room, followed soon by a couple maids, bearing platters with tea service for seven. As the maids went about the process of getting a cup of appropriately sugared and/or milked tea for everyone. Lucius settled himself down on a large chair next to Ursula and Draxon.

"My lord," Fortis began as he sat on the very edge of a chair opposite Lucius, "I am Lord Fortis Vanderstorm."

"Ah, I've heard of you, Lord Vanderstorm. You were quite instrumental in Mountania's recent war against Vladia."

Before Fortis had a chance to ask for Lucius's help, Lucius turned to the other people in the room, minus Levi. "Ursula, Draxon, how nice to see you again! It's been quite a while since I've been to the White Castle, though Mordred keeps hounding me to come up and visit."

Draxon chuckled. "You're welcome to our home anytime, your highness."

Lucius looked a bit embarrassed at the title and waved it away. "Please, just call me Lucius." Though he might technically still be a Prince of Mountania, being deposed and semi-exiled left him feeling that he just be recognized as the Lord of Laceton.

"I'm Cannius."
"And I'm Jupiter."

"We're Fortis's brothers," the two said together.

Lucius nodded his head with a smile. "It's a pleasure to meet you."

Everyone sensed the tension between the king and his brother and didn't bother to include the stoic King in their discussion.

Eager to get the ball rolling, Fortis cleared his throat, getting Lucius's attention back to him. "So, what brings you to my door?" Lucius asked.

Fortis clenched his jaw, and he unconsciously tightened his grip around his teacup, such that the porcelain cup nearly broke. "We're looking for my wife," he forced out. "She was recently kidnapped by Vladian war-lords. We have reason to believe they're camped out not far from here. Lucius's face hardened. "Some Vladians DARED to kidnap your wife?! I know they have no honor, but to stoop so low as to do such a thing...!"

"Lord Lucius, have you seen them at all?"
"It's three men: two teenagers and one in his mid-twenties."
"Eldonia is very lovely. She has blond hair and blue eyes."
"She's about 5'8" or so."
"Oh! And she'd have a baby with her."
"Yeah. She recently gave birth."

Lucius's eyes widened at this realization, and he quickly got to his feet to begin pacing. Anger rolled off him in waves. "I CAN'T believe I was so STUPID!"

Levi snorted at this, but kept his face at the window.

"To be DUPED by some Vladians! And he told me she was HIS WIFE, and I BELIEVED him!"

"What are you going on about?" Fortis growled.

Lucius turned back to towards Fortis, his face red with rage. "Three foreigners, a woman, and a baby--all matching the description you just gave--came to the manor earlier today, asking for supplies and food. They said they were refugees from Vladia--as I recognized their accent--trying to escape the tyranny and injustice up there. I foolishly gave them clothes, food, blankets, and a few other supplies before they went on their way."

"YOU FOOL!" Levi yelled, finally turning around and facing everyone. He stalked up to his brother, his fists clenched in front of him menacingly. "YOU LET A BUNCH OF VLADIAN BRIGANDS INTO YOUR HOME AND GAVE THEM SUPPLIES?! YOU ARE MORE STUPID AND IDIOTIC THAN I EVER FIGURED YOU FOR! YOU HAVE ALWAYS BEEN TOO SOFT-HEARTED AND WEAK, AND THIS JUST PROVES IT! YOU WERE NEVER FIT FOR THE CROWN, AND FATHER WAS WISE TO TAKE IT OUT OF YOUR LILY-LIVERED, FAT, BLUBBEROUS, UNFIT HANDS!"

Before anyone could say anything, the king threw a solid punch to Lucius's face! Lucius's staggered back several steps, his nose spurting blood, but he kept to his feet, impressing the other three Mountanians in the room.

Lucius glared at his brother and swiped at his bleeding nose with the back of his hand. "How dare you strike me for making an honest mistake! I may have to put up with your abuse in Mountania, brother, but I will not stand for it in MY OWN HOME! And when will you ever get passed what happened twenty years ago? I never WANTED the crown! I was GLAD when Father transferred it into your hands! No, I'm not proud of what I did or what happened so long ago, but why can't you let bygones be bygones?!"

"I WILL NEVER FORGIVE YOU FOR WHAT YOU DID! YOU ARE NOT WORTHY TO BE CALLED MY BROTHER!'

"Your majesty! My lord! PLEASE!" said Draxon, struggling to his feet. "This is neither the time nor the place to be fighting about the past! We need to find Lady Vanderstorm and her child as soon as possible, before the Vladians' trail becomes cold and impossible to follow!"

Levi and Lucius glared at each other, their chests heaving in anger, but eventually, they both turned to the rest of the room.

"Yes, Draxon," the king said gruffly. "You're right."

"Lord Lucius," said Fortis, "do you have any idea where they are?"

Lucius nodded his head. "Yes. They headed east, along the main road towards Lucia. It was already getting dark by the time they left here, so I can't imagine they'd have gotten very far before needing to make camp...unless they decided to travel on through the night."

Draxon shook his head. "No, they stopped to camp. My scrying revealed them lying on the ground next to a fire."

"Let me round up a few of my men," Lucius said, "and we can get underway."

Levi snorted, looking his brother up and down and focussing on his large, fat belly. "I don't think a few Fatlanteans will help us much!"

Lucius sighed, trying for patience. "Levi, the men I have in mind are not only Fatlantean. I have several Mountanians employed here, and I assure you: they are strong and able-bodied. Besides, the Fatlanteans I'll recruit to help us are stronger than the average Fatlantean, as well."

"Hmph!" Levi sneered.

Fortis sighed. "My lord, how long will it take to round these men up?"

"Not more than a hour," Lucius said.

"Then, let's not delay! I don't want to be away from my wife a second longer than I have to be!"

Lucius nodded his head and quickly left the room to gather his men and suit himself up for battle.

Fortis trying to get out of his sister's bed was like an elephant trying to get out of a shopping-basket! It was never going to happen gracefully!

Fortis got up and tried to move! But his leg caught the bedpost on the way out! He tripped over and hit the floor with a 'THUD!' that rattled the windows! Eldonia glared at her husband!

"What are you DOING in here!?" she cried out, "I want to spend some special time with my hubby and I find him in bed with his own sister!?"

Minerva knew that Fortis and Eldonia had been on edge for weeks now, and there was probably another explosive argument just around the corner! Seeking to avoid another all-out screaming match...especially at 1:30 in the morning!...she intervened!

"Eldonia, Fortis likes sleeping with me!" Minerva tried. Almost at once, she realised she'd stepped on a landmine!

"OH! OH I SEE! YOU LIKE SLEEPING WITH YOUR SISTER! BUT YOU WON'T SLEEP WITH ME!?"

"That's NOT what she means!" Fortis grunted! He was trying to untangle himself from the mess of bedsheets that he'd pulled off with him when he fell on the floor!

"Fortis wanted someone to cuddle with!" Minerva said, "Some peace and quiet! That's all! He works so hard!...And he's injured!" she added quickly.

"I am NOT!" said Fortis. The very IDEA that such a specimen of Mountanian masculinity would be STUPID enough to get himself injured was impossible!

Minerva groaned. "Your back, remember!?" she hissed, while she pulled the covers off her brother's legs.

"Wh...Oh! Oh yeah...Oooow!!" he grunted, as he got up, not entirely convincingly.

"Your back?" Eldonia said, accusingly.

"He twisted it while he was re-roofing the main barn!" Minerva insisted, "And it's very very sore...Isn't it, brother darling?"

Fortis nodded vigorously.

"He came in here so I could give it a massage! It hurts so very much! Isn't that right, Fortis?"

More nodding!

"Fortis ADORES you just as much as he adores me!" Minerva continued, "You even have a beautiful baby boy! And he would LOVE to...enjoy you even more!...But he can't do it when he's all tied up with muscle-cramps! And he wouldn't want to try anything with you if he wasn't able to um...perform...to the level that you're used to..."

Fortis would probably have slapped his sister, for the first and last time in his life, if she DARED to suggest that HE couldn't "perform", as she put it!...But he withheld his thoughts, knowing that she was trying to butter Eldonia up.

"And you would be very upset if Fortis couldn't make you COMPLETELY happy! And it would make HIM feel like so much LESS of a man if he failed to do that!" Minerva continued. Eldonia burst out laughing when she spotted the look of HORROR on Fortis's face, which Minerva, who had her back to her brother, hadn't noticed!

"Girl!" He said.

"It's true!" Minerva said. "Now Forty's got a very sore back! He should lie down and have complete rest for a week! Eldonia you should take care of him! He would like someone sweet and adorable like you!"

"Oh would he?" Eldonia asked. She frowned. She wasn't convinced!

"Well who else would there to be relax him...and massage oil on his body...and release all the...tension...within...?"

Eldonia liked the sound of that...Her poor little hubby all tied up in bed, needing someone to look after him...poor boy!

"A sister should do that..." Minerva began.

"Don't you DARE!" Eldonia said, "Looking after a man is a wife's duty!" she said. "Come along, Forty! I won't let Minerva steal you away from me!"

Fortis got up, but moved a bit too fast! He let out a grunt of pain as he felt the tightness in his back return! Damn it! He really threw it out this time!

Minerva helped Fortis to his feet and the two young women helped him back to his bedroom. Eldonia went to find some candles and scented oils. Her poor hubby needed all the care in the world! And she had been neglecting him expecting him to do things that obviously COULDN'T do because he was so very tired! It was rude of her to expect him to do things that he couldn't do...at least...not right now...She should've been able to just relax and look after him...

Minerva spotted the hungry look in her friend's eyes, and tiptoed out of the master bedroom, closing the doors behind her.
