choices: There are no more vegetables in the garden--Butterscotch ate them ALL!
Butterscotch disappears! The girls are sad! But he returns with his mate!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Butterscotch snuggled into the nice girl's arms. She held him firmly but delicately, and Butterscotch loved being held! He wriggled around a bit to dry his fur off a bit more on the girl's dress. While he enjoyed his dip in the warm pond, he didn't enjoy being wet for too long. After all, water tended to wash away all the oils on his fur, and he needed those oils to keep himself clean. He'd have to groom himself again when he got back to his hutch.

The one thing he didn't like about his dip in the pond was that his lunch was taken away from him! He'd just gotten in a couple of nibbles and had been about to take a good bite out of the long, juicy, thick carrot he'd found bobbing in the water, when he was suddenly airborne! The stern, scary man tossed him to the nice girl, but the girl hadn't given him any food yet! His belly rumbled in hunger, and he couldn't help himself as he began nibbling a bit on the flower pattern on the girl's dress.

"Oh! What...? Oh, you silly rabbit!" Minerva laughed when she felt and then saw Butterscotch trying to nibble on her clothes! She heard--actually HEARD--the rabbit's stomach growl, and she had pity on the poor, damp creature.

"Oh, you must still be hungry after having been denied your snack of Fortis!" She giggled and began rubbing the rabbit's large, soft, fat belly. The rabbit practically purred at the warm, nice caresses. "Well, you're in luck, Butterscotch! I'm taking you down to the kitchens, and I know Mrs. Tibbs will have plenty of carrots and lettuce and radishes and other tasty veggies for you to eat!"

Butterscotch luxuriated in the girl's arms. He absolutely LOVED having his belly rubbed! It helped to soothe the incredible hunger he felt. He needed to eat lots in preparation for winter! His rabbit senses were telling him that this winter was going to be a rough one, with lots of snow, bitter, cold temperatures, and little food to be had! So, he had to get as fat as possible in order to make it through till spring. He'd been eating at a decent pace once he'd found the large vegetable patch and the flower gardens near this huge hutch the humans lived in. However, he wasn't near fat enough yet! He needed to be at least twice his current size--if not three or four times!--in order to survive the winter off of his fat. He sure hoped the humans had plenty of food for him so he could get as big as possible!

"Mrs. Tibbs!" Minerva called as she entered the brightly lit, well-organized kitchen.

Butterscotch perked up once they entered the room. His little nose began twitching wildly at all the delicious, new, and wonderful smells! When he caught the scent and sight of his favorite meal--carrots!--he wriggled and struggled in the girl's arms!

"Butterscotch! Hold on, boy! Hey! Wait!"

Minerva tried in vain to keep the hungry rabbit in her arms, but the rodent was too eager and his legs were too powerful! With a quick thrust of his powerful back legs, he leapt out of the girl's arms and onto the large kitchen table. He hopped right up to a large platter filled to overflowing with freshly washed carrots and eagerly grabbed several with his front paws. He began nibbling and biting at a quick pace, anxious to get as much food into his hungry belly as possible!

Minerva merely laughed and patted the rabbit on his long ears, which were held back flat against his head as he ate. "I guess you were REALLY hungry, huh, boy?"

"Did you call for me, dear?" asked Mrs. Tibbs, as she came into the kitchen, wiping her hands on her white apron.

"I did," Minerva replied. "I was going to ask for some food for Butterscotch, here, but it seems he's already found some!"

"Oh, bad bunny!" the older woman replied, intending to swat the rabbit away. "Those carrots were meant for the beef and vegetable stew I was gonna cook up for dinner tonight!"

"Mrs. Tibbs! Don't!" Minerva said, putting her hand on the woman's arm to stay her. "I'm sure we have plenty more carrots, and Butterscotch won't surely eat all of them!"

A few minutes later, however, Minerva would come to eat her words. The two ladies watched with wide eyes as the fat rabbit plowed through the large plate of carrots in record time! Before either of them realized it, the platter was nibbled clean! The only thing remaining on the platter was a very bloated, stuffed rabbit, whose stomach had swollen to twice its former size!

Butterscotch lounged on his back, running his furry little paws over the sides of his belly in contentment. Those carrots sure hit the spot! However, despite how much he had just eaten, Butterscotch still felt hungry! He needed more food! He rolled lazily over onto his side and slowly pushed himself up onto his hind legs.

Minerva giggled at the sight the chubby bunny made. His belly was so large and round, it sat a long ways on the table in front of him! Minerva wondered if he could even hop!

Butterscotch soon proved her suspicions true by feebly jumping a couple inches down the kitchen table. He didn't so much hop as more shuffle.

"I have never in all my years seen a creature put away as much food as this rabbit just has!" Mrs. Tibbs said, wiping her apron over her sweating brow in astonishment. "Goodness! He can't still be hungry?!"

Indeed, a ways down from the platter were several large bowls filled with other vegetables that Mrs. Tibbs was going to use for her beef stew: peeled potatoes, sliced, raw onions, sliced tomatoes, green beans, and stalks of celery. Butterscotch sniffed at each bowl, twitching his whiskery nose in delight, before leaning over and grabbing several vegetables and nibbling and biting and chewing them rapidly.

"That rabbit's going to eat my entire makings for stew!" Mrs. Tibbs cried. "Shoo! Get out of here, now! Shoo! Shoo! Go on out to the garden and eat what you want out there, but no more outta my kitchen!"

Mrs. Tibbs grabbed a broom and was prepared to swat and prod the bunny off the table, but Minerva quickly scooped the still-eating rabbit into her arms.

"Mrs. Tibbs, don't hurt him! He doesn't know any better! After all, he's just a rabbit, and he's hungry!"

"I don't care! Get him outta my kitchen!"

Minerva quickly whisked the now much heavier rabbit out of the food-filled kitchen and into the back yard.

Mrs. Tibbs sighed and looked forlornly at her kitchen table. The platter of carrots was, of course, now empty. The bowls of potatoes and tomatoes were empty, too, and the rest of the bowls had maybe half of their former contents remaining! How had the rabbit eaten that much in such a short amount of time? The bigger concern, though, was how to salvage dinner?!

"Lucy, Katie!" she called.

The young girls scurried into the room. "Yes, ma'am?" they said.

Mrs. Tibbs looked sternly at the two girls. "That rabbit of yours ate most of the fixings for the stew I was going to be preparing for his lordship for dinner tonight! I want you two to not only keep a better eye on that pet of yours so that this doesn't happen again, but I also want you to go out to the garden and gather up some more vegetables for the stew! I need potatoes and tomatoes, green beans and onions! Here's a couple baskets for you--gather as much as you can! Now go, and be quick about it!"

"Yes, ma'am!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Hungry Bunny!

choices: Two weeks later, Butterscotch returns with another fat, fluffy rabbit!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Butterscotch! Potatoes! Potatoes, Butterscotch!"

Lucy entered the scullery where Butterscotch had his hutch in the corner. The hutch door was rarely closed. Butterscotch was pretty well house-trained, and was generally free to hop around the kitchen and gardens and servants quarters, but he rarely wandered far. That was why Lucy was shocked when she saw that the hutch was empty!

"Butterscotch?" she said. She peeked under the wash-baskets...and in the huge copper, the big water-boiling pot. Sometimes, when the wash was done and the water was still warm, the bunny hopped in for a scrubdown in the hot, soapy water. But this time, the bunny was nowhere to be seen!

Lucy checked under all the beds, the chairs, tables, in the garden, in the bushes...

--- --- --- ---

Fortis hugged the sobbing servant-girl.

"Hey now!" he said, "Shhhh! It's alright..."

"BUTTERSCOTCH GOOOONE!!" she wailed, hugging Fortis...the closest thing she had to a father...and sniffling hard! Fortis hugged her back as gently as he knew how.

"Butterscotch wasn't really your pet, Lucy. If he decides to hop away, there isn't really anything you can do", he said. "Besides, you don't know that he won't come back! Winter's on it's way, you know. These animals all have to hibernate for the cold weather!"

"What's a hidermate?" Lucy asked.

"Hi-BER-nate", Fortis explained, "The animals all get really fat. Then they go and hide underground where they sleep and sleep for weeks and weeks, to protect themselves from the cold weather when the snow comes! You saw how fat Butterscotch was getting! He was preparing for winter! If he still likes it here, he might come back".

"When!?" Lucy wailed.

"Oh not for a long time! Three or four months, perhaps..."

"FOUR MONTHS!? Is that more than tomorrow!?"

Fortis laughed at the young girl's naivety. "Yes", he said. "It's over twelve weeks! You know how long that is, don't you?"

Lucy nodded, "But...but I want Butterscotch!" she sniffled.

"If you were really nice to Butterscotch, he might come back", Fortis said.

Lucy sniffed. "You promise?" she asked.

"No. But he might. That's all".

Lucy nodded. "Okay..." she said.

Fortis smiled, "Now go on. Help Katie with the dishwashing. It'll take your mind off of the bunny", he said.

Fortis sighed. He figured he'd have to go through stuff like this if Eldonia ever had a little girl, so he may as well practice with the younger servant-girls.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: Butterscotch disappears! The girls are sad! But...

choices: “...carrying a litter of kits! We'll have a whole lot of rabbits in a few days!"
“...got an infected bite! She could have rabies and infect all our animals!"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
“I miss Butterscotch,” Lucy moaned as she stood in front of the kitchen fireplace, warming her hands. The weather had begun getting much colder lately, and all of the womenfolk tended to dress in many layers and huddle around the fireplaces in the large manor as much as possible to keep warm. The men, particularly Fortis and his brothers, didn't seem to be affected by the colder temperatures as much. (Eldonia had commented to Minerva that her husband always seemed to give off an inferno of heat, which explained why he never got cold...and why Eldonia always shared his bed these days, as Fortis kept her nice and warm during the night...among other things.)

“I miss Butterscotch, too,” little Katie commiserated with a sniffle. “Why'd he go away? Didn't he like it here? We gave him lots of food to eat, and we patted him and snuggled him lots and lots!”

“Well, Lord Fortis told me that since he came from the forest, he musta gone back to the forest. He also said that since we took real good care of him, he might come back some day!”

“I hope some day is real soon! He was so soft and warm and cute and snuggly....”

“Yeah.”

Mrs. Tibbs sighed as she overheard the girls' conversation. “Are you two still moping about that rabbit? Goodness! He was only here for a few weeks! And he practically ate me out of my vegetable garden, too! Which reminds me: you two get bundled up and go out to the cellar to get me some jars of pickled beets. Lady Athena requested we have some for dinner this evening.”

“Yes, ma'am.”

The two girls wrapped scarves and thick woolen shawls around themselves, grabbed a couple baskets, and headed outside. The cellar was a large underground storage room dug out of the earth a little ways away and under the manor, but the only door to reach it was outside and practically horizontal to the ground.

As the girls were heading around the corner of the house, Katie noticed the bushes a ways off moving and quaking. A bit frightened, she grasped Lucy's arm and said, “Lucy! There's somethin' in those bushes over there!”

Lucy looked where Katie was pointing and gasped in alarm. With the colder weather, it wouldn't be uncommon for wild animals, such as foxes or wolves, to come near the manor house and the surrounding buildings, looking for easy prey or scraps of food.

“Let's get back to the house!” Lucy said quietly, holding Katie close to her side and slowly moving back the way they came.

However, when the bushes jostled again, a patch of toffee colored fur appeared, followed by a whiskered face, long ears, and a short, rotund body.

“BUTTERSCOTCH!” Katie shrieked in excitement. She ran over to the fat rabbit and quickly scooped him up into her arms. “Oh, how I missed you!” she squealed, hugging the bunny tightly in her small arms. “Boy, you've gotten heavy! You must have still found plenty of food to eat while you were gone! Why did you leave us, huh?”

“I think I know why, Katie,” Lucy said, coming up to the other girl's side and pointing back into the bushes. “Butterscotch brought a friend!”

Indeed, hopping cautiously out of the bushes toward them was another smaller, fat, fluffy rabbit. However, instead of being toffee-colored, this rabbit was nearly all black. Its hands, feet, and face, however, were all white.

“Aww,...did you bring back a friend, Butterscotch?” Katie cooed to the rabbit in her arms.

Lucy knelt down and extended a hand towards the black rabbit. “Hi, there, little fella. Want to come with us and make your home here with Butterscotch?”

The black rabbit twitched its nose warily before taking several hesitant hops toward Lucy. When the rabbit was close enough, Lucy gently ran a hand over the rabbit's long, soft, black ears. This seemed to be enough reassurance for the new bunny, who then eagerly leaned into the soft rubbing before lying down on its side. Lucy laughed and began to rub and stroke the rabbit's round belly. “That's right! We're real friendly, and we'll take good care of you!”

“...If Lord Fortis will let us keep him!” Katie said worriedly, keeping a firm hold on Butterscotch.

Lucy bit her lip. “I hope he will! Besides, having two rabbits surely won't be much more work than having one rabbit. Right? And we don't want Butterscotch to get lonely!”

“Well, now, what's this we've got here?”

The girls whirled around to see Koviac, Fortis's squire, lumbering up to them, his arms filled with freshly chopped firewood.

“Hi, Kovi--...er...Kodi--...um....”

“Koviac.”

Katie blushed. “Koviac. Sorry!”

Koviac shrugged. “It's okay. Oh! Is that Butterscotch? Looks like he came back.”

Katie brightened instantly. “Yeah! And he brought a friend with him! See?”

Katie turned and pointed down towards Lucy, who was still rubbing and scratching the new rabbit's tummy.

Koviac chuckled. “Well, Butterscotch, you ol' dog! I guess you decided you had it good enough here that you wanted to bring your mate to come live with you!”

“Mate?” A quizzical look crossed Katie's face. “What do you mean?”

“Well, if I'm not mistaken, that little black rabbit there would be Butterscotch's mate. You know? His...girlfriend, or wife, so to speak.”

“Awww...Butterscotch has a girlfriend!” Katie said, giving the toffee bunny a kiss on the cheek, making Butterscotch's whiskers twitch.

Koviac placed his armload of logs down and came closer to kneel next to the black rabbit. “Hmm,” he said. “Mind if I take a look at this little lady?” he asked Lucy.

Lucy shrugged and sat back. Koviac ran his hands over the rabbit, examining it. Eventually, he sighed and sat back on his heels. “Well, I don't know if Lord Fortis will allow you to keep this new rabbit.”

“What?” Lucy shrieked, quickly grasping the black rabbit and holding it tightly in her arms. “Why not?”

“Well, it's definitely a female,” Koviac explained, “but she's also...”

The Vanderstorm Household comes down with colds! Everyone is sick!
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"See how chubby she is?" Koviac said, "She's expecting babies! She's all full of kittens!"

"It's a RABBIT", said Katie, "They don't give birth to kitties! Kittens are baby cats!"

"Kittens are also baby rabbits", Koviac explained, "And soon, you're gonna have a whole heap of them!"

"How many is a whole heap?" Lucy asked.

"Ooooh...two...three...six...ten...a dozen..."

"A DOZEN BUNNIES!?"

"Hey, more pie for us!"

"BUNNY PIES!? NOOOOOOOOOOO!!" Lucy squealed, hugging Butterscotch so tight, she nearly broke his neck!

"No bunny-pies...Bunnies is pets...not foods!"

Koviac laughed, "You can't have a dozen bunnies hopping all over the house!" he said, laughing. "Soon you'll have them everywhere!"

"Nooooo...Bunnies is cute..." Lucy said, stroking the two bunnies, who huddled around her.

"Have you girls got those pickled beets yet!?" a voice came from the kitchen door. "Come along, girls! You want to earn your keep here, don't you!?" Mrs Tibbs asked. "What's all this hullabaloo!?"

"Butterscotch!"

"Oh Thunder and Lightning, has that furry fury come back to torment me with my carrots again, has it!?"

"But Mrs. Tibbs, it's cute!"

"I don't care if it's covered in feathers! You keep that miscreant away from my kitchen!"

The girls sighed and went to find the beets for Mrs. Tibbs. They carried the bunnies into the scullery and popped them back into their hutch. They kissed them on their soft, fluffy heads, and promised to come back later to play with them.

choices: Fortis falls asleep. Leo crawls away from papa and goes exploring...
Lady Athena wakes to see her family sick. She starts brewing medicinal potions.
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis lay in bed. The first frost of winter had arrived. The house was freezing cold! His arms ached...He'd been wielding an axe for most of the past few months, splitting tons of firewood for the stoves and fireplaces around the manor and the estate. The enormous wood-lockers in the basements were full of dry, flammable firewood...

And so was his fireplace. He'd stoked the grate up fully before going to bed, and now the room was toasty warm. He yawned and rolled over...

"Hey sweetie..."

Fortis slipped a huge arm under his wife's body and squeezed her playfully, "How's my little girl?"

He bent down and kissed her. "Wakey-wakey!"

Eldonia didn't stir. Fortis hugged her. "Awww...Oh wow..."

Eldonia was sweating and was cold to the touch. Her forehead was blazing hot!

"Hey! Hey wake up, woman!"

"Huh?...Ooooh my head!"

Eldonia opened her eyes. She was freezing cold, sweating, and had a splitting headache! She slowly opened her eyes and stared at her husband.

"Are you alright?" Fortis asked. "You feel terrible!"

Eldonia gulped and grimaced!

She slumped into bed. Her head felt like it was full of rocks! She sniffled and coughed!

"I think you've got a cold or something!" said Fortis. He pressed his hand against his wife's forehead.

"T-t-that's i-impossible! I was sleeping with you! I...AAACHOO!! Oh gosh!...Oooh man..."

Eldonia tried to get out of bed. She swayed and wobbled on her feet! Her eyes were all blurry and her temples throbbed! She took one step forward and fell to her knees! Fortis got out of bed!

"Woah, woah, woah, woah..." he said, "Easy there sweetie...You ain't goin' anywhere...Now you get back into bed right now!"

Eldonia smiled weakly. "Are you trying to tell me something, my lord?" she asked.

"Hey, no time for that now", said Fortis, "You don't look so good. You just lay there".

Eldonia sneezed and groaned! She felt terrible! Fortis opened a closet and drew out a pile of neatly-folded handkerchiefs. He put them on her side of the bed and pulled on his enormous dressing-gown before tiptoeing out into the corridor.

"Aaah...aaah...AAACHOO!! Uuuurrgghhh..."

Fortis stopped and knocked on a door.

"Girl?"

"Uuuuggghh..."

Fortis opened the door and went in. His sister lay in bed, sweating and groaning. He whistled.

"Wow...You look like shit!"

"Oh thank you, brother..." Minerva said thickly, through a heavily-blocked nose, "Aren't you just adorable..."

Fortis laughed. "Eldonia's also got a cold. Must be runnin' all over the county. You stay in bed and sleep. Penny!"

Minerva's maid exited from her own small bedroom and curtised.

"My lord Vanderstorm", she said.

"You see to it that Lady Minerva gets everything she needs, won't you?"

"Yes, my lord! She took ill last night a couple of hours before bed".

"I bet it was those stupid bunnies..."

"Fawtish!" Minerva said through a clogged nose and sore throat, "Dahy onye been here a week! Ooh can't shay ig's dem!" she blew her nose heavily, "It's not fair!" she said, in something closer to her normal voice. Fortis sighed.

Crash!!

Fortis whirled around and left the room. Halfway down the staircase, Jupiter was picking himself up.

"Woooaaah..." he groaned. A hand went to his forehead, feeling his heavy rise in temperature.

"Oh for goodness sake, not you too!" Fortis groaned, "get upstairs and in bed! I don't need the entire household sick!"

"I was gonna get some hot water for my bottle..." Jupiter said, holding up his empty hot-water bottle.

"I'll do it", Fortis said, taking up the shiny, copper hot water-bottle in its fuzzy red cozy-pouch, "YOU go to bed".

Fortis headed downstairs. Thank goodness for the thick rugs and carpets that covered the floors. It was so cold! Fortis went through the dining-room and into the kitchen. The fire in the fireplace was stoked up high, and the doors to the range-stove were wide open. Heat washed over everything. Fortis pumped water into a kettle and put it on the stove. A stout, middle-aged woman shuffled into the kitchen.

"Morning!" she said.

"Good morning, Mrs. Tibbs".

"You should be in bed, my lord! This is not time for you to be up and about!" she said.

"Half the household's sick!" Fortis said.

"Oh I know my lord. Hermes and his older brother Zachary are also under the weather. The girls are alright. They're playing with their bunnies. I told them there wouldn't be much work today, so they could more or less have it off".

Fortis nodded in agreement. With everyone stuck in bed, it was unlikely that there would be much housework. He sighed as he watched the snow falling outside.

"Wooow it's heavy out there..." he said. "I hope the pipes don't freeze!"

"Perish the thought!" Mrs. Tibbs said. "But just in case, I've had the water-barrels in the basement filled up, just in case".

Fortis smiled, "Good thinking. I hope you've got enough firewood?"

"Never enough of that, my lord", said Mrs. Tibbs. The kettle began to boil. Fortis filled up the hot-water bottle and put it back on the stove.

"Perhaps you could make us some chicken soup, Mrs. Tibbs?"

"I certainly will, if you tell me how many would like it".

"Better make enough for EVERYONE. Two or three chickens...just in case".

Mrs. Tibbs nodded, "Very well", she said. "I do hope you stay healthy, my lord!"

Fortis snorted and stood up proudly. "Yeah. Like I'm ever gonna fall sick".

"You had that stomach-bug when you were ten. You were vomiting for a week!"

Fortis groaned when he remembered how long Mrs. Tibbs had been working for his family. She knew every intimate detail about every person in the household.

"...Yeah", he said. "Okay ONE time".

"And the runs you had when you were twelve..."

"Tibby..." Fortis said, with a sort of pleading tone in his voice. The housekeeper and cook smiled and hugged him.

"Ooooh...There there..." she said. Mrs. Tibbs had to admit, having served the Vanderstorm family for so long, she had developed a maternal interest in the welfare of the four Vanderstorm offspring. "You just stay healthy!" she said. "And I'll make us some soup!"

Fortis smiled and headed upstairs. He found his son playing with his pet dragon.

Leo's baby luck-dragon blew out a ball of fire which lit a candle-sconce on the edge of Leo's crib. The toddler giggled and blew it out. The dragon blew another fireball which lit the candle again. Leo giggled and puffed it out! The dragon blew a huge fireball that wafted up into the air! The baby squealed with delight and giggled!

Fortis laughed. "Cute little fellah", he said, stroking his son. "You be good and stay healthy now", he said. Leo burbled happily. Fortis hoisted his son into his arms and kissed him tenderly on the forehead, before sitting down in front of a blazing fire. The baby snuggled down and suckled on his thumb, slowly dozing off...
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.title: The Vanderstorm Household comes down with colds...

"I've been in my room all morning. I've only seen the sun rise! What's wrong?"
1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis yawned and stretched out in the rocking-chair...which was pretty hard to do. The chair was far too small for a person of Fortis's weight, girth and height. Ten feet of Mountanian nobleman was a lot to be contained by a chair that was supposed to be for the household nurse! Nevertheless, he leaned against the backrest and in the heat of the fire, dozed off, with his son curled up on his lap.

The young nobleman didn't know what time he woke up later, but when he did, he felt a lightness on his lap. He reached down sleepily...

...Uh-oh...

Fortis snapped awake! He leapt to his feet, knocking over the chair! He stared wildly around the nursery, and then looked into the crib, whipping back the blankets and pillows! Empty!

"SHIT!" he swore! "Oooooh shit..."

Fortis left the nursery, and went into the master bedroom. The door was closed. Fortis opened it and, by candlelight, so as not to wake his fitfully-sleeping wife, he searched his bedroom, the dressing-room, the bathroom and the spare room. Nobody there. Eldonia cuddled a fat, squishy bolster, her comfort when she didn't have her husband to cuddle with...but there was no baby anywhere!

Fortis left the room and peeked into Cannius's room.

"Hey Cannius, have you seen..."

"Hurrrrrrk!!...Ugh!..." Cannius groaned, blowing his nose into a handkerchief, groaning and flopping back onto his bed in a dizzy faint. "No I ain't seen nothin'!" he groaned. "Leave me alone, Forty!...And close the damn door! it's freezing!"

Fortis slammed the door and opened the next door. Jupiter was fast asleep, cuddling his hot-water bottle. He obviously hadn't seen the baby. Minerva was also asleep, and her maid was busy knitting.

Fortis tore downstairs and into the kitchen! Mrs. Tibbs was busy dicing up meat on a chopping-board.

"Ah! I have hot chicken broth with meat, and noodles, and carrots! It'll be ready in...My lord, what ARE you looking for?"

Fortis was peeking into sacks, opening baskets, checking inside storage-barrels and opening cupboards.

"My lord!" Mrs. Tibbs said, dropping her knife with a 'clank!'.

"Baby..." Fortis mumbled, pulling out a whole heap of pots, "Where's...baby..." he mumbled, stuffing the pots back into the cupboard.

"Baby?"

"Did Leo crawl downstairs? You didn't feed him some milk or something?"

"Bab...No! Why what's...is the baby missing!?"

"Uuuuh....I...I think so!"

"Oh good lord!"

"What's going on!?"

Fortis turned to see his grandmother, wrapped in her nightgown and shawl, standing at the kitchen door.

"Gran! Have you seen the baby!?"

"The baby!?"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"I've been in my bedroom all morning!" said Lady Athena, "I haven't seen the baby at all!"

"SHIT!"

"FORTIS VANDERSTORM!"

"...Sorry grandma...Oooooh shit...Eldonia's gonna KILL ME!"

"Now now! Calm down!" said Lady Athena. "What happened!?"

"I went to sleep. I went to the nursery and I was playing with the baby. I took him over to the fire. I sat down in the rocking-chair and we fell asleep. I woke up, and he was gone! He's not in the nursery, he's not in any of the bedrooms! He's GONE!"

"Where's the dragon?"

"What dragon!?"

"The LUCK DRAGON!"

"I DON'T KNOW! I was looking for a BABY! Not a stupid LIZARD!"

"Fortis, you have much to learn", Lady Athena said. "Come with me".

Athena talked to her grandson as she went upstairs. "Luck Dragons are very special creatures. They protect their charges very territoriality. They'll follow them everywhere! It's a safe bet that where-ever the baby is, the dragon is nearby. So is the dragon in the nursery!?"

"I don't know! I didn't bother to look!"

Lady Athena entered the nursery. She stared around. She moved slowly around the room. Then, she paused. Fortis strode over.

"What is it?" he asked. Fortis watched as his grandmother's hands strayed to the window-sills. Fortis noticed that one of the windows was slightly open.

"Ooooooooooooooh SHIT!...No! No no no no no!! Don't tell me he fell out! Oh fuck! Eldonia's gonna fucking MURDER ME!"

Fortis gulped. It was a LONG way down. Over twenty feet! If the baby fell out the window, then...

Fortis pushed the window open and stared down. There was a LOT of snow outside.

"I'm going outside!" he said. He grabbed a lamp from a table and hurried downstairs. Lady Athena went downstairs to the dining-room, which was directly underneath the nursery. She opened the windows and peeked out. Fortis came into view, wrapped in a cloak and holding the lantern.

"LEO!...LEO WHERE ARE YOU!?"

Lady Athena leaned out of the open dining-room window. Then she saw it.

A jet of flames.

Curled around something wrapped in a blue woolen romper-suit was a sparkly, gold dragon with red under-scales, and bright, green eyes. The dragon blew flames onto the bundle and kept it warm by wrapping itself around it.

"Over here, Fortis!" she called out. "Look!"

Fortis jogged over and saw the baby.

"IT'S KILLING HIM!"

"Oh don't be stupid! It's keeping the baby warm! Here, give him to me!"

Fortis scooped dragon and baby up out of the snow-bank underneath the nursery windows, and passed them through the dining-room windows to his grandmother. Lady Athena put the two precious objects on the dining-table and Fortis climbed in through the window, closing it after him.

"I don't get it..." he said.

"I think I can guess", Lady Athena said, "The baby crawled or toddled to the window to see the snow. The catch on the window must've popped open when he was leaning against the glass. He fell out and landed in the snow. Everyone was either in their rooms, or asleep, so nobody noticed. The dragon jumped out after the baby to keep it warm until it was found!"

"Well I'll be damned..." said Fortis. "Y'know, I don't think we ever named this dragon", he said, looking at it.

"I suggest 'Felix'", Lady Athena said.

"FELIX?"

"It's Latin. It means 'Luck'".

"Oh...okay!"

"There there sweetums..." Athena said. She was busy feeding baby Leonardo a bowl of hot chicken soup. "That's right...sippy-sippy-sippy...Ooh not so fast! You'll burn yourself!...Oooh you like it, do you? Yes it's very yummy isn't it? Ah! Don't spill it!..."

Leo reached for the bowl of soup that his great-grandmother held in her arms.

"Gamma!"

Wham! Wham! Wham!!

Leo burst into tears!

WHAM!! WHAM!! WHAM!! JANGLE-ANGLE-ANGLE-ANGLE-LANGLE-LANGLE!!

Fortis pushed the housekeeper aside, "I'll handle it, Miz Tibbs. No idea who might be out there in a storm like..."

WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! WHAM! WHAM!

Fortis lifted a heavy sword down from a rack above the drawing-room fireplace and approached the front door. He undid the security-bolts and pulled the door open. Snow and freezing wind whooshed into the house! Fortis raised the sword, "Who is it1?" he shouted.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
A hooded, cloaked figure staggered into the house! Mrs. Tibbs slammed the front doors shut and bolted them securely. The man was tall, slightly hunched, and looked worn out! He headed into the drawing-room and pulled off his cloak and hood as he approached the fire! He revealed a mane of greying brown hair and a lion-face with a scar down one cheek. He grunted and blew his nose heavily into a handkerchief. Slowly, he turned to face the small assembly of people.

"Mornin'..." he mumbled.

Lord Venatarius VonGewalt stood before them, dressed in heavy travelling clothes. Lady Athena hurried towards him!

"My goodness! What are you THINKING OF! Travelling through Mountania in the middle of a blizzard like this! You'll do yourself no goodness at all! Mrs. Tibbs! Soup for his lordship!"

"At once, m'lady!" Mrs. Tibbs said. Lord VonGewalt dropped into a chair, shivering.

"I re-re..re...AACHOO!!...Ugh...a-r-received a-an...an urgent s-s-summons f-from k-King L-Leviathan...*sniffle*...Saying he wished to see me as soon as possible!"

"Don't be an idiot!" said Lady Athena, "There's drifts five feet deep outside! How on earth did you come this far!?"

"Horse!...I put him in your stables...I hope you don't mind..."

Mrs. Tibbs returned with a large bowl of chicken soup. Fortis picked up a tray with a whole heap of bowls on it.

"Those are all for upstairs!" Mrs. Tibbs said.

"I'll come with you!" said Lord VonGewalt. "I want to see my daughter..."

"You'll stay RIGHT THERE!" said Lady Athena. "You'll catch your death of cold!"

Lord VonGewalt sighed. He guseed she was right. He sat down and relaxed.

"Gwanpa!"

Lord VonGewalt's desire to see his daughter melted, when he caught sight of her offspring. He smiled.

"Aaah! Come here you little rat!"

Leo toddled towards his grandfather and climbed into his lap. "Wubb you gwanpa!"

Lord VonGewalt smiled, "Aren't you growin' up fast, huh?" he said. "Talkin' and walkin' already. You wanna go upstairs and see momma?"

"Papa say noooooooooo..."

"And your papa's very right!" said Lady Athena, lifting the toddler up, "Your mother's VERY sick and you're NOT to go upstairs and disturb her!"

"What's wrong?" Lord VonGewalt asked.

"The whole household's down with cold, my lord", Mrs. Tibbs said, "Lady Eldonia, Lady Minerva, his lordship's two brothers, and two of my servants!"

"Hmmm..." Lord VonGewalt said. "I appear to have entered a house of plague!"

"Oh I hardly think so!" said Mrs. Tibbs, "But I would advise you to keep your distance from the ill of body", she said. Lord VonGewalt nodded and headed upstairs.

Venatarius deduced by the sheer layout of the rooms which one was the master bedroom, and headed inside. Fortis was tiptoeing across the room. He sat down on the bedside and put down a bowl of soup.

"Hey!...Woman wake up!...C'mon now...Up!"

"Huuughh...wh...Forty..."

"Here, Mrs. T. made you some soup. It'll help with the cold. Now drink it down and don't fuss so much..."

Eldonia groaned. She was soooo dizzy and her fever was burning up! Fortis shifted her upright in bed and handed her the bowl of soup. She coughed! Her sore throat was killing her! She couldn't possibly drink the soup...but she tried...

The soup tasted of nothing but oil and water. Her tastebuds were completely numb.

"Forty I think I'm really sick..."

"I know sweetheart, now you just drink this..."

"I'm seein' weird things..."

"It's just the fever..."

"There's papa..."

Fortis turned around! He'd been so busy waking Eldonia up, he hadn't noticed his father-in-law standing behind him! Lord VonGewalt moved forwards...

Wolfgang Vanderstorm lumbered up the wide, central staircase to the second storey. He opened the first door and headed in. The room was dark, and only a couple of candles on the dresser provided any light, for the shutters were closed and the curtains drawn. He picked up one of the candles and walked over to the bed and sat down. He wrapped a powerful arm around the bed's occupant and stroked it gently.

"F-forty...?"

"Shhhhh...Hey girl..."

Minerva opened her eyes. Her head felt like a pot of boiling water. Bubbly and dizzy and all hotted up. She sneezed and blew her nose heavily into a handkerchief. She collapsed back onto the bed and stared upwards.

"Woofy?" she said.

"Hey Girly...Aren't you purdy?"

Minerva groaned, "You liar..." she mumbled. Wolfgang smiled, "I was on my way home and the storm outside caught me out. I'll be staying here until it blows over".

"Where's the children?"

"At home with Vesta. You didn't think I brought Champion and Astrid all this way in a blizzard, did you?"

Minerva smiled.

The bedroom door opened and Lady Athena entered, carrying a tray with a large pot on it.

"What's that, granny?" Wolfgang asked. He sniffed, "ooh tea...I want some!"

"No!" said Lady Athena, striking her grandson's knuckles with a spoon, "Away! it's willow-tea for Minerva's cold! It should help with the fever".

Minerva gulped down the tea and pulled a face!

"Eugh! It tastes like vinegar!!" she croaked.

"Drink every last drop!" Lady Athena said. "It'll break the fever and bring down your temperature again! And after that, you'll eat your rice porridge with plenty of garlic and ginger-root! It'll settle your stomach and clear out your nose!"

"grandma..."

"Don't you 'grandma' me! Your brothers and Eldonia are getting the exact same treatment! Now you eat every last morsel and drink every last drop! And if you help her with it, I'll tan your hide!" she said to her grandson, and left the room, carrying the tray out with her.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Fortis entered the nursery carrying a large, holly-wreath, decorated with ribbons and pine-cones. He hung it on a hook above the fireplace.

"Hey look, Leo! Papa's got the Yuletide Wreath out!"

"Ooooh...Ooooow!!!"

Fortis laughed, "Ain't for touchin', son! It's for lookin' at! You'll prick your fingers if you get too close".

Leo suckled on his finger. He decided to listen to papa.

"Hey you decorating the house for the Yule cebrations?" Wolfgang asked. Fortis nodded. "Last week of the last month of the year! You're invited to the party...and the family...If you can get home to tell them!"

Wolfgang smiled, "We got three weeks. I'm sure I can get there and back. Hey let me give you a hand".

The two men headed downstairs. To try and cheer everyone up, Fortis was busy decorating the house for the traditional end-of-year holiday, Yuletide. Yuletide celebrated the death and end of the old year in winter, and the rebirth of the new year the following spring. Symbols of hardiness, such a pine-trees and holly and mistletoe, were stuck up all around the house. Wolfgang stared at the huge fireplace in the drawing-room, and shook his head.

"Boy you missin' somethin'", he said.

"What's that?" Fortis asked.

"Where's your log!?"

"Log?"

"YOUR YULE LOG YOU DOOFUS!"

Fortis swore! Every year, they burnt a huge tree-trunk as a symbol of fertility and rebirth. Yeah. A huge tree-trunk. A huge fucking dick. Fortis laughed.

"Hey if I can't cut down a tree, I can chop your dick off and throw that on the fire. It's big enough to burn for a month and a day, ain't it?"

"Don't you dare, cousin!"

"Hey, you're the one who always says you're the biggest in the family".

"You competin' with me, boy? You go get gran's measurin' tape from her sewing-box..."

"I don't care if it IS within the family, my measuring-tape is NOT to be used to satisfy the pride of the Vanderstorms!" Lady Athena said, coming up behind her two oldest grandsons, "Now be off with you!"

The two mountain lords headed out the back, and Fortis picked up a whole heap of tools. Two felling-axes, a saw, hatchets and ropes.

"C'mon Wolfie, let's go fell us a Yule Log".

Wolfgang picked up one of the felling-axes and slung it over his shoulders. "What, with your little pocket-knives?" he asked. Fortis scowled, and Wolfgang laughed.

Despite the cold weather, the two hot-blooded Mountain men wore surprisingly little. The work was so hard and hot that they quickly built up a sweat, anyway. They slammed the heavy axes into the largest tree they could find, chopping out chunks of wood and cutting grooves into the tree-trunk on each side.

"Forty why you makin' that cut so big!?" Wolfgang shouted, "You don't need a groove like that! The tree's fallin' this way!"

"What do you mean? It's comin' down MY way!"

"But I already started makin' my groove bigger! You stop choppin'!"

CRASH!!

The unbalanced tree creaked and toppled into the snow. The two mountain lords high-fived and started chopping off the branches. Fortis and Wolfgang, eager to outdo each other, took to breaking off most of the branches using pure brute strength.

Once the branches were removed and the log and branches tied up, they dragged the whole thing back to the manor-house. The servant-girls helped them guide the enormous tree-trunk into the drawing-room where they had laid a bed of kindling and dry firewood.

"Eliza!" Fortis called out. The head housemaid approached her master.

"Good Yuletide, my lord", she said, curtsying.

"Yeah, yeah...go upstairs and find my sister".

"I think she's still a bit poorly, my lord", said Penny, "She's sleeping".

Fortis swore. It was always tradition for the youngest in the household to light the fire on the first day of Yuletide.

"You know, I don't think Minerva's the youngest in the household anymore..." Wolfgang said.

"Oh yeah...Eliza! Go and get my son!"

"Yes my lord!"

Eliza headed upstairs, and returned to the drawing room with Leo, wrapped up in cloth. Leo stared at everyone and Fortis took him in his arms.

"Hey boy! You wanna do somethin' special for papa?" he said. Leo nodded. Fortis smiled. He handed his son a burning taper.

"Now I'm gonna lower you down, and you're gonna light the fire, right there..." he said, pointing to the base of the fire, "Can you do that?"

Leo nodded. Fortis smiled. He dangled his son upside down by his feet and lowered him down, shaking him playfully. The housemaids giggled.

Leo reached out with the burning taper and touched it to the twigs like papa told him. Fortis turned his son the right way up so that he could see the wood beginning to burn.

"Aww...I was supposed to do that!"

Fortis turned to see his sister out of bed.

"Sorry girl, you ain't the youngest in the house anymore!" he said. "And I thought you were sick?"

"I'm feeling better", she said. "The most important thing is that my sore throat is gone!"

"Well don't get too close to Leo, I don't want him catchin' whatever you got left!" Fortis said. Then he smiled, "Nice you're gettin' better, sister", he said. "So, you like the log?"

"It'll be beautiful once it's burning properly".

Mrs. Tibbs smiled, "It's nice that you're feeling better, my lady. I tell you what, I'll make us all some cookies! Gingerbread, and shortbread sugar-cookies. And some hot chocolate!"

"Oh thank you, Mrs. Tibbs..." said Minerva. "Eldonia's feeling a bit better as well, but she wants to stay in bed, just in case".

Fortis nodded, "I better go see how she is".

Minerva nodded and smiled at everyone. "Grandma, once the weather clears, we better send out letters and posters and invitations about the estate Yuletide feast".

Lady Athena nodded. "I remember when your grandfather was still alive...We used to have such fun...Mrs. Tibbs! You're making a traditional spiced fruit pudding aren't you?"

"Of course! We're chopping up the fruit and stuff right now! Come along, girls!" she said, to the kitchen-maids, "Let's get back! We're making three, this year!"

"Three!?" Fortis said.

"Yes! Two for the household and the guests to the party which I'm SURE you'll be holding...and one for the servants!"

Fortis nodded, "You didn't have to! You're part of the household too, you know..."

Mrs. Tibbs nodded, "But just in case", she said, and smiled, "Come along, girls! And don't forget the brandy in the cellar!"

Fortis smiled at his sister, when they were the only two left in the drawing room.

"I suppose you forgot to get me a present this year", she said, weakly. Fortis glared at his sister!

"Orphanage?"

"The boys and girls at the county orphanage come over for a care-basket and a plate of food each. The lord of the manor has a duty to the destitute on his land, you know..."

"My lord...I'm destitute...Don't you have a duty to give ME something?"

Fortis laughed! "I'll give you whatever you want, woman...once you're better!"

Eldonia smiled weakly. "I'll try..." she said. "What was that racket downstairs?"

"We were setting up the yule-log".

"Awww...We used to do that at home too...I missed it being lit!"

"Yeah...You would be happy. Leo did it!"

"Awwwwwwwww...Oh our little boy and his first Yuletide...I wanted to see that..."

Fortis hugged his wife and kissed her gently, "You will, sweetheart. You just lay back and get better!"

When he was sure his wife wasn't looking, he went to his closet and opened it. Here, he pulled out two boxes wrapped in simple brown paper. One for Eldonia, and one for Minerva. He put them back, and went back downstairs...

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"Aaah...aah...aaachoo!! Urgh!"

"Are you alright, my lady?"

Penny handed Minerva a mug of hot, spiced tea. Minerva gulped it down and groaned.

"I'm feeling a bit better, thank you...The sneezing is driving me nuts!"

Minerva sat in the dining-room. It was now afternoon and the snow had stopped...for a while, at least. Heavy footsteps sounded and Fortis and Wolfgang entered, carrying lots of baskets, which they dumped on the floor.

"What are all those for!?" she asked.

"The orphanage sent them over!" Fortis said, "We're gonna fill them up!...Or rather, you and granny are".

"How are we gonna do that?"

"Oh you know...some chocolates, cookies, a handkerchief, a ribbon-bow around the top...You know, all that cutesy stuff".

"Yes, stuff that you men wouldn't know anything about..." Minerva said. Wolfgang laughed.

"That's right!" he said. Minerva sighed. Her grandmother entered the dining-room.

"Oh good! The baskets are here! Mrs. Tibbs just finished the last batch of ginger-cookies".

Slowly, Minerva and her grandmother started filling up the baskets. A couple of gingerbread men, a couple of small cakes, a handkerchief, some peppermints, and chocolates. Fortis came back and stared at the baskets.

"Is that it?" he asked.

"Well it's not much space", Minerva said. "It's only a small gesture".

Fortis snorted. "I'll be right back", he said. He headed out of the dining-room and returned a few minutes later with a small sack. The mountain lord reached into the sack and pulled out a fistful of something. He went from basket to basket, dropping a little bit of whatever was in his hand, and in the sack...into each basket.

"Forty what are you doing?" Minerva asked.

"I'm givin' you a hand!"

The mountain lord held up the sack and jingled it around.

"Two sovereigns in each basket", he said.

"Aww Forty! You sweet, sweet, adorable...!!"

"Hey! Don't you be gettin' all honeysuckle on me, girl!" Fortis said. Old Lady Athena sighed.

"Fortis!" she said softly, "It's very noble of you! And your sister is just saying how NICE it is...that she's got a BIG...LOVING...ADORABLE brother...who CARES SO MUCH! And..."

"Oooh not you toooooo..."

The old woman laughed and Minerva giggled.

"You know, I THINK he feels embarrassed", said Lady Athena. Minerva laughed.

"Papa!"

"C'mere, girl!"

Wolfgang hoisted up his daughter and kissed her. "How's things, huh?"

"I'm cold, papa!"

"Hehehe, talkin' already...And only two!"

"She learned it all from me!" said a handsome-looking boy of about eight.

"If she starts talkin' what I don't wanna hear, I'll believe it, young man", Wolfgang said. He smiled at his son, and at his wife. She shook the snow off her cape and hung it up. Mrs. Tibbs closed the door.

"Did you have a pleasant journey, Lady Vesta?"

"No we did not! Terrible snow outside! I do hope it stops soon!"

"No chance of that, m'lady!"

"Where's Lord Fortis?"

"He's upstairs! Looking after his wife. Lady Eldonia took poorly. The whole family did!"

"Oh dear! How's Minerva?"

"She's feeling better. I told her she should rest, but..." the housekeeper and cook, shrugged her shoulders.

"Aaah precious Mrs. Tibbs..." said Vesta.

"She sure is", said Wolfgang, "When I used to stay over here when I was a boy, she used to look after me. She's like a second mother to everyone around here".

Fortis came downstairs. He smiled at his cousin-in-law and at his nephew and niece.

"Uckle Fawty!" Astrid squealed! Fortis hugged her.

"Hey babygirl! Muah!"

"Uckle Fawty...Astwil wan' pway!"

"Oooh, not now, sweetcakes!"

"Wanna pway wiff Weah...Weo...Weolardo..."

Champion laughed, "That's LEONARDO, sister!"

"Oooh..." said the toddler, sucking on her thumb, contemplating her mistake.

Vesta laughed, "I'll take you upstairs to play, sweetheart. Come on!" she said. She kissed Fortis on the cheek, "Lovely to see you again! Thank you SO MUCH for the invitation to spend the holidays here!" she said, and hurried upstairs with her daughter.

"Yeah Uncle Forty!" said Champion, "What'd you get me? A sword!?"

"No".

"A dagger!?"

"No".

"A shield!?"

"No!"

"Awww...what?"

"You'll just have to wait, like everyone else".

"I don't wanna!"

"Champy!" Wolfgang said, "You be NICE to your Uncle Fortis!"

"Yes sir...Sorry Uncle Fortis".

Fortis nodded. "We have new servant-boys around the house, they're about your age".

"I don't play with servants!"

"Son! You should learn to get along with everyone!" said Wolfgang. "And besides. If you make friends with them, they'll want to serve you even better".

"Did you learn that in the bedroom of a housemaid when you were younger, Cousin?" Fortis asked, as Champion dashed off down the corridor.

"...Maybe..." said Wolfgang. "...It helped with some things..." he added, and grinned.

Fortis snorted. Wolfgang was always a bit more of...well...a wolf. But Fortis tended to be more conservative and restrained when it came to bedding females. He never allowed himself a flirt with a housemaid...at least, not recently. And if he did, he always made sure to play it safe.

"AUNT MINNIE!"

Minerva clapped her hands to her ears as Champion threw himself around his aunt!

"Champion! Not so LOUD!" Minerva gasped, "If Great-Grandmother Athena hears that, you'll give her a heart-attack!"

"Granny! Where's granny!? Is she upstairs? Is she? I bet she got me something cool for a Yuletide present!"

"Champion! You come back here..." Wolfgang began, but Champion scampered up the stairs faster than a dog with its tail on fire! Minerva laughed.

"I see the other branch of the Vanderstorm family has arrived for the festivities", she said.

"So it would seem", Wolfgang said. "That son of mine is just crazy insane".

"And you weren't?" Fortis asked. "I remember when you were fifteen, granny tanned your hide after you knocked over that vase wrestling with Cousin Magnus".

"Yeah, AND it was his fault..."

"Where is Cousin Magnus?" Minerva asked.

"He couldn't make it. Something about needing to repair ice-damage to his main storehouse", Fortis said.

"Awww...he's so nice..."

"He's peculiar. Y'know he still lives with his sister?"

"So?" Fortis said, "If I weren't married to some hot beauty, I'd probably be livin' with my sister", he said. He draped an arm around his sister and squeezed her playfully. Minerva laughed!

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
"RRRRRRRRRAAAAAAAAAAAWWWRRR!!"

"YEEEEEEEEEEEEEEEK!!"

WHAM!! WHAM!!...CRASH!!

"What on EARTH is that!?"

Minerva squealed as Eldonia came sprinting down the stairs, and hid behind Wolfgang! Fortis came bounding down the stairs.

"WHERE ARE YOU!?" he roared. He stared around the entrance-hall, and then...

"AAAAAAAH!!"

Eldonia squealed! Fortis grabbed her, hoisted her up and pinned her against the wall! Eldonia fought to get away!

Fortis pressed her hard against the wall...and kissed her!

"Oh PUT ME DOWN!" she squealed! "You're a HOPELESS ROMANTIC, you are! Fortis Vanderstorm!"

Everyone burst out laughing.

"He's been pressuring me, ever since I got over that cold, to spend more time with him!" Eldonia said, when her two feet had reached the ground again. Fortis laughed and slapped his wife on the back.

"You looked so weak and helpless...I thought I might have a chance for once..."

"Oooh you!" Eldonia said. Everyone laughed.

"In MY day we didn't put up with these shenanigans!" Lady Athena said.

"Oh, what'd they do in your day, grandma?" Wolfgang asked, as he helped his wife to hang up a holly-wreath from the chandelier.

"When a husband and wife got married, the groomsmen would kidnap the bride and carry her off into the woods and tie her up! To prove his worth, the groom had to track his groomsmen, find his wife, rescue her and bring her back!"

"Oh how romantic!" said Eldonia.

"Pity we didn't think of that at your wedding, Forty!" said Wolfgang.

"No matter", said Forty, "We can do it to Girl when she gets married!"

"Don't you DARE!" Minerva said, huffily.

Wolfgang and Fortis laughed.

"Hey! Where you want us to stick this stupid thing!?"

Jupiter and Cannius came in, carrying a massive, twelve-foot tall pine-tree.

"Oooh it's pretty!" said Vesta, "Look Astrid!" she said, bouncing her baby daughter in her arms, "Didn't Uncle Jupiter bring in a pretty Yule Tree?"

"Hey! What about Uncle Cannius!?"

"...And isn't Uncle Cannius smart knowing his own name!?"

Everyone laughed! The two Mountain men slotted the tree into a purpose-built base for it, and everyone started decorating it.

"Son, you be careful with those baubles now, they're made of glass!" said Wolfgang as his son, Champion, started hanging pretty, coloured glass balls on the tree. And horseshoes and all other manner of things.

"Grandma, what do all the things mean?" Champion asked.

Old Lady Athena smiled.

"The toy tools are for industry and craft..." she said, "...the anvils are for solidity and strength...The baubles are for beauty and delicacy. The horse-shoes are for good luck in the new year..."

The old woman bent down and picked up more ornaments from a dusty crate on the floor. Pretty little shields painted bright colours.

"...The shields represent protection and safety for the ones we love", she said.

Last but not least, Lady Athena picked up a whole heap of little brass candle-holders which she helped hang up around the tree.

"Alright!" said Fortis, "Now, we all get to light one candle each..."

Fortis slotted the thin Yule-candles into the holders on the tree-branches. He lit a taper.

"Vesta, you go first".

Vesta lit a candle. Then, she handed the taper to her daughter, who lit one. Then Champion. Then Wolfgang. Then Cannius, then Jupiter. Then Fortis. Then baby Leonardo. Then Eldonia. Then Minerva. Then grandma. And then, the servants in order of seniority.

Soon, the towering tree was full of burning candles, twinkling light and ornaments.

"Oooh, it's so pretty..." said Eldonia. Fortis draped a huge arm around his wife's shoulders. "Not as pretty as you are..."

"Why Forty!"

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Mountanians were known for rough, tough living. Their extra size, bulk and immense strength and power had been earned from generations of living in the mountains and the harsh lowlands of their native land. Not for nothing were the majority of the men tough, rough and powerfully-built giants, and not for nothing were the women fiery and determined. Not for nothing were the rest of the women caring and gentle, loving and sweet. In such a harsh and unforgiving landscape, strength, power, kindness, sweetness and mercy went side by side. And it was impossible to survive out here without all of those qualities.

Especially in the depths of Mountanian winter.

The temperatures dropped to well below freezing during whiteout blizzards. The days, weeks and months of felling trees, sawing branches, splitting slogs with an axe, or driving in heavy spikes with sledgehammers to break open tree-trunks, to produce the tons of firewood required to keep houses warm and people safe, had been the cause of the enormous Mountain physiques.

The years of quarrying, blasting, chhiseling, drilling, delving and splitting rock and stone had grown them impressive muscles, and the mining, shoring, shoveling and blasting to bring out coal, metal-ore and precious rocks and metals had grown their immense heights and breadths.

For all their fierce and powerful industry, their strength and raw ability, the people of the Mountain Kingdom knew that no amount of strength, power and size would protect them in the freezing sub-zero temperatures of harshest winter.

It was for this reason that during wintertime, it was tradition for everyone to mix and mingle, to share shelter, warmth, food, drink and joy with their neighbours, so that they might survive the punishing months that were to come ahead.

Jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle-jangle!!

"Come in! Come in! Welcome!"

A heavily-tanned young Mountanian entered, accompanied by a pretty, younger teenage girl.

Thor, the village blacksmith, and his younger sister, Sapphire, steered their way into the dining-hall where the guests for the Midwinter feast were gathered. Some people were playing musical instruments, other people were dancing. More people were eating and drinking.

This was not high-class royal ball. It was a simple country gathering. Villagers, farmers, their wives and children, mingled with the lord who ruled over this small parcel of their glorious monarch's kingdom.

Fortis moved among the guests, shaking hands with farmers and wheelwrights, millers, coopers, chandlers and dairy-farmers.

"Good evening, Thor", said Fortis, when his friend, the blacksmith, entered the dining-hall.

Thor bowed.

"Good evening, my lord", he said. He waved his sister forward, "My sister, my lord".

"The beautiful Miss Sapphire..." said Fortis, grasping her hand and kissing it. "It's nice to see you".

Sapphire blushed! "T-thank you, my lord!" she gasped. She turned and went to find Lady Eldonia, while Thor went to greet Fortis's two younger brothers.

In the corner of the hall near the fireplace, Minerva had been cornered by three towering pillars of village life. The formidable Von Eisenwald Triplets.

The Von Eisenwald triplets were three older teenage boys. They were all sixteen, and they were all identical. About seven feet tall, with tanned bodies, long brown hair, and impressive muscles. Their muscles were impressive because they came from a long line of tree-fellers, lumberjacks and carpenters. Their family had run the village sawmill for four generations. And the current batch of Eisenwalds were just as powerfully-built as all the previous ones.

And right now, all three brothers were extremely interested in his lordship's sweet, young, innocent sister.

And Minerva wasn't really able to refuse them.

Sibling rivalry between the three brothers was strong. They had no sisters of their own, and they were in fierce competition with each other to land any and all of the eligible girls in town. Minerva blushed at the attention that she was given.

"Um...You're...very pretty...Lady Minerva..." said Axelrod.

Minerva blushed. "Thank you Axel..." she said.

"C-could we get you a drink?" Ferrus asked.

"Well uh..."

"Perhaps you'd like some wine? Or some of our aged brandy?"

"Thank you Augustus...but some chilled raspberry cordial will be fine".

"Yes ma'am...I'll go get some for you..."
"I'll do it!"
"I'LL do it!"
"You and what army!?"
"THESE ARMIES!"
"You call those armies? They're TWIGS!"
"They ain't any smaller than YOUR twigs!"

Minerva sighed. She left the three hyper-competitive lumberjack brothers and went to help herself to the cordial on the sideboard.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
As everyone sat down to eat, a plump, Fatlantean man wearing a monkish habit entered the dining-hall, ringing a bell. Better-known for their charity than most Mountanians, who believed in hard work and personal strength, an abbey existed on the Mountanian-Fatlantean border a few miles away. Trudging through the snow, the children, orphans who lived at the abbey, had accompanied the monks and nuns and the abbot to the lord's castle for the midwinter feast. Everyone watched as an ancient ceremony was played out.

The abbey and its order, just like Castle Vanderstorm, had existed since the dawn of time...almost. And every year in deepest, darkest midwinter, the lord of the manor gave charity and alms to the poor folk of the abbey. This was not the only time of the year, of course, but it was the most important, because of the harsh and unforgiving winter weather. Some lords gave more. Clothes, cloth and tools. Others gave less. Loaves of bread and jars of honey. But they always gave something. To give nothing at all was unheard of!

Fortis had already donated all their old clothes to the abbey. And he didn't have any tools or equipment to spare. So instead, he gave the children a treat of candy and special foods.

The abbot approached the high table and, hands joined within the wide sleeves of his robes, he bowed.

"I, the Abbot of the Ancient and Noble Abbey of Rockford, do humbly beseech thee, Lord Vanderstorm, Earl, and overlord of these lands in his majesty's Kingdom of Mountania, to give us charity this dark midwinter".

Everyone watched as Fortis stood up to give the ceremonial reply. He stepped around the table and stood in front of the abbot.

"Good Father Abbot, the brethren and sisters of thy ancient and noble order give much to the unfortunates and drifters of our community, for which we are all of us, most grateful..."

There was a general murmuring of agreement amongst the party-guests.

Everyone stared at Eldonia. She blushed, but she wasn't able to do it! She'd rehearsed her part in this ceremony a dozen times...but...she'd gotten stage-fright! What if she messed up her lines!? Lady Athena smiled understandingly. She had done this plenty of times when her own husband had been lord of the manor, and had filled in for her son when his own wife had died. She supposed it would make no difference, if now, she filled in...again...for her grandson. She got up and shuffled forwards, her walking stick clicking steadily on the floor as she came forwards. She didn't need to read the words of the ancient ceremony, inscribed on an old parchment. She'd done this so many times she knew the words by heart.

"His lordship and I duly recognise the great deeds of kindness and mercy which your order hath done. Send forth your needy, so that they might receive the charity of their liege lord, this bleak midwinter eve".

The crowd clapped and then fell silent.

Stacked in front of the high table were small baskets, each one filled with candy, chocolates and cookies, and a few other tokens, like gold coins, silver coins, or a simple toy of some description. Fortis stood next to the pile.

An orphan from the abbey would step forwards. As he or she advanced, Athena would pick up a basket and hand it to her grandson, who would pass it to the child in question.

...or that was how it was supposed to happen.

Old lord Vanderstorm had not been so tall. Or muscular. Or young. Or dark. Or so impressively vast and broad in the chest and shoulders...or so incredibly intimidating!!

"Go along, Samuel..." said the abbot, to a waif of a child who was barely four years old! He was almost microscopic compared to the towering mountain lord, and as he got closer and closer, his confidence deserted him!

"WAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAAH!!!AHAHAHAAHAHA!! WAAAAAAAAH!!"

The hall echoed with the soft sniffling sobs, and a few snickers and giggles from the party-guests, swiftly silenced by sympathetic "Shush!"es.

A sister of the order rushed forwards. She was a pretty young thing in her twenties.

"There now Sammy..." she whispered, and hugged him, "It's alright...What's the matter?"

The boy sniffled and sobbed. He whispered something into her ear.

"What's that?" she said, "I can't hear you over your sniffling, sweetie!"

"Dah big skawey man's gonna EAT ME!!!!!"

The crowd in the dining-hall burst out laughing now, even louder than before! This only made Sammy cry even more!!

"Shhh! I'll come with you..." said the sister. She took the mite's hand and walked him up towards Lord Fortis. The boy was terrified and hid behind the sister's skirts! He peeked out between the folds of cloth, wet, wide eyes staring up in fright.

"Well hello, young man", said Fortis. His deep, heavy voice echoing through the chamber, which was now devoid of laughter.

The boy sniffled.

"And what's your name?"

"S-s-s-S-sammul..."

"My lord..." the sister whispered.

"My lord Sammul...I mean..."

The crowd, and some of the older orphans, laughed.

"It's very nice to meet you, Samuel. Have you been a good boy this year?"

"Yessir m'lord, sir..." the boy said, so softly that not even an ant could hear him.

"Well that's very good to hear", said Fortis. He held the basket out. "This is for you".

The boy bowed, mumbled something in reply, and scuttled off to a table in the corner, where the orphans gathered for their midwinter feast.

Then, the next child came up. Twins, actually. A boy and a girl. Brother and sister. Both seven years old. They walked towards the towering mountain lord, and bowed and curtsied. They gave him their names, and their solemn assurances that they had been good. And Fortis gave them each a basket of candy and coins.

"Thank you, my lord!" they said. They bowed and curtsied again, and went to their table.

In ones and twos, the orphans came forward, now that they realised that there was nothing to fear from the gigantic new Mountain lord. Fortis hugged some of the boys, and kissed a few of the girls and pinched them and patted them playfully, and some people smiled and waved. Once they had all received their presents, and the gift-giving ceremony was over, a gong sounded.

"Ladies and gentlemen. You have up to now, been feasting on canapes and snacks", Fortis said. "I invite you all to stay with us for the main event. Our midwinter feast! Mrs. Tibbs!"

The housekeeper entered, along with the maids and servant-boys, bearing plates and bowls of food. Then, Cannius and Jupiter staggered in! Between them, they carried an enormous, crispy, bloated roast hog! A gigantic Fatlantean swine that had been fattened up to thousands of pounds in weight!

Everyone clapped and cheered.

"The hog has been donated by our good friends from south of the border", Fortis said. "I hope you all enjoy our feast and eat heartily this evening!"

Minerva and Axelrod sat by the fireplace, exchanging compliments. Minerva felt the younger teen's hands. Large and rough, from years of handling an axe, a saw, spikes and sledgehammers. She was about to say something about them when there was a loud CRASH!! A few screams echoed around.

"I yunno..." Fortis slurred, "Wuzzit fuckin' maddur?"

"Eeeww!" said Eldonia. Axelrod laughed.

When the party began to wind down, and people started drifting home, Minerva looked upstairs. She had probably go and see how her brother was doing.

"Hey Girl!"

She turned to see Jupiter walking towards the front door.

"What's the matter?"

"Me'n'Canny are goin' out. We're givin' them orphans a lift back to the abbey in one of the carts. We'll be back in an hour or so".

"Alright", said Minerva. She stood there, waving goodbye to everyone. Now, only a few of the older people remained, chatting with Lady Athena, and Wolfgang, and his wife Vesta. They had left the dining-hall and retreated into the parlour for some drink and dessert. Minerva headed upstairs. Eldonai was in her bedroom, scrubbing up and having a late, lazy soak in a nice, hot bath. Minerva could hear the soft splashing of water as she passed the door in the corridor.

Minerva knocked on the doors to the master bedroom.

"Forty?"

Minerva peered down. A light was still showing under the door.

"Forty!?"

She knocked on the door again.

"Fortis! Open the door!"

The door opened. Minerva gasped!

Fortis stood there, half-naked, wearing only a pair of old, worn out undershorts. His dark blond hair was a mess and he looked dreadful! His face looked drawn and tired and grumpy and his eyes were red and heavy.

"Oh just LOOK at you!" Minerva said, pushing her way into the room, "Fortis you disgraced our whole family tonight acting like you did!"

"Aaah shaddup..." Fortis grumbled, "So I had a couple of drinks and I got a little woozy..."

"A LITTLE!? you were so drunk you could hardly see straight! You couldn't even walk properly!"

"Whaddi paw dawn mah fuckin' froat's mawn bissness!" Fortis slurred. He was obviously still extremely drunk.

"Fortis! You should know better than that!"

"FUCK IT!"

"Fortis! Don't you dare talk to me like that!"

"What are you!? Gwamma!?"

"I'm your SISTER!"

"Oooooh...Fuck it! Why's erryvun tryin' ter teller me whadda do...Is wan day a year...is not da...*hic!*...Endda da wurld..."

"Fortis the way you were acting..."

"Dah way's I was actin'!?...Fuck...You's seen how's you was actin'!?"

"What ABOUT how I was acting!?"

"You's...caryin'yon wiv daht...daht...EisenvonWald guy...."

"What...we were TALKING, Fortis! it's not like he pressed me against a wall and kissed me!"

"YOU KEEP OFF OF HIM!"

"I'll mingle with who I wish! Besides! It was nothing serious! And even if it was, I'd like to have seen what you would've done! You were so drunk you couldn't hardly sit down without falling over first!"

"HE'S A FUCKIN'...f-f-FARMHAND! You're a LADY! You don't mix wi-wi-with...SHIT like that..."

"And you're supposed to be lord of his majesty's land in this part of his kingdom! Some lord you are to get drunk and make a scene everywhere!"

"AH SHADDUP!"

Minerva squealed! She felt a sharp, unfamiliar stinging sensation as a heavy, rough hand struck her across the face! It took her a minute to understand what had happened!

She burst into tears!

"YOU COMIN' UP HERE AN' T-TELLIN' ME...A-ALL THIS SHIT!..."

Downstairs, the conversation was interrupted by the muffled shouting upstairs. Wolfgang sighed.

"I'll be back in a minute, granny", he said to Lady Athena. "I wanna see what on earth all that yelling is about..."

The older Vanderstorm male headed upstairs. He opened the bedroom door to Fortis's private suite. He watched as Fortis smacked his sister hard across the face! Minerva shriekd, yelped and burst into tears!

"FORTIS!" Wolfgang shouted, "Don't you DARE hit your sister like that!"

Minerva regained her composure quickly. "He's drunk!" she said hotly, "He doesn't know what he's doing! And he should be sleeping it off!" she said even more firmly. Wolfgang nodded in agreement.

"C'mon cousin!" he said, "Lie down, and sleep".

"I don't wanna fuckin'..."

"SLEEP!"

Wolfgang swung a heavy fist through the air! It connected with the side of Fortis's head, knocking him out cold! Fortis toppled back and slumped into bed.

"Sorry Forty, old buddy, but it's for your own good", said Wolfgang, "Hey girl! Help me tuck him in".

Minerva tucked Fortis into bed, clucking to herself and shaking her head disapprovingly.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Frost formed on the windows and snow blanketed the Mountanian countryside. Outside, the woods and trees were quiet. All the birds had flown south for the winter, probably settling in Lucia, or southern Fatlantis. In the ancient stronghold of Castle Vanderstorm, the only signs of life were a couple of smoking chimneys. The entire household, up and down, was fast asleep. In the master bedroom, the glorious lord of the land slowly rose from his slumber...

"Uuuuurggghhh fuuuuck my head..."

Fortis groaned. He felt sick, queasy and dizzy. He tried to sit up, but felt so giddy that he just flopped back into bed again, groaning and moaning, his head throbbing and his ears humming.

What a fucking hangover...

Fortis felt around the bed...he was alone...No seductive, teasing missus...no sweet, cuddling sister around...the room was empty.

Fortis groaned. His head was killing him...he wanted something to cuddle...and if there weren't any pretty girls in his bed, then he'd have to go and find a pretty girl and get into HER bed...

Slowly, the dizzy, drunken lord got to his feet. Damn his height...why did the floor have to be so far away...he staggered dizzily forwards, his vision blurred and hazy. He opened his bedroom door and shuffled out. The squeaking of the hinges sliced into his ears like screeching eagles. He heard the soft 'ding!...ding!...ding!...ding!...ding!...' of the clock downstairs. Five in the morning...

Fortis lumbered heavily down the corridor, leaning against the wall every step of the way. He pushed open a door and shuffled inside. He closed the door none-too-quietly, and slumped into the bed next to it. The bed was nowhere near large enough for a giant of his physique, and he had to curl up to fit in. Not that he really mattered...he was more interested in curling up around the pretty young thing already wrapped up in the sheets, than he was in stretching out and trying to sleep. He wrapped his arms around the girl in the bed and drew her in, squeezing her tight, wrapping his legs around her waist and binding her firmly to his body. He rubbed his stubbled chin against her head, playfully, and gave her a kiss...

Minerva yawned...then she felt the arms and legs around her...and the rough scraping and the kissing...

She giggled. "Forty...Forty!!...Forty get out of my bed!"

Minerva suddenly started kicking! With surprising ease, she dislodged her brother from her bed, who flopped onto the floor!

"W-what the...hey...whussa matter girl...I thought you like me sleepin' wit'choo...all warm and snuggly in win'nner..."

Fortis got to his feet and stared at his sister. But then he spotted the black eye.

"H-h-Hey...w-who did that!?"

"YOU did!'

"Hehehe...what? I...I wouldn't do that..."

Minerva glared at her brother and sighed, "You really don't remember, do you?" she asked.

"Huh? Remember what?"

Minerva told her brother, shortly, about what had happened last night.

Fortis groaned, "Aww girl..." he said. "I'm sorry..."

Minerva crossed her arms and shook her head. "Humph! I never saw anything so disgraceful!"

"Girl!..."

"MINERVA!"

Fortis groaned. Sister must be REALLY pissed off. As long as he'd known her, he'd always called her 'Girl', and she'd never complained about it...until today.

"What's the matter?"

"YOU HIT ME! And Wolfgang saw it! And you're so drunk you didn't remember ANYTHING!?"

Minerva burst into tears!

"I...I thought my brother was nicer than that!"

"Aw girl..." Fortis got on his knees and grasped his sister's hands, "I'm sorry..."

"Oh leave me alone!"

"Hey!" said Fortis standing up, "I'm real sorry, okay!? I didn't mean it! I love you! You know I'd never hurt you!"

"Well you did!"

"Girl!"

Minerva shook her hands out of her brother's grasp, "Oh just go!"

"I'm not goin' anywhere! Now come on girl! I'm sorry!...Now let me get in bed with you, okay? You know you like that...It'll make you feel better!"

"I'm NOT sharing my bed with a drunk! Not even you!"

"Girl!"

"MINERVA! MINERVA! MINERVA!"

"Fine! MINERVA! What...what can I do to make you believe that I ain't gonna hurt you!? You know I'd never do that!"

"You could stop drinking!"

Fortis paused, but then he laughed, "No seriously..."

"SERIOUSLY!"

"No I can't!"

"Yes!"

"No! Honey I have to drink something!"

"Drink water!"

"Water ain't got no kick to it, gir--Minerva..."

"Fortis..."

"I tell you what. I promise to drink proper and responsible so's i don't make you upset no more, okay?"

Minerva sighed.

"C'mon! Gimme a break, girl! It was an accident!"

"Oooh alright...But you gotta do it properly!"

Fortis raised his right hand and placed his left fist over his heart.

"I, Fortis Vanderstorm, Earl, Lord of this esate and the lands surrounding it, do, in the presence of my sister, the cutest, most adorable, sweetest, and most forgiving..."

"Don't push your luck, brother..."

"...do solemnly swear from this day forth to drink in moderation".

Minerva smiled. She kissed him and Fortis sighed. "Now can I get into bed with you? It's freezing!'

Minerva smiled. She got into bed and moved over and Fotis climbed in after her, wrapping his body around her and giving her a kiss.

"Jeez you're cold..." Fortis said.

1311122222221111122221211112121212111122.content:
Eldonia shivered! It was fucking cold outside! She rose from her bed in her frozen bedroom and wondered why it was so damn cold! But then she realised that her fire had gone out. She sighed. It was freezing! She went to the windows and cautiously parted the curtains. It was white everywhere outside. She touched her hand to the glass. Yeek!! Thor's sledgehammer! That was freezing!

Deciding that she needed some warmth, Eldonia went to seek out her husband. She had not heard all the commotion from last night, as she had been lazing in her bath, and had no clear idea of Fortis's current condition. She entered the master bedroom, took in the mangled sheets, and determined that he wasn't there.

Where else would that lumbering brute go?

She checked on the nursery. Baby Leo was curled up with Baby Astrid, both babies slumbering in the same crib. The guestroom was filled with Wolfgang, his vast form wrapped around his wife, whom he snuggled protectively. She kicked and fidgeted slightly and Wolfgang drew her into a tight, warm embrace...

Eldonia decided that was what SHE wanted!...But first, she would have to find her husband!

She closed the doors to the guestroom and frowned. Where else would he be??

then she remembered Minerva's room. She opened the door and tiptoed inside.

There he was, curled up around his sister.

Eldonia slipped onto Minerva's bed and snuggled up under the covers, and sidled up over to her husband's broad, muscular back.

Minerva's bed was not designed for this. Most mountanian women, even those who had...enjoyed the company...of the largest of Mountain men...rarely grew taller than about seven and a half feet. In fact, the average height for tall women was about six foot.

The bed was designed for a woman. It was about eight feet long...long enough for even the tallest of Mountanian women to stretch out and luxuriate under the covers. But it was nowhere near large enough for a full-grown Mountain lord!

Even with his body curled up, Fortis's large feet still kicked the bottom of the bedstead. And he took up so much space that there was almost no space left for Eldonia! But she managed...

She snuggled up against her husband and slipped an arm underneath his shoulder....then hugged him. Her hands reached right down, playfully caressing and pinching his round, tight buttocks...

Suddenly, she felt a sharp, stinging "smack!' on her behind!

"You are such a naughty girl touchin' a married man like that..." said a heavy, deep voice.

"Why Forty..." Eldonia teased. Fortis rolled over and pinned his wife deep into the mattress. "Good morning, then", Fortis said huskily. Eldonia shuddered...

Minerva yawned. "F-forty...i-if you're...gonna...do the...do...THINGS...to her...do it somewhere else..." Minerva said sleepily.

"Y'know girl, that's not a bad idea..."

Suddenly, Minerva was wide awake!

"What!? I...ELDONIA!"

Fortis and Eldonia burst out laughing.

"Oh get OUT! Both of you!"

Fortis laughed and kissed his sister, "Yes ma'am", he said. He scooped up his squealing wife, and carried her off out of the room.

"Revolting!" Minerva grumbled, as Eldonia pulled the doors shut behind them as she and her husband left the room.
