1411121.content:
"You want some help with your luggage?" Cameron asked.

"Nah I can do it", said Gladius. He stared at the two enormous hogs. They could barely waddle! How could they possibly help him carry his luggage!? With a grunt, he hefted his trunks and boxes and bags up in his arms. The pile of luggage was so high he could only JUST see over the top!

"Okay..." said Cameron, a little taken aback at Gladius's strength! "...Um...Follow us!"

At once, Gladius could see why Cameron and Edmund would require a bodyguard. To begin with, they were enormously fat! Real targets for assassins or molesters, assaulters, cutpurses, robbers and other lowlifes. But very soon afterwards, Gladius saw the other reason why they needed a bodyguard! They moved like snails! Even though each prince carried an ornate walking-stick with them to take some of the weight off their feet, they waddled along at a, at least to Gladius's eyes, agonisingly slow pace! Cameron's belly sloshed and jiggled as he panted and plodded along. It swayed from side to side and his generous buttocks quivered and rippled as his huge thighs and calves shifted to move him ponderously ahead. Gladius couldn't say with any certainty that Edmund moved much faster! Gladius wasn't complaining too much, though. With all his luggage, Gladius wasn't able to do much more than a slow power-walk! He was beginning to regret refusing whatever assistance it was that Cameron and his brother were thinking of offering him!

As they headed down the corridors, past flaming torches and candles, Gladius stopped and stared at multitudes of portraits that hung from the walls, pausing every few feet to look at the subjects and to read the shiny brass plaques hammered onto the picture-frames. He recognised a few names from his studies of foreign kingdoms. King Daniel the Great. King Chandler the Kind. Darius the Grand. Jacob the Small.

Gladius stopped in front of one portrait.

"Hey who's that?"

Cameron halted and shuffled slowly around.

"Who?...Oh! That's Prince Javelin. He was one of your ancestors, I bet. That's him after he defeated Lord Malevous, who was torching villages and burning crops..."

"Cool..." said Gladius. "I wonder how we're related?"

"He's probably your Great...something...Uncle", Cameron pondered. "Come on!"

After more doorways, corridors, occasional pauses for breath, interruptions from portrait-watching and Gladius stopping to pick up boxes that slid and fell off the top of the tower of luggage that he was carrying, they finally reached the royal family's private chambers.

Cameron started pointing out the doors to the enormous private apartments. Each person who slept here had not only his own bedroom, but his own bathroom, dining-room, living-room, storage-room, closets and even private sleeping-quarters for their personal servants! They weren't really bedrooms, they were more like miniature houses built into the palace compound! Gladius was impressed! Back home, his room wasn't exactly spartan, but it wasn't anywhere near this opulent!

"That's father's room", Cameron said, pointing to one enormous set of doors. "...And this one here belongs to mother. This suite here is actually the royal nursery...It's empty right now. This suite here is my room! And over here is Eddie's. Your private apartment will be this one here, down the corridor".

Cameron waddled up to a crossroads in the corridors and pointed to the right. "That's your room".

"Thanks!" said Gladius. He shuffled towards it and Cameron unlocked the doors and handed Gladius the keys to his bedroom on a long chain.

The Mountain prince entered his new domain and with a grunt, he clunked the trunks down at the foot of his bed. He got up and slowly stretched his back.

"Ooooooooh man!" he groaned. He stared around the room and started exploring it. There was a dining-nook in the corner by the windows, a large fireplace, armchairs and a couch and a low table in front of the hearth, a large wardrobe, a private bathing-chamber and toiletries room, and a storage-room fitted with shelves and cupboards.

"Servants will clean the room for you each day at noon", Cameron explained. "When you'll be having luncheon with our family. If you want anything special done, just leave a note here on your desk. Like having a bath drawn or building, lighting or fueling the fire. They'll do stuff like change the bed-linen, replace candles, fill up lamps, replace wicks, sweep the hearth, gather clothing..."

"What do I do!?" Gladius asked. Although he was a prince, Gladius was never one for being waited on hand and foot! In Mountania, such sloth and laziness was strongly discouraged! And especially for a member of the royal family! Gladius's grandfather, Old King Hercules always maintained that keeping clean and active was just another way to build muscles and strengthen the body. Looking at Cameron and Edmund, Gladius doubted that they'd ever lifted a single finger in work their entire lives! Gladius was sometimes even used to splitting his own firewood! He doubted Cameron or Edmund had ever seen an axe!

"Well the job of the princely bodyguard is to guard the bodies of the princes...or princesses...only we don't have any sisters", said Cameron.
"Well duh!" said Gladius, "I mean, what ELSE do I do? I mean I can't imagine you guys go out very often!"

Cameron and Edmund looked hurt!

Gladius bowed his head. "Sorry...Father complains my tongue moves too freely at times".

Cameron nodded in a "suuure it does", kind of way.

"Well apart from that, your job will be to maintain order among the underservants".

"The what?"

"The underservants. All the servant-children who work in the palace".

"You have child-servants?" Gladius asked. He was surprised. In the Mountanian court, where work was usually a lot more strenuous, most servants were teenaged or older!

"Well most of the work isn't that hard", Cameron said. "And besides, a lot of them are homeless children. We adopt them from poorhouses and orphanages and put them to work in the palace".

"That doesn't sound very nice".

"Hey, it's either starving in the streets, being locked up in a poorhouse or working in service", Cameron said, his voice sounding rather hot, "And if they work here then at least they get some skills and learn something, and they get food and clothes and a home and..."

"You're right!" said Gladius, holding up a hand. "You're right...I'm sorry...again".

Guessing that Cameron and Edmund both probably had small armies of servant-boys to attend to their every single want and need that could possibly ever arise, Gladius surmised that it probably wasn't such a surprise that they were so enormously fat! The prince was about to get confirmation of his suspicions when four boys appeared.

The boys all looked about the same age. Gladius would find out later that all four boys were twelve. The boys were very short. Gladius at six feet tall, must've looked like a giant to them! Cameron and Edmund stood a few inches taller than the boys and from the way the boys were acting, Gladius suspected that these were the prince's personal servants.

The boys wore a uniform of sorts. White short pants that went down to just below their knees, and white, button-down, short-sleeved tops, with lashings of gold along the shoulders, sleeves, cuffs, seams, pocket-edges and handsome, shiny brass buttons. Despite their obvious status as servants, Gladius could see that the boys were fell-fed, their gold and white tunics failing to hide their delightfully round pot-bellies, nor their shorts hiding their chubby thighs or buttocks. Each boy had a double-chin in various stages of development, from a full double-crease and almost no sign of a neck, to just a soft fullness to the face. Their arms and hands also, were chubby, doubtless from dozens of good meals served and eaten in the royal servants' quarters.

The four boys made their obediences and bowed at once to their royal masters.

"Gladius, I want you to meet our servant-boys", Cameron said. "Gladius, this is...Ryan, Ethan,...Samson and Jeremy. Ryan and Ethan are my servants. Samson and Jeremy serve my brother Edmund. Boys, this is Prince Gladius. He'll be living in the palace now as our bodyguard, companion and Keeper of the King's Peace for the Underservantry. You're to treat him with every respect you give anyone else of royal station and you will address him accordingly".

The four boys nodded.

"Good!" said Cameron. "So Gladius, what do you want to do first?"
1411121.title: The princes show Gladius to his bedroom.

choices: "The royal bathhouse. He might be very interested in the swimming-pool"
"The servants quarters. He'll need to be introduced to them sooner or later".
14111211.content:
"So what do you want to do?" Cameron asked.

"I think I wanna explore the palace a bit", said Gladius. "Hey, I'm gonna be here for a damn long time. I might as well find out where everything is".

Edmund nodded. It sounded like a good idea.

"We can show you around", he said. Cameron nodded in agreement.

"Ethan. I want my luncheon in my room when I get back. Ryan. Walk with me".

"Yes, Master Cameron".
"As you wish, my lord".

Edmund dismissed his servants and prepared to follow his older brother around their palatial dwelling. With Ryan in-tow, the three princes started walking...very slowly...around the palace.

"This is the king's study, his secretary's study, the library, the map-room, the archives..." Cameron said. "This is the Queen's Parlour. Along here and through these doors are various courtiers' offices and meeting-rooms and so-forth. This here is the East Drawing Room. We spend most of our time at night in here after dinner".

Gladius opened a massive pair of double doors. He stuck his head in and marvelled at the enormous and grand chamber beyond, with a massive fireplace and huge, towering windows all along one wall. He whistled.

"That's SOME room!" he said.

Cameron blushed.

"This rampway leads up to the second storey. There's courtiers' suites up here with their own private servants' quarters, and more offices and storage-rooms and so-forth. Then this is the gallery over the foyer. That's the foyer down there...and these doors and those over there lead into the Stranger's Gallery..."

"The what?"

"It's where commoners can gather to view the throne-room beyond, when the palace is open to the public".

"Can I see the throne-room?"

"You haven't already? Oh okay...Come on! This way".

Cameron led Gladius downstairs. Gladius was surprised that two such obese princes could waddle so far! But then he reasoned that their legs were probably immensely strong from carrying them around everywhere all the time.

"Ryan, open the door", Cameron said. Ryan pushed open a pair of gigantic double doors into a huge chamber beyond which was all light marble and red carpets and clean, cool-coloured walls. At the far end was an immense, massive dias the size of a theatre-stage! On it, under a large canopy were enormous thrones and foot-stools for the members of the royal family. Sitting on their thrones were the king and queen, apparently eating luncheon.

"Aaah!" said an enormously fat man. A gigantic blob who had to weigh three tons at least! He shuffled in his throne, his dark blond, bearded face smiling as the boys approached.

"YOU must be Prince Gladius!"

"Um..." Gladius began.

"That's papa", Cameron whispered, "King David the Vast, people call him".

"Uh...yeah!" said Gladius. "I...I mean 'Yes sir!...Yes your Majesty...um...Majesties", he added.

Gladius bowed awkwardly. 'Majesty' was certainly a title well-deserved! These people were TREMENDOUS! Queen Isobel was a vast woman with large, bountiful breasts and long, slightly curly, wheat-coloured hair. She smiled sweetly at Gladius, who blushed.

"Showing him around the palace, boys?" the Queen asked.

"Yes, mother!" said Edmund brightly.

"Good! Good! It's important he knows where EVERYTHING is!"

"Yes mother!"

"Boys", said King David. "You should take Gladius to see..."
14111211.title: "Explore the Palace!"

choices: The princes show Gladius the royal estate.
Gladius explores the palace by himself.
141112112.content:
"You must take him to the servants' quarters", said the king.

"What for, father?" Edmund asked.

"Part of his job when he's not accompanying you around is to maintain law and order below stairs!" said the king. "He can't DO that if he doesn't know where that is!"

"Oh...right! Yeah...good point!"

"Come on, Gladius", said Cameron. "We'll show you where it is".

The princes led their new bodyguard through the palace and down a long, low ramp that went down to the servants' quarters. They showed him the kitchens and the dormitories, the store-rooms, the servants' quarters and countless other chambers and offices, store-cupboards, rooms and passageways.

"These doors lead into the servants' hall", said Edmund.

Ryan, Prince Cameron's servant-boy, opened the doors and the princes waddled in.

At once, the hundreds of servants who filled the hall stopped everything that they were doing and stood up.

"Sorry for the interruption", said Crown Prince Cameron, "But we thought that this was important and that we should tell you when you were all in one place, to save time".

"This is Prince Gladius of Mountania", said Prince Edmund. He waddled slowly aside and Gladius smiled and nodded.

"Hey!" he said simply.

"Prince Gladius has been posted to the royal court as our bodyguard and as a token of goodwill between the Kingdoms of Mountania and Fatlantis", Prince Cameron said. "I hope that everyone here will treat him with kindness, friendship, good service and due obedience".

Everyone started chatting and whispering.

"That will be all", said Prince Cameron.

"Well hold on!" said Gladius. Without his goody-two-shoes brother Cassius around, Gladius could at last look like a proper Mountanian prince without being measured against his saintly brother.

"We are not here to interrupt the servants' meal", said Cameron.

"Woah, woah, woah...We're here to introduce ME...the biggest...strongest...hottest...handsomest...of the Mountanian princes, sons of His Majesty, the great King Leviathan...to the servants..." said Gladius. "Would you deny them the chance to get to know such an excellent specimen of my country's physicality as I? Do not be so heartless, your Royal Highness..."

Gladius swaggered through the rows of tables and benches, saying "Hey" and "Hi there" to as many servants as he could touch.

"So where do you keep all the servant-girls around here..."

"Prince Gladius, relations with the palace servant-girls are not allowed!" said Cameron.
"Yeah but a prince has gotta have a mistress right?...Or...three or four...huh girls?"
"Your Royal Highness!" said Cameron sharply, "You can't have a...a...companion for your bedchamber until you're of age!"
"Correction. I can't have..." Gladius paused to try and find the right word. "...experiences with a companion of my bedchamber until I'm of age. But that's not gonna stop me from finding such a companion...What's your name?"

He stared at a plump, giggling girl with chestnut hair. She blushed and turned away.

"Come on!" said Cameron. "We have other things to do. Come, Ryan!"
141112112.title: "The servants quarters. He'll need to b...

choices: Prince Edmund waddles into the room to see what's up.
A bell tolls. Dinnertime! Gladius is in for a BIG shock...
1411121122.content:
Gladius sighed. This was one hell of a mission that his father had sent him on! He knew that he'd been sent on it purely to keep him out of his father's hair, but still...

The young prince continued to explore the palace. He found the palace bakery, butchery, chocolate-maker's, library, the various reception-rooms, and a huge old dusty chamber down in the servants' quarters.

The chamber was vast and dark and accessed by a pair of impressive-looking wood doors. He opened them and headed inside, waving a torch around to see what was what.

"Hey boy!" Gladius called out to a passing servant-boy, "What is this place?"

"That's the ol' Smithy!" the boy said, and kept on waddling.

"Smithy...huh?" Gladius mused. He headed inside and started lighting candles. When the room was sufficiently brightened, he was able to look around. He could see the fireplaces, the forges, the racks of old instruments and tools, the anvils, the blocks, the moulds, the benches, the burn-marks, quenching-troughs, water-pumps, wood-piles...None of this looked like it had been used in decades!

Perhaps, if King David allowed it, Gladius could turn this into a sort of work-room...

Finally bored with exploring the palace, Gladius returned to his private apartment where he broke the seal on a large envelope given to him by his father before he left Mountania.

Dear Gladius,

I write to you now, in the hopes that in writing, I shall say everything in competeness.

Your mother, grandfather and I, have agreed with King David and Queen Isobel, to send you to the royal court at Fatlantis in Regis City. Here, you will carry out the office of Princely Bodyguard. It will be your job to ensure the safety of the king and queen's two sons, who are not generally capable of ensuring safety of their personages on their own...

Gladius snorted! He wondered WHY? They had to weigh a thousand pounds each!

"...this is a great and honourable position which you have been selected for. It shows the great friendship and alliance between our two powerful, ancient and noble royal houses, the House of Van Draconis, and the House of Regis. You will not fail us in your duty to your family, your house, your kingdom, or to your two charges, the princes of Fatlantis. We expect you to be civil, polite, protective and friendly to them and to make friends with them.

With love,

Your father.

Leviathan, King of Mountania"

Gladius sighed. He stuffed the letter under a pillow, flopped back on the bed and groaned...
1411121122.title: Gladius explores the palace by himself.

choices: "...see my bedroom? Help me get up and I'll show you where it is".
"...call my servants? I need somethin' to eat. You can help feed me if you like"
14111211221.content:
Gladius sighed. He didn't WANT to be babysitter to a pair of fat, royal pigs! He wanted to go HOME! He groaned and just lay in bed on his stomach, comatose and bored...

Clonk-clonk-clonk!!!

"Hurrrrrgghhh..."

Clonk-clonk-clonk!!!

"Oh come in! Come in...What do you want?"

The doors swung open and Prince Edmund waddled into the room. Gladius rolled over in bed and made a face! The sight of the prince revolted and disgusted him!

The prince was a year younger than he was, but easily three times his weight! He looked barely mobile as he waddled slowly over the threshold and towards the bed, supporting himself with an expensive-looking walking-stick. His blond hair was neat and brushed, and his fat, round face had three chins! His entire body was fat and soft and buttery. It quivered and swayed as he waddled ponderously towards the bed. Gladius noticed an enormous, quadruple-decker burger clutched in a chubby right hand. It was a mess of bread, lettuce, beef and bacon. It oozed melted cheese, ketchup, mustard and barbecue sauce.

"Hey...G-g-Gladius!" Edmund panted. He waddled slowly into the room. The space between the door and the bed was only a few yards...Gladius's room not being as large, or as grand as other royal bedrooms...but the prince was so awesomely fat that he had to stop halfway to catch his breath, during which he took several large bites out of the monstrous burger in his hand! Gladius watched as Edmund opened his mouth, forced as much of the burger into it as he could, chomped down on it and started chewing, melted cheese, oil, grease, fat and the various sauces and dressings squirting and dribbling down his face. They ran down his jowls and cheeks and over his chins and across the vast, soft, squishy expanse of his chest. He kept chomping on the burger, fat and grease splattering onto the soft, supple curves of his belly. Just eating seemed to be a huge effort for him, because he was gasping and panting the whole time! He finally let out a long, heavy belch, which made his belly quiver. He took another few gasping breaths, and then plodded slowly towards the bed.

He collapsed on the bed, which creaked ominously. He groaned and dropped his walking-stick, which hit the floor with a 'clatter!' and rolled away from his feet.

"O...o....ooooooh man..." he groaned. He sank into the mattress and massaged his bloated, aching belly. "Oooh dude..."

He started rubbing his vast, greasy, sweating belly, belching richly.

"Um..." said Gladius. He was a bit dumbstruck by this overt display of royal sloth and laziness. "C-c-can I...get you a wash-cloth or a towel or something?"

"Y-y-yyeah..." Edmund gasped. He seemed barely able to breathe! "T-t-thanks.."

Gladius rolled off his bed and headed over to his washstand. He picked up a towel, dipped it in water, wrung it out and then brought it back.

"C-c-can you...w-wipe me down?" Edmund gasped. He let out another horrific belch!

"What!?"

"I d-don-don't think I...I can m-move my...my arms!" Edmund wheezed.

Gladius knelt down and started rubbing Edmund's belly clean...and his arms...his face...his chest...his chins...his jowls and his chubby hands and fingers.

"Man", said Gladius, rubbing, patting and wobbling Edmund's belly. He could tell from the warmth and the heavy, stretched feeling that the prince had only just finished what must've been just one of several enormous meals. The prince belched for a third time! He groaned and slumped back against a pile of pillows.

"O--o--o--ohhh..." he groaned. "D-d-don't...BLURRRRCH!...s-s-stop! Oooh so fuuuuull!" he whimpered!

Gladius slowly started massaging the colossal boy, gradually getting over his shock and alarm!

"Oh man", he said. "This is WEIRD!"

"B-b-...HIC!...you d-don't h-have t---BUURRP!...'is...i-in m-Mount-tan-tania..." Edmund struggled.

"Noooo way man!" said Gladius. "Duuude you are HUGE! How can you let yourself GET so fat!?"

To Gladius, the IDEA of being this stupendously obese was shocking! He would NEVER allow himself to get to this state! But for a Fatlantean prince...

"I..i-it's r-royal d-duty..." Edmund gasped. He breathed deeply, slowly getting his composure back.

"Duty!?"

"Th-the royal f-family h-has to be the f-fattest f-family in the kingdom..." Edmund panted. "It's their legitimacy as the right to rule..." he explained. "And the royal princes must al-always be the f-fattest...BELCH!...boys in the...k-kingdom. T-To secure the c-continuation of the royal succession an-and to secure a bride and fatter babies..."

"Man..." said Gladius. This whole idea was totally alien to him!

Shifting his massive butt, Edmund sat up and grunted.

"T-t-thanks for the...belly rub", he groaned.

"So what're you doing here?" Gladius asked, standing up and getting the crick out of his back.

"Well I...I heard you...um...You sounded kinda grouchy", said Edmund, now over his initial bloating enough to talk properly.

"Huh?...Ooooh..."

"What's wrong?"

"I dunno! I've never DONE this before!"

"Rubbed down a fat kid?"

"Ye...well that too! But...I never had to do anything like this! Never had to do bodyguarding stuff or anything!"

"Papa said it's some sort of longstanding tradition. I think your grandpa was my papa's bodyguard when they were youngsters".

"Oh...Well pops didn't tell ME that. I mean I don't even know what I have to DO!"

"I-it's easy!" said Edmund. "You gotta protect us when we go out."

"And what exactly does that mean?"

"You know, ward off muggers, kidnappers, stuff like that..."

"HUH! I'd like to see someone try kidnap a fat cow like you!"

Edmund blushed with pride. "Thanks!" he said.

"So, what else?"

"Just usual stuff. Keep muggers and kidnappers away, anyone who we ain't comfortable with, watching out for us..."

"I'm NOT a servant", said Gladius, "I am a PRINCE!"

"We know that!" said Edmund. "We've got SIX servants to look after us! We don't need YOU too!...But you might be called on to help us move around and stuff...you know..."

Gladius gulped. He nodded.

"Hey Gladius..." Edmund asked.

"Hmm?"

"Um, perhaps, would you like to..."
14111211221.title: Prince Edmund waddles into the room to see what...

choices: Edmund asks Gladius what Mountania is like.
A bright blue flash! Boy Wizard, Merlin, appears before them!
141112112211.content:
"Would you like to see my bedroom?" Prince Edmund asked.

"Um...Yeah, okay", said Gladius. Come to think of it, he hadn't seen Edmund's bedroom...or Cameron's for that matter! Since he was their bodyguard, he should probably familiarise himself with them...

"Great!" said Edmund, "Pick up my walking-stick for me".

Gladius stared. The handsome, brass-headed walking-stick was probably two feet from where Edmund was sitting on Gladius's bed.

"...You want me to pick up your stick for you?"

"Well I can't do it myself!"

"You...You can't pick up a stick!?"

"No way, man!"

Gladius stared at Edmund in shock!

"My servants do that kind of stuff for me", Edmund declared. Gladius sighed. He got down and picked up the stick and handed it to Edmund. He grasped it, leaned on it, and with a grunt, using the weight of his belly to pull himself forwards, he got to his feet. He stumbled a bit, but then stood upright. The bed creaked and slowly reformed its original shape.

"Man you are FAT!" said Gladius. Edmund blushed bright red. Realising at last that this was no insult to a fat, royal prince, Gladius kept his mouth shut.

"So where's your room?" Gladius asked.

"Down the corridor a way's", said Edmund, "Follow me".

That was hardly a difficult thing to do. Edmund, like almost everyone else in the palace who wasn't a servant, seemed to move at a snail's pace! Edmund's walk, like almost everyone else's, was a slow, swaying waddle, throwing his weight forward, shifting one foot forward, leaning back to one side, shifting his other foot forward, and then repeating the process. The result was a pig-like waddle, and a cconstant undulation and quivering of his hundreds of pounds of blubber. It was a fascinating sight and Gladius had never seen anything like it before! So much had he never seen anything like it before, that he couldn't stop staring at it!

"Man, do you ever stop wiggling around?" Gladius asked.

"N-no", Edmund panted. They'd only gone a few feet and he was already beginning to break a sweat!

"Man..." Gladius said again. It was only his first day here! He was gonna have to get used to a LOT of things!

The prince reached his bedroom and opened the doors and panted his way inside. Gladius followed and whistled.

"This is some room!" he said.

The bedroom was enormous! Sunlight streamed in through massive leadlight windows. At one end was a huge canopy bed. There were expensive rugs on the floors, paintings on the walls, expensive-looking furniture, a huge dining-table, chairs, closets, and doors that led off to store-rooms, bathrooms, the prince's personal guest bedroom, and of course, the bedrooms for his personal servant-boys, who jumped up at his entrance and bowed.

"Master", one of them said.

"Gladius, this is Samson and...and this is Jeremy", Edmund said, "Boys, this is Prince Gladius of Mountania. I think you met him already. The new bodyguard?"

"Yes master", said the boy named Jeremy.

"I'm just showing him my room", said Edmund. "Come on, G-Gladius..."

The boys bowed to the new prince. Gladius smiled. At least these boys knew royalty when they saw it...
141112112211.title: "...see my bedroom? Help me get up and I

choices: "I fixed your magical cauldron. TRY not to eat the handle this time..."
Merlin whispered in Edmund's ear. "It's Timmy..."
1411121122112.content:
Gladius was about to ask Edmund why something in his room was set out the way it was...or something...when a bright blue flash blinded him! It filled the whole room and then vanished, just as quickly!

"Greetings, Great Edmund, Prince of the Re...Oh Hey Gladius!"

Standing in front of Gladius was a slim boy with light blond hair and cold blue eyes and pale skin and a longish face. He wore a brilliant set of white and blue robes.

"Merlin!"

The boy wizard bowed. "O, Hail, Great Gladius! Dragon Master!"

"Shut up!"

"Yes m'lord!"

"Hey Eddie, do you KNOW this wizkid?"

Edmund waddled around to stare at Merlin. Merlin bowed. Edmund chuckled.

"Hi Merly", He said.

"You know I hate that..." Merlin glowered.

"Then you shouldn't be called Merlin", Edmund grinned.

"What's Muscles doing here?" Merlin whispered, gesturing to Gladius.

"He's our new bodyguard".

"HAH!"

"What?"

"Gladius...You should've asked for Cassius! He's a real swordfighter!"

"HEY!" said Gladius, "I am TOO a swordsman! A REAL one!"

"You got disarmed by your brother Triton! I saw it last month! He's a puny runt and he still got the better of you!"

Edmund sighed, "Merlin, why are you here?" he asked.

"Huh? Oh right...yeah...um..."
1411121122112.title: A bright blue flash! Boy Wizard, Merlin, appear...

choices: Crown Prince Cameron...sneaking down to the kitchens to gorge himself!
A thin, pale face with blond hair! It was horrifying!
14111211221122.content:
"What's wrong, Merlin?" Edmund asked. Merlin suddenly looked worried.

"It's Timmy..." Merlin whispered into Edmund's ear, so that Gladius couldn't hear.

Edmund frowned. "And?"

"..."

Merlin took a deep breath and slowly hissed three words: "...It didn't work..."

Edmund frowned.

"...He's very weak. He wants you..."

"You should've tested it first!"

"We DID! How was I to know...Oh come on!"

"Alright..."

Edmund started waddling towards the doors, but Merlin grabbed him by the hand and with a flick of his wand, both boys vanished!

Gladius stared in shock. What on EARTH was going on!?

Trying to ignore the fact that a 1,200 pound boy had just vanished in front of his eyes like a soap-bubble, the young buck stared around the room. As he expected, everything here was literally king-sized.

Feeling bored, he left the prince's bedroom and headed down a corridor towards a huge office on the right hand side. He knocked.

"Come in!"

Gladius opened the door and entered. Sitting behind an enormous and ornate antique desk in an equally enormous wrought iron chair with lots of padding and cushions on it, was King David. A huge fat arm rested on the desk while the other held a wax stamp. He splodged it down into a pool of blood-red wax on an envelope and handed it to a chubby younger man standing nearby.

"Cedric, see that goes off at once, won't you?"

"Yes your Majesty!" he said. He bowed, took the envelope and waddled out of the room.

"What can I do for you, young Master Gladius?" the king asked. "I trust that you're settling in? Finding your room sufficiently spacious?"

"Um...Yeah", said Gladius, "Yeah totally, um, very much so", he said.

"Good! Very good. And my sons? You're getting along well?"

"I, I really only met them today...but...Eddie...um...Prince Edmund...seems nice".

"Good! Very good! And what of the Crown Prince, Cameron?"

"Well I haven't had a chance yet to really speak to him...him always being hungry and all..."

The king let out a hearty laugh. "Yes! Yes he is that, he IS that! Aah. Such a good boy. You will take to them soon, I hope. Both of them. And be their friend and protector. That is what you are here for".

"Yes sir", said Gladius. "Um...I wanted to ask you about a room".

"Room? I know nearly every room in this palace. What room?"

"Uh, it's down in the servants quarters. You go down the last ramp, and you turn right, and it's these two big doors on your left..."

"Down...right...Oh! Hahaha. Yes that...that hasn't been used in a while. Inside there's fireplaces and benches and stuff..."

"Yeah that's it!"

"Yes! That's the old forge-room. We haven't used it in years! It was built specially for any Mountanian guests who might come to the palace, back when the palace was new. You're the first Mountanian to hold the post of Princely Bodyguard since your grandfather...so it hasn't been used since he became king, and goodness, that was so long ago. I suppose you want to use it?"

"Yeah!"

"Very well. Find some servants who aren't doing anything, and get them to help you clean it out. There's plenty of old scrap metal and whatnot lying around, which you can heat and beat and shape to make new things".

"Thanks!" said Gladius. "I didn't know Lord Merlin was a friend of your sons..."

"Aaah. His family goes back centuries!" said the king, "I think that lad is a friend with the children of every person worth knowing. Cheeky young rascal, but he has his uses...Well run along, Gladius".

Gladius bowed, and headed downstairs. He came prepared this time, and brought candles. He fitted them into the wall-sconces, lit them, and then started cleaning out the old forge himself. With all the rich, fattening food around here, he was going to need every last bit of exertion he could get if he expected to keep his perfect princely figure...

He swept, dusted, brushed, gathered, beat, blew, scrubbed, rubbed and shook until he'd gotten the place as clean as he could. Hanging on the walls were various antique tools. Tongs, clamps, hammers, punches...all of various sizes to accomplish various tasks. He polished and cleaned everything, and then went searching for stocks of charcoal, paper, rags and wood. He was at it all day, and by the time he'd done, the forge was back to being hot, smelly, steamy and warm, just like it used to be.

The first thing that Gladius had to do was make chains. He'd broken the original chain that hooked to the damper of the forge's chimney, and without a new one, he wouldn't be able to close the damper to stop wind and rain and other things coming down when he didn't want it to. He spent most of his time breaking up the old links and began forging new ones, beating, hammering, shaping and warping.

As he worked, he wondered what it'd be like if he saw Cameron or Edmund trying to do this! It was so funny that he laughed, lost concentration, and nearly burnt his arm on the anvil!

After several hours of pounding, hammering and quenching, most of the chain was finished. He'd do the rest the next day. Right now, he had to get to bed.

Gladius blew out the candles, picked up a five-socket candelabrum, and started upstairs.

It was very late. By now, the palace was dark and cold. Most of the candles had been blown out and fires left to die in their grates. Gladius shivered. He wrapped his cloak around him tighter. Bloody hell it was cold!

He kept moving, from one room the other. Everything was so weird this late at night!

He entered the enormous East Drawing Room and stared around. There were tables, chairs and all manner of things everywhere. At the far end was a huge fireplace that towered nine feet up! Gladius approached it and whistled. He looked at the large, low tables near the fireplace, and picked up a handsome, gold-framed hand-mirror. He held it up to his face and smiled at himself.

Fuck, he was a haaaaaaandsome son of a bitch...

As Gladius stood there making faces, stroking his hair and wondering how he could possibly be any more gorgeous, he didn't notice the doors behind him swing open.

But then, he saw something. It was in the mirror! He opened his mouth in shock! It was...
14111211221122.title: Merlin whispered in Edmund's ear. "It...

choices: Gladius looks terrible. Cameron and Edmund ask what's wrong.
Gladius has to help the princes with their water-therapy.
141112112211222.content:
Gladius had a sharp intake of breath! In the mirror, he saw something! He could count one...two...three...four...five candles...and...six! Another one! And behind the last candle was...

It was thin, very thin, and pale, and sickly-looking. And with light blond hair. And cold blue eyes! If this was Merlin's idea of a joke, it was a very bad one. But Gladius knew at once that it wasn't Merlin! Merlin never showed up anywhere unless he was either summoned, or came for some important reason.

Gladius whirled around! He put down the mirror and rushed to the door! There was no-one there. He peeked out into the corridor and looked left. Then right. He saw it! The face illuminated by the candle!

"Hey!" he called out. Quick as a flash, the face was gone! Gladius sprinted down the corridor, leaving five whispy smoke-trails behind him! Although Gladius could run like a cheetah, he couldn't catch the face, who was always just out of reach!

Was this old palace HAUNTED? It probably could be, it was centuries old, but then, stranger things had happened!

After running around the whole palace, Gladius was exhausted! He would have to go back to his room and sleep. Plus, he was probably waking everyone up! As he headed back down a corridor to the royal sleeping quarters, he didn't notice a hovering candle slink off down another passageway and out of sight...

The next day...
141112112211222.title: A thin, pale face with blond hair! It was horri...

1411121122112221.content:
Jeremy and Ryan knelt by the enormous chaise longes which sat...or...lay rather, next to the enormous royal dining-table. They were busy massaging their respective master's groaning bellies as their fellow princely servant-boys, Samson and Ethan, fed the princes massive bowls of porridge with sugar, cream and honey mixed into them.

"Hurrrgghmmm..." Cameron groaned, stretching out on his seat, as if eating was such an extremely strenuous activity. He glanced across the table and looked around. At one end at an enormous throne was their father, King David, who was chomping down on sausages and eggs. At the other end, their mother nibbled daintily on exquisite-looking pastries.

Gladius poked moodily at his breakfast.

"What's wrong, Prince Gladius?" Cameron asked.

"Now son", said David, "We expect you to be friends with him. Call him by his name!"

"Yes father...Gladius! What's wrong?"

Gladius had poked his sausages so many times that they fell apart on his fork when he finally tried to pick them up!

"Hmmm...Huh!? Oh...um...uh...hmmm..."

"You look terrible!" said Edmund, looking at Gladius's grimy eyes, messy hair and groggy expression. "Did you stay up ALL night?"

"Huhwwwuuuuh?" Gladius gasped, jerking upwards. "What? No! I...I...I got to bed...about..."

"About when, dawn?" Cameron asked. Edmund giggled. Queen Isobel shushed him.

"Is this palace haunted?" Gladius asked.

"Awww, a big Mountain muscle-boy scardededed of a few widdul goasties..."

"SHUT UP!"

Cameron laughed and his belly heaved and jiggled.

"Now sons", said David. "What did you see last night, Gladius?"

"I...I dunno, I saw this...boy in white wandering around the corridors..."

"Probably one of the servants", the king said, "They sometimes like to wander around at night when it's not so noisy".

"No it wasn't a servant", said Gladius, "He was really skinny!"

"Skinny?" Edmund asked, "...What's...'skinny'?"

"Bony! Thin! Emaciated!" Gladius said.

"Oh!...Um...yeah...Never seen that around the palace...You Cam?"

Cameron shook his head, "Nope!"

"It was...it was one of the servants", said Queen Isobel, "I'm sure it was!"

Gladius nodded. He wasn't convinced. No royal servants that he'd seen were THAT skinny! Most of them were fat and round, or at least chubby. Some were thin, but what he'd seen last night was beyond thin! It was almost skeletal!

"Gladius, you have to follow us today", Edmund said.

"Follow you...Oh...Yeah...why?"

"Because it's your job", Cameron said.

"No! I mean where are you going?"

"Into town", said Edmund, "And we're doing shopping and visiting and stuff...you have to come with us".

Gladius looked at King David, who was wiping his mouth with an enormous napkin.

"Your father sent you here to learn proper royal decorum and protocol", King David said. "And in return, you hold the station of Bodyguard to the Royal Princes. It is your duty to follow them and see that no harm shall befall them, whenever they go out, and whenever they are at home, amongst crowds".

Gladius nodded, "Yes sir", he said.

14111211221122211.content:
Gladius got ready to go out. He brushed his hair, put on his tunic, his chainmail, his amour-plates, his sandals and weapons. He had his swords and knives and other assorted bits and pieces strapped, buckled and tied onto the various parts of his body. He stared at himself in the mirror and smiled.

Slowly, he clanked out into the corridor. As he headed past Edmund's bedroom, he heard voices.

"...But what if..."
"Don't worry! It won't happen!"
"Yes but...you know what..."
"He's perfectly safe! Nobody's going to..."
"Yes but...I mean he's so..."
"Relax, brother! Nothing bad's going to happen!"

The doors swung open.

"Hey meatballs! You ready to get going, or what?"

The two princes jumped and waddled around.

"Yeah!" said Cameron, "I was just um...Telling Edmund that he shouldn't worry...about you!"

"About ME?"

"He was scared that you might get hurt when we go out today".

Gladius laughed. "Yeah, like that's gonna happen".

Jeremy and Ryan followed their masters out of their rooms and led them towards the huge carriage parked out front. They helped their bloated bodies into the seats and then gestured for Gladius to join them, before they too climbed in and closed the doors.

Gladius watched as the carriage's motions caused Cameron and his younger brother Edmund to jiggle and wobble. Their bellies sloshed and bounced, slapping against each other and their boobs jiggled and quivered with each rotation of the wheels. It was mesmerising!

When the carriage reached the city, people swarmed around, reaching in and shaking hands and squeezing soft royal blubber. The princes waved and smiled. But Gladius was not in the mood for showing off.

He was too busy thinking about...that face. That body. That BOY that he'd seen in the night!

Who the hell WAS he!? He was sure something was up...but he couldn't figure it out!

"Hey Gladius, is everything okay?"

Gladius jerked awake! Cameron was staring at him, looking nervous.

"You look kinda weird".

"I'm...I'm fine", said Gladius, "Where are we going?"

141112112211222112.content:
"There", Cameron pointed.

He pointed down a long road that led, in the distance, to a huge gate in the old city walls. Beyond the gate was the River Skripp, the main river that flowed down from the Mountanian Alps, several hundred miles to the north. Beyond the gate was a large wood-and-stone drawbridge. Away from the city, along a road and up a low, sloping hill was a huge stone structure with massive walls that towered several feet into the air. The main entrance to the compound beyond was a huge pair of wooden doors which were open. The carriage rumbled up the driveway towards the gates. As they got closer and closer, Gladius could see a huge, carved stone sign above the doorway.

"The Royal Regis Home for Destitute Children"


The carriage rumbled under the doorway and into the grounds of the home.

The moment the carriage stopped, children, boys and girls, rushed out of the front doors and fought to open the carriage doors to help its occupants out! Gladius climbed out after the princes and Edmund introduced him as Prince Gladius of Mountania, their new 'companion'...he didn't want to say 'bodyguard', in case the children got scared!

The boys and girls almost dragged the princes inside. Gladius slowly took in the grandeur of the children's home. In the huge foyer there was a massive statue cast of brass. It depicted a figure sitting on a throne. The figure was that of a boy. An extremely fat, round-faced boy with a comely, friendly, inviting and cheerful face, with neat hair and eyes with...

"...are those REAL sapphires?" Gladius whispered. Edmund nodded.

The very fat boy sitting on the throne had a happy-looking smile on his chubby face and his hands rested comfortably on his throne. At his feet was a large, shiny copper cauldron. Gladius glanced in to see it was full of coins. A plaque next to the cauldron read:

"All Donations Go Towards the Improvement of the Lives of All who Enter our Doors"


The two princes waddled heavily up to the cauldron and tipped pouches of gold coins into it. They stared up at the boy sitting on the throne and, to Gladius's surprise, they bowed!

When they finally waddled away, Gladius stepped forward and noticed a large brass plaque riveted to the base of the statue:

"This Statue is Erected By the Children of this Institution in Memory of
His Royal Highness, the Prince Tristan.
Patron and Founder"


Gladius also tossed some coins into the cauldron at the prince's feet.

"We come here once a month to visit the children and give donations and alms", Cameron explained. "This is the local children's home. It was set up by the prince over a hundred years ago and it takes in all the really poor children".

He gestured towards the various boys and girls who were all looking at them.

"Those that don't have homes, or families, or who live in the streets. The home looks after them".

Gladius stared at all the children. They certainly appeared to be well looked-after! Apart from two or three, most of them were chubby or pleasantly plump in size, cheerful and happy. Most of them looked very young. The youngest was probably two or three years old. The older ones were probably around sixteen. They all bowed to the three princes as they passed by, meeting and greeting.

None of the children here looked anything like the skeletal form that Gladius had seen during his night-time walk around the palace, though! This was getting scary...It was as if the figure he'd seen was something in his imagination! Something that just didn't exist in this land of fat, happy people...

Gladius met the home's cook, doctor, nurse, wetnurse, and a fat, balding man with a kindly disposition, whom the princes introduced as Abbot Mortimer, the head of the Children's Home. The abbot led Gladius all over the vast complex, explaining the Home's mission and purpose.

When they reassembled in the foyer, Cameron and Edmund reached up to the statue of Prince Tristan and their chubby hands rubbed against his round, exposed belly, which, Gladius noticed, was considerably shinier than the rest of the statue!

"It's a tradition to rub Tristan's belly to bring good luck", Edmund explained.

1411121122112221122.content:
King David sucked down a drumstick and spat out the bone. It hit the bone-bucket next to his throne with a 'ping!' It was quickly followed by lashings of mashed potatoes drenched in gravy, and peas and carrots and fat, chunky potato-chips.

He stared at Gladius, who was sawing away at his steak, chips and salad.

"So young Gladius", the king said. "How are you enjoying yourself? I'm sure you're finding my court very much different from that of your father's, or grandfather's, hmm?"

"Yes sir", said Gladius.

The king chuckled. "Don't need to be so formal, my lad! 'Uncle David' will do fine".

"Yes s--Uncle David".

"Good! Everything comfortable here at the palace?"

"Yes s-Uncle David".

"Good, good. And my sons aren't being TOO much of a handful?"

Edmund and Cameron pretended to look offended! The king laughed.

The king reached into a pocket of his massive robes and pulled out a long chain with lots of keys on the end of it.

"Gladius, this is for you. It is a set of the master-keys to the palace".

"Woah, thanks!"

"I expect you to use these with care, and not to lose them, or abuse them".

"Uh, yeah! Thanks...wow!"

"Also, I have a duty which I want you to perform for me".

"Every night after lights out, you're to ensure the security of the perimeter".

"I'm supposed to do what?"

"Walk around and lock all the windows and doors", Edmund explained.

"You can do that, can't you?" King David asked.

"Huh? Oh, yeah, yeah, absolutely! And I'll pound the life out of any pesky trespassers, too!" said Gladius, showing off his arms and chest. The queen giggled.

"Aah, and here's dessert!" said the king. Edmund and Cameron fidgeted as servant-boys laid huge chocolate mud-cakes in front of their bellies...

14111211221122211221.content:
After dinner, Gladius helped the princes back to their rooms. At first he really hated the idea of having to babysit the princes, but he soon realised that it was their servants who did most of the work...and gladly! All Gladius had to do was follow them around. And there was something strangely attractive about the princes. Not that Gladius was homosexual, or anything...but perhaps because they were so fat, and immense and blubbery and beefy and heavy, and because nothing like that existed in Mountania...he found them curious and wanted to know more?

Whatever it was, Gladius started liking the princes more and more. They did have some really excellent qualities. They were friendly and cheerful, always happy, polite, kind to everyone...and were always delighted whenever Gladius teased them about how huge they were...which they seemed to enjoy!

The clock in the drawing room struck eleven-thirty and the prince of purity began wandering around, locking everything up. He bolted shutters, checked doors, turned keys, locked gates and turned down lamps and blew out candles where-ever he found them still burning.

He headed downstairs and began checking that everything was safe and secure. The store-rooms were secure, the candles were doused...If Gladius had realised how big the palace was, he might not have agreed to this job! But at least he got a good walk and got the privilege of seeing the palace at night, when it was quiet, dark and peaceful.

Gladius headed back upstairs and crossed the foyer. In the middle was the towering magical fountain that burbled ice-cold lemonade. The prince picked up one of the magical goblets that stood around the edge of the fountain and gulped down a few good mouthfuls. The cold, sweet, fizzy drink rushed down inside him and made him feel all tingly and cool. Just what he needed!

The young Mountain prince took another long pull of lemonade before he decided that his thirst was sufficiently quenched. He gasped, lowered the goblet down and then yawned and stretched. He stared slowly around. One corridor led to the offices...another led to the bedrooms...another led to the state reception-rooms...there was a lot of passages that Gladius would have to get used to around here!

Gee, everything looked kinda spooky...

Gladius raised his candelabrum and stared around. Then he stopped. At the end of a corridor, he was sure he could see a figure...a face! A face illuminated by a single candle!

"Hey you!" Gladius shouted!

The face vanished! Gladius took off down the corridor, chasing after the light!

"Hey come back here!" Gladius shouted. He reached the end of the corridor and saw the light halfway down another corridor. He jogged after it, but again, was just too slow to catch it! He skidded around a corner and stopped...it was a dead end! There was just a pair of double doors at the end of this corridor...

"Alright you..." said Gladius. He raised his light and pulled out his sword...a birthday present from his father...and advanced on the door.

Gladius stood in front of the door, shifting his weight from one foot to the other...and back again...then he threw himself against the doors!

Gladius didn't look like it, perhaps, but he was a solidly built boy with a bit of weight behind him, mostly from muscles. He smashed himself against the door until he managed to crack the bolt and throw the doors open!

"Alright you little scamp..." Gladius rumbled. He put down his candelabrum and entered the room, sword drawn. He stopped.

The room was surprisingly large. Not enormous, but still sizable. There was a bed, a chest of drawers, a closet, table, chairs, a desk and a few other things. Candles burned on the desk, the bedside tables and the main table in the middle of the room, so it was actually pretty bright. Gladius pushed the doors shut and started looking around the room.

"C'mon you little rat! Runnin' around the palace at night like a RAT! Where are yah!?"

He pulled open the closet and...there was...nothing there.

He opened another door that revealed a surprisingly comfortable-looking bathroom with a large, wall-sized mirror. Gladius stared at his reflection for a bit, then turned back towards the room. Slowly, he squatted down and peeked under the bed.

"Aaaah...GOTCHA!"

Gladius reached in with one hand, grabbed at something under the bed, hauled it out and threw it down roughly onto the mattress, he swung his sword down, stopping it barely an inch from the figure's neck!

It was him! It was the boy! He caught him at last! He found him!

The boy had thin blond hair, flaxen-coloured, and pale skin and cold blue eyes. He was incredibly thin! He had no fat on his body at all! His arms, legs, ribs, collarbone, cheekbones...everything were clearly defined!

"I...Who are you!?" Gladius shouted!

Without any warning, the boy suddenly burst into tears! He sniffled and wailed and cried!

"No! No don't hurt me! No! No! Leave me alone!!" the boy tried pathetically to wriggle away from Gladius's iron grip! He kicked and cried and sobbed. Gladius dropped his sword with a loud 'clang!'

"Woah, woah!" said Gladius. He might act tough, but he wasn't mean! "Hey! Calm down, buddy...w-what's wrong? Who are you?"

The boy sniffled, stared at the young Mountain teen who towered over him and went back to crying! He rolled over, buried his face in his bed and sobbed, trying to pretend that the big scary boy wasn't there anymore!

Slowly, Gladius sat down on the bed, and took a deep, slow breath.

"What's your name?" Gladius asked.

"Mmm-mmm-mee!" the boy mumbled through his pillow.

"What!?"

"Mmmmff-mmmthmmee!"

"Eh..."

"It's..." the boy sniffled, "It's Timothy", he gulped. He sniffed again. "Prince Timothy".

Gladius frowned. Then he started laughing!

"Don't laugh!" the boy sobbed. "It's not funny!"

"You're PRINCE Timothy?" Gladius asked. "As in Prince Timothy. As in His Royal Puny-ness, the Prince Timothy Regis?"

"YES!" the boy squeaked with surprising volume!

"I'm sorry..." said Gladius, "Man you're so SMALL!"

Gladius got up and slowly, Timothy got to his feet. Gladius was amazed! The boy was probably about nine or ten years old, and about five feet tall, if that. And probably about fifty pounds with a full suit of clothes! He was absolutely miniscule!

"Waaait a minute..." said Gladius, "If you're a royal PRINCE, then how come you're so small? Aren't Prince Cameron and Prince Edmund your brothers?"

Timothy nodded.

"They're HUGE! How can you be so puny?"

"I was born very weak and small...the doctor said he didn't think I would survive. I've always been so weak and feeble that I was kept away from everyone so I wouldn't get hurt or scare anyone because I was so skinny and small..."

"That's terrible!...But why don't you just eat?"

"I can't! I get horrible sick if I do! I just start having tummyaches and I throw up and and I..."

"Yeah..." said Gladius. "...can't the doctor do something?"

"Merlin's trying, but it's taking a long time..."

"Huh...I'm Prince Gladius, by the way. I'm from Mountania".

"I guessed", said Timothy, looking up at him. "You must be the new bodyguard for my brothers!"

"And you!"

"Me?"

"I'm the PRINCE'S BODYGUARD. You're a prince, ain'tcha?"

"...I...I think so..."

"Then that includes you".

Timothy stared at Gladius's sword which was still lying on the floor. Gladius stood up, holding up his hands.

"Hey, look. No swords okay? No knives, no daggers, no dirks, no nothing! I am NOT gonna hurt yah! Here, look..."

Gladius pulled his shirtfront open to reveal a shining gold medallion.

"See? This is my coat of arms. See? This is my name. 'Gladius Van Draconis'. I'm a prince of the Mountanian royal family and I'm here as the princely bodyguard. And that includes you".

Timothy nodded. He shifted a little closer to Gladius.

"You not gonna hurt me?"

"'Course not! 'Sides. You're tiny! Your brothers on the other hand..."

As if on-cue, Timothy perked up. He could hear heavy footsteps outside! Gladius snatched up his sword and stepped back. The doors swung open!

"H-h-hey T-Timothy", a voice panted. It sounded heavy and fat. Gladius watched as an enormously obese boy, so fat he could barely waddle, wheezed and sweated his way into the room. The tremendous lardo waddled ponderously around, pushed the doors shut with the sheer size of his bulging abdomen, and collapsed onto the bed, groaning with exhaustion.

"I...I thought I'd...c-come and...and see...see how you...Hey!"

The prince jerked upwards...or tried to...when he saw Gladius peeking out from the bathroom. Gladius shuffled into the room.

"Hello Prince..."

1411121122112221122122.content:
The doors swung open and something heavy and fat waddled inside, leaning heavily on his walking stick. Prince Edmund waddled slowly into the room and sank onto his brother's bed. Timothy smiled and hugged him and gave him a kiss.

"Hi Eddie..."

Edmund smiled. "Are you feeling okay?"

Timmy shrugged. Edmund smiled. He let his brother play with his body, the closest thing he was likely to get, at this point in time, to being fat and happy himself. Edmund looked up to see Gladius standing behind the door!

"Hi Edmund", said Gladius, "I found out about Timmy...I...I was wandering around the palace locking things up and I kinda stumbled across this place..."

Edmund nodded. Gladius was surprised that Edmund wasn't more angry! Perhaps he figured that Gladius would find out about Timmy sooner or later, anyway, whether or not he tried to keep him hidden?

He waved Gladius over with a huge arm and hand. Gladius strolled up.

"You must never mention Timmy to anyone", Edmund explained. "He's very weak and very sick. He doesn't like big crowds of people and he doesn't like people staring at him. We keep him here where he can be safe. Until he's gained some weight and got some sort of strength in him, he has to stay out of sight".

"Why's that?" Gladius asked. Edmund stared at Gladius as if the answer were obvious!

"Gladius, the people expect the king and queen to be able to father and mother fat, hefty, healthy, heavy, chunky boys! Children of substance and size! Children of mass and weight and bulk! It's their assurance from our parents that the prosperity of the kingdom will continue to thrive! It's like how in Mountania, they expect you to be big, strong boys, to prove you've got the strength and authority to rule the kingdom and protect the people. It's the same thing over here".

"Uh-huh..." Gladius said.

"If they all saw Timothy and how runty he is...sorry Timmy..." Edmund added, hugging his little brother, "...then they'd all lose faith in us! They'd think that the prosperity of the kingdom will suffer, and that would cause horrible things to happen, like riots and such..."

Gladius nodded.

"You can visit Timmy if you like, but don't mention him to anyone".

Gladius nodded.

"Sure Eddie", he said.

Their conversation was interrupted by a rattling sound! The three boys looked up. Hobbling towards them was a thin boy with brown hair and simple, white servants' robes. In one hand, he carried a tray with a single hooped handle over the middle. In the other hand, he grasped a simple wooden crutch. He hobbled along, hopping, pausing, hopping, pausing, hopping, pausing and hopping again. The tray rattled with every half-step.

Prince Edmund was a kind, loving, gentle and caring boy who would never mistreat his servants, but he did not so much as lift a finger to help the lad. Mostly because as a prince, he wasn't expected to, and because his great bulk, nearly a thousand pounds in weight, meant that it was just impractical for him to even try! He was there to be served and waited upon, not to serve and wait on others!

"Hey!" said Gladius. He hurried towards the boy who whimpered! He tried to step backwards!

"Gladius! Don'..." Edmund began. But the boy stumbled over backwards! The tray dropped from his hand! Quick as a flash, Gladius grabbed it before it hit the ground!

Gladius towered over the boy! The boy looked terrified!

"Leave him alone!" Edmund shouted. Gladius stepped back and slowly put the tray and its contents onto a side-table. The boy scrambled to his feet again and got up.

Or rather, scrambled to his foot.

Gladius now saw, in the brightness of the room, that the boy had only one leg! His left leg was gone from the knee down! He hobbled in, leaning heavily on an old crutch that looked about ready to break under his minuscule frame! The boy did a sort of stiff, from-the-neck bow.

"I beg of th'pardon, m'lord Edmund, sir, for..."

Edmund held up a hand to silence the boy. "That's enough. It's alright...Go on, sit down..."

"But..."

"SIT...down..."

The boy sat down on the nearest chair at once! He stared nervously at Gladius.

"Hucky, this is Prince Gladius of Mountania...No! Don't get up, just sit...Gladius, this is Huckleberry. He's Timothy's servant-boy".

Gladius stared at Huckleberry. The boy was TINY! He was probably smaller than Timothy! And even that was an impressive feat! He stared at the boy's missing leg.

"Huckleberry had an accident when he was younger", Edmund explained. "He was run over by a horse and plow on his father's farm. The blades sliced his left leg clean off. He wasn't able to do the heavy manual labor in the fields anymore, so my father allowed him to become a house-servant instead".

Huckleberry nodded sadly.

"He does only very light work", Edmund explained. "He delivers letters, he passes messages...he does a few deliveries of food and such..."

Gladius stared at Huckleberry. The boy was so small and weak and hopelessly defenseless! He looked like an innocent little baby. Just like Timothy, he seemed to be terrified of everything around him.

"Don't be scared, Huck", Edmund said, soothingly, "Gladius here isn't going to hurt you. He's a nice Mountain boy, right Gladius?"

"Huh!? Oh yeah..." said Gladius, "Yeah! Absolutely, yeah...um...yeah..."

He kept staring at the stump on Huckleberry's left leg.

"Don'tcha have a wooden leg or something?"

Huckleberry shook his head.

"Damn!...Hell, I'll make you one!"

Huckleberry's eyes widened!

"See, Huck?" Timmy said, "He's not that scary!"

Huckleberry nodded.

14111211221122211221222.content:
"Eddie, I'm getting tired", Timothy said. Eddie nodded. He gave his brother one last, bone-crushing squeeze, Timothy gave Eddie one last affectionate snuggle, and then Timothy crawled under his bedsheets. Eddie leaned on his walking-stick and with a mighty grunt, hoisted his 900-pound bulk into a vaguely standing position. Gladius got up to help him, but Eddie waved him off. Gladius stared at Huckleberry, who hobbled into what looked like a servant's bedroom, next door to Timothy's small, hidden suite. Panting heavily, Eddie began the long, slow process of movement. Every step seemed to tax him as if he'd run a thousand miles! He leaned excessively on his stout walking-stick, and shuffled along. Eddie wasn't sure how his father managed to move like this! The king had once told him something about "letting the weight do the walking", but he wasn't quite sure what that meant.

"Man, Timmy is sad", said Gladius. He was walking at barely a snail's pace, with Edmund wheezing and sweating behind him, pausing to lean against the wall every few feet.

"H-he-he's got a...a -a-a very rare c-condition w-which means his body r-rejects f-food..."

"But he must eat SOMETHING! Or he'd drop dead by now!"

"H-h-he can eat..." Edmund gasped as if he'd just come up for air! "...t-toast and b-butter and w-water...But even then he ca-can't ha-have too much o-or else..."

Edmund stopped to catch his breath again, "Or else he gets real sick!" he spluttered out!

"Sick?"

"BAD SICK!" Edmund gasped. "He throws up and..and everything! You don't w-w-wanna see it...It's bad! Merlin and his great-grandfather, Draxon...they're tr-trying t-to make somet-somethin' that means Timmy can keep his food down and eat properly, but...s-so far nothin's happenin'..."

Gladius stared at Edmund. The boy was so grossly overweight that he could BARELY waddle! His older brother Cameron had to be at least a hundred pounds fatter, but he never seemed to have these issues! Gladius frowned. He supposed that Cameron was used to lugging his fat ass around. Edmund on the other hand, as the second son to the king, and without as many royal duties, probably spent most of his time on his fat, royal ass, being fed by servants who fawned over their master.

"What about Huckleberry?" Gladius asked.

"Huck's a wonderful guy", Eddie said. "You should make friends with him. None of the servants care and he really could do with a friend...I mean the closest friends he really has are me and my brothers. I know it's weird that we made friends with a servant-boy with one leg, but...Hey, we're that kinda people. Especially Timmy. He knows what it's like to be different and left out, so they make really good friends. But just so you know, Huckle scares really easily, so don't do none of your strongman stuff around him, or he might never speak to you again".

Gladius nodded. "Do you think Timmy will ever be cured?"

"I hope so", Eddie says. "Everyone knows his story, but we don't allow people to see him. And Timmy hates that kind of stuff, anyway. He refuses to go out, and honestly, I don't blame him...but he's really nice...You've got a brother don't you?"

"Two", Gladius said. "Like you I'm the middle boy. There's Cassius and then there's Triton, who's Timmy's age..."

"I bet Cassius is bigger and stronger and everything, than you are, huh?" Eddie asked. Gladius grudgingly confirmed all those points. Edmund nodded. "Yeah. Cam's always been bigger and fatter, heavier, hungrier than I was...But then I don't care. He can have the throne! All I want is the food..."

Gladius laughed. It was nice that these two brothers didn't have the super-fierce sibling rivalry that he had with Cassius. It made for a more peaceful household...

141112112211222112212222.content:
"Gladius, do you want some more?"

"I'm good, thanks".

"It's strawberry shortcake!"

"Really! I...I gotta watch my figure..."

"Me too! BELCH!...I want some!"

"NOT for you, Cameron!" Queen Isobel said sternly. "You've already had four helpings!"

"Five!" Edmund retorted, "He stole my slice when I was in the bathroom!"

"Oh yeah..." said Cameron. He smirked triumphantly at his little brother. "Now your shortcake's gonna make me all fat and squishy!"

He stuck out his tongue at his brother, who glared back at him.

"Boys!" King David said. "Enough!"

"Alright", said Gladius, "I'll have a little slice", he said.

The Queen picked up the knife and made what she considered to be a "little" slice. Gladius stared at it in alarm!

"Woah! No no no! Half of that! I'm not that hungry!" he said. The queen smiled, and sliced the slice in half again. She balanced the new slice on the knife and dropped it onto Gladius's dessert-plate. Gladius started chomping on the soft, crumbly, sweet, strawberry-flavoured cake.

"Mmmm!...Oh wow this is good...O this can't be safe for my body...I'm gonna get FAT here..."

"That is kind of the point..." Edmund said. The king laughed! Nobody noticed that Cameron was now sneaking the leftover slice of cake for himself...

CRACK!!

Everyone jumped! Cameron choked and his servant punched him in the back to clear his throat!

"Ow! Th-thanks!" Cameron gasped, swallowing his cake. A short, blond boy bowed to the royal table.

"Ah, Master Merlin!" the king said, "Sit down!"

"Thank you, your Majesty", Merlin said. "But I haven't come for dessert. I came to deliver this!"

He held up a bottle in his right hand. He shook it slightly. Gladius leaned in his chair, and saw that the contents were fizzling a bit.

"It is our latest serum for Master Timothy".

Suddenly, the Queen's face was full of sadness. She held her hands to her chubby cheeks and sniffled.

"It's alright, my dear", said King David. "Bring Timothy here, Merlin, and we'll see what happens".

Merlin put the bottle on the table, and disappeared. Cameron picked up the bottle...

"Put it down, boy!" David snapped. "That's for your brother's life, not your appetite!"

Cameron jumped and almost dropped the bottle! Another earsplitting 'CRACK!' and Merlin returned with the skeletal, shivering, shaking form of the Prince Timothy. He shuddered forwards, and his older brother Cameron grabbed his arm to stop him falling over!

"Timothy..." the king said. Timothy blinked. The candles and oil lamps made the room so bright!

"Y-yes father!" Timothy said very quietly.

"Timothy, we've got a new serum for you", Merlin said kindly, holding up the bottle. "I want you to drink this".

Gladius stared at Timothy. Somehow, he knew that the young prince had gone through ordeals like this before...and before...and before...and before.

Timothy stared skeptically at Merlin.

"It'll work! I promise!"

"You said that last time!"

"Hey! Third time lucky..."

"This is the seventh!"

"...Oh...Um..."

"The first time I threw up, the second time I got dizzy, the third time, I fainted, the fourth time I had...I won't mention what I had, the fifth time, I dry-retched, the sixth time I a stomach-ache for a week!"

"But this one's different!" Merlin insisted, shaking the bottle, "Try it!"

"Oh they're all different!" Timothy grumbled, for the first time, showing something akin to a temper!

"Timothy!" the king scolded. "I know how you feel, and..."

"No you don't, father!" Timothy grumbled. He tried to walk away, but Cameron grabbed him. Timothy could not hope to fight against his brother's great bulk, so he stood where he was.

"Listen Timmy, we all feel sorry for y--"

"OH! So I'm supposed to be..."

The queen burst into tears! Timothy gulped.

"I...I'm sorry mother! It's just that...it...NOTHING EVER WORKS!"

"SON!" David barked. "Merlin and his family have been trying for YEARS! Don't you DARE take that tone with us while Merlin is present in this room!"

"But..."

Merlin grabbed Timothy and stared at him.

"Listen Timmy, I know it's hard, but this might finally be the one! You might finally be able to eat properly and hold down food and finally put on some weight! Goodness knows it's time enough for that to happen! Now come on..."

Timothy groaned. He stared at the bottle and picked it up.

"That's right", said Merlin. "Open it, and drink everything".

Timothy popped the cork off the suspicious, green bottle and sniffed the mouth. He frowned, and then gulped down the contents. He made a face! It certainly didn't taste anywhere near as good as the last few, despite their failures!

"Sit down, Timothy", King David said, kindly. Timothy slowly sat down. He gulped down the serum as fast as he could, and then shakily put down the bottle. He took a deep breath...

"How do you feel?" Merlin asked anxiously.

Timothy seemed to be hyperventilating, taking fast, deep, and fast, light breaths, alternating between the two. Suddenly...

BEEEERRRRLLLLCCCHHH!!

Cameron, Edmund, Gladius and Merlin burst out laughing!

"How do you feel, my sweet one?" Queen Isobel asked.

"I...I feel much better now, mother..." Timothy said, weakly, "I...I don't feel queasy and sick anymore...I...I feel hungry!"

The king let out a tiny smile.

"Hungry, hmm?"

Cameron pushed what remained of the strawberry shortcake towards his littlest brother.

"Go on, Timmy, try some", he offered. He cut a large slice and plopped it into a bowl and gave his brother a spoon. Everyone watched as Timmy ate.

First one mouthful, then two mouthfuls, three, four, five...

"He seems good!" said Gladius.

"Not yet, he doesn't", Merlin warned. "Whether or not he can EAT is one thing. It's whether or not he throws up..."

Everyone watched. Timothy suddenly looked different! His face and mouth contorted slightly...and...

Burp!

"Hey! He kept it down!" said Cameron. He gave his brother Edmund a high-five. Edmund grinned!

Timothy stared at his family, and made a cautious smile.

"Well done, Merlin!" the king said. "Boy!"

A servant-boy rushed to the king's side.

"Find the chef and tell him to prepare a private feast for the Prince Timothy in the small West Dining Room. Merlin, you better go with him, and monitor him to see how he eats".

Merlin nodded. "Alright, Uncle David", he said. "Come on, Timmy!"

1411121122112221122122222.content:
"Come on Marilyn, let's go fatten this piggy for market!" said Gladius. He'd never experienced a royal feeding before, and he reckoned this was going to be fun!

"Oh hah-hah-hah, Gladius. It's MERLIN".

"Yeah, that's what I said! Marilyn!"

"I..." Merlin just sighed, "Come on!"

The two princes and their magical friend headed towards a smallish dining-room that Gladius had not seen before. It was tiny compared to the main, North Dining Hall, but no less grand for its size.

Inside was a large table. Loaded on the table was an obscene amount of food! Chickens, beef, sausages, pies, pizza, cake, pasta, cookies, bottles of wine, bottles of beer...

Timothy clutched his bony midriff when he saw the mountain of food!

"What's wrong, Timmy?" Merlin asked, "You're not feeling sick, are you?"

"I...I hope not!" Timmy gasped. "There's so much FOOD here!"

"It's all for you!" Merlin said, cheerfully.

"For me..." Timothy whispered. Such a thing had never happened before! He sat down at the head of the table. A dozen servant-boys, six on either side, lined the table, waiting for the prince to start eating. Gladius stood behind the prince, with Merlin standing next to him.

"You think this'll work?" Gladius whispered to Merlin.
"It damn well better", Merlin mumbled. "I think he's almost given up hope. I think we all have..."

One of the servant-boys stepped forward and bowed. He began holding a whispered conversation with Timothy. Judging by the way he was pointing and waving his arms, the boy was explaining what was on the table for the prince to eat. Timothy whispered something back to the boy, and soon, a whole assortment of food was being brought before him! The prince nibbled delicately at pizza, pies, rolls, buns, sausages and all kinds of things.

The prince ate slowly at first, picking, slicing, chewing, poking and sniffing. He seemed to take ages! The twelve servant-boys were not used to feasting at this pace! They were used to moving around and keeping the plates and bowls coming. But Timothy's brothers wolfed down their food with complete royal greed and gluttony, completely unlike the slow, dedicated pace which Timothy ate with. The boys were getting tired from standing, but they weren't allowed to leave without Timothy's permission.

Reading their body-language, Timothy guessed that something was up, and sent away all but two servant-boys, who remained to help serve him and clean him when he made a mess.

One of the servants was just explaining how to eat oysters, when the doors swung open. Crown Prince Cameron lumbered into the room, like a starving whale, his great belly gurgling in hunger when it sighted the mountain of food which laid untouched.

"How's it going, bro?" he asked, watching Timothy eagerly slurp down another cold, slippery, slightly salty oyster.

"Mmm!" Timothy said, "Wonderful! It's all so fantastic!" he added, reaching for yet another oyster. He stared at his oldest brother, "Cammy, I can't possibly finish everything. Do you want something to eat after dinner?"

The crown prince nodded.

"You know, that would be great", he said.

The two servant-boys set up another place at the table and pulled up an extra large chair. The Crown Prince sat down and began eating.

After another hour or so, Timothy gasped and pushed his chair back from the table.

"Oh gosh!" he gasped. "I don't feel so good..."

"What's wrong?" Merlin asked.

"I...I feel so heavy and full and my belly feels so tight and painful! Ooooh..."

"Welcome to your first bellyache, Timmy", Cameron said, smirking. "You're officially a prince!"

Timothy belched. "I-i hope so!" he gasped. "Ooooh..."

"Huckle, more sausages, please!"

"Yes my lord!"

The four princes sat in Prince Cameron's private dining-room. They were having breakfast.

Huckleberry limped over to the sideboard, his every second step being a soft 'clunk!'

Gladius leaned back to stare at Huckleberry. He'd measured the boy's other leg, and crafted a spring-loaded prosthetic to fix onto his stump-leg on the left. Breakfast was almost over anyway...

"ME?"

"Dear Gladius, hope you're well and that everything is above board...Timothy feeling better, nice to see that...yadda yadda yadda...WHAT!?"

King Hercules entered his son's office.

The old king chuckled. "I'll go have a word with him", he said.

The old king left the room and headed upstairs to his grandson's bedroom. He paused outside the door.

"Be a good kitty, Munchies, and there'll be a lot of fat yummy mice! And you can eat them all! Now sit still...that's a good kitty..."

King Hercules knocked on the door.

The king opened the door and stopped short.

The entire floor was covered with animals! Two, incredibly fat rabbits hopped lazily across the bedroom floor. By the fireplace, a grey and white wolf slept. A hedgehog shuffled across the floor and two salamanders, Fire and Brimstone, ran around on the hot coals of the fireplace, seemingly chasing each other's tails.

You'll see street-performers and music and lots of lovely things! The princes are very nice boys, and I'm sure they'll like you too!"

"Oh I hate travelling by Merlin! I always get airsick..."

FLASH!!

Miaow!

With their parents gone, Cameron and Edmund suddenly became very relaxed, sticking their feet up onto their footrests and opening their robes to reveal their monstrous, bulging bellies, symbols of their authority. Following their cue, Cassius shrugged off his tunic to reveal his lean, chiseled, muscular physique and dazzling good looks...the symbols of his authority. With the two youngest princes out playing, they all felt that they could let their hair down a bit. Cassius carried over a chair and sat down, sticking his feet up onto the royal dais to relax.

"So", he said. "I guess Gladius has been a good little boy, huh?" he asked Cameron. Cameron nodded. "He's been no trouble".

"Good...very good..."

"Oh shut UP, Cas..." Gladius groaned. He sat down on the steps of the dais, "I am *so* being good! I'm SO *so* being good that everyone thinks I'm fucking awesome! Right!?"
