Cassius sat back in his chair. He stared at the two fat princes in front of him. They were both hovering around the half-ton, 1,000 pound mark. Which was incredible considering that they were only 13 and 12 years old each! Cassius had never seen boys this incredibly fat before in his life. In Mountania, this would've been considered tantamount to a crime against nature. In Fatlantis, it was seen as nothing less than a sign of prosperity, wealth and wellbeing. Anyone who had attained sufficient poundage...or tonnage...was assured of wealth, privilege, servants, money, a large house and a life of sloth, laze, leisure and lethargy. A life of complete freedom and enjoyment...

Which was alright for those who wanted that kind of thing, but for Cassius...and Gladius...they'd get too bored sitting around just eating and having their servants grovel at their feet day and night. They had to get up and around and move and burn off energy! Of course, it went without saying that Cameron and Edmund didn't have much energy to burn, so it never bothered them!

Cassius stared over the two obese boys and smiled as he watched and admired every shelf, every soft tender roll, every bulge, every rotund protuberance, every curvaceous cushion of chubbiness...In his mind, Cassius was living out his deepest, darkest, most depraved fat-loving, fat-touching, fat-groping fantasies that he had ever had...and which were impossible to fulfil in Mountania, for obvious reasons...but which could be carried out here...when the conditions were right...

"I'm bored!" said Gladius. "I think I'll go for a swim or something..." he said, getting up and leaving the room...

"Nice of you to join us, Gladius".

Gladius sat down between the two princes, who sat opposite their parents.

"Good evening King David, Queen Isobel, ma'am", Gladius said, stiffly. He relaxed in his seat and stared around the table. There were plates and bowls, forks, knives, spoons, chalices, candles, salt-cellars, spice-boxes...but no actual FOOD! He frowned.

A pair of doors opened and two buglers in white uniforms tootled off a bright, brass flourish. A fat man with a neat blond beard entered the room, wearing a puffy toque blanc, the traditional headgear of the master chef. Behind him, followed two lines of fat, well-fed servant-boys, carrying trays, tureens, platters, bowls, or pushing trolleys and carts. In Mountania, the visible servants were mostly girls. This was because they were expected to do the lighter work, where the heavier work, more demanding to the body, was done by boys and men. Gladius stared at the procession of servants in wonderment. The oldest couldn't be any more than about 15.

"Once they reach 16, they can either leave service with a certificate of completion, and find work elsewhere, or they stay in their post until an opening as a footman shows up", Crown Prince Cameron whispered into Gladius's ear. Gladius nodded.

The boys lined up their trolleys and left, while the boys with platters and plates laid them on the table before leaving. Then, right at the back of the procession was a fat, round boy with brown hair. He looked about 500 or 600 pounds.

"Good evening, Master Roland", King David said. The boy bowed.

"Roland is Chef Blakely's son", Cameron explained. "He's the Royal Food Taster. He tests everything for poison..."

Gladius's eyebrows rose!

"Oh it's a harmless job..." said Cameron, "...it's mostly ceremonial. But it is useful. In case there's a dish that isn't prepared properly and it slipped through by accident for some reason..."

Gladius watched as Roland waddled from dish to dish, taking spoonful, a scoop, a forkful, a mouthful, of everything there. He was taking just the SMALLEST amounts of food, but with the number of dishes and courses to be had, Gladius was amazed this boy wasn't as fat as the princes!

When he was done, Roland bowed to the king and queen.

"Your Majesties", he said. He turned to the three princes. "My lord Cameron, Prince Edmund, sir".

"You find everything satisfactory?" the king asked.

"Yes sir!"

"Thank you, Roland".

The boy and his father backed away, bowed, and left the room. Gladius watched as everyone charged in! Their servants kept up a steady stream of food while the two porcine princes glugged and gobbled and snatched and slurped and belched and burped and bore down and binged! The king and queen ate with considerably more decorum, but with only a smidgeon less speed!

"My little DARLINGS!" Queen Isobel crooned, "Such sweet little apples!" she smiled.

With the initial edge of their hunger dulled, the princes relaxed into a steady gorging process, where their plates were steadily filled with food every few minutes, to be emptied of food a few minutes later, only to be refilled again...and again...and again.

The king belched and coughed, wiping his mouth. "Gladius...ahem...Tomorrow is an important day..."

"What's so important?" Gladius asked.

"Tomorrow, my two sons are going into town", said the king. "They are attending their monthly weigh-in. It is customary for the assurance of our subjects that the princes be weighed IN PUBLIC once each month, to ensure to them, the security of our dynasty and the prosperity of our kingdom. You will accompany them to this event. And afterwards, you will accompany them to the Regis House for Destitute Children..."

"Oh yeah, I think I went there once before..." said Gladius. "Um...the...uh..."

"Most people call it the 'Tristan House', after our noble ancestor who caused its establishment under the rule of his older brother, the King Darius..." King David explained.

"Oooh yeah...THAT place. I remember..."

"They are going there to open a new residential wing", the king explained. "New dormitories, dining-hall and kitchen. You will accompany them there and see that everything goes smoothly. I would go myself, but I have a meeting with the city council, and the Queen must attend her women's charity group meeting. It will be simple. They will go there, they will make a short speech, a donation, cut the ribbon, sign autographs, meet people, shake hands, rub-blubb with the rich and famous, meet the children, stay for food and drinks...It'll be like a party!"

"Yeah I...I could do that!" said Gladius.

"Good!" said the king, "Wonderful! You will leave tomorrow after breakfast, all three of you. First into town for your weighing-in, and then to the ribbon-cutting at the Tristan House!"
14111211222.title: A Big Fat-Mountain Dinner

choices: The princes reach the Tristan House. Several carriages and visitors are waiting.
141112112221.content:
"We've been doing this every month ever since you turned five! You KNOW how it's done! You KNOW what we have to do! Now HURRY UP!"

"Will yah hold ON!? I'm COMING already! Sheesh!"

Gladius stood waiting in the foyer of the palace. He wore a steel helmet, a silk vest and a steel breastplate and backplate. He had his belt around his waist, with his dagger and sword strapped securely onto it. He was wearing minimal armour and weaponry because he didn't want to look too intimidating. It was just a ribbon-cutting and a weigh-in, anyway! It wasn't like they were going on some cross-country journey to the Deepest Darkest Wilds of the mystical kingdom of Wherethafukawi?

He watched as the two enormously fat princes waddled into view. He stared at them in wonderment. He'd been here nearly a month or so now, and he still couldn't believe how fat they were! How they even managed to MOVE was a mystery to him. They waddled ponderously into view, panting and gasping from the effort of just balancing their bellies and moving their feet. They leaned on sturdy-looking walking-sticks, while they waddled forwards.

Each prince had two servants each. One holding their long capes, the other acting as a sort of human crutch. They waddled slowly forwards, pausing every two or three steps. Gladius recognised the boys: Ryan and Ethan were Cameron's servants. Samson and Jeremy served his younger brother, Prince Edmund. Apparently only one boy from each staff would be going. So Ethan and Samson stayed back, while Ryan and Jeremy followed on with their masters. Gladius followed them out of the palace and into a huge, sturdy-looking carriage with four white horses harnessed at the front. Gladius climbed in after the boys and a stable-boy closed the doors.

"Heeyaaah!" the coachman barked. He shook the reins and cracked a whip! The carriage creaked and then rumbled off down the road, through the gatehouse and out into the world of the common man.

The princes were both wearing near-identical outfits. Red and blue capes done up with gold hooks and buttons around their chests. baggy silk shorts that reached down to their knees, expensive-looking leather sandals, made of Mountanian cowhide with flashy brass buckles. Large, colorful sashes strapped around their shoulders and bellies. They were also adorned with the usual array of trappings that came with being princes of the kingdom of fat...expensive rings, bracelets, and solid gold belly-chains that were held in-place around them purely by virtue of their own bulk and youthful girth!

The carriage drove through town. People cheered and waved and the princes waved back. Gladius stared around, left and right, taking in everything. His father had been training him since the age of six, how to be a knight. This was all supposed to be part of his training - knowing how to protect people. How to spot danger. This included such things as observations, deductions, inferences, reading body-language...Gladius had shown a knack for all these little games...perhaps that's why he was chosen to become the princely bodyguard? He shrugged. He kept watching. He saw that a lot of people had turned out for this event. The monthly weigh-in must be some sort of fancy schmancy ceremony around here. There were people lining the street, people in the square, people up on rooftops and leaning out of windows...

Up on the rooftops of the shophouses and buildings around the main square were some children. They were peering down at the square from the roof of a baker's shop. Mr. Roundley waddled up the back stairs to the top floor of his bakery with a basket filled with buns and rolls. He chuckled at the gaggle of youngsters, all leaning on the wall around the top of his shop, staring down at the square. The were five boys and a girl.

"Susie! I told you to bring the glass!"

"I forgot!" the little girl wailed. "We were all in a hurry! YOU said we'd get here on TIME! So I didn't think we'd NEED IT! I thought we'd get better seats for the weighing-in! Instead we're stuck up here on...the roof of the best bakehouse in town! Uh, h-hi Mr. Roundley!"

Mr. Roundley smiled at the children. Timothy and Susie, and their friends, Bobby, Tommy, Jake, and Eric.

The children were all tiny. Skinny, or chubby, thin and bony. They were all orphans. He knew that. Their parents had all died, or were drunk homeless deadbeats. Or were simply too poor to house them. As a result, all six children were residents of the Tristan House, as most people called it. The big, old monastery a few miles outside of town, over the river and down the way, up the hill and around again...

They were attended to by the Brothers and Sisters of the Order of Prince Tristan, a charity organisation established in the name of Prince Tristan, the generous prince of once-upon-a-time, who established a charity house for poor children under the rule of his father, and who expanded it so very much, under the rule of his brother Darius. The children were all wearing their house-clothes - Brown, hooded habits and tunics with rope belts and cheap leather sandals. Susie, as a girl, wore a simple sack-dress. Nothing fancy, but it served its purpose. She also wore a large shawl which she had draped over her face.

The Tristan House was for all homeless or otherwise destitute children. At the home, they could have three square meals a day, a clean bed, a safe room, and caring and attentive adults to look after them. They were free to come and go as they pleased, to find work, or visit their parents or friends and family...Timmy and Susie did odd jobs for Mr. and Mrs. Roundley. In return, they gave them food baskets.

Mr. Roundley smiled at the two children and their friends. The brother and sister reminded him of the child that he and his wife had once had...once upon a time...stupid wells...

"Aren't you staying to watch, Mr. Roundley?" Eric asked.

"Watch for what?" Roundley asked. "I've seen that ceremony dozens of times with plenty of young princes! And princesses! I don't need to see it again!"

"Shhhh!!" Timothy hissed, "They're starting!"

It started with the ceremonial disrobing. Edmund went first. He hated this! Sure he wasn't ashamed of his size, but he wished that he didn't have to show it off in front of the ENTIRE KINGDOM! His servants, his family, his brother, his parents, his friends...but not complete strangers!! He sat down on a large bench and the mainspring on a scale creaked down, the needle on a huge dial spun around...

"Twelve hundred pounds!" the mayor called out. There were loud woops and cheers! Edmund heaved himself off the seat with Jeremy's help, and quickly threw his cape back around his body! His inspection at the meat-market was OVER!

"Awww!" Jake groaned, "I couldn't see it! Susie you should've brought the glass ANYWAY!"

"I DIDN'T!.."

"SHUT UP!" Bobby hissed, "We're gonna miss the other one!"

Cameron heaved his way up onto the platform, panting and wheezing, his buttocks wobbling and smashing together, his belly swaying and heaving so much, it looked like he would lose his balance and fall over at any moment! He sat down on the bench and the whole thing creaked! The crowd gasped! Cameron slumped there, wheezing for breath! The lord mayor watched the needle on the scale, and waited for it to stop vibrating!

"Fifteen hundred pounds!" he cried out triumphantly! "The princes are doing well in their duties to our fair and prosperous kingdom!" he announced. The crowd cheered! Up on the roof of the bakery, the children screamed and wooped! They clapped and danced around excitedly!

"Come on!" said Timothy, snatching up the basket of buns and rolls, "Don't just STAND there! We gotta get back home before the princes get to the House! Or else we'll miss out on them again! Thanks for the food, Mr. Roundley! We'll bring back the basket next week!"

Susie convinces Gladius to introduce them all privately to the fat princes!
1411121122211.content:
Timothy, Susie, Bobby, Eric, Jake, and Tommy all ran as fast as their short, little legs could carry them to try and reach the Tristan House before the fat princes got there.

"You just...*huff puff*...HAD to watch the weigh-in," complained Tommy as they rounded a corner and kept on running.

"Hey, you wanted to see them...get weighed...as much as the rest of us!" panted Timothy.

"They are getting soooo delightfully...fat!" gushed Susie.

"I can't believe...Prince Cameron gained...two hundred pounds since the...last time we saw him weighed!" exclaimed Jake.

"Yeah, and Prince Edmund...gained one hundred!" added Bobby.

"Can you imagine...how much they eat in a day?" Susie said dreamily.

The boys all groaned at the thought of the sheer amount of food each prince had to consume on a daily basis to put several hundred pounds of fat on their bodies every year.

Once they reached the Tristan House, they saw that the princes' carriage, as well as several other carriages, were already parked at the front door. Lots of fat and obese nobility and visitors were milling around outside or filing slowly into the children's home.

The six kids snuck inside through a little used side door. Timothy crept down to the kitchen to drop off their basket full of baked goods, courtesy of Mr. Roundley. The other five kids climbed up to the balcony overlooking the large foyer of the House where everyone was congregating.

"So," said Timothy when he finally joined back up with the others. "Are we all set for our plan?"

"I don't know, Timmy," said Susie, biting her lip. "Do you think it will work? Those two princes are sooooo big and heavy and huge!"

"That's exactly WHY we want to do this, though!" said Timothy. He frowned at his sister. "Are you a member of the RSPCA or not?"

Susie sighed. She was the youngest of their little group and so was the newest member inducted into the Royal Society of Princely Corpulent Advancement. Every single one of them was amazed and obsessed with the Fatlantean princes, Cameron and Edmund. They relished every single opportunity they had to see and spy on the princes when they were out and about. They drooled over the round, rolling, corpulent bodies of the princes. They would watch and follow them as the princes would slowly waddle and wander around the town square, eating and gorging themselves into a stupor, making their round, wobbling bellies distended and stretched with food. The six children would also willingly do any menial task for the princes to try and get close enough to brush by or cop a feel of all that heavenly royal blubber the princes had by the half-ton-full. And yet, all this was never enough.

Therefore, they had planned and schemed for weeks when they heard of the princes coming to dedicate the new wing of the Tristan House. The princes coming here to their own home provided them with an unprecedented opportunity. The single biggest, fondest dream of each child in the RSPCA was to stuff and feed the princes, to rub and massage their growing, engorging stomachs, and to help add that much more soft, wonderful fat on the princes' bodies.

Now, if they could only find the right opportunity to put their plan into action....

"I'm a member, Timmy," Susie said in a hurt voice. "You know I want to see the princes as fat and large as possible. I just...I don't know how the plan's going to work! The princes are always surrounded by people! And they have that new bodyguard! Look, look! There they are! See?"

Susie pointed down to the foyer as a couple buglers played a royal fanfare. The crowd of dignitaries cheered and clapped as Prince Cameron and Prince Edmund slowly and sedately waddled up a couple steps onto a large, reinforced platform set up for them at the front of the room directly underneath a picture of their ancestor, Prince Tristan. Following directly behind them, his hands on the pommels of his sword and dagger and his eyes continually scanning the room at all times, was Prince Gladius.

Bobby sighed in concern. "How are we going to get passed...that?!" he said, indicating Gladius.

Timothy groaned. "I didn't count on them having a bodyguard! Alright, everyone! Think! We don't have a lot of time!"

The kids racked their brains and whispered ideas back and forth before they finally come up with something they thought would work. Susie, however, crossed her arms over her chest. "I can't believe you want me to do...that!"

"Ah, come on, Sis!" said Timothy, putting his arm around his kid sister's shoulders. "This will really prove how dedicated you are to the RSPCA! Besides, I've seen you sneaking looks at that bodyguard!"

Susie blushed and couldn't help stealing another glance at Gladius. Even though he was thin, he was muscular and handsome. He looked like he'd be more than capable of protecting anyone under his care. What would it be like if SHE were under his care?

The children listened intently as the head of the Tristan House, Brother Porkenstein, got everyone's attention and introduced the princes. Then, Prince Cameron and Prince Edmund stepped forward to the front of the platform.

Cameron cleared his throat. "Thank you all for coming here today. My brother and I are grateful to have this chance to continue and support the legacy our ancestor Prince Tristan started a long time ago. We dedicate the new Cameron-Edmund wing of the Tristan House to all the needy children who still need a place to call home here in Regis City. May they always have a safe and warm bed to sleep in, a dry roof over their heads, and plenty of good, healthy food to eat here in the Tristan House."

Edmund took a ceremonial pair of scissors from Brother Porkenstein and cut a long blue ribbon stretching in front of them.

The crowd erupted into cheers and applause.

Brother Porkenstein held up his hands and said, "Thank you, ladies and gentlemen! If you will all follow me, I will give you a brief tour of the new wing. Refreshments will be served in the new and expanded kitchen afterwards."

"This is it, guys," Timothy said under his breath. "You all know what to do?"

The other five children nodded their heads.

"I managed to grab the supplies from the infirmary after I dropped off the basket," Timothy added, patting his bulging pockets. "Alright. Let's get to it. Susie, you're on!"

Susie blushed, but eagerly stood up from her perch on the balcony and hurried down to the foyer. The other boys followed her down to the foyer, but hid out of sight.

"Timothy," Jake hissed. "Did you manage to get the glass?"

Timothy grinned at his friend and drew the glass from one of his pockets. "Yep!"

The five boys took turns spying through the glass, watching and waiting for the perfect opportunity to make their dreams come true.

14111211222111.content:
"I still dunno..." Susie whispered.

"Come on, Suze!" said Eric. "You wanna be in on this! And it's not so hard! Just go over there and butter him up!"

"I don't have any butter!"

"He means you need to distract him!" Timothy explained to his sister. "I mean look at him! He's a Mountain Prince! I bet he's gotta have a HUGE..."

"TIMOTHY!"

"...I was gonna say 'ego'...and he'll probably be real flattered if a sweetie like you came up to him...pleeeeaaase?"

Susie giggled. She gave her brother a kiss. "Oh alright!"

Susie scratched her head. Wondering.

"When they go inside...then the princes will be all busy with the guests...I can find Prince Gladius then and chat to him and keep him busy...uh...Then you guys can keep bringing the princes glasses of water or something. Sooner or later they're gonna have to answer um...calls of nature...so when they go to the bathroom, you can corner them and..."

"Hey that's a good idea!" said Jakie. "'Cause not even their SERVANTS are gonna follow them into the wash-house!"

Susie blushed.

"See?" said Timmy, "And YOU guys didn't want me to bring her into the group. I told you she was smart! Now go on!"

Susie peeked down at the crowd in the foyer. Bit by bit, they waddled into the new wing.

"Alright, come on!" she said.

They rushed downstairs and into the new wing. The wing had a huge central dining and assembly hall, with corridors leading off it, to bathrooms, kitchens, smaller rooms for meetings and offices and classrooms, and then rows and rows of dormitories.

The boys headed to the kitchen. A fat, bald man, Friar Tuck, smiled at them.

"Good afternoon, young masters!" he said. Friar Tuck was the head chef at the Tristan House.

"Friar Tuck", said Bobby. "Please friar, can we have some water?"

"Certainly! The pump and sink are over there, and there's glasses on the shelves..."

"No we want water JUGS", Timothy explained. "We thought we could um...well...serve drinks during the party..."

"Oooooh...That is a good idea!" said the friar, smiling. "Yes! Alright. There's trolleys over there...and there's the glasses. I'll get the jugs..."

The fat cook waddled away and came back later with several enormous pewter jugs which he filled with freezing cold water from the pump in the kitchen. He loaded each jug onto the trolleys with their glasses and the boys left the kitchen.

"You come back here and fill up the jugs when you have to, won't you boys?" the cook called after them,"I need to sort out the sandwiches..."

Susie watched her brother and her friends milling around the hall pushing their drinks trolleys. While they watered down the guests, she moved towards Prince Gladius.

Gladius was TALL for 13! He was about six feet, with brown hair and a tan and impressive muscles. He didn't have the bulky, hunky look that most girls prized, but he was nonetheless, attractive and powerfully built. Susie curtsied.

"Good afternoon my lord Gladius..." she said.

"Huh?...Oh...Hey!" said Gladius. "You're cute..."

Susie smiled. "Thank you, my lord. His Royal Highness is the princes' new bodyguard..."

"Yeah that's right", said Gladius. "Nice to meet you".

"I am Susette, or 'Susie' as my friends call me", said Susie. She gulped, and then started off with...

"...His Royal Highness is so strong and handsome..." she crooned. She was shorter than Gladius, and she used this to her advantage, moving closer to him so that he would realise that he was taller and bigger and stronger than her. Something else to feed his ego...

"...with such beautiful hair!" she added. Rubbing it.

"Well..." said Gladius. "Thank you. You're sweet..."

Susie examined Gladius's minimal armour and his weapons. She looked at his sword. "Is this your weapon?" she asked. "Oh I'd love to see it!" she said.

"Oh sure!" said Gladius. Anything for a pretty girl...

...and that was JUST what Susie was counting on.

While Gladius pulled out his sword, Susie dropped a coin on the ground.

"Oh!" she gasped.

"Let me!" said Gladius. He knelt and picked it up. Susie took the momentary distraction to search for the two fat princes...not that searching for boys the size of cows was ever going to take very long! Ah, there they were, at the far end of the hall...and her brother Timothy and his friend Bobby nearby...

Cameron and Edmund were not used to this much exercise, walking around the hall and greeting people. They had become silently thankful of the fact that two of the home-boys seemed to be following them around constantly, supplying them with glasses of water, and generous refills. When Timothy ran out of water, Jakie would take over. When he did, Tommy took over. When he did, Eric took over. When he did, then Bobby took over...it was a constant relay of water to keep the princes hydrated. After all...

"The health of their royal highnesses is very important to us..." Timothy said, when Edmund commented on their constant presence. Timothy bowed submissively.

"How MUCH do these guys DRINK!?" said Tommy as he passed Jake in the hall. "They're still going!"

"Well look at them! They probably sweat out half what they drink in, so I bet it's a lot! And how much water do you think they have to fill those huge bellies, anyway?" he asked.

The two boys stared at the princes water-filled bellies, which sloshed and wobbled and gurgled with every gentle movement that they made.

"Good point! But this is my fifth trip back!" Tommy said. "And this jug holds a gallon! So that's six gallons! And there's five of us, so...so..."

"So that means that they'll be going to piddle pretty soon!" Timothy interrupted them. "So go and get ready!"

Timothy opened a bottle and tipped its contents into the jug of water that he had. The water would dilute the colour of the bottle's contents, and in the yellow light of candles, the slight tinge in the water would be barely noticeable. He filled up two LARGE glasses with this 'water' and went to find his sister.

141112112221111.content:
"There you are Susie!" said Timothy. He bowed to Gladius, "My lord", he added. "Come along, Susie! You're missing the big event!" he hissed.

"Big event? Wh...oooooh..." Susie said softly. Timothy gave a BARELY imperceptible nod, and gestured for his sister to follow him.

The new public bathrooms in the new wing of the house had two entrances. One from inside, and one from the outside. The six friends watched as the two princes waddled towards the bathroom. Their servants relieved them of their cloaks, exposing even MORE of their great bellies, and waited for them to come out again.

In the meantime, the boys hurried into the bathroom and went out the other side, through the exterior door into the garden. Tools and equipment left by the builders were everywhere. Including two large wheelbarrows and several empty sacks and ropes.

Timothy entered the bathroom with his trolley. The two massive princes were standing next to each other in front of an extra large urinal-stand. Both boys were sweating heavily from their LONG waddle from the door to the urinal. A grand distance of about nine feet, past the sinks and water-pumps...

And it was now that they realised that without their servants, the princes would need someone else to help them.

"Hey boy!" Cameron gasped. "Come here. You were the one who was following us around everywhere, weren'tcha?" he asked.

Timothy gulped! Did they suspect their plan!?

"Uh..y-yes your Royal Highness!"

"Givin' us all that water, huh. What did you want, a tip?"

"Uh..."

"'Cause all that stuff's gone right through us..."

Cameron dug into the sweaty pockets of his expensive silk shorts, Supersize-5-sized, and tugged out a gold sovereign.

"This is yours if you help us piss", he said. Timothy almost SNATCHED the coin out of Cameron's hands, and helped them pull down their shorts, and prepare them for the operation ahead. Two heavy streams splattered into the trough and the princes leaned against the wall, and each other, in relief! Once they were done, Timothy pulled up their shorts for them.

"Their Royal Highnesses must be thirsty!" Timothy said. He held up the two massive glasses of tainted water. The two princes stared at each other. They WERE pretty thirsty...

"Thanks boy..." said Edmund. They reached for the glasses and glugged them down. They stopped, handed the glasses back and gasped. They NEEDED that!!

The two princes were about to waddle back out, when they suddenly felt dizzy! What was going on!? What was IN that water!?

The outside doors to the bathroom opened and the boys came in, pushing the wheelbarrows. Timothy watched as the huge whales flopped backwards! The barrows were nearly flipped upside down! It took two boys holding onto the handles of both barrows to stop them from losing their centers of balance and dumping the princes onto the floor! They covered the princes heads with sacks, and then tied their arms and legs together with ropes!

"Come on! Quick!" said Timothy! The six young conspirators, three to a prince, started wheeling them out of the bathroom and across the garden. The high windows of the new dining-hall meant that nobody could see out into the grounds to witness their getaway!...By the time anyone noticed that the princes were missing, they would be long gone!

"Get onto the road, quick!" Bobby gasped, "These barrow-wheels are digging into the ground! They'll tell everyone where we took them!"

They steered the severely overloaded wheelbarrows to the main road that ran past the Tristan House and pushed them along...UPHILL!

"W-w--w-who tho-though f-f-f-fat pr-pr-princes *cough!* cou-could be s-so HEAVY!?" Susette wheezed! "H-how m-much fu-further to this h-hiiii-hideout *wheeze!* t-that you p-pick-picked out, b-brother!?" she gasped.

"Okay I didn't think it would be THIS hard!" Timothy gasped. "But come on! We gotta get moving before anyone spots us!"

Shoving the wheelbarrows along was very difficult. The princes' bellies and huge thighs and legs and arms sagged over the lips of the barrows, and their boy-boobs and rolls wobbled and sloshed around everytime the wheels bumped or jolted on an uneven paving-stone. Sadly, the children were too busy pushing the barrows, pulling the barrows, watching the road and checking for followers to appreciate the gentle, hypnotic jiggling of royal flesh.

"H-h-HOW much FURTHER!?" Bobby gasped, after they'd been going for nearly two hours! "And what did you PUT in that drink, anyway!?"

"It's just laudanum!" said Timothy, "That stuff which the doctor gives us when we got aches and pains! A whole bottle of the stuff! I wanted to knock them out proper!"

"You certainly did that!" said Jake, "I'm startin' to get winded!"

"Just over there!" said Timothy. He pointed far in the distance. It was an old, abandoned farm and mill, built near a river. "That's where we've been stockpiling all the food for the past three months!"

1411121122211111.content:
After much pushing and panting and wheezing and gasping, the children reached their destination several miles up the road. It was Timothy and Jake who found the place, several miles off the main road, hidden in trees near a stream - an old farm.

The farm had a combination farmhouse and mill, built into the banks of a river, it had a farmyard, an old stable-block, an animal-barn, and a much larger storage-barn built of stone and shingles.

"In here!" Timothy panted. He pushed one of the wheelbarrows into the barn. The barn was made up of five massive chambers. A central store-room with stairs and balconies and rafters, ropes and pulleys everywhere, for storing, hoisting and carrying grain and food, and four large storage-rooms, two on either side, one on top of the other. The barn was very very dark.

The wheelbarrows were wheeled into the center of the huge main chamber, and then the princes were dumped into a pair of massive, old birthing-chairs, which the boys had smuggled out of the basement of the Tristan House.

The birthing-chairs were slightly reclined armchairs with built-in footrests and a cutout in the front of the seat, which made them look suspiciously like lavatory-chairs! The cutout was, of course, for the passage of new life. There wasn't going to be any new life around here, but they were the only chairs that the children could find that would be big, strong and sturdy enough for their purposes!

The princes were dumped into the chairs, back-to-back, and their arms and legs were tied to the armrests and footrests of the chairs with scraps of cloth!...Timothy didn't want to use rope or string because he didn't dare give the princes rope-burn! The chairs were designed so that the occupant could be easily tied down...Nobody wanted an expectant mother to trash around in a chair while giving birth, and potentially harming the baby!...and it was this feature that the children took advantage of.

14111211222111111.content:
The two princes groaned! Their heads were swimming and spinning and whirling around! When they slowly opened their eyes, they realised that they weren't in the Tristan House anymore! What happened!?

They went to the bathroom...they had a drink...and then...then it was a complete blank! Cameron panted as his headache slowly went away. He stared around and saw that the room was dimly lit by four, spaced out candles.

"Eddie!?" he called out.

"Cam!" Edmund shouted. They realised now that they were tied to large, wooden chairs, back to back, in the middle of a huge room with a stone floor. The room was so huge that they couldn't see the walls around them!

"Cammie where are we!?" Edmund blubbered, "Cammie I'm scared!"

"I dunno!" Cameron said. He sniffed the air. He could smell straw...he guessed they were in a barn or something!

"Welcome!"

The two princes jumped! Their chairs creaked from the sudden movement!

"Who said that!?" Edmund cried out.

"We have aspyed you from afar for years", the voice continued. It was deep and loud, magnified in some manner. It echoed and reverberated around the huge room.

"Who are you!?" Cameron shouted.

The voice laughed, deep and scary-sounding!

"Who we are is not important. What is important is who YOU are..." the voice replied. "...and what you represent!"

"W-w-what do you mean!?" Edmund whimpered!

"Your size! Your WEIGHT! Your GIRTH! Your heft! Your sheer OBESITY represents the prosperity of your kingdom and the opulence and wealth of your family", the voice continued. "Your weight means EVERYTHING to you. Your appetites, your diets, your sizes are your life and death!" the voice added.

Somewhere up above, something made of wood, creaked softly. The two princes tried to stare up into the gloom above, but couldn't see anything!

"Who's there!?" Cameron shouted.

"We have watched you. We have seen you. We have followed you for months and years", the voice continued. "We have seen you in public every time. We watch as you move around the market-squares, past bakeries and butcheries, and restaurants and coffeehouses and cake-shops, gorging and bloating yourselves on the works of others!"

The two boys were getting REALLY scared now!

"We have watched you grow day, by day, week, by week, year after year, into the bloated, lumbering slobs you are", the voice continued. "But that is not enough to satisfy our needs and desires".

The two princes didn't like the sound of this! What was going to happen!? Were they going to be slaughtered and fed to some horrible beast!?

"You have displeased us", the voice continued, "And we have brought you here so that you may fulfill your ultimate destinies..."

"Let us GO!" Edmund whimpered, "We-we've n-never hurt nobody!"

"We do not wish you harm..." the voice began again. "We are a secret society of royal watchers..." it continued. "And we have watched you for years. But watching has gone far enough and it is now time for action. You will be our prisoners and will submit to our will. Do this and you will not be harmed. It is our desire that you should be safe, comfortable and cared for during your stay here. Do not be afraid!"

THIS only made the princes even MORE terrified!

Now, they saw figures moving in the gloom! They were coming downstairs! They were each holding a lamp in their hands. The figures were all dressed in brown, monkish habits, with simple cloth belts tied around their middles, with the hoods up, covering their faces, and the lamps hanging between their fingers, their sleeves closed up in front.

The six figures surrounded the chairs, two on each side, and one at either end. Cameron and Edmund couldn't see the figures, but they could tell that they were now kneeling, on both knees. Their heads bowed down, touching the ground.

"Hail Cameron, Prince of Fatlantis, future king and ruler. Hail Edmund, Prince of Fatlantis, of prodigious and expansive appetite", the voices all said at once.

The two boys gulped! They felt as if they were in some sort of CULT! They wanted OUT!...

But at the same time...this was all rather fascinating...It was like some sort of...fan-club...or something.

"Who are you people!?" Cameron demanded. "My name is Cameron Regis, Crown Prince of this Kingdom! And your actions are tantamount to TREASON! If my father finds out about this, you'll ALL BE EXECUTED!" he shouted. "In the king's name I DEMAND that you RELEASE US BOTH AT ONCE! And TAKE US HOME!"

Jakie, Bobby, Timmy, Susie, Tommy, and Eric, the six eager members of the "Royal Society for Princely Corpulent Advancement", were all so excited that they could hardly contain themselves! They surrounded their princes now, on all sides, and their dizzy, dumpling, doughy, dimpled darlings were now their guests...in a manner of speaking... to whom they could do as they pleased!

They didn't bother to rush. They took their time examining the princes. Cameron, the older and fatter one, was already over 1,500 pounds, and only 13! His younger brother, Prince Edmund, was 12, but already well over a half-ton, despite his young age! The children of the Society marveled and ogled at their captives, taking this time to drink in their sheer size and girth for the first time in their lives, without ever, possibly being interrupted or called away! A dream come true!

"Let us go!" Cameron demanded!

Edmund and Cameron were usually fat, hungry, jolly boys. Their upbringing of sloth, greed, gluttony and incomparable, almost obscene luxury, did little to kill their cheerful, gentle, kind and charitable personalities. They gave generously to the poor, stopped for autographs, shook hands, rubbed bellies, and let others rub their vast bodies for good luck, but right now, they felt neither charity, kindness, gentility or good cheer! They just wanted to be OUT OF HERE!!

"We are your most humble and loyal and obedient subjects, my lord", the voice continued. "We are here only as your servants. How is it that we may pleasure your Royal Highnesses?"

Cameron and Edmund took a few minutes to process this information! WHAT!??!!??

Cameron took a deep breath. He could guess what was going on. They were a group of eager young children who had kidnapped them to spend time with them. Some sort of informal 'Princely Fan Club'.

He guessed he could understand that...After all, they WERE extremely popular...And he didn't want to DENY these poor children the chance to meet ROYALTY...eh?

"Are you mad!?" Edmund whisper-hissed to his brother.

"What've we got to lose!?" Cameron whispered back, "Let's just play along..."

15.content:
Which prince will you decide to follow around the Grecco-Romanesque Kingdom of Mountania?

Crown Prince Cassius

Cassius is 15. He's six feet, six inches tall with a light tan and medium, ear-length golden blond hair and blue eyes. For his age and size, he has impressively large muscles which still mask the superhuman strength with which he is naturally endowed in his genes. Cassius is King Leviathan and Queen Athena's 'Golden Boy' prince. Intelligent, handsome, strong, powerful, athletic, smart, friendly, sexy, capable, chivalrous and youthful. He is in many ways, the perfect embodiment of a young, youthful Mountanian royal prince. Cassius is an expert hunter, warrior and swordsman.

Prince Gladius

Prince Gladius has darker, dirty brown-blond hair. He's only six feet tall and 13 years old. Like his brother Cassius, his body has impressive and large muscles for his age and they too, hide the superhuman strength with which he is endowed. Gladius is the rebellious, grumpy, uncontrollable middle-child. He acts out, fights, grumbles, complains and is generally a troublemaker. There is an intense sibling-rivaly between him and his older brother Cassius. Although he loves Cassius, it's not something that Gladius would admit openly and they fight on a regular basis. Gladius likes smithing, forging and metalwork.

Prince Triton

The youngest and smallest prince. Triton is 10 years old, a much smaller version of Cassius. Not having hit puberty, Triton is nowhere near as tall, strong or as fully-developed as his brothers. He shares Cassius's intelligence and good looks, but none of the strength, agility, power and stamina. Triton has a fondness for animals, reading, writing and sports.

All three princes started military training at a young age and are being raised to become full and proper knights. Training for knighthood was broken into three stages:

From the age of 7 to 14 - A boy trained as a page. He assisted his master (a fully-qualified knight) in daily duties and acted as a servant. He learnt the ways of the knight and was taught courtly manners and chivalry.

From the age of 14 to 21 - A boy trained as a squire. He was now officially a knight-in-training. He learnt how to wear and fight and move in full armour. He learnt how to ride a horse. He larnt how to use a sword and how to attack, defend and counterattack against the enemy. Since a full suit of armour could weigh upwards of 100+ pounds (or more, if the squire was taller), bodily strength and stamina were extremely important. The 100-odd pounds does not include the sword, the scabbard, the shield, the woolen undergarments OR the additional chainmail, which together would've added several more pounds of weight.

Which prince will you follow?

153.content:
King Leviathan sat in his large, comfortable chair looking over the various wrestling matches which were taking place in the arena. He was pleased with what he saw, since all the strong, young men were working hard to win their matches. One match was especially interesting to the mighty, Mountanian King; that of his youngest son: Prince Triton.

Triton walked on to the mat facing Octavius, one of his best friends. Both boys were ten years old, they were about the same height and weight, and they had known each other since they met in the first day of school. They had been in every single class together, and they knew each other's likes and dislikes very well. Octavius was the eighth son in a large prominent family of miners and metal workers in Ferramount, and he had hoped to become one of the servants in the Royal Court.

Both boys wore their shirts, their sweat pants, and socks, as they faced each other in a painted circle on a thick mat. The first boy who was able to bring the other down and hold him during a three-second count, would win the match.

Octavius reached out with both arms and grabbed hold of Triton's shoulders, pushing him back slightly. Triton stepped back and broke loose.

"Hey, man! Easy!" Triton protested.

"Easy, nothing! I wanna win!"

Octavius reached out a second time, and locked on to Triton, pressing down on the prince with every ounce of strength that he could muster.

Unfortunately for Triton, Octavius had more upper-body strength than him, and he forced Triton to come down on to his knees!

"Come on, Triton! You gotta fight!" Octavius said, as he continued to push the prince down on to the mat.

"I... I'm... trying.... You're... too... strong!" Triton groaned, as he ended up with his back on the ground.

Triton was exhausted. Octavius had worn him out. Triton just didn't have the strength to push him back. Not only did Octavius force him down, but he held him down long enough for him to win the three-count as well.

"One... Two... Three! I win!" Octavius cheered, as he got up, allowing Triton to stand up.

"You always win at this...." Triton grumbled, as Octavius extended a hand to help him up. "I hate wrestling. It reminds me of how weak I am..."

Meanwhile, King Leviathan was sitting in his chair, looking on. Next to him, was Lord Blackspear, one of the richest Mountanian land owners.

"Is that your youngest, Prince Triton?" he asked the King.

"Yes, as a matter of fact, it is..." Leviathan replied, feeling somewhat disappointed.

"He looks like he's struggling a bit..."

"Yes, it certainly appears that way! Triton has been struggling at these games for a while now..."

"Oh, don't worry, Your Majesty! Eventually, he will become big and strong! Then, he'll beat everyone! Some day, Triton will be a mighty Mountanian warrior, like his brothers!"

"I hope so, Lord Blackspear! I certainly do hope so..."

1531.content:
Leviathan was working diligently at his large oak desk in his office when there was a knock at the door.

"Come in!"

The door opened slightly, remained open, and then closed on its own, without anyone coming in, or so it seemed.

Leviathan looked up for a moment, seeing that nobody was there, wondering who would open the door and close it again.

"Is anyone there?"

Suddenly, Merlin appeared standing right before his desk. The tall, thin boy with dirty blond hair wore his usual brown tunic with a brown rope around his waist and his long, brown sleeves and brown boots on his feet. Lastly, he always had a chain with a medallion hanging around his neck and his white wand in his right hand. His wand had a blue sapphire diamond at its tip, which always emitted a bright, blue glow of light whenever he used it. Finally, Merlin wore a long, black cape which was draped over his shoulders, which was tied around his neck.

"My liege..." Merlin said as he bowed before his King. "My apologies! I forgot to make myself visible before coming into your office. A thousand apologies..."

"You wizards are all the same...." Leviathan chuckled. "Strange folk... Come, my young wizard, I must ask your assistance in a matter of the utmost importance!"

Merlin sat down on one of three large, comfortable chairs placed right in front of the large oak desk that the mighty Mountanian King worked from. He took the middle chair, so he could face the King directly.

"What can I help you with, Your Majesty?"

"I'm deeply concerned about my son..." Leviathan sighed.

"Which one? I got the impression Prince Cassius was doing so well.... And Prince Gladius was improving in his..."

"Prince Triton...."

"Ahh.... Your youngest son? What is your concern?"

"I've seen Triton struggle during the last three wrestling matches. It hurts me to see him fail! Not only that, but all the other Mountanian dignitaries see that, too. It is very important to me that members of the Mountanian Royal family grow up to become strong and respected members of this Kingdom! They cannot be seen as weak and timid!" Leviathan hissed. "I hate seeing my son as a weakling.... he needs to be made STRONGER! How can he be made stronger, Merlin?"

"Ahem... Your Majesty... Prince Triton can go into a stricter regiment of training... But to gain strength takes time, and the Prince is still very young..." Merlin reasoned.

"It bothers me seeing my son, the Prince, lose to other boys in wrestling, or any other form of competition... I hate it... Even if he is the youngest, he must be the strongest, right NOW, not later!"

"My liege.... If that is your wish... I can create a serum which will increase the Prince's physical strength... My only concern is whether or not the Prince will be able to handle his new strength?" the wizard replied.

"Of course he will be able to handle it! He's a Mountanian!" Leviathan shouted. "He's my son! Do it, Merlin! Create the serum and see to it that Triton consumes it at once!"

"Umm.... Your Majesty.... How strong do you want him to be? I can give him the strength of two adult men, five men, eight men, or ten men?" Merlin asked his king.

"The maximum! Ten men!"

"It shall be done, Your Majesty!"

Merlin stood up and bowed before the King. Then he waved his wand, causing a gust of wind to make his long, black cape to blow, before the teenage wizard vanished in a flash of bright, blue light!

15311.content:
Triton was still in bed when there was a sudden, light breeze in his bedroom. His room was simple, with a fireplace, a desk, his bathroom in one corner, a small closet and dresser, a storage room, a bookcase, a mirror, a window, a door to a guest room and finally the main door. It really didn’t look like a bedroom for a Prince, but since he was the smallest and the youngest of the princes, it was enough for him.

Suddenly, all four candles in the bedroom were lit, all at once!

“Ummm?” Triton groaned, as he woke up by the sudden light in his room.

“Wake up, sleepyhead!”

Triton opened his eyes so see a figure standing before him.

“Merlin?”

The young wizard with silver hair and deep blue eyes wore his long, white tunic and a black rope around his waist, with his long, black cape draped over his shoulders. He held his wand in his right hand.

“You still owe me a game of chess, since you beat me yesterday!”

“Oh… Yeah…” Triton yawned, as he slowly sat up on his bed to face the wizard. “But… It was the first time in three weeks that I’ve beaten you! You always win!”

“I got distracted! I want a rematch!”

“Golly, Merlin! We play chess every day! You always win!” Triton complained.

“Yeah…” the young wizard grinned, as he swung his wand through the air, making the windows close on the other end of the room. “But I never know when you’ll beat me!”

“What did you wake me up so early for?” Triton wondered. “It’s too early!”

“Let’s go grab some something to eat!”

“Okay…”

Triton put on his long, brown robe and tied a rope around his waist. He put on his sandals, and the two boys walked into the large dining area where the Mountanian servants ate. It was still very early, and the boys were among the first ones there.

Merlin and Triton walked up to the large counter where they got their food. There, they were given plates with some toast, an omelet, and a glass of milk. From there, the boys walked over to an empty wooden table, near the center of the large dining room.

“Man… I’m starving!” Triton said, as he took his first bite.

“Here! I have something for you!” Merlin said, as he pulled a bottle out of his pocket. The small bottle contained a white liquid. Merlin unscrewed the cap and poured the contents of the bottle into Triton’s glass of milk.

“Hey! What… What was that? What did you pour into my milk?” the Prince asked him. “What was that?”

“This will make you feel better… and stronger! I made it especially for you!”

“What? Really? But… Why?”

“Just drink it!” Merlin ordered.

“This isn’t another one of your practical jokes, right?” Triton laughed. “I know you well enough that…”

“Honest! I swear on my wizard’s honor!” Merlin replied, while holding up both hands. “This is not a joke!”

“If you change me into something stupid…. You had better change me back!” Triton warned, as he brought the glass to his lips and drank the milk in one big gulp.

“You look great, especially with the horns growing out of your head!” Merlin chuckled.

Triton gasped, as he quickly reached for his head with both hands.

“Horns? I… I didn’t grow any horns! LIAR!” he yelled, quickly running both hands over his head, messing up his blond hair in the process.

“Alright, alright… I’m teasing you, Triton… Here, finish your toast!” Merlin said, as he took another bite out of his own toast.

“Man! I don’t know what has come over me… I’m suddenly getting really hungry!”

“I’ll get you a bowl of fruit!” Merlin said, as he got up and fetched a bowl from the food counter by the kitchen. He quickly pulled out his wand, waved it over the bowl, and made it grow to three times its size! The bowl filled up with sliced pieces of melon!

“I’m… I’m HUNGRY!” Triton growled, as he quickly ate four pieces of melon.

“Your muscles are becoming a little denser…” Merlin explained calmly.

“Uhh… What does that mean?”

“Guess what? You’re becoming stronger! So… Eat a LOT of fruit and veggies over the next few days… And you’ll notice the results!”

Triton was confused. What was Merlin talking about?

154.content:
...Or perhaps your interests lie in the activities of the men of the royal Mountanian family.

Old King Hercules, while still healthy and strong, decided to abdicate so that he could enjoy life and his family without the intense work of being king. He has three sons.

Prince Lucius

Prince Lucius, age 38, is actually Hercules's oldest son, but the crown instead went to Hercules's middle son, Leviathan. There's definitely a story there--one that isn't really talked about in the upper echelons of Mountanian society, let alone in the palace in Ferramount.

However, Lucius doesn't mind not being king. He never had any desire to run the Kingdom of Mountania, anyway. Standing nine feet, six inches tall (the shortest of the brothers), with dark brown hair and friendly chocolate brown eyes, Lucius is as strong and muscular as any Mountanian male, having gone through intense training in combat and metal forging since he could crawl. However, Lucius is more easy-going and carefree. He was always more compassionate and loving of all of Hercules's sons. He didn't quite have the warrior's heart to be as ruthless as he would need to be as king.

Hercules's succession was determined long ago, and therefore Lucius was installed as Lord of Laceton in Fatlantis many years before Leviathan was crowned King of Mountania. Over 100 years ago, the city of Laceton was designated a kind of Mountanian outpost in Fatlantis, and a Mountanian of noble or royal birth has always been given the Earldom of the city by the reigning King of Fatlantis to serve as an emissary between the two distinguished nations. Lucius was fostered in Fatlantis when he was a teenager, serving as bodyguard to then Crown Prince David and David's siblings. When Lucius turned 18, David's father graciously named Lucius the new Mountanian Earl of Laceton, in agreement with Hercules.

What exactly is Lucius's story?

King Leviathan

Despite technically being the middle son, Leviathan never showed the typical middle son personality, unlike his own son, Gladius. Hercules had accepted and thought of Leviathan as his true eldest son for a long time, and Leviathan certainly lived up the expectations of an eldest son. Leviathan was always more aggressive, more eager to compete and prove himself a capable warrior. He readily read and absorbed any of his schooling involving battles long since past, as well as battle strategy. He still spends much of his free time reading up on Mountanian battle history. He excels in chess and has proven himself an apt commander and leader over Mountania's fighting men. Having seen Leviathan's formidable calculating mind and unwavering strength, the men of Mountania would follow their king into battle--and to the death--without question.

Leviathan, while being ruthless on the battlefield, is a very loving and caring husband and father at home in Ferramount. He rides tough on his sons at times, but he knows better than anyone that the rough Mountanian people only serve those who are rougher and tougher than they are. Leviathan is 36, has neat sandy-blond hair, intense blue eyes, stands a staggering ten feet tall, and is the burliest, strongest, most muscular Mountanian one is likely to meet. Hercules made a wise decision in having Leviathan become his successor.

Wonder what a typical (or atypical) day is for the reigning monarch of Mountania?

Prince Achilles

Achilles, age 30, is Hercules's youngest son. Achilles was always the joker and prankster among his brothers, knowing he could get away with a lot more since Hercules never needed to ride rough-shod over him as much as his two older brothers. Achilles stands at an impressive nine feet, ten inches tall, has mischievous green eyes, and flaming red hair. His hair tends to curl when it's short, much to his dislike, so he tends to wear it rather long, keeping it in a pony-tail most of the time.

Achilles's boyhood best friend was Mordred, Merlin's father, and Mordred convinced Achilles to foster down in his home country of Fantasmia. So, Achilles served as the bodyguard to then Crown Prince Reginald, and the two princes became fast friends, getting up to all sorts of hi-jinks together, much to the consternation of Reginald's father. When Reginald became king upon his father's untimely death, Reginald kindly asked Achilles to stay on as his royal bodyguard, and Achilles readily accepted. Despite living so far away in the southern kingdom of Fantasmia (which is even further south than Fatlantis!), Achilles can always get back home to help out his older brother Leviathan quickly and easily, as Fantasmia is a country filled with wizards and magic. Furthermore, all Achilles has to do is twist his magic ring, a gift from his best friend Mordred, and Mordred can teleport right to him and take him anywhere he needs to go.

What sort of mischief is Achilles getting up to now down in the mysterious country of Fantasmia?

So, which of these three brothers would you like to follow?

1541.content:
Hercules opened his bedroom door and yawned. He shuffled out, sleepily, swinging his walking-stick in one hand. The stick was long, solid, and very much a lethal weapon. A shaft was weighted with lead at one end, and concealed a sword within it. A quick twist and pull and several feet of lethally sharp steel was brought into play.

The old king limped along, the result of an old hunting-accident. He watched as the palace slowly came to life. A beautiful young lady in her late teens skittered past.

"Good morning, Lady Godiva..."

The young lady blushed and curtised, "My lord Hercules", she said.

"Where are you going?"

"To see the king, your Majesty. The Queen is awakened from her sleep, my lord".

"I see. Carry on...But don't linger, hmm?"

Hercules raised his walking-stick and tugged up the straps on her dress to a more acceptable, less revealing level.

She blushed.

"The king is a married man".

"Of course, your Majesty!"

"He requires no attentions from young ladies".

"No, your Majesty. Although...he may desire them..."

The king frowned, "I don't think so. You are one of the Queen's ladies in waiting, and you will conduct yourself accordingly!"

"Yes, your majesty!"

"At any rate, the Crown Prince is surely closer to your age...?"

The girl put a hand to her mouth!

"Your Majesty!"

"You youngsters can hardly keep your corsets and codpieces together! But if they are to come apart, at least do it in the presence of someone more age-appropriate!"

"Of course, your Majesty..." she said. She curtsied, and scuttled off.

The king sighed. Girls!

The young Lady Godiva hurried into an enormous bedchamber, done all over with dark wood panelling, a huge fireplace, solid, wooden furniture and large windows with thick, red curtains everywhere. She drew back the curtains and hurried up to the four-poster canopy-bed. Slowly, she drew back the curtains around the bed and stared at the figure lying there.

She tugged down her dress slightly and bent over the slumbering figure.

"Good morning, your Majesty..."

"Hmmmmm...Mmmmm...Ooooooh..."

King Leviathan opened his eyes to the exquisite sight before him. He let out a grin.

"My dear Lady Godiva. Does your mother know you're doing this?"

"She said I should aim towards the top, my lord".

"I am the top, but the top's taken. You should aim for the next rung down. The Crown Prince is currently unattached. So perhaps you should display your natural goodness before his eyes before you display before me..."

The courtesan huffed! She straightened up, tugged up the straps on her dress and pulled the bodice up over her chest! The wasted effort!...

The king chuckled. What a marvellously attractive girl she was! Although far too young for him. She was only...fifteen? Much too young. He preferred an altogether different type of girl...

Slowly, the king rose from bed and stretched and yawned. Someone knocked on the door.

"Come in!"

"Your hot water, your ma-AAAAAAH!!"

"Lady Candice, really!"

"I do beg your pardon, your majesty!"

"You should be used to seeing me out of bed in the morning..."

"Yes your majesty! But...well...I never seen you from the front before!...Is it always that big?"

"You're not suggesting that you want to find out, do you?"

"Yes, m'lord! I mean no, m'lord! I mean...I mean..."

"Candice that's enough! Be off with you before you drop it everywhere!"

Queen Athena entered the king's bedchamber and took the bucket of hot water from the lady's hands.

"Yes your majesty! Right away, ma'am!"

"My dear! How many times have I told you not to whip it out in front of the younger girls? It scares them when they haven't seen something as...healthy...as yours..."

King Leviathan chuckled. He tugged on his smalls and laid down in his chair. The Queen began lathering her husband for his morning shave.

"Did you sleep well last night?" she whispered, splashing hot water over his face and swilling the shaving-brush around.

"Mmmmm...Did you?"

"I did not".

"Why not?"

"I was not sent to my slumber in my usual manner, my lord..."

The king sighed, "You know I would, darling, but things have been so BUSY these last few days..."

"Of course, my dear!"

The queen opened an enormous steel straight-razor, and began the shave.

"Don't sneeze", she said. Leviathan snorted!

"Don't say that or I'll laugh, and that'd be even worse!"

The queen laughed and began to take long, slow, determined strokes, kissing her husband on his shaved cheek.

Soon, everything was done and the king decided that he was ready for the day's events.

"Shall we have breakfast, my dear?"

"Yes. On the northern terrace, I think".

The king got to his feet and put his arm over his wife's shoulder.

Queen Athena was a tall, stately woman...but nowhere near as tall as her husband. Her oldest son, Cassius, was already taller than her by six inches, and showed no signs of stopping.

"Is that where the boys are having breakfast?" the King asked.
1541.title: Leviathan--King and Overlord of Mountania

choices: The king rides his horse through the city of Ferramount.
Cassius and his brothers go hunting in the forests nearby.
15412.content:
"Come my lord. We should breakfast with our children".
"Indeed".
"My dear, do you love our children?"
"Certainly I do".
"Do you wish that we had a girl?"
"Yes".
"Do you wish a girl instead of one of our sons, or in addition to?"
"Certainly in addition to! I would not give up any of our boys for a girl!"
"Why would you not make it so that we would have a girl?"
"Because I know of your delicate condition. Young Triton was not an easy birth..."
"Yes my dear".

The Queen wrapped an arm around her husband's waist and squeezed. King Leviathan put an arm around her shoulder and pinched her on the cheek. She squealed! The king chuckled.

"Good morning, girls".

A gaggle of palace serving-maids who were all peering through a crack in a door, all jumped to attention, whirled around and curtsied!

"Y-y-your Ma-majesty!"

"May I ask what is the reason for this congregation? Are the princes at breakfast?"

"Yes, your Majesty!"

"And why do you gather here?"

"Um..."

"Is it to spy upon my sons?"

"No, your majesty!"

"Do you lie to the king!?"

"N-no you-your Majesty..."

"I will ask you again".

One of the girls stepped forward and curtsied.

"The Crown Prince is...Well..."

She hopped up on tiptoes. "...he's very cute!" she whispered. The other girls giggled.

"I'm very sure you find him so. But he's not to be spied upon while he's having breakfast!...OR while he's having his bath!"

"Emily you TOLD!"
"I did not!...You did!"
"LIAR!"
"I bet it was Pansy!"
"Never in your life! Lilac tell her!"
"Well...um..."

"That will do, girls!" said the Queen.

"Yes ma'am!"

"I will not tolerate you spying on the prince. You will behave accordingly as your parents expect!"

"Yes ma'am!"

"If you wish to see the prince you will approach him as everyone else does. No more of this, do you hear!?"

"Yes ma'am..."

"Very well. Return to your duties!"

"Yes ma'am".

The Queen sighed. "It is a curse!" she said, when the girls had left.

"Curse?" The king asked.

"To have given birth to boys!"

"Why?"

"If they were not so dashingly handsome like their father, we shouldn't have this problem!"

"Ah, but if we had girls, then they should all be as ravishing as their mother. And all my time would be spent with a sword in my hand duelling off the horny young bucks intent on plundering them for their own enjoyment! You shouldn't want that, would you?"

"Well no!"

"Then be glad we have boys".

"Of course, my dear. But still, with three sons, it would be nice to have a daughter or two who they could protect and spoil..."

"You mean like the Earl Vanderstorm's three sons and his daughter?"

"Yes!"

"Aaah. You know I spoke to earl. His eldest son guards his daughter most jealously!"

"I'm not surprised. I've seen her a couple of times with their grandmother. She's a very fine young lady! She would make an excellent match for our Cassius..."

"Do you think so?"

"Oh yes! She's sweet and polite and...and...well she has a underlying firmness...which every queen should have!"

"Do you?"

"Certainly I do! I should not have married you had I not!"

The king laughed, "Of course, my dear. Come, let's to breakfast..."

The king and queen entered their private dining-room and sat at the head and foot of the table, with their sons, and other assorted guests, on either side.

"Good morning, father, mother", said Cassius.

"Good moooorning, father, mother..." Gladius said.

"Gladius don't be rude!"
"Gwaddudus don't be wuuude!"

"GLADIUS!"

"Sheesh..."

"Gladius! Listen to your brother!"

"Alright, alright..."

"Hi mama!"

"Hello, Triton my darling! Muah!"

"Hewwo momma..."

"Gladius!"

"Sheeeeesh! C'mon pops can't I even have a sense of humor!?"

"Not at the expense of your brothers!"

"Damn it!"

"Sit down and eat your breakfast!...Cassius, good morning. Triton, did you sleep well?"

"Yes, father".

"...Don't I get anything?"

"No. You don't deserve it!"

"Oh rats!"

"Well you should've thought of that, Gladius, before you opened your mouth!"

"Fine!..."

"What was that!?"

"Yes father!"

"That's better! Cassius what are you doing today?"

"I've got classes with Gladius until luncheon. Then I thought I might go riding. Hunting maybe..."

"Oooh I wanna come!" said Triton.

"No, Triton".

"Awwww! I wanna come!"

"No!"

"But I wanna come! Papa make him take me!"

"Pops he comes hunting with me he's only going to bring back ANOTHER pet! We'll have more rabbits, cats, dogs, canaries, parrots, fish, frogs...whatevers!...all over the castle!"

Leviathan sighed.

"Triton you MAY go with your brother, and you may hunt with him. You will NOT bring back another pet!"

"Not even a bunnywabbit?"

"Not even a mouse!"

"Awwwww...what about two mice?"

"Triton!"

"Awwwwwwww...okay..."

"There child..." said the Queen, "Cassius you take good care of your brother!"

"Yes mother", said Cassius.

"And you, Gladius, what are your plans for the day?"

"I dunno...read?"

"You don't read!" said Cassius, snorting, and munching on a slice of toast.

"I do so!"

"Yeah, the Adventures of the Black Knight! That's baby-stuff!"

"Yeah and the stuff YOU read is SO much more grown-up!"

"Boys please!" said Leviathan. "Why don't you go riding with your brothers, Gladius?"

"Oh great! The Brown Bastard and the Golden Boys!" Cassius said sarcastically, "Pops don't I get ANY time alone!?"

"My lad, when you are king, you won't even be able to SLEEP alone".

"That'd probably be the only GOOD thing..." Cassius grumbled.

"CASSIUS VAN DRACONIS!" the Queen cried out, "Don't you let me hear you speak like that!"

"No, mother..."

"Boys please! Let's have our breakfast", the King sighed.
